name: The Family
reviews:
i visited "the family" restaurant with my family and was delighted by the experience. from the moment we entered, we were warmly welcomed by a big, fluffy teddy bear holding the menu written on a charming chalkboard. this adorable touch instantly made us feel at home.
the food was well presented, with generous portions that were just right. most importantly, the taste did not disappoint. each dish was flavorful and satisfying, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. "the family" restaurant certainly lives up to its name, providing cozy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a family outing.; so i google a place to have a reasonable steak, so many great reviews about this place and i need to add mine as well. the service was fantastic, spoken english, had an english menu on a chalkboard which is pretty awesome and check out this food in the pictures. i can see why people come back to this place for sure. well done, bravo!!! 👍🍻👏👏👏

both deviled eggs salad and steak were 👍👍👍; felix was the best waiter!! super attentive, very funny and so kind!! made great wine recommendations and the food was phenomenal! highly recommend stopping by the family on your next trip to paris!; nice staffs, even though i don't speak french.
reasonable price. tasty food.
the onion soup was a bit salty.
feeling full and no room to order dessert.
happy dinner in french!; the best linguine i have ever had.  the chorizo made it perfect. fantastic service. only in paris three nights and ate there twice because it was so good. the rest of my family had the steak and they all raved about that too.

name: Bouillon Chartier Grands Boulevards
formatted_address: 7 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
going to a bouillon is always a good idea but this one was something else!
the place is gorgeous, it keeps all of its charm while being cozy. the food was very well prepared, savoury and with a nice presentation and big portions.
the waiters are professional, super nice and fast, no need to wait for the food.
great discovery!; looks can be deceiving! this restaurant boasts a high google maps rating (4.2-4.3), possibly due to its historical significance, but don't let that fool you. the food quality was a major disappointment. the french fries tasted like they'd been reheated multiple times, and the meat was simply inedible. sadly, i cannot recommend this place based on my experience.; the fastest serving of food i ever had! incredible! it tasted pretty good, and the prices were very cheap. the service is quick and efficient. one downside- other tables are very close yours - so it’s a bit “cozy”

i’d definitely recommend this place.

here's a polished version of your new review:

---

the fastest serving of food! incredible! it tasted pretty good, and the prices were very cheap. the service is quick and efficient. one downside is the seating; people are so close that you're practically at the same table. despite that, this place is worth recommending.; i checked google for restaurant near me, and found this place with over 22k reviews in google, and have to try it.  i have never seen any place with so many reviews!  then i found out this is a restaurant with hundreds years of history, with very reasonable price.  we tried three appetizers, two main dishes, two desserts, and coffee, and happy with all the food we tried.  the waiter is very efficient, he wrote the order and calculated the check total on the table cover paper which is very special.  we are lucky to find this special place.; be ready to be in queue. we went there on monday evening but we had to wait for 30 minutes to get the table, they have only walking in system, not table booking in prior. the system was quite intriguing. the food was great with an amazing service. every thing is so quick. the ambiance is amazing. the cost is worth too. must try restaurant as it has started from 1968.

name: Upper Café Les Halles
reviews:
i was sitting with my friends and the waiter (a short, bald man)was extremely disrespectful. he told me to leave if i didn’t order something, even though my two friends were already drinking and consuming. i’ve never encountered such poor service in my life. very disappointed.; i am in a split mind about the place. the location is ideal, at the door of les halles,and the menu looked absolutely perfect, with real fish and chips, and special burgers.  however the food was not as good as it looked, and the one waiter, although very efficient,  was a bit loud and vulgar........; we ordered 2 salads and 2 cocktails, they were fresh and tasty!; the manager is so mean !! i will never come back again.
first, at 15 pm they stopped hot beverage.
then when asking to put the tv sound for a can match, at first he doesn't even want to answer because as he said he didn't start working yet... and after he said that they put sound only for france and psg matches 😏; the staff and overall service were ok, but fish and chips was mediocre with its not crunchy at all coating and unseasoned fish.

name: Restaurant Loulou Paris
reviews:
i loved the place. the atmosphere is pretty cool, modern design, lovely music on speakers, friendly staff and wide choice of interesting breakfasts and brunches. very interesting warm drinks like the gold milk,  pink and blue latte, will come back to try them out! it’s a little busy during lunch time so if you really care, i would suggest to make a reservation.; delicious meal and fun atmosphere! great gluten free options. my iced matcha was perfect,  hardly sweetened.  the gf club hit the spot, and the fries were crisped to perfection. my husband loved his buddha bowl. friendly and patient service!; very demure and very cutesy restaurant. the food was good and service was quick, nice staff. came here for a brunch style breakfast, can highly recommend the avo-toast! decently sized portions.
easy payment with their qr-code.; little aesthetic place here and the food was also really good, but just that it was cold.

club sandwich - my brother is not usually a fan of club sandwich, but whatever they did here actually was good! he was actually quite impressed by it. only thing is that it was fairly cold.

chicken parmesan - really delicious! not greasy and the tomato sauce is quite flavorful. perfect amount of cheese as well. i don't usually have a chicken parmesan because usually greasy and then the tomato sauce just gets too strong for me but actually enjoyed this one.; i am gluten free and finding somewhere to eat in paris is not simple. this place had gluten free options (including pastries!) and my meal was delicious. i recommend the avocado toast. perfect poached eggs.  the staff were very kind and their english was excellent. the vibe of the place is great too. thoroughly enjoyed it.

name: Café de la Régence
reviews:
the food was good…especially the cream brûlée is a must order for dessert. we sit out side,the atmosphere was great. must say the staff are very nice and gentle. they are super busy, but never show attitude to  tourist even at the peak time. i’m appreciated it  and we had a lovely lunch time there before visit the museum. thank you!; we came here for lunch, and the food was fantastic!

highly recommend the duck breast and the beef tartar, both were very well prepared! the tartar was well seasoned, and the duck breast was cooked to perfection!

shout out to the staff at regence - we were in a rush and only had one hour for lunch. the staff was able to server all food and drinks in under one hour! we enjoyed our french lunch very much and wished there was more time for us to have a dessert.

the entrees plus tips came to be around €70. ever reasonably priced in paris!

come and have a delicious meal!; i came here for lunch and was promptly seated. since it was a nice sunny day, i opted for the outdoor patio, which had plenty of seating, and the servers were almost always available. i had a simple penne pasta with tomato sauce and parmesan—it was decent, though nothing particularly standout. the salmon poke bowl, ordered without rice, had fresh and flavorful salmon. overall, it’s a great spot for a quick bite, especially for lunch!; we were a little hungry at night, so we stopped by a restaurant near the hotel. the staff was so friendly and the food was so delicious that we ended up ordering three dishes late at night. it’s a great place to have a drink while spending the night in paris because it’s open late. the escargot and duck dish were really good.; i ordered tartare and it was my first time eating fresh meat. i’m not used to but i won’t say it wasn’t great. i also ordered soup as well and i liked it. the service was great and i also like the restaurant’s decoration.

name: Restaurant Martin Paris
formatted_address: 40 bis Rue René Boulanger, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing brunch! lovely hidden garden patio.

they offer great smoothies, salty dishes such as avocado toast or egg muffin as well as sweets like cake or pancakes.

free parking and fair prices!
highly recommend checking it out.; doesn't look like much from the outside (barely visible from the street) or the inside (generic fancy hotel bar/restaurant), but highly recommended. great service and a delicious three course dinner of fine french cuisine for a reasonable price.; went there for a brunch, we think we found a little gem in the heart of paris. the garden patio is very peaceful, you could forget you are in the center of paris. the place / hotel is  very well decorated. food-wise, the brunch menu is simple bit everything was very tasty,  especially the black fish burger. only downside, service was very slow.; decent restaurant, well decorated, kinda slow service, once i had to wait over 30 minutes for a burger and place wasn’t exactly crowded…; food was really disappointing. only fixed menus and the meals were not great. my meat was no tender and had barely any potato mash. the fish my partner had was tasteless with a nutty sauce which was not good.

there was a comedy show that started mid evening in the hallway.

not good for romance, not good for food. nice terrace. staff were very nice.

name: Maison Maison
vicinity: 63 voie Georges Pompidou, Dans l'escalier face au, 16 Quai du Louvre, Paris
formatted_address: 63 voie Georges Pompidou, Dans l'escalier face au, 16 Quai du Louvre, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
a wonderful little spot tucked on the side of the siene. an amazing atmosphere, the food is incredible, and the staff is super friendly. this is our second time coming here and we will return again next time we’re back in paris! just the best!; just coming to the end of a week in paris for the olympics and this was the best place we went for food on the entire trip!

we got 4 plates between two people and it was very filling, the food was of the highest quality (the tuna tataki was my personal favourite) and the service was excellent. the view of the river and the paris skyline was the icing on the cake.

recommend!; splendid place by the river. you can see the eiffel tower, have a coffee or drink and enjoy the people walking past. atmosphere is so nice!; i had longer layover in paris, founds this cute place on the seine. no regrets 😄
good snack, wine, view. the staff is helpful, genuine smiling.
you can't see eiffel tower perfectly, good enough for me for the amount of time i had.
recomand if you are in the neighborhood and want to unwind for a bit; a find whilst walking along the seine. what’s not to love about a glass of rose by the river and friendly helpful staff. have come back each visit and will try the food next time. drank by the riverside this time - no seats available, portable plastic ice bucket 💕

name: Le Village
reviews:
the food is average, coffee is good. the toilet room was dirty, no soap, no paper, but it’s not a cheap place)))
the cafe is located in a quiet street, among boutiques. at lunchtime they will let you in if you will eat. prices are high, service is ok; it's not cheap, but you're eating in a café in paris in the stylish pedestrian street that has boutiques from chanel and dior, so just enjoy.  food was pretty good, the steak tartare offered better value than the petit filet, which lived up to its billing.  chips and salad good.  service was efficient.; awesome place with great food and pretty much the only place with good service we experienced in 3 days in paris. chich and trendy decor, nested in a cute arcade between the dior and chanel store, well thought out and presented dishes, encompassing a range of tastes and flavours from around the world. they were also very accommodating with our 4 year old and made a dish for her that wasn't on the menu. not cheap but it is what it is.; place is nice but the food was terrible and expensive, 12€ for a plate of scrambled eggs that appeared to be soup with a small bread that was hard as a rock, the coffee was worst than instant coffee and it came from a machine not from an espresso machine which for 8€ is a scam.

the service is ok, nothing surprising just regular paris service.

the place is in a nice spot but definitely not worth the price, you pay top money and get low quality.; tucked in an alley next to dior. freshest seafood i’ve had in paris and this place has outdoor seating and indoor seating. we had thai salad with prawns very fresh. we also had brunch with smoked salmon with avocado salad also very fresh with the fluffiest scrambled eggs. the menu is simple with other salad options, rigatoni, artichoke salad, tuna tartare, beef tartare, club sandwich (looks yummy) and desserts. service is professional and friendly. no cheese options though as i always want a plate of cheese while in paris.

name: Cafe Louise
reviews:
we came here for brunch on a sunday. it’s €38 per person, including a juice (freshly squeezed or detox juice), a coffee, a choice of either waffle or savory tart, and bottomless fruits and desserts from the buffet table. the warm and friendly staff made the already fantastic meal even better. highly recommended.; great place for sunday brunch, had a good parisian breakfast. fresh juice, coffee as well.
dessert was divine, came here with family. the service is slow but quite enjoyable.; we loved louise! such parisian atmosphere and interior. excellent service and amazing food. right on the middle of the famous boulevard saint-germain across the street from famous cafes. so lucky we found it!; visited café louise twice last weekend and we were very delighted.
the staff was super nice, professional and funny and the food was delicious. highly recommended!!; had a uniquely french lunch - "grilled cheese" and champagne, sitting outside, taking in the atmosphere, and watching the crowd walk (fast) by.

name: Wonderland brunchy Notre Dame/ Restaurant Brunch
reviews:
super good food ! yummy and looks so pretty. we were well received and served with a smile (so important in paris right ? 😇)
it’s a little more expensive than we thought but you get what you pay for. around 18€ for a main. we shared pancakes after so it came out to about 28€ pp for a drink a main and a shared dessert.
toilets clean, coffee is pretty good, i got a very original drawing on line which made me very happy !; absolutely amazing brunch spot! we went here every day during our trip in paris because it was so good. the staff was so kind and friendly to us, especially the server (wish we had asked her name). highly recommend the eggs benedict, purple pancakes, and purple french toast. if you want to avoid waiting, go on weekdays or get there when they open on weekends. we loved it!; best impressions! food is always delicious, my favorite place for brunch dishes in paris! located in the great spot as well! the service is very kind and friendly. thank you for your always welcoming attitude and honesty.; food was excellent! everything that we tried was tasty. portions were big. staff was friendly and helpful. but it was 26 degrees outside, you can sit only inside and it was too hot.
all in all it was a very pleasant experience! thank you!; me and my friend had the purple french toast, which was amazing!! she already had it before and had to come back to get it.

also the staff were so lovely and gave us great tips for paris as a first-timer 🤍

name: Café Latin
formatted_address: 30 Rue Saint-André des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
the best meal in paris! we had a fantastic dinner at cafe latin on a busy saturday evening but were seated right away. our waiter was super friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly passionate about the food.
the duck confit and veal kidney were the best dishes we’ve had in france, ever! the waiter also recommended a lovely wine that paired perfectly with our meal. i really can't recommend this place enough. if you find yourself in paris, go to cafe latin - you won't regret it!; we loved this place. happened to stumble in and had an amazing experience. the cook is a former michelin chef that opened his own place. the cheeseburger was to die for and the kidneys were exceptional if you're looking to go authentic. waitstaff and owner were so friendly and made sure our meal was perfect! highly recommend!; i had the steak tartare, one of the best one ai had. one of the owner is serving and is very friendly and you can see that he is passionate about his bistro. check it out, worth the detour!; we enjoyed a very nice meal at this restaurant. it was a busy night but we were seated promptly. the food was well presented and very tasty. the service was professional and friendly. there was a lovely atmosphere and at all times we were treated as welcome guests.; 14€ for 3 slices of cheese and some random salad. really? what a rip off. they weren’t good either.

name: CAFE SAINT HONORÉ
reviews:
we had an amazing dinner here this evening. the atmosphere was pleasant and chic. everything that we ordered was delicious and had a beautiful presentation. even our kids thourogly enjoyed their meal. the waiter was attentive and very friendly. conveniently located near the louvre and to emily in paris 😍 if you’re a fan! definitely recommend!; cute bistro located close to the louvre. we visited for lunch and had a french onion soup, a smoked salmon with toasts, and a nutella and strawberry crepe alongside a glass of wine. the food, the service, the ambiance - everything was good.; it was cold and raining so we were lucky to find this nice little gem just near louvre. waiter was very nice. we ordered two big beers with a happy hour price of 6 euros and a pizza parma san daniel for 20 euros. the pizza was fantastic! they were generously covered with good quality parma ham, rocket, shaved parmesan cheese and mini fresh mozzarella balls. comes with a bottle of chili olive oil on the side. taste heavenly and price is reasonable too. highly recommended.; the food was excellent, especially the salmon maison terreazure pizza! it’s a must try.
our waiter nathan was the friendliest and most hospitable waiter we encountered in paris, thank you for your beautiful service & great energy!
we will definitely be coming here again on our next trip.
merci pour tout; had lunch here after visiting the louvre. the service was fantastic,  the shop itself, is absolutely adorable and gorgeous all in one.

i had the croque madame and it was absolutely to die for!

i would highly recommend going here and would happily come back!

name: Cocorico
reviews:
nice restaurant with reasonable price.  it’s located across the bridge from the louvre museum.  the onion soup, frog leg and the snails are all delicious.  the atmosphere and service are top notch.; we were in a bit of rush to grab food but we didn’t want to eat fast food. cocorico served the food super fast and the service was excellent. probably we had lunch during the quiet hours but still are satisfied.

the atmosphere was nice as well. it was just a bit hot inside. good access to museums and central area.; beautiful restaurant right across the sien. perfect spot to dabble in french cuisine in between the museum rounds. they serve such delicious preparations. amazing quality of frog legs and octopus. every sauce was uniquely flavoured. best baguette ever! loved their mille feuille.; after a full day of wandering around the center of paris we have found this cozy place. frog legs as an aperitif, and octopus with duck as a main course added their flavor to the impression of the city of lovers. this restaurant will quietly add to my collection - a must visit. thanks to the staff for the pleasant atmosphere and delicious food.; we were very hungry after the louvre and so glad we chose this place. both the service and the food quality and preparation are absolutely excellent! we ate snails, onion soup, leg of sheep and octopus. the waiters were polite, cultured, attentive, but not intrusive. the quality of the food is excellent. we highly recommend this place to all tourists hungry for excursions in the louvre!

name: Meating Corner
reviews:
amir and salim were excellent waiters. we came two days in a row as the burgers were that good. first night it was the brother burger and father then the following evening 2x brother burger.

high quality burgers, with amazing bun and meat nicely done. ingredients were first class and i genuinely couldn’t fault anything even though i have very high standards when it comes to burgers; overall decent spot, cozy little restaurant and the burgers are pretty good. however taking off one full star due to the sweet potato fries. they are not very good, and were undercooked a good bit. if they fix this, willing to give five stars. good customer service though, so would recommend you check this place out.; super friendly and attentive staff. very clean and supper yummy burger. one of the best burgers 😍🤩🤩🤩
and trust me i tried sooo many burgers in my life . never fails me , i bring each time a group of friends with me and they adore it!
will come back for sure❤️
oh and dog friendly😌😌; burgers were delicious. there’s a lot of burger options and the atmosphere and decor is amazing. i recommend !; this place was amazing! the atmosphere is so nice for a romantic dinner. the burgers are amazing. my boyfriend is a lifelong vegetarian and said that the veggie burger was the best one he’s ever had. so freaking good - he ordered the uncle and i ordered the grandpa and we shared fries with cheese and fried onions. also the service was great - we needed to charge our phones after a long travel day and they had a phone charging station that they brought to the table.

name: La Fontaine Cuvier Restaurant
reviews:
everyone knows french food is delicious but i wasn't expecting to get fantastic burgers in paris! stopped in randomly for dinner and this burger and fries was perfection. there's a whisper of garlic on the fries that's soooo good and the caramelized onions in the burger were delicious. definitely recommend.; i have eaten here twice in the last two nights and found the staff to be very friendly and the food was delicious . i had salmon in a crispy pastry with beautifully cooked vegetables in a sumptuous sauce and a medium rare beef dish with excellent fries and salad. the white wine and rose were wonderful too. great atmosphere and music. i will be back :-); great resto just next to the jardin des plantes. our 2nd time here and food was good and service right on.; we had amaizing evenings in this restaurant with real parisian view and vibe.
we had french fries and mousse au chocolat which was delicious but contained a little bit of lumps.
but we would definetely come back.; delicious burgers. close to the jardin de plants. the restaurant is on the corner of a street and easy to miss if you're coming from the north side. but if you do spot it, you'll will find a small restaurant that cooks your meal where you can see it from the outside terrace. the burgers are to die for, great taste. the lady serving us was very eager to help and explained everything to us in english. the restaurant is on a corner of a busy street though, which is not ideal, but probably worth it.

name: Loup
vicinity: 44, rue du Louvre Angle, Rue Coquillière, Paris
formatted_address: 44, rue du Louvre Angle, Rue Coquillière, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing food! we didn't know what to expect, but it was super good! we got a bunch of plates: salad, veggie burger, cordon blue, fish, and everything was perfectly cooked and delicious! the waiter was super fun and helpful, even if he was super busy because the place was almost full.
our only complaint was that sadly, the glasses weren't polished and mine had even lipstick stains on it.
even though i still recommend it sooo much! it was a great experience.; this was the last restaurant we visited on our last trip to paris. i am still so grateful i chose this one. the decor was fun and very artistic. i gonna say the french knows how to make a good burger. you can see from the photo it tasted incredible so juicy and so tasty. the onion soup is also a must amazing. don’t miss out on their cheese cake because it is simply the best cheesecake i have ever had. i don’t think i can find it anywhere in australia. the staffs are super friendly and patient. overall amazing experience. the roast chicken wasn’t very warm i don’t know if this is a french thing.; overall score 8 out of 10 👍🏻

(1) locations: (9/10)
great location,,, few steps from saint honore,,, just at the corner of rue de louvre and rue coquilliére, where many bistros and brassieres are around.

(2) escargots/ snails (9/10)
it’s typical in french cuisine, but the taste from place to another is different. here they make it really good, better than many other places around the city..

(3) onion soup (10/10)
well seasoned soup, crispy on top, cheesy, and you can live the french experience very clearly… i had it in different other places, but they weren’t convincing compared to this one.. it felt more authentic besides it was so delicious.

(4) burger 🍔 (9/10)
it would be a shame if i see any score below 9… we may not like the fact they didn’t ask how we like the meat cooked (it was made medium), yet it was fresh, juicy and delicious.. one of best burgers we ever had in our travels. the pickles lifted flavors to another level.  the cheese was only part of the experience not overwhelming where the bun was soft and worked very well with their sauce and veggies they added.

(5) baguette (4/10).  served on the table..
i can’t lie, it tasted like those commercial bread you eat anywhere else in the world… it’s far from authentic french bread, at least in my opinion.

(6) service (6/10)
although they were nice, yet very slow.

we saw chickens being roasted, so we will come back for sure to try them out.; it was an excellent spot to watch the evening marathon at the olympics, they had a large tv with the basketball final on too. the staff were very friendly and attentive. prices are on the higher side, but the good was excellent.; the food here is amazing, i had medium rare steak, snails and desserts. the cheesecake is the best.

for hot drinks, i ordered a cappuccino, it was the best cappuccino i've ever had.

the waiters and waitresses are really friendly as well, they aren't afraid to joke around and they're pleasant to talk with!

name: Les Belles Plantes
reviews:
this is a very good restaurant with great atmosphere. i really like the outdoor settings because you are surrounded by plants and trees. when i went, it was raining and the sound of the rain made the experience more pleasant and enjoyable; beautiful atmosphere! we ordered the mezze board for a starter and it was amazing. the spritzers were refreshing and delicious. lovely little find.; great stop before exploring the garden outside is well shaded and friendly staff. inside is beautifully decorated and the bar had a great caribbean mule.; beautiful, great food, great service and fair prices. loved it. i’ll be back. i highly recommend their tiramisu; the food and service is pretty good! would definitely recommend getting lunch here after visiting the museums and zoo nearby.
my kid loved the pasta so much that he actually finished the entire pasta portion ( which is quite huge portion ) by himself.

name: MONBLEU Faubourg Montmartre
formatted_address: 37 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
we decide to take the extra fondant pasta (truffle +3€) and the roasted st nectaire with ham. needless to say it was absolutely excellent ! as french and cheese lover i’m very picky usually but i can say this is now my new favorite cheese place. can’t believe i’ve never came here before. thank you so much for those delicious meal we will come back for sure. thanks for our lovely waiter that took time to translate everything !; great selection of cheeses and wine. missing some condiments such as jams or dips. wine list is also nice. highly recommend the crème brûlée cheese!! 🤤🤤🤤; great place to enjoy some delicious cheese and fresh salads! the outdoor vibe was fantastic—until a bottle came flying out of a second-floor window and shattered just 5cm from us. we nearly had a 'parisian drama' moment, but hey, what happens in paris stays in paris, right? 😄; the cheeses in this place are something! servers were nice and smily and the food came fast.
for two people we had the plateau of 5 cheese, portion of jambon blanc, two glasses of wine and dish of chicken to share. price 83€, fair for te quality of the food (the fridges  plenty of cheeses from france and out in the entrance simply deserve the 5 star), but i found the chicken slightly expensive for the size.
the ambiance in the restaurant is cool, we seated on the second floor and we loved the more relaxed vibe. i would definitely recommend this place for a cheese lover visiting paris.; absolutely delicious food! the menu is small which makes the decision easier to make. i went to fancy restaurant yesterday for the dinner and now i realize it was nothing compared the food i had at monblue. service is good, atmosphere is authentic, with many cheeses and comfy seats. cheese lovers check it out!

name: Santa Lyna
reviews:
i loved this place! i had the chicken waffle, the almond butter chai latte, and fresh oj. highly recommend - i even tried their sister restaurant the day after, which was just as good. the service was great — thanks so much to gabriel and cesar. will definitely be back.; no reservations. you have to stand in line

some interesting twist to you’re usual brunch favorites. they look good & taste even better

it does get very very busy on weekends. so if you’re a tourist take time into account; great place, nice vibes and good food. the portions were really big for the price! also the iced strawberry matcha was super good. i loved the chicken waffle it was amazing!; the vibes were absolutely amazing. great food, amazing concept, diverse menu, cool decor and great staff. everyone was very accommodating, even to special requests. overall we all had a great time here 2 days in a row. that’s how great it was. (side note the music was amazing too).; had the spicy crispy waffle. very nice but a bit on the dry side and definitely needs maple syrup as an addition. friends pink tacos were good too.
great service from abu.

name: Chez Nicos
reviews:
the staff was really nice, helped us with our order because we didn’t understand french.
the salt crepe was really really delicious! we’re used to sweet crepes, but the combination with the salty fillings was perfect. we were really full after 😅 the crepe was very big and well served!
i really wanted the sweet crepe for dessert, but i couldn’t get anything after 😂
highly recommend this place! it wasn’t expensive at all!

edit: we came back twice after this review and it exceeded our already high expectations. the nutella and banana crepe is to die for! 🤤; made-on-demand crepe with lots of options for fillings. we went savory this time with ham and cheese, they were super generous with the filling. thing with it having tomatoes though is the bottom gets a bit soggy. nonetheless a very enjoyable and filling midnight snack.; great crepe, i tried banana and nutella crepe. really yummy 😋
then i went ahead and had one more, dark chocolate with coconut. equally good. i also had a coffee shot to have a good combination of sweet and bitter.; this is the most surprisingly tasty and filling meal. i went twice in one day because it was so good! best food!! wish i could go back it was that great. the chef crepe was my favorite. the nutella banana was also great; we came to paris for 6 days and we came to nicos on our second day here. we came back today because the first time was that good (and we might be coming back tomorrow for lunch as well 😂). this time was even better. freshly made salted crepes… even more delicious than the first time. very well served, we get out of here with our tummies full and happy.
the staff is very kind and thoughtful.
we will make sure to come back here next time we’re in paris.

10/10!! highly recommend.

name: Le bon moment café
reviews: what a beautiful cafe! the staff is super friendly and kind. the latte was delicious, and so were my pancakes! they reminded me of american pancakes, which are not easy to find in paris. i definitely recommend. i can’t wait to go back and try more things on the menu!; we ate here recently for breakfast. it's a really cute café in a very quiet street. my friend and i ordered pancakes, i ordered also the açai bowl. the food was absolutely delicious, and the only fault i had was that the pancakes are so small and unfortunately not filling at all. they were great though but definitely need at least 50% more. the staff are very nice and attentive. the plates were beautifully presented. the coffee is exceptional here, my new favourite café for coffee. highly recommend this place.; i recently tried the passion fruit iced tea at this café, and it was fantastic. refreshing and full of flavor, it was the perfect drink for a warm day. the café's setting by the seine and next to notre-dame makes it even more enjoyable. the beautiful surroundings add to the relaxing atmosphere. highly recommend giving it a try!; one of the first places i visit when i arrive to my first visit to paris. i needed to work something in my computer and it was great the atmosphere, very wholesome. it has an area for kids to read. the owners were so nice and welcoming. the coffee and the chocolate chip cookies were great (i am a fan of 🍪). if i ever go back i will like to visit once again. i wish the best to this café.; really cute & lovely coffee shop! loved the staff there, really nice! in terms of food, we took a carrot cake, a black sesame latte & mango&pineapple smoothie. everything was really good! i would love to come back and try the other things there. in terms of space, there are not a lot of tables so it can be easily packed, not suitable for big groups. i would recommend coming there! ++ for the lovely menu which was probably handmade and then printed.

name: Le Petit Café
reviews: you know that reputation the parisians earned among americans in the 1960's as being rude and having bad service? not true anymore, but if you feel like you missed out on your opportunity to experience the rudeness, come to le petit café (perhaps better named le petit service) to get ignored! otherwise, the food's great, if it ever arrives! ...and it's just steps from the pantheon. don't go there hungry!; great staff here in this lovely surprise restaurant. we had the onion soup, and fish and chips. both were spot on - the soup was loaded with cheese, steamy hot but not scalding. the fish were nicely battered and cooked properly so not greasy or oily. for once here in paris, the chips (fries) were still hot. the staff seem run off their feet with the college crowd but they remained friendly and attentive. overall, this was a nice dinning experience. the younger crowd can get loud and exuberant, so if you want a quiet dinner out, this might not be for you. for us, the staff and the food made up for any noise factor concerns.; we stopped in here for lunch. we ate the salmon salad, onion soup, and had some champagne.; good food, the fries were especially good, fast service and the staff is accommodating to english speakers; my favorite place for a coffee in paris! i visited a few times during my trip. their coffee was very good. i tried their cafe frappe and it was great on a hot day. the hot latte was also great. their mojitos are also nice, they have a happy hour! i also tried their burger, it was very good and a big portion. the atmosphere is amazing, the outside seating area is lovely, very quiet, no noise from the street. the staff was nice and friendly.

name: Kick Café
reviews:
i visited this cafe in april 2022. as we got there 15 mins before they were closing, they only served us something to drink. the drinks were delicious, i also bought a txt album. very friendly staff. mark tuan went there too!!!!!
i love the decorations, the atmosphere and the concept.; came from uk for event this cafe was amazing food was delicious loved the drink designed by castle j will definitely return here when we come for our next concert; nice kawaii coffeeshop. the back of the shop need to be more furnished seems a bit empty and not organized; cute little café and boutique k-pop themed. if you like color and sugar, this place is for you :); really nice cafe! cute decoration and the staff was very nice and spoke english very well! the drinks were delicious and i loved all the kpop decorations!

name: La Grande Colette (Ex Café Livres)
reviews:
as others have said, this is an unusually relaxing venue for paris. serene next to the square (tour st jacques) and the staff are lovely. the restaurant seems a little over-priced. for example, i asked for jam and they charged euro 1.5 for a tiny bit of jam. i took one star off for the cost - i paid euro 7 for the same thing a few days ago, rather than euro10.; had a fantastic experience at la grande colette!! the food is delicious and the entire staff is super friendly, especially our server amber. she went out of her way to make sure we had a fantastic experience, chatted with us about our trip, and had great recommendations.

speaking of recommendations, my wife and i had the caesar salad and the egg casserole, and finished with an amazing pistachio creme brûlée (and espresso). the scotch sour was also excellent.

if you’re in the neighborhood, definitely stop by - it’s worth it for the friendly staff alone!; beautiful little spot with tremendous food and service was really good. we had the chinese wok noodles with shrimp, omg so good, a burger which was tasty and the chicken burger was insanely delicious and beautifully presented. cocktails were really good too.
this is a great little spot and the terrace is well placed. the waiters were very happy and kind to us. we enjoyed this restaurant and would highly recommend it.; great atmosphere and a very different bistro feel. an intellectual french appeal, bookish characters, including a cat roaming around.; i actually came here based on my partner's recommendation, as he visited this place when it was called cafe liveres.

i had breakfast here and was quite disappointed.

i ordered a crepe expecting a light, delicious treat. instead, it smelled overwhelmingly like eggs—so much so that it overpowered any other flavors. the crepe had very little powdered sugar and only a small lemon wedge for garnish. i was hoping for more sugar and perhaps a lemon sugar sauce. this really affected my enjoyment and made the crepe quite unappetizing.

the coffee was okay, and the orange juice was just average.

the service wasn't great either. the wait was long, and the server seemed judgmental about my partner’s food choices.

overall, i wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast. there are better options out there.

name: Café Baby Foot
reviews:
one water (50cl)  and one orangina (23 cl ) 9 euros. too expensive and so bad attention from the waiter. never will come back.; good food to a really cheap price; priceless vestige of a paris that almost disappeared. a thousand miles from faux-authentic marketing, this is a neighborhood café where you immediately understand that you are not the umpteenth customer to be fleeced. it's precious. we just regret that it is not open more.; very pleasant and original café located a few steps from the station: port-royal...and the magnificent garden of the great explorers...!
the owner is very welcoming and smiling and makes excellent croque-monsieur or sandwiches with unrivaled talent and know-how! ...
in addition, it is allowed to cultivate oneself and she sells second-hand books, all at a flat rate of €2...allowing you to nourish your mind as well as your body...
café that deserves to be discovered for its original and diverse atmosphere...!
there is a real table football in the café (the english say: "table football" for table football...i think...)..an out of tune piano (for the moment)..guitars.... a slightly bohemian café, in a way, as we like them on the boul'mich to relax without problems...; discovered by chance, an atypical place in the heart of paris. authentic, no fuss. if you're a fan of rigor and pseudo parisian chic, don't worry, it's a real neighborhood bar.

name: JOZI BRUNCH Pantheon
reviews:
we've found this small cafe not far from where we were staying in paris in the latin quarter. we've been there twice and both occasions the food was delicious and the coffee was arguably one of the best we had in paris. service on the other hand is on the slow side may be due to the number of staff servicing the tables, once the order was taken food and drinks were served pretty quickly. i'd definitely recommend it and go there myself again.; had a lovely meal and all in our group were happy with their food. the avocado toast with egg was great.

charming spot, and very friendly staff. i did my best to try and order in french, and they were very patient with me and helpful.

keep up the great work!; i loved loved loved this place.  they had excellent high quality coffee, as good as a good melbourne cafe, and prices were fair and every single staff member was friendly and positive.  they even laughed (in a good way) at my attempts to joke in french.  i tried lots of places but went back here multiple times as my go-to when i was staying in the area.  thankyou jozi for making such a lovely welcoming place.; great place by pantheón to grab brunch. we had the brunch menu and the ham and cheese croissant. everything tasted awesome and the staff were very pleasant. not much space to sit and the place seems popular so get in early so you snag a space. one correction needs to be said that even though they open at 8am they start serving the brunch service at 9am. before 9am you can only order to go coffee and pastries.
other than that recommend this place to get food before coming on pantheón visit.; great breakfast at jozi brunch.
very nice and quick service. it took about 5 min to get the food, and it looked amazing.

avo toast and a croissant (we are in paris right?) with coffees.

around 15€ per person.

name: Café de l’Église
reviews:
amazing! came here twice!!! must stop to eat and drink! the best crispy goat cheese salad i’ve ever had!! fantastic espresso martini, wine selection and spritz’s . the staff is very accommodating and pleasant.
huge french soup portion for lunch served with warm bread.; great service, excellent food and good atmosphere. highly recommend! we had the church board as a light dinner and french toast and pancakes for dessert, all tasted terrific.; used this place on our last day in paris to enjoy a leisurely meal before catching the eurostar home. the cafe is a short distance from gare du nord, has a great view of the church and is popular with parisiens. the waiter was very attentive and took our orders, even in our school level french. the cheese and cold meat selection was ample and tasty. the croque madame and chicken croque with a side of frites also went down a storm. the was no pressure to leave the table and we enjoyed the people watching.; we chanced upon this restaurant while looking for a place for french cuisine near our hotel. we had the best meal throughout our trip in paris here. the food was served nice and hot. the portion was huge and generous too. we ordered french onion soup, escargot, duck confit and mac & cheese with beef. special mention to the staff who served us this evening, both the lady and the gentlemen were friendly and polite. they were very observant and paid attention to us, ensuring that we finish our entree before serving us with our mains. we had a great time here!; we had such a nice experience here we went back for dinner after having breakfast there with our family of six (parents + four kids). the food is typical brasserie food at good prices and the service is the nicest in all of paris! they will make you feel like a local and their warmth will make the experience memorable. we were in a rush for breakfast and they delivered high quality food very quickly. so impressed and so happy to have found this great local spot!

name: Café A
vicinity: Maison de l'Architecture, 148 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, Paris
formatted_address: Maison de l'Architecture, 148 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: the place is super nice and waiters are very kind. food is also great although kind of expensive! 25€ for a small salad is quite a lot. next time i’m in town i’ll try something more “consistent” because i was still hungry when i finished my salad.; lovely staff and beautiful atmosphere but the food is unfortunately underwhelming. pancakes and french toast come in tiny portions (and not amazing) and the “avocado toast” is a marriage of avocado and other veggies with a few small pieces of toast and a lack of flavour.; a pleasant oasis with fresh and delicious food. we had the cafe a-vocado and it was among the best lunch plates that we've had in paris.; the food was very tasty ... the service was amazing, the staff is super friendly and helpful.; pretty and quiet corner near the station. fast service, salad was very good and filling.

name: Café Mignon
reviews:
maybe it's christmas and the crowd is less and it was enjoyable to eat and the music selection was great! i had fish & chips and chakchouka. not quite the chakchouka i usually had. dish looked simple, but taste was ok.
service was ok, but the waiter kinda slow and not responsive.; shout out to sturgill simpson, awesome place. i enjoyed "tying my mooring line to wine".; my family and i visited france from peru and spain. it was a wonderful experience to dine here. the waiters were always very nice and treated us like family. the food was delicious and we ended up coming back multiple times. although we spoke a different language, everyone was super welcoming. we had the steak, salmon, and crepes. if we visit paris again, we will definitely be coming back here.; love this locals spot for a drink and some great food. such sweet guys work here; sofane and edwin are the very best! a definite must for people watching and enjoying a drink.; the good was great and the wormers were really nice to us. dankjewel!!

name: Café Cassette
reviews:
croissant was not crispy.  chocolate was too sweet. cream brûlée was not bad and not too sweet. the atmosphere and service were not bad.  just to go for experiencing the coffee time in france. so many people lined up, waited for around 10 mins.; great choice for a casual dinner in montpasse. generous cocktail pours and classic french bistro food. solid preparation. attentive service. good atmosphere with lots of terrace dining.; cute café in the 6th with a nice terrace. sunday brunch is pretty good, offering several combos or “à la carte” options.

big downside is the quality of service. staff are overwhelmed and very inefficient.; great looking place with cool decoration, and nice staff, but the food was awful.
highlight was watching another customer eating a croissant with a knife and fork.; enjoyed some very tasty french onion soup, poke bowls, and seafood pasta. the restaurant is very cosy with an open air garden which is very enjoyable in summer.

name: FLUFFY'S - Bakery et brunch
reviews: good brunch and breakfast spot! i had a brioche style bun with two eggs and one with bacon - it was tasty! the cappuccino was tasty as well. unfortunately not all options from the menu were available at 09.00am, would have loved to try other ones as well. the menu is available in french but the kind service team helped with choosing.; amazing place with very good staff. i was impressed. they prepared special gift for my daughter’s birthday. fluffy pancakes and avocado toast-must try.thank you so much; fluffy has delicious pastry with the perfect texture. normally, cinnamon rolls are hard to make and they can be dry. however, the one here was soft and moist. overall, it’s a great brunch place and cafe. moreover, the staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful (you wouldn’t have to lift a finger 😉).; stumbled across this gem, glad we did. owner (lady in photo) kindly explained the french menu to us - we opted for the classics. heads up sausage / ham in paris could mean bacon, in this case ours was done perfectly. the croque madame was lovely as well. the cafe uses bread done the japanese way — a favourite of ours. coffee could afford to be stronger. overall fabulous. we will return!; just love this place! wanted to go there for some time and it was exactly as i expected it to be - fluffy, yummy, and amazing. the food was great, the staff was super friendly and we had a great sunday brunch. highly recommend the spinach fluffy... was so good!

name: Judy Market
reviews:
a wonderful experience at judy. i have a gluten-free family member so finding this restaurant/cafe was very exciting. service was great, and even though it was almost a full restaurant and we didn’t have a reservation front of house kindly accommodated us. food was all excellent- polenta fries were my favourite as the was extra crispy and seasoned with a delicious mix of sweet paprika and other spices. portions are very good-sized so you get your money’s worth. also loved the complimentary ginger shot we got given before the meal. hope to come back to try the gluten-free pastries!; amazing food and lot of options.
i will definitely go back to try more things!!
the place is very cozy and the staff is friendly and welcoming.
fast service.; the atmosphere of the place is so good. the service is really efficient and kindly. the food could be better , maybe i had the wrong dish so i think i need to go again to try another one.
18 € for 3 pieces of chicken and lettuce is a bit too much..; my salad was so good with the crispy tofu. glad to know it was also gluten-free. unfortunately, the surface was not great which impacts the atmosphere.   i spent almost 15 minutes, trying to get someone’s attention and finally gave up and went inside the café where i was sitting.  8 minutes past 4 pm and they said too late i couldn’t get the little side of tofu addition.  fine, but the fact that they never came and checked on me after they delivered the food, especially before the kitchen closed - it wasn’t very busy. we are towards the end of august.    i was speaking french  though  poorly.

i will give them one more try and update this review; quite funny because i’m from melbourne australia and we take our coffee seriously,  the coffee was so amazing. (best in all of paris) that i said to my friend there must be an aussie here. lo and behold the staff member was from melbourne! i can’t speak for the food as we just had coffee but incredible. i have now found my fav coffee shop in paris.

name: L' Esprit de Famille
reviews:
restaurant we recommend by a friend from paris. we weren’t let down at all!
small and cozy family run restaurant.
we were the only guests at the time we got in. the owner was very welcoming and friendly and had made this an unique experience.
food was also very good! the couscous we delicious and could have served two people.

go there if you want to feel among friends and have good food.; such a lovely restaurant! my duck breast was perfect.

hidden gem not far away from the city center!; we had one of our best meals we ever had in this place. proper french cuisine. everything was superb even the salad. service friendly. wine was also great. highly recommended
try the set menus at 24 pounds; this is an excellent restaurant that clearly demonstrates love and attention to homemade food. don't be fooled by its modest appearance and simple menu. everything from the starters to the dessert and coffee was superb! the menu is short, but all the dishes we ordered were impressive in taste and freshness. definitely go for a set menu (many variations). our stew set came with complimentary salad and tagliatelle. i had planned to eat a salad but ended up gorging 3 courses including beef and foie gras! even the complimentary meringue that comes with coffee is homemade. service was great and jovial. will definitely return!; lovely meal. lovely hostess. enjoyed all my courses at this cute bistro. hostess was gracious enough to translate the whole menu for me. wine choices (i had a rose, white and red) - all delicious. would happily eat here every night! it has that homely feel whilst the food is high quality - with an interesting asian subplot (my salmon had lemongrass, there was a prawn curry etc), but still classically french. what a combo!

name: Au Babylone
reviews:
we were nearby grocery shopping and happened to discover this simple, no-frills family-run restaurant for lunch. the two women that took our orders and served us were both very friendly and helpful. everything we ordered was delicious. from the herring appetizer to the turkey with fusilli, beef carpaccio, mixed salad, and roast beef. too bad we are traveling with two young kids and the hotel we are staying at is not within walking distance or we would probably come back again during our stay in paris. highly recommended if you’re looking for a delicious, simple, home-cooked meal in a laid-back atmosphere.; visited: lunch, saturday, february 12, 2022.
i have had the fortune to enjoy several meals at this wonderful, family-run, establishment over the years: unfailingly, it always rewards a visit with excellent (traditional) food, a friendly welcome and its cosy, unspoilt, ambiance.
highest possible recommendation.; my husband and i were in paris a few weeks ago. we stopped in this lovely restaurant and had a wonderful meal.  great service and delicious food.; my friend and i stopped here for some lunch yesterday, we both had a gorgeous chèvre chaud salad. the service was impeccable and food was delicious. can’t wait to come back and see the ladies that run it 😊; food was good. friendly and well versed staff. service was excellent.  good value for money.

name: Le Petit Samaritain
reviews:
we spent a very comfortable time with very good and friendly service, and the price was reasonable.
the soup of the day we had was home-made style and was very nice with paprika and other vegetables as well as lots of melted cheese on top.; it was super noisy, due to some sort of gathering; we could hardly hear each other. the food was kind of mid, the confit de canard was a bit dry, the other food i tried was not exciting. the mousse au chocolat was absolutely terrible, neither of us who ordered it had more than a taste before giving up. it was like eating cold, dense cake frosting. the waitress was friendly and efficient.; have to say that it’s very badly cooked.  very oily, reheated fries, very overcooked frozen fish.  don’t know why it has rating 4.6 on google . i think it’s worth a 3.5/5 for the price it takes. not much service either .; fantastic restaurant. ambiance is perfect, tucked away from crowds. georgina was an incredible hostess and made the whole experience great. merci beaucoup!; it is a big mistake to come to paris without eating in this restaurant. it was easily the best meal i've had in my life. if i will ever be on death row i will order le petit samaritain's foie gras, poulpe, and confit canard as my last meal. merci!

name: Friends & Family Restaurant
reviews:
restaurant is so aptly named as the atmosphere is cosy with tables of patrons chatting happily away. the waiter is very friendly. even though he can barely speak english but still tries to communicate as much as he can. the menu is very simple. you either choose 2 courses pairing the mains with entrees or dessert for 28 euros or all 3 courses for 36 euros. all the items in each course is written in french onto the chalkboard. so i presume it is changed regularly. though i can't understand french,  its easily overcome with google lens . the entree of squid and chorizo sausages in an orange thick soup was a pleasant surprise. for the mains i tried beef tatare for the first time and it tastes good. ended meal with a chocolate mousse with sea salt. the waiter was a one man show handling many tables so each course took some time to arrive which was understandable. hope the restaurant can find some help soon for this kind gentleman :); great casual spot.
came for a thursday night dinner. service was very good and the staff is very nice. the place is quiet and chill and away of the street’s bustle.
buratta and the apricot crumble were the highlight of the evening.
beef fillet was also good, but nothing too exciting.; we were looking for a fine dine restaurant, this was recommended by our hotel staff, and surprisingly this was indeed a good experience. price it's reasonable, portions are great, great service! the only improvement i see are the desserts, they are too heavy by my taste, but definitely does not affect overall experience.; the restaurant was an absolutely fantastic discovery having come here for dinner with a friend! we chose it judging by all the positive reviews & we weren't disappointed 😍 every dish that we ordered was absolutely exquisite!! we had the burrata as a starter, the dorade ceviche as a main and the seasonal crumble, as well s the mousse au chocolat for dessert - each and every one of them was a little wow experience 🤯 the prices were fair for the outstanding quality - 27€ for a starter + a main dish or a main dish + a dessert; or 35€ for all the three courses. i had a white wine suggested which fit perfectly with the food and all in all, the service was so warm and welcoming, which is extremely refreshing in the world of grumpy parisian waiters 😅 the only thing to mention, is that it would be great to have some more qualitative tea instead of just lipton in a tea bag 😏 it's located in a little hidden street, so it's really calm & away from all the noise of the cars, while being super central, it's simply the perfect mix!!! we will be back for sure & i have already suggested it to other friends ♥️; it was a nice fixed price menu place. my favorites were the mushroom soup starter and the desserts. for my entrée i had the steak tartare, and i guess it's one of those things i can check off the list as having tried. they've got plenty of wines to choose from, if that's your thing.

name: LArchimede - Restaurant Bistronomique Paris 10
formatted_address: 11 Rue Marie et Louise, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
exquisite experience.
food was wonderful, every dish was on point and staff recommendations were accurate.
very delicious.; best french food i experienced. hat off to chef. we would like to come back again. hope they have more selections to choose from.; at 2 steps from the canal saint martin, in a quiet street, a very nice restaurant with human size main room and terrace.
a short and updated menu with 3 starters, 3 mains and 3 desserts, which is a garanty of freshness and good products
i ate with a friend and we were delighted by the taste, quantity and balance of our dishes.
a great and pleasant experience highly recommended; food and wines are good!!! the main course beef is a bit tough though.; lovely meal in a relaxed atmosphere. the service is very friendly and welcoming!

name: Le Trumilou
vicinity: 84 Quai de l'Hôtel de ville, Paris
formatted_address: 84 Quai de l'Hôtel de ville, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
we visited this restaurant for dinner based on a recommendation and we’re so glad we did! despite a little bit of a language barrier, we managed to order our appetizers - an avocado “caviar” and oeuf de mayonnaise. i think what was brought out instead was a daily special which was eggplant based, and whereas i was expecting more like deviled eggs, what we received was a salad with eggs and mayo was n the side. despite the hiccup, it was delicious. the eggplant dish was really good, and not sure what makes french mayo taste so good, but i had no problem slathering this over my eggs.

for our main meal. my husband ordered the duck with prunes with a side of pan fried vegetables and i had the beef fillet with pepper sauce and fries and a nice glass of bordeaux. i am not a fan of duck but this was the best duck i’ve ever tasted. i would seriously have no problem going there again and ordering that dish.

my steak was medium, as requested (glad they asked!) and i appreciated that they served the gravy without the peppercorns. i can’t tell you how many times i’ve ordered a similar dish and they filled with them. biting into them just ruins the dish for me. this sauce was so good i kept dipping my fries and bread into it. and i truly did not mind that it got into my salad!; really loved the french onion soup and snails. great food and nice place to people watch if you sit outside. the duck was slightly over cooked and the sauce’s tangy taste over powered the duck a bit and there was a lot of sauce. other than that everything else was very good!; a great place to try authentic/traditional french dishes. unfortunately, not the largest portion sizes, so either spend a lot for not a lot or go not too hungry.

very good mayonnaise; not store bought.

snails: texture of octopus, "taste likes chicken" - just meat innit. a novelty dish which doesn't taste bad, just tiny bits of garlic sauce smothered meat. (snails will taste similar everywhere.); very authentic place, rare food items, kind and quiet service.

your are welcomed into what a french restaurant use to look like maybe 40/50 years ago. this is your authentic french bistro of paris. you may get out of here for some very nice food such as roast pork, tartare, snails and frog legs.
but i preferred the most today : the duck with plums, and the sweetbread ( it’s an organic located around the throat of the veal that disappears during growth ) were truly moving. generous, the sauce of the duck is just a nice cuddle that enveloppes the meat and makes it juicy and moist.

true bites of pleasure.

the vue is very nice, you can see notre dame, i would rearrange the plants to have more light inside, and maybe put some old french variety. but the ambiance of the seats and the staff was welcoming. away from the craziness of some touristic spots!; very nice atmospheric place, friendly staff and quick serving times. we ordered the escargot which were delicious, however we both got steaks, pepper steak and the beef fillet with butter and ordered them medium, but they were very overcooked, not even slightly pink.

i wish i could have communicated it then, but that’s okay, we still had a lovely time.

name: Hippopotamus Steakhouse
reviews: great location near gare montparnasse, very good size servings and their staff are excellent. we celebrated a birthday here and the staff went above and beyond to make our experience memorable.; the sirlon steak is very greasy and it has hair on it. the was the bottom of the steak so i know it's not mine. my husband described his burger patty as flavorless with velvetta cheese on top. also we asked for water when he brought out food and we have yet to get it.; casual steakhouse reminiscent of steak chains in other countries with plenty of indoor seating.  service was good with servers with a great deal of patience for the tourist crowd.  we ordered the smaller steak, which was a flank steak cooked to order.  the steak was good and cooked correctly.  the peppercorn sauce was nice but they had several to choose from and i kind of wish i had tried something new.  the apple pie skillet was very nice - much less emphasis on the sugar and cinnamon and a whole lot more pressure on the apples, which turned out very nice.; lovely eatery, my partner and i order steak with jacket potato (be warned jacket potatoes are huge!) both steaks were lovely as we shared each, we had a alcoholic drink, coffee and dessert as well and was just under €80 euro which is good. our server audrey was superb and assisted us as both of us speak little french!!; as what the restaurant name is, this place serves steak. i order a entrecote and medium rare so it turns up at the right texture.....soft and chewy. definitely will consider to go back for the food but the restaurant is quite noisy.

name: Au Pied de Cochon
reviews:
a true parisian bistro classic, established in 1947, this wonderful bistro is full of stories and atmosphere. as the name would suggest, it specialises in pork dishes, but also has a variety of other options. deserts are all made on the premises and are to die for. great wine selection too.... amazing service, very professional, but welcoming and friendly. no problems if you are an english speaker, but at least try your french, it's always appreciated.
loved it!; after the snotty reception from the host, i wasn’t expecting much but the food and atmosphere were very nice.  the french onion soup was great, the large portion of muscles were yummy with tasty fries and the 14 hour cooked pork and mashed potatoes were excellent.  our waitress was lovely.  we sat outside and enjoyed.; tradition french restaurant vibes
food was good and there’s a wide selection of oysters, seafood and other french dishes.

the place was a little stuffy and we were not able to open the window.

i ordered the coffee and miniatures desserts, slightly too sweet for me.

overall the vibe is lively and in a vibrant area, though nothing surprising.; i think this is one of the traditional french restaurants with a cozy decoration.
the onion soup is wonderful, the sweetness from the onion and the soup is not salty.
the mussel pot tastes brilliant. a simple way to cook lights up the freshness of the mussel.
the sea bass is surprisingly well. crunchy skin with a moist fish meat.; quintessential parisian brasserie. gruff service to begin with, but once our server realized we were there for the long haul, the service improved dramatically. amazing experience overall. great people watching on the patio!

name: Hippopotamus
reviews:
used to love coming here. the meat was of great quality and the prices were very good, it was worth it. the food quality is now cheaper than other faster foods, asked for a hamburger, the cheese was still cold, the bread same, very thin and of bad quality, ask the server to have it at least a bit warm, and she came up with some random excuse. do not recommend; service is not that great
they are busy all time

food was good
chicken burger was so fresh and delicious
wings were good but they did not provide any ranch or blue cheese or any kind of sauce on the side ..!
i would recommended adding them ..!
when i asked the waitress said no side ..!

they have chips on entry for free
they are so good ..!

would recommend trying this place .!; we came in a perfect time where it’s not busy at all for our family of 5 to dine. our server kerine is so nice and friendly. food came on time and everything was delicious. and again our picky kids enjoyed their food. plus their ice cream deserts.
highly recommend this place in paris.; i recommend this restaurant. the service is polite, smiley and speak well english. you have to wait to be seated. we spent 110 eur for four meals, drinks, coffee and deserts. my doughter said that it was the best vegie burger she ever had. all meals were delicious.; best overall dinner is experience me and me girlfriend had in paris. great comfortable seats, great staff, great steaks, great drinks. clean toilets. easy to understand menu. full control on allergens like gluten free food. so, great for gluten free and coeliac people also.

name: Hippopotamus Steakhouse
reviews:
went here for a late dinner with friends. the restaurant was quieter at that time because we maybe missed the dinner crowd. my friends and i opted for the formula dinner, which is really a great value. i ordered the steak, which was a little tough.. my friends got the roast chicken and they were big fans of that. staff were very friendly and attentive, we did not have to wait around or feel the need to flag them down.; such wonderful service, we had great conversations with the personnel. they were very friendly. and the food was worth every cent.; the service was great, the steak amazing, the drinks and desserts very good. i am glad we went when we came to paris as we had been to one in marsaille and loved it.; food was good but service was below standard. we ordered menu with dessert but the waiter brought no dessert. then we have to ask again. also the waiter with tattoos was quite rude. he didn't listen to our order, having ciggerates and fun. the other waiter has to come and fill the order.
3 stars that's for food but 1 star for service.; great ambient, nice people and really good food (we ate burgers and various deserts)

name: Famille géorgienne
reviews:
i've discovered this restaurant thanks to a georgian friend of mine. i have never been disappointed by this restaurant. the food is amazing and heartwarming. the staff is pleasant. though, make a reservation as the restaurant is pretty small.
100% recommend; amazing! we happened to be staying nearby and stopped in for a late dinner. they were so friendly and helpful despite our french being abysmal and knowing nothing about georgian food. everything was fantastic! warm, comforting, and delicious food. i highly recommend to anyone if you're in the area.; little cozy place with incredible cuisine! khachapuri was very tasty with a lot of cheese, also liked the sauce of khinkali! everything was great, will definitely visit more! great atmosphere and very welcoming service.; we got just about every cheese bread on the menu and they were all so delicious! the ravioli were great too, both the meat and cheese ones. delicious, i want to go back already (but my stomach says... take a cheese bread break 😂).
very friendly owners/chefs too.; giorgi, thank you for the first and best georgian meal we have ever eaten. your service and suggestions were great and we had a super tasty meal and the best bottle of wine!

name: Le Tourne Bouchon
reviews:
wonderful little family owned restaurant.  nice food, amazing atmosphere and the best host and hostess in paris.  the chocolate mousse is delicious!

thank you!; great value for money and very nice service. starter & main or main & desert for 13€ is a great deal.; passed by this restaurant and decided to give it a try before rushing to the airport. we were english speaking and they only spoke french, but they tried their best. duck confit was really excellent. steak and frites tasted great but the meat they gave was a really small portion. just wanted to commend their service as we left our jackets there but they still kept it for us past their closing time. thank you for the experience!; cozy restaurant, super kind staff and tasty food at a budget friendly price.; very good food here. full of local people enjoying cous cous on the weekend. i had lamb cous cous. it was served with a delicious sausage as well as the lamb. the vegetable stew to go with it was very tasty. good coffee. nice rouge wine. friendly service. highly recommend.

name: L'Alsacien Châtelet - Restaurant / Bar à Flammekueche
reviews:
very good food and homemade drinks.
nice atmosphere.
super nice and helpful staff.
definitely recommending it.
pay at the counter when you finished. both card and cash are possible.; i love this restaurant! great food, good beer, nice atmosphere and pleasant service. if you're in the mood for flammkuchen, be sure to visit these restaurants.; quite delicious. this was my first time trying alsacien cuisine and it didn’t disappoint! ☺️; pizza was good, but service was terrible. not many tables were available at that night, either with reservation or no reservation without table then, that’s it. but the girl took few minutes to study, evaluate and consider the seat (ok, no worries, we can wait), but she was the one acting impatient to the situation. when me and my friend were being seated, the menu was thrown to table rudely, i am not sure if this restaurant is asian-hater or not friendly to all non french speaker, or too stressful to facing good business night, what i know is “"to be respected, you must first respect others."; loved the food and reasonable prices, service was also fair. drop by for some delicious flammkuchen!

name: Hippopotamus
reviews:
16th august 2024
food tasty and well portioned.
restaurant feels a little like a fast food restaurant but it's fine. prices are good.  service friendly and efficient.
we had the half roasted chicken with potatoes and salad plus the steak skewer. they also give you bread rolls and home made crisps which are yummy.

18th august 2024
was served by soléna who was friendly, spoke good english and gave us a good insight into the menu. another great meal. had the entrecote steak and pork ribs.
would definitely return but are leaving paris tomorrow morning.; madalina was an excellent server. my french isn't that good, but she was able to assist me in english when ordering. she made my dinner experience a very comfortable one. i highly recommend this restaurant if anyone is looking for high-quality meat to eat.; drawn in by the extensive menu and warm looking atmosphere.

we waited exactly 1 hour and 15 minutes from order time to delivery of our 2 burgers and 1 steak.
the only thing that came early was the kids meal and appetizer for one member of our party.
the only thing that kept us from eating our shoes were the small amount of chips and bread (with no butter or side plates) we got early on.

tables that sat after us got their food before us, when we got there it wasn't too busy, when we were done were one of the only ones left.

my theory - given service is tucked into the price, those that ordered lots of drinks and more expensive meals get fed first.

of all the places we ate while visiting in the area, never had this issue.

the ribeye- first came out rare (ordered medium) which was then fixed to well done -- was extremely fatty, chewy and lacked flavour. apple crisp  dessert lacked apples. the only redemption was the chocolate mousse and fries.; american restaurant.
nice food. mostly meat.
service was great.; i highly recommend this restaurant!
the food, service & atmosphere is brilliant.
i attended here with my daughter; i had the salmon with vegetables & my daughter had the cheeseburger with chips for our main course. they were cooked perfectly. we then had dessert, i had the strawberry soup with lime sorbet which was out of this world. my daughter had the chocolate cake which was very rich & oozes melted chocolate in the centre served with real vanilla ice cream.
the total cost of the entire meal was fantastic we expected to pay more.
would definitely visit here again when we return to paris.

name: Casa Festa
reviews:
our server karene was both cheerful and delightful. pizza was as good as anything you would find in naples and it was nice to discover some healthy salads (not always an easy find in paris). prices were very reasonable, especially the tasty house wine. not to be missed!; an exceptional dining experience! the service was truly outstanding, with the main server going above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed. you felt like you were right in italy the minute you walk in and greeted by the servers. from delicious italian pasta to escargot and a great rosè, every dish was a delight. the attentive service made the meal truly memorable. it’s hard to come by this great of hospitality in paris. highly recommend this gem of a restaurant!; stopped in for dinner on a sunday and it was not crowded. they had a menu in english. the pizza was delicious and the staff were both kind to our baby.; great food and even better service. the workers are fast, friendly, and fun. we visited for lunch and dinner. both times they were very busy, but were able to get us in without a wait. we can recommend the goat cheese and honey ravioli, milan chicken, salmon, veal with parma ham, and tiramasu. modest prices.; we had authentic italian pasta with very good italian red wine. the waiters are friendly, sometimes with maybe a bit too much sarcasm for some.

we got some olives before the pasta came, and parmigiano and baguette to the pasta. they asked where are we from and gave us a free round of kir. to the table next to us came some people from poland and they got a free round of zubrowka.

name: La Table d'Hami
reviews:
very disappointing. starters are good but overpriced, and the bibimbap was sadly the worst i ever had: the bowl was not hot enough, so the rice didn’t turn crunchy, there were salad leaves that of course cooked once mixed with the rest, overall the taste was pretty bland.
the crew was however very nice and welcoming.; friendly and helpful staff. the food was delicious and very well presented. i had the japchae, bibimpap with bulgogi. sticky rice balls with red bean paste were a nice finish. would recommend for anyone craving korean food. it would be nice to have a grill, but maybe that's in the future.; the spot was so cozy, with a helpful and nice owner. the taste of everything was exquisite. i totally recommend the dessert, with a black sesame ice cream and a lemon mousse. thr gyozas were so good too.; cute well-placed restaurant.  delicious chicken bibimbap, veggies all deliciously cooked and dressed,  was great for a rather rushed lunch. the piping hot ginger tea was so sweet there was no need for dessert. very much looking forward to a more relaxed return visit.; the food was ok, but not worth the money at all. for a very simple lunch for 3 people and only got one drink and tap water, we had to pay 105 euros. then their pin device wasn’t working and it clearly was because of a server error. it took forever for them to figure something out and call the service number. i’ve waited patiently until it was almost an hour later. there was no “sorry for the waiting” or a drink on the house for all the waiting or some reduction on the bill. in the meantime i got to have a good look at the kitchen and that wasn’t very satisfying either.

name: La Taverne du Cap Vert et du Brésil
reviews:
excellent food. brazilian feijoada was like homemade, brought me memories from family lunch. service was excepcional, he explained the whole menu and even managed to do some changes for us. that was great, well done!; the service was excellent, with very traditional food! tasty and delicious. the bolinho de bacalhau was one of the best, it reminded me of home.; great atmosphere, very friendly staff. food was extremely satisfying and hearty.; delicious brazilian food and nice staff. a cool place to go eat in easy going good mood environment.; the waiter is really the friendliest ever, super nice, witty and helpful.
the food is great, authentic but super tasty and affordable.
you feel like being invited by friends.

name: L'Alsacien République - Restaurant / Bar à Flammekueche
reviews:
