very cute spot! our group was the only ones in the restaurant which was nice. the server was very kind but not super attentive. the flamacouche was all absolutely delicious - the banana chocolate flamacouche was surprisingly tasty. would recommend!!; we hoped to find a place with some wines from alsace and some famous flammkuchen. we found this place and it was perfect! especially the mushroom flammkuchen was delicious. a very thin dough with a layer of sour cream and the fresh mushrooms on top. we missed a bit the authentic vibes. it felt a little more like something between a fast food chain and a modern restaurant. nothing wrong with that!; a relaxed and cozy spot for a meal and drink. the flammekueches were delicious, and we appreciated the variety of vegetarian and vegan options. i’d love to return on my next visit to paris!; really good food, portions and fair price! never tried before but it's delicious. just book your table in advance or you will need to eat in a small high table(doesn't matter if restaurant is empty).

place is cozy and service really kind. we definitely recommend!!

pd: check profiteroles as well.you won't regret it.; everything was great. salad was very fresh, dressing was delicious, as was the pizza and riesling. beat meal i’ve had in paris so far. ice cream is worth getting as well!

name: Hippopotamus
reviews:
we didn't eat but had some complementary homemade crisps served with our drinks.
both drinks and crisps were very tasty.

staff is very nice and the atmosphere quiet without feeling dull.; the view is amazing!
about the food, i recommend the rib it was delicious. the beer was also good. the portion is not that big at all.
the salad was big which was a surprise. the foie gras was reallllylyy good better than all the restaurant i have before.
the service was good.
the price is about 20+ for each dish.; if you’re looking for a great value meal with excellent service, hippopotamus steak house is a fantastic choice. we visited for lunch and opted for the lunch special, which included a main course and dessert. the meal was not only delicious but also provided excellent value for money.

i had the steak frites as part of the lunch special, and it was exceptional. the steak was cooked to perfection, tender, and flavorful, while the frites were crispy and perfectly seasoned. this classic combination was executed brilliantly, making for a highly satisfying meal.

the lunch special was a generous portion that left us all full and happy. each dish was prepared with care, featuring fresh and flavorful ingredients. the dessert was the perfect ending to a satisfying meal, offering a sweet treat that complemented the savory main course.

despite appearing a bit understaffed, the service was commendable. the staff was friendly, attentive, and respectful of our schedule. we mentioned that we had a show to attend, and they made sure to get everything done quickly without compromising on the quality of service.

overall, hippopotamus steak house provided a delightful dining experience with great food, good value, and attentive service. if you’re in the area and looking for a reliable place to enjoy a hearty meal, i highly recommend giving them a try.; finally food with flavor! i’ve been trying different places every day during my vacation and everything has been super bland with no flavor. however this place finally used seasoning.; my experience at hippopotamus steakhouse was satisfactory. the service was prompt and very attentive. i ordered the steak with fries and opted for the pepper sauce on the side, as it wasn't my favorite, but the steak itself was well-prepared. the bathrooms were clean, which is always a plus.

name: Les Enfants Perdus
reviews: we came here three times during our stay in the area. the food is absolutely exquisite. everything is cooked to perfection. service is great. i came and got the exact same meal every night, the veal. i tried veal at two other expensive restaurants, and they were not as good as the one here. the pain perdu is also the best desert..ever. we will miss this place and will be back next time we’re in paris.; great food with a very cozy atmosphere and  dim lightning. perfect to catch up with a friend or a date!; a very cosy restaurant, very welcoming and friendly staff. food is great, i had the beef tartare and foie gras and both are amazing. i wish i could try the escargots but it’s not the seasons.; les enfants perdus is a hidden gem! the salmon and lasagna were amazing. perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. great ambiance and service too. highly recommend; services and ambience are very nice!!!! but it’s a bit packed, literally we touched the people’s arms next to our table. food is good.

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
this is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of paris. the food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did i have a gastronomical experience. its just one of those places that gets popular i guess. the restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. the service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. the five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - i have had better. reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. it seems overpriced to me.; our second time in les enfants rouges was interesting. definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. cozy atmosphere. staff is super nice. best dish-desert. both pavlova and cheese cake were superb. lamb chops were delicious. neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. dishes from les enfants rouge and chef-patron daï shinozuka. he takes classic french ingredients and adds japanese flair. each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. the rum baba is the best in the world. with one bottle of wine, the cost was just under €100 a head.
the first time we came was about ten years ago. standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. five stars! (and the service was good too.); a must stop by place if you’re in paris. modern french cuisine, with a japanese twist. everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. reservation recommended! great selection of drinks including japanese cocktails and sake 👌; blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. this place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. the grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! all very interesting flavour combinations from both japanese and french influences. highly recommended!

name: Café du Marché des Enfants Rouges
reviews:
i went to this delicious bistro in paris. what a delight from the service, the food very well prepared, the light ambient music from our new location, jazz and pop, everything very light. the location is very good and the prices are fair. i recommend. eat light dishes like oeufs mayo and escargots with 12, typical french dishes.; solid bistro choice. came here twice due to the ease of its location. when i first arrived in paris and got the fish and chips. it  was decent, but not star. and again for a solid pre fix breakfast. the baguettes with butter and jam were warm, fresh, and delicious.; we wanted a sit-down restaurant and found this place near our air bnb. we sat down and checked out the menu.

we ordered, and the server was friendly.

our food arrived and was very delicious.  the burger was incredible.  the truffle fries were awesome.  the steak was cooked perfectly.  i'd definitely recommend trying this place out.; "café du marché des enfants rouges serves delicious food with speedy service. ideal for a quick and tasty meal!"; it was a lovely brasserie dining experience. the portion sizes were good and the prices were fair. i really enjoyed their house red wine. my steak came with a generous salad and a garlic dipping sauce which looked house-made. the salad my wife had was much better than one we had in montmartre a few days prior. a great place in a nice area.

name: Le Burger Fermier des Enfants Rouges
vicinity: Marché des, 39 Rue de Bretagne, Paris
formatted_address: Marché des, 39 Rue de Bretagne, 75003 Paris, France
reviews:
first of all: the burger and the fries where amazing. everyone was very nice and sweet. their selfmade sauce for the fries was also very tasty.
afterwards we had a chat with the owner and he told us that every product they use is either self made or from the region of paris.; friendly, fast, tasty.

this place operates with the customer designing their own burger; the french waiter was very helpful with this by providing recommendations.

very fast service with very generous portions - each bun is generously packed with the patty, pickles, and veggies. and each burger comes with a portion of fries!

overall, a very pleasant dining experience in a busy market facilitated by tasty food and friendly staff.

(note: à point angus beef burger pictured); i was skeptical with the reviews, but what can i say, this place makes a delicious burger. the bun is freshly made in the morning, if you get there before they open, you can see them putting the egg wash on the dough.

they don’t open exactly at noon, they opened around 12:15, but they were completely full by 12:30, so you need to be there early or line up.

burger patties are usually cooked to the more rare side in paris, so a medium is closer to a medium rare, seemingly the opposite of north america, so keep that in mind when ordering.

they definitely do not skimp on the cheese, and it overflows from the burger. taste wise, yes this is the best burger i have had in paris, so if you’re in the area and in a burger mood, come check them out.; pierre's stall, located in the marché couvert des enfants rouges, is an unstoppable burger machine. 🍔🍔🍔🍔🍔🍔

and if you have ever tried one, you know why.

here the burgers are actually perfect and it doesn't matter if you choose an angus or a chicken one.
starting from soft bun breads, everything is delicious. 😋

attentive service, despite the crowded place. not too many seats available. possibility to take away.

highly recommended.; the absolute burgers we have had! located inside a very cool market. despite the craziness they were able to seat us and provide amazing service and outstanding food.  a true must do when in paris!

name: Les enfants du marché
vicinity: Marché des, 39 Rue de Bretagne, Paris
formatted_address: Marché des, 39 Rue de Bretagne, 75003 Paris, France
reviews:
10/10 recommend! i loved the food and wine selection. the staff was friendly, you can trust their recommendations, the mussels with gorgonzola are a must. only tried two dishes as the portions were big and i was dinning solo. there were so many other dishes i wanted to try that i need to go back. they were playing good music and you can tell the staff were enjoying themselves, just a good vibe. no reservations so there is a line, however it moved fast, so don’t worry. i sat at a communal table and had a lovely chat with the people there. you can tell its a place for foodies. excellent place for lunch with great natural wines in paris.; this is the best kind of quick service high-quality market stand food. we had the muscles in a gorgeous gorgonzola sauce and a dry age steak with burned onion and chard beats. the food came out fast as the wine and both were delicious. solid rustic, honest cooking at its best highly recommended.; one of my favourite restaurants that i visited while i was in paris. an unassuming restaurant in the market with the freshest ingredients and elevated dishes! my personal favourite was the crudo but everything was a hit! the wines were delicious as well. they don’t take reservations so be prepared to wait on busier days.; my wife and i stumbled upon this gem while exploring the marche on a rainy day! long story short, this place blew our minds and hearts. this is the best food we had in all of paris! so much so that we had to go back on our last night. martial and chef shunta…thank you for your hospitality, making us feel special, and for your art and love for hospitality.; absolutely amazing food. it’s honestly the best tuna and squid i’ve had in my life. the vibe is chill and friendly, the quality of ingredients it’s astounding.
you have to wait in the queue though, but honestly it is so worth it.

fine dining in a casual environment, and a whole lot of wine

name: Les Fils à Maman Grands-Boulevards
reviews: so this place has the best burger i’ve ever had in my life.  we stayed at a hotel just down the street and found it by accident.  we went back 3 times.  lots of cool 80s stuff inside too.  it gets super busy so make a reservation; the vibe here is like travelling back in time to the 70s/80s with decor (cassette tape wall, kid and adult tv series posters and vintage signage) appointed from a time past. the origin story of the restaurant is featured in a spiral bound menu that was provided in addition to the fold-out brunch menu. the formule at 30 euros is a steal. in general, the restaurant offers great value for money. the egg/ham croissant was a 3 for me because of the scrambled egg quality (reminded me of cafeteria powdered eggs) and croissant quality (tough texture). the service is a 3 because the order had to be reconfirmed a few minutes after our drinks were served and one of our drinks was served “virgin” in error. the ambience is fun and the guests appeared to be very pleased. note: the table seating is very cozy; delicious food and friendly, accommodating staff. ambiance is nice as well, with plenty of interesting things to look at. we shared a charcuterie/appetizer platter, with deep fried croquettes of cheese, pulled pork and more, along with some sliced salami, pickles and some amazing "fries" made out of chickpeas. for mains, we had the chicken cordon bleu and some kind of mushroom and cheese pastry. they dont have english menus, but the staff was great about explaining things. give the french ipa a try as well!; on our final night in paris, my mother was really craving chicken cordon bleu and we were fortunate enough to find it at les fils a maman. service was great and we really loved the fun, quirky atmosphere. i ordered the filet mignon (delish) and the cosmo spritzes were great as well!; very pleasant dinner experience - they accommodate large groups with reservation. the cordon bleu chicken deserves all good reviews it has. other dishes are also tasty.

name: 808 Mac and Cheese
reviews:
stumbled across this place totally by accident and what a find! the guy behind the counter was really friendly and recommended the tokyo mac & cheese which came with chicken tenders, crispy onions and a sauce of your choice. the food was so hot and tasty and very reasonably priced. i'll definitely be back while i'm out in paris!; the food was good, but everything was oddly oily. i assume that it was because of the amount of cheese and the way the toppings were prepared for the macaroni and cheese. the flavors were very good and i really enjoyed it! i will say that the mac n cheese balls were underseasoned and a bit bland.; we really enjoyed our mac and cheese, there were different interesting options to choose from. we got the paris mac and cheese, which was amazing! the prices were affordable and included the drinks. service was friendly and helpful.; amazing food !!
portions are really big too, we couldn't finish our meal which we were ready sad about.; best mac n cheese i’ve had!! not only is there mac n cheese but there are burgers, salads, and chicken tenders as well!! good place for picky eaters and for those who love mac n cheese!!

name: Le Barbouille
reviews:
the best here is the staff - so kind and friendly and welcoming. the food is good and the portion sizes very generous, did not leave hungry. would return in le marais :); staff is very nice! the food is amazing and so are the drinks. must visit place if you are near le marais. spectacular spot to have a good time.; amazing beef tartare. the staff is quite helpful!; i spent a few hours in one afternoon at this café, drinking mulled wine, and writing quietly. this place is indisputably loved by the local. if you’re in paris and would like to feel a local bar vibe, or appreciate friendly interactions between the staff and customers, then this is the place.; really nice bistrot in the heart of paris with a great cuisine. the street does not have a lot of traffic so you can have a calm moment while having a great lunch. prices are correct and the flavours really good.
cherry on the top, the staff is really nice.

name: PNY
reviews:
paris isn’t exactly known for its burgers, but this place gives it a decent shot. the service was kind, though unremarkable, and the place was packed—a good sign, i suppose. i’m picky when it comes to burgers, but i was pleasantly surprised here. the regular cheeseburger was tasty, though the mustard-heavy sauce was overpowering, drowning out the other flavors. surprisingly, the vegan/vegetarian burger outshined its meaty counterpart, proving that plant-based doesn’t mean compromising on taste. the fries? perfectly crispy and small-cut, just the way i like them. i’ll be back.; the only burger place where it’s worth getting loaded fries. they use actual cheese rather than “cheddar” cream most places will use. i’ve come back and tried multiple burgers and they’re all great. the only thing i’m not a huge fan of is the oreo milkshake but the cheesecake is 😍; ordered the return of the cowboy and the vintage cheeseburger.

return of the cowboy was as not as good as this beast used to be. the bacon and crispy onion are soggy and not crunchy and the sauce was overpowering. the burger was still good but can be improved 3.5/5.

the vintage cheeseburger was amazing. buttery toasted bun to perfection! thick meat cooked medium juicy and luicy. the fillings were great and the simple mustard heavy ketchup and mayo sauce rounded this perfect creation. 5/5; delicious hamburgers and loaded fries. the oreo dunk shake is also masterful. i had the american and it was really good, and the bun was delicious. this is a nice small place with an interesting vibe, and large windows which open to the street. check it out.; pny has an atmosphere of a trendy burger place. the staff was nice but slow service. the burgers were not bad, however the bun super soft and spongey. lack of texture between the bun and the inside of the burger. got the vintage burger asked for no cheese, however still got cheese. the meat seemed flash frozen, not evenly cooked. however wasn’t bad. the salad was fun and refreshing, i enjoyed it. the chicken tenders had a good fry to them. burning man sauce definitely lived up to its name. overall not bad but doesn’t meet the price expectations.

name: Les chouettes (Grand Duc)
reviews:
10/12/2024

the staff was super nice and the restaurant had a great feel and theme. the food was good but maybe not great though i think it might be a difference in the steak i grew up with vs here. basically it's chewy and has been like this at multiple places. i'm betting that france has better laws on how cattle should be treated and better for cows may not equal more tender meat.

anyway, i still loved the restaurant and would enjoy going back and trying other foods.; the brunch was quite enjoyable and priced at 35 euros. the food was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. the restaurant wasn't overly crowded or noisy. we chose to sit outside, which was a lovely decision, making our sunday very relaxing. however, the waiting time was a tad excessive. i'm not sure of the reason, but we waited for over 30 minutes for our food to arrive; was all in all a pleasant except one of the dishes i was served gave me food poisoning and made me violently ill. i ordered sea bream carpaccio to start which did not taste fresh and scallop risotto for main which was pleasant. around 20 minutes after the meal i become very unwell and was stuck in my bed for 2 days; yes, the pictures look good but the food itself is horrible! i had so much high expectations for this place from the pictures i previously saw but ended up being disappointing. the food looks old and not fresh, tried the poulpe salad, not good, the octopus didn’t look fresh and the salad itself was not tasty. next, the fish fillet with vegetables, the fish was ok but some vegetables went bad and had to spit it out as i didn’t want to end up with a food intoxication. to finish, the creme brûlée was ok but too much sugar on top or they didn’t take the time to burn it all and ended up with big pieces of raw sugar in the mouth. the staff was lovely and the space is really nice. it’s such a waste to serve such poor quality food in such a beautiful space. i would seriously invest in finding a better chef or whoever is responsible of the menu !; went for my birthday as a surprise! and the sunday brunch was absolutely amazing - the freshest seasonal vegetables, fish, the lemon cake - oh my! i also had some white wine - chablis and tried their fois gras. everything was  excellent presented and tasted great. our waiter was very kind and spoke bothe french and english. the spot wasn't as packed as many of the other restaurants in le marais which made it even more special. and the decor is perfect for a special event.

name: Chez Jeanphi
reviews:
sweet little place with lovely service and honestly some of the best tasting pita i’ve ever had! just take the hummus on the side as well.; "very delicious food and fast service. a great spot for a satisfying and efficient meal!"; the best pita i have had and the humus is excellent. they were extremely accommodating with food allergies. a must!  i highly recommend.; disappointing. i don’t know why this place is hyped, i tried the vegetarian pita, and it completely lacked flavor… veggies also felt very heavy as it was cooked in too much oil, i would skip it; we ordered the hummus and french fries as appetizers and the meat and chicken pitas. the appetizers were great. the meat pita was amazing , very juicy and flavorful poivre sauce. i did not like the chicken pita very much it was way too much chicken breast with little sides and not enough sauce. after a while i could just taste the chicken , and the texture wasn’t great. the meat was shredded so it was easy to pull off the sandwich but the chicken was cut in huge blocks and made it chunky and hard to eat. i would’ve done this dish differently but it was
still good.

name: Le Troisième Café
reviews:
i went there for the dinner and after visited there, this restaurant becomes my favorite spot in paris! love their home made delicious healthy food and the vibe! also, the staffs is so friendly and so cute! will visit again when i go back to paris for sure ! :); an incredible find which we stumbled on one random afternoon. the owner serves free food to those in need but has incredible, fresh plates for a small price for those that can afford!
kind, wonderful hospitality and excellent food!; my girlfriend and i wandered in off the street after smelling the wonderful aromas from the sidewalk- it turned into a highlight of our trip to paris! the food was wonderful- braised lamb so tender you could cut it with a fork, tangy bulger salad with lentils, veggies, and vinaigrette, and a chantilly cake with pineapple. but even better than the food was the warm and welcoming atmosphere. three separate staff members (including the chef) came to see how we were doing, the chef came over and welcomed us (and goofed around for the lost americans). we felt at home and comfortable; the ambience was better than any of the other dinners during our week in paris. it was like having a good friend make a great meal for you. and to top it off, 2 dinners, dessert, and a bottle of wine cost only 30 euros. i cannot recommend it highly enough.

we had a wonderful experience and; lovely homemade food, they gave us a free biscuit too. really like the atmosphere of this place, would highly recommend!; charming place with simple home made cooking. friendly staff, delicious food and reasonable prices. surprisingly this was one of the best meals we had in paris.

name: Les Enfants Sauvages
reviews:
good selection of wines, cosy atmosphere, and very good food plates to share!! highly recommend; nice warm place with low music..
limited tables.

for sure might get interesting later in the night..
loom around this street and you will find this place vibes with young crowd from around…
guests who have a table or have reserved a table sit there till they wind up and it’s not a hop off pll lm ace.

friendly people there at your service.
they have a small open kitchen which serves great snacks and food.

getting a table later than 19.00hours is difficult, you need to be there early.
you just need to keep requesting that you need a table.; i totally understand this is paris. i get there at 6:30 and they tell me that they’re not open till 7 pm. i’m not asking for a meal on asking for pate. pate does not have to be cooked number two they were dirty glasses dirty dishes at the bar as i’m ordering a half a liter of wine. disgusting bad hygiene,

your staff is young and regardless of that to not sophisticated enough to give good service. you should teach them how to address people.; awesome staff, great finger foods, great wine.; excellent atmosphere   lovely food and very welcoming staff. if we ever come to paris again we will definitely book a table here.

name: Les Vitelloni
reviews: this is a hidden gem in paris.  located in a very quaint neighbourhood. my mother is italian and this is one of the best italian restaurants i have been to.  the food is very fresh, the pasta as it should be; al dente, the menu is quality over quantity with very generous portions and a daily specials menu.   a classic drinks menu.   very friendly and welcoming and filled with locals.  this is a place that you must visit when in paris.; this restaurant is just an amazing place! service can already cover all your needs. food delicious, fresh, tasty. randomly we were passing this place and paid attention on crazy smell from inside, checked menu on the entrance. then adorable italian man came and gave us full menu to check, cos on entrance it’s daily offers. we never regretted. also really appreciate that guys don’t mind if you sharing dishes, because usually staff in restaurants give a look on us when we are saying we would like to share (we really love to try more different meals, but can’t eat a lot). it was bellissimo! gracie!; fantastic food, service and atmosphere. roquette and parmesan has never looked so good, and the speck ravioli was simply perfect. merci!; our first time at the restaurant and it won't be our last. the food was excellent but the service was even better. it's a warm, friendly, inviting atmosphere.  it will definitely be in our rotation on our trips back to paris; a port of refuge on a very rainy night in paris.  the atmosphere is warm and comfortable.  the staff are very friendly and helpful to english speakers.  the cocktails, appetizers, mains and desserts were delicious and serving sizes are very satisfying.

name: Café La Tour du Temple
reviews:
really worth my 5 star. don't get the 3.9 review. brunch worth 21 euros. the pasta at 15 euros scrumptous with parmesan shaker too! beer at a fantastic temperature for a hot day. the server very competent.; delicious!!! i had the burrata & oslo salad and my friend had the pasta and both were great! quick and friendly service with lots of outdoor seating to enjoy the nice spring weather.; new owner - new great authentic spot ! happy to be able to enjoy this beautiful view and outstanding service ! can’t wait to discover your dinning menu when the inside of restaurant will be open after a quick makeover.
we had a great apéro and we will be back.; service incredibly bad even for paris standards. have to ask twice for a knive for the butter the waiter brings me a spoon. the tartine is just one small piece of bread. only went her because la favorite on the other side of the church was closed but i definitely regret it.; i usually go there for drinks and first time trying lunch there !
great moment, tasty food, great service and quiet fast as well !
(fish n chips 17€)

name: L'Arbre à Cannelle
reviews:
it's all about the specials menu. great food and people, highly recommend! fyi they have an english menu if you prefer. take a walk/sit in the jardin des plantes and stop by for lunch. excellent homemade desserts!; i visited this place recently with my boyfriend after a long, exhausted day, and it couldn't be more comfortable and extraordinary experience. the host was completely polite and kind and attentive. we just had an amazing experience here and totally recommend it to you! 🥰
p.s. the food was delicious!!!; came for lunch and was impressed. the food quality and flavor was absolutely outstanding. for a small cosy restaurant, i was blown away. the steak, i took bloody, was so delicious as well as the duck which was the meal of the day. the sauce and salad even though it wasn't the main star of the dish was just as delicious. too bad i was running late and couldn't stay for dessert but i will return. fantastic all round.; we came for breakfast and ordered the “grand déj,"  which includes pancakes, eggs, and a glass of orange juice (barely half a glass, in fact). let’s just say that we weren't particularly impressed.; we visited the restaurant after the natural history museum. it is very local. all the workers are very friendly. we tried the onion soup and steak tartar. they were both amazing with a pair of caraf of their house wine. prices are very reasonable. if you are around it is a nice place to stop by.

name: La Banquette Marais
reviews: every dish the table ordered was exquisite. fair prices and such a cute neighborhood. staff was very nice. we ordered the duck, the eggplant with ricotta, and burger.; the best way to start a paris vacation! what an amazing night we had here. the staff were so kind and knowledgeable about allergies. we had fantastic wine and food. the cesar salad with chicken should be ordered the second you walk in. it is unreal! we loved the pavlova for dessert, and truly enjoyed the entire experience. we went for a late dinner and highly recommend you do the same. go here! (pictured last: our new best friends, the humans that run this awesome place!); must try! we absolutely loved this small restaurant. the food and wine were amazing. there were many seating options available outside as well as inside. we came for dinner however they also serve french breakfast and lunch! would definitely recommend.; what a treat to find this place! great vegetarian options! we had the zucchini tart and the eggplant and they were fresh, delicious, and a welcome change, the drinks were also really good and superb service and atmosphere, merci!; the dishes taste amazing and reasonably priced! octopus is smokey, crispy on the outside and soft inside, plus a wonderful  chimichurri. cauliflower is well seasoned and good grill flavor.

name: La ferme de Charles
formatted_address: 9 Cr des Petites Écuries, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
👍 absolutely satisfied with my experience at la ferme de charles! when it's good, it's good. the welcoming staff had such warm smiles, which was really delightful 😊 the decor creates an authentic atmosphere - love the cozy simplicity! opted for the lamb with seasonal veggies, the daily special, and it was a delightful choice. so delicious! overall, a great find with excellent value for money right in the heart of paris 🍽️👌; it's a bit difficult to gice a 2 star rating but i have to be honest.
the food was really average/bad.
appetizer fried parmesan rice balls were ok
terrine was ok
main: beef roti salad is extremely bad: super dry beef and week old potatoes
dish of the day was fish and fish was old frozen fish
but service was really nice. the waiters were super kind.
they offered to serve another dish since i didnt touch mine and i kindly refused.
so they offered the dessert fruit salad (unfortunately it was apple sauce with canned fruits)
but appreciated the gesture for sure.
since fixe menu was quite reasonable...can't complain much
unfortunately i will not take the chance to go back...; we are a family of 5 from the us.  we went for an all-you-can-eat brunch on the weekend.  it was pretty cold out (march), so we got a table indoors, and sat next to the windows.  the decor was cozy.  the furniture was all wood, and had antiques with a farm theme.

the vibe is v. family friendly and local.  we arrived early.  the dining space filled up pretty quickly, and included a mix of families and groups of adults.  aside from us, the clientele was all locals.

the food was great.  it included a large variety of dishes, so you're sure to find something you like.  on the day we went, there was poached and smoked salmon, mussels, a couple of chicken dishes, and a large roast beef.  in addition, there were homemade country style cold-cuts, pickled vegetables, and cheese (the cheeses were great!).  there were a lot of vegetable dishes, including a potato cheese gratin that was the best i've ever had.  the kind of thing you just can't stop eating.  to round things out, there was a fresh fruit and desert table.  i had some apple tarte, a crepe and an excellent double-expresso.

we were there for an a bit more than an hour.  the staff was great, v. friendly and helpful.  the bathroom was clean.  it's too bad we only found this place at the end of our trip, we would definitely have come again.; pretty nice and the staff is super nice! kitchen was closed and the chef took extra time to make a planche mixte. thanks again.; friendly stuff, original atmosphere, but one sort of beer, i would not recommend cordon bleu and french fries. tartar is good one.

name: Foufou
reviews:
i went on a cold friday in october/24, good food, service and atmosphere too, high point for the musical soundtrack! i enjoyed it! congratulations to the team that makes this place a great suggestion for a happy hour.; we had breakfast here today.  service is great & food was very fresh.  we had avocado toast, eggs, bacon, & pancakes.  they serve a nice cabbage salad with the avocado toast.  good vibe & good american music playing. def recommend!; very good breakfast here!
we enjoyed our avocado toast and baguette with jam.
very nice, english speaking staff 😁; popped by a few times for an espresso! lovely spot in the marais to sit for a bit and people watch. staff are nice and i like that it’s by a little park!; went for happy hour and was so pleasantly surprised by the aubergine with tahina!
just wanted a veggie snack and i did not expect it to be warm, with depth of flavors and textures - and also, how pretty it looked! they have many other snack options but i would come back just for that.
they also made any cocktail a mocktail during happy hour for 6€ which was nice.

great option for happy hour if you want something other than cheese & charcuterie boards.

name: Loufoque - Restaurant et bar à jeux
reviews:
we truly enjoyed our time there. 6 hours passed by so fast. needless to say all the games they had.
what we appreciated the most was the game animators there. they were so friendly and patient, explained us the games again and again, even in english!
they truly made our time there.
we will definitely go back soon. 👍🏻; very good vibes, the staff recommends games and can teach them to you! we just walked in but most of the tables were full around 7-ish so making a reservation might be best. they have a ton of games (somewhere in the 800s). very glad we decided to come in when we were just walking by.

i didn't catch our main game master's name but she was super nice and gave us a great game recommendation, and found a game we were looking for based on my partner's vague memory of a game he played one time. and another guy taught us turing machine. 5/5 staff

drinks and food are both good, though we only came for drinks and dessert.

highly recommend if you like games at all (wide selection) and/or food and a good restaurant atmosphere; this was hands down the best food we had in paris, the atmosphere was great even when we were there very early. they have a short menu but plenty of options for specific diets like vegetarian or alcohol-free. afterwards we got recommended a few quick easy to understand games even for if you don't understand french very well.
we were here on a tuesday in the low season and it was booked full later on in the evening so make sure to place a reservation.

the games require a small fee per person, but you can play unlimited after that. the food and drinks are not expensive though so all in all you can't go wrong here.

the only thing i wasn't a fan of was the slightly sticky, low tables and grungy toilets. i don't think they were dirty but they can come across as a bit off putting.; great board game place with an amazing array of games. the staff are super knowledgeable about the games and give wonderful advice depending on how long you want the game to last, how many players and what kind of game you want to play. on top of all that, they have a great selection of drinks and the food was tasty and fresh. can't wait to come back again!; great place, warm and welcoming. lots of games you can play and the staff is friendly and helpful. we stumbled there by chance, it was pouring rain outside and we found this amazing joint where we spent a couple of hours drinking hot chocolate and tea and playing games. if you're in paris, don't miss it!

name: Le Dernier Bar avant la Fin du Monde
reviews:
when we visit, this is one of our favorite haunts, a place filled with lots of charming sci-fi memorabilia, including a gremlin in the ceiling, et greeting you at the door, and the millenium falcon on the way to the bathrooms.  this year, it appears a little different than usual, but we still enjoyed ourselves, drinking some new cocktails.  there are community games, valuable resources on the wall, and usually there are lively groups of friends that gather and we imagine they are also playing some of these games on a regular basis.; interesting environment for people who like board games and toys from another era. the toilets were not very clean, the beers were ok, but you have to be especially careful with the people behind the bar: i ordered the same beers 3 times and each time they charged me a different price (increasingly higher). i realized this when i looked at my account. it's ugly to scam tourists.; absolutely loved that place with every kind of pop cultural references possible
ps : huge witcher figures !; great play for nerds to eat and have fun. tons of board games to freely play. great decorations (years ago when i went they had a giant venom head near the bathrooms and a mana potion over the bar), and pretty decent bar food named after tons of geek references.; super nice bar with loads of games! cocktails are on the expensive side when not in happy hour but still a bit of choice. the nachos bowl was our favorite, simple but loaded , we also tried the vegan and vegetarian platters, both good options as well.

name: LE NID - Cocon Ludique
reviews:
the people are nice and the game selection is very good. the downside is, however, that it's extremely noisy inside. players at the other tables were talking so loudly that i could bearly hear my friends around our table. putting sound absorbing panels on the walls and ceiling would really help. it is not expensive. some basic separators between tables would be good as well. also the ventilation was very weak, if there was any. as more people were coming, it became difficult to breathe. the fresh air flow should definitely be increased.; great amazing place to spend time with some friends. wide variety of board games with instructions in french, so be prepared to use your phone to find the english instructions (or the language you speak).

some of the staff speak like perfect english, which is very convenient.; nice bar off the main street.

we had a campari spritz and blonde beer.; awesome game place with very nice staff 🙂
📣 pretty loud and can be very loud if large groups are playing
🍒 many amazing vegetarian options - i highly recommend the veggie hot dog and the nachos 🌭
⬇️ it's a bit dark and stuffy if you get a table far from the entrance; i didn't try the food but i had a very fun time playing various games and enjoying a drink. i would suggest you ask for your second drink if you pass the 2 initial hours because you are still going to pay for it. it can get noisy but overall it was a great experience that i would definitely recommend. plus the variety of games makes it suitable for everyone!

name: Les Gamins
formatted_address: 6 Pl. du Marché Sainte-Catherine, 75004 Paris, France
reviews: charming cute little breakfast spot. friendly and courteous staff. great coffee and options. wife ordered the avo toast and i got the salmon benedict which was awesome. egg perfectly cooked and bernause sauce was glorious. cute outside seating and shaded area too.; this is the best breakfast we have had in paris! they have crepes, pancakes eggs, bacon…. all in a quaint little square tucked away from a busy street.; food was excellent !! situated in a beautiful area, the food and service here was wonderful. highly recommend if you are looking for a quaint breakfast/brunch spot. the portion sizes are large enough for one person, i was full after the muffins eggs benedict. my mom had the burrata toast.; i have never had such a nice and tasty brunch! the food was delicious and the service was really great!; the decor of this restaurant is so cute and cozy. the dishes are delicious (one of the best caramel machiato i've tasted). honorable mention for laura who was incredibly friendly, patient and helpful. can't recommend this restaurant enough

name: LE CAFE
reviews:
highly recommended!
very good food quality, generous portions, homemade dishes, reasonable prices.
excellent service and amazing friendly staff!
quiet cosy yet in the center!; friendly staffs and their food portion quite big
price reasonable 👍
there have indoor/outdoor , basically can cheer over there with group of friend
seat bit limited , better to make reservations if big group; i like the place, it's casual and the people are friendly.  the food is hit or miss, for example one time i ordered along with the 10 other friends i was dining with and they literally forgot to inform me that the oven used to make the croque madame was not working, as such i didn't eat.  despite this i have come back and it is a good place.; discover by chance when looking to kiliwatch. we were very satisfied with warm welcome and service, had a joyful breakfast.; perfect place to stop for dinner! excellent duck confit, charcuterie, and omelette! excellent atmosphere and service! dinner was accompanied by bread and balsamic vinegar, which was very good also!

name: Les Grands Gamins - Bar à jeux de société et Boutique
reviews:
amazing game bar! accurate reservation confirmation, convivial atmosphere, and super friendly staff. their service and advice were spot on. we had a great time and will definitely be back. highly recommend!; just what you would expect from a boards game bar. bartenders were very friendly, there is a decent collection of games to choose from and everyone around seems to be having fun !; not a bad place but felt a bit overpricy despite the positive comments. an entry fee is charged. in addition to that every two hours you have to buy something. had some muslim friends and they were not lenient on the fact that they were fasting. this messed up the vibe a bit unfortunately :(; very good and clean place, amazing staff, a lot of games still new under blister!!; a brightly lit and spacious place to play board games with a small or large company. the entrance fee is 3 euros for three hours. you have to order a drink with it. (since they don't have a liquor license, you have to order food when you order alcohol but otherwise, you can order soft drinks.)

they have a wide selection of games and the staff are super nice and helpful. they will explain all the rules and repeat it how many ever times you ask them. most of the games are in french but they have a lot of games where you don't need to use any language skills to pay.

at the end, when you go to pay, you can roll a pair of dice for a chance to win free entry. i played and won so i only paid for my drink and the 3 euros entrance fee was excluded.

name: Le Cirque - Beaubourg
reviews:
just stopped by for drinks and a pizza. pizza was good; much better than the rest we’ve had in paris. we had the pinder (pepperoni & green pepper). pizza was €16 and larger enough for 2 people. nice quick stop.; came for lunch on saturday and was a buffet for 35 eur. low quality food, would rather recommend a la carte or another restaurant non buffet for the price..; nice view to centre pompidou or have a drink/eat inside. possible tp privatisé the area for a private event. very well decor and the waiter attended us was very polite.; i'm giving 3 stars because the place is really nice!

but the burger was the worst i've ever eaten...  the stray dog should be beaten to make it eat this sheeeeeet. 🤣; a good place to drink with friends or colleagues. very professional, polite and friendly staffs.

name: Meisia
reviews:
super welcoming and friendly! loved the atmosphere, and beyond thousands of games to play they've got plenty to eat and drink as well.

our group is definitely going back there!; the food, the service, the games, the suggestions and explanations of new games… in english! both the kids and the adults loved it. it was the highlight of our trip for the 12-year-old and everyone spent a lovely evening. thank you! 😊 … and the pastis ; the staff are very friendly and accommodating especially to tourists (we spoke english), the game selection was good, and we had a great time in a really nice environment with good drinks.; kind of expensive. this place works by counting the time you have the right to be there based on how much you spend. (to put an example, if you spend 20€ you have the right to sit there for 2 hours or so. once your time finishes you have to buy something else or they will charge you the extra time). they start counting the time as soon as you sit, no matter if you're awaiting for someone else. the games are not that good, but the food is. nice hamburger though.; had a really fun time. it is 4 euros per hour or a drink/food above 4 euros per person. food did not seem great, drinks were ok. i recommend coming for the big selection of board games.

name: Fluctuat
reviews:
great place to stop for drinks while walking along the siene! very friendly and helpful staff and awesome music and overall atmosphere in the bar. fair prices too for their location! stopped in for drinks and ended up grabbing a pizza to go - which was delicious. highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a casual drink or eat!; this is one of our favorite restaurants and we come here often.  we booked online and received confirmations only to find the entire restaurant was closed due to a private event.  it will be like this through the summer i’m sure but please update your booking service so we don’t book if nothing is available.; friendly service and cozy atmosphere. bathrooms are clean and warm! tasty beer and a great location. fast service and delicious pizza.; quiet, quaint and sooo good. a really great lunch: lamb shank and beef stew, both generously watered with a carafe of côt red wine. the staff is lovely!; got a watermelon drink here, and it was really refreshing after spending a lot of the day walking.

the staff was very quick to make it and i was equally as quick to finish it.

name: Les Petites Flèches Strasbourg-Saint-Denis
reviews:
i reserved 3 dartboards in this bar for my birthday. the welcome was very good, and the staff was very friendly and available to explain the different games to us. the automatic scoring system by camera works very well, and the various game modes allow for a good mix of games, preventing it from being just one type of game.

we had 3 dartboards for 10 people, and it was the perfect amount for everyone to play quickly without having to wait. there’s also a global ranking between the different targets, which spices up the evening.

regarding drinks and food, the prices are reasonable, and all my friends told me the cocktails were strong and well-mixed. we ordered the large platter for everyone at €49. initially, we were 9 people, and we all ate from it. it was very good and plentiful. of course, it doesn’t replace a full meal, but it was sufficient for the evening.

overall, a very good birthday evening, especially in an air-conditioned place, and i highly recommend this spot.; loved it! lots of fun, the digital scoring is nice and throwing a dart is always so satisfying. also very reasonable price for a group activity in paris. everyone was eager to plan our next visit right away :); i had a team offsite in paris and made reservations at les petites fleches for a team activity.  my team had a such a great time that my boss wants to come back to paris for another team offsite just so they can visit there again.  the food was great, the drinks were great - but was better than everything was the service!  gia helped organize everything for from start to finish and then followed through with photos of my team.  i'm looking forward to having another team event there and hope that i can make it there too.  thank you gia and team for your incredible service to my team!; the dart board is great, the service is great, the drinks are great. food could have more variety :)
the guy spoke english :); nice place to enjoy dart and drinking

name: Les Éditeurs
reviews:
we were very grateful to be able to get in without a reservation at les éditeurs when dinner plans elsewhere fell through.
we had a great meal while enjoying the view from the outside seating. the service was wonderful and all of the food was delicious! we had the escargot, the scallop and leek entree, the steak frites entree, 3 cheese plate, and crème brûlée - every single thing we had was fantastic 👌; what a quaint place! they seated us right away and were more attentive than expected (we were told that’s not a thing in paris). the food was delicious! i had the special with caponata, seabass and crème brûlée—which was so light and creamy. my husband had the best chicken club sandwich and fries that put “chips” to shame!; great location at a lively intersection for plenty of people-watching while enjoying a drink or meal. we stopped by for a little walking break and enjoyed a cafe latte and the smoked salmon dish. the staff was very friendly — our server mohammad ali (yes, that’s his name) was fabulous! as a writer and editor, i especially love the bibliographic decor — and complimentary bookmark that comes with l’addition! 🤗; we recently had dinner at this lovely and cozy restaurant, and it was a delightful experience. the food was absolutely delicious, and the staff were incredibly kind and friendly. the location is just right, making it easy to find. overall, we had a wonderful dinner here and highly recommend it.; nothing to add, just love this place. les éditeurs never disappoints, great location, friendly staff, and food is yum.

name: Au Père Fouettard
reviews: the place has a nice terrace and the service was good. the waiter was very friendly and helpful. however, i was a bit disappointed with the food. i had the fish and chips and it came as small fish pieces that were over fried and became hard to eat. i think they could've done a better job with the dish.; really cute place to have a quick and nice lunch. the food was delicious and looked good! unfortunately the glasses weren’t clean, so we skipped the water that we got with it. recommend to go! :); wouldn’t recommend, skip this place if you can service was brisk and unfriendly (not a huge deal we’re in paris) but the food was the issue - worst of our whole trip. not sure what these guys think bruschetta is but it’s definitely not what we received (more like a pizza?)! the mojito was made with dark rum not white and had granulated sugar in it instead of syrup. croquette was more like an arancini ball and the bread was stale.; fish and chips. poisson sec. goût moyen. frites oubliables. the fish was dry. the taste of the chips very basic.; i only can recommend to play more happy songs :)

name: Le Luco
reviews: lovely little restaurant connected to the hotel observatoire luxembourg conveniently located opposite the gardens - near a metro station & the parthenon. you can do better but this is a great introduction to french onion soup & escargots. sit here in complete comfort whilst you watch the passing parade outside it’s so very french you’ll love it you’ll want to stay longer so check into the hotel. it’s perfect.; the burger du luco was so amazing!; great place to have lunch at after spending some time at the luxembourg park.; croque madam fabulous. very worthy express breakfast.; carl was fantastic and the food was so good! i had the salmon and mashed potatoes. will eat here again!

name: CHEZ BOUBOULE MONTORGUEIL
reviews:
nice place to have a drink and some food. you can play balls if you want (you register - for free- for a 30 min games with your friends)

only issue we had: the staff is really nice but can forget half of your order. so if you wait a bit, don’t hesitate to ask them for what’s missing; nice night out, good beers, good fun. nice service. loads of people on the waiting list for the pétanque and slightly narrow at the bar but recommended bar in this district !; a bit crowded but good fun. good taste of the french life.; very fun with a group, nice relaxed atmosphere. maybe a bit pushy on the order of drinks to be able to play. only one field here, gets quite crowded during the night. fun nonetheless; very friendly place. just a bit expensive but i can understand in the part of paris. if you want to play, you need to register as soon as you arrive as there is enough place for 1 game at a time only.

name: Le Drop Café
reviews: wonderful staff. they encouraged us to try new drinks, helped us explore new flavors and practice our french in a friendly atmosphere. this bar is also in a great location for sightseeing. they have a “french toast” dessert that is excellent and goes great with a coffee or cocktail.; we stopped by after a long afternoon at the musée d’orsay. the staff were welcoming and spoke english. we had steak and it was tender and cooked perfectly. we also had the crème brûle and it was heavenly. highly recommend!; very good location, amazing service by max who gave us recommendations on what to eat and the linguine pasta was 10/10 and crème brûlée was the best 👌; lovely friendly staff, great food choice and reasonably priced.; waited more than half an hour for our food (5 people's food) to arrive. the people who came later than us had their food earlier than us. the waiter or waitress didn't help to check the status of our food order before we asked one of them to check when our food will be done. service was not great. the basket of bread only came when our food came.

name: Le Grand Cerf
reviews:
stopped in for dinner and some wine on our first night in paris. everything was simply wonderful. cute little place with great food and service. :-)

update: stopped by a second night for just dessert and drinks. once again, a wonderful place. possibly the best part of our short trip to paris.; (from a thurs lunch in march, 4 people).
the best looking onion soup of my 2 weeks in france! tasted great too.
yummy champagne.
gregarious friendly service.
felt welcomed by staff.; me, daughter and grands had breakfast here sep of '24. server cedric was awesome, food was excellent, and the outdoor seating is flexible and can absorb large 6-8 person groups. pain perdu was kids fave where my scrambled eggs and bacon were perfect. highly recommended.; the breakfast was good and the service very fast. we got the big breakfast (formule coup de cour).
the view from outside is also very cute; came here for breakfast and it was great value and delicious. the service was decent! we ordered the formule, which came with croissant, bread, fresh orange juice, a hot drink (my son ordered a cafe crème), bacon and eggs, fruits, and yogurt with granola. my son ordered the pain perdu (french toast) which was super soft, flavorful, and delicious! the bacon was super fragrant and we loved it so much we decided to order a full size of it as well! another notable thing was the butter for the bread! so cute and so fragrant and delicious. highly recommend this place for an affordable breakfast or brunch!

name: Les Enfants Roy
reviews: an “original” gift idea for the birth. superb achievement, more than perfect customer service: efficiency and kindness! many thanks. a delighted and loyal customer.; it’s the birth or “1 year” gift! combining music, poetry and the child's first name. such a nice gift, i highly recommend!; my voucher had expired and customer service did not hesitate to reactivate it for me with great professionalism. thanks !; grandparents of soan, we are satisfied to have offered the starmyname giant heart box for his 3rd birthday. soan's birthday song was welcome. thank you for creating all these songs linked to his first name as well as the little booklet that accompanies it.; the site is very well done. i have placed several orders. and recently i made a mistake on a book and immediately i sent an email and the very quick response allowed the modification to be made.  modification is possible up to 5 hours after ordering.  very efficient after-sales service.  and quality is there.

name: Les Enfants Gâtés
formatted_address: 6 Bis Rue des Récollets, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: excellent, imaginative cuisine in a small cozy setting with wonderful service. appetizers were particularly creative.; great little place to stack up on good produce with a few cheese and saucisson options. open on sunday; good place to buy snacks that are tasty and healthy. some cool clothes for kids too; friendly staff. very good sausage. ok wine; wonderful wine cellar and delicatessen store.

name: Sipetit Paris
reviews:
carole t.
commack, ny

8/7/2022
my husband and i happened upon this store in october of last year.  we were so impressed, and wished we had a little kid who could wear something from here.  we are going back to paris this year and this will be one of our first stops.  the lovely woman who makes the clothes had offered to make me a head band that would fit me but we were leaving the next day.  we will be going back to si petit one of the first days of our next trip, to be sure we get that head band!   i can't wait!; bought the loveliest handmade jackets and outfit here and the owner is so nice! ☺️; very nice discovery of this shop which mainly sells children's clothing. everything is made in france and the materials are chosen with great taste. i fell for a lilac fleece kimono which caused a sensation. good welcome and the boss gives good advice.; bought very good and beautifully handcrafted children's clothing, with extremely nice advice! we'll be back!; very welcoming people, excellent quality of clothing, and lots of originality, colors and shapes...!
i highly recommend this store!

name: Les Petits Mecs - Costumes Enfant Cérémonie
formatted_address: 63 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
great quality and lots of options.; super coool; i am very satisfied with the costume i bought for my son in this store this week. there is a wide choice for both boys and girls. the costumes, dresses, shoes and accessories are beautiful and of high quality. the seller's advice helped me a lot in choosing the size and accessories. i really recommend this store without any hesitation.; visit the two stores in paris to purchase suits and shirts.
costume purchased in store and shirt online, collected in store.
quality products well cut according to the models but mediocre finishes. the seams are not clean, not neat and especially not done in places.

the welcome in store at château d'eaux, extremely negative experience, a disaster, the seller barely welcomes you, advice is non-existent, and aggressive behavior. you should not ask too many questions or be demanding. we clearly feel that we are disturbing. no support and no customer consideration, it's absolutely unprofessional.; very nice shop with a lot of choice unfortunately i deplore the lack of professionalism of the seller who does not hesitate to make prices according to the customers and who asks the customer in particular me to do a minimum of fitting of two suits no more, basically he doesn't want to take out the goods for nothing because if the size matches there's no point in trying other colors and finally to finish during my visit there are lots of customers who arrived from the neck he leaves you completely at the giving up is forgetting that you are there! to conclude the store i validate, the seller i do not validate at all he does not put you at ease and he is not very commercial i find that a shame because he gives a bad image to the brand! i don't recommend coming to the store but taking it on the site!

name: Retrovision Kids - Opticien spécialiste Enfant bébé adolescent- Marais - Paris
reviews:
this is a beautiful toy store with different toys than the ones you see in commercial stores.

loved the fact that they had musical instruments for kids!

the lady selling them was especially kind and ready to answer any questions.

great place to find some beautiful and fun toys for your kids :); amazing store for kids, cute selection and great customer service!! highly recommended; alex was helpful and good with children. she speaks english. she helped us replace our daughter’s lost glasses within 24 hours.; i am incredibly confident in france's economy where stores do so well, they refuse customers at the door "come back later!" okay but there are other stores for kids close by, i will never be back; what a scam. bought a toy for €39, realized that the standard price in any other store is €19! not 5 or 10€ difference, no no double. are you saying to yourself that for this price you will get a nice gift package and a bag? of course not, they make you pay additional 30c for an ordinary paper bag. i'll let you judge the quality and care given to the package!
impossible to get reimbursed obviously.
no commercial spirit, go your way.
so many other toy shops in paris that know how to convey the pleasure of giving a toy to a child.

name: Bonpoint
reviews:
looks good from outside but definitely closed on bastille day. psa; i love their design! one of the best brands for children. the patterns are so lovely. all the pieces are comfortable and children love wearing them. always a pleasure to pass by.; great quality and great service at this store...; a perfect welcome and service!
i went there twice and for both visits the customer experience was perfect...absolutely no negative aspects.
i will return without hesitation for future purchases.; very helpful and honest (did not force the purchase and recommended other stores for what i was really looking for..)

name: Marie Puce
reviews:
great looking little store for baby fashion. i stepped in to buy a pair of shoes of first baby shoes and when asking about size the sale assistant was trying to sell me different pair with hard sole. clearly we got on a wrong foot which can happen. i decided to leave but the lady wouldnt even respond to my « au revoir ». in the consequent conversation i was told (with finger being pointed at me)  not only i am rude, i have a big problem but also that i am a bad person and can never fix it. this was concluded by « aaa you can now go on the internet and write bad things » which indeed i am doing. lovely clothes though!; cute little french brand! lovely selection. good quality garments.; great spot for children’s wear.; i went to choose baby clothes for my niece's child who will be born in june. all of them are cute and eye-catching. the female staff member was very kind in giving me advice on sizing, and i decided on summer clothes that i could wear right after my baby was born. a wide variety of sizes are also recommended.; i fell in love with this store discovered on instagram, i do all my purchases there for my nephew!
don't hesitate to go there if you are looking for quality products. marie puce's team is welcoming and provides very good advice!

name: Tartine et Chocolat
formatted_address: 24 Rue de la Paix, 75002 Paris, France
reviews:
worst experience of my life!! the seller ( long black hair) is the rudest sales person i’ve ever encountered!!! just unacceptable.
came there to pick an online order asked her for a gift wrap, she aggressively points to the sac ( normal paper bag not at all for gift) that this is it!! wow!!! and rude ! really rude!; excellent service ! highly recommended ❤️; very pricey but they have good taffies; by far the best tartine et chocolat store in paris.
i love this brand as well as the welcome.
in addition, the store and employees are a credit to the brand.
in the time i have been buying, the quality and refinement have never disappointed me, the prices are more than reasonable compared to other brands.
the salespeople are all perfect
(smiling, pleasant, attentive...)
they take the time to advise and support you.
it's a joy.
thanks for everything.; while passing through paris, i went to the boutique on rue de la paix. very warm welcome, very pleasant shop. the salespeople are great, everyone took great care. many thanks again 🙏🏼

name: Au Vieux Campeur
reviews:
super knowledgeable and patient staff. always there to assist and guide to choose the most suitable rock-climbing shoes for each individual person. best shop of its kind.; great selection of climbing shoes that you can try. just the lack of some sizes can be annoying.; the store has a huge selection of climbing shoes. it may be overwhelming as a beginner but if you know what you want, you can just do it all yourself and find the right shoe. the customer service was pretty much non existent but that’s fine if you know what you want. i took one star off because i wanted to know if the shoe i was getting was leather (will stretch with use) or synthetic, but they couldn’t tell me.; on the map, it says this particular location is for children.  it seems they have multiple store fronts that are unconnected.  when we were here, this location had cycling gear and men’s shoes.

th reason for the three star is that the cashier was an idiot. my partner tried to pay for a pair of shoes. it was ‘declined’ when he tapped on the card reader. he did this twice. apparently, you need to insert the card if it’s over 50€. the cashier didn’t seem to know this fact. someone told us about it afterwards.; great place to try all the climbing shoes!!!

name: L'Arbre Enchanté
formatted_address: 40 Rue du Château d'Eau, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
excellent toy store.the personnel is willing to help and advise about yr choices.i recommend it strongly.; brilliant toy store, lots of wooden toys, mobiles, soft toys and books; kids; very cute little shop selling children's toys and books, costumes, etc. i love going there, it’s a real pleasure ; a toy store established since 2011, whose positioning has evolved, because at the beginning the assortment of (wooden) products was more high-end than today.
i am a customer for his miniature bird figurines (the stock is frequently renewed), a collection of an ornithology enthusiast...
the store can experience high traffic, but with salespeople who manage these flows well.

name: Loir Paris
reviews:
i heard from this brand from a close friend of mine and i decided to order a few dresses for my daughters. they came in quickly and were as pretty as i expected! i particularly enjoyed the mary dress with its floral pattern (wish they produced clothes for women too 🥲 !!); the staff was extremely nice to me, they didn't hesitate to help when i forgot to add a shirt to an order i placed a day before!! thank you ❤️🙇‍♀️; love it ! 😍; if you're looking for quality clothing that matches children and the seasons, you've come to the right place!
elegance, quality, ethics and service…
we have been following loir since its beginnings and we have never been disappointed! thank you for supporting our children every day.; first little romper purchased for my daughter.

very pretty, elegant cut.
beautiful materials, perfect finishes.

i'm delighted, can't wait to order again!

name: Babies Nageurs "L'enfant D'eau"
opening_hours: ['Monday: Closed', 'Tuesday: Closed', 'Wednesday: Closed', 'Thursday: Closed', 'Friday: Closed', 'Saturday: 9:30\u202fAM\u2009–\u20095:30\u202fPM', 'Sunday: Closed']
reviews:
we have a great time every saturday at the pool with our baby. we love bébés nageurs!; a great activity to do with the children all year round. the swimming pool is full of toys and children can move around in the water at their own pace, with advice from the lovely supervisors. we have been there now 3 years and we recommend it to everyone in the neighborhood!; second year that we have been swimming with my daughter every saturday. it's always so pleasant, the team is very friendly and reassuring! and the water is hot :); i've been participating in baby swimmers with my children at l'enfant d'eau for 5 years already and i'm leaving for a 6th year at the start of the school year!
warm atmosphere from the supervisors, a 32 degree pool filled with toys and activities.
this is not a course strictly speaking because everyone progresses at their own pace and benefits from the advice of the swimming instructors.; the perfect space to familiarize yourself with water and be safe as a parent! our daughter went there when she was 5 months old and is now impatiently awaiting her saturday appointment!

name: L'Enfant Lyre
reviews:
if you are a lover of children's books, then indulge yourself with a visit to l'enfant lyre. the owner greets you with the warmth of a friend, and without being pushy or precocious, she will help you find some wonderfully illustrated treasures to add to your collection.; such kind and helpful staff & a wonderful selection of books en francais!; great bookstore with children's books. great selection and great service advice. i recommend; a superb local bookstore full of surprises: there i found the classics of my childhood and discovered some very beautiful illustrators.
books and games for all ages, with a really warm welcome and excellent advice.
thanks !; the perfect place and advice for an uncle with many nieces and nephews who never knows what to buy

name: Poisplume
reviews:
superb shopping experience for my little nieces aged 3m - 2years. the lady at the store took the time to recommend some little clothes and toys (including the fabulous little journal for early learning) and the result - delighted children and parents! thank you thank you 🤩; superb store, it's an alibaba cave for making gifts for little ones but also for older ones! she differentiates herself from the others.
the salespeople are adorable and the service exceptional! rare to find this today.; a very varied choice in a small area, and above all very good advice, without pushing for sales.; very pretty boutique with a very nice selection of brands and designers.
the saleswoman gives very good advice and is adorable. there are lots of great gift ideas for the holidays.; magnificent boutique with a superb selection of designers.
a real gem for finding original christmas gifts!!!
the salespeople are super pleasant and attentive to our needs.
special mention for laury

name: L'hirondelle - Paris 4
reviews: best meal we had in paris!!! the lamb was fall off the bone tender and tasted amazing. the parisian salad was perfectly fresh and balanced and the octopus was very tender with an incredible sauce. we were told the chef here studied under one of the great chefs of paris and it really shows. it was nice to find a restaurant with a different menu than all the other cookie cutter menus in central paris. come here and you will not be disappointed! oh, also, it was very reasonable. 93 euros for 4 people which is great; very good traditional food for a decent price; the food was great, came out fast and the prices are reasonable; pleasant atmosphere. pleasant service. a fine accompaniment to my journey in paris; excellent bar !

name: Big Black Cook
reviews:
the best caribbean restaurant that i’ve had in paris so far. the sweet chicken is the restaurant special. i’ve been multiple times now and thoroughly enjoyed every dish. the flavor is wonderful. the service is good and a busy little spot.; dining at big black cook in paris was an extraordinary experience. both the food and the atmosphere were top tier. the waitstaff were very welcoming, taking the time to explain the venue and the menu, which was greatly appreciated.

specializing in caribbean cuisine, the restaurant served some of the best food i had in paris. i ordered the sweet chicken and fried plantains, and both dishes were absolutely amazing. while i didn't have a cocktail, they looked incredible and are definitely on my list for next time.

located in a vibrant area, big black cook is a must-stop if you want to enjoy delicious food in paris. highly recommended!; so good!! i had the columbo chicken plate and wow it was really good!! not heavy feeling, healthy and tasty. i can't handle hot food but made an effort for it, as i new it would be so good and yes it was spicy but yes its a good 2 out of 4 in hotness :)
good price too!
the homemade drink with ginger mint etc was good but maybe a bit too sweet for me.
thank you!!; this time is the third time i come back, and well i have the feeling that it has changed a little in terms of quantity, it is recommended to order an extra accompaniment of plantain or sweet potatoes if you want a notable quantity, the shrimp accras are very delicious but they are lacking a little bit of cooking n this time,but everything is very delicious,
it is not something that i would recommend as a great meal if you are a good eater but to try something good and flavorful... it's not bad, we all understand the location and the price which is food nowadays but i always look for restaurants of this style to transport me for a moment to my island, but there is nothing like the generosity of one's own homeland.

very attentive staff, very clean place and great decoration.; loved everything about this place! if you’re in paris go to this place. they have an english menu for us terrible french speakers 🤣 so you know what the dishes are. we went twice while we were in paris. great sized portions with flavorful food. make sure you try the infused rum and try the pepper sauce to but be careful because it’s spicy.

name: Le P'tit Bistrot
reviews:
this was our very first meal in paris and unfortunately was a terrible experience. we ordered the daily special and the beef was sooo tough our teeth were hurting trying to chew it. we told the servers about this after one bite and they angrily took it away without apologizing. when we got our bill, we were in disbelief that they still tried to charge us for it when we didn’t end up eating it. on top of that, they had the audacity to argue that they sold 30 today and no one else complained. i cannot speak for others, but all i know is that the beef on my plate was tough like rubber. i even encouraged the servers to try it. in the end, they reluctantly took it off our bill and threw it on our table. we hoped this was not representative of how customers are treated in france. i will never come here again and will warn everyone i know to avoid this place.; great vibes, solid food, good service. had the escargot, caesar salad, and tagliatelle w/ salmon. yum, would 100% recommend. meal and a view of the park - was a good day.; picked this place on a whim because we were starving having just come back into the city from stade de france to watch the rugby 7s for paris 2024.

food was fantastic. came out quickly. was cooked as asked. most importantly the staff were so friendly and nice and accommodating. we were a group of 6 mixed english and french speakers and they had no problem speaking both to the various group members. also shared a few laughs and they offered to take a photo of the group without us even asking.

would recommend coming here versus other places in the city centre of paris as there are tonnes that aren’t as high quality and friendly as this place.; excelent food and service just a little bit off the notre dame cathedral.
if in the area is an excelent choice.; lovely small bistro with delicious food.
we got the daily lunch menu - got the plates of the day together with desert and all the plates were absolutely delicious. lovely interesting salad, delicious pasta and juicy and well done steak with fries. desserts were divine as well.
quick and attentive service, our server brought us water multiple times, was lovely and nice.
sitting outside for us comes with challenge - we really don't like cigarette smoke, so it was annoying to smell smokers everywhere. likewise, the nearby road was little noisy.
but the good food was really winning over us.

name: Au Bistrot de la Montagne
vicinity: 38 Rue de la Montagne Sainte Geneviève, Paris
formatted_address: 38 Rue de la Montagne Ste Geneviève, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
we came here with a coach party,  for a 3 course meal with drinks included. i started with pate, then beef and finished with sorbet.  the food was excellent,  the drinks were free flowing and the service was great.  there was
also live music which added to the already lively atmosphere.  a great evening!!; au bistrot de la montagne was such a delight to eat at. it was my first experience eating at a french restaurant and i loved it. i had the french onion soup, chicken and potato with gravy and the apple tart with whip creme. the chicken was a little red which was a bit concerning but the bits i did eat was very nice. my favourite part of going here was the live music. two men, one with a guitar and one an accordion, who were singing and playing. it made it so atmospheric and so nice. the interior was also lovely though the tables were very close together so you didn’t have much room.; the atmosphere of this restaurant as well as the area is great! the service is outstanding. however, the food and drink was just ok for my taste.; just average selection of alcoholic drinks, in case of bigger groups as ours -60 persons not enough capacity of air conditioners, same for some other additional services. food above average, but not special one; tasty burger and wings for an affordable price. the food arrives really fast. very nice and friendly staff!

name: CRISPY SOUL Paris 2
reviews:
