great food and great service. waffle with 3 chicken fillet sounded different so we tasted it. volvic exotic juice bottles are a bit less concentrated, not very sweet. but the food was great and the service was excellent.; the burger was massive which is good because the price here is expensive. the price is kinda worth it because the burger was good. the sauce was my fav because i have never eating anything like it ( curry mango sauce ). the fries was spicy but not too much but over all. it has jalaepno and cheese and some sort of cayenne pepper powder.; remember my rant about staying authentic with american cuisine? this restaurant chain does that! instead of being gimmicky the chain actually respects the history of dishes like chicken & waffles and provides a delicious unique take to the meal. the flavor is there, the recipe is correct, and the price is perfect! highly recommend the midi menu for your next trip to paris or lyon. (also the music playlist at the restaurant reminded me of home 😊); unfortunately the chicken was not crispy at all, and so do the fries. i don’t know what happened, maybe they were boxed for too long before we got the order… we open the boxes as soon as we got them, so we were quite disappointed. the burger seemed good, but the chicken was not special at all.

service was not very welcoming.; amazing food! ordered the honey brown waffle and did not disappoint. halal as well :)

name: Bocamexa Marais - restaurant mexicain
formatted_address: 12 Rue du Bourg Tibourg, 75004 Paris, France
reviews: mexican food like you dream of! simple, great raw materials, friendly & competent service making sure you get what you like (we had plenty of samples). recommend the frozen margarita as well. when you are fed up with the french cuisine, go mexican!; food was great and so was the service! the menu is easy to understand so it is perfect to experiment with different flavours.; very fresh and tasty food. the restaurant person is so friendly and attentive to special requests. so humble! restaurant atmosphere is also quite vibrant. thanks.; live next to this place and never came in. finally tried it, and it's honestly insane. the frozen margaritas are to die for; the cook is not only a sweetheart, but he also makes the yummiest tacos (highly recommend the chicken and bbq tacos); overall, the entire staff is simply lovely, charming and welcoming. will be making it my go-to place from now on.; nice mexican restaurant. the burritos were tasty and service very friendly

name: Café Montorgueil
reviews: lovely local vibe, the waiters are professional and friendly. foods are also wonderful. recommend here; unbelievable experience overall, top service,  excellent food, good value, charming setting. great for people watching.  get the churcuterie board and the sancerre white wine,  you won't be disappointed.; cafe montorgueil offers a pleasant atmosphere and location. i liked the red fur on the chairs it's cute. they also had blankets if you were cold. i went 3 different times. i usually would get a croissant from stroher walk to cafe montorgueil and order coffee and enjoy people watching. i did go with friends and we ordered a charcuterie board can't remember the name of it but . it was plenty for 3 people. lots of cheese, meat, jams, bread, even froi gras which at this place i didn't like it, itbwas very strong in taste, also little sandwiches with different options, such as fish, chicken and meat. overall cute place. i didn't try any main food there and i dont think i would, doesn't seem like a place for that. tables are all tight together, but all the bistros are like that. if you want something small like coffee or wine and snacks while enjoying the day and people watching, i recommend it .; it's ok. they ask for tips, and if you don't leave any, they automatically change their attitude towards you .; they had a sign that said “2 for 1” for all drinks and we also asked for it to confirm it. yet when we were going to pay they were like its 2 for each person only so you have to pay for all the drinks. thank god, i know the law. we only paid for the drinks we got. if you’re a foreigner they’ll try to scam you with “i don’t know english well.” but they also forget french when you speak it. bisous!

name: Sardé
reviews:
sure! here’s a suggestion for your google review:

---

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

i recently dined at sarde in paris, and it was a fantastic experience! the lebanese food was absolutely delicious, bursting with authentic flavors that truly transported me.

if you're in paris and craving lebanese cuisine, i highly recommend sarde.; what can i say? original, flavorful, intriguing, yet authentic. wow!

(don't miss out on their lebanese lemonade); amazing food! pure authentic lebanese  food! must must try; had an awesome meal here. the food was excellent, but the service was even better. everyone there was super friendly and made the whole experience great.

the wraps are definitely the way to go—packed with flavor. the fries were seasoned just right, and even the coffee was solid.

if you’re looking for good food and even better service, this place won’t disappoint.; a nice and cozy place to enjoy delicious lebanese food. the dishes were well presented & the kebbeh reminded me of home!!! 😍 the desserts are a must try!!

name: Chez Cay
reviews:
we ordered a fried rice and pad thai for take away; the woman at the counter was very friendly and the atmosphere of the place seemed nice, but when we got home the food had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. a small bit of soy sauce included helped the rice a tiny bit, but every bit of the pad that was a grey-ish brown and devoid of any flavor or seasoning. very disappointed.; reasonable price, delicious dishes and very friendly service. i recommend; if you are in paris as a tourist and have been eating mcdonalds or burger king everyday you’ll realise that it actually does not work out very cheap and the food is not great at all. if you go to this place you will get a plate of egg fried rice and meat of your choice with a drink for the same exact price. try it you won’t regret it.; the food was really good, especially these dumplings with meat and cabbage. very good 👍 👏 👌 i had 2 orders to myself. staff were friendly and helpful. wasn't able to communicate with words but communicate with the shared enjoyed for the amazing food.; we found this unassuming little restaurant in a rush, just coming out of the centre pompidou (only 2mins away on foot), and were blown away by the food, service, and prices.

to start off, i casually asked how long it would take as we were in a rush, and the owner was more than understanding. she recommended dishes that would take quicker and our fried rice dishes and fried noodles were on our table within five minutes. extremely kind and friendly, and watching the other customers you could tell she has that rapport with everyone.

the food! no frills, just simple, and damn good. we ordered a veggie fried rice, chicken fried rice, and veggie fried noodles. it was much better than most else i’ve had at other “asian fusion” restaurants at double the price. the portions were also very generous.

this is the kind of food my friend and i, both being from taiwan, ate growing up at neighbourhood places. to have found this in paris, after living abroad for so long, really warmed my heart. i would absolutely recommend this place to anybody looking for authentic food of southern chinese origin.

name: Yumie-Yumie
formatted_address: 10 Rue de la Tacherie, 75004 Paris, France
reviews: paris has some  incredible bahn mis but this is not it. product doesn't taste fresh. bread is too hard. it leaves a lot to be desired. i'd skip this place during your stay in paris and find yourself someplace better.; love the beef bo buns noodle! good value with very nice service.; my family and i are from america and visit paris about three times a year.  whenever we do, we always eat at yumie yumie at least one time per visit - maybe more.  the two owner-sisters are our favorite people in paris!  my 11 year old daughter has adopted them as her long lost sisters.  they are very patient with our limited french and they spoke wonderful english. we've ordered almost everything on yhe menu at one time pr another and it's all amazing. every dish is expertly prepared using fresh, high quality ingredients. they have an extensive menu with every type and option of vietnamese dish one could want - and wonderful boba teas! the prices are extremely reasonable. they make us feel welcome and at like were "at home." we will continue to re-visit here every time we are in paris. thank you, yumie yumie,! 🙂👍❤️; super friendly staff and authentic south-east asian food. highly recommended for a quick exotic meal in a pleasant environment. the location of it also makes it an excellent option for lunch if you're visiting paris for a holiday. it's fairly close to major attractions! greetings from taiwan and the uk!; good food, union beef was delicious, owners quit funny and polite!

name: La Salle à Manger 2.0
reviews:
ordered los pollos plus, croc papou and for drinking a couple of wine cups.
the food was good and the waitress was really friendly.
recommended.; we went here over new years. from the uk. beautiful food, fresh and homemade. cute little restaurant with a very cosy, warming atmosphere. very polite staff and helped us with translating. perfection from the chef for all the dishes. would definitely recommend.; we are a group of americans and have had many fried chicken sandwiches before. this was the best i've had in my life. chicken was flavorful and delicious, great cheese, light flaky bun, tangy sauce and right balance of toppings. the spicy homemade sauce to go with the fries was the cherry on top. absolute perfection.; amazing place and amazing hosts!!!!
really lovely people and great location, food was amazing and they were able to host a 16 people group!!; really nice place with an amazing atmosphere, good coffee and huge mugs for a reasonable price. the big beer is only 4,8€ which is cheap for paris. the food is honestly the best i’ve had in years, every bite is better than the one before and it’s unlike anything you’ll ever eat. the potatoes are heavenly and the chicken is incredible. best thing is, it’s not expensive! for 20€ you’ll get a huge meal and a beer.will definitely come back at my next trip to paris, best restaurant ever.

name: Bistrot Benoit
vicinity: Hall Napoléon Pyramide du Louvre, Paris
formatted_address: Hall Napoléon Pyramide du Louvre, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
we had roasted chicken and ravioli there. they both tasted great! salad was ok. the waiter was so kind and welcoming. they brought us a lot of fresh breads with our meal. the service made the experience amazing.; delicious food and wonderful service here! the servers are very attentive and friendly, and eager to help us understand the menu. my husband and i enjoyed the plat + dessert menu formula for lunch after touring the louvre. the food is true to traditional french cuisine and absolutely delicious! we highly recommend the blanquette poulet and ravioli. superb!; arrived at about 4pm when snails were sold out.

ordered 4 dishes here and found all main dishes to be disappointing.
- roasted chicken breast is very dry, and tastes like rubber? the rice in the side is good.
- ordered medium steak but got it over cooked (again…like why it’s over and over again t.t). very salty by the way - i seriously do not recommend.

otherwise, salads are fine and tartlet dessert is eatable.

save yourself for some other places if you are not super hungry.; steak was unreal, can't remember the last time i had steak so tasty, one of the best i've had in a long time. ravioli was also excellent. staff were great, having a laugh with customers. our waitress even gave us a dessert for free. can't rate it highly enough. it doesn't look fancy but completely worth it and right beside information desk so if you need food quickly just go right there, food comes out fast.; was visiting the louvre museum and so decided to have our lunch here. we ordered 3 lunch sets costing €31.50 each. food is good but the portions are a little small. service could be better, it seems waiting staff would only respond to customers seated in their allocated zones only. i only realised this when the waiting staff not assigned to my zone would not respond to my request to order food.

name: Tasty Burger
reviews:
it's more of a fast food joint, but he makes a really good burger and fries. and there is a safe gluten free option. he has gluten free buns and the fries are safe too. i had the boeuf fromage, which comes with two cheeses and his sauces and garnish inside and it's really good. the fries were done just right, not soggy. they have six condiments to choose from including a home made sauce called "biggy" which is really good! the price and seating are like a fast food joint, and the meal quality is like a restaurant. i recommend it.; excellent burgers!
i had the classic one
everything is homemade, fries were so good
definitely worth it ! recommended; the chicken-potato burger was freakishly good. others were good, too: caramelized onion and red peppers on them - very good. good fries too.; delicious fries and gluten-free bun. burger was a bit dry, but the overall taste was really good. they have a bathroom for customers and a sitting area both in and outside.; i am sorry we went there reading the reviews and it was not tasty at all. the burgers did it do justice to the name of the restaurant. we tried the hot chicken and premium burgers and the chicken was deep fried a few times that it had lost all juiciness, it was so hard to chewy on it. you could feel the oil in every bite, let that be fries or burger. not a good experience.

name: Terry's Café
reviews:
i found this adorable cafe in my neighborhood when i visited paris. the dishes are fresh and tasty. the steak was especially good. the staff were courteous with great service. highly recommended!; it’s the kind of restaurants that offer 10 pages menu with many different types of cuisine, so, many of the food is frozen food and not homemade.
the snails are almost tasteless, no butter neither sauce.
the hamburger xxl was okay, but not worth the 28€! the crème brûlée was not brûlée and soggy. the tiramisu is good tho.
the service is very good, and the staff so nice.
however it is very pricey for the quality of the food!; this is a cosy place with a good selection of food. the cocktails are average. do give it a try if you're in that area. their menu option is the best.; quieter local restaurant - food is fine and reliable. ate here times in the past 4 months (may-september). french onion soup better than most on montparnasse and staff work well as a team.
the best lemon cheesecake of my life, but it’s not always available.
it would be nicer if they would do something about the fact that the whole restaurant smells of cigarettes, given that the smoking veranda pulls all the smoke into the space.
some days i didn’t come because i knew i wouldn’t be able to deal with the smoke that day.; the italian chef's specials are amazing, the sauce and the melted cheese were very tasty, i recommend, plus for the view 🤌

name: Breakfast in America - Marais
reviews:
i found this place while looking for a good full english breakfast in paris. spoiler alert: instead of finding an english breakfast, i found an american one.

the products don't exactly match the uk ones 100%, but i shouldn't have expected that anyway. the food was good and full of calories — as it should be! ;) the burger and desserts were also nice, and the restaurant has a great american vibe. if that's what you like, you should definitely visit.; potatoes were crispy, eggs scrambled perfectly, the banana french toast was delicioussss. much needed breakfast satisfaction.; we went to a small, charming breakfast place with our baby. the staff was polite, friendly, and helpful. however, the prices were a bit high for some items. we had asked for coffee, and they brought it with milk. they also refilled the second cup for free. i think it was a nice gesture of good service to refill the coffee twice.; a small but very welcoming place to have american dinner.
a very fluke that our waiter forgot my milk for my coffee but totally understandable as the place was really busy and he was on his own i believe.
overall our family would highly recommend this place if your looking for  english speaking breakfast and have a usual american breakfast; good restaurant overall. server was very nice and polite.
quesadilla was a little overcooked and didn’t have much cheese.  salad was very tasty and chicken bowl was good.

name: Le Relais Haussmann
reviews: fabulous! delicious food, gracious host and fine wine! this restaurant covers all the bases of a place to visit if you want to try french cuisine while in paris!; isabelle and manon are wonderful hosts. isabelle translated the menu from french to english for us. manon recommended wine. the food was 5/5 delicious 💕💕 a wonderful family fashionable yet family feel restaurant. who also helped with extra services.; very delicate restaurant with delicious cuisines, servers are friendly and responsible. worker got taxis for us on augest 16th in the rain; very great experience.; good meat, cooking, service, wine n desserts ..what else!? best place to enjoy good food with friends n kids!; very rude, first told us there was no availability except in the back by the toilet, then when we said no tried to offer a table in front before we could leave, people shouldn’t try that in 2018. keep in mind this is lunch on a thursday.

name: Chez Hanna
reviews:
enjoyed a casual lunch during the week.  falafel was delicious, would definitely come back! dining room is small and can be crowded, but the service was great.; chez hanna is located in the jewish quarter of paris. i found this place after packing the car nearby. it was the middle of the night and i was so hungry that i could eat anything 😊
the waitress convinced me that chez hanna was the place to eat, i asked for a lot of meat and the waitress understood the assignment. she gave me a really meaty kebab type dish which i devoured in minutes, i then bought fresh orange juice which was nice and refreshing.
the place was closing so i ate outside but i thoroughly enjoyed the experience. if you're in the jewish quarter and you're hungry. come to this place, you will not regret it 🤗; the food was mostly disappointing although the shawarma was decent. the lamb chops were under seasoned, undercooked and overly fatty. the service was not good, and we were really crammed into our spot. the waiter really pressured us to leave a tip which was unpleasant. cannot recommend.; the food was good but i feel like the waiter is racist toward asian. he wouldn't look at me the whole time i was there, didn't reply when i asked for the check and didn't ask if i wanted tea or desert after the meal, but he would be all friendly, attentive and even joking and laughing with other guests. i was wondering why until i realized i was the only asian there. guess whether your experience is good or not really depends on your skin color.; wow chez hanna took us by surprise, it is soooooooooo delicious. enormous portions so i would suggest sharing one meal but other than that it was close to perfection. colourful and healthy plate served by welcoming waiters. i highly recommend the falafel special! the district it is in is also so beautiful and worth exploring.

name: Sacré Frenchy !
reviews:
food was excellent, very tasty dishes. the chicken was amazing, and worth sharing. the happy hour on cocktails was a good deal as well, and delicious cocktails.

service was not great for our visit, cocktail forgotten, and a 45 minute wait for the main dish after starters. we noticed several other tables having quite some issues with service as well around us. it was not busy or full at the time. a great dining experience turned poor by long waits and off service.

that said, not so bad i wouldn’t try again, it could be an off day, but the food was great, and service was friendly despite the waits and inattentiveness.; this place was absolutely wonderful! our waitress, amelie, was incredibly kind and attentive, making our experience truly exceptional. the food was fantastic, and the cocktails were equally impressive.; i don’t normally leave a review, but i felt compelled. we had eight people and they accommodated us at the last minute. our servers name was emily and she was absolutely phenomenal from picking wine to suggesting entrées. the food came on time and it was fantastic. what a great dining atmosphere experience. if you’re in this area, don’t look any further.; very kid and tourist friendly. the staff were so sweet, and the food was wonderful. i highly recommend their seafood ceviche. dessert was to die for too. their crème brûlée was the table’s favorite.; my wife and i had our first dinner in this last visit to paris. my wife is not a “lamb food fan”, and had a steak, while i ordered the “7 hour lamb dish”.
the food was great, cooked to order, and very tasty. service was great too. with that said, i would like to emphasize the “7 hour lamb” dish that was probably the best lamb dish i had so far. it was adobe style, super duper tasty. it was so good my wife ate more of it than her steak. since we came for only 3 days to paris and did not want to go to the same place twice, we went to explore other places in the following g evening. we regret not coming back to have this lamb again. other dinners were fine too, but this was the most remembered from this trip. served with spinach warm side dish and (what i believe was) mashed cilantro root. it is a must have dish!

name: Moghol
reviews:
excellent lamb kebab with spicy chicken biryani as for my palette... the owner of the restaurant is highly hospitable and raja the server excellent on suggesting menu.  end with gulab jamun ( just remind them to make it hot)
advice i recommend this for indian  non-vegetarian food lovers.; wonderful restaurant for all the family. we received a warm welcome and mild dishes for the children as well as good wine and soft drinks. we very much enjoyed our meal and would very much recommend. fantastic service and great food.; the saag (spinach) chicken was great, i really enjoyed it. the kulfi was also very good and a little different from the other ones i tried (i tasted a hint of condensed milk, which gave it something special). the presentation of the food is not the nicest i've seen but taste wise i'm very happy with everything. also really recommend to try the tea of the house, it was perfect after the meal.
the staff were polite and friendly. the interior is quite casual.; the restaurant has a very good place. the food served not very warm but the taste was fine.; booked via fork, some hidden clauses need to be mentioned explicitly. (they ended up giving a discount irrespective, so good people :) )
otherwise food was decent, good indian experience. good portion sizes.

name: La Tour Montlhéry - Chez Denise
reviews:
this place is an authentic france old school cuisine. the dishes are remarkable great and delicious. if you are looking to a good franch restaurant this is the one. they are not very pretended to be fancy, just great food. the place is very nice and old decor. you really feel yo are in france when you diner in this place.; food was so good. i got the duck confit and she got a steak with fries on the side. my duck was crunchy on the outside but moist on the inside. the ceramic bowl they serve it in is so hot so don’t touch it like i did. the chicken is served on a bed of sliced potatoes that soak up the flavor from the duck fat. my goodness this dish made my top 3 in paris during our 1 week stay. the steak we got was served with onions on top. very buttery and tasty. the language barrier here was quite difficult so we pulled up pics on our phone to order. i got a beer and she got a wine both were good but the food was the winner here. i’ll be visiting again during my next trip to paris.; hello there. if you wanna a true old fashion french food experience i can only recommend this restaurant. go to chez denise and find yourself surrounded by an amazing ambiance and wonderful waiters. let’s talks about the food : all fresh, all homemade and the taste is just incredible. if you wanna go on a great experience i advice you to take and share the baby pork shoulder serve with fried garlic and parsley potatoes. i can continue like this for a long time but i will just finish by telling you to go and try yourself, you won’t be disappointed. a big thx to all the team. enjoy; great experience and good food. i’ll definitely come back when i’m in paris. would recommend if you want to have authentic french cuisine. waiters were friendly too.; supreme duck confit! tender, crispy and taste just right!
portion is huge and service is brilliant, everyone is smiling and willing to talk to you.
for those saying they are impolite, just to remind most of the time it is just because you are rude.

name: Restaurant 52
formatted_address: 52 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
every dish was beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. the “ tartare de bœuf coupé aux couteaux et moules marinières” as well as “ cochon, purée de courgette et praliné de courge”  and tataki d’onglet de bœuf sauce vin rouge” was particularly memorable, with the perfect balance of textures and tastes.
for deserts, “clafoutis de mirabelle, glace au miel et romarin”
excellent.!

what truly made this dining experience exceptional was when the chef elias took the time to personally visit our table, answer my questions about the ingredients, and share insights into his culinary process. this thoughtful gesture added such a personal touch and elevated the entire experience.
thank you restaurant 52!; i visited the restaurant when the kitchen was closed and had to order from the cold cut menu. hence, i can't provide feedback on their food quality. however, the service was exceptional. they really tried to cater to our needs.; great spot with interesting, fresh dishes with interesting flavors. really loved our fish entree with candied celery. lovely, friendly staff. great ambiance and wine selection as well - will come back!; certain foods were great, but others were just not good. the spare ribs was definitely worth the price; however, the crispy egg pasta and the mixed cheese platters were bland and too salty, respectively. although the menu has what is in each dish, the menu is a bit misleading on whether a dish is an appetizer, entree, or a special, since those words aren't written/typed on the menu. the food came out all together as we asked, so that is a plus, but th8⁸e waiters did not pay attention to our table at all, maybe because we are younger than most tables. they took way too long taking the check even after calling them. the place itself is great, but the staff and food can inprove.; they have a wonderful creative menu! i’ve had the best entrée i’ve had in years, what a surprise. the staff is what you would expect from a great place, i highly recommend. would come back 12/10

name: L’Écumoir
reviews:
i was really expecting more after reading the reviews. the food was acceptable, the service was acceptable, and the atmosphere, less than acceptable.

the interior of the restaurant felt cluttered, and not very clean. just outside the entrance of the kitchen, the owners dog was kept in the dining area, in some form of makeshift dog house. the dog would occasionally bark, and the dining room had a slight scent of dog smell, not what one would want in a restaurant, where you would expect a food smell.

nothing about the food i ate, impressed me to the point where i would remark about it in this review. unfortunately, i would have to say that we were disappointed. especially after reading the reviews. perhaps there may be other opportunities for an exceptional dining experience in this restaurant, but on the evening we visited, that was not to be.; a real french/paris experience. hotel made reservation when 1st choice booked. walked in and greeted by owner, host, waiter, chef. almost left as we we only people there and only one item on menus. very kind local young woman sitting outside translated for us and assured us we would not be disappointed. what as t followed was a wonderful home made(we watched her cook) meal of beet salad, broiled salmon, smashed potatoes and the best chocolate mousse zi’ve had in years. simple food prepared with skill and much better than many of the cookie cutter bistros,etc. on every block. whole bill with very good wine was less than e60! highly recommended.; came in here on a whim. service and ambiance were tremendous––felt like we were allowed to join an amazing french dinner party. tasty soup for an entree, delicious crispy fish with a sort of mashed potatoes where you could really taste the flavor of the potatoes (likely very well grown) and finished it off with a chocolate cake––i was genuinely taken aback at how good it was. also we asked for a white wine to go with the fish and it was scrumptious; stéphanie is an impeccable chef with a wonderful attention to detail! her plates are plentiful and delicious. we tried both her gateau d’aubergine and the poulet fermier. the chicken was fantastically tender. such a great restaurant. it’s like being at home, away from home. i would definitely recommend, ten times over :)
-mackenzie t. & sabine k.; marvelous food and great service. we are really happy. we will come back 👍🤩

name: JJ Beaumarchais
reviews:
we thoroughly enjoyed our 4-course dinner at jj beaumarchais. seated at the patio window, we got to people watch and have our own little quiet cozy corner of the restaurant. my husband is not keen on seafood, yet he loved the meal, especially the cod! everything was so delicious, cooked well with high quality fresh ingredients, and healthy. nothing was overly salty nor greasy, and we left with happy tummies (and wallet!). definitely book a table here if you want to take a break from traditional french dishes.; extraordinary. the meal at jj beaumarchais was not only delicious but surprisingly healthy too. the choice of ingredients were dominated by vegetables and fish, and seasoning was used in moderation, so the meal was low in fat, salt, and cholesterol, yet achieved a level of satisfaction usually associated with heavier dishes. service was friendly and efficient, and the environment was quite pleasant. very reasonable prices too! all around excellent.; now this is an experience. elevated small plates focusing on seafood and vegetables. i could feel my palate expanding during this dinner.

one of our top culinary experiences in paris, and that’s saying something. do yourself a favor and stop by jj for a special night.; we were looking for a special place to celebrate our time in paris. jj beaumarchais caught our attention based on the comments of visitors and its rating on google. we went to check it out and were intrigued by the fact that we would be served a menu chosen by the chef with 4 or 5 dishes specially prepared for each night. we added to the uncertainty and expectations of what would be served, observing the neighboring tables. the dishes that followed us on our unknown journey were compositions with fish, seafood and vegetables. an explosion of flavors with fresh ingredients, enhanced by the seasonings and sauces of the dishes. highlights include the octopus with tempura, the flounder fish with roasted lettuce and a delicious dessert with cherry ice cream with a lemon mousse and a cupcake. matching the spectacular dishes, the service staff is extremely attentive and thorough in their explanations, very friendly, offering excellent tips on pairing drinks with the dishes. surrender yourself  to the atmosphere and flavors of jjb and make your time at the tables in paris more special and unforgettable than ever.; this place is truly exceptional, i would give it more than 5/5 if possible. the quality and value of their food are unbeatable, with four courses costing $46, and five courses priced at $59. in addition, when we ordered a glass of wine, our waiter was generous with the pour.  we had missed our original lunch reservation due to a delayed flight, but we were delighted to have made it to dinner instead. the menu is a surprise blind menu, and changes daily based on the fresh ingredients available that day.  each dish is distinct and flavorsome, but with all elements well-balanced, such as the combination of asparagus, pistachio, and pumpkin seeds or beetroot, cherry, and tomato. my favorites were the langoustine bisque and grilled mackerel, but i can't wait to try their new menus in the future. overall, a fantastic dining experience!

name: Le Caveau de l'isle
formatted_address: 36 Rue Saint-Louis en l'Île, 75004 Paris, France
reviews: for typical french cuisine - think frogs legs, confit de canard, fois gras, snails etc, this is worth a visit. the food was tasty and staff friendly. it may feel and look a bit touristy, but we had a good time.; a lovely night of authentic french cuisine. beautiful atmosphere, attentive service and delicious food. the service is so good that we accidentally left something behind, and our server ran down the street with it to give it back to us. above and beyond!; fifth paris vacation and we finally made it to île saint-louis. after escaping the crowd of people,  we found ourselves in front of le caveau de l'isle admiring the menu and the beautiful gray cat sitting below the menu board. sans reservations, we enjoyed foie gras, boeuf bourguignon and steak tartare along with a bottle of tavel. highly recommend! cute, cozy and french.; the restaurant gives us a very homy atmosphere. we can see it us welcomed by the locals a lot. we had the traditional duck, which is super tender and well seasoned. the tarta was the best ever we had. you can still feel the texture of the meat, and most importantly it didn't mix with other seasonings. at the end we also got the lemon liquor, very good!; the food is amazing, as you'd expect in any good french restaurant. sadly like in most french restaurants, the service is cold and indifferent. the place is fairly small and lacks basic things like a coat hanger, which makes it feel even more crammed. a smile and a coat hanger aren't that hard to provide and would make this experience a lot nicer. the feline employee was very friendly so +1 star for that, though keep it in mind if you don't like cats.

name: Kaza Maza - Restaurant & Traiteur Libanais
formatted_address: 1 Rue de l'École Polytechnique, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
had lunch just three times there just this week! the flavour really taps into back home 🇱🇧! the service is very cute where a small cup of tea is provided to customers upon arrival.
the owner i believe is very patient and kind to explain in details all the different options.

highly recommended for a quick and affordable lunch/dinner; we found this small restaurant on our way to notre dame cathedral. we just walked along the streets and we were feeling a little peckish so we decided to find some restaurants with good reviews. we ended up here. the restaurant is quite small. it can cater for like 10 people. our restaurant host told us to wait before we ordered our food. he gave us some tea before we ordered our food. the food was ready in 5 minutes. we ate and then paid. the host was very accommodating. i do not speak french, but he knew english and ordering food and paying was not a problem. our meals were delicious and we were happily on our way to enjoy paris.; we had the falafel sandwich (as good as anything we have eaten in the marais) and the taboulé salad that was perfectly seasoned, light and refreshing. really excellent! highly recommend!; the food was delicious the guy was great atmosphere was olympic;); great little lebanese restaurant, food is superb! the little sausages (makanek) are to die for! the spinach pies are what i grew up eating.

name: Les Turbines
reviews:
me and my mom wanted to eat brunch at french cafe, with french food and a nice look. this place was spot on to meet those standards, with a real french athmosphere because of the viev right into the street. it is a really beautiful place, with delicious food to a good price. our server was very polite and the food came quickly. perfect place for a brunch, with fresh pressed juices, eggs and bacon, french toast and crossaints.; gaelle was absolutely amazing! the service the food the environment was everything

i got the caesar salad which was by far the best and the nutella crepe!

again gaelle are server was incredible very sweet highly recommend to request her when you visit; food was great. ali the head waiter was super helpful in deciding what to get. he even helped us find the perfect seat when we asked to change spots. the location atmosphere is great. lots of cool bars and restaurants in the area.; dona was a very kind young man. we had an apartment in the neighborhood and passed by often. he always had a smile and a wave. when we had drinks here (3 or 4 times in the week) he was quick and attentive.; very nice place the service is great, tatar was very good just the fries could get better. in happy hour cheap very good vine and a lot of tapas in good prices.

name: Le Mastroquet
reviews:
fantastic meal! if you like cheese, the oeufs cocotte is a must!! we really liked the gaspacho too. the service was fantastic and we enjoyed our time there.; good restaurant near the gare du nord. excellent service, good food, and good for a stop at the gare du nord. homely atmosphere and great for a lunch either solo or with a friend.

i ordered the set menu with the rigatoni and peach tart. comes with complimentary bread.

rigatoni was good, though it didn't seem as good as the two other mains which i could have ordered. i think this dish may need a bit more to it. food was still delicious. feedback would be to work on this particular dish a bit more to make it perfect.

peach tart dessert was excellent.

rigatoni paired well with a wine suggested by franc, who gives excellent service.

definitely reccomend to anyone around this area.; a 5 star experience - don't miss this local gem! we spent our last night in paris as a party of six. the owner, frank, was lovely and very gracious. he made great recommendations for food and wine. each menu item was wonderful - everyone enjoyed tasty options including the daily special. we will be sure to return. merci, frank!; this place saved us. we were desperate to finally try proper french cuisine and finally found it where we didn't expect.
amazing food, cozy atmosphere and home welcoming.

try burata with truffles, it's piece of art.

street and district is cozy and smell good;); i went with my wife, and neither of us can speak french. the server was extremely patient and kind towards us. he taught us some basic french words, ensured that we felt welcomed, and the food was top notch! highly recommend.

name: La _ dolce vita
reviews:
food: 5/5 excellent. everything was fresh, and delicious. the margherita pizza is the best version that i have eaten in france and in several parts of italy.

service: 5/5 excellent. quick, polite, and professional. orders and requests fulfilled immediately.

ambience: 4/5 very good. the general dining area has the typical latin quarter quaint charm. however, the stairs descending to the restrooms in the basement are not attractive because the banister is broken in multiple places.

cleanliness: 3/5 good. the men's restroom definitely needs an overall scrub to the door and floor.

value: 5/5 excellent. €15 fixed menu. from the many options, i ate a niçoise salad, margherita pizza, and dame blanche.

overall: 4.4/5 very good. i would eat here again.; the doorman/the waiter did his job very well; if it weren't for him, we wouldn't have come over.

the waiter and service, in general, were commendable.

we found the food and house wine delightful, and the prices were reasonable. however, we were disappointed to find that there were no salads or sauces served with the schnitzel and fries. additionally, the lava cake lacked lava as it was too chilly. despite these shortcomings, we still enjoyed our overall experience, particularly the combo meal.; very slow service, the waitress wating their time touching their hair, watching his phone, walking around but no paying attention to the people.
bad quality of food, tastes like frozen burn lasagna.; food was awful, no taste at all. talked about it with the waiter, he did’t understand and cared at all. people next to us when we entered the restaurant had same experience. one of us became very sick that night.

and to your reaction on my complaint: yes i'm sure we have eaten at your restaurant (see photo of ticket). it was at may 11. we made a complaint, one meal was deleted after the waiter went to the manager/owner.; spent a weekend in paris and after walking quite a bit in the quartier latin area, i decided to get some delicious food. i came across an italian restaurant called la dolce vita. i was greeted by bruno the waiter there who is an extreme an wonderful person with an amazing character who knows all there is to know about food and also what drink best goes with what you are eating so that you can enjoy and have the best experience! also has an awesome knowledge of history and other cultures. i had the red wine steak with fries and pasta chicken alfredo which were both to die for! service was super fast, friendly and all whioe entertaining you as an guest. highly recommended. thanks bruno!

name: Le Bonne Nouvelle
formatted_address: 24 Bd de Bonne Nouvelle, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: great restaurant- highly recommend. issa our server was very attentive and couldn’t do more to help. food was delicious and some very good deals on drinks in happy hour. would recommend a visit; cozy interior and exterior, food was nice and reasonably priced for the area/city. had pasta carbonara & pizza margherita (see photos attached). waiter was super attentive, food was fine - definitely come for the drinks, there’s a generous cocktail selection.; we came across this restaurant when looking to have lunch on our first day in paris. the service was friendly, inviting and informative. we were offered a corner table with plenty of room to sit and watch the world go by. we opted for the salads and two glasses of white wine. salads were beautifully served and tasted great. would definitely recommend a visit.; stumbled upon this restaurant by chance and was pleasantly surprised! the food was really good, making it a great find.; the waiter refused use to give us tap water at first because not everyone took something to drink and food. he said that the manager says only people that ordered food can get free tap water. there was no manager so our waiter says he is the manager since the actual manager was not here. then came back being very disrespectful and accused the customer that we are understood him wrong. very entitled and say is to calm down when we were just asking a question. then he said everyone gets water. they also charged us 11€ for one small mozzarella ball.

name: Tata Burger
vicinity: 54 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, Paris
formatted_address: 54 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
this was a fun place! if you are easily offended, this is not for you. i got le dsk, which came in the shape of a, well, you can tell by the picture. it is a lot of meat 🤣

i didn't realize the theme until i looked at the menu. that is when i got the gist of the place. great staff with a fun attitude.; the burgers are delicious, they have good variety and can accommodate all tastes. beyond burgers they have other options so it’s a great place for people looking for more than just burgers. the staff was friendly and that made the experience even better.; good place to have a burger, fun and easy. though nothing extraordinary and exciting, it was just plain and simple food more like on the fast food side (i think they only have burgers), nothing special or worth bragging about. dressing was on the cheap side with little amounts of fried onions and cheese in the burger. it didn't really knock my socks off:); me and my friend were very hungry, so we decided to go for burgers, as the reviews were very good. unfortunately, we have not eaten such tasteless burgers in a while. french fries were totally greasy and cold.; i loved this place. cute and quirky decor, it was "country" themed when we visited so the staff were dressed as cowboys. the food was incredible, probably the best burger i've ever had and the staff were lovely. we were greeted immediately and attended to quickly. it started getting busy towards the end of our meal but we weren't rushed out or anything.

so, the decor is definitely not conservative (good!) but also nothing nsfw is really on display (unless you don't like handsome men or cheeseburger angels or get upset by underwear). you're not there for the art, you're there for the good company and amazing food.

if they got an espresso martini on the menu then they would score 11 from me, so they'll have to settle with a 10 until then 😉

name: Chez Zaza
reviews:
attention ⚠️ ⚠️ 17€ for 2 coffee and 2 inedible croissant!
we were seating on the restaurant nearby, but i think it is the same owner because the waiter brought the coffee from there and the receipt was under “chez zaza”
anyway, because both of them are traps; i don't recommend this bar bad as ...
this was my worst experience as a tourist. my friends and i were rudely told to leave this bar-restaurant after sitting down without being greeted. when we tried to complain, both the staff member and the manager insulted us. i do not recommend this bar as it is expensive and mistreats customers. they also manage the bar across the street called 'aux trois maillets'
here's some pictures; great service and good eats. had the duck confit and shrimp alfredo. highly recommend both. c; amazing service and food great price surprised at reviews; i had booked and gotten the confirmation about my booking of a table for during a euro championship game. i extra reserved it here to be able to watch the game and eat... however when i arrived (10 minutes before the booking time) the restaurant was already full. i spoke to two waiters, who both answered me arrogantly that right now the booking doesn't count because they're full, so they basically ignored the reservation, sent me away arrogantly and as a result i couldn't watch the game neither eat, since all other restaurants were understandably full too.

name: Bella Piazza
vicinity: 8 Rue de la Petite Truanderie, Paris
formatted_address: 8 Rue de la Petite Truanderie, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
we went during a soccer game. the pizza shop was facing a lively crowd enthusiastically cheering their teams on. it was quite an experience. we ordered a pizza and were served relatively quickly. it came out hot and tasty made to perfection. we requested three chili oil as a side. it paired so well with the pizza and crust. the buffalo mozzarella was fresh and melted in our mouths like fresh cream. the staff was friendly and understood our english.; great service and pizza!

reasonable priced pizza and very nice staff. went for a late lunch and the pizza kept us full. the ingredients tasted fresh and the oil to put on top of your pizza was excellent.

it’s in a very central location making it easy to stop in for a bit to eat or a glass of wine.; the pizza was very good. the dough was nice, could have been a little more moist, but that's nitpicking on a very high level.; was waiting in line for the pharamond bouillon when i decided i was too hungry to wait.i picked that restaurant across the terrasse on chance and was it a great choice!true pizza with real buffalo mozza.and only 5$ a bottle of beer(moretti),in the halles dictrict,awesome deal.good and friendly service.; excellent napolitan pizza, great service, nice ambiente, a bit expensive but worth it.

name: Raffiné
reviews:
great service and one of the tastiest steaks that i have ever tasted. also their signature dessert “le r de raffine” is exceptional with a unique taste!; i started with the sando, followed by sliced wagyu and black angus t-bone steak, served with french fries and creamy spinach. the steak was incredibly flavorful and definitely worth the price—the wagyu melted in my mouth, and the t-bone was simply delicious. both steaks were cooked to perfection! the sando is also a must-try, with its unique and delicious taste. after reading the one-star reviews, i was hesitant to dine at raffine, but since the restaurant offers halal meat, i decided to give it a chance, and i'm glad i did!

a must try halal steakhouse in paris!!; one of the best steaks i’ve ever had, was really juicy and tender. the mash was 10/10. food portions were really big and reasonably priced. staff were accommodating and very helpful. would definitely recommend and will be visiting again very soon; every weekend we pass-by tuileries garden to walk our dog yet we did not notice this restaurant. until yesterday, we found it. it’s like a jem. all i can say is awesome! we appreciated the quality of the meat, the tender and juicy is a real treat for our taste buds! they have a great wine selection, we had chablis to start and saint joseph (red) to get along our meats. the deserts are for the win too. it was a very satisfying experienced. from the guy in front of the door, to the restaurant staff and the chefs are all super nice. they know what service means. please close your eyes on the price side, but i assure you it’s worth it. will be back next time.☺️☺️; very nice restaurant with great food but overpriced i would say!

name: Nectar
vicinity: Hôtel Maison Mère, 7 Rue Mayran, Paris
formatted_address: Hôtel Maison Mère, 7 Rue Mayran, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
can't say enough about this place. if you are brave enough to try anything and everything, then this is the place to have an experience with food. i loved everything the chef offered us with the prefixed menu and the in between surprises to taste. there was also live music. everything was fresh and delicious i want to come back for more.; we chose nectar to spend the valentine’s day evening. the whole dinner was beyond our expectations. the special menu was one of a kind, and the alcohol menu was perfect.
thanks for the experience. when we’ll visit paris again, for sure we will come once more.; really loved this place, located inside a hotel. the service was great, and food delicious! definitely recommend- great value for the price given the quantity / quality of food and service.; we ordered the spring pollen prix fixe menu and thoroughly enjoyed the food, experience, service, and ambiance. during the meal, we were given countless of snacks from the house, and each were truly delicious. the prefix items were terrific, and the ingredients and composition of the dishes were also really innovative. the snacked red mullet was spectacular, and the service was also michelin level. we were even given a personalized letter from the restaurant and a snack bag to take home at the end of our meal. on top of that, there was a live jazz performance every thursday, which added even more to the dining experience. overall, a great restaurant for special occasions, celebrations, or for just an elevated dining experience.; we made a reservation at 8pm and arrived 15 mins late. the waitress kept reminding us that we would have to leave at 9:30 pm, as we were part of the first shifts. this pressured us in ordering quickly and we did not enjoy being rushed.

regarding the diner, we shared multiple starters and dishes. portions are small.

the presentations of the plates look super nice but the food is okay. what i liked most is the restaurant’s ambience: nice decoration, calm music and good cocktails (we went for gin tonics).

name: Restaurant Le Cellier
formatted_address: 25 Rue de la Victoire, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
we visited restaurant le cellier in paris and, despite the restaurant being completely empty when we arrived, we were asked if we had reservations, which we did. as the only table present, we were surprised by the long wait times and lack of service. unfortunately, the dishes we received were disappointing.

when another group arrived and began filming, they received much more attention from the staff, which added to our dissatisfaction. overall, the experience was mediocre and not memorable. we left the restaurant still hungry, which was far from ideal.; a nice bistro with great hospitality. don’t expect a long menu here, it rather adopts seasonal ingredients, with a fusion twist on some of the dishes. we were there for dinner and shared an appetizing salmon taco as the starter, with smoked chicken leg and seared octopus as the mains. everything was well presented and savory. and for dessert we had the miso chocolate mousse - warm, airy and light in texture, a perfect ending for a fantastic meal.; tried their lunch menu which was above our expectations.

same quality of food and service you get at chef’s one michelin star restaurant.

for such quality of food and portion size, set menu is very well priced.; the restaurant was empty. food is really average if not disappointing, clearly no fuss about it. spend your money somewhere else, there are so many options (bill of 200€, 4 people); stumbled across this tiny restaurant on my way back to my hotel and read some great reviews so i gave it a try. this was one of the best meals i've had during my stay in paris.  i had the filet de lieu noir cuit doucement au four, fine mousseline de patates douces. it was incredible! for dessert,  the la boite à "chocolat-miso" coulant au chocolat was also excellent. my waitress was friendly and attentive. i'd definitely come back again.

name: Restaurant Du Sénat
vicinity: ter, 15 bis Rue de Vaugirard, Paris
formatted_address: ter, 15 bis Rue de Vaugirard, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing experience. one of a kind in paris!
food was amazing !; this place is where the senators can eat when they want. they provide three course meals for around 25 euros for the visitors. the menu was classic french but the taste wasn't as authentic as its interior. although the food is little disappointing, the friendly waiters and its unique atmosphere makes the dining experience enjoyable. the restaurant is only open on certain days per week for the public so check before you go!; love it try it; excellent; by invitation only

name: Le Laborde
reviews:
the steak was delicious! perfectly cooked and tasted incredible. would recommend to anyone looking for a great steak dinner.; wonderful restaurant, amazing hosts and superb food!
they are very accomodating and the dishes were very delicious.
would definitely come here in every visit to paris.; best meal we have had this year! my husband and i are visiting paris from america and can’t believe how delicious this meal was. everything appetizers, steaks, wine truly 5 star. makes us sad to go back to the food in america. highly recommend!; a great restaurant which serves very tasty food , super friendly staff and a wonderful atmosphere.
in 5 days we were there twice. this means something.
reservation is needed because it’s a relatively small restaurant. you won’t regret it.
great prices also , a very good value for the money.
highly recommended.; such a cozy little restaurant. food was amazing. had foie grass and burata for starters and day special - duck breast (medium), and file mignon for my wife. everything was just unbelievably tasty! service is outstanding, and interior decor is very welcoming. all in all had great experience. almost forgot : rhum baba and creme brule very very very tasty as well!

name: El Chingon
formatted_address: 66 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
coming from the west coast of usa i was so craving my fix of mexican food when visiting paris. i wasn’t confident that i could find anything authentic but i was thrilled to have had this place recommended to me.

loved the decor & vibes and it was clear that this place had a genuine appreciation for the mexican culture and cuisine. definitely would recommend stopping in for a quick bite when you get homesick!; we waited a bit, but the food was totally worth it…

friendly stuff and amazing food.

i highly recommend everything el chingon offers with shrimps. i tried the salad, the tacos au blé and tacos au mais all with shrimps and they all tasted amazing. their drinks fait maison are also so refreshing. and the desert was so delicious too (refer to the picture)

thank you for the great experience 🙏; this was the 16€ lunch special. great value and really tasty. my favourite was the refried bean tortilla which had just the right hot spicy kick to it.; delicious finding! if you’re looking for a good mexican food in paris, this place is a good choice! tasty and the barbacoa tacos were amazing!; for a truly authentic mexican food experience in paris, come here. everything was delicious food wise. the salsa wasn't spicy but had just the right amount of flavor. i had barbacoa and al pastor tacos and i enjoyed both but ordered an extra round of barbacoa. my girl had nachos and was pleasantly surprised it was served with gouda. she enjoyed each bite. thank you for great service as well as delicious food.

name: Flam's Lombards- Bar Et Restaurant De Flammekueche
reviews:
we ordered the fresh mushroom and primeur both of which were reasonably priced and tasty. crust was crispy, ingredients and white sauce ingredients just perfect. these were both good tarte flambes worth ordering again. would gladly pop in for a quick and light bite at the flam's on lombards.; we were looking for something french to eat and luckily we found this place!
we went there almost every day while visiting paris 😊
amazing food and fantastic staff 😍

you can order the pie without meat but unfortunately they don't allow to exchange it for something else :/; the pizza is good and the service is satisfactory…i think some of the servers did not completely understand our group but that is understandable (english speakers)

this is a great place for a large group and the happy hour is really nice…we all liked our drinks!

it was also nice of them to join us in singing happy birthday for someone in our group.; the place looked okay and only doing flam's so it sounded like a good place to have it there.

the food was ok, there was no flavor or something special at all, good place to have a bite in downtown for a reasonable price, but not to go if you are looking for good flams.

service was really good, they also offer tap water for free in a big bottle which is good if you are going the whole day in paris.; we ordered 2 flams, one original with mushrooms and one with chicken and they were very tasty. the server was the nicest guy ever with a big smile on who elevated our positive experience. he was also very helpful when we asked about halal options. would totally recommend!

name: Le P'tit Piano
reviews:
great food and service! the staff were nice and friendly. we got their sirloin steak with shallot cream and one with morel (mushroom) sauce, and duck breast. we also got the creme brulee, lemon tart and chocolate fondant with ice cream for dessert.; we loved everything here!
the service was great and we were greeted by a smile as soon as we arrived.

food came out super quickly and was delicious. great portion as well, so great value for money. cocktails were tasty and refreshing for these hot summer afternoons.

ambience was one of the things i liked the most. soothing and relaxing, allowing for you to properly enjoy your food and take a breath, despite being located in a busy street.

100% recommend.; we decided to try this place out after seeing all the fantastic reviews, but upon arrival, we almost thought we were at the wrong place—it looked almost like a pmu from the outside! however, stepping inside changed our minds instantly. the interior is surprisingly cute, and it was bustling with energy during our saturday brunch visit.

there's even a piano set up for their piano nights, adding a charming touch. the staff was incredibly friendly, which made our experience even better.
the food? absolutely delightful. i had the foie gras and salade périgourdine as starters, which were hearty enough to be mains, followed by the succulent souris d’agneau. the portions were generous across the board, definitely making it worth the money.

i would heartily recommend this spot and affirm that it truly deserves its high ratings, especially for the quality of the cuisine.; amazing little gem. very good food. very nice staff and they helped me with my gastric bypass needs. food was delicious steak was a little undercooked because i asked for medium rare but i got rare. no big problem was tasty nonetheless!; alfredo is great! the dishes he recommended were surprisingly good. we ordered the lamb, goat cheese salad, charcuterie board, and french onion soup. to top off a great dinner he treated us to mint shots that we loved. give this place a try!

name: Joe Allen
reviews:
i was craving authentic bbq so i came to joe allen. yes. five stars. ribs- amazing. cole slaw- best i’ve ever had. sweet potato fries- heavenly. vanilla ice cream + warm cookies, say no more.

this place is bomb.

service was fast, attentive and they even generously gave us muffins from this mornings brunch in a doggy bag, for free.; if i'm in the mood for the good life 💅🏻i dream of joe allen. a pleasant memory in the middle of my visit that i haven't stopped thinking about . the regulars here are great, almost perfect. i would like to come again. 💜; the place didn’t seem really interesting at the first glance but after trying it, i really changed my mind:

🍔food (4,5/5): i tried the joe allen signature burger which was really really great. maybe one of the best i ve tried. on the other side it was a bit pricey, yet i will definitely eat it again.

🛎️ service (4,5/5): the head waiter was, at least in my occasion very very kind and attentive. i don’t speak french but he gladly answered my questions in english, joked a bit, made sure that everything is ok and made me feel welcome to bother him in case i have any problem with the food. however the other waiter and waitress that served our table was not so pleasant. i could describe them as a bit moody.

🌃atmosphere (4/5): the internal space is decorated quite nicely, giving nice cozy vibes. however the external one has nothing special.

👍overall (4,5/5): a pleasant experience. if being just a bit more pricey than the usual is ok for you, you should definitely try it.; great food! great service! great atmosphere! music in the background was a mix of nirvana, queen, ac/dc, johnny cash, and other bands relative to the genre. server was great and ensured our order was out in a very timely manner. one issue i didn't inquire about was the extra €25 charge on my receipt. threw away the receipt after i left and didn't really inquire about it. my loss if anything but double check your tickets. other issue is the outside/outdoor seating (enclosed) and the amount of smoke. of course, it's paris, and people smoke and u have nothing against it (smoked for 20+ years). if you don't mind it, sit outside and enjoy your meal. highly recommend the pulled pork! would definitely return!; my son and i, being in la marais neighborhood, decided to stop for a drink and a little something to eat at joe allen.  our wait person was responsive to our requests, our food freshly prepared, and beverages were cold and refreshing.  clean bathroom,  i ask for nothing more.

name: Café Grevin
reviews:
very elegant! a little old but elegant, i had a very tasty hot wine! very good location next to the museum.; if your asian never ever eat this place seriously.
they will treat you as second class citizen. and serve everybody before you!!!! they wont even return the change that you give!! i was so angry. ill place a picture to prove i was in the cafe; great service, and good ambiance.... food seems to be honorable, but avoid the italian salade... mine was so "small" compare to the other, and barely eatable... for 14€, that was a clear ripoff of my menu.; nice and cozy place, but closes too soon. all the stars for the great location.; ok eas nice

name: La Maison
reviews:
nice atmosphere, good spot for drinks and delicious food. i had a rum steak and it was perfectly medium, as requested and i loved it. prices are very fair and there are some nice special-offers.; can’t recommend this highly enough! arrived to gare du nord at 5, had a train from austerlitz station at 7 so we had around an hour to eat before we left paris. arrived just before 6pm on a tuesday, place was almost empty except a few tables. suuuuper friendly guy running the place, we managed to fit in 3 delicious courses on their fixed price (sooo reasonable for the food quality) menu. starter was hard boiled egg with mayo, delicious! main was bavette steak, cooked medium - perfect, and the chips were sooo fluffy yet crispy and flavoursome. dessert was either crème brûlée or peach tart so we got both and shared. highly recommend this restaurant! oh and the red wine was delicious too - similar prices for all of them so we took his recommendation of the top one and it went down a treat. the menu is huge too if you don’t fancy the plat du jour!; really nice beer, excellent rare steak and pleasant place to watch the football. not had the bill yet so let's see.; awesome spot we discovered while waiting for our train.  all good was great. special mention to the sea bass! grilled perfectly.
great portions and value.; i have never had onion soup before but this one had a lot of flavor and spices. it was slightly sweet and a bit spicy from the black pepper. i thought it was delish. i tried 3 different wines and they did not disappoint. my friend got the roasted potatoes and they were delicious. they add garlic to the potatoes and it made it so very different than any old plain roasted potatoes. the owners are really amazing people with a great attitude and personality. they went above and beyond for my friends and i and genuinely wanted us there. please make sure you stop into this place and give it a try!

name: Chez Haki
reviews:
amazing place with amazing food with good prices. def recommend! we ordered vegan soup and chicken noodles and both were amazing! big portions and good taste.
there were also vegan noodles!

also food came out super fast! with those prices and taste i wish i could visit this place every day.; i came to paris to try french food. however, i didn’t realize i stay in a airbnb that are surrounded by chinese food. as somebody who was 100% made in china, i cannot believe how delicious the beef noodle soup is. a brought me back to the college days back in shanghai. we did not have this delicious beef noodles. soup backing seattle united states. love.; large portions and quick service. we got the spicy beef and vegan soups...both great! we also had edamame to start and vanilla mochi for dessert. recommend if you're looking for a quick and easy dinner option.; amazing food, everything is fresh. the noodles and the dough for the dumplings/gioza are made on the spot, couldn’t recommend more (:; fresh handmade noodles and dumplings in large portions, and most importantly, delicious. what more could you ask for

name: L'Amazonial
reviews:
the food was great!

we ordered the piece de boucher grillee (butcher's grill) - which happened to be beef today, french onion soup, poached egg with mushrooms and bacon(?) and a salad.

the beef was cooked to a perfect medium rare as requested, the fries and salad provided were good.

my personal favorite are the poached egg and mushrooms. the soft mushrooms with caramelized onions were sublime.

the only thing i didn't enjoy with this place was the cigarette smoke coming in from the outside (regardless of which table), but this is largely outside the restaurant's control.

one minor feedback i have is that the salt shaker has too big holes and too much comes out at once. that shaker is probably for pepper.

nevertheless, this place gets a strong recommendation!; i had lunch today at the restaurant and found both the food and service to be very good. i just thought the portion could be a bit more generous given the price they charge. nevertheless, the food tasted really good.; . i have asked the gent, not sure if he was a waiter, if i could use the toilet, he did not understand english well, i understood, so i asked him where is your toilet... then the story, incident started. he ordered me to greet him nicely first, trying to give the non french a lesson in franch language, me saying bonne soirée before asking for using the toilet, first. once i did it and asking him for the toilet again, he started talking french only saying no toilet here, i understood. although i have experienced paris and olympics as a great event, unfortunately we ca  also find a very unfriendly examples and a shame behaviour. thanks good, this only of very view negative examples, i hope, as paris and the french are so wonderful hosts od the olympics. the response, apparently it was the owner, shows how disrespectful he is, expecting the foreigners speak his language. unfortunately, i don't speak french but it shouldn't be a reason for discrimination. such a behaviour no one should tolerate. we don't and will make sure all our friends will notice accordingly. no apologies on our end, and based on the response of the owner, we don't expect any on from him. we also do not plan to ever visit again. it is beneath of our level. just asimple message. not recommend at all.; food was a good serving size and pretty good flavours, would’ve liked a form of sauce for steak however.
everything is fairly priced and a good variety of options.
service was friendly but slightly slow as we were in a quieter section and felt somewhat forgettable. in saying that no wait was ever major and the staff member running service was super friendly and helpful.

would recommend to anyone in the area to try.; we had a very enjoyable weekday lunch here. tasty food in a classic bistro style, and considerate service. in a heavily touristy neighborhood where it’s easy to be overcharged and underwhelmed, this was a welcome find.

name: Les Fauves Restaurant
reviews:
i had a fantastic experience at this restaurant, where the dishes creatively combine flavours from french, italian, japanese, lebanese, and south asian cuisines.

each dish felt thoughtfully balanced, with original combinations that really worked. the duck tagliata brought together french and italian elements perfectly, while the beef tataki, with its pomegranate reduction, satay, grilled cashews, and ginger, was a surprising and tasty mix. the seabass filet served with a modern take on caponata was also a standout, and the razor clams were perfect.

service was friendly and attentive throughout, and the quality-price ratio was excellent. highly recommend!; absolutely great food. the steak was surprisingly good. we  loved the interior design, too. highly recommended.; excellent little restaurant with very good service. the sea bass ceviche starter and mushroom linguini entree were both great. nice atmosphere, nicer decor but not sure if i would quite call it "formal".; the food is really nice and the price i think is reasonable from the entry to desert and with drink, first time in paris, i am lucky to find your restaurant, specially on sunday, there is a lot other restaurants are closed. surly will come back in the future.; tried steak, pork and chicken. all were cooked well, tasty, and prices were reasonable. did not have a reservation but party of 4 was seated right away for late lunch. service was quick and pleasant.

name: Un Air de Famille
formatted_address: 26 R. du Château Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: really cozy , beautiful and welcoming people at the restaurant, i ate my first desert in paris and it was goood; kids friendly great food healthy; very pleasant place and very nice staff especially for the child care part.; taste good, all aspects are pretty good; amazing place and excellent food!

name: Sylon de Montmartre
reviews:
nice breakfast/brunch place to eat. seems like most places in the area serve lunch starting at 1200 pm so if you are in an in-between time before lunch and need a bite to eat, this is a great place. service was great, it does get a little crowded. the manager/owner spoke english, was endlessly hustling around taking orders, cleaning up, etc. respect the hustle.; amazing food, perfect service and atmosphere!!! loved the bacon and cheese croissant and the bacon pancakes. the servers were extremely friendly, so can’t recommend more :); absolutely amazing food and service. everyone was super friendly. we had the chocolate pancake, egg croissant and yogurt bowl. i would dine here again.; what a beautiful gem, we stopped here for breakfast on the last morning of our trip to paris and highly recommend!

the waitress was polite, friendly and helpful, the food was fantastic. best breakfast we had in paris!

highly recommended!; really good side street cafe serving third wave coffee. nice staff and good coffee. flat white was a solid 8.0, nice flavour and smooth milk work.

name: Café quai 33
reviews:
we came to eat here after seeing some of the olympic games, just for a casual lunch. we got a nice table out front and the service and food were wonderful! not even that expensive for being in the center of paris, but certainly not cheap. perhaps my fish & chips and a beer wasn't the most traditional of orders but everyone in our party (the others ordered burgers or salads) enjoyed our food.; the food is good. it is closed to my hotel in paris, gare de lyon, i just jumped in since it has a good corner exposure but turn out it was a great experience.

i agree with all comment here saying that the service attitude is much better than french culture, the servers were welcome and very nice.; cute spot close to gare du lyon and gare d’austerlitz. we had the escargot, a large salad and fish of the day and were not disappointed. the server, who spoke french and english, was great. my only complaint was that the escargot did not come with any bread so i couldn’t soak up the sauce.; cute little bistro close to gare de lyon. the virigin mojitis were good. the food was underwhelming. we got the french onion soup and we have had many better ones. the garlic bread with goat cheese au gratin lacked texture. the rigatoni with pesto and burrata was decent. the confi'd tomatoes that came with it were good.; quick mid day snack...and to hydrate.  ordered the soupe à l'oignon and burrata et pesto.

name: Tribu Coffee Récréatif
formatted_address: 183 Rue du Faubourg Poissonnière, 75009 Paris, France
reviews: a fun, friendly environment! they have coffee, tea, snacks for kids as well as a great play area with lots of toys and books. they allow laptops as well so i got to get some work done while my family played in the play area. and ines was really kind as well!; great little place to come pass an hour or two, with or without kids! the cafe is clean and has a great energy; friendly, welcoming, come-as-you-are vibe. there are so many events for kids and families in their two rooms in the back and downstairs, plus the space in general is made for little ones running around. can't wait to come back!; such a great spot for families! we’re lucky we live steps away as we just had a baby. the owners are so lovely, the coffee & sweets are delicious, and their activities, like yoga, are so great to have in the neighbourhood.; came here as i was looking for a place to let my 11 month old baby have a safe space to roam while this mum gets to drink a warm cup of coffee. super good atmosphere, quite a good selection of toys to play with, toilet is clean as well. felt really safe to let my child play here, owners are super friendly as well! definitely will be back again; great little place, we had some time to kill before our eurostar train and this was conveniently located. the menu isn't very large (sweets only) but what we tried was very good (matcha white chocolate cookie and chocolate hazelnut cookie). prices a little steep - 5 euros for very small latte, 4 euros cookie each but i guess you are also paying for the playarea. it felt a little cold inside too.

name: La petite Bleue Brunch & Coffee - Opéra
reviews:
absolutely fantastic experience at le petite bleu! my family of four enjoyed the most amazing eggs benedict and salmon and avocado toast. the food was exceptional and definitely lived up to the wait and the hype. the service was lovely, with kind and helpful staff who, despite being busy, took the time to speak with us. it was a truly great breakfast, and we can't wait to come back! five stars all the way!; i adore this place. the ambiance is perfect, so stylish decorated and even the plates and glasses are perfect. if you come in and you’re enthusiastic about the decor, wait till you have the food… i had the best french toast ever here! the crème was so soft and light, the fruit fresh, it was sweet but not too sweet. my friends had other dishes and were as happy as i was.
this is a place i’d definitely would go back to!; 4.5/5 stars! the food presentation is beautiful and the food tastes good as well! the only reason why i took off a star was because the all the food came out not hot. the truffle scrambled eggs were delicious!! out of everything on their menu, i definitely recommend that. also the tiramisu pancake which i was super excited about was served as if it was made in a rush. but otherwise, this is a cute brunch spot with your girlfriends. but it does get very busy during peak brunch hours, had to wait outside in the rain but they were nice enough to give us umbrellas.; i recently had the pleasure of dining at la petite bleue, and i have to say, their eggs benedict was absolutely outstanding. the perfectly poached eggs, creamy hollandaise sauce, and tender, flavorful ham created a delightful combination that truly hit the spot. the service was just as impressive—friendly, attentive, and warm, making me feel right at home. the cozy, welcoming vibe of the restaurant added to the overall experience, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed breakfast or brunch. and the best part? the prices are incredibly reasonable for the quality of the food and service. i’ll definitely be coming back!; amazing breakfast experience!
from the moment we walked in, the warm, inviting atmosphere set the perfect tone for our 3rd day in paris! the staff were friendly, attentive.
the tiramisu pancake was the fluffiest i’ve ever seen, served with a drizzle that was simply divine!

name: Café Petite
reviews:
really good coffee
the food was good or was i just very hungry ? i loved the mix of ingredients i would never think of by myself
i felt really good inside, it was a rainy day after work, i could find a moment of calmness here
