waiters are one of best service i saw from many restaurants; server in white turtleneck (name might be feudin?) is a complete jerk. hope he owns the place. otherwise should be fired. pretty good atmosphere. beer wasn’t too cold. crème brûlée was okay.; more bar than resto but food was good, all five of us agreed. the jerk chicken was a pleasant surprise. burgers and croque got the job done. bad acoustics inside with loud music and loud talking by drinkers made it hard to communicate. this is a bar primarily, hence the food and service are decent but the menu is limited.; we tried the thai tartar and the croque madame and they were both delicious. the waitress who served us was also really nice and friendly. the price is okay considering it's paris. overall, a great experience-i would definitely come back!; very tasty burger and great service from the team!

name: Happy Caffé
reviews:
the crepes are very delicious, both savory and sweet, a good way to start our morning in paris. furthermore, the owner’s hospitality was warm and kind, made us feel welcome. would love to visit again! 😊; delicious food, good value. very attentive staff. my crepe even came with a nz flag after they asked where we were from. we sat outside so it was great for people watching and resting our feet. definitely recommend.; we stopped here on a whim while walking to the louvre and so glad we did. the crepes were great but the service was even better. they were very kind and so funny, we felt like we had breakfast and a show. be sure to ask for a bottle of champagne opened by mr tom cruise himself.; happy cafe in more ones than one. great service- warmth, care and engagement. not at all pretentious.
yummy crepes- savoury and sweet plus the cheese cake.
super location too without the tourist prices.
highly recommend.; delicious food for an affordable price in this area. the service was wonderful, as the staff friendly and fun. we don’t speak french but they spoke spanish! our daughter’s crepes came with a colombian flag and a nice message, such cute touches to complement our lunch. our server also gave our daughter a desert as a gift and she loved it. we all kraft with our tummies happy and a big smile :)

name: Little Café
vicinity: 62 Rue du Roi de Sicile, Paris
formatted_address: 62 Rue du Roi de Sicile, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
brilliant cafe/restaurant all life passes by.  lively and fun place.  waiting staff friendly food good and not expensive.  i have eaten lemon cheese cake in many countries cities town villages and this place makes the best.
recommended.; we stayed next door to the cafe during our visit to paris. service was on point and we loved the atmosphere. this was our go to restaurant for after dinner drinks, as well! throughly enjoyed the pressed chicken dish.; stepping into this hidden gem was like stumbling upon a parisian secret. the atmosphere was a delightful fusion of classic charm and modern allure. from the moment i entered, i was greeted with genuine smiles and impeccable service. the staff's passion for their craft shone through in every detail, making the experience truly remarkable.

the menu was a tantalizing journey, offering a diverse selection that catered to various tastes. each dish was a masterpiece, perfectly combining flavors and textures. the attention to presentation was exquisite, making each plate a work of art. the flavors danced on my palate, leaving a lasting impression.

what truly set this place apart was the unique twist they added to traditional french cuisine. it was evident that the chefs were pushing boundaries and exploring new dimensions of taste. the culinary creativity was inspiring and left me eager to return for more.

the ambiance was equally enchanting, with an inviting and cozy setting that encouraged relaxation and enjoyment. as i savored my meal, i couldn't help but notice the subtle details that contributed to the overall charm of the place.

in a city brimming with dining options, this establishment manages to stand out by offering an experience that goes beyond just a meal. it's a true celebration of food, art, and culture. whether you're a local or a traveler, this place promises an unforgettable journey through flavors and emotions.; i had such a wonderful experience at this charming venue! from the moment i walked in, i was greeted warmly and received attentive and friendly service throughout. the staff's kindness and professionalism truly made me feel welcome. the cocktails they served were masterfully created and full of flavor. the dishes were promptly brought to the table and exceeded my expectations. the balance of quality and price was outstanding, offering exceptional value for the exceptional experience i had. i highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a perfect spot in paris. its central location in marais adds to its allure. whether it's for a meal, drinks, or simply soaking in the ambiance, this establishment delivers on all fronts. the tastefully designed interior and the attentive staff combine to create an inviting environment that feels like a true home away from home. don't miss the chance to try the leffe and hoegarten pints, skillfully served by the friendly bartender and waitress. it's a spot i'll definitely return to, offering a blend of elegance and relaxation that's hard to find elsewhere. overall, it's a delightful venue that strikes a perfect balance between sophistication and comfort, ensuring a memorable experience that's also budget-friendly.; amazing waitress. the food was also very nice, the menu is different that the one here, no vegan options, but otherwise very good

name: Almydan - Restaurant libanais Paris 10
formatted_address: 160 Rue du Faubourg Poissonnière, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
usually, to find authentic local food, you need to explore rare areas and small streets to discover hidden gems. we found ours here—this is the best lebanese food i’ve tasted in france so far.

it felt like being at home with delicious, authentic dishes. we ordered two sandwiches: shawarma chicken and halloumi, along with a platter that included hummus, tabbouleh, mtabal batenjen, sambusek, and two special dishes (sawda with extra lemon and batata harra). of course, we couldn’t miss the 'rakkakat jebne.'

the service was incredibly warm. for anyone wanting to try authentic lebanese cuisine, i highly recommend this place!; had the best falafel sandwich. they were so kind to serve us and dine in even though the place was closing in 10 minutes. we could sit and enjoy the food. totally recommend.; cute little restaurant! was hard to find! google maps kept taking us to wrong spot. food was good! the chicken shawarma was delicious! enjoyed spinach puffs.; it was our 1st day in paris (from canada), so we needed something warm and light…. btw we shared the plate! perfect place, yumminess hummus, fatouche and we took the beef (shawarma), and a small plate of potatoes (with garlic, spices and coriander) and one of us took the arz lebanese beer delicious, and myself the orangina drink ….23euros the cook and the waitress are both very welcoming. small quaint place (not ohlala) merci 🙏🏼; great food, great service, great price

name: La Famille Heureuse
reviews:
delicious foods full of flavor and great service.  if you are craving for chinese foods, you should come to this nice family owned business.; great. i can trust owner's choice; the catering restaurant la famille heureuse is an excellent choice for fans of chinese cuisine.
the dishes offered are delicious and authentic, with a variety that will satisfy all palates.
the service is fast and courteous, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is welcoming and warm. a slight downside on the portions, which could be a little more generous, but that does not detract from the overall quality of the experience. an address to remember for a tasty meal with family or friends!; automatic welcome, not really warm.
having priced a beef soup with 5 spices at 11.90 euros. i found it rather simple, not really feeling the 5 spices. the beef was fatty, the noodles rather plain. not really feeling any flavors, tastes, spices…just the coriander. too simple for the price.
disappointed.
occasionally try catered dishes.; ate very good soup. huge portion and great quality. what should also be mentioned is the extremely friendly service, even with us non-french speaking customers. thanks for that!

name: Terminus Nord
reviews:
got recommended this restaurant by a french local. food was flavourful and authentic. 40 euros for 3 courses is an absolute bargain for the value and the high quality food. the steak was cooked perfectly and lamb was really tender. the oysters were fresh and tasted really good, the creme brûlée was the best of my whole stay in france. would recommend to those that wish to taste authentic french cuisine. will come again next time i come back to france.; i did really enjoy the service, food and atmosphere. the staff did very nicely handle my subpar french and did really well. the food was tasty, had good portions and high quality. my steak was one of the best i had in a while. also the atmosphere is what i expect of a brasserie.

can highly recommend; just stumbled into this french restaurant. superb food at really good prices. who knew french cuisine could be so affordable as well ? the lamb was succulent.  very well cooked. not gamey and nice and juicy! the escargots were out of this world. super well seasoned with olive oil and mint. and the ravioli doused with the cheese. heavenly. the waiters are really busy. guess the quality of the food speaks for itself. also had the draft 1664 to go with the meal. also had their french onion soup which was also excellent and not overtly salty.  must come here again !  this is my 4th time eating here. speaks volumes !; restaurant with a mirror hall and beautiful floor tiles but not the ceiling. overall, food is ok and oysters are really fresh. price is reasonable and service is above average.; fabulous lunch, my oysters were lovely. langoustine ravioli was delicious and the tuna steak was huge. mum really enjoyed her pate encroute and the fish and chips.
highly recommend.

name: Chouchou
reviews:
one of the few restaurants where you can have breakfast before 12:00 pm. the interior is unique, and the staff is friendly. the food is tasty for its price. we ordered a breakfast that included an omelette or eggs with potatoes and greens, a hot drink, freshly squeezed juice, and a choice of a croissant or sweet pancakes with filling. the price for breakfast was 17 euros. we recommend this place!; the restaurant is good.  the food, especially the confit and the roasted chicken are delicious.  the waiter is also very helpful.  when i feel the grilled steak is a little bit over cooked than what i expected, the waiter has voluntarily replaced one for me though i didn’t ask for.; during my recent visit to paris, i dined at chouchou and was thoroughly impressed. i ordered the formule plat+des and a tajine d’agneau prun eaux amandes. the portions were incredibly generous, easily enough to satisfy even the heartiest appetite.

the tajine d’agneau (lamb tagine) was bursting with flavor, beautifully seasoned with a perfect balance of sweet prunes and almonds. every bite was tender and rich, making it one of the best dishes i’ve had in paris. the formule plat+des offered a delightful variety, adding even more to the feast with a well-rounded meal combination.

not only was the food quantity remarkable, but the taste was top-notch—definitely worth the price. with a total of €43.40, the quality and portion sizes made it a fantastic value for money. the ambiance was relaxed and welcoming, and the service was prompt.

takeaway available and restaurant functions till 2am!

if you’re looking for a place that offers hearty meals with unforgettable flavors, chouchou is a great choice!; friendly and helpful staff. french fries were tasty but the onion soup needed more seasoning. for the tartar, i couldn’t taste the beef flavor. overall, food was okayish, but great service.; the waitress was kind and helpful.
the food was tasty and well priced.
unfortunately they only have one baby chair, but fortunately the restaurant was mostly empty at lunchtime so we got to use the baby chair.

name: Le Trumilou
vicinity: 84 Quai de l'Hôtel de ville, Paris
formatted_address: 84 Quai de l'Hôtel de ville, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
we visited this restaurant for dinner based on a recommendation and we’re so glad we did! despite a little bit of a language barrier, we managed to order our appetizers - an avocado “caviar” and oeuf de mayonnaise. i think what was brought out instead was a daily special which was eggplant based, and whereas i was expecting more like deviled eggs, what we received was a salad with eggs and mayo was n the side. despite the hiccup, it was delicious. the eggplant dish was really good, and not sure what makes french mayo taste so good, but i had no problem slathering this over my eggs.

for our main meal. my husband ordered the duck with prunes with a side of pan fried vegetables and i had the beef fillet with pepper sauce and fries and a nice glass of bordeaux. i am not a fan of duck but this was the best duck i’ve ever tasted. i would seriously have no problem going there again and ordering that dish.

my steak was medium, as requested (glad they asked!) and i appreciated that they served the gravy without the peppercorns. i can’t tell you how many times i’ve ordered a similar dish and they filled with them. biting into them just ruins the dish for me. this sauce was so good i kept dipping my fries and bread into it. and i truly did not mind that it got into my salad!; really loved the french onion soup and snails. great food and nice place to people watch if you sit outside. the duck was slightly over cooked and the sauce’s tangy taste over powered the duck a bit and there was a lot of sauce. other than that everything else was very good!; a great place to try authentic/traditional french dishes. unfortunately, not the largest portion sizes, so either spend a lot for not a lot or go not too hungry.

very good mayonnaise; not store bought.

snails: texture of octopus, "taste likes chicken" - just meat innit. a novelty dish which doesn't taste bad, just tiny bits of garlic sauce smothered meat. (snails will taste similar everywhere.); very authentic place, rare food items, kind and quiet service.

your are welcomed into what a french restaurant use to look like maybe 40/50 years ago. this is your authentic french bistro of paris. you may get out of here for some very nice food such as roast pork, tartare, snails and frog legs.
but i preferred the most today : the duck with plums, and the sweetbread ( it’s an organic located around the throat of the veal that disappears during growth ) were truly moving. generous, the sauce of the duck is just a nice cuddle that enveloppes the meat and makes it juicy and moist.

true bites of pleasure.

the vue is very nice, you can see notre dame, i would rearrange the plants to have more light inside, and maybe put some old french variety. but the ambiance of the seats and the staff was welcoming. away from the craziness of some touristic spots!; visited here on a saturday lunchtime in paris.

we wanted to find somewhere traditional french and a friend recommended trumilou. this was exactly the vibe that we wanted, we felt like the minority as tourists in here as most people were french which is usually a good sign.

the food was good, two of us shared the sharing steak and whilst impressive in size, frustratingly it was quite chewy and probably not how i would usually like it. the steak was very fatty and just difficult to eat (see photos).

aside that, the chips were great and the ambience / vibe lovely. would recommend this place for a traditional french lunch, but probably go for something other than the sharing steak.

name: Mamma Primi
reviews:
a fine restaurant with a cosy environment, especially if you're on a date or meeting friends/family. i'd been here with friends and i had a good time overall. they have a good variety of food and drinks. we had ordered cocktails, which were pretty good. the pizzas were decent at best. the only disappointing dish was the truffle pizza. the ambience adds to the whole experience.; great place to enjoy a delicious meal! the food was excellent! the service was amazing … quick and responsive. our server antonio was awesome and gave us great recommendations on wine and food. definitely worth dining here! we were blown away from the warmth of the staff and the quality of the food. try the burratta and for main the truffle pizza, you won’t be disappointed!; was a bit disappointed from my last visit to mamma primi.
the portions got smaller and prices higher. i ordered pasta with cockles and didn’t expect the amount of cockles to be just as little as 6…
pizza’s choice is very little (only 5 pizzas to choose from including marguerita). and to my mind, was mediocre.
service… we were 7 and were served with the delay of 15-20 mins. my pasta got cold when my colleagues had their pizza.

we went here quite often a couple of years ago and the overall impression has always been top. it has changed, not sure if we’ll ever come back dining here again.; truffle pasta is extremely strong, if you don’t like truffles like a lot. you won’t like it. other than that everything is amazing. server was superb and extremely friendly with helping us order. i will be back next time i will be in town for sure.; very popular which made it quite noisy.  the utensils were cute.
pizza was great.  pâte et ravioli were salty. the tiramisu was a bit too creamy with few ladyfinger part. the price is a bit high considering the portion of dishes.

name: Carpe Diem Café - Paris
reviews:
carpe diem café is a french bistro that has truly captured my culinary heart. from start to finish, our dining experience here was nothing short of amazing.
the menu boasts an array of delicious options, and each dish we ordered surpassed our expectations. the attention to detail in preparation and presentation was evident, showcasing the commitment of the culinary team to delivering excellence.
one notable aspect of our visit was the quick service. the staff was attentive and efficient, ensuring that our dining experience flowed seamlessly. and the best part? there was no long queue to contend with, allowing us to enjoy our meal without any unnecessary waiting time.
the delightful experience at carpe diem café has left us eagerly anticipating our next visit. with so many tempting items on the menu, we're excited to explore more of their culinary offerings and discover even more reasons to fall in love with this bistro.
if you're in search of a french bistro that excels in delivering amazing and delicious food, with a quick and attentive service to match, look no further than carpe diem café. it's a place that beckons you to savor every moment and every bite.; amazing food, not the nicest staff but they were busy! would visit again the food was great quality; we arrived at the happy hour, and we wanted to have a few drinks. we ordered a portion of wings, that didn't have much seasoning, and were ok.

without asking if we would want anything else, the waiter brought the bill, by explaining that they needed the table because of multiple reservations they had for the night.

a bit rude, especially when we actually wanted to stay for a few more drinks. more concerning because it didn't seem to be the case for other tables that were still ordering their drinks and food.

won't go again.; this is more of a local place with decent food and great beers on tap. we came here twice during our trip. the staff was very friendly.; visiting from the u.s and wanted to eat at a nice french style restaurant. the was the one. i enjoyed the very pleasant environment and excellent staff. the food was absolutely delicious. i had the duck and my wife had the steak. we enjoyed the vegetable dish for the appetizer. followed by an excellent dessert! fyi the chocolate mousse is all you can eat. i would recommend this place to anyone wanting a nice dinner.

name: Le Café Populaire
reviews: very nice breakfast and relaxing atmosphere! 🩵 just opposite to our hotel, so convenient, but we would recommend it to anyone to go here! 👌🏻; i can only speak to breakfast, but there was great service, a quiet outdoor seat and warm croissants and coffee to be had here. good early morning find!; absolutely delicious breakfast. al fresco, with delightful flavors and textures. will be back here soon!; this place was good. not amazing only good. the staff was nice. food was good; 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 a wonderful waitress, everything is cooked very quickly, they also helped us figure out how to get to the airport on the day when there was a marathon and everything was closed. super breakfasts! everything is delicious and heartfelt. music is also very nice playing in the cafe.

name: Le Vestiaire à Roulettes
reviews:
super service; second-hand clothing store for children with excellent value for money. you can find everything (pants, sweaters, little tops, pajamas, coats) in all sizes. in short, it’s really good!; it’s always a pleasure to come to the locker room on wheels!

the clothes are cool, and the teams provide good advice and above all are super friendly.

we can't wait to come back!; great exchange with stéphanie from the locker room on wheels! it's great to think that we can do a good deed by recycling our toddlers' clothes and earn a few euros (even if we clearly don't do this for profit). thank you to the locker room on wheels for this positive and so necessary approach; it's a great initiative but it's closed two out of three times when i go there because the opening hours communicated in the newsletter are sometimes modified. i don't have the "google" reflex so from this point of view there is a small communication failure.  crossing the whole of paris several times with a baby in a stroller or in stifling heat only to find the door closed is very discouraging.

name: L'Acrobate
reviews: i bought all my jellycat toys here -- they've a very extensive collection for an intimate shop ❤️ super friendly too!; amazing little shop with and amazing stock for kids! i bought two children's rucksacks and they are just lovely; adorable toy and clothing store with unique handmade pieces. bought my niece a reversible vest that will be the perfect gift from my paris trip.; we bought a bunch of stuff for our son. high quality and hand made. very hard to find these days in chicago.; wonderful owner, great prices, beautiful handmade toys, highly recommended! ❤️

name: Le Phénicien
reviews: great food and service.; friendly and competent service. fresh and delicious food; i wanted to give 5 stars but my chicken was dry. everything else, and the service were fantastic. really, really good. the bread served was the best i've ever had. like pita but much lighter and very delicate. great huumus.; i love this place! it’s always been consistently good. i have been going there since 2019.; try the mezze! fantastic taste!

name: Auberge La Mouginerie
reviews: warm welcome. the presence of the dog is a significant asset.;

name: Pink Mamma
reviews:
this restaurant is highly recommended for its combination of good food, attentive service, and a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience. whether you’re dining alone or with a group, the environment strikes a perfect balance between comfort and sophistication, making it an ideal spot for various occasions.

one of the standout items on the menu is the **truffle pizza**. if you’re a fan of pizza or just looking to try something unique, the truffle pizza is a must-try. the blend of earthy truffle with the rich, cheesy toppings creates a mouthwatering dish that appeals to both casual diners and food enthusiasts alike. the pizza has a thin, crispy crust with just the right amount of toppings, offering a flavorful experience without being overwhelming.

beyond pizza, the menu offers a wide variety of dishes that cater to different tastes, all prepared with quality ingredients. service is prompt and friendly, ensuring that your needs are met efficiently. whether you’re coming for a casual meal or a special celebration, this restaurant delivers a well-rounded experience that will leave you satisfied and eager to return.; food and drinks were delicious, service was friendly and available without being intrusive, reasonable pricing for such a hot spot. make reservations before going or get there before opening to stand in the queue and you’ll be able to get in (at least at the bar). pizza and pasta are the stars of the show! gabriel was our server and he was great!; amazing all around. ambience was perfect for conversation and enjoying. servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. food was absolutely amazing!! totally worth all the hype and the prices weren’t even bad. will definitely return someday.; if you are in paris and enjoy italian cuisine, this is the spot for you. the service was phenomenal, the atmosphere was laid back yet romantic. food and drinks were so good.; delicious food, very friendly service. we were late and unable to reach the restaurant but they were very accommodating and got us in as soon as possible even with their packed schedule. highly recommend the truffle pasta! it is as good as they say. i preferred mine with extra parmesan and salt as i am a huge cheese lover but it was delicious without any changes! very strong black truffle flavor! the restaurant has a warm and relaxing ambiance. great prices as well.

name: Judy Market
reviews:
a wonderful experience at judy. i have a gluten-free family member so finding this restaurant/cafe was very exciting. service was great, and even though it was almost a full restaurant and we didn’t have a reservation front of house kindly accommodated us. food was all excellent- polenta fries were my favourite as the was extra crispy and seasoned with a delicious mix of sweet paprika and other spices. portions are very good-sized so you get your money’s worth. also loved the complimentary ginger shot we got given before the meal. hope to come back to try the gluten-free pastries!; amazing food and lot of options.
i will definitely go back to try more things!!
the place is very cozy and the staff is friendly and welcoming.
fast service.; the atmosphere of the place is so good. the service is really efficient and kindly. the food could be better , maybe i had the wrong dish so i think i need to go again to try another one.
18 € for 3 pieces of chicken and lettuce is a bit too much..; my salad was so good with the crispy tofu. glad to know it was also gluten-free. unfortunately, the surface was not great which impacts the atmosphere.   i spent almost 15 minutes, trying to get someone’s attention and finally gave up and went inside the café where i was sitting.  8 minutes past 4 pm and they said too late i couldn’t get the little side of tofu addition.  fine, but the fact that they never came and checked on me after they delivered the food, especially before the kitchen closed - it wasn’t very busy. we are towards the end of august.    i was speaking french  though  poorly.

i will give them one more try and update this review; really cute little place. both my friend and i really liked the coffee here, the blend was excellent. the service is kind of slow but the serveuse are nice.

name: Restaurant L'Etoile De l'Est
formatted_address: 10 R. du Château Landon, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
this place is a hidden gem! been in paris 2 nights & we went there for dinner twice in a row! spent valentine’s night dining here and it was awesome 👍🏻 waiter was friendly and accommodating. the chef’s cooking: absolutely delicious! 😋 the portion is so big for such great price!; don’t judge the book by its cover, judge it by its food! the food was amazing. the place is run down but it looks like it’s been open for a while and there is a reason for it… the food!; underrated small family-owned business serving homestyle authentic french cuisine. very reasonably priced and generous portions. the family is very genuine and helped my spouse and i with her first escargot experience. simple ambience and obviously frequented by the locals.; the service was friendly, the prices reasonable and food was delicious. make sure you come hungry, because portions are quite generous.
would recommend.; this place is an absolute gem. had lunch twice here while in paris on holiday. it's family run, unpretentious and out of the main tourist areas round gare du nord and gare de l'est. really exceptional food, well served and very reasonably priced. our goto place for food in paris.

name: GLAZ
formatted_address: 56 Bis Rue de Clichy, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
awesome!

glass restaurant, near place de clichy, is a  cozy gem, run by brothers and friends who have transform it into warm, inviting  spot adorned with vintage vinyl covers and a great music selection.

they offer an exceptional wine list, featuring french selection and delicious authentic french dishes made with fresh local ingredients. the staff is awesome, friendly and transparent, they provide an excellent service making every visit feel personal and memorable!!

for a  true taste of parisian charm, authentic cuisine and best vibes ; glaz is a must-visit !

great value for money, portions and quality are amazing !; amazing food and service. the waiter ( a cute girl ) explained menu perfectly in english.

you must try it if you visit paris.

plus, the cats monet is so friendly!; this restaurant was amazing. we went to a michelin starred restaurant on this trip, and while it was delicious, i honestly think i would recommend glaz first. the food was so so good.  we had the beef, chicken, cheese plate, and chocolate mousse for dessert. everything was amazing.

the service was also wonderful, our server was so helpful with recommendations and just very cheerful. ambiance was also superb. one of the best restaurants i've been to in a while.; had a lovely meal here, delicious veal tartare, asparagus, chicken and gnocchi plus a cheese plate and a very good chocolate mousse to finish. good choice of wines by glass or bottle.  the staff were very friendly and we had a lovely relaxed dinner. would recommend booking for a weekend evening as we did, we went a saturday evening and saw various walk ins turned away as they were fully reserved.  we felt very well looked after here and whilst it's not cheap it felt like the right amount to spend on a meal of this quality with nice friendly service.; unique dishes in a unique setting where cats and dogs are as welcome as you are.
and the cuisine is simply pristine!

name: La Vache Acrobate
reviews:
we ordered onion soup, escargots and two of their signature beef filet. onion soup and escargots were a bit subpar. overall excepted much more.; excellent french restaurant. the fried squid salad on the starter menu is delicious and easy to share.; i ate there by myself last evening .the timing  of my arrival was lucky as i was fortunate to get a table. i couldn't decide on escargot or onion soup so i ordered both. each was excellent. the restaurant was vary busy, but the service was excellent. definitely warrants a revisit when i return to paris.; not a lot of vegetarian options but the one they had (ravioli) was good. the staff was very nice (always props if they speak french to you when you are a french-speaking foreigner and don't immediately switch to english). small, but nice neighbourhood restaurant!; great restaurant, with calming ambience.    good value and portion sizes, and the duck is highly recommended.

will return on a future visit to the neighborhood.

name: Bioburger Montorgueil
formatted_address: 45 Rue des Petits Carreaux, 75002 Paris, France
reviews:
we really liked the halloumi burger, the staff were very nice, it's a good spot to sit ad chat for a while; good burger, fast service, all bio food. there is enough choice, this restaurant is in a lively area.; i have been in this place during my visit in paris and i was very satisfied for the food quality and the service provided. you can order the dishes also via the totem located inside choosing among different languages including spanish and italian. the quality food is ok and the dishes are made up with bio ingredients with tracked supply chain. in the store there are also explanations and description of used methods of production and preparation.; i’ve been to this location several times and it seems both the food and the service have improved. i love the bio concept, and the vegetarian options are so tasty. i was surprised to see it open on 1 january and i must say the service was exceptional, special thank you to the lady working the front 😊 will return again!; loved the concept. bio and organic fast-food. we have been to the location at montorgueil. ordering at th counter at a mashine. to go or sit down. a variety of burgers to chose from. vegetarian options as well. food came very quick. staff was helpful.
fries were crispy and a good amount of salt. definitely homemade. my boyfriend tried the pulled pork burger. bun and meat have been of very good quality.
menu (🍔+🍟+🥤) from 11-15€. excellent value. compared to other lunch spots in paris great price for a meal.

name: La Poulette de Grain
formatted_address: 261 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
top service and good food in this exquisite parisienne bistro.

the waiter was very acommodating, extraordinarily friendly and helpful with our requests and explained the menu nicely.

the onion soup was very good.
the steak was okay, but they have nice fries & sauces. the creme brulée was delicious!

can recommend!; as a new yorker coming to paris coming to this restaurant was simply fantastic. it was great fast service and the waiters were kind funny and gracious. i will definitely come back here again and they say open after midnight, which is fantastic.; the most delicious onion soup i've tried! must have to order!
the rest of the food was tasty as well.
prices are also very good.
i will definitely come back.; very cozy atmosphere, friendly and passionate staff. food quality is all we could ever ask for. roast chicken is extremely tender and juicy, paired with flavorful sauce. we also have the duck parmentier, ribs and sea bass, all of them are delicious! we were served with an aromatic mint tea afterwards, which soothed our full bellies.
overall, very good experience, 200% will come again when we travel to paris!; highly recommend. delicious food, excellent service and great prices. merci!

name: LES TRIPLETTES DE BELLEVILLE
reviews: we highly recommend this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are excellent plus the service is exceptional! our server and the chef went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was five stars. thank you very much 😊; okay. i just arrived in paris after being in italy for 2 weeks, and this was honestly better than anything i had there! don’t tell italy, but this place is sooo good. i had the coquillettes pasta with ham. they use truffle gouda and it’s to die for! i ate the whole thing. finished it with the chocolate cake. the server juliette was very kind to me and gave me recommendations for things to do while i’m in paris. highly recommend! ; went here for breakfast. the design looked quite cool and the food was pretty good but we noticed a lot of mouse / rat droppings on the sofa and and on the counters which put us off a lot also the toilet wasn't nice and didn't have any soap which didn't help with the cleanliness feeling.; the breakfast menu consisting of a hot drink, croissant, and fresh orange juice was great. especially the croissant that was just fresh out of the issue. while the cafe au lait was delicious, the peppermint tea consisted of fresh mint leaves and a bag of green tea. this wasn't great for people who order mint tea specifically because they don't enjoy green tea.; had a lovely time here. two friends and i ordered a menu (formule) and they took a bit too long. they forgot my starter and brought it after the main dish which was messed up too; the steak was half-raw when i like it done. so to compensate, they gave me free desert and only charged me for one dish. altogether i really appreciate this gesture and i would return.

name: BROTHER SISTER Brunch Lunch Dinner
formatted_address: 72 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
nicely located in the 11eme of paris. the staff has been very nice and accommodating, and the service has been quite fast. you might find a line outside but is going through quite rapidly especially for groups of 2/3 people. the food is okay, with nice choices and various options. overall a good experience to recommend.; a good restaurant, but a bit overpriced. it is located in the 11 and the place is well decorated, service is great. we had a nice breakfast!
40 euros for two.; had a short wait around noon but it was well worth it . the service was quick and efficient , we enjoyed the breakfast burritos & avocado toast . visiting from the us , we consider ourselves foodies . we would recommend 10/10. thank you to our wonderful service charlette ❤️; cosy place with californian vibes decor, simple but loved the atmosphere! we loved the personnel, the server (maybe owner) was really nice and she did a really good service. it terms of food we absolutely loved it, your money is worth the quality. it tastes very good! i would recommend trying this place out! you also have a terrace for the sunny days it can be nice!; we had the most amazing time at brother sister! this was our last night in paris before heading back to the states and we wanted to have a great time and this place was so awesome. the drinks were delicious and the food was incredible, get the mac n cheese balls!!🧀😋 charlotte was our waitress and she was so lovely and made our night the best it could be! thank you for an amazing last dinner in paris brother sister!!💕

name: Café Petite
reviews:
really good coffee
the food was good or was i just very hungry ? i loved the mix of ingredients i would never think of by myself
i felt really good inside, it was a rainy day after work, i could find a moment of calmness here
waiters are one of best service i saw from many restaurants; server in white turtleneck (name might be feudin?) is a complete jerk. hope he owns the place. otherwise should be fired. pretty good atmosphere. beer wasn’t too cold. crème brûlée was okay.; more bar than resto but food was good, all five of us agreed. the jerk chicken was a pleasant surprise. burgers and croque got the job done. bad acoustics inside with loud music and loud talking by drinkers made it hard to communicate. this is a bar primarily, hence the food and service are decent but the menu is limited.; we tried the thai tartar and the croque madame and they were both delicious. the waitress who served us was also really nice and friendly. the price is okay considering it's paris. overall, a great experience-i would definitely come back!; on thursday night always crowded with people and i ordered tard tard tested good and have various sauces.

name: Café Obrkof
reviews:
lovely staff very friendly.
we had two toasties and they were ok.
the bread wasn't great with limited filling inside and the chais latte wasn't very good.
overall it was ok.; hidden gem for breakfast. the menu is simple but very flavorful. we loved sitting on the sidewalk enjoying our toasties with salad and a coffee. really great service too!; nice little gem! had a matcha latte there… was tasty and well made. unfortunately they don’t do soy milk - shame! what s the problème here in paris with soy milk?!?! nice little alfresco, friendly staff, but not warm at all. cafe culture is such a different game in france compared to australia!; one of the best breakfast we had here i paris! good price and high quality products as well as friendly employees:) definitely recommended if you stay in paris and you want a "normal" not too sweet breakfast:); loved it! great coffee and excellent service. i ate the salmon avocado toast and added fresh salad and boild egg on the side, it was simply delecius!

name: On Partage - Cantine Caféinée
formatted_address: 137 bis Rue de Charonne, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
very fresh, quality for price and wholesome. love the small menu that changes each day depending on the ingredients. their dessert looks amazing although i didn’t have. the salad was absolutely delicious, decent portion as well and comes with tasty bread. they were accommodating despite being packed (wait was less than 5 mins).

it isn’t too spacious or it feels that way because tables are packed together. however they have nice bar window options, if you are lucky 😊

definitely worth a visit.; had a great time at this cafe! they were super awesome and made us feel at home. the iced lattes and dirty chai were delicious. and their sandwiches have unique flavours that are simply a new discovery for the tastebuds! thank you so much to the team here for making our lunch time so enjoyable. although i was disappointed by my experience at a well-known cafe, recto verso, a few days ago, today at this cafe completely changed my mood. their service was exceptionally good and made me feel truly cared for and warm.
highly recommended to anyone looking for great flavours and warmth!; perfect place to get cozy and enjoy delicious food over a break from this crazy world. friendly and incredibly welcoming staff, warm and comfy atmosphere and absolutely delicious food /  high-quality products.
a special thanks to olivia ! chickpea waffles are a keeper ♥️
will come back for sure; a cozy spot with a small kitchen. suitable for both working and enjoying a not wide but looking good selection of sweet and savory dishes, as well as excellent coffee products.

i only grabbed two cappuccinos to go, so i can't comment on the food. however, the vibes were great and from the taste of the drinks, it was evident the attention to detail they put into this place.

friendly staff and good vibes. i hope to return soon to give my opinion on the food. in the meantime, highly recommended for coffee.; the best place! the food was delicious and fresh, the people the nicest. just go here! loved it! ✨

name: À Mon Café
formatted_address: 182 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
highly recommended place. we had the brunch menu which included hot drink, orange juice, croissant, avocado toast with poached eggs and smoked salmon, a small salad, baked potatoes and yogurt with mixed berries jam. the portion is big and the food is just delicious, the service was very good as well. everyone was very kind.; we enjoyed everything, it was fresh and very tasty. great ambiance too.
p.s. the second time we came, steak was of bad quality to the point we had to send it back. and its sauce was like water. we were very disappointed. the other day was prepared differently too. we ordered the same things as before and got completely different result.; a local, friendly café in paris! most foreigners come to paris for sightseeing. however, there are somewheres too much 'sightseeing' to true lifestyle of parisian.
i get here for normal life franch antee, plats and coffee. some neighbours were reading or using laptop with their meals. some visitors like me had a good time here 😁; very nice place, comfortable, cosy, food is great, atmosphere created with classic french music where sometimes the staff join in on the song being simply overcome with being part of it, and gets busy with local parisians.; i looove this place, good vibe, kind and good attention from the staff, they also speak english, they serve a goooood huge brunch, for a good price to be paris, i would definitely recommend to go there

name: East Mamma
formatted_address: 133 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
absolutely amazing truffle and cream pasta! the wine was perfect! the desert, i almost died! i’ll call it death by chocolate floating on top of the best whipped cream i’ve ever had!
service was decent despite the crowd. i was solo so i sat at the bar watching the cooks do their thing. i was here 7 years ago and it’s even better  than i remember! i’ll be back! 💜; my husband and i came to paris to celebrate our honeymoon and this is the first restaurant we visited. this experience was delightful. the food was delicious — highly recommend the nocciolamisu. our server, shady was spectacular and the host was so sweet! we will definitely come back!; we came without reservations and got seated at the bar quickly. busy place and service was great. the pasta was a little too al dente for my liking . but the pizza was decent.; the pasta is fresh and the service was really quick. i felt that the service was not too friendly, but that may have been because i was dining by myself. the truffle pasta was fresh but very, very rich and not enough truffle flavour. the tiramisu portion was generous but lacked coffee flavour and was mostly just cream. the atmosphere was nice.; east mama is a warm, cozy but also euphoric little oasis of italy in paris, with everything good that should come with it.

wouldn’t you like to enter this restaurant and then hear such sweet words as “enjoy ragazzi” with that perfumed unmistakable tuscany accent when you’re about to dive into an impossibly delicious looking pistachio tiramisu? i know i did!

the food is 10/10, the atmosphere can be both lively and comfy, the service is perfect and there is nothing more you can ask for.

the truffle pizza and the margherita are some of the best pizza i have ever tried in my life, the veal carpaccio was actually surreal, i couldn’t believe how tasty and delicate it was, and the caccio e pepe was without a doubt the best pasta i have ever tried. the desert was unbelievable.

do yourself a favor and reserve a table in this place, it will leave you fond and golden memories of paris, just for the right reasons.

name: La Cantine de Babelville
vicinity: 77 Rue de la Fontaine au Roi, Paris
formatted_address: 77 Rue de la Fontaine au Roi, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
i got the thieb poulet for €6.80. the meat was tender and everything was well spiced and so delicious. probably the best meal i had in paris. also the food is enough for two servings if you are not so hungry to eat all of it - super generous portions; the place is interesting. the quality of the food isn’t anything amazing, but considering the prices it’s more than good. the menu is set and i think there’s like 4 dishes that you can choose between. they offer a discount for students.; amazing food! great prices and friendly staff ! totally recommend ! get the plantains; generous and delicious meals for dirt cheap.
the staff is kind and welcoming.; everything is nice, big quantity for a cheap price and everyone is respectful!!

name: Les Enfants Terribles
reviews: coffee was nice but the staff was abominable. there was one nice lady who served us, while the other one told us we cannot sit in the normal seating area as we only have drinks. there were 4 other groups of people who only had drinks, all of which were sitting in the dining area. this was while we were forced to sit at the bar. she also said this in a very rude and accusatory tone. we felt discrimated and hurt by this. we do not recommend coming here.; great spot for drinks. staff were very friendly, regulars are awesome and love to mingle. music was great all night!; great location and friendly staff. a very cosy set up and large variety of drinks and snacks. good decoration and relaxed atmosphere. very nice local place to visit !; nice atmosphere and welcoming staff, but should put more efforts in serving better drinks. ti-punch was poorly balanced in my opinion (too much rhum compared to the amount of lime and sugar, sugar not mixed into the drink would be probably better with sugar sirop instead of granulated sugar); i was in paris for work and discovered this bar by accident. i like the personal, they are wery kind and funny. also the drinks were good. the bar is looks good and i love the name of it.

name: Le Bibe-Rond Bobo
reviews:
staff is great, very welcoming, pints are cheap, vibe is tuff. definitely will be coming here more often!; incredible service, linda is helpful, attentive and it's really a pleasure to share a good dish with friends here! the dishes are hearty and tasty.; excellent and hearty royal couscous!!
semolina, vegetables and meats very well cooked.
we had a great time and we left with a doggy bag!
the welcome and service were very friendly.
i highly recommend it, especially if you want to taste couscous worthy of the name!
very good value for money.; the couscous was succulent and the welcome impeccable, i recommend and above all i will definitely come back, thank you for the service 👌; simple and home cooking, 100% fresh organic. we had our brunch there, it was very good! homemade fries and delicious mint tea. in short, we recommend with our eyes closed!

name: Le Troquet des Glaces
vicinity: 46 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, Paris
formatted_address: 46 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
a no-frills bar with great beer and wine.
recommend the la barge east craft beer. friendly owner/barman.; lovely bar and lovely owner. spent a wonderful evening here watching the football and tasting the speciality rum.; very good. one of the best bars, great stuff!; very kind; great bar! excellent choice of wine and charcuterie, the owners are very nice. very affordable.

name: Les Niçois
reviews:
we found this place randomly and it was a nice surprise
great staff, good food and beer with a reasonable price
definitely recommend; a mediocre food, combine but a worse service ever, a nasty woman, who refused t serve my table based on her mood. menu  eclectic not original neither interesting, overprice and not worth a penny, is a pity they waste such a good location; quite unusual place, with a real pétanque playground and table soccer board game in the basement. the food is nice for lunch, and prices are reasonable. the waiters' kindness and waiting time are greatly varying. for 16 euros, you get a 2 course set (entry + main dish or main dish + desert), with quite good, nice and fresh food, well cooked and well presented. soups are way too salty though. the interior design is based on french southern style, the city of nice especially. the window-roof makes the place quite bright.; good place for brunch but also tapas in the evening. chill place, very friendly staff, tasty food. highly recommended for a nice evening with friends (you can play the typical french "pétanque" downstairs) or for couples. will definitely go again !; small but rather cozy place. service was good. food was decent and a really good price for lunch set (according to paris standards). i paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. they also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: La Revanche - Bar à Jeux
reviews:
came here for games and drinks - it was fabulous. was with english friends and the service was great - super helpful in english. games are mostly in french, but there are a few in english. drinks were good and affordable. will absolutely be back!; very limited games choices, the bar tender doesn't offer the most known games like uno and monopoly, he says it's best to play other games which are not so famous.
but then he comes to explain in detail every game; really cool game bar, a bit expensive but a lot of games. they could make the food better honestly but otherwise i’m satisfied!
the staff was super nice and helpful!; very nice place where you have access to hundreds of card games, boardgames and almost everything you would find at a game store
entrance fee is 4€ and you need to purchase a drink every 2h to stay, which makes it rather expensive, but considering the diversity of game you could borrow it was worth it!
place tends to be a little too noisy when full; we had a great evening.  there's an impressive collection of board games.  the café is welcoming and comfortable-perfect for board games-and the staff could not have been nicer!  merci la revanche, we'll be back.

name: Cendrillon
reviews:
incredible service and amazing food. atmosphere it unmatched- fun, inviting, and hip. the chefs-owners were beyond friendly and hospitable- making us feel like close friends. loved the meal from to back. also, bonus points for really cool looking bar!; cendrillon has absolutely incredible service and incredible food. the dishes were very well crafted and creative. the atmosphere of the place felt grunge but in a very elegant way and it is very refreshing to have a restaurant around the corner that finds insanely creative ways to present the food with insanely creative ingredients and still retain taste. this is definitely one of the best restaurants in the area. a must check out. very impressed with the humility of the chefs and deco that is disguised under a very high quality experience. just what me and my friends like.; tiny spot with a powerful menu!
the staff is super friendly and helpful with any food or wine questions.
we shared several items and every single dish was solid!
* a la carte menu sundays & mondays.
*bonus points for the house dog; there’s nowhere better in paris… between the chefs’ incredible creativity, excellent execution and the team’s incredible service, you won’t be in a better place. thank you so much to everyone, especially lucy and iris, you guys were amazing.; came here back in may right after they opened. was a great dining experience with a great atmosphere. our servers name was lucy and spoke perfect english. she was so sweet and really made the experience memorable. i think they need better music though!

name: Emeu Kidstore Éco-Responsable | Boutique Bébé Enfant | Cadeaux De Naissance | Jeux, Jouets, Activités, Livres
reviews:
amazing shop if you are looking for gifts for toddlers & young children. quality clothes, quality toys and… great service! will definitely come back if i have other presents to make.; my favorite store for the neighborhood kids :))
the welcome and advice are top notch :)
the boss is passionate! the employees too!
i recommend ++
i discovered some of our most beautiful books there; magnificent shop! very beautiful, quality products and the welcome is really very friendly. i recommend 1000%; a great store with a well-thought-out selection! and always an impeccable welcome :); great shop. we want to buy everything! and the prices are very reasonable, especially since everything is eco-responsible.

name: Terrain de Jeux d'Enfants des Couronnes
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
while this wasn’t the best playground for our toddler there’s a great alternative playground for little ones just down the hill - the only warning i would give is that this park is really steep so tumbles are pretty easy for toddlers.; i was very disappointed by the park, not looking very safe and by the absence of green spaces to sit but my nieces (6 and 8 years old) had lots of fun; super fun playground.; for children aged 6 to 10… it’s a dream. they love it!; high quality games for children!
a mega slide, climbing walls, special cushioning composite floor, rope bridge…
refurbished, the children are having a blast! belleville and its magnificent view of paris and the eiffel tower

name: The Family
reviews:
i visited "the family" restaurant with my family and was delighted by the experience. from the moment we entered, we were warmly welcomed by a big, fluffy teddy bear holding the menu written on a charming chalkboard. this adorable touch instantly made us feel at home.
the food was well presented, with generous portions that were just right. most importantly, the taste did not disappoint. each dish was flavorful and satisfying, making our dining experience truly enjoyable. "the family" restaurant certainly lives up to its name, providing cozy and inviting atmosphere perfect for a family outing.; so i google a place to have a reasonable steak, so many great reviews about this place and i need to add mine as well. the service was fantastic, spoken english, had an english menu on a chalkboard which is pretty awesome and check out this food in the pictures. i can see why people come back to this place for sure. well done, bravo!!! 👍🍻👏👏👏

both deviled eggs salad and steak were 👍👍👍; felix was the best waiter!! super attentive, very funny and so kind!! made great wine recommendations and the food was phenomenal! highly recommend stopping by the family on your next trip to paris!; nice staffs, even though i don't speak french.
reasonable price. tasty food.
the onion soup was a bit salty.
feeling full and no room to order dessert.
happy dinner in french!; a very friendly and hospitable restaurant which gives good quality foods and pleasant atmosphere. if you want some light meal, thai salad or salmon plate is a nice choice.
steak is delicious and ensures to satisfy your appetite.

name: Restaurant chez Alex WENZHOU
reviews:
staff was nice, but struggled in english quite a bit with other guests. the food although was excellent! mapo tofu had authentic taste and very good levels of salt. the dumplings were nice but not outstanding; this restaurant is known for its "brioches", which are not, however, its best dish. after testing many bao restaurants in asia, the buns offered by this restaurant are too hard and resemble classic bread rather than bao bread.

the restaurant's other dishes are good and affordable.

the service is fast.

⚠️they don't accept credit cards. cash only.; it was not great. food was mediocre. also one of us had to wait about 20 minutes for her dish after my friend and i had already finished our food. we got sth additional that we didn't order. we immediately realized this and gave it back to the waitress explaining we had not ordered this. she insisted this was part of our order so we took it back. then when we went to pay, the "accidental dish" was charged as an additional dish to our bill. we explained again that we had not ordered this and did not want to pay for it. the staff started shouting at each other and pointing at us. it was all very uncomfortable. eventually they took it off our bill but with a very grumpy attitude. will not come back here.; had a big dinner with 15 friends and they arranged everything very well for us. amazing raviolis and noodles. only suggestion is they can mention the type of noodles in the menu as i dont like the fat noodles but didn't know it while ordering. still fabulous food and service! ✅; i went to this place three times, and was delighted every time. everything is homemade, there's vegetarian options as well as authentic chinese food. it's incredibly cheap (hot roasted pork or delicious veggie buns for just 1€, bigger than your fist, and most dishes around 6€) and they even have cool desserts. don't miss it.

name: Family
reviews: local gem! authentic vietnamese food in paris. their serving is great for the price. absolutely delicious, been going 3 times already in a holiday, 100% deserve a 5-star review.; every time we come to paris we would go to this authentic vietnamese restaurant. the food is always amazing. instead of having french cuisine all the time, it’s good to have other options in paris. situated away from touristy places, this place is definitely a local gem.; beautiful place it’s christmas all year round the food is high quality and great service 10/10 recommend; maybe it's a small restaurant but i can say that it's one of the best restaurants i've ever seen. the food is delicious and the portions are very good. great staff and a great environment. i'll come back with my friends for sure 😊; they had very sweet and caring employees. the quality of the food was very good. i ate the best vietnamese food i could eat in paris.

name: Le Relais Diderot
reviews:
loved the atmosphere of this restaurant. the picture of my favourite french singer added to the ambience. it is the kind of place you must return to and feel paris life.; the owner was very friendly, the food was tasty and well cooked
although the owner does it all, takes orders, cooks, serves, etc… we didn’t felt forgotten or unattended; one of the best couscous i have ever had ! affordable and fast service ! thanks; here we come to eat well.
the dishes are generous, the meat excellent.
we'll come back for the barbecue because there wasn't any left this evening.
starter main course, dessert or glass of wine for €14 for lunch or dinner!
we found our neighborhood restaurant.; great service, excellent algerian couscous, great meat, not too expensive. the owner is very nice. we loved it

name: Les Mascareignes
reviews:
excellent food, flavorful dishes and worth the prices. servers were very kind. i wish i could try everything on the menu.; authentic reunion and mauritius food. the rougail sauscisses et boucanne was really good.; lunch offerings include either an entrée plus main (e+p) or main plus dessert (p+d) for €16, featuring generous portions. the samosas and pickled vegetables were good. among the mains, the chicken curry was a pleasant surprise, outshining the sausage rougail with its richer flavor and tender meat. each dish was accompanied by a hearty serving of rice and beans.

this is an ideal spot for a filling and satisfying meal. a greater variety of vegetables in the dishes would be a welcome addition.; beautiful food and pleasant, friendly service. the flavors are incredible… it’s truly a wholesome and delicious experience. i’m so happy i went. 100% will return.; as a 🇷🇪/🇲🇺 person, i loved it.
this place, owned by a kind 🇲🇺 family, offers the warmest welcome, some great homemade starters and tasty authentic dishes.
would recommend 💯!

name: Chez Justin
reviews: we came to have lunch in the afternoon and we were completely impressed by the good service of staff and quality of food. the waiter was very courteous. if you’re reading this review, please note that this place really worth your visit.; local hot spot - friendly service from the team, we only stopped to have a few drinks and the owner was very accommodating in explaining different types of drinks. four stars as we only had a drink.; mediocre overpriced food and no separation between smoking and non-smoking areas. french really have dirty habits.; enjoyable atmosphere and friendly staff. the food nothing special but tasty and worth the price. recommended for simple & easy but enjoyable meals.; burgers, pasta, cafe, & wine

name: Moncœur Belleville
reviews: nice restaurant in a nice place, but that's about it. maybe great for locals, not recommended for tourists. when i asked about the menu, i was arrogantly told they no longer serve food. then the two tables next to us ordered food. so i guess different rules apply to tourists. a 'pleasant' experience and rude, uneducated and most racist service i’ve ever seen. thank you and never again.; friendly crowd. 20th arrondissement established place to meet and drink and have a great time.  right across the street from #lavieuxbelleville caberet  fantastic view of paris and the eiffel tower during the day and magical view at night; amazing spot, 5 stars services. prices are ok for such a nice view (you can even see the eiffel tower from the terrace!!). i’d highly recommend anyone who stops in paris to go there, especially with such a nice staff, they give such a cool and warm vibe to the place.; nice view, friendly staff and cool spot in the sun on top of paris. beers are quite ok and the blond is cheap and refreshing. some finger food option as of 9:30pm. see you soon; extremely well situated at the top of belleville parc, this neighborhood bar/restaurant has a nice outdoor area with the view over paris. they serve decent comfort food and standard drinks. the staff is pretty friendly there!

name: Le Bec Salé
vicinity: 119 Rue de la Roquette, 1 Rue Pétion, Paris
formatted_address: 119 Rue de la Roquette, 1 Rue Pétion, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
we had a nice meal here. the service was quick and very friendly people. it made us happy that they had clean toilet.
the food was fresh and very tasty. small menu but nice dishes to choose from. lots of locals came there too, which i always like.; had a good french breakfast combo here on the last day of our trip here.; a charming restaurant with mauritian cuisine. everything tasted great. i had the rougail saucisse served with basmati rice - a flavorful combination of sausages and an aromatic sauce. l’assiette mauricienne is definitely worth trying. you get a plate of various mauritian starters, which you can share with friends.; we stayed at the hotel next door and this became our go-to breakfast spot! delicious coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh bread/ croissant. the coffee was one of the best we had. the staff are super friendly and there is a lovely community vibe to the cafe! beats a hotel breakfast and would highly recommend!; one word: legit. solid service. cool atmosphere even when in between service and even without a crowd. good vibes. clean. organized. centrally located. bathrooms super tidy. shot glass of single shot of espresso is so funky cool. i willbr back with my amigos and girlfriends for sure.

name: Le Maximilien
reviews:
location: paris city center, just next to the gare de lyon!
staff and service: extremely friendly and sweet staff, excellent service!
ambiance and setup: big and comfortable space! you can even rent your own private space.
cuisine: good cuisine ! big portions, fresh ingredients!
price: very fair prices , 14 € menu per person for appetizer and main..; someone was watching over the shoulders here :) lovely cat which seemed to belong to the owner. we ate breakfast here and got nice and crunchy croissants and baguettes and of course coffee and tea. it was delicious.; i was sceptical at the ‘ friendly waiters’ reviews but it’s true.  and so handy for gare du lyon.  thank you for the lovely meal!; best meal on our european holiday so far. and good value for money and very friendly. fantastic. note photo taken half way through meal, couldn't resist.; looks like my mothers house.
very good cous cous.

name: L'Ile aux Fées
vicinity: 66 Rue Notre Dame des Champs, Paris
formatted_address: 66 Rue Notre Dame des Champs, 75006 Paris, France
reviews: the most beautiful girl’s clothing store! handmade  and one of a kind dresses. the dresses can be heirloom pieces as the quality is of the highest and made to last. i felt the prices were also very reasonable as well. i highly recommend shopping here if you have a little girl (i believe they even had some pieces for boys). staff is very helpful and friendly (and speak english). i will definitely be back.; this is an exquisite little girl’s boutique. every dress is handcrafted with the finest detail that is nearly impossible to find anymore. charlotte was so dedicated to assisting us in finding the perfect gifts for our little princess. even my husband enjoyed shopping here!; on monday i visited this wonderful boutique in paris. in addition to the spectacular dresses, the treatment we received from the owner was "red carpet". i have been buying dresses for my granddaughter ana isabel for about 5 years. they are made to order and charlotte sends them by mail. it was a pleasure to meet charlotte in person and of course, i bought a beautiful dress for my granddaughter and i will order the ones she will wear for christmas. they are beautiful and very high quality dresses, they are unique!!!; really an incredible store, so happy i came here. they have a nice selection of designs that are unique and handcrafted, great quality. it was a delight to browse the store, the saleslady working there was super helpful and caring, thank you for your help in selecting the perfect dresses! you made the experience really special for us; this is the perfect place if you look for a very special outfit for your little girl, or for a classy present that will be forever remembered! in this enchanting little boutique mme charlotte will show you the most amazing, hand-embroidered dresses, that have the poetry of past times, when high quality garments would be passed on in the family... it reminded me of one of my cute little dresses my mother put carefully away...and that i was able to pass on to my daughter! ...a place to fall immediately in love with!

name: PB Poulet Braisé Châtelet
formatted_address: 12 Rue de la Cossonnerie, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
yo, this place is so overrated! i don't get how it got 4.7 rating. the food is just average, man. we had the chicken with cheese and potatoes, and the potatoes were way too sweet and oily. the chicken was bland and dry. we also had the grilled chicken, which was just basic. i wanted to try the pasta, but i was already so disappointed. the only good thing about the place is the service. there's a long queue, though, so people must be waiting for something.
🫡🫡😐😑; superbly delicious grilled chicken! super tasty and portion was also big. had special offer during olympics. 10 euro for 1/4 piece, two wings, rice, and grilled banana (a bit random combination for my palate); shaina has been so far the best hostess who receives people with a smile and good vibes. excellent food and price friendly. very clean and tasty. thanks to salma too for her kindness; you can eat inside or order takeaway. i got a deal with 1/2 chicken and salad, and it was fresh and well-seasoned. the only issue was that they didn’t include the sauce that was supposed to be included, and since i ordered takeaway, i only noticed it at the hotel, which was very annoying. anyway, i highly recommend it; just be sure to check your order before you leave the place.; a nice spot 2min from the metro exit
the grilled chicken really ain’t bad even though it’s not visually super attracting.

they may need to improve on the plate presentation and the toilet cleanliness.

name: Bocamexa Mouffetard - restaurant mexicain
reviews:
i was craving food from home, so i was excited to try this place. this was the most disgusting burrito i have ever had. if this is what people think mexican food, i feel for them. i am mexican, this place is is not true mexican fast food. don't waste your money.; loved this place for a lunch with my mom.
the staff was so kind, and the food was delicious and fresh! we both got burritos and they were amazing. the location is so original, it was such a nice place to spend time.
price was absolutely fair and they offered us coffee.
totally recommend the experience. and thank you guys, you have been so kind to us.; i love this place! i always get a build-your own burrito. i work right around this restaurant and it has become a weekly must.
staff is super friendly.
it’s challenging to find good mexican food in paris/ france… but this place is super delicious and authentic.; authentic mexican food in the heart of paris. delicious from first bite to last. i had 3 tacos each with a different filling 🌮; the food itself is really nice, i had 3 tacos with 3 different meats and sauces and all of them were delicious.
however the portion was rather small and not enough, but still 9€. only after ordering i saw that it seems you can get 6 tacos for 11€ or even 9 for 13€...  i'm not sure, but if that's true then its a great value. the 3 for 9€ however is not.

name: Restaurant Discovery Food
reviews:
i came here excited to try their food, but once i began ordering that changed (i’m only visiting so my french is very little) tried to order what i could in french and the rest id point, the lady was so rude mumbling under her breath like “you don’t speak french” very rudely which i understood because i understand french. i so no, sorry. i continued to order and she continued to be very rude to me, so i just left. just because you feel miserable doesn’t mean you have to treat others horribly.; by far the best food place!! here you can get freshly prepared dishes at fair prices. if you are looking for a delicious and healthy lunch, this restaurant is the best in the area. moreover, the staff is super friendly!; it looks beautiful and tastes good. the seating is so small and it's crowded as there were only 2 people trying to do everything. great service though. i bought a sandwich which tasted good. i'll try visiting again !; finally a restaurant that understands what we really need in paris!
being able to eat a balanced diet, with a wide choice, for a reasonable price!
thanks to the managers, the atmosphere is very pleasant and intimate, i recommend!

@lvs.kid; excellent place, i highly recommend! thank you to the very friendly and helpful duo of ladies who received us.

name: Brasserie Lipp
reviews:
old but stylish classic french brasserie… all the food we had was amazing. top notch service and experience when it comes to classic french. trust their specials on the menu and you can’t go wrong. it’s helpful if you can speak some french, it helps but there’s also english speaking service stuff available. they will adore if you do speak french as a tourist :) make sure to book as the place is usually full. even locals go for dinner here.; lively spot. went on a friday night and omg: i have never received more carefree service in my life. we had a 7:30 rez and were seated at 7:55. we didn’t get mains till 10pm. the food itself was not super flavourful. steak + frites = okay. the steak was pretty bland. the oysters tasted like ocean. escargot was my favourite part of the dinner.

the profiteroles with ice cream were also quite nice.

i don’t get what the wait / hype is about. would not return; but maybe try it on a weeknight or for lunch.; a wonderful true french restaurant experience.   friendly professional service, the food was delicious. i thorough enjoyed myself.  highly recommend.  no
shorts allowed!  as it should be.; i ate here twice in one week and came back to try the meat. even if you are not a pork fan (for which they are famous), there are many options from the steak to lamb and duck confit. we had all three and they were delicious. of great note were the mashed potatoes and the desserts!; my favourite brasserie in the world.

fabulous french classics served by friendly staff in a wonderfully evocative period interior.

as a creature of habit i always start by ordering a bottle of rosé and the foie gras, this little ritual can take an hour to get through if i’m alone, watching the scene as waiters glide past me.

then usually the kidneys in a sublime rich mustard sauce…..

i could go on and on…

no trip to paris is complete with out at least one visit to brasserie lipp!

name: Le Oulala halal Paris
reviews:
i got the beef filet with foie gras.
it was good! i'd give it a 4.5...it's rare to get halal steak.
the highlight was the service...kudos to the serer lady running back and forth handling everything,  she was very nice; we were looking for a casual sit down restaurant, and this place more than fit the bill. excellent food, not to mention an excellent service experience throughout! the potatoes dauphinoise were delectable. an added discount to the crepes for dessert was the cherry on top, making this a top choice for tourists and parisiens alike. so much more makes this place really outstanding: the historic architecture, the free wifi, our wonderful server beja, and more! 💖💖💖from oregon, usa!; the food was outstanding, and the hosts were extremely nice and patient. the chicken normandy style was good and overall great experience. the steak was tender and the pepper sauce had a very nice flavor.
would definitely come again if i’m near by.; i am from cali and it's my first time in paris and i was looking for halal food and this was the first restaurant that popped up on google search. oulala has a wide selection of food including indulging pizzas, pastas, halal steak and fries too which is hard to find here in paris. i ordered chicken pizza and my husband ordered the steak with fries. the food was really fresh and delicious. they also have virgin drinks that are really great. do try this place if you're in paris. the menu is all halal. the staff was very friendly and the owner is really sweet. he personally made sure everything was good for us. nice chill ambience as well!; we like very much, tenderloin boef very good, also pasta with chickeen really good also, the classic tiramisu delicious but we forgot to take pic. the waitress is very nice and kind. last but not least best halal restaurant in paris

name: La Gorgée
reviews:
i'd say this place is overrated where it currently stands. it both served very delicious plates as well as puzzlingly poor ones. we ordered:

terrine with pickles (5/5) - very delicious terrine with some caramelized onions and a pickle. everyone at the table liked this.
chicken meatballs (4/5) - ordered for the kids but they didn't like it because it had too much parceley. overall it had a nice texture and a good sauce so we gobbled it up.
smoked haddock on cauliflower rice (1/5) - i love smoked fish but this was disappointing. the cauliflower, sauce and fish didn't work together at all and it was too salty
steak with chimichurri sauce and fries (5/5) - the best dish we got. usually ordering stake is disappointing because of the cut of meat or poor seasoning. this was perfectly cooked and seasoned and very tender - incredible!
chicken breast with linguine (4/5) - chicken was okay but linguine was just ok. the sauce was a fig and olive sauce which was too sweet.
turbot with tarragon crust and red rice (1/5) - ugh so salty and way too much terragon. could barely finish this.

if you come here order the good stuff and you'll be happy.; we went there in a small circle with our families after our civil marriage and the owner was simply adorable.  they made sure to prepare everything in advance. very kid-friendly! we had a great time there and great souvenirs! we will definitely return :); unexpectedly charming. an upmarket choice, beats most nearby bistros. visibly enjoyable by locals. little need to go beyond the daily menu, impressive presentation of food.; my girlfriend and i visited today and had an amazing experience. the food was great and our server, max, was incredibly friendly. we were the only tourists there (which is always a good sign), but max's english was great! the food was delicious too. my girlfriend had the wild white fish and i had the beef w/ potatoes and both were absolutely amazing. prices are very reasonable and the outdoor seating was super enjoyable. if i was from around here i would come back often.; a small family run restaurant with maybe the best service i’ve ever had in paris. kind and generous, willing to explain the dishes in english and when the waiter didn’t know how to explain it, he went in back and came back with the answer. i had the scallops with leeks and a spicy sauce. the scallops were perfectly cooked. i love leeks, and you just don’t get them fresh and plentiful like this in the u.s. the wine pour was more than i paid for. i was allowed to take my bottle of water back to the hotel even though it’s supposed to stay to be recycled. all around a wonderful evening even though i was dining alone.

name: Café Restaurant L’Arrosoir
