reviews: quite big portion for regular asian. for me the dish is better with a bit of salt and pepper. 1 salad and 1 steak should be fine for 2 person. they offer free drinking water.; lovely place under the arches of the promenade plantee. good value, very friendly service and lovely food. the fried goats cheese is amazing. and so is the crème camarel!; excellent place to sit on the patio and enjoy a fantastic meal. started with croque-monsieur on brushetta followed by a salad cesar and croque-monsieur, salad. all with a paname barge du canal ipa to wash it down.; very pleasant staff. good location. nice vibe. bad food. it was unfortunately most unpleasant. avoid unless you're starving.; very nice place to eat. food here is very fresh and good quality. very good selection deserts and wine. definitely worth to step in and try.

name: L'Alchimiste
reviews:
stumbled on this quaint family owned restaurant. total about 22 people. very warm and cosy ambience. good service from the owner. very reasonable prices as well. entree and desert 20 euro only. large portion! more like american sized ! thought the french are very little ? had the duck confit and veal. with white and red wine. very tasty. the duck was heavenly. the veal a tad salty but still very delicious. and the desserts were  splendid as well. worth a trip.; this cozy, rustic restaurant tucked away in the corner of a street has always caught my eye, being consistently packed during lunch and dinner hours. after living in the neighborhood for years, i finally had the chance to try it.

be sure to come hungry, as the portions are generous. the complementary appetizer was intriguing, with flavors we couldn’t quite place. i highly recommend the pastilla de confit de canard – a delightful balance of sweet and savory with an interesting mix of textures. for something lighter, go for the croustillant au cantal.

the molten chocolate cake was a standout – dense, rich, and not overly sweet. the roasted apples served as a perfect palate cleanser with their slight acidity, ideal for those without a sweet tooth. the apple tart, more akin to an apple cake, was also delicious and not too sweet. lastly we also got to try the poched pear cream with chocolate – it was my favourite out of all 3 desserts!

given the reasonable prices (20€ for a menu, 5€ for a glass of wine), the generous portions, and the quality of the dishes, i highly recommend this spot!; this is a small quaint french restaurant with a chalkboard menu.  my duck was chopped up and served in a fried duck fat package with date, pistachio, and honey flavors.  served with a big green salad on the side, and a vegetable pate to dip the bread in.  dessert was a delicious warm chocolate lava cake.; back in my home country for a few days i was craving real french food. i was not disappointed. delicious generous portion and super friendly staff.

the cantal crisp brick roll with écrevisses (craifish) and scallops (coquilles st jacques) and ratatouille (the real one, not the disney one 😉) was delicious.

the cooked apple with violet liqueur, cassis (berry) sauce and chocolate sauce was perfectly balanced

for both of those, an offered peas/carrot/mint/basil dip, a glass of rose, and of course an espresso it s only 26 euros !; low-key dining room in an unassuming neighborhood. the food exceeded expectations. the duck was amazing. one of the best meals i have had.

name: Bistrot de la Gare
reviews: found another restaurant near the station.  we were seated right away even though it was a bit crowded.  waiter and staff were all attentive and friendly.  we ordered the beef bourguignon and coquillettes à la crème de truffe.  both lacked flavor in my opinion.  dessert was great!; breakfast was tasty and we had the best view. in the morning they are short in personnel so it was a slow service. i would come back many times, but if you are in a rush choose something faster.; we went there for dinner after seeing the city all day. we were seated quickly since the place was not crowded. the server was very friendly throughout our meal. i had the beef bourguignon and my friend had the beef tartare. my friend enjoyed his entree. my meal was good in portions but lacked flavor. i expected it to have more taste but lacked it all together. the desserts were decent. i did order a port wine with my dessert but it never showed up. i'm glad i checked my bill before paying because they charged me for the port wine. i pointed it out to the server and they took it off the bill. overall was an ok place for a meal.; beautiful classical french restaurant. fried fish, chicken and onion soup was our meal. excellent quality and decent value for money given its location.; the atmosphere was nice, but unfortunately the service was slow. we were here the night before and had loved the food. when we returned the next day it was all a disaster, cold food, slow service, they forgot about us even when it was time to settle the bill. i recommend only going after 9pm.

name: La Bodega 64
reviews:
we went there a week ago for a friends birthday (group of 10). the food is great especially the jamon croquetas and the pain perdu. the sangria was good too. unlike most spanish restaurants i do not recommend the house wine. we didn’t like it. we had a great time but the only reason why i didn’t give it a 5 stars is before they kicked us out 30 min before closing time even if on google maps says they close at 1am on fridays. the waiter was nice and accommodating but the waitress a bit rude. finally parking is super difficult at night. overall great time. i will come back for sure.; good spot for tapas and drinks. good price at about €21 for 4 kinds of tapas(the servings were generous). they also have good hh deals but only on weekdays.; super friendly staff. delicious beer! i can absolutely recommend this place. awesome!; lovely little tapas place with an amazing service and great food. we mistook serrano for peppers (as pescetarians) when ordering pan con tomate and were surprised when we got ham served. luckily the staff was so kind and let us order something else. they actually took care of our concern.

quality to price ratio is fair. combining this with the gray customer service we will definitely come back again when visiting paris.

recommend!; sweet staff. great tapas 👌🏽

name: Dixième Degré
reviews:
overall: good atmosphere even though you can feel the owners (assuming they are) stressed when people come in. food was ok

good: good flavoured rum (rhum arrangé). food looks really on the plate and is kind of good too.

bad: be ready to be pushed out after 8pm if you don't plan to eat in. it can be understood but not really appreciated when you are still drinking with friends. stressed from the people working in it when people start getting in; this is a fun-looking restaurant with excellent food and drinks. it was a rainy night when we stopped in so it was a little busy, but the staff did a great job keeping everyone happy. we split the brick de legumes and the veggie burger and it was more than enough for two people. the decorations inside are super fun, and make sure to check out the handwashing station outside the toilets:); amazing food, local wine and the nicest and sweetest owners i have ever met; super cool space - stunning collage work cover entire interior - beautiful art!
love it here.; fun neighborhood spot with great food and friendly service.

name: Dame Tartine
reviews:
we came across this place totally by chance but what a find. people are incredibly nice, welcoming. the food, homemade, is really good and the meat was excellent. although area is very touristic, it is the exception and it feels like a local restaurant. every time we went, most customers were french people which is a great sign. the terrasse experience is really nice; the food was great. i had the veal steak with mashed potatoes and it was awesome. kids had the beef steak and loved it. honestly can’t remember my wife dish name but looked great!
the staff were super friendly and spoke fluent english.; i ordered a beef steak and was surprised when they brought a medium rare. by default in every restaurant i've ever been it's medium.

medium rare is still smth that i eat but it was unevenly fried and a half of the steak was completely raw. although i was very hungry raw is not what i can eat.

the waitress didn't even bother to ask why i didn't finish my steak. overall she looked tired, unhappy and at the same time busy - she was the only one to serve all the tables. it wasn't a peak hour and only about third of the tables is not less were occupied.; great place with great food. i had the sea bass and a huge portion of profiteroles for dessert. so good.
the place is heaving with people in the evening, it’s got a very youthful vibe and i like that.
great selection of drinks too.; awful service, the guy was rude to customers and slammed our glasses when serving them to us.
not to mention when my friend asked for the bill he loudly said that he should go inside to pay while shaking his head.
do not recommend unless you’re a big fan of cheese and rude people.

name: Union Square
reviews:
we dined at union square and opted for the formula from the menu. the portions were generous, the food was delicious, and the prices were affordable. the staff were very nice and attentive, making our experience even more enjoyable.; the waitresses are friendly several of them greeted us, the place is on the corner you can spot it right away, they have big space outside & inside. the food was nice 8.5/10, we ordered the formule menu of appetizer + main + dessert. the appetizers which were baked egg & escargot were ok, the steak & dessert were nice. the best thing is that it’s not expensive compared to other restaurants.; the food is delicious and for a great price!

if you go for lunch you have the option of a menu that is 13.90€. it includes a starter, plate and a dessert.

the french onion soup was flavourful and hot. the beef stew was the best, i would recommend this. i had the chocolate cake for dessert and it was gooey on the inside and warm.

great value for your money. i would highly recommend checking this place out!; nice place, good vibe! acceptable food.  but do not use the external battery for your phone from lye from this location, they are rubbish!  not charging!!!! after more about one  hour my phone has 18% battery and i have paid  6 euros!  even the staff told me that the price in 1 euro per hour!!!!!   i have asked for o real phone charger, they did not gave me.  for this reason i will provide 1 star!!!  be smart, bring your phone charger or external battery!!! come to romania where you will find by your own what the true kindness  is!; came there for a menu dinner. it was the best option in the neighbourhood. good onion soup, the best meat i tried in paris and the perfect chocolate fondant

name: Le Café Parisien
reviews: had a long day and a delayed flight to paris, and found this place still open until late. ordered steak, very nice. people are friendly and kind. great place and would definitely visit again.; we were there for breakfast and happy about the portion and quality of the food served. we did buy a small box of fruit from the nearby market. we asked for the permission to wash and consume in the restaurant. the wonderful lady that served us washed thoroughly for us. we appreciate a lot for her kind gesture.; charming man taught us what "tartar" means. god bless him for his patience and kindness! the food was delicious and the music was great. 🔥; we had a great experience here. super friendly and inviting from the start. this appears to be a local spot, as we seemed to be the only tourist at lunch, which is a great sign. we had the parisienne burger, the croque monsieur, and a bottle of white wine. the burger was the best i’ve eaten in a long time. somehow the delicious sautéed onions stole the show, but the cheese and bacon were great as well. if you are in the latin quarter you need to definitely visit here.; food is good but service is really slow. prices are average. they have wifi

name: Food Society Paris
reviews:
ordered the mozzarella pesto crepe. it was very tasty and the salad was fresh. would definitely go again!

the place is very cool and well air conditioned.; great concept and ideas. similar to usa food court. i like the concept where you can order everything from different foods kiosk in a single order. when done, you can go pick up your food. price is good. food is ok, so don’t expect typical gourmet food like in paris.; very cool food court with many different cuisines and food options, including coffee, ice cream, and alcohol. you can order on your phone using a qr or, pro tip, you can order at the main bar in the center of the space if you rather order through a person and not create an online account (which you need to order on your phone). highly recommend if you are in the area!; soirée champions league. it’s perfect to watch football matches and have variety of food and drinks.

i ordered a burger and hot dog from “burger society”. it was not bad but it can be better. the prices are very reasonable.

i recommend it to watch football games but not to have exceptional food.; 🎉 absolutely thrilled with my experience at food society! what a fantastic concept! 🙌 the setup where you navigate between different food stands works seamlessly. the app for ordering food is a game-changer - super quick and efficient. the staff are friendly and helpful, which is always appreciated. the only downside is that the central bar can be a bit slow. now, let's talk about the decor - industrial vibes all the way! it's refreshing to find such innovative spots in paris. major applause! 🏭👏 opted for the chicken dish, and it was excellent - no complaints there. overall, a new spot with a fresh atmosphere, and i'm absolutely loving it! can't wait to go back for more! 🍗😍

name: Cozy Factory ( poke bowls & sandwich)
formatted_address: 36 Rue Saint-André des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
the poké was very fresh. i liked the portion size also. the staff was very friendly and patient. you can ask for the wifi code to save some data when visiting around paris. they also have a restroom too. which is a nice addition for a small place. nice place to rest when walking around paris.; good poke restaurant, fresh products,  good service
prices are correct: from 9.90 euros
two sizes : l or xl
you can make your bowl as well choosing the size; great food and good service! not so nice to sit because it‘s a small place; lovely place to eat! great service, friendly staff, so willing to help us even though we don't speak french very well. the food was delicious, very fresh and a lot of choice. also the name fits well: cozy and pretty interior. would definitely visit again!; very cozy place with nice and fresh food
recommended for a quick lunch

name: Vagenende
reviews: we love this place both for the food and the gorgeous art nouveau interior. service is friendly as well.  the veal steak on a bed of risotto was the highlight of our visit last night. will definitely return.; truly wonderful traditional french dishes in a beautifully detailed interior of some 120+ years. a historical building. the tapanade was the best we've ever had,  the onion soup was delicious as was the caesar salad and frites. the champagne was excellent. and most of all the staff were absolutely delightful. we'll be back our on return trip to paris!; amazing experience for our birthday. we were served champagne at the beginning of our service. we ordered the oysters and magret de canard and agneau. i didn't know what wine to pick so they sent me the sommelier who offered me something and we got a bottle of white wine "mercury" it was delicious. everything was so well prepared and tasty and the service was amazing. we felt very special and welcomed during our stay and will be back again.; came for lunch, service was impeccable! had a 3 course lunch of oysters, the french liver with mash and the cafe gourmand. with a side of a st germain spritz. all were really lovely. service as a solo diner was great.; traditional brasserie in paris 6th district. the decoration and ambiance cannot be more parisian. the food is very classic and you can find delicacies that most restaurants don’t serve anymore like the “quenelles de brochet soufflées, sauce nantua” that are deliciously heavy and tasty. tartare, choucroute, duck, and beef marrow are all specialties. they have a very good wine list and service is attentive.

name: Extra Life Café
reviews: this place is unsafe and anti-queer. they were grossly showing off harry potter merch, making it clear they do not want people to feel safe here. avoid this cafe; my husband and i found the extra life café on a recent trip to paris and i'm so glad we did. the selection of new and retro games was amazing. the staff are friendly and really know their stuff. great value, and they have every mario, street fighter and tekken game imaginable.; this spot is in a really cool neighborhood tucked away off the main drag. the staff is so friendly and helpful. they boast 85 milkshake flavors and have a basement full of classic video game consoles. my daughter was over the moon and we felt comfortable and welcome.; had a great couple of hours here playing video games with my son. the staff were so friendly/ helpful explaining how it all worked, and spoke great english too. tasty milkshakes. perfect break from sightseeing!!!!; a lot of arcade games, manga, cool place to visit!

name: DICE Caffè
vicinity: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue du Pas de la Mule, 75004 Paris, France
reviews:
this place is a hidden gem next to more well known restaurants. we were lucky enough to walk in, unlike most other spots in the area. the service is amazing and the food is incredible. it’s a small menu, but it’s perfect for a date night. the ambiance is superb. i would totally recommend this place to everyone, but we don’t want it to get overrun like everything else in this neighborhood. go here before it gets too famous.; it was really nice lunch with two of my friends. healthy and light, and i loved that there are selected menu for a few days. i have issues with choosing the menu, but there were not too many options, so it was easier. i had the haddock fish with aubergine caviar, and it was really tasty and good portion than it seemed. the place was cute and the staff was nice. i'd like to come back :); had a great customer experience. simple, tasteful menu. good food, wine selection and friendly atmosphere. i'll be back!; 4,9/5
excellent ! excellent ! excellent !
wandering the streets looking for a nice address, we found this cozy joint next to place des vosges, with a sunday brunch menu !
very nice and not-cramped restaurant, few tables with spacious seating, wood decor, simple and heartwarming !
the owner (diego) is a super friendly italian from parma, he handles the bar, his wife is the kitchen boss (super friendly as well, graced me with the honour of best client of the week ;)
we tried the 3 brunch main courses, and they were all 3 delicious !
eggs with salmon, potato galette with cream cheese.
my favourite was the bun with mozzarella and coppa di parma ; incredibly tasty
and the 3rd and most original was pupkin pancakes with cheese, topped with beets and salad !
simple, tasty, and copious !
their juices were really good too ; i tried the refreshing apple, cucumber, lemon shake !
a must try address, e !ven if to grab a simple coffee.; a lovely place. we stumbled upon it for lunch and for 23 eur had a 3 course menu with generous portions. the food is delicious and the staff lovely. the place is also nicely decorated and definitely worth a visit :)

name: Café Hugo
reviews:
one of my favorite traditional restaurant in the area

always nice stuff

everything tasty

tartar strongly recommend; food was very good - loved the grilled vegetables w/ tapenade, hummus & babaganooh  - also abacadp toast with salmon🥰; this cafe was in my paris trip itinerary, and i’m glad i went. the decor is amazing, food and service is great. the location is the best, i had breakfast here before walking to the vintage shops in marais. you’ll also get the view of place des vosges. i recommend visiting this area and cafe for sure!; ate brunch at this cafe twice last week. excellent food, classic cafe table service in a stunning pre-revolutionary palace arcade on the border of the 3rd and 4th districts. there are several breakfast options which are a better value than a la carte  (these are referred to as 'formules'), for instance a freshly squeezed fruit juice, hot drink - coffee or hot chocolate and choice of pastry for under €10. there is a more extensive brunch option available including avocado toast and scrambled eggs. not the cheapest place around to eat breakfast but a spot with character and romance (we met a korean couple at breakfast on their honeymoon).; a really lively bar / bistro right on the place des vosges.  food was great, (and reasonably priced) although not a massive choice.  very busy, great for people watching.

name: Funzy Café
reviews:
the place doesn’t look super nice but the it is great and alexandre is hosting very well all the guests. nice parisian atmosphere.
we came back again in july 2019, a year after our first visit, and still very good. thank you alexandre!; best quiche in my whole life! merci beaucoup :); the authentic french bistrot.; cozy place, nice coffee, extremely pleasant service; funny funzy

name: KANASUK - Restaurant Créole & Rhumerie
reviews:
super friendly service, extremely tasty, slightly spicy food - it really tastes special, not the average "exotic" stuff. and reasonable prices. i'll be back😁 soon.; particularly found the avocado and cod fritter appetizer and eggplant dish quite delicious.; gourmet and comforting cuisine, faithful to caribbean flavors. a friendly restaurant team and a wide selection of rums reinforce the whole, with the addition of a super pleasant terrace, a rare privilege in the neighborhood.

all in all, one of the best spots for this style of cooking in paris, with a very reasonable bill.
well done to the whole team and thanks to kenny for his rum suggestions.; it’s excellent!
fresh, hearty and flavorful dishes.
great value for money.
the location is very nice opposite the swimming pool in a pedestrian street.
the service is relaxed, smiling and very professional.
not to be missed at the butte aux cailles!; restaurant that smells of sun and islands.  friendly welcome, fast service.  the dishes are very good, original and in sufficient quantity. be careful with the spices, it's awesome! the drinks are also original and sunny. the neighborhood is quiet and clean.

name: PÂTES THAÏ - Restaurant Thaïlandais à la Place d'Italie
reviews:
hello, fellow traveler! upon our arrival in paris, we tried to find a spot for a delightful meal. after much exploration, we settled on pates thai, drawn in by its positive ratings and reviews. the praise for this place, particularly its food, was absolutely warranted. you simply must experience their dinner menu. here are the details:

pros:
- the taste is both unique and amazing. (especially main meals were one of best.)
- the menu is satisfying, offering a variety of options. (a little bit hard to understand or predict tastes :), but it is a good thing.)
- the staff is attentive and friendly.
- the place is very clean and well-maintained.

cons:
- the interior design could use some improvement to make it more cool.; amazing food! so delicious. and the service was great.  even had free tap water. i really appreciated that. the portions weren’t very large, we had a long day and were very hungry so we have to eat more afterwards but for a normal dinner it would be perfect.; delicious thai food. good prices. friendly bilingual staff. great music.; good honest delicious thai food. nice menu deals. friendly service.

not a hip or trendy spot but perfect for a good quick meal.; the service is slow. only 1 waiter to do drinks and food order. need more waiters for faster service. food was flavoursome and loveky

name: Il était un square
reviews:
everything was delicious. highly recommend egg mayonnaise and goat cheese salad as starter, followed by steak tartar and a hamburger.

better to make a reservation, because it was full when we arrived and the owner was kind enough to helping us find a table outside.; the cheddar burger is next level, clocked medium rare just perfect! we tried also the hungarian tartar and was delicious, people and atmosphere are super nice! 5*; stumbled on this place by accident on the internet.  i nooked it as was more towards east of city so great place to stop if going in city from disney.  its kinda out of town, and we parked nearby. i was a little nervous that we would be the only people on a tuesday evening, but when i got in there, it was fully booked.
it's super casual but awesome food. my wife and i shared a burger and a salmon tarta, and kids had burgers. the cheff clearly had a love for cheese, and developing tastes at the food was fantastic.  if you want fine dining, this is not for you, but great burgers and food in a casual atmosphere is for you.  the staff are super cool and speak english.  book, and loads of nearby parking...
my photos are rubbish, but the ones on their website are a true reflection; my absolute favorite tartare place in paris! went there twice in june 2024. had different tartare creations. both were really nice. the meat was so fresh. would keep coming back every time i visit paris. the service was great. the staff were cool.; many images already but here you have another one of the roman. it was very good but what stood out for me were the atmosphere and service. the guys were so casual, helpful and fast in delivering our food. very very good value for the money, can’t wait to come back. also notice the reserve button in google and use it, they are fast at confirming that also.

you have a great business there, congratulations and vest wishes to you all.

name: La Table des Copains - Cuisine Française
vicinity: 16 Rue de la Grande Chaumière, Paris
formatted_address: 16 Rue de la Grande Chaumière, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
this is my first 1 star review but i can’t lie. we started off well where the young gentleman was kind enough to explain the menu in english as it was only in french.

we settled on  the zucchini courgettes and tuna carpaccio.

courgettes were nearly burnt but we didn’t complain.  tuna was yummy.

my husband had the lobster roll, which, in the midst on my disaster, i forgot to taste.

i ordered the hanger steak. (bavette).

i am a meat person and love meat.

this meat smelt like it had gone bad.  i tasted it and thought it might smell bad  because it’s not wagu, but next bite and my fingers smelt like dead meat.  it tasted bitter, so i stopped eating.

i politely asked the waiter if the meat was fresh.  both he and the female said yes, and called away and didn’t ask if i am ok.

the meat was left as is and at the end, they asked if i enjoyed my non eaten meal and i replied ,no.

the waiter said he would tell chef and brought the bill.

both hubby (had an ounce), and i felt unwell that night. so disappointed with the service  and care factor zero i received.

we walked across to the dome cafe and had the yummiest milllefeux to make up for the no dinner.

apologies as i know it’s a small business. but customers do matter.; we all really enjoyed our diner at la table des copains. ceviche was great as a starter. we then all had the dorade fish as the main course. cant wait to go back and try their burger. i highly recommend.; the waiters and the chef went out of their way to accommodate all the dietary challenges of the table, and there were quite a few! they were very patient and supportive. the cooking is definitely leaning towards the “brasserie” style, but with a good degree of invention and personalization. a good experience!; thought the food was just ok, a bit expensive. didnt realize the toast appetizer would be cold. meat was great. octopus was good but not as warm as potatoes. dish lacked balance imo. service was quite nice.; disclaimer: review as italian visiting paris.
i have a mixed feeling about this restaurant. for sure a lovely, cozy atmosphere. great preparation for the dishes. of what i tried, the slow cooked meat was great, a bit less so the fried zucchini, which lacked taste, and the profiteroles, a bit odd revisitation in my opinion. service friendly but they seem understaffed so it’s hard to grab their attention. paper napkins and forcing to reuse the same cutlery between appetizers and main dishes felt a bit out of place compared to the level of preparation of the dishes.

name: Les Baux de Paris
reviews:
stumbled upon this little gem during our stay in paris. the food, service and atmosphere was excellent and the prices quite reasonable. we had theboeuf bourguignon, which tasted so good. the restaurant had a romantic feel to it and had a live piano player to help set the mood. staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions. highly recommend.; food was decent, not very expensive.
the starter had some sweet elements in it, which i don't like. but that's my fault for ordering something without knowing what it was. the chicken was very good. i think they gave the rice with chicken specially for me, it's not part of their usual order. so, i was delighted.

interiors are very pretty. and location is great too, the outside street is very nice. the staff is very cordial and polite, and the service was amazing.; the food is perfect. the staff are all friendly. wonderful beef filet! this is our last lunch in paris and we went there with some large luggage cases. the staff gave us a lot of support. when we pay for the bill the staff forgot the folk discount but it was perfectly solved immediately when we reminded him. great! it deserves high recommendation!; had the escargot, the beef rossini with fois gras, the grilled octopus with peppers, the zucchini fritters, the greek salad, and the bruschetta with goat cheese, figs, and walnuts. everything was delicious! very good presentation as well, the greek salad was especially beautiful to look at. staff was super friendly. it was raining and we didn’t have an umbrella, we walked in before the restaurant appeared to be open, but they allowed us to sit inside while we waited for everything to get going. excellent food, excellent service, cute restaurant. highly recommend.; an amazing restaurant, the owner is a very nice and kind man, the food is delicious! definitely worth visiting, this place created a great experience of our time in paris ❤️

name: Les Quatre Saisons
reviews: the best fruit in town and at excellent prices

name: Le Jardin des Pâtes
reviews:
well located by the jardin des plantes, this italian restaurant serves creative fresh home made pastas dishes. 👌 it's pretty tasty and good value for money. 😊; they run out of homemade pastas and have me corkscrew pastas. without mentioning it.
the taste of the dish was innovative but not refined. still i appreciate they're exploring.; a 3.5 to 4-star good local restaurant, with freshly made food. unfortunately, the dishes were nothing to write home about. my veggie pasta was tasty but slightly overcooked & the sauce was a bit on the lighter side, and my friend's salmon barley pasta was ok but a bit too bland. good thing is that the food came very fast. slightly disappointing also is that, arriving at 7pm and leaving at 8.30pm the restaurant was still relatively empty (30-40% occupancy only).  that was a wednesday evening. is it a good or a bad sign?; i got salmon pasta, goat cheese, french cola and coffee. i paid 31 euros total. prices are good, portions are large for paris standards and food was delicious. first time i tried french cola and i like it. pasta was fresh and good quality. service is also really good. employees know english.; the restaurant is cozy.
it is recommended to shares the dishes, as it allows you to try different types of homemade pasta at once, just like we did.
all of the three dishes were delightful and delicious.

name: Chez Taeko
vicinity: Marché des Enfants-Rouges, 37 Rue Charlot, Paris
formatted_address: Marché des Enfants-Rouges, 37 Rue Charlot, 75003 Paris, France
reviews:
food stall located in the marche des enfants rouges. we stopped on a whim while exploring the market and i had one of my favorite meals during my stay in paris. they have many options of bowls and bento boxes. we ordered the bbq pork special and it was absolutely delicious. it’s a busy spot at lunch but service was quiet and nice and the busyness is all part of the atmosphere. i hope to come back one day!; i tryed the bento karaage as you can see in the pictures . the chicken was really tasty and juicy . i recommend trying this dish at chez taeko’s kiosk if you pass by the marché des enfants rouges .; always a pleasure and a great experience eating at chez taeko or getting food to go. it’s super flavourful. the agedashi tofu has the perfect texture between crispy outside and soft inside. the fish is fresh for the maki. the sushi rice is sometimes a little warm and soft, though. portions to price ratio is well done. the staff is very efficient.; ordered the wrong thing! didn’t very much enjoy the donburi chicken teryaki, it was served in a patty form with really huge bits of garlic/onions- i personally don’t like the huge chunks…

although, i tried my mom’s bento ebi fry and jt was amazing! highly recommend- if you know the restaurant in the philippines called “yabu” it tastes just like it! staff is very kind, but slightly overpriced-; very delicious authentic japanese food the boss from tokyo. we had a great time there. arrived early to avoid crowds.

name: Cosi
vicinity: 5 Rue des Filles du Calvaire, Paris
formatted_address: 5 Rue des Filles du Calvaire, 75003 Paris, France
reviews:
delicious sandwiches for affordable prices. all of their desserts are delicious. we ate here multiple times during our trip to paris. great vegetarian options too, which was nice. dine in and takeaway options available.; my husband is a very picky eater and crowned the blt he had here as the best thing he has eaten in paris. the bread is very delicious and fresh, and the staff was exceptionally nice.; this is a great little place in paris. there are two of these, but i have only been to this one. the staff tells me that the owner is from new zealand, enjoys opera music and a lot more italian culture, so he does what all italian lovers do, and moves to paris.

the result is a gorgeous cafe with lovely staff, a lovely playlist, amazing fresh baked focaccia bread with fresh toppings. i had a tandoori turkey sandwich and the baby tomatoes were so fresh and sweet and complemented everything. €14.50 gets you one of their high end sandwiches, a drink, and the best crumble i've had in ages - with a little dollop of creme fraîche.

it's already fairly popular so i doubt i'm doing anyone a favour here but it's lovely and a place with a genuine personal touch to what the business is all about, and with all the trendy places popping up all the time, it's great to see a place with just as much cool, but also it's own personality. i hope it continues to do well.; excellent experience.  i tried a sandwich, the combinations are very original and the bread is incredible 😍.  special mention to william and magaly who gave us a very warm welcome.  i can't wait to come back 😀; i came to paris for a month and tried a lot of different restaurants, but found myself coming back to cosi again and again. their bread is freshly baked onsite. all the desserts are great. the inés and the tom dooley sandwich’s are amazing! the staff was super helpful and the food was prepared quickly. i highly recommend cosi!

name: Les Petits Pois
reviews:
had a wonderful dinner with my wife! the place is fantastic, enjoyable, just perfect!
food was delicious. i was amazed that food menu is changed often, i like that! service was also top-notch!
for the price, it is very affordable per person.

cheers from croatia!; my wife and i had a wonderful experience at dinner here. the atmosphere is perfect - cozy, inviting, chic, and all around well executed. the service was top notch, our server even translated the entire menu for us and continued the hospitality by being exceptionally attentive. the food was delicious, desirably unique, and reasonably priced. cannot recommend enough.; a lovely restaurant with a very welcoming owner, we were very lucky to get a table for a family of four on a thursday night without a reservation, but the owner was very accommodating moving tables around to fit us. the food was incredibly good, a small menu but all the food was fresh and cooked absolutely perfectly.  it looks like the menu changes regularly and serves seasonal produce. the service throughout the evening was outstanding with the owner taking the time to explain each dish to us in english (correcting our poor french and mistranslations) and helping us pick out a dish that our children would enjoy.  the food was served quickly despite it being a busy service and they even brought two wines for us to sample to help us decode which to choose.
i can't recommend this restaurant highly enough but makes sure to make a reservation in advance.; very delicious food and friendly stuff.😊 enjoyable experience.😊; friendly staff and cozy small restaurant just next to jardin des plantes.
good food.
3 course set lunch at €25.

name: Au Coin Bio
reviews:
very good home-cooked food, the dish of the day was bourboulon steak, well seasoned and tasty. the carrot quiche was also very good. prices a little high for the simple environment, but the experience of having lunch at the market was worth it.; a sweet little spot for a quick bite. quiche, salad and a glass of wine while watching the busy market.; deserves zero! we ordered two drinks. waited 20 minutes. i received my drink, which was wrong, sent it back and then was informed they didn’t have what i asked for (so eventually i picked something else). server poured my drink and left it on the counter while she continued to serve everyone else… eventually we left, the other drink we ordered was never even started. we waited about 35 minutes never got a drink. in that time another couple was served food, ate, and left (they got there after us). i have never felt more ignored in my life. just terrible.; amazing service (considering how busy they were with a great location of a terrace in the sun, they were so attentive, quick and kind!) and delicious food which apparently is from one of the shelves of veg sold at the market, all organic and delicious chicken!; rudest most unfriendly establishment we’ve encountered in paris.

we sat on the patio intending to order lunch.  we had just bought some fruit in the nearby market and i think they thought we were just intending to use their seating to eat it

we asked for a menu 3 times and tried to clearly indicate that we wanted to purchase lunch from them, but they just kept saying “impossible, you leave now”

embarrassed, we promptly exited.

if you want to experience stereotypical french rudeness, than this is the place for you.  otherwise, stay far, far away.

name: Le Petit Commines
reviews: amazing food and wine, impeccable service. all is fresh, much of it locally sourced. the menu changed daily. we made reservations for a second night!; a wonderful dining experience. the food was terrific - fresh, local, inventive and flavorful. the service was even better. eunice guided us through the menu and the wine selection with good humor and insight. the price was very reasonable. we will return.; delicious food, fish, fromage, desserts, everything was perfect. the staff is fantastic and the atmosphere of the restaurant is relax and pleasant. thank you for holding our booking and for delivering an amazing service even at 22pm. we will come back; we loved it and we absolutely recommend it. the service was amazing, very friendly staff eager to answer any questions we had. the food was incredible, what we think a proper french restaurant would serve. the kids were very happy and i recommend the snails. you should definitely come to this place. well done to the chef and staff.; staff was great took the time to explain to us menu in english helped us pick out our wines, very kind and friendly. food was excellent! had duck and aged ribeye

name: Oh! Happy-Paris. Le sens de la fête
reviews:
very nice place. a hitten juvel, if you are with your friends, and want to experience some real french culture.; very nice place, with good food, good music and possibility to experience the french culture🇫🇷😊; super cool place to have party !; excellent night
stéphane is the best ❤️; yeaaaaaaaaaaaaaah !!!!! hot

name: Rush Bar
reviews:
good spot in semi-secluded area but close to “action” areas. concerts quite often. 2 big screens allowing to follow 2 different matches.  good guinness well drafted and delicious burgers. good general cleanness. good general mood and vibes.; this place was our local for nearly 2 weeks during the rugby world cup. great bar, brilliant for rugby, friendly and efficient staff (even matt!), really delicious food (especially the slow-cooked pulled pork burger!), and they can _nearly_ pull a decent pint of guinness every time 😉(only joking, the guinness was delicious)! fabien is a great host and the bar will be our go-to whenever we get back to paris!

"wilbur's fireside chats" has some great music on monday's open-mic nights!

does tend to get a bit crowded when france are playing in rugby world cup quarter finals (get in early before big matches!) and we noticed some freeloaders not even buying food or drink, just watching the match, if you can believe it! :astonished:; a fine boozer. magnet for colorful characters from across the globe. shows the football. i’m told it’s a former lfc paris haunt but the supporters were too rowdy and asked to leave.; rush bar, tucked away in a charming corner of paris' 11th arrondissement, is a hidden gem that exudes a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. this bar is more than just a place to grab a drink; it's a community hub where regulars and newcomers alike feel right at home.

one of the standout features of rush bar is its exceptional staff. xavier, known affectionately as "the extraordinaire," brings a unique flair to the bar with his charisma and exceptional service. lauren, described as "the gem," is a beacon of warmth and friendliness, making every patron feel special. james, "the solid american," adds a touch of familiarity and reliability that is comforting to both expatriates and locals. fabien, the owner, has cultivated an atmosphere that feels like a second home. his dedication to the bar and its patrons is evident in every detail. and then there's millie, often referred to as "the queen," who rules the space with grace and charm, ensuring every visit is memorable.

the regulars at rush bar are a significant part of its charm. they contribute to an atmosphere that is convivial and full of life. the sense of community is palpable, making the bar not just a place to drink, but a place to connect and share stories.

overall, rush bar in the 11th arrondissement is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience genuine parisian hospitality. with its extraordinary staff and exceptional regulars, it offers an experience that is both unique and unforgettable.; this is my happy place! the food is amazing, considering it’s a pub — all fresh, not frozen. the staff is genial. the atmosphere is magical!

name: Au Petit Bar
reviews:
the food was really good. i would recommend their pastas. it was clean and good looking on the inside. my only complaint would be the wait time. it was on the longer side even on a calmer day. other than that i would recommend this resturant to pretty much anyone that comes by.; i only had drinks, but they were delicious, and the service was excellent.; we enjoyed many drinks at la petite bar during our stay in paris. everyone was so welcoming and accommodating, even for our big rowdy group.

we really appreciated their kindness and hospitality. as well as the good beer, great espresso and massive breakfasts.; truly enjoy coming to this quaint place. beautiful wine and beautiful service. all i can say is that even if you are alone, this place is the perfect place for everyone. they have board games and the music will make you travel very far while having a drink or eating. the place is open late.; food and service is great! love the simple ambience. cozy and friendly.

name: Café d'Orléans
formatted_address: 43 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
they have very tasty breakfast, i ate mushroom omelette , croissant and tea which are very delicious.
the restaurant has a very good location and view.; worst experience ever!!! look at the photos, these are the presentation of dishes without even touching yet. the blanket de veau is half portion like some plate left from other table, the boeuf bourguignon has 2 small tiny pieces beef inside. the confit de duck is the only plate that look like a plate but super dry and no taste. all 3 plates are tasteless and the food is not fresh. it’s 7pm and busy hour, the whole restaurant only has one waiter and we waited long time to seat and to order and to pay the bill. will never go back again!!!; really liked this place! had very quick and friendly service from the moment we entered. the restaurant itself had a relaxed vibe so it was nice to sit and talk in whilst having lunch. the waiter that served us spoke in english and the menu itself had english translations. would recommend.; very nice experience for a brunch. the food is generous and delicious 😋; delicious old world french food. just touristy though with authentic service. delicious terrine and burgers with fries. the kids even loved the food. we had an excellent lunch al fresco after seeing the catacombs. highly recommend.

name: Déclic Café
reviews:
best burger i have had in a long time and worth the money. had a really bad day on the trains (read multiple cancellations) and needed somewhere to eat. passed by several other places but the vibe/atmosphere at this cafe was excellent, quiet, modern and welcoming. staff couldn't do enough to help, even spoke to me in english when they realised i knew very little french, and as i said at start of review i really enjoyed the food, i am very much considering going back when i pass back through paris in a few days; excellent service and food! very good portions! we tried the chicken and was amazing crispy. also the sweets were delicious!; if you haven't experienced déclic café, prepare to have your mind absolutely blown! this isn't just a café; it's a celestial paradise where every cup of coffee and every bite of food takes you on an interstellar journey. the moment you step inside, you're greeted by an ambiance so enchanting, it makes the most luxurious palaces seem like a distant memory.

now, let's talk about the stars of the show—suzette and shaka. suzette's charm is so infectious, it's like she sprinkles a bit of magic into everything she touches. her service is beyond impeccable, transforming a simple coffee run into a red-carpet event. she remembers your name, your favorite order, and even the way you like your coffee perfectly frothy on top.

and then there's shaka. hailing all the way from el salvador, he’s nothing short of a coffee alchemist. shaka's expertise in brewing is so profound, it's as if he's channeling the very essence of el salvador’s rich coffee heritage into every cup. his espresso shots are so smooth, they could make the finest italian baristas weep with envy. watching him work is like witnessing a maestro conduct a symphony; every motion is pure artistry.

the food? don’t even get me started. their pastries are baked to such perfection, it's rumored that angels descend to have breakfast here. the burgers and salads are so fresh and flavorful, they redefine what it means to eat well.

in summary, déclic café is not just a place to grab a coffee; it’s a life-altering adventure. suzette and shaka create an experience so extraordinary, it makes you believe in magic. five stars? this café deserves an entire galaxy!; pretty human and warmth place to stop for a hot wine with a slice of orange (vino navegado en chile o queimada en españa) ohhh my...in the cold winter time... plus some great creations from the kitchen for you and your family around very wild decorations and the service was fantastic...for us first timers our service was super friendly and helpfully with me poor french, it is a must stop if you are around; pub style food with many drink options. food was average, cocktails were ok. nice place to sit for a drink and watch sports.

name: Les Mauvais Joueurs Austerlitz, bar à jeux
reviews:
very nice place to be and play. the staff is very nice and helpful. the beer was good as well !; it’s great, we had a great birthday evening! the staff is very friendly, lots of games and we had a lot of fun. there is plenty of space which allows you to have fun doing mimes and etc. i highly recommend this bar, which is also well located.; large games room with unlimited board games with friends. there is table football and billiards. unlike that of bastille (only boards) there are real savory dishes: pizza and burgers and cocktails, beers and other alcohols.
it's really cool with friends. there are 9 tables so don’t hesitate to book in advance!; we spent our saturday evening in the les bad players bar near the austerlitz station. booking was easy. the welcome was rather friendly. however, we were very disappointed not to have been accompanied spontaneously like in a real games bar. we had to ask for advice.
the food was okay, nothing more. unfortunately, we will not return, in favor of other bars which are keen to share their passion for games.; a spacious and quiet place with a large choice of games including billiards, table football and switch. the server is very friendly and attentive.
the food portions are very generous!!

name: Demilune
reviews:
an incredible selection of brands!! from big brands to small designers found only at demilune. i have dressed my two children there since they were born and also go there frequently to give lovely birth gifts!
quality, attentive and personalized service.; demilune, an institution in children's fashion... it is with immense pleasure to come there and to always have a warm and welcoming welcome. i have always found the best styles and trends there for mine or for a gift. a sure value in good taste. thank you to exist. a rare store worth the detour; this restaurant was recommended to me as it is famous for its snail dishes. it's small, but the service is friendly and the food is delicious. you can eat snails without any worries or unpleasant smell. the price was reasonable and not too expensive, so it was good value for money.; excellent personalized welcome
the products are of very good quality with completely consistent prices. i find happiness there for a baby but also for my teenager 😊 i recommend!!; sneakers on sale for €200 for children sold by staff as friendly as a prison door.
we live next door, i remember now why we never come.
go to bonpoint, we are well received.

name: Du Pareil Au Même
vicinity: 23, Passage de la Réale C.C. du Forum des Halles, Paris
formatted_address: 23, Passage de la Réale C.C. du Forum des Halles, 75001 Paris, France
reviews: very lovely sleeping clothes for a reasonable prices.; usually love their clothes but this shop has no fitting rooms!; excellent store! i have come several times to collect my orders placed on their site, and the saleswoman is always very friendly and smiling.; i visited on wednesday june 5, 2024 with my daughter, and the welcome was excellent. the manager and her two interns were all smiling and friendly. their attitude even made me want to join their team. well done, these are exactly the kind of salespeople we want to see!; very good store with two super nice salespeople who helped me find my favorite one for the class photo

name: Bonhomme De Bois - Paris Roquette
formatted_address: 19 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
reviews: a magical shop with high quality toys for affordable prices. my daughter loved playing with all the toys that were set out and we found several items we couldn’t leave without. great place for gifts or souvenirs for littles. the staff was super friendly as well.; great store with high quality toys - got my two year old nephew a tambu drum here and he loves it. we all love playing it too, so i know he’s going to use it for many years to come. definitely a great stop if you’re looking to pick up gifts for littles.; great kids shop. lots of great selection and the staff are really helpful; very nice, always find something here for my daughter; a very nice store with a wide, well-selected choice, without falling into the mass of toys that can be found everywhere. useful advice and gifts appreciated! thanks

name: DandelOO Jouets
vicinity: 11 Rue de la Folie Méricourt, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue de la Folie Méricourt, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
this is a small shop, so you don't get overwhelmed with choice. that being said, there is still a great choice, and toys are organised by age level. one stop and all my children's gifts were purchased and wrapped. friendly welcome.; excellent; i stopped by this store today where i found what i was looking for! lots of jellycats in all sections (food, animals etc...) i highly recommend this store, especially if you are looking for jellycat plush toys 😀 you will also be very well received, the manager is unparalleled in her kindness.🙏🏼; very nice toy shop. you certainly won't come here by chance since it specializes in jellycat plush toys: these little smiling fruits, vegetables and foods! the choice is substantial and the supply regular.
really very pleasant welcome.; i highly recommend this store, especially if you are looking for jelly cat plush toys! and you are very well received!

name: N+1
reviews:
cozy, small place. my service wasn't brilliant as we had to wait more than a hour for the main. entree was avocado toasts (very good) and we ordered multiple burgers; i got a duck breast one and it was excellent.; n+1 is a cosy restaurant that provides a delicious variety of plats/burgers/salads... the portions are good, the price is really fair considering it's in paris !
a must try; n+1 is a must try if you are at the zone.

the food is excellent with a beautiful presentation. it deserves the price you pay.

the atmosphere is really lo-fi and fine to talk. also the waiter is really nice.

très bien n+1! 🙌🏼; the food was not french style but it was good; great place, food was great
the waiter had several issue in comprehend each other while talking fluent french

name: Au Petit Village
reviews:
good service, staffs are friends, food is delicious especially the grilled meat (perfectly marinated and grilled) & the hot mint tea( really like it) bravo..; in love with this place! the food is fantastic, the portions are large, the staff is friendly. highly recommended .

p.s. try couscous; a mix of tourists and neighborhood folks made for an enjoyable atmosphere.
i had the beef filet and boulaouane wine. it was magnifique!
my companion had cous cous which was also very tasty
generous portions and super friendly and fun waiters. perfect way to end our week in paris
the complementary apple liqueur at the end was a special treat!  merci; a little neighborhood restaurant run by two cool brothers. great food and charming interior. there seem to be many regulars here and it's a nice spot to eat outside of the center of the city.; couscous dishes were fantastic - we went for the couscous royal but honestly the vegetarian couscous dish could have been enough! substantial portions, lots of flavour and the staff could not have been friendlier.

name: La Table de Colette
reviews:
this french restaurant in the heart of paris delivers an exceptional haute cuisine experience with a modern twist, all at a reasonable price. the surprise menu caters to all tastes, emphasizing regionality, sustainability, and offering excellent vegetarian and vegan options. a fine wine selection complements the meal, while the knowledgeable and friendly staff ensure a memorable evening.; good food, and i can tell they took care to prepare quality ingredients. i appreciated that they were able to make the meal vegan for me and remove pork for my sister. i have two complaints and it’s that some parts of the bread were burnt and the savory dishes were too salty. i liked that they let the ingredients shine, but the salt over powered some of the flavor of the  pea and parsnip.; incredible food and service! the food was creative and perfectly presented. the wine pairings and descriptions were very thoughtful.; to sum it up:fantastic service, good food! creative and sophisticated vegetarian (and of course carnivore) dishes. we visited in the evening and the waiter remembered the notes i gave for the reservation (e.g. congratulated my mother’s birthday as well which i noted we are coming in for). the food: it was good, tasty and thought-through - but it was missing an extra bit of something to make it great. the “wow” was missing. e.g. the second dessert was a vanilla and earl-grey infused cream with a strawberry on the side. tasted good but something i already had at an ice cream cafe before. we did not opt for the wine pairing which maybe would have made it a more wholesome experience. the service: fantastic! waiter and chefs are really welcoming and pay attention about your wellbeing. they present each course at the table and answer questions. if they are able to match the food to the standard of the service, i believe the michelin star would stand a lot stronger! nonetheless, a great evening!; very good restaurant, with options for menus, tasty food and good wines to go with them. i found the dishes creative and modern. the service was also pleasant and attentive, making our weekday 3 course lunch go by almost too quickly. was happy that they were able to change some ingredients based on preferences of one in our party, who really enjoyed the meal.
my only critique is that they add the option, and verbally emphasise, for a tip can be added when paying the bill with pre-selected options of percentages to choose from. this creates an expectation to tip, which is a practice i have only seen in tourist areas (been living in france for a decade, never seen a restaurant outside of a tourist area offer this option). however, this is totally unnecessary - tipping is not required in france as servers are paid a living wage and service is included already on the bill. if a person chooses, they leave a few euros - not 10-15% of an expensive bill. this extracts extra money from the client, who is already paying a lot for a nice meal (especially if it is a tourist who is also dealing with exchange rates!), and guilt for people who have to, in front of the server, choose no tip. for a high end restaurant, i am truly surprised at this practice given both the amount of money it represents and the ‘bad taste’ it could leave on the way out. thought about giving a lower star for this (i wish 4.5 was an option!), but i think its unfair to the rest of the experience - but wanted to note in hopes that the management reviews this unnecessary and counter-cultural practice.

name: Au Bon Coin
formatted_address: 21 Rue de la Collégiale, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
my daughter and i went to this place per google reviews. you guys didn’t disappoint us. the food was delicious and service was efficient and good. the stewed veal belly was so tender and flavorful. we took the leftover home and made a great pasta dish with the veal and sauce. the chicken in mushroom sauce was also great! i almost wanted to lick the plate clean.; this was the best meal we had in paris hands down. the atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the wait staff was so attentive, personable , charming and nice and the food was 10 out of 10! the prices as well were extremely reasonable for the incredible quality of the food.

we had the pigs ear salad and foie gras for starters both were above our expectations. the foie gras was grilled which was new my husband and i and this may be our favorite new way of having foie gras it was crispy but also melted in your mouth. for entrees i got the duck breast and it was the best i have ever had! it was cooked to perfection and had the most gorgeous sear on the skin, sitting beautifully in the center of a semi glaze sauce, the best word to describe it is succulent! i don't think any duck i have in the future will compare, which is why i'll have to come back to paris if only for this dish! the side i got was a pumpkin mash and it paired perfectly with the duck! my husband got a beef dish and it was spectacular as well, but he hailed my duck as king that night. for dessert my husband got a chocolate mouse which was rich and decadent. i got the floating island and the meringue just melted away in my mouth with the vanilla custard sauce and caramelly drizzle. i will forever be dreaming about this dessert as no dessert on the us will ever compare. everything form start to finish was phenomenal.

there is nothing that will stop me from ensuring i eat at this restaurant whenever i am in paris again! it was the highest of highlights. and to speak to how incredible it was, we met an archeologist when we first sat down who has been coming to paris for 15 years for work twice a year and he always eats at this restaurant because of how fantastic it is.

highly recommend!; a very nice dining experience overall (thanks to the wonderful staff), but some dishes could be improved. we loved the welcoming staff and speed of service, as well as the freshness of the dishes. for that alone, we could come back anytime. that being said, the risotto (fregola sarda risotto) was devoid of any taste at all (really bland) and the raviole (pasta) on the half salted cod filled was consistently undercooked. i sent it back once, but it came back identical (undercooked). mushy in the mouth and clearly not properly done - why innovate with pasta when the fish is so wonderfully done? the rest of the dishes were tasty and served with elegance (appetizers, snails "profiterole", gambas, deserts etc). at the end of the day, we hope to be back but will opt for more conservative "french" choices next time.; this place is a must! i’m from usa originally, but have traveled over 40 countries and currently live in brasil! i wanted traditional french food. my hotel recommended this place. i could not be any happier! mushrooms, veal, duck, wow, the wine. i might just come back to paris just to eat here again. servers were awesome also! spoke english well and really helpful! 10 stars if they would have let me; raw beef and duck foie gras taste great. veal was over cooked, cod was very fishy and bland. a bit underwhelming. friendly service

name: Bistrot La Grange - Restaurant Paris 5
reviews:
went in at ~1:45pm, so it was nice to find something open at that hour. two of us got the burger - omg it was delicious. one of the best burgers we've had. the other meals were also very, very delicious, as was the mousse for dessert. would definitely come back again. staff was all very friendly. come eat here!; had lunch here. the snails were delicious and the burgers and the magret were great. the prices are super reasonable.

i would definitely come back.; charming bistro just off the seine in paris that offers delicious food, good service and value.

we enjoyed a bottle of wine, a cheese board assortment and baguette slices while taking in the local beauty. then we enjoyed a chicken breast entree and a seared salmon with dill sauce over a tender pasta noodle 🍜 tre bien 💯; this place is divine. the dock was cooked well and the service was excellent. this was an amazing meal!; food was good in a fair price. order the steak tartare and loved it. their home made bread is also tasty.

name: JC's Kitchen
reviews:
an excellent address for lovers of good food, the couscous is fantastic. random opening however, reservation required. children's toys available for family outings.; the chef is very nice, a treat on the plate! do not come by car, the wine and drinks list is incredible.
only negative point: we know when we arrive, less when we leave.; despite the change of address, the owner has managed to keep the ingredients of his success. a little far from home unfortunately, i intend to obtain delivery in the provinces by dint of tanning it.; i was told it was great but i didn't taste it. the wine is pretty good, you have to get used to the humor of the owner; i knew the owner years ago, well before the opening and his reputation is up to par.

unfortunately too far away now, i am waiting for a delivery service to open.

name: comptoir de la gare
reviews:
a place of rejoicing with a typical "spanish inn" atmosphere, but only reserved for skilled linguists handling at least the verb of molière.
a breeding ground for all good discussions, the herdsman's well-deserved rest was made possible by the large and comfortable four-poster bed allocated to us.
to do again dqp.; incredible telecommuting location!
be careful of accidentally throwing nerf balls, it can hurt!
welcome always at the top and fridge always stocked with tasty dishes!; i went there on the advice of a friend, i spent an excellent evening there with a few friends who couldn't wait to go back. i highly recommend.
the only downside was that they brought me a cbd pizza even though i had asked for a 4 cheese...; very qualitative cuisine and warm atmosphere. the bosses received us very well! a must do!; very well located, kosher (uh, not expensive) and pleasant! a shared accommodation of good people who know how to welcome as it should 🤩

name: McDonald's
reviews:
i didn’t receive my order after 20min in “fast food” chain.
( order was only 3 items: french fries, juice, mcnuggets)

after 20min i went to the cashier and requested refund and cancelled order. they returned money faster than they provide service.; it's "food" that is relatively quicker to obtain than a real restaurant.  the orders are often wrong and resolving the missing or incorrect items is more tedious than it should be.  if not for a child's lack of taste it would be best to avoid.; excellent mcdonald’s! very clean, friendly staff, warm environment. i am visiting from canada so it was very nice to see a familiar eating place while visiting. i had a great experience and all of the workers were patient and friendly. will definitely be coming back during my vacation! :); happiness is having a tasty caramel sunday, reading my kindle, while resting between the long walks in paris.
having recharged my batteries (and my blood sugar level) i was ready for another multi-hours trek, towards le marais this time.
didn't see any mouse by the way ;-); i came in here to enjoy diner, first thing i see before even ordering is 2 mouses casually crawling on the floor under the chairs. we alerted the staff of the situation because this is scandalous !!
this issue needs to be addressed.

name: L'Apéro, Bar Restaurant à Montparnasse
reviews: great local spot buzzing with business folks and locals. good selection of wine, entrees (etc) and dessert. feels very local and food was good. i did learn that pinot noire in france is very different that in varietals in the i enjoyed my dish with poultry/mushrooms and the vanilla cream dessert. staff was very accomodating. i am gf and was able to find an entree and dessert that worked for me.; great service and super cheap draft beer! 👏; too cute also stuff are so friendly.; great place for a beer. full of young people at night. cheap.; super friendly staff. good vibes.

name: LE CONVIVIAL
reviews: so this was our go to spot while in paris. the food was really good and everyone was so welcoming and helpful. we don't really know alot of french words which made it hard at first but they were very patient and made it a great place to enjoy a meal. if you're in the area you should definitely check it out. very low key but full of flavor.; after ordering like 10 times, i finally made time to write a review about this great place. the pizza is great and the service is even more amazing! (my personal favorites are the "parma" and the "regina" if you want to give them a try); good location to to marriott.  staff was friendly and attentive. they get 5 stars.  we had pizza and it was just average.  we had a rainy night and wanted something close and this was perfect. just accept average food; not a very fancy place but we came just searching a place to eat on a saturday at 15h and the food was good, specially the penne borghese (i recommend). the service is good and it is located a bit away from the street, so it is relaxing as well. the terrace is a good dinner option on a summer evening.; just ordered a seafood pizza and carbonara takeaway. super delicious, price is amazing (20 e for both), owner is so kind...he added some extra seasonings and cheeses as i requested, would love to come back again.

name: Bistrot 13
reviews: great dining and exceptional service!!! food is amazing.; this is “the” place. khamel will make you feel like family and welcome from the moment you step in. i have been to bistro 13 multiple times now and is always a success. from  the algerian couscous to the salmon tartare or the snails, this place is excellent. inside, it has a large tv to watch live sports and is always opened late. a really good restaurant with excellent prices; the best bistrot in paris! service is just next level, i will definitely take one more meal next time when i will be in paris. unfortunately i had to decline shot offer, but not in next time 🌝; the food was really amazing, especially the couscous and the magret de canard. the service was quickly.; we are visiting from australia and wanted a truly french restaurant experience and we were not disappointed. the service was exceptional, the waiter was very accommodating with our poor french, the food delicious and the prices very reasonable.

name: L'Acanthe
reviews:
do not go my mom had the chicken risotto which had grey, chewy, bland pieces of chicken and the risotto itself was complete mush. the bread they gave was literally frozen in the centre. you could feel the temperature difference with your fingers. they took off the risotto but had the audacity to charge €9 for a water bottle. obscene restaurant there are so many better places to go in that area of paris; we dined here as a group of 4. we ordered four main courses. to start with, the portions are very small. the staff are nice and friendly, but sometimes they were pushy by offering their desserts. we even told them the portions were small, they said it they while were joking "it's to make sure you will keep enough space for desserts".

the food was fresh though, nothing bad about the taste, and the ambience of the restaurant is also friendly and welcoming. located in a busy street with other restaurants.

the waiter offered us free rum shots to compensate for the small portions. the prices are on the higher side of the spectrum.; i recently dined at l'acanthe, a charming french bistro fusion with italian, located near the louvre, and was thoroughly impressed with my experience. i ordered the french bistro steak and it did not disappoint. the steak was cooked to perfection - tender, juicy, and full of flavor. it was served with a side of oven potatoes and salad, which were equally delicious. my husband had the chicken risotto, which was very tasty too.

the atmosphere of the restaurant is warm and welcoming, with a cozy and intimate setting that's perfect for a romantic dinner or a casual meal with friends. the staff were friendly and attentive, providing excellent service throughout my meal. the prices are reasonable for the quality of the food and the experience, making it a great value for money.; we spent one night in paris and this restaurant was the perfect place to spend our evening. great atmosphere! superb service! the food was truly amazing! best duck breast i have ever had, melt in my mouth delicious. christopher really made us feel welcome and it really made out paris experience a positive one.; it started well. drinks in the square under the trees. we intended to freshen up at the hotel before dinner but started for our reservation time. half an hour before our reservation we told the lady our plans. we were told off for not telling her as soon as we arrived. we ordered food. a huge beef starter arrived, quite tasty but incredibly salty. we were further told off for not keeping our cutlery clean in order to use it for the next course. the main course of salmon gravadlax was absolutely not gravadlax. tasteless chuncks of raw salmon with stone cold tasteless potatoes with a herbycaper sauce and the oddest thing i’ve ever come across… sweet whipped cream all over.

name: Au Vieux Comptoir
formatted_address: 17 Rue des Lavandières Sainte-Opportune, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
my husband and i had the immense pleasure of enjoying our final meal in paris at this gem of a restaurant, and it was nothing short of extraordinary. the host anne sparkled with warmth, kindness, and humor. the staff also attended to our needs with care and genuine hospitality.

as for the food—sumptuous doesn’t even begin to describe it. most of the dishes are traditional cuisine but each is crafted with such artistry. we had pâté en croute and langoustine bisque for starters and beef wellington and veal kidneys for main dishes. oh my, they were so so very delicious, all perfectly executed and bursting with flavors. the restaurant also had a very extensive array of wines for wine connoisseurs.

it was the ideal way to cap off our time in paris. if you’re looking for a dining destination that offers simple but at the same time exquisitely prepared food, wonderful and convivial service, and an atmosphere filled with warmth, go to au vieux comptoir and anne will make sure you are at home! 🤩; make sure you have a reservation! very attentive and friendly staff. we very much enjoyed the food. the atmosphere was cozy and relaxing. the staff really make you feel comfortable.; i ordered white asparagus and bœuf bourguignon. both menu were delicious! would say that it was one of the most tender beef bourguignon i have tried so far.

also the service was excellent with warm welcome and proactive of both owner and staffs. i would highly recommend this if anyone is looking for traditional - comfort french dishes with cozy atmosphere restaurant.; perfect dinner i have ever tried! i eat the whole thing on the dish. im very satisfied 🥰🥰🥰; very nice dinner, the food is both traditional and innovative, the service is great (loved the soup served from old milk pots) and friendly, waiters make you feel at home. it’s a little noisy but with a very nice atmosphere.
highly recommended.

name: Le Paris Italie
reviews:
we were close to that place and we wanted to have quick breakfast, so we choosed this place i think it’s not the best option, but is good, we took breakfast option: which is 9 euro for one hot drink+fresh orange juice+croissant or butter jam toast, so for 3 person we paid 27 euro, and croissants was delicious. service was nice too.; super cute restaurant with wonderful staff. our dinner was absolutely delicious and very well priced. i definitely recommend this as a place to eat if you want very good food and service for a lower price!
we had the onion soup, a cheese plate, the cod, and chicken skewers (not pictured). i can’t express how yummy it was.; nice cafe and very lovely waitress, we had the little breakfast with baguette, jam, croissant, cafe and fresh oranges juice, i can recommend, definitly not touristic :); super nice cafe with a friendly waitress. i had the small breakfast which was really delicious!; nice experience with tasty drinks. highly recommended.

name: Le Reveil Bastille
reviews: lovely busy little place it’s a warm welcome and good food. helped out with our rubbish french even though their english is excellent! a great place for a refuel and a drink! would recommend a visit.; wonderful experience. the owner greeted us and was very friendly.  beer is cold and food is fresh.; excellent food. friendly and helpful staff. i tried some of my very basic french and they smiled and worked with it.; great place to stop for a glass of champagne in the area. incredible service & atmosphere. free wi-fi available as well. we had the camembert and it was divine 👌; we stopped there for a drink. the staff is very kind and friendly. nice service. recommended.

name: Auberge Etchegorry
reviews: we loved the evening set menu here and the price is very reasonable for the portion size and the quality of the food. couldn’t fault any of the dishes and everything came out quickly and hot. we’d love to come back again!; we enjoyed being there. it seems a bit pricy but the portions were so big. service, food, atmosphere and quality totally worth it! you can find good ones from french cuisines. if i come france once again, i will definitely eat there!; cozy place on a green corner, nice atmosphere and good service. the food is fresh and delicious, the tuna and veggies were perfectly cooked. decent value for 20€ lunch menu. great find.; such a cozy and lovely restaurant. i chose the simple menu written on the chalk board, but after my boyfriend's cassoulet arrived (ordered from the main menu), i immediately regretted my choice (although it was still delicious). next time will go for the traditional menu!; this lovely reataurent has very anvient roots and serves excellent basque food. really lovely staff and great food.  i had the duck breast which was very tasty and the dessert was really great.

name: Le Plomb du Cantal
formatted_address: 3 Rue de la Gaité, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
came here for the steak and aligot. we were seated right away with a street view. both of us got the entrecote with aligot/fries. there was a lot of aligot but it was really good. steak was cooked a little too long for a medium but that's okay. great parisian experience and would recommend; good and convenient for the railway station, just a few minutes away.
the menu is slightly confusing, so i opted for one of the omelettes, with lardons and potatoes, which arrived quickly and was good.
save some room for dessert- the chocolate mousse is very good, and absolutely huge!; renowned for their mash potatoes side dishes. overall, the food was ok, but not that special. they were out of the duck, which was quite disappointing. also, if you order your steak medium, you are getting a very bloody piece of meat. very touristy, the service was fast but quite dismissive. good selection of wines and vert tasty deserts.; we had higher hopes for this restaurant but it was overall a good experience. the aligot was delicious!! steak had no season but cooked perfect. we drank tap water and asked for ice. the white wine was good. the apple creme brule was good, seemed like it should have been warm. the carmel tart was nasty! the sausage was decent. glad to have gotten an authentic restaurant experience. the server was great!; huge portions, tasty rustic food. excellent service. busy at lunch.

name: Restaurant, Bar , Brasserie La Tour, cuisine traditionnelle, Paris Gare De Lyon , Galerie Gamma
reviews:
