it’s a great place for a quick bite.  if you’re from the states, this is the equivalent of a diner.  just solid fresh food, nothing too fancy.  the servers were great and the food was good.; we came upon this little gem when we were looking for a place to hang for a while before heading to the airport.  elsa gave us a warm welcome and managed to serve us dinner even though it really only caters to the lunch crowd.  i would highly recommend this little brasserie across from the gare de lyon.; great little bistro conveniently situated just a few metres from the gare de lyon...almost in the concourse.  don't be deceived by the unassuming appearance....everything here is made in house.....from a to z as madame proudly told us.
excellent food and service with a smile ☺  the cafe gourmand was one of the best we've had....at any price. go there!; excellent little brasserie - worth seeking out if you have some time to kill at gare de lyon.  it’s a short walk down a ramp from hall 1 - wifi and baggage friendly!; wonderful restaurant, with “real food”, a very welcomed meal after eating sandwiches and croissants for days! super close to the station, no issues with suitcases, very attentive staff even if you don’t speak french. amazing cafe gourmand too

name: Le Ju'
reviews:
solid overall. i really liked the atmosphere. it was pretty cool with all the rainbow umbrellas and decor. the service was solid. they catered to us even though we were not french. it had a pretty nice view on a busy street. the food was my only slight issue. it was kind of lacking in quality. i felt the onion soup especially was definitely not good. it was lukewarm and came in a bowl and with a spoon that definitely did not match its size as well. the price of the food was not too bad though as it was pretty cost effective. aldo u loved the menu idea. very original. overall i was a fan and i would come back if i was in the area.; my favorite place after the closed open cafe.
very nice service, good food, nice drinks.
sometimes performances, animations.
perfect place for lunch and dinner. it's nice to sit over a drink, talk to friends and watch life in paris.
i'll be back; excellent place for drinks. very lgbtq friendly, i ordered the cocktail of the day which i really enjoyed (something mixed with vodka, rum and champagne).at only 9 euros per drink, i think it’s a good deal. they also have an happy hr.  it did get crowded very quickly but the waiter was friendly and as attentive as possible. the menu here is extensive, maybe i’ll return to try the food at some point. overall, highly recommended.; great lively spot for people watching, and good bar bites and cocktails.; such a nice patio, friendly staff and a really interesting and varied menu. recommend for brunch! felt really hip too.

name: BIG SUR
vicinity: sur ESPLANADE, 105 Rue de Tolbiac, Paris
formatted_address: sur ESPLANADE, 105 Rue de Tolbiac, 75013 Paris, France
reviews: good value for money!! the food is very good! good service 5/5; meat and bun perfection for your mouth. 🤤; great classic burgers, fresh produce, good tunes, good vibes, people were lovely, great location. go check it out 👍; one of the best chicken sandwiches i've had in paris... menu with sandwich, fries and drink was a great value. i'll be back!; it’s really good burger and testy

name: La Petite Bouclerie
formatted_address: 33 Rue de la Harpe, 75005 Paris, France
reviews: no flavour. brown crepes that tastes like wheat. i prefer the lighter color crepes. it's not bad, just expected better. wanted to sit outside but there was smoking.  sitting inside i still smelled it...i sat about 10ft from outside.; beautifully decorated, great service and best of all, gluten free and celiac safe food. we had crepes, the onion soup and creme brulee. also cider :); great taste, loved it! the gentleman at the front was very warm and welcoming. he explained the menu to us in english, trying his best. he’s a lovely and genuine person!; pretty good crepes, including gluten free and lactose free crepes for the husband. when we ordered my husband was clear he couldn't have the cheese that came with the crepe he ordered, the employee said ok, but when it came there was now cream cheese on it instead of the cheese. so he had to wait  a while for them to remake his order. mine was good but not amazing.; small cafe with pretty decent crepes. don't speak much english but very nice staff and good service.

name: Restaurant Les 5
reviews:
yep. listen to other reviews. beautiful place to sit and have a couple of drinks, but i don’t recommend the food. it’s very mediocre and not worth the price unfortunately. the service was great though; after a long walk, me and friends stayed for lunch at les 5, and we were greeted very nicely by young male waiters that were both very secure with speaking english. i had the burger “saint-nectaire” which was incredible good. fried eggplants and cilantro made an interesting twist to this dish. rounded up with a nice chardonnay. overall a really nice location, typical french style with a relaxed area. highly recommend staying there. definitely a local spot! merci “les 5”; we came across this lovely little restaurant while wandering. delicious unpretentious french food, lovely service, and an all round fab experience on a grey day. we shared a roasted cheese - divine - my husband loved his burger and my goats  cheese salad was delicious (i wish i could replicate the dressing) and enormous! thank you!; the terrace has an excellent atmosphere, the tango accordion plays in the background, delicious food and wine, friendly service, good prices (by parisian standards).  it was one of the best meals we had during our trip to paris.; we had a great time during the olympics. we were looking for a more typical experience than the fan zone, and fell upon this small restaurant with an amazing terrace. the food is simple but really good, prices are really ok compared to paris' standards, and the team is great ! the waiter octave even took the time to indicate the best unknown places to visit, and and all in german too, what a surprise!!
our only regret is that we didn't discover this place sooner !

name: De Damas à Beyrouth
reviews:
a small typical lebanese restaurant with a lot of variety to choose from (even for those who are lactose intolerant). the food is very tasty, the portions are generous and the quality/price ratio is excellent. i recommend it if you want to try some good food that is different from the usual. the owner is kind and ready to answer any questions you may have.; what a delightful dinner we had at de damas à beyrouth ! the service is fast and very friendly. the food is very delicious ! would recommend !; we were looking for a not too expensive place to have dinner. if you like ethnic food, this restaurant is the perfect choice.
we asked for 2 bowls with rice, meat and vegetables and 2 dishes with meat/falafel and various sauces: everything looked and tasted great, we satisfied our hunger with less than 70 euros (4 people).
the waiter was also very kind and explained to us all the options, since the menus were only in french, and gave us the directions to choose the right food for a lactose-intolerant person.; absolutely incredible. the best lebanese food i’ve eaten anywhere. such strong flavors. fantastic vegetarian protein alternative. wait staff was very friendly. i can’t wait to go back; the food was super delicious. service is more than perfect. i am absolutely going again when i visit paris next time 😋😋

name: Les Arènes
reviews:
we loved this place! it was crowded but the waitresses were so friendly and welcoming. the napoleon cake had a great portion and delicious!; came here for the tea to try to do some work: decent level of noise, with a mixture of elder locals, students, and working professionals. i liked that the owner presented a whole selection of teas and gave me the teapot which allowed me to pour as much or as little water as i wanted. the owner was super kind, but unfortunately the wifi wasn't working which made it hard to get work done and no croissant was available when i went in. good place to stop for coffee/a quick bite on a rainy day!; nice place to take lunch on a rainy day. local vibes and tasty food. execellent service, the staff is really friendly. we enjoyed the tartare and la tarte citron. the dessert was reinterpreted and looked like a mushroom. definitely recommend it!; not great. super slow. waitress was alone and overwhelmed. risotto was oily and the fish fingers were a mix of fish and chicken.
overall i would give it a miss. but still, do be nice to that poor waitress; she was trying to cover like 40 tables.; great food - everything we've tried has been fantastic. nice neighborhood atmosphere - you can tell there are regulars who come in for their daily drink or espresso. will have a university crowd at times, depending on the day/time from sorbonne around the corner (presumably).

name: L'Escarmouche
vicinity: 40 Rue de la Montagne Sainte Geneviève, Paris
formatted_address: 40 Rue de la Montagne Ste Geneviève, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
we celebrated my birthday at this fabulous restaurant and couldn't have selected a better choice.
the place is cozy, the food is excellent, and the service is impeccable.
they have two musicians (guitar and accordion) that will play traditional french music and include music from the guests' country of origin; it was impressive!

our family had a fantastic time, and we can’t wait to come back to l’escarmouche! it’s five stars all around.; the atmosphere was excellent, we almost wanted to stand up and dance. food was ok.  entrée - goat cheese salad was perfecto, i could have ordered another serve. main course was vegetarian risotto, bit dry and flavorless. dessert - apple pie, hmm... apple pie 😅; rave reviews for l'escarmouche in paris!! i enjoyed the most delightful dinner at this restaurant. everything was fabulous from the entertainment to the food!! the musicians were joyful and jolly. they made a great effort to serenade every table. i was joined by  a very large group of nearly 40 people. the service was top-notch! the food was high quality, especially considering the number of people they were serving simultaneously. the french onion soup was flavorful and comforting. the prawns were of substantial size and made for a great entree selection. lastly, the floating island for dessert, yum! i will remember this evening for a long time to come. the atmosphere is lovely and made for a perfect last meal in paris!; came with a tour group for dinner and dishes were pre-selected.  ambience was comfortable and nice and greeted by 2 performers upon arrival.  onion soup was served lukewarm; escargot tasted strange; frog legs were too salty.  other dishes and dessert were ok.  at the end of dinner, the singers/performers were at every table asking for gratuity and made some people uncomfortable.; came with tour group for a 3-course welcome dinner. escargot snails were rather small. beef bourguignon tasted like it could have come premade from costco. chocolate eclair drizzled in chocolate syrup and filled with chocolate cream was too much chocolate. i’m a chocolate lover! and the worst part — the unlimited table wine (red and white) was watered down. the bread basket came after the first course had been served. what an underwhelming welcome!

name: Le Jardin Privé
formatted_address: 8 Pl. Marguerite de Navarre, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
cozy little space situated in the courtyard of a novotel hotel.
service personell is very attentive, while having a relaxed aura (eloise was fantastic).
the food is just awesome.; the food is really not good and not what would be expected at this price point, and the service is really bad.

the overall vibe is of a fake "fancy" restaurant, but it just feels fake. the only fancy part are the prices.

the garden is ok-ish, but in reality it is surrounded by tall, ugly buildings, and you need to go through the hotel/restaurant and construction site to access.; great place! warm welcome from the entry. gentlemans serving and assisting on top level. stunning garden. magnifique!; went here to relax after long trip.  food was good but had to ask 3 times to receive water and by then already done with food. also asked for bread but was never brought to table. suggest hire more staff to accommodate guests because takes away from food and atmosphere.; good place for tea time.

name: Apégo
reviews:
absolutely fantastic place with a warm, welcoming atmosphere. as an english speaker, i felt completely at home with no language barriers, as the staff speaks excellent english.

i arrived on a sunday around 3:30 pm, and there was plenty of food available. i even had the chance to try the scrambled eggs with truffles—an absolute treat! the only minor downside for me was that for the main courses, you need to ask the staff to serve you.

this could feel a bit awkward if you're someone with a big appetite like me, having to go back multiple times for more. overall, a great experience!; we had our sunday brunch at this place and while the service was amazing and the waiter was very considerate, the food was really horrible! we ordered eggs benedict and we got cold boiled eggs that tasted like cardboard, just like the pancakes. it was a very poor quality brunch, never happened to us in paris! we won’t come back and we surely won’t recommend to anyone! “a very cold french nightmare “ (group of 4); lovely attentive service and fresh food! i had egg benedict with trout and extra avocado, delicious! i asked for an extra shot in my cappuccino and it was spot on for me! exactly what was needed to wake up and start the day!; amazing place for all-day brunch buffet in saint-germain!

apēgo is a great spot which serves only organic and locally sourced fresh products.

the 39e all-you-can-eat buffet formula offers a large range of choices of sweets and salty sandwich, with great coffee and fresh juices.

highly recommend this place for a cozy brunch!; great little spot for brunch.
organics fruit and breads, fabulous coffee and desserts.

name: At the Pavillon
reviews:
came here for breakfast on a summer mid morning - there were only a couple of people and service was prompt and polite. food was good and very parisian - we had the breakfast which was reasonably priced. indoor and outdoor seating.; food was below average.
french onion soup was bland and tasted like stock.
chaucuteri board was okay. strange to have packet salad and tomato on it but it was the best part of our dinner.
the prime rib was well below average. steak was ordered as medium-rare and was served blue. unfortunately i had to send this steak back to the kitchen (the first time i've ever sent food back) the steak was reserved cut up and cooked medium well. unfortunately it was still inedible and i declined to eat it and i sent the steak back again.
once finished our meals, we waited a decent amount of time for our bill and felt that we were negated to a level after returning a meal.
overall we were disappointed with our meals as expected more when ordering french menu at a french menu.; the service was great, the prices was good, and the quantity matched the prices. the food was not bad, but not wow. overall, it was good.; this is my go-to for a friendly dinner and/or cocktails. the server is extremely nice and the their craft cocktail selection is amazing. i recommend bombay chai - sweet and spicy, you’ll def come back for another glass. it gets busy and loud in weekend nights. tourist friendly.; okay food, okay staff, okay location. nothing special, but you’ll get food and something to drink here.

name: Aux Deux Ecus
formatted_address: 1 Pl. des Deux Ecus, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
we just pass by and decide to have a lunch. waiter, jose, was amazing and rest of staff too. we took daily menu and all dishes was super tasty. we were surprised with salad which was amazing. we have nice time there and hope to come back.; in an adventure to find desert after a long travel day. we stumbled upon this place. they had their menu posted outside so we were able to explore before we walked in.

it was a cold night so we chose to sit inside, but many parties were sitting outside.

thank god our server spoke english, this was a huge plus.

we started with a mojito and a sex on the beach. drinks were strong and refreshing. for dessert i ordered the "brioche perdue" (french toast) and honey had the "crêpe miel" (honey crepe).

my goodness! i melted after the first bite of the "brioche perdue". it was so light and bursting with subtle sweet flavors. honey said her crepe was light, good mixture of fluffy and crispy, and the honey was a perfect addition of sweetness.

we didn't have any food, but the desert and the drinks are worth the trip.; good brunch and lovely service.

visited in may 2024; me and my friend have had a tasty brunch over here. quiche and other food was very tasty but the cups were poorly cleaned. unfortunately they dont have bags for leftovers. however they provided their apologies for that and asked several times whether everything was fine.; we came across this restaurant quite by chance.  a really pleasant atmosphere, a varied menu of food and drinks. we really appreciate the water and chips we got from home. also, very friendly staff and the best burger we've tried so far in paris.  any recommendation from us!  keep it up, you're great!

name: Santa Lyna
reviews:
i loved this place! i had the chicken waffle, the almond butter chai latte, and fresh oj. highly recommend - i even tried their sister restaurant the day after, which was just as good. the service was great — thanks so much to gabriel and cesar. will definitely be back.; no reservations. you have to stand in line

some interesting twist to you’re usual brunch favorites. they look good & taste even better

it does get very very busy on weekends. so if you’re a tourist take time into account; no reservation. expect stand in a line for at least 20 minutes. great decor, funky vibe, fancy brunch, instagramable food and huge portions.; great place, nice vibes and good food. the portions were really big for the price! also the iced strawberry matcha was super good. i loved the chicken waffle it was amazing!; the vibes were absolutely amazing. great food, amazing concept, diverse menu, cool decor and great staff. everyone was very accommodating, even to special requests. overall we all had a great time here 2 days in a row. that’s how great it was. (side note the music was amazing too).

name: Bleu Olive
reviews: cute place for students, fast and courteous service. but, overpriced. the food is nothing special. the coffee is good though.; first things first, the coffee is very good. i had a v60 pour over with beans from peru, this roast was wonderful and i would have ordered another if i could handle the caffeine. the service was exallent, they were helpful explained everything even when it was very busy. the food is limited so mostly snacks, but they have a breakfast plate with cheese, avocado, ham and bread. i would definitely come back for the coffee.; no coffee is worth this place, hesitated to write a review, thought the waitress was just having a bad day, but this experience made me feel so bad i felt other customers should be informed. she snapped at me for asking a dietary question as she was saying i shouldn’t ask any questions since everything is on the menu and she has too many things to do at the moment, we waited patiently for our coffee, after 3 other groups of people who came in after us got served, we asked about our coffees, their response was beyond acceptable, we asked our money back and they accused us of being rude, we saw another costumer asking if he could add a scone to his order; since he already paid she said he can’t change his order anymore ~ not sure if anyone felt welcome here; my go-to in this neighborhood, always tasty and the staff are lovely! they also let you use your laptop (except from noon until 3pm) which i really appreciate; a small, cozy and friendly-feeling cafe. popped in for a light breakfast which was both tasty and good value, and it arrived within just a few minutes. the granola was particularly enjoyable. plenty of tea blends to choose from, too.

name: UMAMI BURGER PARIS
vicinity: 19 Rue du Commandant René Mouchotte, Paris
formatted_address: 19 Rue du Commandant René Mouchotte, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
tried their sam’s crispy chicken burger, truffle cheese fries, bacon fries, k-town poké bowl and peanut butter pie. chicken burger was deliciously flavourful, and so was poké bowl (although it did come with hair eww). fries were not crispy although truffle ketchup was good. peanut butter pie was mousse-based so it was quite light while still being decadent.; friday night, my wife and i were looking for a burger, as we were craving for one !
we found this place, which is actually a restaurant of the pullman hotel near gare montparnasse.

i must say, the place is gorgeous ! the decoration is absolutely beautiful, and super quiet. the waiters are super nice, and quick. i loved that our order was taken rapidly and always with the proper words, love that ! huge thanks to the guys who served us yesterday !

when it comes to the burgers themselves, well…. those are not the best burgers in town, they are decent. who had the classic burger and the crispy chicken. nothing fancy here, no special sauce, the buns are ok, and the crispy chicken was probably over fried as it came out almost black.
the fries are good, don’t get me wrong they are probably home made, but again not something i would come again for.

all in all, we had a nice evening but we won’t probably come back, as the food was just ok, and the prices are pretty high for that. 2 burgers, 2 fries and 2 coke = 48 euros.; don’t let the name fool you…umami burger at the pullman hotel is a great spot!  our server alexandru was both friendly and attentive…making our dining experience all the more special.  great food, burgers could be cooked a little less well done but overall still great…and the sweet potato fries are simply fantastic!; the burgers are ok. the fries are very good. servers were very friendly and it's a cute place. i was staying in the hotel so it was very convenient, i would go back.; pros: friendly staff and good atmosphere.
cons: food took too long and then when it did, the burger was cold and dry - didn’t enjoy it. sweet potato fries were quite good. milkshake was very watery and had like 3 tbsp of peanut butter just sitting at the bottom of the glass - not fun.
cheesecake and chocolate cake were just ok.

name: L'Entredeux Paris
reviews:
owners looks like nice gentlemens.

going to review only the vegetarian food here : well first of all it's a good thing that they at least propose one vegetarian option per day. but deep inside me i wish it would be something else than a vegetarian salad. i know you sometimes have choices like vegetarian pasta, but i would like so much to have more different vegetarian dishes other than salads.; we privatized the in between for a company dinner aperitif, it was great. we wanted an informal atmosphere where everyone can chat and move around without it being too formal and it was perfect. simple and good dishes, wines too and above all a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. i recommend privatization, especially since the managers took great care to ensure that everything went smoothly, from the quote to the evening itself. top location (lines 6 and 12).; two passionate brothers, who manage to combine good products and refined, original and gourmet cuisine at an excellent quality/price ratio. perfect for eating well and not too expensive during your lunch break or when you're too lazy to cook for your family.
i have already made it my benchmark!; very good cuisine with fresh, tasty products. balanced dishes with real, well-cooked vegetables that aren't bathed in sauce, and hearty enough for me. not a bad choice. good value for money in my opinion. and, the icing on the cake: i love their desserts (the black forest and the coffee dessert, yum), as well as the pots of ice cream in summer. i've already been there a dozen times since they opened, and i plan to go back. in short, quality with smiling people, what more could you ask for?; very good place in the neighborhood where you can eat varied and balanced dishes at reasonable prices (between €9 and €15 depending on the menu) to eat in or to take away. the two managers are always welcoming and attentive to dish suggestions. entredeux has become our favorite canteen for my colleagues and i ;)

name: Papy aux Fourneaux I La table d'hôtes I Montparnasse
reviews:
good food?

while the restaurant hinges on the concept of sharing--sharing meals with your partners and friends, sharing tables with strangers--its main goal should be to propose food that tastes, that can be savoured, that inspires memories and triggers new associations.

nothing like that happened at papy, at least to us. this evening, our meals were unseasoned and a bit too raw to be enjoyed.; we had the pleasure of dining at this highly recommended restaurant, and it truly exceeded our expectations! the culinary experience was nothing short of amazing, with each dish bursting with incredible flavors and exquisite richness. the attention to detail in the restaurant's decor was evident, creating a delightful ambiance that enhanced our dining experience.

what pleasantly surprised us was the reasonable pricing considering the exceptional quality of the food. it's rare to find such a harmonious balance between value and taste. moreover, the service provided by the staff was exceptional. they were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction throughout the meal.

we wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone in search of an exceptional dining experience. it's an absolute gem that deserves recognition for its outstanding food, inviting atmosphere, and remarkable service.; beautiful restaurant with delicious home-style food and fittings. staff were extremely friendly and the portions were generous! would highly recommend.; great experience. extremely wonderful customer service who speaks english with english menu provided, friendly team of staff with strong dedication in french cuisine culture. foodwise, impeccable, very authentic french cuisine from french produce. highly recommended. please make sure you book since it’s always full.; wonderful restaurant, real family feel. choose a plate to share and enjoy a real home cooked, french meal. attentive and thoughtful staff, games to play while waiting, reasonable wine prices and a highly recommended experience. worth a visit and reserving a table if you don't want to be disappointed!!

name: Big Fernand
formatted_address: 40 Pl. du Marché Saint-Honoré, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
i had the best dining experience during my trip to paris, with exceptional food and service. staying near place vendôme, i came for a late dinner and was deeply impressed by the thoughtful service and delicious food.

as a korean, the male staff thoughtfully recommended a sauce, assuming i would enjoy something spicy, and even brought out some chili. his attention to detail was truly touching.

from the taste of the food to the service and even the freshness of the beer, everything was incredibly impressive. i would like to express my deepest gratitude to the male staff who served us at the outdoor table around 9 pm on september 19. 🙏; great spot in that area. service is good and friendly, the waiter took the time to explain the menu to us and there is a good kids menu which is 10€ incl drink. food is fresh and tasty, portions are generous especially for kids. it can be hard to find family friendly and reasonably priced spots the area so we were happy to find big fernand.; nice spot in a courtyard with a decent vibe of neighboring restaurants. our server william was very attentive and helped guide us through the menu for any questions. they had chicken tenders and chicken sandwiches in addition to their burgers. food and service was very good. thank you again william for a wonderful meal!; we really enjoyed the meal here! i had the big fernand burger and i would definitely recommend it. we had amazing hospitality also from william who made sure we were okay through out. great services!; good burger options. tye hosts are friendly and professional and they speak both french and english. outdoor seating area has nice scenery

name: Les Pépites, maison d'artisans - Restaurant Paris 15
reviews:
les pépites, maison d'artisans is a fantastic spot for a satisfying lunch. i visited during lunchtime and was immediately greeted by the friendly owner and waiter, who made me feel welcome. the atmosphere was relaxed and inviting, perfect for a midday break.

for lunch, i enjoyed a grilled cheese pastrami, an omelette, and a tartlette for dessert. the grilled cheese pastrami was delicious, with the perfect combination of melted cheese and flavorful pastrami. the omelette was light and fluffy, just right for a lunchtime dish. the tartlette was a delightful way to finish the meal, with its balanced sweetness and fresh ingredients.

i reserved my table through thefork and received a 20% discount, which was a great bonus. overall, les pépites offers excellent food and warm service, making it an ideal choice for lunch in paris. highly recommended!; amazing brunch! one of my favorite restaurants in paris. amazing quality, good food and they are really friendly. 100% recommended; really beautiful rooms to hire, expat friendly. very warm welcome and excellent food and drinks. there's always something exciting going on here so you have to keep an eye out not to miss anything. parking is really good here too.; very kind staff and also good foods.
it seems that they are selling the eco-friendly products.
the taste of pasta isn’t strong, rather a little bit weak but i like that.; amazing brunch !!! (check my insta food account @_takeyourseat_ ) 💗

name: Le Roi de Pique
reviews: my first stop in paris this time.  the escargot were great.  so great i had a second order!  sara was very kind, since i speak very little french.  will be back!; great food - we had tuna teriyaki with carrot hummus & a salad with smoked salmon and avocado. lovely staff. location too is fabulous for people watching: looks like le roi de pique has a very cool clientele.; perfect place to have lunch, dinner, coffe or just a glass of wine.sit outside or inside.friendly.good music in the evenings.very good soupe à l’oignon gratinée.(i have many in paris).; a terrific place to stop by on our way back to our hotel.. we looked at several other bars and chose this one and were quite pleased with the service and the outdoor location.. we ordered two beers and enjoyed the friendly environment.. when viewing what other customers were eating we will consider coming back for a meal; late night drinks and snacks were fine.  chips and guacamole were doritos flavored chips. 🤣 fries were good.

name: Bontemps Le Restaurant "Jardin secret"
reviews: it’s a very nice place with a very decorative atmosphere , it tried 2 tartes that were delicious and the coffee is very good; this is an amazing place to go for lunch. the food and the service were exemplary. i went numerous times during my recent stay in paris and would absolutely recommend it to anyone who is visiting or lives there.  i will return on my next visit; super cosy, food was amazing and the service very friendly; brunch of 45€ worth every cent. the interior is cosy and the service is top.; le patisserie there is incredible light and balanced. our drinks were spot on. is fire sure an hidden pearl in paris

name: Dolce Romana
reviews:
we recently dined at this wonderful italian restaurant with two families, including two small children, and it was a fantastic experience. the service was exceptional, truly top-notch. every staff member was attentive and friendly, making us feel right at home. the food was incredibly delicious, with authentic flavors that transported us straight to italy. a special mention must go to the owner's son, who was an outstanding host. his warm hospitality and keen attention to detail made our evening even more special. highly recommend this place for a delightful dining experience!; food was mediocre. not bad, but not italian. pasta and ravioli was prepared with too much whipped cream. pizza was ok but again not what you would expect from an italian restaurant. the creme brulee was cold on the inside which could be a thing here in france, i am not sure.
overall it was a decent place and staff were friendly, but not the food experience you would wish from an italian restaurant.; af first, this italian restaurant looked promising. but the starter we ordered, a fried risotto mozzarella unit, was still cold and half frozen inside. instead of frying new ones, they just microwaved and served them again.

main course was okay.

for compensation of this error, we got nothing on the house or on the bill. it could have stopped me from writing this review.; dolce roma is a gem of a restaurant. everyone from the proprietor down to the bus person were friendly and offered excellent service.

the restaurant itself is well appointed, the tables aren't crowded and the decor is in excellent taste with a bright interior.

the food is excellent. i had a veal chop that was cooked rare, to perfection. the meat was juicy, nicely brown on the outside and beautifully purple on the inside.

my companions had truffle ravioli and the carbonara. both dishes were expertly cooked and the sauces were smooth, creamy and flavourful.

dolce roma is absolutely worth a visit. i highly recommend it.; cutest & coziest restaurant with a rough vibey interior, complimenting the classic italian cuisine. love the staff, who were the sweetest & the twist on tiramisu, with a tropical mango flavor to it! a must try when it comes to dessert!!

name: Popu Bistro à Pizza
vicinity: 12 Rue du Champ de Mars, Paris
formatted_address: 12 Rue du Champ de Mars, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
stopped in for a late lunch.

the pizzas are touted as being made with french organic wheat and spelt from local mills. while that is certainly a commendable approach to local and sustainable food sourcing, it was not specifically noticeable in the end product.

regardless, the pizzas we ordered hit the mark in any event.

the tomato sauce on the marguerite was perhaps a smidge too sweet for my palate, but overall the dish was fine. i’m also used to more basil on this particular pizza. the frome-tonne was certainly very cheesy! the restaurant provided chili oil with the pizzas, but it wasn’t especially spicy. oddly enough, they also provided a chili honey with the frometon, which, in addition to going very well with the cheeses, worked wonderfully with the from-tonne. i’d recommend asking for a side of the honey if you order this particular pizza.

we probably could have foregone the popu bread. the fleur de sel and olive oil were not very tangible in the dish and the hummus was fair to middling at the best.

despite the slight let down on the bread dish, the meal was overall a success.; i had burrata and blue cheese pizza. the pizza was unique and tasty. there were other vegetarian options, 4 other pizzas, some salads and perhaps a few others, all clearly marked on the menu.
the server was nice and friendly. i ordered a brunch size pizza and mistakenly they made a large one. i was charged the brunch sized price for the large pizza; took half back on a to-go box.; a very nice place to taste pizza with a french twist! lovely staff, great service, delicious food! the pain popu as appetizer was amazing and the burrata pizza was sooo good ! plus, don’t forget to taste their fresh juices. must try🍕; my son wanted pizza for his time paris. we just stopped at this place because of its proximity to musée rodin and we were not disappointed. the pizza was delicious and quickly served. the manager even recommended the sauce that goes quite well with the pizza.; decided to try this restaurant based on reviews i read. wow!, how can this place have good reviews for the food!  my wife and i ordered pizza that was totally tasteless. we would have had a better chance of eating the cardboard take out box. i would give -5 stars if possible. there must be a mind control device on site that implants great reviews into people’s heads as i avoided this by sitting outside!  do yourself a huge favour and do not eat here!!

name: Le Charles Quint
reviews:
great choice of belgian & world beers , food wise we only tried planche mixte but it was top notch.
more than anything the service was great, outstanding really, attentive, quick when needed but non invasive at all, great job. i would highly recommend for a relaxed beer and bite .; never seen before hospitality!!!

very nice friendly, humorous staff! the kitchen was already closed, when we arrived, only drinks were avaible. however when we said we would like to have some snacks next to the vine, the waiter went somewhere else (perhaps other restaurant) and got a very deliciois paté for us with bread. also the other waiter offered us shots as a gratis, which we very really happy about!

very pleasant experiance!; great beers and great service in a bistro setting on montparnasse blvd; top cocktails and beers, hh until late and responsive service with a smile to boot, it's always a pleasure to come here!

we also organized 2 events there and everything went very well.; ambiente agradável, com comida saborosa, bons drinks e bom preço. happy our até tarde e funcionários simpáticos.

name: Notsobig Toys Gifts Children Ready To Wear Creators
reviews:
perfect; this store is one of the best in paris in terms of choice of soft toys. the saleswoman was very kind and guided us on our choices of stuffed animals.
i particularly recommend the address to fans of the jellycat brand: i was able to find a very cute one!; the store looks nice. i say it "looks" because i haven't been able to get in yet... they are closed during the lunch break (which is not indicated on the store opening hours of course) and every day, the reopening time is different. i've been trying to go there for 4 days...
not practical at all!!!
to complete after answer, of course employees have the right to a lunch break, absolutely no one has said the opposite! but you should take this into account in your schedules instead of announcing continuous service when that is not the case.
all you have to do is update your google information and change a sticker on the door (rather than a post-it), just to save people from having to travel for nothing ;); overpriced scam!!!!
40% more expensive than its competitors, you read correctly 40% i did the math!
i felt really bad when i found out the true price of the items i bought!
a shame! yes to help small traders even pay a little more than usual, but 40% more expensive?!!! i saw the same items in other small parisian boutiques with the real price displayed.
it's because of stores like you that consumers prefer to order online!

edit following the store’s response:
in view of the derogatory response which looks down on its dissatisfied customers instead of questioning itself, the "mystery" product as you say with so much condescension is not one but two....
here are the 2 articles:
- quut medusa bath puzzle: paid €18
the average price of this item is 13€ (we also find it cheaper and the maximum that i have seen is 14€90, except at your place...18€)
- quut hoppi dino garden green jumping ball: paid 65€ and all the prices i have seen are 49.95€ or 49.99€ at your competitors

i bought because i wanted to please my nephews as i don't have children myself. i'm not aware of prices, i think a lot of people are in my situation, when you love you don't count.. if it's the price, that's how it is, on the other hand this feeling of having been cheated after knowing the prices charged in other stores is very unpleasant and i would like to warn all your potential customers.
i even add to my comment that for this price we could expect incredible service, but i asked for gift wrap which was made very roughly, so i did it again... it's a detail but at least everything is said!; children's paradise: toys, decoration, clothes, stuffed animals (all soft and very original, i actually fell for one of them!!!l, accessories, perfect when you're looking for a gift for a little bit!

name: L'Enjoué
reviews:
we wanted to end our trip to the uk and france with a wonderful meal and were pleasantly rewarded. this was a great memory for us. thank you.
we had a special (see the picture below) so this meal is not available every day but i highly recommend this restaurant. it was another wonderful memory of paris.; my friend and i had dinner here and really enjoyed our meal! the service was wonderful and the food was delicious, from the starter (we had the sashimi), to the main courses (beef shank and duck were both incredible) and dessert (chocolate mousse). we also enjoyed a glass of wine which was also amazing! would recommend to anyone to go to l’engoue if they are in paris!; disappointed with the quality of food and taste.
for the main plate, we ordered the chicken dish and it was unpalatable. the chicken was luke warm and lacked flavor.

the owner was also not very welcoming.

i recommend going somewhere else to eat; lovely food. the perfekt place to a good and affordable lunch after a morning full of sightseeing in paris.
super friendly. definitely will go again on my next visit to paris 👍; lovely staff and d
good service

name: Le Parvis
reviews:
cafe near notre dame. interior and exterior are good. we ordered onion soup and the dish of the day - it was ribs with potatoes. the waiter was very polite, the service was pleasant. the food is delicious. i recommend the traditional soup 👌🏻 the portions are large.; the food is amazing!! one of the best restaurants near to notre dame, i can’t describe the happiness in every bite!
if i visit paris in the future i will eat here again a and again ❤️; nice little place a stones throw away from notre-dame. really warm welcome from the front of house team, bilingual as well. food came really quickly and was good portion size. would recommend for food or a drink on a warm day sat out in front.; the food was great and not too expensive, in comparison to other places in paris.

the service was very good. the waiter was pleasant and patient with us, tourists, who weren't completely sure as to what we should order.

as for the atmosphere, the inner part of the restaurant gives a sense of an upper class place, since it's decorated with classic chairs and tables.

all in all, it's a great and recommended place!

p.s. a huge apology to the restaurant for accidentally breaking a jar next to where we sat.; after a busy work trip we had only two hours to enjoy paris so time was tight and we wanted to see the notre dame and then find a lovely parisienne cafe to enjoy the atmosphere. we walked around and nothing hit the spot until we found le parvis. it was perfect! we had a lovely seat outside this cute little bistro to people watch and enjoy a bottle of wine and a delicious cheeseboard. our waiter was really friendly, didn't treat us like tourists which we had fully expected and made us feel super welcome which really added to our experience and we had a fabulous time. thank you le parvis for a short but very sweet french welcome break in your lovely cafe.

name: Restaurant Pastamore
reviews:
excellent home made pasta and delicious dessert. fun and casual atmosphere, but special enough for a night out. experience excellent italian food in paris.; the pasta was heavenly it was absolutely amazing. some of the best pasta i’ve had in my life and the tiramisu for dessert was perfectly nice. the atmosphere of the restaurant was fairly average and the waiting staff were slightly unhelpful but all in all didn’t massively detract from the experience. would recommend the spaghetti pastamore.; i loved the shrimp linguine, it was so delicious i would come back just for it. the alcoholic drinks are very pricey for the amount you get, so i would avoid getting those. however, the food is absolutely amazing and you should definitely come here if you are around montparnasse.; cute little restaurant. we had the truffle ravioli and the pesto linguine, both were divine.; delicious pasta! i ordered the pastamore spaghetti. the bruschetta was also amazing!
it is a small so i would recommend making a reservation ahead of time.

name: La Ravigote
reviews:
we were very happy to walk into this restaurant on a rainy day. the restaurant is a bit small but very cozy, and the staff and chef were very friendly! although we don't speak french, they made a great effort to communicate with us.

the food was absolutely delicious. everyone was very welcoming and we had a very memorable time! merci :); i just want to thank the chef. not only did he make me a great meal, he even came out of the kitchen and introduced each dish for me since i don’t understand french. thank you for welcoming me with such grace!; when you go to other countries you hope to find a great restaurant, if you come to paris this is one of those places. kristoph is fantastic. the food here is magnificent. he even ordered a taxi for us after our meal. excellent.
service amazing, food amazing, cooked to perfection. great fantastic amazing, you need to come here.; this place is really good.
people speak english. the food was great .; recommended by a family member our expectations were high but the chef and team were friendly and delivered on them. authentic french cuisine (speaking as a frenchman) served in a cozy atmosphere. one of our party made a special request for something off the menu of that day (andouillette) and the chef gladly prepared it with fresh ingredients. would happily return on future visits to paris.

name: Brasserie du Louvre - Bocuse
vicinity: Place André Malraux, Paris, Île-de-France, France, 75001, Paris
formatted_address: Place André Malraux, Paris, Île-de-France, France, 75001, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
a very easy place to just drop in for a traditional french meal which is very well cooked. service is great with bilingual staff.
we tried the veal liver which was excellent, soft and tender which perfectly combined with the sauce that after a few bites the taste of liver that puts most people off disappeared and became very pleasant to eat.; we had a lovely early dinner here at the hotel restaurant. david was our server and he was very kind and attentive. other staff were very nice too! (i believe their names are theo and victoria).

we ordered onion soup, lyonnaise salad and the steak. all were perfectly prepared and delicious. i was surprised but the portions are huge (even the salad and soup).

the patio seats have a lovely view of the louvre museum.

i wanted to have desserts at the bar but unfortunately we were too full :); foods were really good. the traditional lyonnaise salad's sauce was great, well-balanced tastes. beef steak cooked so perfect, pretty plating. their staff were very kind and professional. this place have a good atmosphere! you can enjoy your time in the calm, organized vibes. highly recommend!; excellent french cuisine. very high standard and attention to detail. higher prices, but definitely worth it. friendly and attentive staff.; the delightful french cuisine was a true treat for my taste buds, and the attentive service from the staff made the evening truly unforgettable. highly recommended for anyone seeking a gastronomic adventure in the enchanting ambiance of paris!

name: Ciasa Mia
reviews:
i’m not sure if they’re having an off day or what, but our experience definitely did not live up to how others have reviewed this place. for €85, the quantity of food was not worth it, the taste was subpar, and service was average.

they must’ve changed up their menu because out of all the dishes, only two were good - the duck speck and the dessert. let me review each course one by one:
1. appetizers - tapioca chips with radish cream, carrot cake roll, and pork lard with bread - none of these stood out and lacked complexity in flavor and texture
2. appetizers 2 - egg yolk - this is quite unique and tasted decent
3. appetizer 3 - parmesan puff with mushroom mayo and beet root with horseradish - this was okay for me
4. course 1 - crab filling dumpling with chicken stock - this was interesting in a bad way. with the stock the bottom became soggy very quickly, the flavor was quite mild
5. course 2 - duck speck - this was unique and delicious, i liked how it was presented, and the pickled onion really balances things out
6. course 3 - pasta with almond filling and veal broth - this was okay, again flavor is super mild
7. course 4 - fish sausage - by far the worst dish of the night. the sausage was extremely mushy and lacked any complexity in flavor. for the main protein this is a major disappointment and felt like they’re being cheap
8. course 5 - dessert - this was delicious, i liked how it seems like a heavy dessert but the ice cream and other parts actually made it less heavy

service also leaves a lot to be desired - after we finished dessert and informed the waitress that we don’t need coffee or tea, she left us there for 20 minutes without bringing the bill or checking in on us. we had to try to catch her and ask for the bill. when i put down my credit card, she still gave the receipt to my fiance to sign even though she saw me taking it out of my wallet; absolutely outstanding! so glad i stumbled on to this place for ma food blog review. it’s off the beaten path in a small and cozy little space. francesca made us feel so welcome!
the food was delicious.; beautiful restaurant, incredible food, and excellent service. a hidden gem of paris. dog friendly!; one of a perfect dinners in my life
a bit expensive but, it's worth to pay for it!

the mood was quiet and cozy
server was so kind and nice
and all foods were so great!

it's italian in french but i became to go italy to have dinners like this

i started with a starter of vegi chip/prendang/bread and a cooked egg (it was cooked inside but looked rare outside but was so nice and creamy with truffle sauce)

then another breas with olive oil
beans with cream and crunch
another breads
cabbage with cabbage sauce
gnocchi with vegi chip
duck with cooked potato (i couldn't take a pictur of potato but with was so soft and tasty)
vanilla sauce and bread

the last sweets was the greatest
kakao chip and cream, and there was strawberry sorbet inside!

enjoy perfect italian in france; absolutely the best meal of our trip to paris and maybe in my lifetime! the ambiance, service, food presentation and flavors were all outstanding.

name: Au Petit Tonneau
reviews:
this place was quite the turn of events. we didn’t have a reservation so had to wait a bit to get a table, which is understandable. however, once we were seated and given menus, no one was serving us after more than 20 min, which made me unhappy and was thinking to leave. finally, they came to our table and informed us that they were out of few of the main dishes which didn’t leave us that many options.

we decided to get a main dish and two appetizers and see how it goes. meanwhile, the dishes at tables around us didn’t look like anything especial and a bit plain, so i was getting worried and was looking for the next restaurant to go after to get “more proper”food.

once they brought our food, it was a turning point. as simple as it looked, it was all made to perfection and absolutely delicious. to the point that i decided to stay longer and have dessert. i’m so glad that we did. it was spectacular. again, super simple green apple tart (or more like a green apple upside down), but wow.  i never had apple tart this good and i’m not an apple dessert person.

i’ll be back and hopefully can get a table again. well done. 👍

ps: the chateaubriand steak with potato gratin is an absolute must have.; everything you want from a paris bistrot - not too big, relaxing atmosphere, excellent food featuring many classics, a good but not pretentious wine list. extremely friendly and helpful service. we went on a quiet sunday so it was a little quiet, but i'm sure on a busier day it would have a little more bustle.; recommendations: get the lamb dish and the gratin potatoes side. the tart was lovely for dessert.

the good: the place is nice and staff is very polite. the dishes are a fairly good size and quality.

the not too good: it's a bit expensive for what it is. specially the starters. location is the reason so no big deal. you can enjoy a nice meal here.

here's the menu:; 🍽food -  4 of  5 i ordered beef with bean, which was well done with great sauce. foe deserve i ordered tarte which was ok. i didn't ordered champagne but they accidentally served me one which was so good but didn't know that it was 18€!!!

👨‍🍳service - 4  of 5 kind attentive staff

🏡ambiance - 4  of 5 it was very clean and cute place

💰value -3.5  of 5 my ordered cost me 47€; nice small place with best france food and family atmosphere. like the appetizer item of snails very authentic fence favorite food. also enjoy their duck and veal entries.

name: Bistro 1
vicinity: 4 Rue de l'École de Médecine, Paris
formatted_address: 4 Rue de l'École de Médecine, 75006 Paris, France
reviews: extremely nice place- great food and drinks and friendly service. can absolutely recommend. the cafe gourmand was a great dessert! and it's always great to enjoy a tripel karmeliet from the tap; super delicious food , vine, kind staff, nice place. highly recommend this place.; abusive owner. screaming and shouting, stepping on our shoes, pushing us. it was absolutely unacceptable, stay away from this terrible place!; damn good food if you're after a quick bite to eat! this was my go-to for breakfast during my stay in paris if that tells you anything. the guy working the counter during the day is super likeable, treats you like an actual friend regardless of how many times you've been there!; i just love it. friendly people, cosy vibe and really delicious food.

name: Les Bons Garçons
reviews:
since they are located only a block away my wife and i stopped in on multiple occasions (three).  the drinks are all reasonably proceed and i was able to order a well crafted/prepared negroni the way i like it.

dinner was fantastic.  my wife's entree of salmon was cooked perfectly and of roasted vegetables were tasty.  the delight of it all was my entree of kidneys (can't really find it in the us).  was cooked just to order and tasted fantastic.; last month i went there with my family.
it was so nice cuisines  and wine in a warm and comfortable atmosphere.

only french menu.
but you can use translation papago application and googles 😆

i think this restaurant escargot is so big and good taste. 🫡
and beef steaks and duck cusine also nice.
we can concentrate on our conversation with good cuisine. at that time, i enjoyed french cuisine after i arrived at paris.

thanks for everything and good memories in paris.; really nice place with great service and excellent food.
i can highly reccommend this place.; this lovely bistro was just around the corner from my hotel. i had breakfast twice there and stopped in on 2 other evenings. most of the people working there speak pretty good english. i spent some time with the owner, richard, and he was a very charming and courteous host. the food and coffee were very good. i ended up speaking with some local french ladies during happy hour and they were friendly and engaging. you cannot beat the view since it's on a fairly busy avenue and the eiffel tower is right there. i cannot wait to stop in again on my next visit to paris. j'adore la france et paris!! 🇨🇵; food was good, drinks as well. it was pre-dinner, so the place was empty. waiter was attentive and kind.

name: Brewery Laura
reviews: nice place with artificial chimney for a dinner. cozy atmosphere, decent food; really friendly and helpful owner, patient with our children, and delicious food. lovely atmosphere, very relaxed and pleasant to be in; very good food and prices!; nice caffe good coffee and beer; fantastic!

name: Firmine
reviews:
service and atmosphere were excellent. it’s in a very touristy part of paris by the eiffel tour. the food was good it just didn’t work well for us. the pizza tasted great, the crust was excellent. however it wasn’t cut prior to it arriving at our table which made it difficult to eat with the utensils we were provided.  i gathered this was however normal?; the restaurant's exterior is beautifully adorned with warm string lights and lush greenery, creating an inviting and cozy ambiance that perfectly complements the vibrant atmosphere.

i had alfredo pasta and pizza which was simply delicious. this was served with a mini bread basket. my dish was served in a cute metallic pan with a handle. loved it!

the service was attentive and friendly, making the evening even more enjoyable. whether you're seated indoors or outside, this trattoria offers a perfect setting to savor delicious italian cuisine while soaking in the lively parisian atmosphere. highly recommended for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in the heart of paris!; one word: wow!
a fantastic experience on all levels, from the attractive waitress that greets you in the street (and acknowledges you a day later when you walk by)  to the amazing food and the attentive service staff. david was our waiter and not only made us feel like royalty, but the attention to detail he displayed was second to none. will definitely be back when i’m next in paris.; i discovered a well-located italian restaurant in paris and was thoroughly impressed. the dishes were delicious, with authentic and well-prepared flavors. the prices are fair and in line with local standards. highly recommend a visit!; the location is fantastic—very close to the pick-up and drop-off point for my versailles tour and near the eiffel tower. the ambiance is really nice, and the waiters were quick and efficient. the food was good, not mind-blowing but definitely satisfying. it was a bit pricey, but after a long tour, it was the perfect spot to sit down and relax.

name: In Casa - Paris
reviews:
incredible food and exceptional service! the ambiance was fantastic as well. we tried both pasta and pizza, and they were absolutely perfect—10/10. although the restaurant closes at 11 pm, we arrived around 10 pm and placed a dessert order at 11 pm, and they graciously accommodated us. the staff was incredibly kind and ensured we had a wonderful experience. this is added to my go-to italian place.; we spent a few days in paris and visited them twice - lunch and dinner. the staff are very friendly, we feel easy to communicate and dine in the restaurant. on the day for lunch, we need to go to airport and request them to serve the dishes quicker, it is very nice that they can do it.; we walked in to this place by accident after giving a miss to the tourist traps located near the eiffel tower and this was the best wrong turn we took. amazing food and amazing ambience. located in a quiet street, it was a perfect dinner. staff was super friendly and helpful, plus very fluent in english. definitely would come back of we are in paris!; food was incredible, service was really friendly and restaurant had a good atmosphere. best food we’ve eaten in paris and for a good price. definitely recommend.; restaurant was located near the tower but the street was nice and quiet and very safe. restaurant was not full at all when we arrived around 18:00, the service was good but most importantly the food was delicious and well priced with many options.
highly considered as a nice quiet option that won’t break your bank!

name: Carmine Café
reviews:
you can enjoy spaghetti, pizza, and a variety of other dishes, but the food is just passable—not as delicious as anticipated. the coffee is also average.

on the plus side, the service is attentive, and the atmosphere is pleasant. while i like the place, i don't see a compelling reason to return, especially with so many other cafes nearby to explore.; frog legs were delicious definitely the highlight of our meal! we had one moody waiter which rushed us to order but luckily the waiter who served us after was very friendly and made our experience better.
kids pizza was a very generous size and tasty the steak was bit chewy, beef bourguignon was very tender and falls apart; the creme brulee was the highlight of the meal. the scallops were over seasoned and the fish were over fried. but overall the food was good and worth trying. no need to go back though.; come in for our tea, brilliant restaurant with a lot of options. we walked a little further down the street from the eiffel tower (only a 10 minute walk) and noticed this restaurant offering a variety of things at a more pleasant price compared to the others down the street.
didn't disappoint, service is great, everyone looked after us and was welcoming throughout. recommended place to grab a bite to eat 👌🏼; great vibes, hearty food

carmine café might not serve gourmet dishes, but the food is hearty, enjoyable, and comes in generous portions—just what you need after a day of exploring. the service was excellent, with helpful and friendly staff. what really stood out was the lively atmosphere, fueled by the olympic excitement! with games being shown on projectors, the energy in the café was electric. if you're looking for a place to kick back, enjoy good food, and soak in the buzz of the city, carmine café is a solid choice.

name: Le Corner
reviews:
this place was absolutely amazing. i found it online and decided to give it a go. the food was flavorful and hearty, i had the duck breast which was cooked to a perfect medium and paired very well with the soft baguette. the real star of the show was our waiter. when we first came in he greeted us, he sang songs, and was overall super energetic and kind. after finishing our meal me and my mom left early to go and catch the eiffel tower sparkling, leaving my father to pay at the restaurant. our waiter was so concerned that we had a fight and dramatically left that he gave my dad chocolates (pictured in the photos below) and offered him a amaretto. quality service really goes a long way and le corner fully delivered. go here!!; filet de rumps track was extremely good. the waiter was so nice, we came after 10pm, the kitchen was still open and he was very friendly during our whole time here. the table next to us ordered the burgers and they also looked very good.; this restaurant has a lovely atmosphere. the food was impeccable. we were two people and shared an entrée, had mains, finished with a dessert and had a bottle of wine. the whole meal was under 85€ which is fantastic. all waiters, especially amir, were great. smiling and making us feel at home.  we finished our paris trip here and it was a great way to wrap up our visit to this beautiful city.; went here for dinner.
ordered the escargot which was amazing.
the waiter recommended the entrecote de boeuf which was lovely.
the waiter also suggested some nice red wine which went very well.
the service was excellent, despite my terrible french, the waiter helped me as lot.
overall, great experience, amazing food, wine and service.
merci.; staff were lovely, attentive, informative and friendly, the food was all excellent and we couldn’t fault it. starter, main and dessert were all delicious!
we even had three desserts because we couldn’t decide and all three were delicious! we spent under €100 and that got us both two glasses of wine, a bottle of still water, a starter, main and dessert each, plus another dessert as mentioned!
simply incredible.
also upon ordering wine i’m not expert and the waiter helped me decide. he suggested a red and it was absolutely delicious! they then also wrote it down so i could buy it when i get home.
we would highly recommend it and we would happily return over and over again. we will be suggesting to our friends who visit paris.
faultless.

name: Bistrot Le Poincaré
vicinity: 62 rue de longchamps, 22 Avenue Raymond Poincaré angle du, Paris
formatted_address: 62 rue de longchamps, 22 Av. Raymond Poincaré angle du, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
lovely setting with friendly service. i was craving good french fries and this place excelled at that. the fries were buttery and crispy served with a fantastic mayonnaise. my french onion soup was super cheesy and rich, but not similar to the typical 'brown' onion soup. my husband asked for his steak medium and it was served rare (which is quite typically french) it was a little pricer at 52 euros for the two of us.; i came here in july for dinner and was blown away by the level of care from the staff. the food was also delicious! the escargot were swimming in garlic butter (just how i like it) and the poke salad bowl was nice and fresh. if you go here you must try the nutella tiramisu!! hands down one of the tastiest things i’ve ever eaten! i would go back just for that!! give this place a go before seeing the eiffel tower :); i visited this restaurant near the eiffel tower and decided to try the onion soup since it’s supposed to be quite popular here. unfortunately, the experience was disappointing. the waiter’s attitude and facial expression when we ordered only one item were unpleasant. i paid €13.8 for a single onion soup, which wasn’t worth the price. i don’t recommend this place, even though it’s conveniently located close to the eiffel tower.; hands down the best bistro food we had in paris!

during our 6 days stay in paris bistrot le poincaré happened to be just a few blocks away from our airbnb. one day we stopped there for dinner and liked it so much that came back for lunch on the last day just before going to the airport :)
both times we sat outside, watching passers-by. the service was quick and super friendly.

during our visit to paris we didn't go to upscale/fine dining/michelin restaurants but ate at bistros and cafes similar to bistrot le poincaré. hands down bistrot le poincaré had the best food we tasted in paris! it was very fresh and absolutely delicious on both occasions! presentation was also great like a piece of art! i wish i can visit this place again someday.

we highly recommend bistrot le poincaré if you are in the area!

dishes ordered

avocado toast with smoked salmon, beetroot caviar, feta cheese and egg yolk - this looked beautifully and tasted deliciously!
tuna tataki - this looked beautifully and tasted deliciously!
duck breast orange-flavored honey sauce, spelt risotto with asparagus - duck breast was a bit tough, but very flavorful. risotto was as good as the duck.
beef tartare with herring caviar, smoked oil - excellent. could get a bit more spices imo.
poultry suprême stuffed with truffle and baby spinach with slow-braised baby potatoes - delicious
slow-braised baby potatoes - excellent
chicken burger - good
sea bass fillet, white butter sauce with saffron - delicious!
strawberry pavlova	- perfect
crepe with caramel - excellent french crepe. it was a great last note to part with paris on :); we wanted to try some typical french food, and this was my daughter’s recommendation, and it didn’t disappoint. the food was delicious, and the service was excellent. it’s a little pricier than some places, but you get what you pay for. remember not to order your steak well-done; i said it jokingly, and he gave me a strange look. 😂😂 i do like it medium-rare anyway. take my daughter’s recommendation; it’s worth the money.

name: The Kitchen Champs-Elysees meat and burger viande grillades
reviews:
you get the option to choose the meat cooking from rare to well done.
i got their classic burger, it was delicious halal meat 😋👌.
the burger is served with fries and a lot of packs of ketchup, mayo and mustard.
the staff were very friendly and the service was quick.
the place has an underground floor as well.; it was an interesting experience. we got curry sauce with our grilled mexican chicken and an unknown sauce with the crispy chicken. we had  virgin drinks as the only alcohol option was beer. the salad was good,  the saving grace.  i don't think we'll be back. the service was average, and there's lots of other places to try.; this cozy restaurant has left the best impressions! hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation.
one of the best beef burger i eat in my life the meat is amazing

i recommend to everyone! i would like to come back here again and again.; went to paris for the first time, visited this restaurant and i was impressed, the food came quite fast. the fries were double fried so crunchy but the avocado burger was the star of my dish. nice flavours, combination of the veggies chosen in combination with the medium cooked beef burger, i took my first bite of heaven since this burger just melts into your mouth, loved it 10 outta 10, definitely recommend!!; we did a search for late night kitchens and found this place. it appeared to have good ratings, so we rushed over in a heavy rain storm. when we arrived, i saw a gentleman delivering a plate to a couple sitting at an outside table. when my family attempted to place an order, we were told we could only place an order to go. i offered to pay extra to be able to sit down in the otherwise empty restaurant and avoid the thunderstorm. i once again was told no even though the restaurant was listed as being open for another 30 minutes and i had just witnessed him serve a couple. i’m not sure if this man was a manager or owner, but he was extremely rude, unprofessional, and unwelcoming. i was very hungry, so i ordered, but my family was so offended by his behavior that they refused to order anything. the only difference between my family and the couple who was receiving friendly service was they were muslim and we are american. the man appeared to be of similar background to the muslim couple and was very friendly and allowed them to sit and enjoy their food. i believe we were victims of blatant discrimination. all customers should be treated fairly regardless of religion, ethnicity, or nationality. his behavior is totally unacceptable. we are here for the olympics as are thousands of other non-muslim americans. we all should be treated kindly. in addition to the discrimination, we had some serious issues with the food. i ordered a cheeseburger and it was burned. i couldn’t finish it because every bite tasted like burned bread. the fries were soggy and unseasoned. my salad was flavorless. i could only eat a few bites of the cheeseburger and the rest went into the trash. i could have at least enjoyed the food if i was going to be forced to endure blatant discrimination. it’s zero stars for me.

name: Mokus l'Écureuil
reviews:
wow and more wow ... waiter fantastic, food fantastic, service fantastic,  the waiters english was perfect and he was probably the most friendliest person i have ever met in france 🇫🇷. we had pizza 🍕 x5 and garlic bread and a ravioli with beef ... all in all my kids loved it and we paid 140€ for 6 people...totally acceptable for paris. i wish everyone a lovely meal with the family or friends. check out my pics and videos...nearly forgot the toilets are amusing 😄; food is delicious. definitely one of the best if not the best ravioli i ever had. however portions are a bit small for the price. waitresd seemed to forget some of the stuff we asked for. vibes were great in the place. best of all... the bathrooms are very cool.; super friendly service. tasty food and delicious drinks. very busy but waitstaff handled everything with pleasant efficiency.  the decor, especially the bathroom (seriously), is worth a stop by itself 😆; we popped into your restaurant by accident. it turned out to be one of the best lunches we had during our stay in paris   the caesar salad with chicken was amazing, but the best was the raviolis, spinach and cream sauce, so delicious. we know we will come back to paris and we will come sit at the bar same. and have lunch; it’s a nice and cozy place to get pizza. the service is good and quick, waiting time for food to be served absolutely adequate, the same about the prices. pizza was good, we enjoyed spending a bit of time at this place before continuing to explore the city.
i see that lots of people mention toilets in their reviews, i’ll add a note on that too. they look futuristic and impressive, that’s totally true

name: La place Longchamp
reviews:
really nice restaurant. the food was pretty good. steak was tasty and the fish was delicious. nice indoor space and some outside tables. i don't think they have air conditioning.; very pleasant staff, good food and wine and a lovely terrace on a pleasant street near the place de mexico with nearby eiffel tower views.; bonjour
the last i had dinner here, it was in 2019 with my husband and today its 5 year back again in the same table and restaurant…. the standard, intimacy and ur special design menu is still the same.. i forgot the name of the waiter but he said he’s from 🇸🇳 ( senegal) he was professional and assist in take us through the menu.. thank you for making my stay to be special 💯; cozy restaurant with very polite and friendly staff. in my opinion this place have a cross over between french and asian food. the beef filet with pepper sauce was awesome, very yummy. i also tried the beef "crying tiger" style, fried noodle with vegetables and that was also really good.; i could not be more thrilled to make a post about la place longchamp in paris. the ambiance was perfect, the staff was so classy, inviting and warm and finally the food was delicious.

for our stater we ordered (not pictured) the salmon ceviche and the chicken steamed dumplings — you should get both of these things!!!

for our main course we ordered (pictured) the grilled sea bass and crying tiger and finally capped off the meal with the most delicious brioche bread covered in caramel drizzle and a side of vanilla ice cream.

the chef clearly used curated, high quality, seasonal ingredients to prepare the meal and it was prepared with a  touch only a french culinary expert could apply.

name: Crêpe Station
reviews:
**hole-in-the-wall**

place is very small so order for take out!!

food was delicious!! they have both savory and sweet crepes along with hotdogs and paninis!

i ordered the
-bombay crepe (savory) - non spicy, eggs, chicken, sauteed bell peppers, cheddar cheese
-and the build your own bubble waffle with nutella, crunch and banana 10/10!!
that was for both me and my fiance and we are satisfied!! it only took like 5 mins for them to make and bring out! i will definitely come again before my trip ends!

they have english speaking crew but definitely learn some french!

10/23/24
opens at 11am
no bathrooms
small sitting area (order for take out)
no parking enjoy the walk
literal hole in the wall; we went to this place to get some dinner for evening. sadly the waffles were not available, but they had other options that did not disappoint. we ordered a hotdog and some crepes to go. the wait was less than 10 minutes for the food to get prepared. it was presented in some nice paper containers and a bag to carry the food back to the hotel. i appreciate when businesses use environmental friendly materials like paper and not styrofoam.

the crepes were delicious and the hotdog was a hit for my son. i would definitely eat here again when i’m in paris again.; roaming the streets of paris, exhausted us.
finally found this little place in the crowded lanes of paris.
the guy was amazingly friendly. humble and patiently explained all the items
we ordered xl tachos and crepe.
frankly it was just average food. nothing special.
it just did the job.; really nice crepe! i chose the kentucky one! good price for a really tasty crepe! also, i took the milkshake and it was one of the greatest i have drunk! the employee was very kind! i would recommend it to everyone!; tiny but cozy crepe place! we went twice already, once for dinner and another time for dessert. you can choose your own toppings. service is quick and polite. the crepes itself are fresh and crispy. loved every bite! we plan to go again for another dessert crepe 😁

name: Bar Gustave
formatted_address: 23 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
nice spot to stop for lunch after walking around the eiffel tower area. lots of outdoor seating. pretty good quiche as well. frites were excellent. the staff spoke english and were friendly but they weren't overly inviting when we walked up. decent selection of wine and beer as well.; excellent staff and service. ask for suraj, he is very friendly and attentive to your dining needs. speaks good english as well. smiles a lot, made our last night in paris fun too. goes the same for the rest of the staff, they are happy to serve.

very near eiffel, good seating spot, right at the street corner. we ordered the onion soup, house wine, the roasted chicken and mixed cheese and cold cuts. good food servicing portions too.

service water available as well.; the dishes wasn't washed well. keep in mind that you have a chance to eat while garbage truck will be picking up the garbage right in front of you, as it was in my case. small tables.
the food was ok, for the office they ask could be better. price per person around $35 (sep 2024); we went for lunch on a very busy weekend. staff were amazing. it was a packed but still the staff were polite and tried their best to get the orders out fast. the omelette was okay but the soup was very good.; food was really good, especially the onion soup and quiche! but service is really slow… it took us at least 20min to get a waiter to take our order, which is bad. we sat inside and there was only one waiter for the entire area, however we noticed that they had multiple waiters outside. maybe you will receive a better service outside… i don’t think we would come back unless they improve their service.

name: La Casa di Alfio
formatted_address: 43 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
first time giving a google review which should say a lot for the restaurant. went after reading the google reviews and immediately regretted it. regretted also not listening to my partner of getting up and going to another restaurant.

the service: they have a service charge for this but the waiter is extremely rude. this was a personal experience and of course can be different for people. maybe he was having a bad day but honestly really took away from our night.

the food: i didn’t like it, comparing to the dishes i had in italy so wasn’t an authentic italian experience otherwise ok

the issue we had: we did have an issue with our pizza where we did not want pork and they added ham to it. there was a miscommunication which is fine and of course can happen, but the waiters kept discussing ham this and that loudly which made us extremely awkward in front of everyone. will never come to this place again. couldn’t even finish the spaghetti. 1/5 from me. only gave 2 stars because they changed the pizza.; really good! food was fantastic. i ate a gnocchi with truffle
