service out of this world. we met two staff - jonas and and another staff i can’t spell his name, they were amazing. jonas was sympathetic and went beyond his role to make our time here a special moment 😊; we stopped by here at about 11:30 p.m. we saw they had good reviews. the pizza was absolutely delicious! it is pretty pricy, i had a coke it was about 11 euros, that's nuts! paris is very expensive. the atmosphere was good. the service was very good!; amazing restaurant! perfect distance from the eiffel tower, and an amazing place to stop by if you’re a tourist or traveling. the service here stood out the most and is a staple of the restaurant. you won’t want to miss out!; the guys were super sweet and friendly, they were not only funny but very friendly. the ambient was super exiting yet very relaxing.

name: Petite Forêt
reviews: so happy to have found this wonderful, much needed, welcoming space for moms and babies in the middle of the hectic (not always child-friendly) city of paris. lots of room, clean space, friendly staff, cute children’s products. and the coffee is always great!!! i also cannot wait to try the classes once my baby is a bit older. thank you for creating this haven for parents and kids!!!; the perfect cafe if you're in central paris with small children. gives the children a chance to run around, play, relax with books and enjoy a meal. staff very friendly. the menu is a little limited for savoury meals.; great little cafe if you have little ones. the staff are incredibly friendly! the coffee was good and the food was fantastic. we had a salad and a pesto pasta, while our 1-year-old loved the tomato pasta. the baby change and bathroom facilities are great, especially for kids.; there's no other place like petite forêt in paris. kids and families are not only welcome but it's a paradise, especially made for them. you can enjoy a hot (!) drink and a cake with delicious berries while the little ones play with the many beautiful and high quality, wooden toys, books etc. there're several stokke highchairs with different seats (yes, infant seats as well!) to make it more comfortable for everyone, playmat for the littlest, lots of space for the kiddos to play and move around, proper parking space for the pushchairs, delicious tea, coffee and cakes on the (expanding) menu, healthy snack and drinks for the children and honestly, i could just keep going on. the founders, laura and kaja are very kind and attentive who created the most amazing place for families. did i mention  there's a bf pillow, changing table, several children's size toilets, all in a beautiful, clean and hygienic bathroom? seriously, the list goes on.; i had the luck to find this lovely café just after they opened. inside it’s spacious and full of light, and very family/child friendly. i enjoyed the small touches, like how pretty all of their ceramics (plates/bowls/cups) are. both my latte and cinnamon brioche were delicious. i’m curious to see what kind of ateliers they will offer in the future - i’ll definitely be back!

name: Ducale Café
reviews:
this quaint little restaurant is amazing.  great selection, great staff and best cappuccino we’ve had in paris so far.  i recommend you visit this little gem, it has a great atmosphere.

we only had a brunch but all meals that came out looked amazing and the staff are so attentive.; look no further for the local cafe experience. this is not the cafe with staff in white uniform and different roles. and fancy computer screens catering to tourists at the 30 euro per plate range. nor is it overly casual that they don’t care for tourist business. our host was capable in english but remained courteous and polite to engage with me in my intermediate french. he was professional, personable and helpful.

the food was fantastic, customised to our requests (putting things on the side, avoiding dairy/egg contact, beef cooking levels), and served at the same time with attention and purpose from the staff. plates were in the sub 20 euro range, very reasonable portions and well prepared. it is only steps away from trocadero and because it is 1-2 blocks up from the main roundabout, prices were 10 euro cheaper per plate.

the beef tartare was excellent, well-mixed, and served at a lightly cool temperature, served with salad and fries. duck confit and rump steak both cooked perfectly.

great for families as we didn’t want to be overly pampered from eager wait staff, nor rushed out and didn’t want to pay too much.

the only downside is that the cigarette smoke from the customers sitting outside kept blowing inside towards us. but that is a paris-wide cafe issue.

highly recommended and would love to visit again.; stopped by for drinks and dessert.  it was divine.  great little spot and not overrun with tourists.  appreciated the diverse menu but stuck with crème brûlée.  it was really good, paired with a nice beverage and wonderful people watching (dog watching too 😊).; excellent food and service. i had the special of the day, sausage with cheesy mash. didn’t look amazing but tasted unbelievable. delicious soup, mozzarella sticks, steak, salad and burger too, finished with a generous serving of crepe. definitely recommend.; we had salmon and a burger. they accommodated gluten free. we had a wonderfull fresh fig desert with ice cream. a nice atmosphere in a pub.

name: Café Kléber
vicinity: 4 Place du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, Paris
formatted_address: 4 Pl. du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, 75116 Paris, France
reviews: wow just wow! we had the most amazing experience here earlier today. we were seated immediately and waited on within 5 minutes. the french onion soup was absolutely amazing i would definitely recommend it to anyone! and the desserts were so light and fluffy. our waiter was so lovely, friendly and had really good english. if you’re looking for somewhere reasonably priced with amazing food, this is your place!; friendly and very french café. waiter was a good laugh too he was joking with the kids..kids all enjoyed crepes and ice cream. there was good looking lamb shanks coming out of the kitchen. onion soup was nice but lack a little depth of flavour and the bread on top was t crunchy and a bit heavy on the cheese. despite this i finished it all. interior surroundings were bright and airy with wood panelling. toilets we a bit of a let down very small a bit smelly and there was no toilet roll or napkins to dry. hand dryer wasn't working either. maybe i was just unlucky.; we were very happy with our late evening dinner here. the staff were nice, friendly, and professional. we ordered the warm goal cheese salad and the mushroom pasta with crispy chicken - both were great. plus the street-side ambience is a plus. definitely recommend.; it is just near the trocadero metro station which is nice. just a few moments from the perfect spot for a photo of the eiffel tower. the service is great if you speak french. that sums up all the positives. food quality is below average but you pay for location. see the onion soup and judge by yourself.; as a visitor to paris, it’s always a bit hard to choose the restaurant and you really hope you are served with best food. we visited this restaurant on sunday afternoon and came out with mixed feelings. basically we were 3 people and ordered 3 dishes. fish & chips and prawns was really good but chicken was absolute tasteless (disappointing). and lastly toilet is in terrible conditions, definitely needs some attention there! i wanted to give 4 star but chicken and toilet brought it down! worth mentioning staffs are very welcoming and doing a brilliant job keeping the guests happy.

name: Terres de Café
formatted_address: 67 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
great coffee and cakes selection. i had a latte with lemon cake which was fantastic. the service was great and very helpful. they also sold decaffeinated coffee. they have a vast selection of beans for sale. ethiopian, kenyan, rwandan, and south american.; the coffee is ok, but nothing special. 2,9€ for an expresso is the double as compared with italy. but you are near eiffel  tower. can be quite crowded. did not taste the cookies. toilets are clean.; always very polite and very kind staff🫶 their coffee is exceptional in this district! ☕️; really great coffee, they use their own roasted beans. also close to the eiffel tower if you want to take a walk and enjoy the fresh air. the cafe itself is also very cozy :); the coffee is really good but quite expensive and you have to pay for plant milk.
at least it was very tasty and near to the tower. the staff was also very nice

name: Café Belloy
reviews:
great spot for coffee, pizza or breakfast. we went early for breakfast and they had no eggs since they get everything fresh everyday, which is a good thing! also tried their pizza and it was good.; once we arrived the person at the door was very friendly and spoke english very well, even cracked a couple of jokes and got us seated.
we wanted to try frog legs and snails, when we ordered the waiter seemed to get offended and his mannerism became rude.
the food seemed well prepared and served beautifully.

prices:
snails 25€
frog legs 15€
tourist scam: water bottle 9€; we had a wonderful breakfast here during our time at the olympics. there were enough seats for bigger groups, we could move tables together. the service was very quick and friendly, especially nordine was communicative and offered excellent service for us - thank you!; hello! two years ago we ate delicious onion soup at your restaurant! and this year we will happily return to you for onion soup 😃 ​​tell me, is it still on the menu?; jeb was our server and was very attentive. lovely food and the atmosphere was amazing

name: Grand Café Capucines
reviews:
suggested by a store nearby so we went and had lunch.

very pricy for what it is. you pay for the location and all the waiters running around. some were friendly but the one who took our order was rude.

we ordered mussels with chablis wine (i’m from the chablis area,, very good wine), couldn’t taste the wine at all, you find better in cheaper restaurants.
got the salmon with spinach, good but pricy, nothing extraordinary about it.
got a goat cheese salad for the appetizer, no real taste to it, had to add pepper on each bite so it would taste like something and asked for olive oil to also add some taste to it, the oil barely tasted like olives.

originally wanted the veal dish but the rude waiter simply and rudely said i don’t have that.
got a steak with pepper sauce instead, i asked for it very well done, it was cut in the middle to cook it well i’m guessing but even with that it was pink inside. very well done means very cooked. it doesn’t matter if you don’t eat your meat like that or it’s sacrilege for the cook, i’m the one who will eat it. and for 45€ steak with fries you can’t cook it well done without opening it in the middle or even opened for that matter ?!?! you should be able to cook a thick steak very well done for the price and that kind of establishment.
the pepper sauce didn’t have any pepper taste to it.

we will never go back to pay over priced food. food is not bad it’s just the overall experience and again  very pricy.; we had a great time. we were running late, but they held our table. the veal was amazing. try the fresh seafood platter with raw oysters.; this is one of paris most authentic restaurants (of course a little touristy) but perfect to get the full on experience. the escargots were amazing, same as the steak and frites. good atmosphere, beautiful decor and very relaxed setting!
thumbs up!; our service was perfect and the meal was absolutely delicious. i had sea bass and my daughter had salmon tartar. the parisian onion soup was likely the best i’ve ever had. my daughter experienced her first ever escargot here and she admitted she loved the flavor it had an earthiness that was brought out by the herbs, garlic, and butter. for dessert my daughter ordered crepes flambé and she was able to watch as our server prepared it which delighted her. thank you so much for the experience and we look forward to dining with you again in october.; the food is excellent especially the seafood. the service is great and friendly! appreciate the hospitality and if there is a bathroom at downstairs that would be perfect!

name: Café Dauphine
reviews:
friendliest and most pleasant service we've ever experienced in our many trips to paris.  the food is great and prices 30-40% less than the touristy-snobby restaurants a few blocks away.  the dining area is small but the 2 persons tables are large and well spaced, and chairs super comfortable.  such a wonderful discovery.; quiet cafe in a side street.  i wish i'd discovered it earlier on my trip to paris!  great spot in the morning, with a comfortable vibe, good coffee, and reasonable prices.; very good breakfast. not as fresh as another cafe we love but definitely it bad. great big breakfast with lots of choices. great ambiance inside.; what a great place! the food was delicious and the service was very good. i really enjoyed the de experience.; damn it’s cold in paris, but this cafe has amazingly cheesy hot french onion soup and hot mulled wine! a real life saver!
great atmosphere at lunch.

name: L'Abreuvoir
formatted_address: 24 Rue du Dr Finlay, 75015 Paris, France
reviews: after a long day of walking at the palace of versailles, we were hungry and ready to eat. l’abreuvoir hit the spot! we started off our dining experience with a variety of cheeses and cured meats. each one in different combinations was incredible and the mixed salad in the middle was also delicious. i also did order probably my favorite espresso i had had in paris here. as far as our meals went, my wife had the chicken cutlet burger sandwich which was absolutely huge. ton of flavor and the fries were also super crispy. my dish i wish i could remember the name, was a fish dish that was delicious. it had a ton of veggies and gnocchi on the bottom that was cooked to perfection. the fish was soft and had a ton of flavor. i was incredibly impressed overall with this place and would happily go again on my next visit.; if you're visiting from the us and don't speak the language, the staff here speak english. reasonable wait time for the food and we're seated quickly as we arrived near opening time. my brother and father had the gus burger, which comes with fries, and it was a good size as well as delicious. the caffe gourmand was also delightful, and it came with pastries. myself, i got the ribs (travers de cochon des montagnes), and i was absolutely blown away by the flavor. i don't like mushrooms, but the shiitake mushrooms were delicious as well as the rest of the dish. not only that, it was really filling. it's also within walking distance to the eiffel tower. would definitely recommend it. first time enjoying french cuisine and was thoroughly impressed.; popped in here on a whim while in paris, delicious food we got the chicken karaage for start i got the pulled pork burger (amazing) and i got myself a cheeky mojito too, the staff were so friendly and welcoming despite us not speaking french. would definitely return again.; the employees are very friendly. food is great! great service. definitely recommend here if you are near eiffel tower. meal of the day is great!! great salads!!; highly recommended, if you are near the eiffel tower and try out this cafe and 3 dishes above pics. saibai salad very refreshing smoke salmon fruit and salad 👍👍!

name: Tivoli
reviews:
first night in paris we walked by this restaurant and decided to try, i wanted pizza!  good decision!  very nice staff and the food was superb. pizza was just the right balance of sauce and thin crust and the grilled octopus with mushroom risotto was excellent. we were going to go back another night but ran out of time. next visit definitely!; stopped here for lunch with a friend without a reservation. staff were attentive and the very friendly. large variety of different dishes on the menu, quality of the food was average. lovely outdoor seating terrace in courtyard away from the road. child friendly  and would work perfectly for a large outdoor meal with family but equally charming for a date night in a couple.; my visit to this restaurant was disappointing overall. the service was not very friendly and left a lot to be desired. the food was mediocre: the pasta with fresh herbs tasted okay, but the crumbly parmesan was not very appetising. it came with water and bread, which is a positive thing.

a major annoyance was the belgian beer, which at €10 per 0.5 litre was not only expensive but also of poor quality. the table outside was wobbly and made it very uncomfortable during the meal.

in addition, the service was inattentive: i was neither asked how the food tasted nor whether i would like a dessert. the plates were cleared without comment. overall, the experience was disappointing and not recommended.; the seafood linguine was delicious, the bordeaux wonderful, and the tiramisu a delightful finish. very friendly and attentive waitstaff as well. would recommend.; the worst restaurant! it has to be an italian restaurant but the pasta and pizza are clearly not italian. the carbonara is made with cream that’s not a real italian recepie. the parmesan is moldy. the lemonade is not real, it’s from a bottle and it tates like schweppes. never eating here again!!

name: Gran Caffe Convivium : Restaurant Italien Paris 08
reviews:
this was hands down my favorite restaurant i visited during my time in paris! from the food to the service, everything was top tier. you will not regret eating here. the food was absolutely mouth watering and delicious. the truffle pasta stole the show - i’ve never had anything like it. we also ordered zanotti and fendy pizza, both delicious as well.

i was also celebrating a friend’s birthday and they were so sweet and accommodating by bringing out dessert (tiramisu with nutella) with a candle and singing with us. it was such a wholesome moment and i was glad to have such great service. also, that tiramisu melted into my mouth like no other. it’s truly the most delicious tiramisu i’ve ever had. everything is top tier here, you absolutely have to go and try this!! a huge thank you to francesco, our server, who was an absolute gem! au revoir paris, i’ll be back soon 🤍; the salmon lasagna was good. the mussels pot with sicilian style sucks, mussels were tiny, some of them went bad and smelly… we told the waiter the issues and he brought the dish to the chef and the chef claimed it’s fresh. we didn’t want the dish and asked him to return, but ended up they still charge us at a full price. this particular incident marred our overall experience.; i am rating this restaurant for the excellent service

antorino , thank you

the coffee amazing; food was delicious, the service was perfect..

highly recommend; excellent italian food.
if you want to enjoy expensive but delicious food then this place is for you.

name: Exotica
reviews:
no offence but i not a huge fan of lebanese cuisine but their dishes were so delicious that i absolutely loved them. the tastiest hummus i ever had 👌

the grills were perfectly cooked, proper juicy and full of taste. it is located at such a perfect place, was only a few hundreds meter from the hotel we were staying and it is right next to metro station as well.

the name of the hotel doesn't seems halal but all the dishes are absolutely halal 😄; excellent shawarma in paris, would definitely be comparable or better than that of ottawa/toronto. the meat was slightly dry however. but the flavoured hummus was really good if you order under the exotic plates. good choice of meats as well. would recommend.; the food was delicious. i love their french fries… very crispy. the owners/staff were very kind. the only negative was there was a lot of smoke coming from people smoking near the door.; outside of lebanon, there are now two places that you can find good lebanese food……

1) park royal (a406 london) and….
2) exotica, paris.

well done keep it up.; if you love middle eastern food — hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbouleh, baklava — this is your place! came here two nights in a row because it was that good. generous portion sizes for a good price and amazing quality. food tastes very homemade. people are lovely and service is fast.

name: Bocamexa Odéon - restaurant mexicain
formatted_address: 59 Rue Saint-André des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
very good and delicious—highly recommended!

the hottest sauce is really hot, even if you’re from thailand.; their boeuf barbacoa are the best, well seasoned and not too salty! got their quesadillas last time it was melted and savory. coming back for the tacos and nachos, as expected they were so good! even my friend loved their bowls. the guacamole is just as fresh as it can be. and to mention, the service just as good! one more thing, their spicy sauce is a real deal!; the tacos were nice, all meat version were pretty good, but the tortilla was a bit cold.
we got level two and three sauces and both were very good with all we ordered. i would give it another try.; solid and tasty, was worth the price. they have a variety of vegetarian options.; really delicious tacos and salsas.  we tried all the meats which were flavorful and lean.  the salsas were delicious we tried 3 including the diablo which was really hot but delicious!  we would come again.

name: Big Fernand
reviews:
really a pleasant experience. kind staff and the burger is amazing. i've eaten the big fernand and the meat was amazing. outstanding product for a reasonable price compare to paris average. water, fries and a big burger with double patty and cheese (the cheese was super as weel as the meat) for 24 euro. good job guys!; went for lunch as recommended to us.
was very disappointed with the meal. the burger wasn't the hottest to start with, the bap tasted uncooked and yeast like. (toasted would have been better) the meat was pretty tasteless no salt and pepper. the chips, some were hot, warm, cold, and even a burnt one. so if they were fried fresh to order all should be the same. sadly i can't recommend it.; its okay, when it comes to the smash burger, at first the cheese hits you with a nice flavor (or not) as it tastes unique, then the rest is your typical burger that you might have tasted much better elsewhere.
staff are friendly.
atmosphere isn’t the best, tables not the cleanest, and the general decoration gives off a weird ikea like shop-work shop vibe which does not make sense and add anything to the dining experience.
summary, not impressed nor am i bothered by the experience, simply doubt i would visit again.
can be a good option for budget travelers however.; great little burger place we came across while walking to the sights. the staff was very jovial and the service was fast. the food was solid, not mind blowing but defiantly solid. they had this homemade ketchup i’m assuming as it was in a self labeled jar but wherever they got it, that stuff was on point. the fries were coated with paprika which was new to me but defiantly tasty.; super friendly staff with a great french concept. the "hamburgés" are very good and fries aswell. just a little bit cold hence the 4 stars. their own soda is great!

name: Le Président
formatted_address: 59 Av. Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 75008 Paris, France
reviews:
we are americans visiting paris and enjoyed this place very much. i ordered an iced latte and it was delicious. we also ordered the meat and cheese plate to share, as well as a side of fries. the service, food, and drinks made for a pleasant time. they also had clean toilets. i’m really happy we stopped here before we kicked off our evening in paris.; every thing is fine. the day we came was the olympic parade, lots of restaurants were closed and happily we found here.; my wife and i loved this place. the food was delicious and the staff were super friendly even with my half decent french. would highly recommend. ask for the espresso martini! best i've had in a long while.; this restaurant had thee best food during our trip to paris for the 2024 olympics. we had the fish & chips,  croque monsieur, caesar presidente salad (it had fried chicken on top) & the tartin tart for dessert. everything was delicious!! we got to watch the france 🇫🇷/germany 🇩🇪 basketball game, the men's 200m 👟🥈🥉  & some of the usa 🇺🇸/serbia 🇷🇸 basketball 🏀 game while we were there. the staff was so nice & patient because we were there for over 5 hours. we made sure to order more food and drink while we there watching the competitions.  we even helped cheer on the france 🇫🇷 team with the other patrons & told passersby to come in and eat, which they did. i'd definitely recommend ke presidente when traveling to paris.
#intheseparisienestreets; food and service was amazing. my family and i are visiting from usa and really enjoyed their food. would definitely come back if i had the opportunity.

name: Les Nouilles Dansantes
reviews:
the atmosphere is very nice, the service is good, they bring the dishes quite quickly. the food is good and in large portions and it also costs less than the dishes of other restaurants. overall it is a great restaurant that i recommend to people who want to eat or experience oriental food.😋; best fried noodles i have had! 10/10 best thing we had in paris. it was so good, we had it twice in one day! we sat down for lunch then we took takeout for dinner, back to our hotel!; absolutely delicious! great service. must check it out. the noodles are freshly made and are a must try! quite reasonably priced and big portions. we had the duck and rice and the spicy chicken and noodles.

it was so good we went for lunch the next day. this time crispy chicken and noodles.

absolutely delicious!; just perfect! the most tasty soup i've ever had.
perfect service and nice atmosphere. price/ value ratio is great. i know its more or less usual asian food, but this here is really high quality and really tastey.; love the food, services were also fast and good. highly recommended if u miss asian food in a foreign country😊

name: Birdy
reviews:
i went to birdy burger restaurant before work this afternoon and ordered their special of the month, the olympic burger, as a meal with coke zero and chips.

firstly, i need to say the burger came to my table in less than 10 minutes—the service was impressively fast! the taste of the burger was good, and i enjoyed it. the chips were normal, nothing particularly special.

they provided a bottle of water with my meal, which was a nice touch, but it didn’t add much to the overall experience. however, they forgot to give me some napkins, but that wasn’t a big problem.

overall, i enjoyed my visit, and i think birdy burger is a good option for a quick takeaway.; if you want a classic american styled cheeseburger in paris, this is it.

portions were generous and everything about the burger was done to perfection.

and oh yes, don’t forget to order the peanut butter milkshake.; take away cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. had to wait about thirty minutes as they were busy. but oh my gosh, what a burger. well worth the wait. chips were ok, but burger was out of this world. highly recommend.; amazing experience at birdy! when you go for a fast food you expect a basic service but the veggie burger was absolutely amazing. very great burgers, great service, super fun team! great food i will come back any time i’m in paris! +1 for the milkshake; very friendly service from the staff at birdy.
they welcomed me very warmly and explained their concept and different type of burgers.

the burger and fries were good but nothing out of the common. i ordered the yankee and it was ok.

i feel prices are extremely high for the size and type of the hamburger’s.

19€ for a burger, drink and fries see to me very expensive.

name: La Bête Noire
reviews:
nice breakfast but i was expecting more following the review. raspberry cake and cheese toast were average, even though service was nice.; this is our favorite little spot to eat in paris. the food is exquisite. the pastries are unique, never relying on very much sweetness but so interesting. we haven't yet met the cook but can imagine how inspired she must be. and the server we always see is utterly welcoming.; la bête noire is a wonderful little café/restaurant in front of port royal.
i have only been for café and pastries (twice), so i can only comment on that. great quality coffee. they have some massive fresh scones that are very nice as well. there is a selection of freshly baked cakes and other pattisseries. i really like it.
customer service is prime. the staff members always explain everything in detail and are super nice; always a good conversation.
the environment is nice. it’s calm. they have temporary art exhibitions from upcoming artists on their walls (for sale), which is interesting.
100% recommended !!; this is the best brunch restaurant in paris so far. the server was very kind and the food was excellent. please go and try!; lovely little corner cafe tucked away in a small alleyway. went for a small breakfast. eggs were boiled in perfection, simple cakes and breads were not too sweet. the scone was slightly too dry and hard but an  easy going atmosphere. i loved the rough rustic interior. also dog friendly.

name: La Terrasse de Madame
reviews:
nice place with awful service and less than average food but with high prices!
ripe off in our view. we waited for ages until our order was taken even if it was not full. they took the order wrongly, didn’t bring water. not worth going.; i decided to go into the restaurant because of its nice looks, however i found a huge disappointment. even though their staff was very nice, that did not make up for the immense lack of quality. i ordered the “entrecôte”, which was probably the worst meat i’ve ever been served. it was full of fat pieces that made it hard to cut. not only that, but they brought it too me surprisingly fast and completely cold. which only means it was pre-grilled, who knows when..  mind you, this was a 26€ plate. conclusion: tourist trap; most of the staff are very rude and the food is bellow average. the luxembourg  burger we ordered is the worst burger i have had in my life, the meat is unsalted and not tasty in general. the food is not fresh and the prices are very high for what you get.; we had pain au chocolate with hot drink for €6.80! it was horrible! the pain au chocolate wasn’t crispy and tasted like old (even the ones you find in a fast food is 100 times better)!
such a nice place but with horrible food and expensive!; located in a dream place. taking a meal in the middle of the garden is just gorgeous. the dishes are not spectacular, quite the reverse, but they make the deal. price is not as crazy as one might expect. if you're a tourist and you can afford a 17€ hamburger, go ahead.

name: Take Otac - Pasteur Necker
reviews: very fast service. i got some tasty quesadillas and my friends got the trio of mini tacos. great value for money.; the best burrito! for real., so delicious, a lot of ingredients inside, all that you need + cheesy cheddar nachos, if you take the menu. with the spicy sauce "valentina" makes the perfect harmony. yumm😋 🌯; best mexican food north of the equator. make sure to try the desert and home made chili sauce. jummy!; really great halal mexican food in paris; best burrito ive had in my entire lifeeeeeeee like literally 🤌🏻

name: inavoué restaurant
reviews: if you plan to come here in the evening make a reservation! this area is a popular evening dining spot especially with all the outdoor seating. the service was a little slow but there didn't seem to be many people working. the food was really interesting but very delicious. the fries and bacon bits were a little lackluster, i was expecting way more bacon. i enjoyed the wine selection and it wasn't too pricey to eat here.; a very good address for a quiet brunch in a soothing setting. it's a pity that some dishes weren't available at the time, but otherwise it's delicious.; brilliant place for brunch, excellent set menu. friendly and helpful staff, lovely atmosphere in the courtyard. delicious coffee, pastries, and the salmon bagel i had was superb. great value for money and will definitely be coming back next time i'm in paris!; we had a brunch and it was very good. i recommend; incredible food. three course fixed menu but you have flexibility within each category. great ambiance

name: Le BK restaurant
reviews:
i will start reviewing the service because it’s the thing that caught my attention to most.
excellent service and extremely lovely staff !
the menu is a brunch kind of menu, but they offer the food for the whole day .
i had the chicken burger, and it was very good!
for drinks i had matcha , it was good.
finally, i got panna cotta as a dessert, and i can say that it was the best part of the meal !; the food was tasty and the waiter that served me (who was the barista too) was really nice and welcoming. the ambiance is nice, but the room was a bit hot.; delicious food and nice staff; we didn’t even get to eat and by the time we did seated we wanted to leave. they made my girlfriend and i wait at the entrance for 20 minutes to seat us. there were multiple empty tables but instead of just seating us and letting us look at the menu while they did whatever it was they needed to do they made us stand and wait. when we finally got seated we got seated inbetween two tables that were so close it felt like a family dinner. our waiter forgot my utensils but remembered those of the customers that lined up behind us over the 20 minute wait. they also ran out or just flat out didn’t give me a menu and so while my girlfriend was looking over the food i was sat doing nothing. after a couple minutes of waiting for a menu we decided to leave. do better and manage your time better.; not at all special. waiter was not friendly and the place did not look nice. pizza was disappointing and the pasta was abysmal. definitely would not recommend. there are many other places for a decent pizza.

name: L'INSPIRATION
reviews: we just stopped here for a drink. the place is very nice and friendly staff! next time we’ll try the food; not cheap and vegan options are non-existent (not even soy milk). but the decor is attractive, the staff is attentive, and you're welcome to bring cakes from nearby shops and enjoy them here.; rice with “crying tiger” angus beef, delicious!! and reasonable price!! 😋😋; honestly excellent food and service. we came in hungry from a long flight and sarah did a wonderful job helping us understand the best menu options. we will be back!; beautiful place. the food was delicious and the staff was very welcoming - we poorly tried to speak french and they were fine speaking to us in english and even tried some spanish. loved it!

name: Le Petit Falguière
reviews:
we are happy when we discover a place like this almost by chance (it is the location of the already well-rated pg's bar)
here, homemade, by the cook, who also does everything else... welcome, service etc...
we really enjoy it for a fairly low total price.
go go go!

name: Les Gamins Paris 15
reviews: first meal out in our paris adventure. friendly staff, plenty to choose on the menu. i had croque mosieur and my daughter had a take on caesar salad. both were generous portions and very tasty. highly recommend.; a wonderful casual place to eat and drink with delicious dinners and delightful deserts.  very friendly staff, great music, food and drink. weekend and weekday evenings are a delight.  just two blocks from our hotel.  will be back again.; unable to give clear rating as we only called in for a drink. happy hour between 4 and 8pm which gives a big discount on the normal drink price but only a very select few drinks; nice moment, staff, food and wine. recommend duck breast!; great hospitality

name: ENZAFAMIGLIA - LOUVRE
reviews:
very nice pizzeria near the louvre museum. the bruschetta was good but a bit over oiled. pizza was delicious. other nearby diners had salads which also looked delicious. there is some seating inside on the main floor and more seating on the 2nd floor. staff was very friendly and they spoke good english (asked me not to speak french lol) i would eat here again.; we found the restaurant by complete accident, when we were looking for some pasta near louvre. the whole experience was stunning and the food delicious. we would be glad to find out the name of our waiter, who came from romania. he was truly helpful, friendly and he made the whole food experience even more pleasant.; beautiful tasty food and service at enza famiglia. we highly recommend. we had pasta carbonara, arancini, bruscetta and tiramisu - all amazing. staff is so friendly and helpful and really go out of their way to make sure you're happy.; absolutely best italian food we’ve ever had outside of italy! no cream in the cacio pepe or carbonara just like it’s supposed to be made🙌🏼👏🏻 absolutely delicious. very relaxing atmosphere, they have delicious butter noodles for our little one and as it started to rain they let us go in to a new table inside so we could do coffee and dessert which was also phenomenal. literally we have not said mmmmm after a bite of food since the last time we were in italy 🤣 and that’s exactly what we said after a bite of the food here. 100% recommend; overall rating 9/10

flawless… we always walk by this place on saint honore and had that feeling to sit and eat some… it happened and we are thankful 🙏🏼

our orders:

arancini (9/10)
it’s the first time to have it perfectly made (no specific ingredient that is overwhelming like cheese or a spice)..

pizza 🍕 (9/10)
we had the tuna and was a winner… those who don’t like onion, this may not be a good option..
crisp and soft, chewy crust but so enjoyable.. very light, you barely feel any stuffiness afterwards, we just kept eating.. it’s a complete experience by itself..

cacio e pepe (10/10)
i can’t describe it enough. very simple dish with no complications… i always prefer spaghetti with tomato sauce, but i felt to try something else at least once,, and this one change my settings .. we added chili 🌶️ flakes on top as well as parmigiana,, it’s an extra layer of flavor that’s all.. besides the rich experience with this dish, i’m still enjoying the thought of it the next day… highly recommended.

name: La Mascotte
formatted_address: 6 Av. du Président Wilson, 75008 Paris, France
reviews: after a long walk from the eiffel tower, we stumbled upon this place, no reservations, sat outside, the meal and our drinks were perfect.  our server was sweet, nice, and spoke english.  the onion soup was fantastic and the salmon tartare was delicious.  a great ambiance outside.; i stumbled upon this gem while exploring the area, and it turned out to be the best find of my trip to paris! i ended up going twice during my short weekend stay and indulged in their incredible food. everything was beyond delicious! the service is quick and welcoming, the cozy interiors make you feel right at home, and the drinks were spot on. with all my heart, i highly recommend la mascotte – an absolute must-visit!; this is a very nice restaurant. the food is good here. ambience is good. it has large sitting area outside. the service is good. the ambience is okay. the staff know english and are very friendly. overall a great restaurant to have lunch or dinner if you are in this vicinity.; surprisingly good and affordable option amongst the many high priced alternative. near the crazy horse. which is also recommended! we loved the cordon bleu style chicken. flank steak was less impressive. excellent service; tasty food, good value, and very good and fast service! convenient location for tourists!

name: Ma Cachette
reviews:
what a great little restaurant! our waiter robinson helped us as we’re from australia and our french was poor.  the food was amazing!  steak slightly under but very tasty. dessert was outstanding!
highly recommend!
just get there!!😁; nice little place. food was nice, only note will be to cook a bit more the steak. order medium and got an almost raw one. but overall it was a very nice place and the rest of the food was great.; authentic french food place, when i was there it seems like it is a two-man operation the waiter and the cook in the kitchen, very nicely managed and very nicely executed the food is high quality and delicious the waiter who i think was the owner also is friendly accommodating and full of humor.; fusion of french and asian cuisine. nice atmosphere and service.; decent restaurant with decent food and ok wine list. not for atmosphere, food ok

name: Les Caves Alliées
formatted_address: 44 Rue Grégoire de Tours, 75006 Paris, France
reviews: one of my favorite original bars. if you want something new, to try small production flavored original beer or some very rare beverages like mead or spiced wine that is usually only served at medieaval festivals and special stores then this is your place ! they have over 40 different beers and some nice appetizers as well. think old tavern from times long passed ! also it's really cheap for a bar in the center of paris unless you're usually used to drinking diluted beer from supermarkets and third rate countryside pubs.; i’m going to paris mid february for my birthday and i’m definitely  coming here.. i fully appreciate a manager  that has an ability to stand up for their establishment and staff! love a beer and a board game! see you soon; if i you’re an american in paris looking for a fun local beer bar, this isn’t it. it’s a nerdy board game bar with some beers and mead on tap.  staff knew almost nothing about the beers on tap. the crowd was 90/10 male/female and people were playing magic the gathering and other games at the tables.  if that’s your scene, cool. but this isn’t the “beer hall” google portrays it to be.; i heard about this bar from friends of mine and i'm so glad i stopped by for a drink.  hopefully you can go on a night when the bar owner is working because he really is amazing. he goes out of his way to make sure that you feel welcomed and that you have the perfect drink for you.  the obvious sense of community amongst patrons shows how much the regulars value this as an inviting place to catch up with friends and try new and exotic beers.  but don't stop at the beers, you need to check out their range of sparkling soft drinks! they are mesmerising. the bar stocks a lot of board games and it's definitely somewhere to come with friends to spend an evening having a few drinks, (i think you can also get platters of nibbles) and playing a game or two.  if you are lucky enough to live in paris i'm sure this will be one of your regular hang out joints. and if you're only passing through, know that you'll be made very welcome, as i was.  i will definitely be returning on my next trip to paris.; fabulous collection of beers, which if you're served by the owner is an absolute pleasure to discuss with, a real connoisseur who knows what to recommend depending on your preference.  a relaxed no-frills environment with a collection of dozens of boardgames to play.

name: Le Bouquet de Grenelle
formatted_address: 68 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
tried creme broullee at 5 different places and this was the best. also very good french onion soup. waitstaff was busy but noted when i needed him. attentive even though busy.  great corner for people watching.; excellence service. had dinner for one, but never felt alone or isolated. service was warm and friendly. lovely atmosphere in the evening. great spot for people watching and contemplating.; honestly one of the best croissants i've ever had, fresh bread and butter and great cappuccino and orange juice. quick and pleasant service and location.; service was as good as the food,  which was superb!
the lamb shanks... omg.... sooooo goood!! fall off the bone, tasty... saying it's delicious doesn't even do it justice!
highly recommended!; here in france we have been looking for some excellent french onion soup, but so far, we have found only one place with very good onion soup. to be honest, we came here hoping the onion soup would be good, but it was terrible, absolutely terrible. the onion soup was totally bland with no flavor. the only saving grace for me was the caesar salad was acceptable, but for some reason there was a strong hint of wasabi in the salad. this is definitely another tourist trap, i recommend skipping this place and finding another place.

name: Restaurant JB - Rendez-Vous Des Amis Paris 15
formatted_address: 73 Rue de la Convention, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
nice cozy restaurant that offers vietnamese and french cuisine at a very reasonable price. the place is newly renovated and mr jb is friendly and remember us all the time.; i went out with friends. the menu
( french and vietnam) was great. if you are a fan of meat or fish, it's a good place for you.the owner is sympathic; the owner, jean baptiste,  proudly claims to be franco-vietnamese, and celebrates it through his cuisine. a few exquisite, delicate, iconic vietnamese dishes, as well as a couple of traditional french staples form a small, but appealing menu. everything is home made, from fresh ingredients bought that morning....
jean baptiste gives his customers a very warm welcome   and makes you feel right at home.
this place has been opened for two months only,  and i would advise to rush to it before it becomes too popular......; fantastic food, great prices, friendly owner and staff. don’t let the humble exterior fool you this is a gem.; homemade cuisine, with fresh products, and such a passionate and pleasant boss who advocates quality, and who created this place to meet and share in the heart of the 15th arrondissement! don’t hesitate to stop and taste his cuisine, you won’t regret it! plus the prices are unbeatable

name: Bugsy’s
reviews: delicious does not begin to describe our meals. as with most things in paris, we just happened upon this whole walking around. they had me sold at our special is beef tartare, then a blue cheeseburger! also had the creamy chicken which was perfect as well. cocktails with ice, good beer.; this bar/restaurant has been here 24 years , i remember when it opened, and was delighted to find it again , the owner has no problem keeping his business up to date with everything, the points, and cocktails next to none , food amazing steaks , burgers , fish, and chips home made which is very unusual in paris, it been such a fast city , his chef has stayed 24 years , so the owner is treating his staff right ,,24 years of success ,  and wishing them another 24 more years of success,, thanks very much guys until the next time , keep up the great work; amazing burgers and steak. we could tell they used good ingredients because everything from the patties to the burger buns and toppings were very tasty and fresh as well as the meat used for the steak. the staff was very nice and helpful. highly recommend; it’s like an irish pub… but nicer. i visited for a lunch and a dinner, it can get a bit crowded but the busy staff doesn’t leave you hanging… was greeted right away and was guided to a few good spots to sit at the bar as the remaining tables were reserved for other guests. great irish/uk pub menu with good portions and decent prices. variety of tap beers make it even more fun. food was great, will stop there again. our bartender luke was our bartender both times, cool dude took awesome care of us and the patrons in there strike up good football conversation.; great anglophone pub amidst a business area with lots of embassies and lawyers' offices. alan has been running the place for 25 years and has cultivated a great community. rugby and football on the tvs.

name: Club Barrière Paris
reviews: food is great and very expensive. if you ask water they just drop you evian ( 6 euros) and always ask for tap water . that is a bit rip off i guess. food is good . we loved the pasta with ham and truffle . detox salad was very tasty. always try the burgundy snails. so yummy.; very bad service with the security on the night from the 14 to 15, i come often and he very rudely pushed me and denied my entry. could have gotten hurt no need for physical agression.; unclear face control and not speaking english. was not let in in my casual boss suit, but guys in jeans were ok. i guess i was a bit unlucky; my friends and i visited the club a few weeks ago and had one of the best times i've ever had at a casino.  we were pretty intimidated at first, but the manager was very kind and super helpful.  after getting our memberships, we had a blast playing blackjack.  the dealers were nice and i ended up hitting three 7's and nearly winning 36,000 euro but walked out with around 1600 euro.  will definitely be back.  would love to spend more time and play some poker next time around.; very nice place, texas holdem is great there with nice dealers and a great crowd. my every night stop when i'm in paris. should not miss it. food is excellent as well. they don't let you have more then 1 drink every 30 mins but i guess thats watching out for you. i appreciate it.

name: Le Tournesol
formatted_address: 9 Rue de la Gaité, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing veggie burger made with eggplant, and fries! cesar salad with chicken and bacon also great. service was attentive!; quality of the food was extremely bad and expensive for how bad the quality was. 16€ for the bummy plate in the photo.; i grabbed a quick cocktail on their outside cafe trottoir. i requested a bloody mary the waiter was nice enough to ask bartender to prepare it for me although not mentioned on the menu . it was quite good . the prices are reasonable. the service is very fast . the staff is friendly enough. the indoor is super loud and crowded. cheers; great location, great place.
but a little over-priced; went on a saturday night. waiter had a few tables to look after but was still fairly attentive for parisian standards. ordered the cheese platter and was honestly among the best we ever had in paris. each cheese was simply delicious! came with cranberry jam, honey and lots of bread (which was filled up without asking).

name: La Terrasse de Pomone
reviews:
we had breakfast overlooking the beautiful lake decorated with the stars statues.
the surrounding is just amazing
the food was good a wide variety, staff professional. highly recommended for a brunch whenever you are passing by jardin des tuileries; nice cafe, serving coffee, salads, sandwiches, all kinds of drinks, ice cream etc. worth knowing that the menu when you sit down is more expensive than if you order takeaway and sit in the park on a nearby bench. fair enough, i get it, but you might like to know.; a very average place for tourists the spot is great, but the rest... just be aware that they won't accept credit card under 10€ (it's indicated with a very tiny line on the menu, waiter indicated it to me when paying), but also that any person seated has to have an order. if not, you can't !; the waiter brought me two days old sandwich. i couldn’t take a bite. for this they wanted 11-13€, nauseating coffee was 6,80€. the best was still water in glass 0,5l for 5,50€; beautiful place to sit and have a coffee.  service was excellent.  we didn’t eat but the food looked good.

name: Les Facultés
reviews:
very friendly staff. i strongly recommend this pub. they even have good pints for only 4€ during happy hour.; excellent jambon & melon salad and croque monsieur for very reasonable prices close to jardin luxembourg; 2 americano 1 capucino  - 11,5 eur. terrible services. i dont know that is standart?; unprofessional, i didn't think the staff was interested in serving me although i spoke french and addressed him nicely (full of respect and with a smile). i asked for water but never received it, got my sandwich with no butter or sauce and when i asked he told his colleague that i never asked. i then asked for the wifi twice but it wasn't working either. i personally didn't have a pleasant experience but i hope this review helps improve the service for your next customer.; waiting 35 min for the wrong omelet.
then the hypocrisy of the owner telling us we ordered what he served (knowing i can't eat what he served)
27€ for two omelets.

merci

name: Restaurant groupes paris diner anniversaire
reviews:
it was a great experience !!!
the food was nice and the music good, there was a singer before the dj’s set.
my friends and i had such a great time, it’s a perfect place to celebrate a birthday or a bachelorette party. i recommend and we’ll come back; great food, service and really good djs and live music!; i had an incredible evening at the tout le monde en parle restaurant! the atmosphere was really great, with entertainment that brought the room to life and a really friendly atmosphere. i can't wait to try the comedy club evening.

and the food... a real delight! each dish was very good, and the service was impeccable. i highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to have a good time with friends or family. congratulations to the whole team for this memorable experience!; i recommend this place, very well decorated, the food is very good and the atmosphere is perfect, magician meal, singer and then club, everything comes together to have a good evening.; great experience at tlmp on a friday evening, the dinner is good and very decent, the entertainment is really nice and the dj programming is everything i expected, i will come back.

name: Le Mistral
reviews:
we ate here on a friday night. at 6:45 it wasn’t busy, except for a very loud table of diners. aside from the other diners, the food was spectacular, the vegetarian salad, the vongole spaghetti, the meat lasagna. we would definitely eat here again.; it has a very nice atmosphere, and the server is really, really friendly. it made our dinner happy. the food is fresh and delicious. even a child who didn't eat well during the trip ate the whole pasta.; amazing place. the service was outstanding and the food was delicious. would definitely come back!; this place was fantastic! the staff spoke english fairly well and between their english and my french we got it all figured out. the staff was very friendly and good-natured.

the food was prompt and delicious. we had the artichoke appetizer (artichoke hearts with some olive oil, endives, cherry tomatoes, shredded mozzarella and some spices), the romeo and the tortufa (see pics). the artichoke appetizer was a generous portion and was delicious. the romeo and giulia were probably the best meal we've had in the five days we've been here! i would highly recommend either one. the romeo's creamy sauce with cured ham was spectacular. the tortufa's parmesan cream sauce was absolutely fantastic. don't miss either of these!

the price was very reasonable. i would highly recommend this place.; amazing restaurant! the food was absolutely incredible and the servers were wonderful and extremely friendly!

we had the romeo, the daily special, and homemade tiramisu. would easily get all those options again!

they have their menu printed in both french and english which is handy for someone who isn’t fluent in french.

name: Paris Follie's
reviews:
location is quite strategic. friendly staffs with affordable price as well. french onion soup is perfect for a rainy day to warm yourself up!

missed out to get a dessert as we are already full at the moment. definitely will go back and try out their dessert on the next visit.; great restaurant near the eiffel tower with reasonable prices. we didn't have a reservation, and there was quite the line to get in at 7 pm, but we were a party of two, so it moved quickly. large groups may be stuck waiting for longer. the interior was pretty but packed with people. our waiter had to pull out our table so i could get into the bench, and we were very close to the tables around us. neither of us cared much about how packed the restaurant was, but something to take note of if you prefer more privacy, space, and quiet while dining. waitstaff was quick, kind, and efficient. i ordered the duck, and my friend ordered the chicken. both were incredible and super tender. the side salad and side of potatoes for the duck were perfectly portioned as well. we also each ordered the chocolate cake, and it was amazing - super rich and just the right level of sweetness. would absolutely come back.; compared to other restaurants, this restaurant offers incredible price for their food. our bill was €60, without drinks. space is a bit tight but i have no complaint. downstairs washroom area state of cleanliness has a big room for improvement.; our family had dinner at paris follie’s and it was great. service was friendly (and also in english) and fast, the food was delicious - especially the french onion soup! - and the atmosphere was very nice. we felt there was a good mix of locals and tourists. the creme brûlée was 💯 and can easily be shared by two people! we’d visit again 😊; we read only good things but had to wait over 1.5 hours until our order got taken. then we got served cold food. only the snails tasted really good and were warm. furthermore they didn’t care about cleaning up the table next to us which dropped a plate on the floor, they just left the food on the ground. unfortunately very bad experience!

name: 1.2.3. Famille
reviews:
i love this toy store! i found it last time i was in paris and loved it so much that i just had to come back this time when visiting paris again. ❤️
they have a lot of djeco toys and similar quality  brands and none of those main stream plastic toys.
the staff is very nice, smiling and helpful. they also speak english. 😉; an exquisite boutique for all your lil ones fanatsy dreams. it has a wide range of interactive toys and books, also theme dresses. whole birthday party celebration requirements goodies are available; got some lovely original toys for my nephew when visiting paris.; i loved this store. best gifts for children.; very friendly staff

name: Secrets d'enfance
formatted_address: 90 Rue de l'Abbé Groult, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
we are visiting from the states and came to paris looking for children's consignment clothes for my 10-year-old daughter. we prefer sustainable fashion and mostly shop at consignment and thrift stores back home so we have been to many of these types of stores in the us. this is a wonderfully kept shop, bright and with plenty of options to look through. my daughter found *many* things that she loved and that we would not have found at home. there were some us items as well, but we left those behind. the shop owner was very welcoming even though we might not have been her regular clientele. she let us take our time to go through every single piece of 10 and 12 clothing to find some treasures. we spoke enough french and she spoke enough english that we could communicate well. p.s. ignore the 1 star review. we saw the owner interact with several visitors while we were there. she was warm and welcoming to all of them.; top; secrets d'enfance is a real rare gem in paris for finding second-hand children's clothing in perfect condition, combining quality and style. the store is impeccably laid out, making searching for pieces a real pleasure. special mention for the saleswoman, always welcoming and attentive, who knows how to advise you with care and finesse. his expertise and attention to detail make all the difference. an essential place to dress your little ones tastefully while respecting the environment. thank you for this great experience each time you visit!; super friendly person and nice store
good advice. claire knows her products perfectly. to do again jérôme; super nice shopkeeper and very practical for dressing your children inexpensively. a wide and very appreciable choice.

name: Kidibo
reviews:
i paris is known for the different french kids clothes brands.. of which some is extremely expensive. this is a small shop in backside area where you can find spanish kids clothes  from the brand (mayoral). i like the design of the clothes and the brand in general...

you can find designs for new born till 14 years old if i remember well. majority of the stuff and clothes goes for new born to 5 years old.. dresses 👗 t shirts 👕 toys 🧸 and some shoes are sold in the shop

prices are reasonable and shop owner and staff are very friendly and helpful..

you can't find kids shop on the same street unless you go to the shopping mall near by (10 minutes walk)..

i recommend you to visit and see what they have.; a beautiful shop run with care a surprising choice of clothes, soft toys for girls and boys up to 16 years old prices for all budgets come quickly before christmas the manager is top 👍🤩👑✨✨✨✨✨✨✨;

name: Les Petites Mascarades | Animation et spectacle pour enfants
reviews:
in mid-june 2023, the small masquerades allowed our company to relaunch its carnival. this historic and friendly event intended for our employees and their children had been put on hold during the covid-19 crisis and its return was eagerly awaited internally. the organization of the carnival included many technical and logistical challenges. indeed, in addition to offering shows, games and activities calibrated to the commitments of our group, the agency also had to install the same day and in a very short time (2 hours flat) all of the decorations corresponding to the activities of in the afternoon, in limited space. mission impossible for some, mission successful for les petites masquerades! they rose to the challenge with flying colours, offering us a memorable afternoon. the boundless creativity and remarkable organization of this happy group who have worked together for years were the keys to the success of this carnival. it is always more pleasant to collaborate with a company on a human scale. in addition, the value for money is extremely interesting. beyond professionalism, the petites masquerades agency approaches each mission with passion and this is reflected in all of their work. entrust them with your corporate events without trembling!; for our wedding, it was important that the children present were supervised.
and everything went very well! thank you very much to the animators, lise and elias, the children were delighted. they had a lot of fun.

having a man and a woman doesn't seem like much, but the little guys were happy, because we know girls suck! 😉 boys play football!

a big thank you for the painting and especially for it to be taken by the children through the reception room, it doesn't seem like anything but this little surprise moved me! my daughters were super proud to be the children of the bride and groom, they were special!

really thank you, even the parents were relieved.

i highly recommend les petites masquerades; creativity, courage, determination and the desire to do well are the key words of clémence lièvre when it comes to carrying out her projects within the petites masquerades.

i had the pleasure of entrusting a complex project to clémence and her team and each challenge (creation, decoration, animation, catering, etc.) was met with a smile for an impeccable result at the end...

bravo, thank you and above all long life to petites masquerades!; thanks to the little masquerades team! the facilitators took care of the children with a smile, they were fully motivated, dynamic, friendly, inventive. our wedding took place on a houseboat with safety concerns for children, and parents were able to relax thanks to the entertainment team. the children had a great time! call them without hesitation.; i am delighted to have requested the little masquerades for my son's birthday. the actor/host duo works wonderfully! the captain america costume was impressive so that the children immediately immersed themselves in the avengers universe. clémence is very responsive and attentive, she knows her job perfectly and gives you plenty
advice to best anticipate the arrival of these little rascals!
thank you again, i will not hesitate to use this agency again next year!

name: Etoile de Rêve
reviews:
if there were more stars, i would give them! we hired two animatrices for my daughter's 3rd birthday at our house (with 17 kids!) and they were incredible. i cannot recommend etoile de rêve enough and looking forward to using them for future events. thank you!; i used etoile de reve for the first time for the 3. birthday of my daughter. we ordered just animator and magician, but everything went very well. the magician took the attention not only for the kids but for adults as well, he has been amazing! organisation was very good, 2 days before the animator was calling me to ask how we would like to make the party, to the party came 30 minutes before to settle everything up. you can let them to organise your party with decoration , cake, etc. but we already had everything before. for the next time will let them organise everything. thank you etoile de reve for the nice timet!; the birthday party with the paw patrol theme of our 4 year old was an absolute success! the team was very professional, very good in engaging even with the most shy ones and in keeping the group together. we were impressed!; i wanted to thank the entire étoile de rêve team for having once again accomplished magnificent work, creating beautiful animations!!
the children were delighted!!!
well done and see you next year; i recommend with my eyes closed! my children and their friends had a great time! sabine is excellent, sweet, fun teacher, she has all the qualities to celebrate an unforgettable birthday! thanks again to sabine and the entire étoile de rêve team!

name: Bonpoint
reviews:
beautiful shop for a very traditional brand for children clothes, situated in st germain.
the staff is really polite and ready to help.
i loved the creative presentation of the outfits. the place is very large and you'll find the whole season collection presented here.
and the plus is the restaurant situated in the shop, you just go down the stairs to find it and the garden.; this brand is a scam. they don’t answer emails regarding quality issues.; a really wonderful children's clothing store.
i went here a lot with my old employer.
the clothing is all very well constructed & incredibly adorable. a lot of styles & colors to choose from. the kids loved the clothing, & they looked so incredible in them as well/

the store also takes a lot of pride & care in their displays & it is quite beautiful & magical to just be in there. the kids never minded going to this store, as there was always something to look at & play with, & they loved the clothing as well.

it is a bit pricy, though i'd have to say it's worth it.; are those people buying clothes or just visiting a museum ?!
clothes are fine and handle well on my kids ;) but the staffers are sooooo rude and full of bad advises
just go with what fits and his useful for your family.; very pretty store two stars for that. 65 euros for babies pyjamas is outrageous imho. go and look and leave 🤪

name: Bread And Chocolate - Store Baby - Saint-Germain
reviews:
by far the greatest service in this rapidly developing and growing brand. fabrics are givenchy quality. service and selection is great. personal assistance and advise was given to every little detail.
great clothes for boys and girls of ages up to 7 y.o. with special attention to the young ones.
definitely worth a visit if you are looking for a french french style in your kids wardrobe.; what a wonderful experience we had here. the lady helping us was so kind and welcoming and helped us pick out our baby's first outfit. she made it such a special experience that we will remember for a long time!; cutest collections; it's 10:15, saturday january 27, the store is still closed. no respect to customers. three people came divided up.; being used to ordering directly from the website and having it delivered to my home, i chose for the first time to have my order delivered to this store.
it was the opportunity to visit the store which is magnificent.
i received a very professional, friendly, smiling welcome. the reception largely lived up to the brand image of tartine et chocolat. simply perfect.
thank you

name: Chen Wang Lai Lai
reviews:
quick and good food; correct; quick good food; it's very hot to serve rice with eggs + pineapple inside to escape the chemical taste of the food is horrible the neme is very hard it looks like stones after all it's the chinese we can't do anything do there; impeccable service, the managers take great care if you eat there, very kind.

nothing to complain about the dishes, it was good, and it's a nice pleasure to have a fruit salad for dessert! nice discovery i will come back

name: Apollon
reviews:
amazingly surprised!! it was the second time that i’ve visited paris and during our walk we decided to taste a greek restaurant in paris. i still cannot believe the high quality of food. virgin oil which is produced by the owners is used for cooking and dressing. well done guys, the atmosphere, the greek and parisian combination and the high quality of service were excellent. lastly, i have for sure to mention the affordable prices. you can taste a greek full sandwich of gyros for 8€ only!!  must visit 👌; it was my second time, we got a really high recommendation to come here, and absolutely perfect foods that we been looking for , staffs add friendly and helpful, clean restaurants and nice greece style. recommended; we had a good time at the restaurant to  celebrate my 55 birthday.   home made flavor plates, with a real orange cake «πορτοκαλόπιτα « specially made for us on request.   thanks for making us feel home .   😍🙏

ευχαριστούμε πολύ  😍🇬🇷; do not order any of the food from them for delivery i regret! i received the wrong meals and it tasted horrible, not fresh at all i won’t be surprised if they give us left overs from the restaurant. i’m very disappointed! even the taboule is bad; my husband enjoys eating greek food all over the world. today it was paris. we actually walked 2 miles from our hotel to eat here because my husband liked the menu choices. the food was delicious. our waiter was utterly delightful. the food was plentiful and a good value. we highly recommend!

name: Cook'n Saj
reviews:
absolutely incredible dining experience. the food was wonderful, the atmosphere is lovely and the tempo and mood is set by the lovely owner ahmed who greets you so kindly and takes time to chat with you. what a gem of a restaurant.; if you want to experience the best food, the best environment of people and good energy go there!!!!. i felt i was at home, this restaurant is very very special.
10/10 in everything.
all the best and success thank you for having us!  🫶🏽🇫🇷💋; had an amazing lunch here. just stumbled upon this gem while walking around. i believe the owner / manager waited on us and he was amazing. wish i got his name. we would go back for sure and certainly recommend it.; absolutely amazing experience and food! 10/10. from the moment we walked in
, we were greeted so warmly and felt immediately welcome. like having a meal with a long lost friend. the owner is joyful and friendly and has the best interactions with all of the guests. our waitress was phenomenal; she explained the menu in english for us and was incredibly kind. we loved everything!! from the smoothie watermelon mint mocktail, to the cns burger with special sauce, the keftah wrap and the cheddar sauce on the fries! all of the flavors were so well thought out and were a wonderful medley of flavors. get the cheese sauce on the fries, you won’t regret it. and if you have room, save it for dessert! we enjoyed the biscotti sauce with the pita; what a combo. thank you “mille merci” for our most memorable and enjoyable experience in all of our paris dining. ♥️♥️♥️; eat n’ saj here is my new favorite thing to do in paris. from the moment we walked in, we knew this would be a special place.

we were warmly welcomed into the restaurant by the host, who we learned owned this place with his family (brother and mother). when i say it was a warm welcome, i mean it felt like we’d known each other for a long time and i was coming to dinner at their home.

he went through the menu options with us in english, offered suggestions and took our order of taouk (chicken) saj, fattoush salad, 2x falafel, and hummus. look at this photo of the hummus as an example of how much love this family puts into their restaurant and their patrons. they make sure you feel comfortable.

and the food did not disappoint. it was likely the best saj i’ve ever had - even compared to the options i’ve had at home. the chicken was tender and the composition of herbs and sauce were both cooling and deeply flavorful. the falafel was equally special, with a small tomato at the base, making each bite refreshing and a little more moist. the fattoush salad, though they used an iceberg lettuce that fell a bit flat in flavor, did not disappoint overall. the hummus was also great.

before we left, they offered dessert, and we ordered the baklava, though we don’t often leave room. i’m glad we did this time because it was the flakiest, most flavorful i’ve ever tasted. though not made in house, it’s made by a local baker and delivered fresh every day. i can’t believe how good these were. he even sent us home with 2 just because i said they were delicious.

i can’t wait to tell all my friends who visit paris that a meal at cook’n saj feels like a warm hug from a friend you haven’t seen in a long time.

name: AlKaram Paris 75015
reviews:
i love this restaurant and recommend it to everyone searching for lebanese food made with love. the owners are adorable and very generous. the food is 10/10 i recommend you get the assiette gourmande to try as much options as possible!; best lebanese restaurant in paris. authentic and delicious food. staff was amazing and very welcoming. definitely recommend!; my friend and i went to this restaurant 2 years ago. throughout those entire 2 years, the sweet memory of this restaurants delicious food stayed with us. yesterday was finally the day of our return, and it did not disappoint. fantastic lebanese food and hospitaly. highly recommend!; one of the most enthusiastic five star reviews i've given. this place is simply the best lebanese food i've had. the falafel was perfect, flavorful and crispy. the skewers were moist, well spiced and melted on your mouth.

sprint to this restaurant as fast as you can. a true gem ran by the kindest people.; if you're looking for an authentic lebanese dining experience, then you won't be disappointed with a visit to al karam. this cozy restaurant is a hidden gem in the heart of the city, and i recently had the pleasure of dining there.

the atmosphere of the restaurant is warm and welcoming, with beautiful middle eastern decor that immediately transports you to another world. as soon as i walked in, i was greeted by the friendly staff who made me feel right at home.

now, let's talk about the food. the menu at al karam is full of traditional lebanese dishes, and each one is prepared with care and attention to detail. i started with some of the appetizers, including the hummus and baba ghanoush, both of which were rich and flavorful. the pita bread was warm and fresh, and the perfect complement to the dips.

for my main course, i opted for the shish taouk, which is marinated chicken skewers. the chicken was tender and juicy, with a perfect balance of spices. it was served with a side of rice pilaf and a fresh salad that was bursting with flavor.

to top it all off, i ordered the baklava for dessert. the pastry was flaky and sweet, with just the right amount of honey syrup.

overall, i highly recommend al karam to anyone looking for an authentic lebanese dining experience. the food is outstanding, the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the service is top-notch. this is the perfect spot for a romantic date night or a fun night out with friends. don't hesitate to make a reservation – you won't be disappointed

name: Sapori di Parma
formatted_address: 56 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
quite literally the worst food i’ve ever had in my life. not sure what all the positive reviews were for since that’s what convinced my friends and i to try this place but we had the absolute worst experience you could ever imagine. we were the only customers and it took the server over 15 minutes to even acknowledge our existence. we ordered the buffalo as an appetizer which was tasteless and bland. then gnocchi, truffle ravioli, and veal with pasta all of which were literally inedible. we told the staff and they just yelled at us that this is what fresh gnocchi is like. we just traveled here from italy where we had fresh gnocchi for many meals, so we know what it’s like. this was the equivalent of tasteless cornmeal. none of us ate it and even after expressing our disappointment in it we were still charged for it (not that we asked for it to be free but felt odd to force us to pay for something we hated so much) beware because we left here disappointed and starving because we couldn’t even stomach the food they served us. photos of the disgusting gnocchi included here. we overlooked the lack of ambiance for what we thought was going to be good food but it was a terrible atmosphere, awful food, and incredibly rude service.; lovely place to eat! the best italian restaurant in paris and they speak italian french and english! made out of homemade pasta! if you want to experience a real italian dish in paris then this is the perfect place to go to! nice service, and don’t worry it has a restroom too! really recommend the bruschetta! if you want to bring some homemade pasta then you can even buy it cause it has a shop too! it’s the perfect temperature!😁; such a good experience! this lovely family run restaurant is definitely worth a visit. we felt like we stepped into italy. the food was amazing and the family serving and making the food were warm and kind and very welcoming!; italian shop and eatery near eiffel tower
buratta + truffle + ham ..both pretty much tasteless despite being fresh
spaghetti carbonara massively overcooked and lacking taste also
a real disappointment, considering the good reviews
i wouldn’t recommend; loved it! the food is simple yet delicious. price is resonance and the vibe is so chill. it tastes like home cooked italian food

name: La famille & cie
reviews:
the food was perfect. we ordered duck, chicken, and beef and it was so delicious, and good pairing with the recommended wine. the chef is a very kind person and he kept caring our table. recommended for everyone in paris! it's a good restaurant i want to visit again :); the food was incredible, really good quality ingredients cooked to perfection. the portions are really generous and the service could not be better. a really pleasant surprise,  excellent attention to details and friendly atmosphere. also very reasonable price, will definitely come back in future visits to paris, without a doubt; wonderful experience in a local bistro. from the welcome to the food we could not have had such an amazing experience. charlie runs front of house and the drinks, and only two chefs out the back.

food service is perfectly paced and allows you to enjoy the food and the company.
