we loved it so much we went twice in five days. merci charlie!; outstanding small place in the 15th arr. we had great food starting with roast st marcelin cheese. mains were roast angus beef, crusted chicken and the “family” burger. each had an outstanding sauce to enhance the flavor. the beef was tender, the chicken moist and the burger was tall and tasty on a brioche. the desserts were a tiramisu of whipped cream, oreos and raspberries; chocolate lava cake, and sautéed plums. the whipped cream was delicious but the plums were the stand out of the evening, drenched in warm sugar caramel sauce. great service despite one man handling all duties. search this place out!!; we stumbled upon this french restaurant by chance, and what a delightful surprise it was! from the moment we walked in, we were warmly welcomed by the lone waiter, who, despite managing all the tables on his own, was incredibly professional and friendly. his attention to detail and kindness really added to our experience

the meal was simply amazing. we started with two appetizers: rillettes and terrine. we loved the option to share these dishes as a family, which made the experience even more enjoyable. even though we're irish, we absolutely fell in love with these authentic french flavors

as for the main courses, both the parents and the young adults were equally impressed. the tagine was beautifully aromatic, with perfectly balanced flavors and excellent cooking. the ribs were unbelievably tender, falling off the bone effortlessly, and with an excellent sauce. every dish we tried was outstanding, prepared with great care and passion i think !!

whether you're with friends or family, this is the perfect spot to enjoy authentic cuisine, all complemented by impeccable service, even when the waiter is handling the whole room on his own. hats off to them, and thank you for an unforgettable evening !!!

name: Gusto Italia 218
reviews:
nice italian restaurant slightly away from the busiest area near the eiffel tower and reasonably priced. service was good and food was well presented. we had an antipasti starter for four and it was really great. tagliatelle bolognese was also very good. pizzas are huge!; this is definitely one of the gems of paris. the food is beyond amazing. the portions are also very generous considering it is mere minutes from the eiffel tower. the food was in-fact so good, we came here on multiple nights. their pasta and pizza are absolutely amazing, and you really can’t go wrong with anything on the menu. on top of all of that, the prices were very very reasonable. the staff was also very attentive and accommodating. they made great recommendations and tailored food for our toddler exactly as requested. only downside to the whole experience is, if you sit outside you will eat while smelling smoke almost constantly. but then again, that is endemic of almost all outdoor seating in paris in general. if/when we come back to paris, we will most definitely revisit this gem!; had one of our lunches here while in paris.
i ordered lasagna and a creme brulee. had the shock realising that the lasagna had a strong curry taste (a legit italian would get a heart attack hearing of this). italian cuisine does not, under any form, use curry in any of its dishes. this is for certain not an italian dish.
the creme brulee was fine.
the place was rather cold, there wasn't any heating available.; 🍝 great food, average service 🇫🇷
we had some absolutely amazing food here. my spaghetti bolognas was so saucy and delicious and my fiancés calzone was huge.
however the service could definitely do better. whether they were all just flustered or there wasn’t enough of them, after seated we were left for about 15-20 mins without a menu. we had to ask and then once we had decided what we wanted had to wait a further 20 mins just to be serves. but once the ball got rolling the rest fell into place.
all-in-all, great food at affordable prices, which is a lot to ask when in the vicinity of the eiffel tower.; when you think about eating out in a capital city you expect that prices will be high but gusto italia is a parisian delight.

located near the eiffel tower, this delightful italian bistro might be small in size but it is huge in character, ambiance and service.

we just wanted a small lunch and went for the margarita pizza to share between the three of us. we were greeted with a free grilled vegetable appetiser and a bottle of chilled water for the table while we waited for the pizza to arrive.

when it did, it was extremely nice. the fresh, hand pulled base was beautiful and baked to perfection. the ragu and cheese complimented the base, making this an excellent margarita. i wish we could have tried some of the other pizzas on offer but my 9 year old son just likes the plain cheese but he did say it was one of the best he’d had.

all of this for just €10, in paris! if you are in the french capital seeing the eiffel tower, this is the place to go.

name: LA FAMILLE - Finest Lunch - Kleber
reviews:
the best breakfast at a local place! lots of tables inside and outside, great sandwiches for around 5-6 euro, delicious fresh pastry and friendly staff.
it was a delight finding this place instead of the overpriced tourist restaurants.
we passed by again lunchtime, it was very popular.; excellent food and fantastic service. triston was very nice to us too. thank you; great sandwich on fresh bread. fast service.; excellent sandwich, fair price, friendly service; great sandwiches at a reasonable price in paris

name: Brasserie des Champs
reviews: we were in paris just 3 weeks ago. we just happened upon this restaurant on the very busy street. i ordered the escargot 12 pieces while my wife ordered the mussels. both were very delicious! it was the best escargot i’ve ever had. our kids ordered burgers and fries. they liked their food. we sat in the patio area. our waiter spoke good english. even though the restaurant was very busy, the service was really good. we were very satisfied with the food and the price we paid.; i’m not a food snob by any means, but i could not eat the food we received. we ordered pasta with all’arrabbiata sauce and a burger and fries. the pasta sauce is supposed to be flavorful and spicy, but it was extremely bland, watery, and not the consistency of all’arrabbiata. the fries were normal, but the burger had an awful smell and aftertaste that i could not get past. i’m not a picky eater and would say i’m quite flexible and easy to please with restaurants, but for the first time, i left a restaurant hungry, leaving a full plate of food. definitely not worth ~€20 and would not return.; we were in paris for vacation and stopped by this place for a quick lunch. food was okay, not the best or most tasty food. prices were reasonable and location is nice and convenient right on champs elysees. one time try. not a place we would want to go for the second time.; went to this restaurant while visiting paris. boyfriend absolutely loved the escargot and mussels. both food and service were good. loved sitting outside people watching; brasserie des champs is a charming eatery that exudes a cozy, bistro-like atmosphere reminiscent of classic french brasseries. located in an inviting setting, it offers a menu filled with traditional french fare, including savory dishes like croque monsieur, coq au vin, and a selection of freshly baked pastries. the ambiance is relaxed and elegant, making it ideal for both casual meals and special occasions. service is generally attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant dining experience. while the prices are on the higher side, the quality of the food and the authentic french vibe make brasserie des champs a delightful destination for a taste of france.

name: Grace Café – Le Bon Marché Rive Gauche
reviews:
worst tea time experience in paris…
ordered a moelleux aux pommes, wasn’t on the menu, it was a cake of the day i supposed, arrived so dried i had hiccups. then i paid the check, it was 9€ instead of 7, the waitress didn’t want to make any gesture.
very disappointing because for 9€ a cake in paris you can have so many delicious delicacies…; had croque-monsieur. the bread was really fluffy and tasty, and the side salad also tasted well balanced with vinegar dressing and dried cranberries. the place was busy and small, and ladies were too busy and less friendly, but my overall impression is good.; perfect for a healthy and delicious lunch!
the service was very good and their behavior was very polite, and the kitchen was very clean😍; i just needed to take a break from shopping and so i went here to get an iced latte, the server today gave me a hot latte and then proceeded to add some ice when i said that’s not my order. it tasted really bad i only drank 1/4 of it for €8 and couldn’t drink the rest. wasted money for a bad experience.; the cafe is located inside le bon marché, so it’s ideal if you want to take a little break while shopping. the service is okay. maybe a little pricey, but as expected given the location. good selection of pastries/cakes.

name: Restaurant de Sers
formatted_address: 41 Av. Pierre 1er de Serbie, 75008 Paris, France
reviews:
food and service was amazing! the decor is elegant with fresh air in the summer time.  light jazz music playing in the background. perfect for a romantic evening.; brunching at hôtel de sers, a five star hotel in champs-élysées. the dining area is just lovely as it’s kind of a glass house making you enjoy the sunlight with the greenery. the buffet is rich and varied with asian specialities (nems, shrimp tempura) seafood section (shrimps, oysters, salmon, a huge fish ...) salads, a cheese platter, cold cuts and many more not to forget the hot section including risotto, veal, white fish...
the desserts had a world for their own with tarts, crème brûlée, fruits salad, pain perdu, crêpes, pancakes, cookies... i loved that there is a wise selection in the items which makes it impossible to miss a thing. i highly recommend it.; nice atmosphere. delicious food.; patio, great food, nice staff; perfect for cocktails

name: Place Suisse
formatted_address: 5 Av. Albert de Mun, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
all in all, the food was nothing special and could be way better: fries weren't good, onion soup was more like water soup (barely any taste). on the other hand, the mac and cheese was well prepared and tasted good.

the place is generally nice though, great ambiance; great place, good vibe! we had the large warm wine and chicken and wafles... real nice. and my girlfriend tryed to order everything in france (instead of english) and got rewarded for het effort with a free shot of brandy! love it; very cute christmas market - the best is mulled wine at the last stand next to the entrance. its white wine and i think is mixed with cider but it tastes delicious. i highly recommend it.; very very bad place. and has absolutley nothing to do with switzerland or tasty swiss food.
this is the biggest scam ever and shouldnt be there. food is called and taste horrible. and the traditionell swiss food they offer has nothing to do with swiss food. they dont even use the right products. dont go there; it was a lovely and wonderful experiences

name: Balilli
reviews:
cozy ambiance. nice decor. our table had many crumbs and it took approx 10 minutes to be acknowledged for water and to take our order, but the food arrived quickly.

we ordered margherita pizza and the calamari/shrimp/seafood appetizer platter. the food wasn't to our liking. the pizza crust was soft and fluffy, and the cheese was generous, but the pizza was dry and lacked flavor.; so lovely. went here on my first evening and i had to return on the second evening. food is amazinly delicious. very friendly staff. i recommend highly this restaurant.; the linguine bolognese is good, the so-called "burrata pugliese" served very cold, is an insult to puglia. margherita pizza with fior di latte mozzarella was quite tasty, shame the poor quality of the mozzarella; a restaurant with a tradition that started in the 1980s. it's a pity that the price is a little high due to the location, but overall the food was quite good. it wasn't the best, but the taste of the food wasn't bad. the ingredients were high quality too. on a nice day, i recommend eating outdoors while looking at the park across the street.; balilli was great! the staff was super friendly - our waiter was a true italian -  and the bolognese was super delicious. it really seemed like a neighbourhood favourite. i would definitely recommend this restaurant!

name: Au Convivial
reviews:
simple "bar restaurant". main dishes are mainly meat based. the food is basic.
however, the ingredients are fresh.

15 € main dish + 3€ starter + 3€ for dessert

for this district, it is probably good value for money.; excellent service!! they are all the nicest people. food is really tasty, and during weekdays you have a menu option for 17€: totally worth it!; stopped in to pass some time before checking in to our next hotel. the place has bar on the sign out front so i figured my wife and mother could and myself would grab a drink and order some fries. after asking the waiter if we could have two orders of frites he spoke in french extremely rudely to my mom, who is fluent, that they cannot give us fries without ordering a meal. being vegetarian, nothing on the menu was meatless so that didn't work. we were somewhat rushed out as the waiter stated, " i have a lot of people who want to eat here". we were surrounded by empty tables...; excellent!; weekday menu very good and well priced, €18/person. the bill went up a little more for the drink other than water. very friendly waiters and good atmosphere of local people. more than recommended! we found it by chance and it was a pleasant surprise for the price-quality of the food.

name: La Belle Époque
reviews: this place has an unique charm, service is excellent and so the food! i highly recommend the steak!!! yummy; made a vacation trip to paris and stayed in the novohotel in montparnasse. this restaurant is conveniently nestled right next to it. husband ordered the duck confit and i got the pasta bolognase. delicious! also had escargo, panna cotta for dessert, and some beer we do not have back in the states. love the atmosphere and it was the best duck we have ever had! highly recommend this place in paris!; we stayed across the street at the hotel and walked over. we had the specials steak and salmon. the waiters were very nice, speedy service and the food was fabulous.  we also got a creme brûlée and a cappuccino. it is a hidden gem with lots of locals who visit. americans will like it.  you can scan menu with qr code as well.; nice service, tasty meal, super tiramisu, right belle epoque; my friend and i have 2 different kinds of ‘dish of the day’, both are scrumptious. the staff who attended to us is very kind to explain the menu which is all in french to us. we’ll be back again. :)

name: Le Comptoir de l'Artoise
reviews:
delicious legit italian foods with fresh seafood and ingredients. pastas were my favorite. quite busy at lunch time so better make reservations.; i was very surprised by this restaurant. i lived in the area but haven't been inside before but tonight we decided to have dinner something italian food. there's nothing more i can say, but the food was so good. from red wine to starter, the main course and desert were so delicious and perfect that is what we wanted. the restaurant is tidy and clean and nice dining lighting. nice atmosphere. one more thing amazed me the service of the staff was outstanding, he was very friendly and approachable and expert to say for what's on the menu coupled with nice relaxing music they played on. i highly recommend this place. be sure to make reservations before going to the restaurant as this place is always full.; it was a good surprise!

friendly staff, quick service, most importantly great food and tiramisu!

had pasta with gambas and zucchini,  pan fried artichoke and finish my meal with tiramisu.

reasonable price and good vibes!; super nice food here! authentic french food. the owner is super friendly too. love this place, highly recommended. definitely will come back again.; a lovely place for a lunch (in our case). friendly people and service was great.
the food was inspiring and tasty. good choice of wines

name: Le Volant Basque
reviews:
the food is amazing. this is the best restaurant i have ever been to in france.
the service is excellent. the staff is patient despite the language barrier. they are very helpful and professional in serving french cuisine. ❤️; le volant basque is one of those off the beaten path restaurants that you must try!  it's a family run restaurant and the food was incredible!!  my husband and i both ordered the beef bourguignon for our main entrees and it was absolutely delicious!   the staff are extremely accommodating and attentive.  we were seated outside which we were more than happy with since we didn't have a reservation, and by the time we left, the entire restaurant was jammed packed with people.  i recommend going early like we did, or make a reservation because it fills up fast!!   totally worth it and definitely recommend!!; stopped in for dinner without a reservation on a monday. was very quiet as soon as they opened (around 7) but got busy quickly after. we had a bottle of wine, charcuterie, beef bourguignon, and crème brûlée. everything was amazing. the server was super nice and very friendly/helpful and the atmosphere was great. portions are very hearty, we were two and shared and it was lots of food.

it’s tucked away off the main street, so a bit quieter outside, but the vibe in the restaurant was great. prices were very fair given how close this is to big tourist spots. highly recommend this place!; after searching throughout the 7th and 15th for a restaurant that would accommodate our birthday party for 16 persons, i remembered this somewhat hidden basque restaurant that we often walked by but never tried. it was a great decision.  from the moment we met the manager paolo to our departure that evening at midnight we were in good hands.  warm, engaging and full of character, a refreshing breath of fresh air in this era of credit card deposits and snobbery.   and the food is delicious.  if you are in this area and want a french meal as it used to be served with real heart and care, don't hesitate to visit.  thank you to everyone at le volant basque for such a memorable evening.; such a lovely restaurant, food is authentic and absolutely delicious, staff were friendly and the location was just a short walking distance from the city centre!

name: Wallace Restaurant
reviews:
it's a hidden gem. i was a little unsure about the place at first, but i tried it anyways and i'm glad i did because the food was delicious and the service was great! it's not my first time traveling to france, but definitely my family's first time traveling outside the us, so i was a bit apprehensive about the kids' behavior.  it was my first time bringing my kids to paris, and the staff was very kind, patient, and accommodating. the wait staff spoke their best english, and i tried my best broken french from just 2 semesters in college many, many years ago, and we got along just great. the steak was delicious and basically just melted in my mouth. the kids were happy with their burgers, and my son actually said it was the best burger he's ever had...it's his first time outside of the us. the atmosphere is relaxed where you can enjoy a pleasant meal with friends and family. it's definitely going on my list of places to eat at off the beated path away from the touristy areas. it's also just steps away from the bus stop and metro so you can grab a bite to eat after a long day of sightseeing. highly recommended.; bistro food and cocktail bar. nothing remarkable. the salad was supposed to have magret del canard but it was not there; when we asked for it, they just apologized, but didn't lower the price or offered to change for another dish. the dressing in all salads was mediocre. tartares and burgers were generously served. the terrace has a nice location. service is friendly. the lunch menu looks like a better deal.; i would put 0 stars if it was possible.
very long service, even bringing a beer took them at least 15 minutes. when we asked to bring water, we had to remind several times. sauce for fries was in a dirty bottle and completely disgusting. we ordered club sandwich which looked and tasted totally disgusting, made with a cheap soft bread, not cooked like it should, some chicken and (!!) a half of a cherry tomato in the entire dish! nothing else, no cheese, no salad, no ham. i’ve never seen anything worse than this, even a 2€ supermarket sandwich would look and taste better. fries too oily and tasteless. we didn’t eat the dish, we complained to the stuff but no excuses were given, no change of plate proposed.
i’ve seen dishes on other tables and they didn’t look good either. waiters very rude and unfriendly.
avoid this place, it is really bad.; i had a perfect lunch there a few days ago. very good food (avocado and tuna as a starter, then bavette ), kind and professional waiter. i ll definitely go back soon.; the food here is hands down amazing. they have amazing french cuisine.
the waiters however are a bit rowdy but they were pretty helpful in helping us translate the menu to english.

having the menu available in english would do wonders for the numbers of tourists visiting.

as for food, i tried the beef tartare and the scallop risotto. i fell in love, they're picture below, in addition i also had the profiteroles for dessert and it was definitely a sharing dish.

the atmosphere needs a little work but otherwise it's a great place with amazing food!

name: Les Trois Garçons
reviews:
great atmosphere and perfect for a quick bite. ask about the wind tunnel seating on a hot day!; a discovery! we were just walking around and got hungry, so we stopped here: what a lucky choice!; friendly staff, great location. the steak was on point and great flavor. shout out to the bartender for serving us and translating/explaining the menu to us! 😁; nice location. very friendly hostess. food was good and atmosphere was nice. we tried the salmon tartare, beef tartare and the tuna steak. all very tasty.; homophobic waitress and bland food. female waitress making snarky comments / remarks, thinking people can’t notice that.
food has been downgraded over the years.
won’t be coming back.

name: Le Plomb du Cantal
formatted_address: 3 Rue de la Gaité, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
good and convenient for the railway station, just a few minutes away.
the menu is slightly confusing, so i opted for one of the omelettes, with lardons and potatoes, which arrived quickly and was good.
save some room for dessert- the chocolate mousse is very good, and absolutely huge!; came here for the steak and aligot. we were seated right away with a street view. both of us got the entrecote with aligot/fries. there was a lot of aligot but it was really good. steak was cooked a little too long for a medium but that's okay. great parisian experience and would recommend; renowned for their mash potatoes side dishes. overall, the food was ok, but not that special. they were out of the duck, which was quite disappointing. also, if you order your steak medium, you are getting a very bloody piece of meat. very touristy, the service was fast but quite dismissive. good selection of wines and vert tasty deserts.; we had higher hopes for this restaurant but it was overall a good experience. the aligot was delicious!! steak had no season but cooked perfect. we drank tap water and asked for ice. the white wine was good. the apple creme brule was good, seemed like it should have been warm. the carmel tart was nasty! the sausage was decent. glad to have gotten an authentic restaurant experience. the server was great!; huge portions, tasty rustic food. excellent service. busy at lunch.

name: Au 41 penthièvre
reviews:
creme brulet burnt, meat definitely too much for medium
wine/drinks good, service typical paris okish.
too expensive overall; turbot was well cooked and delicious, home made foie gras was a hit, and the wine was yummy. a very successful lunch; amazing food , amazing service first time experience such a good food and service . highly recommend; a beautiful menu, the service is attentive.
and the fresh, tasty flavors.
the welcome is rich.
i recommend.
the restaurant is located in a quiet and chic area; excellent cuisine, very refined!

name: LE BISTROT D'ARSENE
reviews: would rate higher than 5 stars. very relaxed and friendly atmosphere, very good food, quick service, very friendly and polite staff.; simply excellent all the way, incredible value for money, not pricier than the average bistrot, yet definitely above average. very impressed by the food and pleased by the excellent service.; hummus and the veggie special was absolutely amazing. really really really good. great staff. only didn’t get 5 stars because we asked for the burger well done (i know i know! but that’s how he likes it) and it came out bleeding.; great lunch here, with really friendly and welcoming staff (especially lisa). food was good and would definitely come back next time; maybe they were too busy, so they forgot my drink... but the rest was fine. the staff was nice. although the dishes did not look really pretty, the tastes were good.

name: Le Monte Carlo
reviews: although the food and drinks are somewhat mediocre, the service is absolutely horrible. extremely rude and borderline impolite. honestly i prefer having my coffee, drink even dessert elsewhere. the experience is not worth it.; cafe le mont carlo was quite an unexpected surprise. we were actually heading for a different restaurant that ended up being closed, and this sat on the opposite corner with very few people inside. as tourists, we took a chance for the opportunity to have a bit more space. they welcomed us with a smile as soon as we walked in. our party of three included a four year old, and our waiter was so very kind of her. the food was good, made even better by the hospitality. it was much appreciated on such a rainy and cold day after a long few weeks of traveling.; asked for french onion soup, hamburger, steak tartare. everything was delicious, but the server was the best part! joked and laughed with us the whole time. super friendly; went to this lovely restaurant. the service and food was excellent. the highlight of your experience was stephanie. he was very good and courteous and kind. the made the experience even better. if you visit here while in paris - ask for him. we will definitely come back here when we are back in town; the food was actually good but the waitress was very rude. it’s the first time in years both my wife and i agreed we wouldn’t give a tip or pay service charge; it was that bad. as an example, my wife placed her serviette on her finished plate and when collecting plates the waitress took the serviette off and placed it on the table in front of my wife. it could only be interpreted as some odd passive aggression. we also came with our dog and they said it’s fine. the waitress then looked at our dog like we’d brought a camel into their restaurant. it was a nice setting with good food but the service staff let the place down. other reviews seem to point to the same issue.

name: Little Davoli
reviews:
davila is located on rue cler, offers a chic and sophisticated dining experience perfect for adults seeking a refined atmosphere.

the restaurant’s elegant interior complements the vibrant and colorful italian dishes, which are not only visually appealing but incredibly tasty.

the menu showcases a variety of authentic flavors, with each dish crafted to perfection. whether you’re there for a casual meal or a special night out, diagoranis provides a delightful blend of style, flavor, and ambiance.

highly recommended for those looking to enjoy italian cuisine in a stylish setting.; this may be the best restaurant in paris we ate at. the cacio e pepe will take you to rome and the lasagne is amazing. you must start with the caprese salad - i have not had better. if you are in paris go. reservations are recommended. while we ate they turned away 6-8 couples. the place to eat!; ate at this place twice in one week. the food is great and very tasty, however, the service not so much. water in paris is provided free of charge which is tap water. they brought the first bottle (didn't ask for it) then brought a second bottle (didn’t ask for it), again tap water but charged 4€ for both bottles on the second visit in that week. they took advantage given being a tourist. everywhere else tap water is free across france. and they did not charge on the first visit to the restaurant but did so on the second visit.; excellent experience from the service of the waitress and waiter present during the night of our visit. high quality of food and wine combined with a warm and authentic atmosphere mainly created with the old school style & open bar to the room. we recommend to visit this place, thank you to everyone.; great italian restaurant in paris! the food was delicious, especially the pasta. the atmosphere was cozy, and the staff were really nice. a perfect spot for a good meal if you’re in the city. highly recommend! ✨

name: GAVROCHE
formatted_address: 4 Rue Grégoire de Tours, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
we found this restaurant to be great value. the staff were attentive and very friendly and the food was “magnifique”. i can highly recommend the amazing bouef bourguignon and the le fondant au chocolat was to die for. my husband had the  cheesecake with berry coulis and he said it was superb and very smooth. shout out to the talented chef!!
highly recommend this little gem.; loved everything - we ate here three times because chef pilou's dishes were sooo good 😍; i can’t come up with a single reason to dislike gavroche. service was great, food was excellent, location was perfect.; great atmosphere, great service and even better food… awesome spot for a dinner; pure food,

name: Café Beauvau
reviews:
it was very nice here.
we came for a drink and enjoyed ourselves.
seating is comfortable and service was quick.
overall very nice.; i have only been is france for 4 hours and this place made me feel so welcome and at home in this city. thierry is so welcoming and friendly. i want to keep exploring paris but i also don't want to leave this cafe. such a perfect blend of local regulars and random tourists like me. their english is perfect. 5 stars to thierry and eddy !; very very busy and the service was slow. however, the food was lovely.; the server and bartender here were so nice with us. we walked in at around 3pm and looking for some lunch. their kitchen was getting ready to close but the server took our order and the meal was delicious. i accidentally knocked over my drink and the he came up and before i knew it it was as if it had never spilled. they were awesome! i will definitely come back!; we went to the restaurant, which was a disaster from the moment we arrived until dessert, and the waitress was terrible.
she opens her mouth for derogatory remarks.
i've never experienced anything like it in 30 years of parisian life.
she should change profession... fish saleswoman.

name: La Créole
reviews:
we just stumbled on this restaurant while searching for a dinner place in montparnasse area. my husband and i have never had creole food before so we were very keen to try. we asked the server regarding recommendations and we got what he recommended - the whole fish and the goat stew dishes. they were both very delicious. they tasted authentic and flavourful. the facility was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. the prices are also very reasonable / affordable. i would recommend this restaurant for anyone who wants to try something different while staying in paris.; this spot caught our attention as we were strolling along the montparnasse blvd. we walked in and were immediately seated. appetizer was good. we ordered the crab cakes and enjoyed them. for the main entree i ordered the steak and my wife the curry goat. surprisingly, my steak had no flavor. i couldn’t even taste the salt or pepper. may have been my worse meal in paris. my wife thought the curry goat was ok.; a very good discovery!
i highly recommend this place!
we took the “rougail saucisse” and the “colombo de cabri”. the samousa are also great.
the staff are friendly and welcoming.; in central paris there's few places where you can eat well for a reasonable price. this is one of those rare places.
have some rum too!
its all good!
we reserved at "thefork" and we got a discount for it.
we particularly liked the plantain bananas
you can start with a mixed platter for two persons.; this place was amazing! we were attracted to it by the happy hour menu but stayed for the food! we love creole/caribbean food, so this was a pleasant find! we ordered the codfish fritters (accras de morue) and the stuffed crab (crabe farci). for the mains, we had the goat stew (columbo de cabri), king prawns stew (carry de gambas), and the creole sausage specialty. we especially enjoyed the prawns and goat. highly recommend this place if you enjoy this type of food. oh and get the hot sauce! 🔥

name: Sphere French restaurant Paris
reviews:
the restaurant was very cosy and i loved the food which was excellent with the wine pairing. luca our server made it more special with his amazing skills in explaining the dishes and his great sense of humor  . i loved having my girlfriend’s birthday there. we enjoyed it!; had such a lovely experience at the sphère. we decided on the 4 step course and it was magnificent. portions were pretty big for a tasting course and the flavor pairings were beautiful. i mentioned how i was celebrating my birthday on the reservation and they were sweet enough to light a candle on a dessert for me! would revisit next time i’m in paris.; truly an experience! we opted for the curated six dish course and each dish was amazing! the service and ambiance were great as well! overall, i’d recommend trying if you’re visiting paris. such a memorable experience!; i had the pleasure to enjoy the most delicious food at sphere. i would recommend everyone to try this restaurant if you visit paris. the flavour combination is divine! the service is excellent too (thank you, chloe!!) i have an unusual allergy selection and they are able to cater to them beautifully. i can’t recommend enough, especially for a special occasion :)

note though they do charge €9 for tap water, so not for the faint hearted, but the service, the food, the atmosphere is worth it for those special occasions!; beautiful restaurant and amazing gastronomic experience!

we came here to celebrate my fathers birthday and it was a wonderful experience. we had the 5 course tasting menu at 89€, it was more than enough food. we enjoyed the multitude of fish dishes.

starting with an amuse bouche of different fish bites - an excellent entry into the evening.

then we had some beautiful fish dishes to follow - i can’t recall which fish but they were very tasty and beautifully plated. the foie gras was also a nice sight! the steak dish was very tender.

there were two desserts. best asian compliment for a dessert is « not too sweet » and these fit the bill.

the service, by our waiter luca, was very attentive! what a coincidence to be served by a fellow canadian! wonderful experience.

name: Le Bistrot des Fables
reviews: cute spot for typical french fare - the french onion soup, the cod and the profiteroles were outstanding. friendly service, and a nice ambiance.; incredible! lovely location and very nice staff. food was excellent, and prices quite reasonable for paris. can get busy, so either go a little early or reserve a table. but definitely try this place if you’re nearby! make sure to try dessert…; this was the first meal i had upon arriving in paris after a long flight and it was more than a little disappointing, i ordered the beef tartare and it had a distinctly sour taste that made it taste suspiciously like the beef had gone bad, it emphasized the gamey taste of raw beef. i've had beef tartare many times and not a single one has made me want to gag as much as this one. while the beef was bad the french fries that accompanied it was worse, they were skinny and dull and all lumped together. seriously a good chunk of the fries stuck to one another and they were limp like they were day old french fries reheated. the snails were quite good, i will admit that. the atmosphere was fine, i mean the servers were a little blasé and inattentive, but that's almost to be expected in paris. the tdlr is that this place felt like a tourist trap with below average food and above average prices.; this is an absolutely charming restaurant, that you might miss if you don’t look for it.  the inside is impeccably gorgeous and has a cohesive comfortable yet sleek theme to it, the servers are as nice as can possibly be.  the food was terrific and creative a rare occurrence to try some classic dishes i loved growing up completely renewed.; the filet de rumsteak only came overdone and terrible. the scampi were also overdone. none of our party of 16 were really happy about the food.

name: L'Escapade
reviews: beautiful little parisian restaurant. popular with locals. warm and friendly service. great food - the cassolette d’escargots de bourgogne is a classic.; l'escapade is a delightful surprise! the food is outstanding, with every dish bursting with flavor. the owner is incredibly friendly, adding to the warm atmosphere. prices are very reasonable, making the high-quality cuisine even more impressive. overall, the bistro far exceeded my expectations. highly recommended!; told the people here i was a tourist and they immediately prepared the best meal for me. food cost me 40 euro but it was a meal well worth it. if you are a tourist looking to end the day on a perfect note come here. they serve great food and provide great service. they care about all their customers.; the best meal we had in paris. i loved this restaurant, the service, the people was so nice. the cocktails left me speechless and i am still dreaming with the veal stew 😍 if someone from the restaurant read that: save me giving me that recipe 😭 please; great place for a pint of lager, €3 in happy hour, and an even better view.

name: Odette et Charlus
reviews: to be honest, i was not sure of eating here, but it turned out to be a wonderful place. food was delicious, service was amazing. will definitely recommend 👌; the best within this area or zone tbh.i  have spent a week in hotel novotel nearby and this restaurant is the best bar/ restaurant.  i always see it's packed pass by. amazing cheeseburger and cold beer. great service. open until 2am. quiet space for conversation, spacious and nice music. rebelle is light but refreshing. love it. if you live in novotel, this is the best for you.; good place for a glass of wine and quiet talk. quite attentive service, inside and outdoor seating; very nice restaurant with new owner who started a few weeks ago. amongst the dish of the day, we had a nice salmon with vegetables of the day : just great! same for the italian salad. the desert, tiramisu with apple and "coing" was excellent. all dishes were homemade ! the service was very nice and we really enjoyed the place with nice music of 1980 for this evening.; our favourite bistro! tried escargots for the first time! great service, no rush, helpful and friendly and took time to let us try our french in conversation. not busy in the afternoon. the croque monseiur is my daughter's favourite. also be sure to try the cheese plate, and the risotto is amazing! we have been there 3 times in 5 days!

name: Halle Quatre
reviews:
we had our lunch at this place on our visit to paris. it is more of a hotel based restaurant. they gave a good menu collection. we went with fries, four-cheese pizza, and margherita pizza.
for drinks, we ordered fruit juices thinking they were fruit juices but got them in packaged bottle drinks.
it took more than 40 minutes to get our food to the table. but the food, meaning pizza, tasted very fresh and nice.
fries were tasty, too.
the staff herwvis very polite and kind and can conversate in english.
i see a lot of people ordering and having a good time here. they do have nice outdoor seating which we used and very nice place.; good service the place is clean and has indoor outdoor seating. the food pretty good we loved the appetizer of baked bear cheese with truffles and the steak was good for the value. the margarita pizza was just ok didn’t have any fresh basil, refresh mozzarella, but i guess that’s the way it comes, but didn’t really pay that much attention to the menu. the staff speaks english, so it’s very helpful and they have menus in english in addition to french. overall, a pleasant experience.
the breakfast buffet is great.; great service. delicious food. exceeded my expectations. got the closest i could get to jollof rice and it was really good. really enjoyed the meal. as well as the juice and cocktail.; great service and seriously delicious food. it was beyond my expectations. definitely recommended, especially if you're staying at novotel.; great food from a select menu from friendly staff.  had the steak tataki with fries and salad.  very good.  ordering was very easy - using a touchpad system which has an english menu - but the staff was equally helpful and their english was great (and sorry my french is so bad).  staff was very welcoming and friendly.

name: La pépinière
reviews:
great spot for lunch or late afternoon snacks. i stopped here one day when i only had 30 minutes to eat and they were incredibly kind about it. cute atmosphere with quite a bit of decor. my french onion soup was solid!
would definitely come back.

thanks you the sweet bartender for accommodating my super fast lunch!; food was good, drinks were great, loved the décor, but the service was trash. the vibe was right but the server literally ignored me constantly spent almost an hour and a half there because he simply would not come to the table then when he would come he was extremely rude. i am usually patient and understanding when it comes to food service after doing it for so long but this was disappointing.; had a fantastic meal as an early dinner and enjoyed it outdoors. everything tasted great! we ordered french onion soup, duck, fish, pasta and all entrees came freshly prepared and delicious. service was great too. highly recommend!; a great spot for a late-night meal or drinks in a central location with a nice décor. the onion soup is delicious, so is the fish and steak. good beer and cocktails. friendly service.; food was great! we got the lobster roll and it was very tasty. i tried the mashed potatoes which were wonderful and my husband had the fries which were perfectly crispy and fluffy. the service wasn’t anything too crazy, but i also think they were anticipating their usual lunch rush, as the every table around us filled up 15 - 30 minutes after we arrived.
the atmosphere was lovely, so colorful and fun! great spot for a nice lunch.

name: Il Grano
reviews:
excellent italian restaurant. everything was perfect, from the sitting to the service to the food. the « welcome to italy » pizza is literally one of the best pizzas we’ve ever had so far (including during our trip to italy). the pasta is also good but we preferred the pizza way more. we will definitely go back to this restaurant.
i recommend.; went without reservation on a week night and was seated correctly. food was really good, the pizza was a bit hard to cut. the escalope was perfect and the burrata was good; food was excellent, service was also great. i just gave 4 stars as they took us to an empty table (not made up) and didn’t give us any menus which meant we could only look at our phones until they eventually made their way over. would highly recommend though! great veggie options!; the food was excellent, in fact ironically this italian restaurant was the best food of our trip to france so far, and we do love french cuisine. the ingredients on our appetizer cold plate were very fresh, delicious with no added seasoning other than a touch of olive oil. our paste was cooked perfectly not too soft, and the sauces exploded with flavor. the truffle flavor in the tortellini was just perfect, enough to bring an obvious flavor but not too strong that it overpowered the mushrooms and cream, simply ideal.; lovely neighbourhood italian joint.

went on a sunday evening around 7.45pm without a reservation and got the last available table it seemed.

service was fast (maybe even too fast) but super friendly and efficient. we had the milanese (breaded and fried veal cutlet) which came with simple tomato pasta (is that traditional? felt a bit odd but fine).

we also had the outstanding and star dish that was the truffle ravioli - despite a cream sauce, was not at all heavy and didn't rely only on truffle oil as it came generously shaved with the fresh truffle.

the tiramisu was a perfect desert as it always is when serviced without any changes to the old classic recipe.

those dishes plus two beers came to 65 euros.

name: Mignon Café
reviews:
oh my god, the food here is so good!! the 25€ brunch is well worth it. incredible value. i had the house lemonade, a latté, the avocado tartine, the overnight porridge (a lovely delicate mixture of soaked oats, chia seed and fresh fruit), and a slice of apple caramel cake to finish. the cake was the highlight, though everything was delish. the waitress told me that everything is handmade, and you can definitely taste that in the food.; so delicious - the flavors of the avocado toast with sesame sprinkle all over!! and the pesto was incredible. the eggs - boiled on top of the toast or salad - very fresh and yummy!! we loved the waffle with fruit and enjoyed the juices - fresh squeezed ginger, carrot, lemon. apple, ginger, lemon..and more!!! great prices and super friendly staff.; great carrot cake.
coffee, really not good at all. i had a coffee earlier the day at the excellent casa (specialty coffee paris xii).
well, the contrast was sad.

also we waited about ten minutes with few clients for our drinks and the waitress mixed up the cakes also.

improve the coffee and service and you'll improve your rating.; the best brunch i’ve ever had! ok, to be honest, i haven’t had many brunches in my life so far… and it was my first time in paris as well. but it was so delicious i don’t know if anything can be better… freshly squeezed orange juice - great taste, not acidic, superb pro matcha, overnight porridge i never thought could be so special, extraordinary avocado toast (of those i’ve had quite a lot, so trust me that this one was top notch), and waffle, the waffle!!! with salted caramel… oh my mouth, stomach, eyes, everything, so happy, super full for 25€… i didn’t eat until dinner… merci!!! i need to learn french!; small but lovely place. very nice service, great selection of food, coffee and tea. coffee comes with a choice of plant-based milk if you prefer a vegan option.

we had the chai and coffee latte, and a granola, which was awesome. the bowls and toasts looked awesome, too.

can recommend!

name: VALMA
reviews: we are so lucky to have valma a few steps from our home. delicious food, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. the menu is simple and changes weekly and constantly, pleasantly surprises us. we come here regularly and plan to brings friends, family, and visitors alike. highly recommend this hidden gem.; walked in excited and left super annoyed.🤬the restaurant had easily 8 tables open, maybe 6 with customers and when the person in the cashier understood we spoke english she told us that all the remaining tables were reserved. seriously!?! typical rude parisian restaurant workers ! avoid them!!!; cool place for a sunday brunch, the quality of the food is excellent and simple with good portion, the taste is good, not phenomenal , the juices were very good and original, but it is a bit small and when it gets busy, it gets loud.; great food and great staff! highly recommend. made to feel very welcome; very nice place for a brunch during weekend. food is very good, kept simple. kids friendly place. best to book.

name: Break | Restaurant Paris 17 | Terrasse | Brunch Paris
reviews:
amazing brunch place with a fabulous atmosphere, amazing decor and delicious food.
we ordered 3 of their brunch items and they were all utterly delicious. the whole place is decorated as an ode to alice in wonderland in a simple yet creative way.
but the best (out of all good things in this place) was the service. despite having a full house, the service was quick and smooth, and laura, the owner always with a bright smile and a kind word, would still manage to exchange a few words with every table. we highly recommend you try this place and next time we are in a paris we will visit again.; the place was nice and unique and i did enjoy the vibes. the service was great as well. but the food pancakes that i ordered were mediocre and was not worth 17€. however the coffee was extremely good. would come back for coffee; burger was good. my girl ordered a blt w/avocado. ended up with a strange club type sandwich with egg and chicken and no bacon. definitely a language barrier in describing what kind of blt she wanted. they graciously replaced the sandwich.(i described through google translate a dry toast, bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado sandwich) came back very close but poorly executed blta.; amazing place and staff aswell.
the food was incredible!; i recently visited this establishment and had a very disappointing experience. the waitress was extremely rude, not even bothering to greet us. as we started to place our order, she abruptly walked away and began setting tables around us. the lack of basic courtesy and attention to customers was unacceptable. we decided to leave without completing our order.

name: The Place to...Wagram - Resto Pub
reviews:
the atmosphere was great especially for studying sessions! bonus points for the wifi, couches and charging plugs. the mocha was incredible, i could really taste the chocolate. the waitress was a bit rude tho , i might come back to try the food; waiters are so uncultured. when we came on brunch on 11:38 and took the plates, they stoped with loud voice and asked to place it back. i can understand that they could be late, but that moves are unacceptable
wait for the menu, order and bill are so long

food was okay, but far from perfect

atmosphere is good, especially on the street seats; i was clearly disappointed by the unfriendly welcome at the place to be... wagram. the service was cold, lacking any explanation of the venue; i didn't feel welcomed at all. however, the decor is nicely done, creating a cozy atmosphere where one can comfortably work. i opted for the tartare, a parisian brasserie classic, which was good. yet, the lack of hospitality leaves much to be desired. it's a shame because with a warmer welcome, this could be a great spot. a smile costs nothing. 😕🍽️🏨; i really enjoyed working at the place to.
the place is suitable for working in peace and quiet and it's very well set up in terms of coworking space. you can stay there as long as you want and you are not really bothered.
i find that the prices are relatively expensive (but that's normal given the neighbourhood) and it's rather justified given that there is no "package" like some coworking spaces offer in paris. so you have to play the game! the coffee is excellent and the staff are charming and always available. i didn't have to raise my hand for the waiter to come and give me the instructions for the wifi.
one small comment about the wifi: you will have to reconnect via the gate very often and it's a bit inconvenient if you're in a meeting. i hope it was just punctual.
great decor, the music is very discreet in the background compared to starbucks for example.
the food menu is really varied and i highly recommend the vegetarian burger (which i ordered about 2 years ago)
thanks for the welcome; joke place. just sent back 2 terrible steaks rest of the food cold horrid!!!
kebab was cold. don't bother eating here avoid!
look at this for salad 🤣 we're in france😂 culinary delight culinary shiteeee more like. manager is also terrible........ he is rude. terrible human. asked what do i want..... i don't want to pay you silly little tanker...... hopefully you get fired.
managers really need to address last nights issues. must say almed the waiter i think his name was the only one who is worth employing.

name: Tifinagh
reviews: amazing! 3 course dinner and coctail cost 26 euros.; we wanted to try this family style classical french restaurant, it was a bit difficult to find but we found it after walking down from the street above. the food was ok but not great. we had the 3 course plate. the tomato and mozzarella appetizer was excellent. both our desserts ( peach pie and apple crumble was delicious as well. the perch we had for one of our main courses was good but somewhat bland. the potato’s were very good. the chicken and mushroom dish was problematic. the mushroom sauce was very good but the chicken was very dry and overcooked. it was a generous portion but i couldn’t eat more than half of it. the service was very good and the manager/ owner made sure we were comfortable and insured we were served well.; great little family bistro tucked down a side street a couple blocks from the moulin rouge. the food was good, not great, however the service was fantastic and the owners son was so personable and pleasant to chat with. one of our favorite dining experiences in paris. i had the duck and mashed potatoes, very good.; best waiter and costumer service ever, this family restaurant is one of the best i’ve ever been to. the meat was huge and delicious. overall 💯; a little off the beaten path, a bistro frequented by the locals. really impressed with the appetisers, salmon encased in filo-pastry and the tuna salad were very good and the veal main was superb! so much better than the oh so disappointing mechelin star restaurant we went to last night!! kudos to the chef! highly recommended!!

name: Café biergit
reviews:
cheesecake and an oat milk latte on a rainy day with my sketchbook in a comfortable corner.  perfect way to wait out the rain.; (german native)

people were pretty excited about this place having german food and so on, so i wanted to give it a try as well.

in the end i was pretty disappointed and so was my wife. sausages do not appear to be of quality, curry sauce isn’t home made and the fries don’t look homemade either but the server insisted they are.

kiez remains the #1 spot for german food.; nice place. nice food. nice prices; very traditional and cozy german café with nice food, specially the cheese bretzel, the black forest cake and the sausages.

they also have a wide variety of german beers and the service is top!; quality food with such a low price that warren buffet would even enjoy here because fine german style sausages with wide selections of german beers and a few wines and scotch whisky as well. very friendly staffs and opens late until almost 1 am. you would feel paris is not so expensive when you are here.

name: Maison Milie
reviews:
big surprise!
i find expect much from this place but i couldn't be more wrong! i think it was one of the best shaksuka i've tried! a bit different then the classic one but full of taste and veggies.

the place is very cozy, not too crowded. the dishswere served quickly and the staff was very nice. i highly recommend trying out for a quick lunch.; the service and location are excellent. i loved the presentation of the food as well as the staff. the food was savory and the experience is second to none. the price point is perfect and i will be back soon.; good brunch. the matcha is really tasty. the food is good but nothing special. the cafe is in a really good place if you want to visit the sacré-couer basilica.; ordered a mocaccino and iced americano. drinks are good but they charged 3 extra euros for a “café frappé” when i ordered and received an ice americano. refused to compensate despite it being on the receipt. granted they don’t understand english so avoid if tourist.; cute cafe in paris!

friendly staff made the experience even better. great food & coffee.

perfect spot for a cosy weekend brunch!

name: Café Latéral
reviews:
delicious breakfast.
we had english breakfast for 18.50€ each, which includes a hot drink, croissant,french bread, butter and jam, fried eggs with bacon (which they swapped with scrambled eggs with bacon for us) & a freshly squeezed orange juice.
staff very nice and friendly and great location, overlooking arc de triumph.
( i would prefer fried onion rather then pickled in the eggs); the staff were so nice and helpful, everything was delicious and with a great price also! true parisian experience. would definitely go again.; the location is lovely, you get a view of the arc de triomphe, however, it’s extremely noisy and crowded. i wanted to sit inside but there was no table available hence i was sat outside with loud honking and constant chatter of crowds. i felt that the service was a little condescending and there is a discrimination against non-french people. i ordered the salmon and it was pink on the inside, not my preference but i love salmon so much that i didn’t mind. the dish wasn’t the best but it is not the worst i have had either. definitely overpriced even in comparison to other places in paris, you’re definitely only paying for the location and the view.  this one in my opinion is definitely skippable unless you take their brunch menu which i didn’t find quite appealing.; being just opposite my hotel it became a very convenient place for our regular breakfast during our  stay in paris, we enjoyed their quick service and warm ambience.; we come here for drinks and snacks every time we are in paris.  service is great today. the waitress was friendly and cheerful.  we like the outdoor seatings and less crowded street.  the sidewalk is wide and properly shaded by trees.

name: La Compagnie du Café
vicinity: 19 Rue Notre Dame de Lorette, Paris
formatted_address: 19 Rue Notre Dame de Lorette, 75009 Paris, France
reviews: fantastic coffee shop! very nice and fast service, delicious food, and the coffee is really good. the vibe is great. you can bring your laptop in the morning, but not for lunch. they also have free wi-fi. with the brunch menu, you can just add a cappuccino with oat milk for two additional euros. the place is also spacious, and of course, there is an outdoor area. i highly recommend it.; the place was just cozy and the atmosphere was nice. i was there with other friends for a late breakfast and we had an amazing eggs & sides meal. the portions were good and the taste was good as well. the coffee i got was americano but in different level. all in all it was a good experience.; the best brunch spot we went to while in paris! they had a huge menu and everything looked delish. went with the brunch special which was soooo much food for only like 25€! loved everything that we had and didn’t wait more than 10 mins for a table for the 4 of us. coffee selection and taste was also amazing!; a lovely cafe i found walking in south pigalle. the young people at the register were super nice and accommodating. i didn’t have any food so can’t rate that but the coffee and tea were good and the atmosphere very relaxing.; the golden milk is really good, i loved it. for the hot drinks seems like this place is using real products instead of the powdered or syrup flavours. the food is good but there should have more dairy and gluten-free and vegan options available in the menu.

name: Ernestine Café
formatted_address: 72 Rue Joseph de Maistre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
**5 stars - amazing spot!**

loved my visit to ernestine cafe! the coffee was rich and flavorful, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. the cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a perfect place to relax or catch up with friends. will definitely be back!💖🤩 highly recommend; was just walking by and decided to give the cafe a chance, i’m so glad i did!

the cozy interior is very charming, they host a lot of children workshops here in a separate playroom open for them to play in while their parents enjoy their meal / drink. there’s a large window looking into the playroom so parents can watch their kids but also have a bit of space to themselves, very family friendly and innovative. the atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming; there’s mostly locals who stop by here but ernestine cafe is also very tourist friendly because the workers speak and understand english well.

the menu is diverse and creative, with all the food being made in house. they have a restroom in the back which makes it convenient to spend some time here. i ordered their brunch and left quiet full and content, will definitely stop by the next time i’m in paris!; ernestine is the café i always wanted. it has delicious and wonderful café options, the food is copious and nicely priced, there are ateliers and storytelling in english and french, and i feel relaxed and at home there. more importantly, so does my baby. also, yannis has an intuitive and sentimental capital that really lends the sense there is a love of children; it is not an attention confined to merely the children's section.; it is a very cosy and charming cafe with a special area for children. while our one year daughter is playing we can enjoy excellent macchiato. don't miss this place if you have young kids and like very good coffee.; super cosy and relaxing shop.

name: Café Marlette
reviews:
the food is incredible and the service was outstanding. adorable little spot for any time of day and the selection of cakes are delicious.; this was my second experience at marlette
while in paris on vacation. the food is not only so good but well executed and on the healthy side with many options, service is very friendly and i found out that this amazing helpful man who was so good to us was the owner, i also love how accommodating they are about you having your laptop out and be connected. this is a cute little cozy place that has it all.; check out marlette for breakfast. their egg, bacon, and cheese is delicious - a perfect mix of flavors. also, try the ginger tea; it's refreshing and a great start to your day. highly recommended!; friendly staff, and very willingly accommodated our limited french. the breakfast here was very good.  scrambled eggs stuffed into a bun, topped with bacon, cheese and then baked. amazing!; the food is good, but on one occasion, we asked for two orders of scrambled eggs, and only one  arrived. we kept telling the waitress we still had another order pending, but they never gave it to us. in the end, we waited for 40 minutes for scrambled eggs that never arrived. also, i've been there a couple of times because honestly, the food is good, but sometimes they change the recipes from one day to the other. so you can get a delicious chocolat chaud and the next day you can get chocolate powder.

name: Chez Marie
reviews:
the ambiance was amazing. the food was delicious. one of the best meals i have had all week and i’m on my last day. the owner is darling and so accommodating. highly recommend stopping at this gem.; this is a gem in the middle of a very touristy space! the food is amazing, not expensive and in general great service and atmosphere! the servers are so kid and attentive, the food has that parisian real touch! the duck confit was amazing! worth trying; wonderful little parisian bistro with warm friendly service, cute outdoor seating, and very delicious food!

my dad had the cheeseburger, it was seasoned so well and the bun was super tasty. it had two patties!

i had the chicken caesar salad and it had a fried chicken cutlet too.

my mom is a big french onion soup fan and this is why i picked this restaurant! she loved it, not too salty and very flavorful overall.

highly recommend this cute little restaurant especially if you’re near moulin rouge and avoid a tourist trap; we had a nice lunch here on our first day in paris! the omelettes and salad were delicious and tasted very fresh. good service, nice atmosphere and reasonable prices.; met two lovely sisters working at the cafe.  great hosts.  one of the best lunches i had while visiting paris this trip. i must return.  the freshness of all ingredients made for the perfect chicken burger.   on vacation i always try the deserts.  their cheese. cake exceeded all expectations.  welcome to paris and france.  every meal is a master piece!

name: Le 27 Gourmand
reviews:
fantastic family run place.
on point recommendations, very lovely food. fantastic wines. the cheese platter was simple but so so delicious.
lovely and quiet, but atmospheric place. i came as a single diner and enjoyed myself thoroughly; amazing food , great service and nice atmosphere, what more could you ask for? salmon appetizer, duck & chicken w/ mushrooms and truffle ravioli, and profiteroles for dessert !; love this homemade taste cook but very high class in taste!
it’s owned by the husband and wife for 28 years together! very sweet ❤️❤️❤️

appreciate to find this gem in the middle of paris, escape from all pricy tourist place. this is absolute a gem!

this restaurant deserves more recognition!
we ordered the duck and mushroom, it’s bomb!; absolutely fabulous 👌 i would highly recommend. very cosy and relaxed atmosphere. elegant menu and friendly service; the ambiance, lighting and cozy factors are high!
husband (kitchen) and wife (front of house) make an amazing team for a culinarily delightful evening. we couldn’t finish our dishes as the portions are very generous. highly recommend!

name: Chez Poupette Paris
reviews:
great lunch. good service, only one person bur she was very nice and fast.

the food is great, highly recommend ❤️; food was excellent and service was good. our server was especially helpful even though we did not speak french; very enjoyable meal, great food, great wine with great service. very nice experience; super nice waiter and delicious food! thank you very! ❤️; shockingly mediocre. i don’t know what’s going on in this street, multiple very cute and relatively expensive restaurants and they are putting no effort into the food. i don’t know if the citizens of batignolles are to blame or the owners…

came for an early dinner and had pan tomate, ceviche, chicken curry and dessert… would rate them all 5/10. guys put some effort, this is embarrassing for everyone involved, merci.

name: La Famiglia
reviews:
lovely home cooked food with an authentic italian family touch (e.g. saltimbocca). we visited during the olympics and were delighted to find such a top quality restaurant open.  friendly and efficient service (in french and english). just a shame that on the evening of our visit we were virtually the only customers. tourists and parisians alike clearly missed out!; the restaurant continues with the same good service as always, super attentive. the atmosphere is intimate and modern, the linguine à la truffe de bourgogne and the alle vongole were very well executed. emphasis on the octopus and the tiramisu, which accompanied the meal very well.  excellent experience, i recommend.; was excited to have a nice italian meal while in paris knowing we would be eating a lot of french food in the days that followed. we were seated by our host/waiter who showed no grace or decorum. there was one other american family there besides us and a french family came in later.
we started with fried calamari which were like eating a worn tire, rubbery and chewy.
i still had hopes for the homemade pasta. my meal was beyond el dente! if this were truly fresh pasta it would not have been so hard (uncooked). fresh pasta does not take that long to boil! my husbands gnocchi was a disappointment as well. he said some were very good, others not so good at all! not once did the waiter come over to check on us. he gave all his attention to the french group.
finally when he came to clear our plates, i let him know how disappointed we were in the meal. to his credit he offered us a tiramisu which was very good. though as my husband said, they probably didn’t make it.
please, save your money and go somewhere else!; i only post if i feel passionately about a place.   well this place is just waw!! my best friend and i visited paris for the first time in april and wanted an exceptional food experience. we planned our trip for months and finally were in paris.  i am so happy i agreed with her after she said the photos of the food looked incredible. we walked in and at first i wasn't sure they would serve us because we did not have a reservation but when the gentleman greeted us it seemed that we could stay.

the atmosphere was comfortable and modern and the service from the restaurant team was attentive and comforting.   from selecting the wine to dishes we were blown away by the quality and taste.  it is quaint and a place you feel special.

i've experienced some of the best italian food in san diego such as il fornaio and enoteca buona forchetta but la famiglia in paris left me speechless.

if you want fine dining that is luxurious and most importantly the best food this is the place to visit.   a hidden gem of paris, tres bien!!; if you find yourself wandering the charming streets of paris, craving a taste of home amidst the plethora of restaurant options, look no further. nestled in the heart of the city, this culinary gem provided us with an unforgettable dining experience that truly felt like a warm embrace.

as we step in the restaurant at first we were clueless of should we sit or wait for someone as we didn't find any server for 5mins, but as soon as the staff saw us they greeted us with smiles that immediately made us feel at ease.

let's talk about the food – oh, the food! every bite was a symphony of flavors that danced on our palates, leaving us utterly enchanted. as travelers accustomed to sampling various cuisines, it's rare to find a meal that truly resonates with the comfort of home. yet, each dish at la famiglia exuded that unmistakable sense of familiarity and nostalgia, transporting us to a culinary haven where every bite felt like a warm embrace.

whether it was the perfectly seasoned cod, the indulgent pasta dish, or the decadent dessert that left us weak in the knees, every aspect of the menu was a testament to the chef's skill and dedication to excellence. each dish was crafted with care and attention to detail, resulting in a dining experience that surpassed our wildest expectations.

name: ISANA PARIS
reviews:
we found this place through google as we were craving south american food. i had this plat du jour. the meat was from the shoulder of the pork made with mexican spices. undoubtedly this was one of the best pork dishes i have ever had. service was really good as well.; authentic, flavor is amazing! the menu has a variety of dishes from peru to mexico to argentina! service is very friendly! pls try the pisco sour is my fav! i recommend literally everything, too difficult to choose one; amazing food, from the fish tostadas to the tacos and the ceviches everything was perfectly executed. the cocktails are worthy of a good cocktail bar at below average prices for paris, try the mezcalita or any of the sours! the whole experience was excellent and in no small part thanks to our great host; the latino american restaurant is cozy and has places to seat inside or outside in a road without traffic. the main plates are ceviche that was really good and the empanadas. on sunday they offer the brunch formula that gives the possibility to try different plates from latine america. the service is very friendly and prices really reasonable. wifi and electricity plugs are a plus specially if you are a tourist.; food 10/10
atmosphere 10/10
service:
- we had a confirmed reservation but didn't find a table available when we arrived
- our food was served anomalously later than other tables
- we were given a dessert without any spoons and napkins

it's quite a pity because the food was really amazing

name: Un Air de Famille
reviews:
delicious food, lovely atmosphere, kind staff. we had a romantic and enjoyable dinner for two in the evening and ordered starter, entree, desert and bottle of wine on the menu that changes each day.; wow what a special delight! we found this restaurant accidentally when we were out walking around. i wanted real french food and this place did not disappoint! it offered a full menu of very french dishes. all tasted like grandma’s recipes, which was a perfect match to the very homey atmosphere. it’s like a cross between a very old fashioned air b&b and an antique store. look at the pictures to see the cool treasures sprinkled throughout.

if you want to go to a place for a true french experience without tourists, i recommend finding your way to this delightful restaurant.

i had the best foie gras i have ever had for a starter, followed by a traditional meal of sausage on lentils and vegetables (saucisse de toulouse). for dessert, i had a wonderful tarte aux pommes. my friend started with a gorgeous appetizer - layered egg plant, cream cheese, and zucchini, and beets. gorgeous. (millefeuilles de beetrave.) her main course was a vegetable dish with grated vegetables (gratin de poireaux, épinards, et légumes) and lemon tarte (tarte citron) for dessert.

we were so pleased to find this place by pure accident.; lovely decor and warm foods. good selection of wines 🍷we spent a good time here. i ordered baeckoffe and it was well cooked. would recommend!; very charming little restaurant with special dishes and a feel-good atmosphere. highly recommended.; cozy and intimate setting. amazing authentic food and they have something for everyone. the service is superb. cannot recommend this place more!

name: Papilla Brochant
reviews:
first time here with a group of friends, 6 of us ordered some appetizers and mains plus wine and dessert. food was really delicious, service was very fast and friendly, they also speak good english! prices are normal, even cheap for paris. tiramisu for 4 people was enough for mixed group of 6! highly recommend if you like italian food and you are in the area; i recently visited papilla, hoping for a great italian meal in paris, but unfortunately, my experience was underwhelming. the food was decent, but nothing extraordinary considering the price. the real surprise, though, came with the bill—€5 for a bottle of water! i’ve never been charged that much for something so basic, and it left a bad taste in my mouth (pun intended).

the atmosphere was nice, and the service was okay, but the unexpected charge for water, on top of already average food, made the experience disappointing. i think there are better italian spots in the city.; been here thee times so far.

breakfast: the croissants were warm and absolutely delicious!!

dinner: we took starters and main course, which were delicious as well.
we came back a third time just for the amazing starters!

the service was a little depending on who you got. some of the waiters were just ok, one was a little grumpy, and others were fantastic!
the third time we got an adorable waitress how gave us the best energy and experience.

would definitely come back.; we were in a hurry and had a simple menu order of pizza, mojito and cappuccino. very fast order fulfilment. and i must say pizza was exceptionally good !! good service too.; papilla is wonderful! everything we had was delicious and the vibe is on point. everyone that works at papilla are so welcoming and delightful.

we stayed about a block away on our trip to paris, we would either start or finish our day here.. we were never disappointed! we miss them already.

100/10 would recommend

name: Le Moulin de la Galette
reviews:
you must visit this restaurant if you are visiting paris. food here is absolutely delicious, beyond your imagination. staff are attentive and fabulous, couldn't ask for anything more. the onion soup is a must and also recommend the chocolate mousse for dessert. oh and the fries are by far the best ever! the courtyard out the back is also the best spot for relaxing with the delicious food.; used city pass. was great to have nice and professional service. coffee was smooth with the macarons. enjoyed the nice morning break on the porch.
went back for dinner again used city pass. for soup and escargot. dinner was delicious, beautiful and served by happy fun people. great experience.; lovely place just 200 meters off place du tertre. staff is very friendly and helpful, though they were very busy. my daughter wanted to switch places, that was no problem. the melon and ham starter tasted lovely with homemade melon sorbet. prawn start is great! main course was the cod, very good. just as the pasta that was very tasteful. we were happy with the price quality ratio so i would definitely recommend this place. we had several dinners on place du tertre square but we found the quality often poor. so this restaurant is worth the short walk.; really nice experience from the ambience, the service and to the food.  we used our gocity pass and received french onion soup (chosen instead of the escargot) and my husband and i were served a glass of wine and our two kids received soft drinks.  all of that was included with the pass. we then ordered the linguine and also the risotto.  to top it off we shared an amazing chocolate mousse.  a big thank you to our waiter for a special first meal in paris!; everything you could possibly think of when you’re in paris is there.

friendly staff, with a good food and atmosphere!
we booked table in advance because it gets crowded (especially at night). area is safe and bit touristic.
try escargot’s and onion soup, it’s delicious

name: Le Petit 18ème
reviews: i’d give 6 stars if i could! both the lentilles salad and the cod main were delicious! super the best!; had the parisian burger (salad side), entrecôte steak, cod fish, and quinoa salad. everything was wonderfully delicious! service was greet, meal was great, prices aren’t too bad either!; crazy good food, good vibes. the wait for the food was a little long. ask for the dish of the day, we got some pasta with chicken and vegetables, it was amazing. good service:)); unbelievable small piece of fish with fries for 19 euros. left hungry. hamburgers are apparently ok. everything tasted good but that fish… speechless.; fantastic place for a coffee and a bite to eat. welcoming to us even though we don't speak french. just wish we would have found it near the start of our trip instead of the last day!

name: Bistrot MÔM
reviews:
