came to celebrate my birthday.  lovely atmosphere but my steak was chewy, not great, and i found a hair in my fries. even though my friends said their pasta and risotto was all right. wine was good. i don't think i'll come again.; the chef did a great job with the food selection for the new year's eve dinner! we enjoyed the sea bass and beef dishes, with elegant presentation and generous portions. friendly, cozy and chic atmosphere tucked away in a lovely neighborhood. thank you for making our family's nye dinner special!; nice french resto with a lot of options. the prices are reasonable & the service is great. had a birthday here and did not dissapoint. the only drawback was that it the taste of the food was just good, not great or unbelievable, and this is not a bad thing actually.; loved the place ! food and drinks are of good quality and staff is nice and welcoming. prices might be a bit high but you won’t regret it.
to top it off the blind test on the first floor and the private room allow you to plan for more than just a nice meal.; impeccable service and absolutely delicious food. highly recommended.

name: L' Elfe Assis
reviews: this is my second time at this crêperie. as usual, the sweet and savory galettes are really good. however, we had to wait an hour to eat !; amazing food, heartwarming service and superbe atmosphere, so consistent throughout more than 10 years! levallois is not far from city center of paris, hop on the line 3 of métro and enjoy the best galette & crêpe with a pot of tea, an experience that you will always remember and even want to carry with 🤍; i can’t recommend this place enough. the best crepes i’ve tried in paris. the service is wonderful and welcoming.. extremely quick to bring out the food and as for the flavor.. you’ll never forget it!; nice restaurant with great crepes varieties.; a hidden gem. galettes and crêpes both standard and creative for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike.  their creative dishes (les +s i) are extraordinary.  pleasant service and a curbside seating area for nice evenings.

name: Bibiche
reviews: a week ago during the olympic games we had dinner, along with our french friends at the bibiche a montmartre. the tables on a small square , crowded, vivid, with some traffic around. the food was very tasty, gourmet but not too much. the service relaxed, parisian style, ok. i recommend the camembert rôti au miel et aux herbes de provence (hot camembert cheese ,excellent along with wine), the tartare d’avocat à la mangue, coriandre, menthe, sauce au piment d’espelette ( a fresh avocado based salad, perfect for a summer day) and the pavé de rumsteack angus au poivre, frites maison ( steak with french fries). i did not like the araignée de cochon duroc, jus de moutarde et purée maison ( grilled pork loin) because it was overdone, too dry, although the sauce and the potato puree were good. the prices, taking into account paris, montmartre and the olympics, were reasonable.i will visit this nice restaurant in my next trip to paris!; fantastic meal - had the beef tartare and viennese coffee. delicious! staff were so friendly and patient as i practised my limited french. great ambience inside on a rainy day; absolutely loved this restaurant, we were english visitors trying to speak french, working out what we wanted, staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. food was great, very tasty and presented to a high quality. we sat outside, the atmosphere was awesome really soaking up the atmosphere of the area. a perfect start to our holiday, we will definately be back. recommend 100%; overall a really good experience at this bistrot/café, which offers al fresco seating on a cute little square just outside of the main tourist trail in montmartre. the waiting staff were pleasant and relaxed and the (more than decent) food came rather quickly. i also noticed a lot of locals eating or drinking at this place which is always a good sign.; disappointing visit. avocado tartar lacked flavor, poke bowl was average, and calamari was gritty with sand. manager admitted to poor washing but offered no apology or refund. unacceptable hygiene standards. can't recommend. the one star goes to our waiter who was kind and had a positive vibe.

name: Lucette fait des crêpes
reviews:
great place for crepes! staff was very patient and helpful, even with our limited french. food was delicious, both savory and sweet. great service and atmosphere; my favorite crêperie in paris! i’ve been here many times and every time i leave more than satisfied! there’s a lot of great options of crêpes and galettes and they’re all just a good as the last. the staff is always friendly and the vibe very cozy. and the prices are very reasonable as well!; best crêpes in paris, had two at the same time as one was not enough. the staff is friendly and the environment is very chilled and nice with seating indoor and outdoor.
to my surprise, marie from the staff knew italian perfectly so could communicate with her directly in italian, she’s lovely and super friendly! thank you, will be back when in paris.; ⭐⭐⭐☆☆

the crepe restaurant in paris offers a bustling atmosphere with a decent selection of french crepes. i highly recommend trying their classy ham, cheese, and egg galette – it's a true delight for the taste buds. however, i would advise skipping the chicken and avocado crepe; opting for the classics ensures a more satisfying experience.

the restaurant itself is quite small, and at times, it can feel a bit cramped. despite the limited space, the food quality is pretty decent. overall, it's worth a visit if you're in the area and craving some tasty crepes.; service was good and the rosé wine perfectly acceptable for the price. the decoration is pretty nice and there is a pleasant atmosphere there. the savory pancakes are enjoyable. the dessert pancake too, but the one that are “flambé” are just not … you can definitely taste the alcohol but it was never lit up, that part was a bit disappointing.

name: Le Talon Caché
reviews: we are lucky to have this place within 2 minutes of our apartment.  great food and wine and the best and friendly staff.  we return regularly! thanks guys!!!; great pizza!! authentic italian pizza in france...; nice restaurant! will come back again. good service and great quality of the food; awesome little italian restaurant. prices are reasonable, food is delicious and service is awesome (but a bit slow). highly recommended.; nice and friendly staff but food below average

name: Chez Alice
reviews:
we stayed in paris a few nights over the olympics and went here as it was close to our hotel. really glad we did, it was one of the best meals i had in paris during my stay! really good value too. would absolutely recommend.; extra; best cod i’ve had! so good!!!; good food and service; a rather family-oriented portuguese restaurant serving rather family-style cuisine too. it's not very sophisticated, but simple and good, offering some essentials of portuguese gastronomy, including of course cod in different forms. generous quantities, so you better be hungry.
very large room and small terrace. possibility of coming with children, the setting lends itself to this.
small problem: the toilets could be better, especially since there is only one.

name: Le Dream Café
reviews: it was clear the waiters did not want tourists in their bar and hovered over our table listening to conversations and staring making us feel uncomfortable. one of them also made a point of saying we were tourists but didn't think we heard that. also attempted to charge us for more drinks than we ordered. was also told they weren't serving food despite others eating. very underwhelming and rude service and really need to learn to welcome all types of paying customers. unfortunately this was the bar right across from our accommodation which really sucked.; nice standard bar with standard bar food. the selection is not extraordinary but functional.; good pizza.  i would have liked a few more toppings.; they don't  like tourists! the sever asked us to leave without  saying  it; giving us the check while still eating and drinking. came up to our table multiple  times  for payment without  being done. while having  the back of the establishment  empty. pass; first the good - lovely coffee at reasonable cost in a lovely location. now the bad - when trying to pay, server insisted on cash ( no signs anywhere). had no cash so told to visit cash point opposite...i refused. was told they had no working card payment machine so i said that's their problem. miraculously a card machine then appeared and i paid, accompanied by the muttering abuse of the male server. be careful.

name: Les Caves Populaires
reviews:
my favorite bar in paris. a place where you can work during the day or mingle with the diverse clientele in the evening. the staff are friendly, the atmosphere is always nice, the choices of wine and beer are quality and it’s open every day! i have been in paris since 2006 and i can never find the same feeling i get when i am there in any other bar. try it and you’ll understand :); a pretty casual coffee place to have a break, great atmosphere, staff are very friendly and helpful, drinks are ok, but the morning croissant 🥐 tasty terrible unfortunately…, other than that, is a nice place to chill out with friends.; funky little student friendly wine and beer bar. warm and inviting for solo travellers !; didn't have any food but prosciutto/cheese platters and fresh made baguettes looked decent.

good service in a rustic environment. lots of locals which made for a great atmosphere.; great atmosphere and friendly staff that does not hesitate to orientate in your wine choices and let you try beers from small breweries. food (planches) was ok but not outstanding

name: NAVARRO PUB BAR A JEUX
formatted_address: 1 Rue du Dr Heulin, 75017 Paris, France
reviews: this place will be forerver in my memory. coming from malaysia, i had visited alone in may and made some great friends, including the bartender/owner michael. i came back again in oct and guess what, i met the same people again, and got to know more friends!  it's a great place to mingle and shoot some pool/billiard albeit the space was a bit tight, but all in good fun! you could also play darts, arcade and foosball. there's also a boxing machine to test your power punch.; great experience, specially if you like pool.; we arrived tired, with two small children in tow. sylvie, our host was delightful. she was very attentive and helpful, providing a wonderful summary of the dishes. the food was delicious - and most definitely fresh! the calamari was so tender. the bisque incredible. sylvie was also very kind and patient with our children (2 and 4 years of age). we really appreciated her patience with the kids - as we’d all just arrived from the airport and they were hungry and tired. i would go back here in a flash. we all would. if you are staying nearby do not miss a meal at stanley.; the owner of this restaurant kicked my trip to paris into high gear. i was welcomed into this beautiful place with a warm hug and a "bonjour". after i expressed that i didnt speak any french, she taught me a few words, gave me a tour of the space and then translated the menu for me. if that wasn't enought, the food was delicious. if you are ever in this part of paris, do yourself a favor and stop by.; wonderful experience, we felt so welcomed by the entire stanley team. the food was excellent, and the service impecable. i can’t wait to return with my friends and family! merci beaucoup pour l’accueil très chaleureux!

name: Les Petits Cons'
reviews:
absolutely fantastic!
this place is affordable but keep up with excellent cuisine (felt like home - fries are delicious, and i'm belgian) and awesome hosts. we got a 3 courses menu for lunch and it only costs 16.5€! delicious and cheap - must try!
at night this place converts into a tapas bar, with a good atmosphere, delicious beers, and cocktails;); very nice local bar. is a great place to spend the evening, and they also serve a great breakfast/brunch in the morning.; one of my favorite local bar/restaurants; i visited the place with my colleagues as an afterwork activity which we already reserved in advance. you might think that the place and staff will be ready to welcome its customers, but what we found was:
extremely sticky and dirty tables, floor, glasses and plates, the place was cold inside. the staff looked unhappy and not active 😅 please have a drink before your shift!

please do check the owner's reply to my review and other people's reviews as well to know what type of business owner he is. i just updated the review because it replies with low manners.

btw the free parking in sarlat was at least clean!

the worst and stickiest experience.; a nice little place to get some drinks! the price is excellent and the staff, too cool. great experience all around. hoping to revisit soon! 😃

name: La Fourmi
reviews:
our last burgers in paris - and they were great! great service, extremely friendly and great food at very reasonable prices.; they serve good pub food at a reasonable price. i enjoyed the relax atmosphere even though the music volume was a tad too loud. i want to compliment the young man who served me. he looks like he enjoys what he is doing. i will highly recommend this place.; came across this bar on a corner as we descended from montmartre onto pigalle via rue des martyrs on a saturday afternoon.
i believe it can get very busy later in evening but a great spot on a saturday afternoon. great big windows to people watch - as well as outdoor seating. loved the distressed look.
fantastic prices - can get a pint of grolsch for €5.50 but loved the barge ipa for €8.
glass of wine - €4.; always visit this venue when in paris. the service is good, staff friendly, music great and food is good quality and hits the spot. the burger is recommended! it usually very busy in the evenings, particularly nice in the summer when windows an doors can be open. highly recommended.; soooo... the thing with this place... it's quite cheap for paris prices & for me, they've got one of the tastiest salads in the city - the salade chèvre chaud!!!!!! i've tried some other food here though and it wasn't as amazing, the service also is super slow at times, so it depends if you're lucky or not 🙈nevertheless, what speaks for it, is its laid back and chilled atmosphere, which is perfect for meet-ups with friends or dates! it somehow has that kind of parisian charm! if you're lucky & get a little sunny spot on the terrace, you'll enjoy everything even more, while having your spot for people watching 😏 (and grab that chèvre chaud salad at the same time 😜)

name: Aux Dés Calés 18 - Moreau
reviews:
we had a really nice lunch at this restaurant. we had the lunch menu with three plates and everything was delicious. the stuff was very polite and friendly. we would definitely visit again.; it’s a good place to eat french food, they have a very nice terrace in a quiet street.
the service is very good. the staff are so friendly. , the prices are really reasonable and the food is very good.
i recommend the steak tartare .; fantastic little bistro. we went with two kids aged 7 and 9 and they both asked to come back the day after. food is great quality and the specials interesting. prices very reasonable and friendly staff.; really nice restaurant! the atmosphere was cozy, the staff was very friendly. they even turned on a small heater next to our table when i said that i was cold. the food was amazing, so delicious!; have lunch here with family, food is delicious and dessert is great.  good service and owner is very friendly.  highly recommended

name: The Canadian Embassy Pub
reviews:
my absolute favourite place in any given time of the year! great choice of beverage and food.
the staff are super fun, warm and welcome you with a fantastic smile. the owner pascal, wonderful wonderful man!

highly recommend it!! get a drink, meet friends, have pub dinner, watch some live sports.. you got it all!; extremely rude stuff, treating us like criminals. the male dude does not even want to reply or talk when i went in and said we are four for drinking and dinner. what is wrong with that? they cashed me immediately after providing the beer, as if i would escape the bills. is this the right attitude towards customers?
you can also look at the price, see how much a blanche costs here, complete nonsense. the food is also averagely tasted.; i gotta say, the food here was delicious!
i tried the pulled pork poutine and the fries are cooked to perfection, the pork was mouth watering and the prefect amount of garvey. the cheese could have been a bit more melted, but i wont complain.

i also tried the cherry lambic kriek and it was heavenly. great to have on a hot summer day. very refreshing

10/10 will be back; we had such a fun time we came back the next night! shareef, the bartender, was very friendly, provided great service and even remembered what we were drinking from the night before. there are obviously hundreds of restaurants in paris, but we enjoyed the canadian embassy so much we were happy to come back, and we're happy again!; as a canadian i felt right at home here, it was a nice break from paris within it.

i did order a bloody mary that they have dressed as a cesar on the menu and it was awful, but the bacon cheese burger, and chicken cesar salad were great.

name: Le Mansart
reviews:
i had a plane to catch and was in a rush. the staff was extremely nice even when the place’s packed, and helped prioritize my orders. enjoyed all the dishes, a great experience!; an extremely well known local spot that’s been here for a long time and open late. food is very cheap, about 5-6 euros per plate. it’s nothing crazy but a great spot to be with friends and enjoy a drink. food is served quick but don’t expect much service; visited for coffee so i cannot comment on food but they had many cheap plates (for 5-6 euros).

nice spot to sip a cup of coffee.; a little off the tourist path we really liked it they had a great lunch special for with three courses and beverage or wine; great food, great drinks great price (no service)

name: L'Étincelle
reviews: beautiful food, very good price and fantastic atmosphere of french bistro 🥰 don't miss it; nice place to be. great food. great staff and good prices; amazingly delicious and authentic french cuisine. dont miss it while around, cause you will miss divine food experience; food is not important in this pub, but it has fantastic employees with karaoke party in the evening, a lot of young people, smiles and good mood. i drink 5 strong beers which were manificent. recommendation for every day coffee, party during the weekend. 💪🤟👊👍; a great friendly local bistro. lots of families and local people but not crowded and in a very pleasant side-road.

name: Bistro Hasard
reviews:
went twice and loved the taste, but portions are way too small. i had eggplants the first time, and veal the second, both served on small plates. without the side bread, i would have been hungry. additionnally i had to ask for bread and water, which should have be offered automatically...

given the recent opening and nice decor, i am disappointed.; service is lovely. food is ok, nothing to remember. we came at 1pm and they ran out of fish and chicken. we ordered tartare, it was ok. the croque monsieur was overcooked, ratatouille was a bit oily and not much flavor. chery pie was ok. i wouldn't recommend.; great for an apero afterwork
not that many food choices, but it was all delicious
if you go, get the frogs' legs; great place to eat especially outside; low food quality for french standards. chewy beef

name: Le Club Children Parisiens La Cour Eclectique
reviews: our children have been going to the club regularly since they could walk. an amazing kid-friendly club for paris families. anne and her team do a fantastic job making everyone happy, providing quality and fun classes in a safe place. the coffee shop and terrace are perfect for busy parents who need a break or a place to work while the kids are in class.; their facilities are descent. however, the instructor for tuesday babygym is lack of experience working with young kids. very rigid and strict. it’s not suitable for kids development.  would make more sense to hire someone with a bit more experience with dealing with toddlers.; lovely space for kids, fun dance class with paloma for little ones. but please clean it well-walls and mirrors look very “french”.  the rest is one and only! thank you!; i love this place! the place is great, the activities are awesome and the team is very nice! i recommend! my two kids, 9 and 5 years have been going there since we brexited!; small space and one hour for the kids to snack seems too much

name: La Librairie des Enfants
reviews: hopefully this review will offset the idiots who don’t read carefully before they damage a businesses reputation. this store is not located in new york city and does not have a killer dog, it just shares a name.; writing this to offset the bad reviews--the  new york times recently posted a story about a bookstore with the same name in nyc having a killer dog-- it is not this bookstore!! do not hurt this bookstore's reputation by posting a bad review.; dangerous dog roaming that has attacked at least 3 other dogs and killed 1. will i bring my children there? nope. will i visit? nope.; abusive staff who won't control their syko dogs; great selection of kids books, very helpful staff

name: Little Enfant
formatted_address: 14 Pl. du Général Kœnig, 75017 Paris, France
reviews: the place is quiet and beautiful

name: Les Enfants Gatés
reviews:
we had a great experience at les enfants gatés. we left our hotel for breakfast at the day of our baby’s first birthday and all the workers made his day so amazing. he got his birthday celebrated in french and in english. from all the places we visit in paris, les enfants gatés will be always in our memories for making his first birthday special.

thank you ❤️; a very good cafe/patisserie. the pastries are amazing and the hot drinks of good quality. the staff made you feel welcome and do not hurry you to finish despite space being of a premium.; everything was tasty. nice place to sit and enjoy breakfast. coffee quite nice. crew very friendly. really enjoyed the place.; staff is slow, serving cappuccino without foam, pastries and fresh juice are pretty nice; good pan au chocolat! they didn't allow me to use the tables even though the place was about to close in one hour...

name: Tape à l'œil
reviews:
fine...; i have been a loyal customer of your store for a while and i have always been satisfied with the warm welcome from aurelie and ryma. however, today, my meeting with a saleswoman, a certain victoria, was disappointing. his unpleasant, almost racist attitude and his lack of response to my questions greatly hampered my experience. she seemed to denigrate your store by claiming difficulty finding salespeople...which contributed to my decision not to return there. it's unfortunate, especially because my children loved going to tao, and even my daughter shared content on your instagram page. too bad.; the only flashy thing about this store are the spotlights that they leave on all night. they are so strong that they dazzle me every morning when i walk past them.
i have to doubt that the parents of the children you dress come to window shop at 6 a.m.
thank you for thinking a little about the planet and the future of the children you dress!; a joke. a cashier who is alone and leaves the customer at the checkout who has already taken a very long time... go back and forth in the aisles then play sales advisor, always at the checkout instead of politely asking the lady to finish your purchases once and for all before going to the checkout. result.... 20 min wait with only one customer...; ⚠ gift cards in stores in paris are only valid for one year ⚠

mine received from another region was valid until the end of august and not exactly 1 year
she was able to go to the “right” checkout and i thank a lot for the professionalism of the salespeople in having taken a lot of time to assert my rights 💪

note for customer service: rights must apply to all brands in france!
fortunately the error was corrected but how many have had to resign themselves when the salespeople cannot have the time like her because the people in charge are not there?

name: Tim Pouce
reviews:
when you enter this shop you feel like you are bothering the couple that works there.  prices are fine and they have a good inventory but what good is it when you feel disrespected? i don't want to spend my money where i don't feel welcome. sir, even if you have been selling children's clothes for 30 years you still have not gotten client service right...; don't bother entering the store. i don't know if they are "racist" toward those speaking english or the store is a front for money laundering and they don't want to deal with any customers. my wife and i entered and started looking around for an outfit for our daughter. around 30 seconds later my wife liked something and asked (in english) how much it costs. there was a man and a woman at the cashier's area, and the man replied that they didn't have any more of that. then told us the store is closed (in broken english and even though it was 3 in the afternoon on a monday). we left and he practically slammed the door behind us. never been treated that way before, pretty ridiculous.; the saleswoman kicked me out, claiming that it was table time for her. and when i left, she returned to the counter and the shop remained open…
after reading all the opinions, i must consider myself lucky not to have been insulted.
i hope that a quality business will replace this store.; a real hysterical person, this merchant completely insulted me and shouted at me because i kindly asked for a small discount like 1€ or 2€ maximum for an item. i told him that i was going to think about it and come back for my swimsuit. son, he yelled at me, telling me not to come back and that i was almost a cheapskate or a poor person, but for him to take this poor trader?! it's normal that the customer has the right to think and especially to negotiate an item if he wants to, i've never seen that! the customer is king and the seller has nothing to say and especially not force the sale because he scares away all these customers. it is thanks to us that you make a living from your shop, come down from your pedestal because having a haughty attitude is useless, you are not a billionaire or from the nice neighborhoods to think you are superior. i now understand all the negative opinions on this store, moreover for information purposes i have already bought from you in the past for the birth of my son and i wasted more than 100€ so who is the stingy and poor thing? service in history ?? it is not good to judge a client by his appearance or wallet because with your aggressive attitude you lose clients. it surprises me that you still exist with such deplorable and aggressive customer service if you are frustrated you have to change jobs you are not cut out for this job apparently but where is the world going??? we come to buy to be insulted…; i have just read the opinions which are nothing but pure slander and slander. i had to deal with a very pleasant and very professional couple. a considerable choice is really inexpensive compared to other stores. i was very well advised and the couple were very charming and very patient, thank you, i will come back

name: Le Pestacle de Maëlou - Boutique Déco & Cadeaux
reviews:
excellent service and stock.; lovely and very friendly; this is the second time i have bought my jellycats from this lovely store! very pretty shop of very original and affordable soft toys and accessories. you won't come here without buying! the choice is substantial and the supply regular.
really very pleasant welcome, the lovely manager. i recommend! 😃👍🏻; the prettiest shop in the neighborhood for a birth gift or to equip yourself for your child. the selection is magnificent but what makes the difference is the always excellent advice and the kindness of the saleswoman/store manager.; great welcome for a great store. always good advice and gift ideas, each one cuter than the last. the ideal place to give gifts that are different from what you can see elsewhere...

name: Children of Berthier
reviews:
shoes bought for 115th to end up being too big and above all already all damaged even though they have not been worn for even 1 month (and my child is not hyperactive) little choice offered.; a person who loves animals can only be kind. by giving this balloon to luppa, you made her happy. your store is very pretty!; really adorable saleswoman and super cute store unfortunately the shoes bought for my 3 year old daughter 2 weeks ago do not fit her, they hurt her because her foot is too wide for the shoe, so be careful when buying the shoes that they are adapted to the child's foot.; the saleswoman is very kind and pleasant! thanks for the ball for luppa; nice store and perfect for children!
a wide choice of shoes for girls or boys.
the welcome is warm and the staff are helpful and adorable.
i highly recommend it!!

name: Arsène et les pipelettes
reviews: very attentive and caring customer service! i stopped by the store today because i had been given a gift voucher, the store manager was very kind and provided truly customer-oriented advice.; i have been coming for several years for birth gifts and others, adorable saleswoman and very beautiful products.; adorable little store that offers very beautiful pieces. very warm welcome! go for it, it's worth it; superb store with pretty clothes of very good quality and colorful (even for boys), very good advice, go there with your eyes closed!; nice local shop, very relevant advice which allowed me to find the perfect gift

name: Le Pestacle de Maëlou - Boutique Mobilier - Chambres d'enfants
reviews:
amazing service! came for a mattress and she was so well informed that i went back for a tapis. the delivery process was seamless and they are very serious about providing detailed service as these are items for babies. going back for more and i recommend the shop for any mums; great shop, the manager gave me very good advice and even offered me some nice treats 😉; very well recommended in this store. i equipped all of my children's rooms at pestacle de maellou and i am very satisfied with my purchases which last over time.
the furniture is quality and the customer service is impeccable!; children's store which offers pieces very well selected for their aesthetics as well as their quality (robustness, respectful production). for furniture, we purchased a charlie crane crib as well as the oliver furniture extendable bed. after 4 years of use, we are still delighted with it. we recommend +++; good morning,
i would like to sincerely thank the entire team at the le pestacle de maëlou store for their attentiveness, availability, professionalism, responsiveness and, above all, their kindness throughout our numerous exchanges (telephone and visits to the store).
we bought a bunk bed for our daughters there and we are really delighted with our purchase.
thank you for your welcome.
see you soon
doris silberbauer-lidy

name: Maison Marelle
reviews:
original collections and beautiful fabrics, great customer service and personalized attention! i love maison marelle. the prices are very reasonable for the quality.; unsatisfactory experience again i'm nice since i went to your store twice with my baby (see for a christmas photo outfit) and broke my teeth....well twice!!! if your hours say opening at 12:30 p.m., have the respect to put at least a note for your customers if you open later! remember to call your customers back when they leave you to find out when you are going to open, i say that i say nothing 😉
i'm really really disappointed because i would have really liked to see my son with your collections and buy in store rather than on the internet but that's okay.. keep up the good work!; gorgeous.
i have always ordered online but now i wanted to visit the store and meet the designer.
maison marelle clothing is truly magnificent, unique and of unspeakable quality. and the designer is adorable.
i love it 🩵; always as beautiful, i have been ordering since the creation of the site, and now, a very pretty, tastefully appointed store. the designer is charming, i recommend for the quality, creativity, and beauty of each piece, bravo 🤗🤗; superb timeless clothing store. ordered a romper for my son's baptism. the details and especially the collars are magnificent. sending and receiving times extended due to an overorder but remains entirely reasonable. i highly recommend.

name: Range Ta Chambre
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
very bad experience. unexpected and incomplete delivery (the bed was missing!). after-sales service not available (on vacation...while the site is open!). waiting a whole day without delivery....i don't know if i will ever receive my order placed 1 month ago.; great experience, fast delivery and great communication!
delighted with my purchases, i highly recommend; very good experience, top delivery!👍🏻; fast delivery to my daughter's room. top quality, i recommend this site!;

name: Crealoca
reviews:
magnificent boutique for babies and children located at 66 rue lévis in the 17th. the welcome is very warm, you feel at home. the choice is varied between imitation sets of minikane doll, stroller, a whole range of accessories, including the magnificent strolling universe, water bottles, lunch box, backpack....
games toys various birth gifts soft toys.
you will find your happiness there. i highly recommend this store.
thank you ❤; this toy store for babies and children is truly incredible! their huge selection of dolls allows you to let your imagination run wild and dress them however you want. plus, they offer a diverse assortment of mealtime utensils, making toddler mealtimes even more fun. but that's not all ! you will also find many other exciting things to discover in this store. it's a true paradise for children and parents looking for new ideas; i found a little gift for my son that made him happy. thank you for the wise advice from the owners :); very cute shop and adorable seller! i recommend; quality advice and products i recommend this store for children!

name: Kids around Paris Courcelles
reviews: i recently ordered from kids around and am extremely disappointed with my experience. i ordered a set including shorts and a t-shirt, but only received the t-shirt. despite my attempts to resolve this issue with their customer service, i have not received any satisfactory response or proposed solution. this is clearly a scam and a lack of seriousness on their part. i strongly advise against buying from them if you expect reliable and honest service.; a very beautiful store, we want to buy everything! girls & boys clothing from brands (boss, zadig & voltaire, timberland, billyblush...) sizes from baby to teenager 😊 a top team that advises its customers perfectly.; i highly recommend this store. my wife let me manage the purchase of my nephew's clothes for his birthday when usually she is the one who manages all that. the salesperson was very pleasant, friendly and available. i'm not sure but i think she was the person in charge. she gave me very good advice. with her advice, she made this first experience easier for me. this kind of welcome is unfortunately being lost, which is why i recommend this beautiful store and this charming person.; very pleasant shop, very professional staff. i was very well received, small downside, lack of choice in brands. thank you again for advising me and i will come back with pleasure.; seller who knows her items.  top advice. good welcome

name: Le p'tit Wagram
reviews:
what a great find this little brasserie was. i stayed in paris for a week in early september at a hotel opposite and didn't fancy eating at the hotel. stumbled upon le petit wagram on my first night and came back 2 more nights the same week.
very well priced food, happy hour until 9pm on a good range of drinks and friendly service and customers, who i got chatting to in my schoolboy french on my last night. they serve la bete beer on tap, a good find too, a strong (8%) pale ale that the regulars like to knock back.
would definitely recommend this place for food, drink and atmosphere, the beef bourguignon was particularly tasty with creamy mashed potato and fresh bread. merci!; off the beaten path but still within glimpse of the arc de triomphe. delicious food and wonderful service.  very reasonable prices as well.  highly recommend the pork shoulder and the crepes with smoked cheese and bacon.; this was such a nice surprise right next to our hotel. we got in late and went for escargot, charcuterie board and a bottle of wine and it was lovely. just what we needed after getting off a long flight. service was wonderful.; if you listen to anything i’ll ever say please let it be to come here. i was in paris for the weekend with some friends and we were looking for an affordable breakfast (we are still college students) and we came about this place by pure luck! we were very kindly guided inside and the waiter spoke spanish fluently as he explained the menu to us. we had a filling and delicious meal while planning our activities for the rest of the day. i cannot stress enough how excellent the food was, not to mention the friendly waiters making the experience a 5/5. we cannot wait to come again!; we stopped on for dinner and the pasta and was very tasty. i got a double burger and it was fantastic. definitely a spot to try if in the area! very tasty and great staff

name: Brasserie Naï
vicinity: 8 Avenue de la Grande Armée, Paris
formatted_address: 8 Av. de la Grande Armée, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
the friendliest place one can find in paris. yes they exist. both the food and the staff were great. the staff were chatty and polite. the portion of food is big and better shared. it was not out of this world mediterranean food but coupled with the smily service it left us with a lasting impression of the place.; foods are good. people here are friendly. i like the meal, especially dessert. they also have a very cute dog :d
nice experience near arc de triomphe; brasserie naï is a contemporary restaurant in paris near to arc de tromphe.

the ambiance is chic yet welcoming, appealing to both casual diners and those seeking a refined dining experience. it’s also noted for its stylish interior design and warm lighting, creating a cozy setting for guests.

i had a americano which was awesome. prices are affordable and enjoyed the favorable moments.; my friends and i had the best dinner here! the food was delicious, the location was awesome, and our waiter (bernard) was so personal and attentive! i can’t wait to come back next time i’m in paris; you know what, this restaurant serves a variety of cuisine and worth a try for all. it is isn’t a tourist trap despite being in a prime location. the family and servers are genuine, the cuisine i had was excellent, & it’s in a good location close to metro, some hotels, arc de triomphe views!

name: WASL GOURMET
reviews: one of the most delicious lebanese foods i've ever tried. try the dessert, muhalbya, it is absolutely stunning. i strongly recommend this place.; best libanese around no doubt. the  chef just opened the boutique and is very motivated. outstanding quality.; had the best shawarma of my life. crispy, juicy, savory. intense yet balanced spices. highly recommended!; recently opened - we walk past daily and we were wondering what would be coming into the space. incredibly lovely owners and absolutely delicious lebanese food. a very welcome addition to the neighborhood; i had great time after so far in paris .one of the best place for having lebanese vide .the shawarma and sweets are amazing.

name: Comptoir Brochant
reviews:
afordable and delicious food and wine. really nice local spot. they helped to change meal to make it veggie.; nice place, nice music, good service.
we came for dinner, both ordered entrecote simment and two beers grimbergen. beer was very good but entrecotes were very chewy. we noticed that not that many places can prepare nice steak in paris. better to order fish, slow-cooked beef, etc.; it’s a vibrant pub serving a variety of european food. we had sea bream and steak, the taste is great, just the service is a bit slow.; very nice place and nice price. we had a lunch menu for 12/14 euros with entrée, main dish, water. it's possibile to have dessert as well. the waiter was really nice and we eat very good. we said that we are lactose intollerant and they prepare us food without milk. very suggest.; after a long day at the eiffel tower, we arrived here for dinner, the waitress was lovely and very friendly and spoke good english. we had a steak dinner and dessert, very reasonably priced and tasted great.

name: Fuxia
formatted_address: porte maillot, 99 Bd Gouvion-Saint-Cyr, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
i love this place and the food it serves.
the staff is so friendly i would go back again and again just for the awesome service. it helps they speak english. the food makes it even better.  i ordered a burrata and lasagna for takeaway. the lasagna is my favorite ( ive tried a few in paris and the united states where i live) and the lasagna here is by far my favorite and the best ive had. the texture of the pasta is not gummy or thick, it has a nice bite but smoothly carries the delicious flavor of the perfectly meaty bolognese sauce with small chunks of tomato and other veggies. it is served with some chopped up lettuce and shaved parmesan which adds a crunch and saltiness to the dish which not only rounds out some of the acidic flavors of the sauce but also balances the different textures in the dish. im going to miss it and fuxia when i go back to my home country.; the place is nice and located in a calm neighborhood in paris.
the staff is friendly and speaks english,  we really enjoyed sitting outside.
we ordered pizza margareta, it was regular pizza and straight away from the oven 😋.
the place is nice but nothing special about it.
i think it might be a great option for a group of friends who they want to go out in a calm place😊; i had an exceptional dining experience at fuxia, located near the arc de triomphe in paris. the highlight of my visit was the delicious pizza accompanied by high-quality drinks. the restaurant itself was clean and well-maintained, creating a pleasant atmosphere for dining.

the staff at fuxia were incredibly helpful in assisting us with selecting our dishes. their knowledge and recommendations made the decision-making process easy and enjoyable. the service provided was professional, with attentive staff ensuring that our needs were met throughout the meal.

i highly recommend fuxia for anyone looking to indulge in a delightful meal near the iconic arc de triomphe in paris.; great food - make sure you go there hungry because portions are quite huge. my friend had a pizza (the crust was a bit soft but the cheese tasty) and the fried mozzarella sticks with pesto, and i had the polenta (absolutely delicious!), a portion of bresaola and a side of veggies (very good, quite oily though). overall, tasty food, nice atmosphere and kind staff. would recommend !
they now have an english menu too :); "fuxia" serves the best pizza i've ever tried, and i highly recommend their nduja pizza. the perfect combination of flavors, coupled with attentive and friendly staff, creates a delightful dining experience. the inviting interior adds to the overall charm, making fuxia a must-visit for pizza enthusiasts seeking a memorable culinary adventure."

name: Que pour les Gourmands
reviews: a cozy, sort of hole-in-the-wall place with good food, better service, and comfortable ambiance! all dishws were good, especially the mains with the sides of tangy salad. one thing i would improve is the bread/baguette, which was a bit plane.; we are very happy that we chose this place for dinner.  pleasant and warm service, cozy enviroment and amazing dishes! 💛 i strongly recommend it and would like to come back again😍; perfect service… amazing wine… delicous food. nothing more to say - thank you!; it was recommended to by my hotel front desk as well as surprisingly by few of my colleagues. not so close from my office but they walk all the way here sometimes. i’ve been in paris for a week and this is the best meal i have had so far. perfectly cooked, you can see details in the preparation. the place is run by mother and son. cooking must be the favourite thing for mother. the guy made me try couple of wines to pick the one i liked the most. damn too good, must try, can’t praise more, just go there if you are around and find it for yourself.; we had an excellent dinner in this neighborhood gem. all of the dishes were delicious with generous portion size. we highly recommend this place to those who are in the area, and please check the website for their latest opening hours.

name: Big Fernand
reviews:
went here a few days ago. i don't understand the 1 stars and the bad reviews and the complaints. we had a fantastic service with delicious food. if my 14 year old teenager daughters enjoyed it, then so will others.; ordered via uber eats the order never arrived. sorry to rate you with one star but nobody refunded me for my order in july the 4th. uber support is not fair with incidents.; it's fast food, nothing fancy. the burgers had  a particular flavour -not for everyone... not sure if it was a spice or ingredient that tasted 'off'
fries were soggy unfortunately. staff were friendly. not for 'dining' out -more a 'burger after a few pints' kind of vibe...; the staff is very friendly and efficient. the burgers are fine, but their fries always seem small and too crunchy (like they spent too long on the frier); the staff were great, the food not so much no taste too many sauces small portions and 0 presentation (when you're paying 20 euros for a burger u expect that)
+ the place wasn't clean , clients left hours ago ,the empty plates and cutleries stood on the tables next me with mosquitos coming to the smell . i was really disappointed for what i paid expected and received.

name: Chicken Street
reviews:
i always come here when i visit paris! all halal, affordable prices, and the owner is super friendly. the naan burger is delicious; very friendly staff and so good food, we came back 3 times, sooo delicious 😍😍; one of the best burgers i've ever had period in life. some of the best chicken i've had period in life, coming from a southern black male from the south of the united states. they did that bird proud for his sacrifice. i highly recommend. the service was quick, and very nice and professional.; we visited this branch of chicken street in place de clichy on a recent trip to paris.

we dropped by on a couple of occasions for dinner and we were impressed. the wraps and chicken tenders were delicious. portion sizes are large and it's really good value for money. food wise it's halal french kfc which tasted better than the english kfc we regularly have.

the restaurant is clean and has a large screen tv so we managed to catch some football whilst we were having a meal.

overall its excellent value for money, the food is good and we would definitely visit again if we were in the area.; pretty decent late night spot. our flight was delayed getting to paris, so we arrived at our hotel later than expected. thankfully, chicken street was open.

name: Hippopotamus
reviews: the review is specifically to thank mrs. sofia for her excellent customer care and attention. there was a small mistake in the order, and she was so proactive in immediately solving the issue in a way that left us very satisfied. the food is fine, and the atmosphere is okay. prices are very reasonable.; it's my second time here. the steak was excellent and delicious. the most important thing is to ask for mediumwell. caesar salad is regular, but order it without chicken because the chicken is dry for me.; we were delighted with our experience at the restaurant. the venue is beautiful, the food was delicious and the service excellent. many thanks to mariam for her kindness and availability. we'll be back very soon to discover new flavors; first time ever trying pork ribs and man oh! man. what a taste! amazingggg! never gonna forget this place. the burger was also juicy and delicious 🤤; came in expecting a great experience but i had to ask twice for water and by the time the water was served my throat was so dry i couldn’t talk. caesar salad and chicken on top was very bland and cheap. mac and cheese balls were also bland and dry. mimosa’s were good. cute atmosphere.

name: Café Jacques
reviews:
unfortunately we were insulted by a french waitress who was extremely rude to us .thinking we.were american. her facial expressions said everything. she even ignored us and pretended not to know english when we clearly heard her speak to another customer. the waitress who did serve us however was very nice and  polite .
we didn't leave a tip because the rude one ruined our whole lunch. definitely do your research especially for the first time in paris .the menu even in english was hard to understand and very overpriced for what it was .; quiet and away from the crowds, it felt like a secret garden view of the eiffel tower! we just had dessert and drinks, perfect for the patio.; we were welcomed and offered a seat outside with a great view of the eiffel tower. the menu has some good options and the croque monsior was very good and also came with salad on the side. the service was good and so was the coffee. reasonably priced. would recommend!; best place and best food! we are from south africa, the steak and potato dish was the best ever. thank you for the great food and great service; terrible service, racist !!!

i and 3 other friends asked three times if it’s possible to sit at a table outside since the weather was nice and we saw some guests were also sitting there, but the waitress and waiter refused us and said they closed the terraces. so okay we understood and sat inside where we were designated to sit. then what??? 5 minutes later, they allows 2 or 3 groups of guests sitting outside?? reallyy!!

we tried to ask why? the waitress used her worst attitude and communication to explain that they just closed that area for 10 minutes! now they opened again. really? even the guys who welcomed us, not friendly at all.

i wish she could have proposed or asked us again if we would like to sit there when they opened again, i could understand. but no!

such the worst coffee shop i have ever been to!

name: Bistrot la lanterne
reviews: a hidden gem in paris. the restaurant is unassuming from the outside. but when you sit down - the owner makes you feel right at home. he's nice, friendly, and always smiling. there are no menu, but the food is so good! i had chicken with salad and fries. it was perfectly cooked! come and try it out!; the best steak frites i had in paris. server had great energy and was accommodating. 10/10 worth a visit; very delicious! the best french coffee 😂❤️; wonderful ambience. daniel is very welcoming, charming, and accommodating.  faux filet delicious!!!!; very pleasant experience, very nice people and delicious food

name: ANGELUS
vicinity: 4 Place de la Porte de Champerret, Paris
formatted_address: 4 Pl. de la Prte de Champerret, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
we hosted a corporate event at angelus and our experience has been definitely positive. although communication before the event was not always easy, the staff proved to be very competent and attentive to our requests.
the venue is very nice and big and can accommodate a large number of people. easy to find, in a good location.
the food and wine served was of a high standard and all attendees enjoyed it. one of the things that impressed us most was the impeccable service of alex and nina. kudos to these two waiters, truly polite, kind and very attentive. excellent service.
overall, the evening went very well and was perfect for a corporate event. all was very professional and elegant.
thanks adrien!; without showing menu, a beer and a aperol cost 20€ ! will never come again!; traditional french brasserie. the food is good and the service is ok. the atmosphere is typical of such parisian places.; excellent venue for petite déjeuner .  nice food and friendly staff.  only regret is having to leave before try an evening meal here.; it was a nice place. the staff was ver helpful.

name: Le Dulcinéa
reviews:
loved the tagliatelle w/salmon & my husband had linguini w/ clams...both very delicious & generous portion!  best pasta!
great warm service!
you won't be disappointed!
such a gem!; love this little restaurant in paris! such great food & service. we arrived just before 6 and had the restaurant mostly to ourselves. after 7 it was full and lively. great truffle pasta & espresso after. would definitely recommend and will return on our next trip.; absolutely delicious food. large plates of perfect pasta and great starters. service is friendly and helpful. place is small but cozy. if you want to eat italian food while in paris - this is the place!; i tried the lasagna, which was awesome. however the steak we ordered for my son wasn’t  as good as the other items we ordered (we also ordered a pizza and a few other pastas). it was supposed to be well done but it was medium. it was also very chewy.; really nice find. stones throw from moulin rouge. great helpful host. tasty food. good menu. we were in a rush & the host accommodated us. clean facilities.

name: Gusto Italia Amélie
reviews:
great place! one of the most delicious italian restaurants in paris 😍 we ordered margarita pizza, burata salad, pasta with mushrooms and chicken, and everything was perfect!! we recommend it to everyone! friendly staff, good service, 100/10. and most importantly, the prices are pleasant! thank you for a great lunch 🫶🏻; small local italian restaurant with excellent food. not a tourist trap. fresh ingredients and excellent service.  we did pizza to go one night and they are huge and fresh. then we returned for our last dinner before leaving paris and orders the foccia
penne white sauce and mushrooms and linguine cabernero. i can’t say enough about this place. hidden gem!; wow, this tiny little italian restaurant seats max 17 people. talk about hot seating, but once you eat their food you get why it's a case of 2 people in and 2 out 😁😊 superb italian food❤️ one of the best lasagne's i've ever had, and that is my favourite meal so i've had a few worldwide😋🍴great value, quick service and friendly staff. absolutely recommend this place as a 'must' if you're in the area ☺️👍; love small restaurant. great food, my pasta tastes delicious 😋 great service as well. the staff are so lovely. we had a great conversation with them and they gave us a tiramisu for free. will definitely visit again.; great food and service. portions were great and very reasonable. i had 3 courses for around 40 euros! fantastic and quick.

name: Le Petit Moulin
reviews:
we came here for drinks when staying at the hotel opposite. the atmosphere and music was great and the staff were really friendly. we sat outside in the street and it was a really relaxed vibe. we had 2 gin tonics for 20 euros; my wife and i were recommended to visit le petit moulin for a drink when we first arrived in paris. what was supposed to be a quick glass of wine before dinner turned into a tremendous experience! the entire staff made us feel at home and before we knew it my wife and i had enjoyed 4 hours with everyone who passed through the restaurant. thank you to pj and staff for making us feel so comfortable and for the delicious food!; this place has a very good local rustic vibe and it’s right across my hotel. very nice and friendly people. it’s a small cozy place which seems to be run by a group of friends. the serveur was very welcoming and polite, and the cook always checked on me if i liked the food.

i had a beer, a ribeye steak cooked the way i liked, and a i had a french onion soup to go. i got to meet the owner pj who apparently knows how to speak filipino. what a great guy! he even offered me a shot of his rum and fruits concoction. i’ll definitely be back here more than once while i am in paris.; little bar on a corner in montemarte! the owners are super fun and nice..
we sat outside but there’s plenary of seats upstairs inside.

there’s a minimum of €15 euro; looking for a place not to far from moulin rouge?  go here, this place is worth the visit.  the owner pj is the best host in paris 😆, fun guy with a great personality!  the lady serving us was amazing as well.

we had the beef bourguignon.  beautiful!   we also had the escargot and french onion soup, both excellent.

thanks for a great experience le petit moulin 😉

name: Le Costaud des Batignolles
reviews:
one of the restaurants on rue de brochant
the server was wonderful! and opened up the restaurant for us close to nearly midnight which was very kind.
we had the dessert touchocode magali which was just okay.
he cream served with it was quite airy and fulfilling.
the restaurant needs to up it's menu to attract crowds.
they have a decent selection of drinks and are priced well; nice place with efficient staff and excellent chef.
i recommend the petit boudin, traditional french receipe, revisited to its best.; love it, love it, love it.
pablo was excellent, super nice, friendly and kind.
made us feel like family.
delicious food and the place itself is magic, great concept to combine art with a restaurant.
the place is so attractive and inviting.
you will love and enjoy it too; outstanding food. chilled atmosphere. great team. take the st jacques, you won’t regret it!; while the restaurant is open through the day, no food is served between midday and the usual for paris 6 or 6:30 pm. nothing is said about it on the site. three stars for the fact that the lady has shown me the way to seemingly the only place in batignolles where you could actually eat.

name: Mezzencore
reviews:
this was the first time i tried lebanese food but it was a very pleasant experience. we had no idea what to order, so we just chose randomly, but in light of their taste and quality, we could've chosen anything. portions are not huge, but they are savory and flavorful, all the ingredients have great texture, make people crave for more after every bite.; the best shawarma , healthy, clean and very very fresh!!!
friendly staff friendly service i love this place , highly recommended to try out! also nice sweet’s and best greek beer 🎉; great find! spotless venue, welcoming staff. came here for a second dinner after a letdown elsewhere. the freshly made dish was a so delight! will definitely return!; i love lebanese food and as i told you i'm a really complicated person as far as food is concern ... so each times i want to eat real, authentic lebanese sandwich, achawarma, i go there. you'll be well received,  the vegetables are fresh tasty and you will also come back . i recommend 🥰❣❣; this is no words to describe how good the food is , it's amazing best lebanese food you can eat in all paris, i highly recommend to go and try, friendly staff great service,

name: RESTAURANT LE P'TIT MUSSET
reviews:
the food is fine, the other menu was good
but my main dish was the fish not so special. started was good, dessert was ok.; seriously good food with super friendly staff! found through google reviews and would recommend if you’re in the area!; it is very good french 30 euro for dinner place. book it on lafourchette and get significant discount! without this discount it is a bit pricey.; me and my mom went to this lovely restaurant during our vacation. we choose this rest because there was a sign with the legend: traditional cuisine. it wasn’t a lie. everything was lovely, the decor, the beer, the dishes, the waiter and waitress. service was really quick even though the place was packed. risotto with fruit de mer was incredible and the entrecôte was superb. the waitress and waiter were excellent even though they didn’t speak any spanish and only a little bit of english. our deep appreciation for both and their patience with my limited french skills.; simple restaurant with good food. very parisian like.

name: Chez Vous
reviews:
it's quiet & quaint but yet modern with ease of seating. i chose combo (brunch) of the day. started with french baguette with home-made chocolate, jam & butter. then came the salmon with eggs & accompaniments. french toast style was new to me & so was parfait. host was awesomely friendly. overall, had my fill. loved the place & food. recommended.; the terrasse is nice; they have big tables well suited for groups of 4-6 and it gets the sun in the evening.
the pints of beer we were served were not cold tho… and the fries plate was not crispy at all, pretty obvious that it was microwaved 😐; the restaurant had a really nice atmosphere and look great. sadly, the waiters were incredibly slow and unattended. they were very nice and friendly, but we did not get all what we ordered took ages, and the food was cold when we got it. the last thing and most important my girlfriend and i both got food poisoning from this place. we don’t know what dish it was, and it was not obvious when we ate it. so we would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. it was an overall bad experience.; really good service and nice food. i highly recommend this place, both for lunch or if you want to have drinks with your friends in the evening.; perfect date, great drinks!! highly recommended, i’ll definitely come back!!

name: Chez Léon
reviews:
the menu was in french only, but the waiters spoke little english. the service was very fast, but i’d say chicken was quite pale, roast beef were good, and the fries with the mayo sauce were amazing! this bistro i think is very popular with locals, as we didn’t see any tourists. i’d recommend for a real french bistro experience.; nice little restaurant, great ambiance. place where parisians like to hang out.; great restaurant ! if not the best in the neighborhood when it comes to value for money. it preserves traditional french ambience and cuisine.

the food is fresh and traditional, portions are generous and the staff is the nicest. if you are looking for a good little place to grab a bite and a drink even coffee this is the best you can do in the area.; an authentic french experience if there ever was one. this tiny rustic place serves classic french dishes but is also great to just grab a drink. the ratatouille was hearty and filling, the apricot tart came fresh from the oven. staff very helpful and quick.; i loved this restaurant. we arrived at around 7pm, didn't seem too busy. once we were seated, the place quickly filled up and i understand why. we ordered the roast beef frites and it was incredible!! our server was very kind and attentive.

name: Le Relais Gascon
reviews:
this was a delicious meal! service was really good, too!

all the dishes we had were tasty and very big. the salads were a highlight - covered in garlic chips!

a bit pricier than places around, but definitely worth it.; good quick food option during a busy sightseeing day. i would recommend salad than meat dishes. salad is really tasty and filling. my husband ordered a duck dish but we ended up swapping to salad because the meat was a bit chewy for us.
although the restaurant was very helpful and changed the dish for us without charging more.
our daughter cried at the beginning of the meal and the staff gave us juice and other drinks to entertain her. very thoughtful; i am very confused on why the amazing reviews , unfortunately for us the experience was not the best,
the meat was tasteless and dry,  very blend for both.
sitting outside is nice and i know in paris you seat close to each other but this was another level, we were squeezed between each other like sardine without even being able to use our arms properly .; order: medium well duck with potatoes and green beans and a glass of wine.
the duck was cooked perfectly and the hint of honey in the sauce was very tasty. the potatoes were crispy and soft but not salted but they give you salt on the table so that was good. the green beans were garlicky which was great because i love garlic but again not salted. overall i loved this dish. the portion was so filling too but one critique is that it came out pretty quick after i made the order and wasn’t very warm.; nice location on a corner in monmarte, so great for people watching.  last dinner for us in paris and was disappointed by the quality of the escargot, which i'd had at several other spot in france.  not enough garlic butter by far!  my husband's portion of salmon was very small but an abundance of potatoes.

name: Le Bosquet, restaurant
reviews:
we showed up 5 min before close because our son really wanted some authentic french creme brulee. it did not disappoint. we also tried the french onion soup and escargot. it was all delicious. very friendly service as well.; not a bad experience but not our favorite spot either. we were sat promptly and the waiter staff were friendly and attentive. there’s a host of parisian dishes mixed with other options. we ordered the duck, burger and oysters. nothing terrible to say about any of it - nothing remarkable to note either. overall it was a good experience and the portion sizes were quite large.; decent food though not super impressive. toilets were clean, service was efficient so a plus point. normal prices for paris, maybe even on the cheaper side.; the beef in pepper sauce was the highlight of my meal. the meat was tender and the sauce had a rich, complex flavor. my wife enjoyed her grilled cod, which was flaky and moist. the atmosphere was cozy and the service was attentive.; we saw some good reviews and thought we should try this place on our last evening in paris as it was walking distance from our hotel. sadly, it was extremely unpleasant. from the moment we've been seated, the waiter treated us as a burden, made us get up and move tables (from a small table for 2 to another), and then he changed his mind. the place was not busy, so we never understood what that was about, but of course, we were open to all suggestions.
there was another red flag when a couple entered, sat, and suddenly just left, we had already ordered. otherwise, we had the same feeling as not the best place to be..
we ordered the oysters, smocked salmon with toasted bread and butter to share, and creme broule. and 2 glassed of chardonnay.
we only enjoyed the oysters. we were disappointed by the salmon, which was like a packed supermarket slice of salmon, with dry old bread 😕 and a slice of lemon, with the label on ( therefore not even washed)
i can't believe how we spent 61€ on this dinner, which we could have had in the hotel room from the supermarket at the corner...
extremely disappointed, we would not recommend it at all. with all the great restaurants in paris, please avoid the disappointment.

name: Restaurant Bus Toqué Paris
reviews:
arrived in good time and received a very warm welcome. a brief explanation of what to expect was given to us. we were shown to our table and given a guide to audio system that could be used. offer a glass of champagne and water provided as part of tha package.
started the journey and the first of our 5 course's quickly arrived and each course after that arrived at a timely fashion. saw plenty of the tourist hot-spots during the journey. the staff were extremely courteous and pleasant.
the tour stopped at the eiffel tower so you could get a good photo with it all lit up. a very pleasant couple of hours spent being wined and dined. would highly recommend.; fun, but not over the top.  cons; too warm inside temp and engine noise (we sat in very back) was noticeable, dinner was blah, our tech screen was temperamental.  honestly i was disappointed based on all the fabulous reviews and priced paid was excessive.  if i did it again, no dinner go cocktails and tapa style food, keep the cost down, don’t upgrade on champagne (still tasted poor).; what a wonderful, different way to enjoy dining in paris!  we reserved the “paris by night” dinner on tuesday, june 5th, which began at 8:30pm.   i didn’t tell my husband where we were having dinner because i wanted it to be a surprise.  when we approached bus toqué on the champs- élysées and i told him this was our restaurant, he was definitely confused.  we were greeted by a very nice gentleman who showed us upstairs.  there we met our server who showed us to our table.  unfortunately, i did not get our server’s name but he was excellent.  he took care of all the tables and did so in a very efficient manner.  he started by delivering 2 glasses of champagne, poured our wine throughout the evening, served our various delicious courses in a timely manner, and cleared dishes when we finished each course.   he also explained each course and each glass of wine, as well as how to use the tablet, on the side of the table, which explained the various paris sites we were passing by (the louvre and notre-dame to name a few).  he did it all!   we made a brief stop at the eiffel tower and continued on our way.  it was a fun experience, and was especially enjoyable thanks to our wonderful server.; it was a great experience, loved the concept of a night time tour of the city while enjoying a delicious gourmet meal, complete with drinks and dessert. they had a ipad table that operated with headphones so you could follow along with the tour of the sights and a little history and background of the monuments/sights.; what an amazing and unexpected experience. gourmet dining while we driveby night to the best monuments paris has to offer with a stop at the eiffel tower right when it is light up. an experience we will remember. the bus is very well designed, looks very fancy. the service was incredible from the bus driver to the waiters. the food was very good, refined(5 courses). the ambiance was really good and very romantic. we spent two hours and we didn’t see the time go by. price was good as well

name: Le Grenier du Rire Dîner Spectacle Paris
reviews: we had a fantastic evening with the family. great humorist & magician and warm welcoming from the owner. cozy atmosphere and a lot of fun. will come back soon!; loved the ambiance and show. it was the perfect place to have a fun night out with my husband. 😜; great experience. great comedians. great show!; excellent moment; super !

name: Forest
formatted_address: 11 Av. du Président Wilson, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
took over 15 minutes after seating to be offered chance to buy water, no tap or filter water available. then over an hour before my order was taken. fish had bones in the filet that appeared to be ‘clean.’ some staff were great, others were rude. the least satisfying meal i’ve had in france so far, having dined at over 50 restaurants in past 12 months as a tourist speaking fluent french. decent view of eiffel tower but with obstructions. not worth it. had minor but not horrible diarrhea after the meal. july 14th holiday dinner.; nice atmosphere, staff was great. the servers recommended a high quality wine which tasted great. i recommend the poulet rôti (like a salad). prices are a bit high for the portions but definitely worth it for the quality. will be returning for sure.; amazing. in my three days in paris i had a lunch and a dinner here.
the menu is very interesting and greedy, the waiters are the best part of the experience: pleasantness and kindness are assured.
prices are a little high but occasionally, i recommend it!!; went for lunch here, had the hummus and cauliflower steak. both were amazing. great portions. the fresh loaf of bread was such a nice touch too. highly recommend if you’re in the area :); i really enjoyed this restaurant, a very well balanced and tasty cuisine.
the service is really top notch.
bravo to all the chefs in the kitchen that you can see working hard to please everyone. a great found and a real treat. also perfectly suitable for vegetarians or vegan 🌱
the plus : eating on the terrace outside when weather permitting with the eiffel tower.

name: Le Capitaine Fracasse
vicinity: de, L'île aux Cygnes, Escale, Pont de Bir-Hakeim, Paris
formatted_address: L'île aux Cygnes, Escale, de, Pont de Bir-Hakeim, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
we had a romantic night, my fiancé and i, in a dinner cruise with ‘le capitaine fracasse’. it was an unforgettable dinner along the seine river. the food was exceptional. the waiter was so nice, he started a conversation with us and ended up trying to wish us happy holidays in our native language.
the ambiance was absolutely magical, with the gentle motion of the water and the twinkling parisian lights setting the perfect romantic tone. cruising past the eiffel tower, beautifully lit up against the night sky, made the evening even more enchanting. it was truly a night to remember.; excellent boat trip and value for money.
i reviewed several others before booking & this company is one of the few who offer a dining menu that matches with the atmosphere - a 1st class restaurant.
upholstered dining chairs, upbeat background music & food that not only looks exquisite but tastes good too!

everyone on the boat had window seats and the opportunity to go onto the roof of the boat & take panoramic parisien views!

nothing was rushed and we thoroughly enjoyed it our trip.; overall it was a good dinner experience. the waiter we had was friendly and tried to hustle as fast as he could, but there were numerous large tables he was helping out with. the views were spectacular and watching the sunset.
the only complaint we would have is the photographer lady on board took our photo in front of the eiffel tower while passing it and cut half of the tower off in the pic. now you should know better as a photographer to capture the entire structure. duh. when she brought us the printouts for purchase, we nicely requested a retake. she had the audacity to go complain to the manager right by us and then ignore us the rest of the cruise. we would have gladly bought all images if she would have just retaken the one image. i would recommend they hire a new photographer.
food was small portions but enough to fill you up. desserts were delicious, also.; booked a sunset dinner cruise on the river seine and highly recommend! we celebrated our 25th anniversary, it was a memorable night. everything from the boarding crew to the host plus waitress/staff was excellent. they made sure this was a special night for us. food was excellent, they even added a bonus wine bottle! first time visiting paris and we will definitely be back!; the food was good, but the service was wonderful and the atmosphere was perfect. all the staff were so welcoming. we were served by jewel and he was very kind, switching between french and english whenever necessary. this definitely provides value for money, the cruise is long and you don't feel any need to rush the meal. i recommend to anyone who wishes to have a beautiful dinner cruise along the seine!

name: All Good Things Paris
reviews:
spent time browsing through so many other brunch options in montemarte and settled on this last minute

came early on a friday morning, one of their first customers. their coffee was surprisingly really good! we ordered an americano and latte. my husband and i don’t drink coffee often but we loved it here. it came with pain au chocolate which were divine with our espressos. we also had the croque madame, good balance of meat, cheese and sunny side up egg but the toast underneath was a little dry. still good nonetheless. our waitress was so nice and sweet. loved the atmosphere of this restaurant! clean bathrooms.; location top and staff amazing and super friendly! we had a brunch this morning and wow! food is super tasty ! we will definitely come back! ps: un gracias especial a federico, que ha sido súper simpático y habla un italiano perfecto! 😉😉😉
a big thanks to everyone.. we will definitely come back! giulia & sara from italy 🇮🇹; second visit, the first being brunch.
very friendly and the place was buzzing for dinner tonight. the host and staff were attentive and even helped with our struggles with french yet made us feel at ease. the menu was available online in english which was greatly appreciated. food was excellent and the staff even went a little more than needed with service. i enjoyed three courses and would happily eat here again.; great place, amazing service, cute interior, very good food. we had the eggs benedict with cheddar and ham (€15) and it’s just like you’d wish them. they have full brunch menu for €25 with drinks included. there’s space for improvement for the home made iced tea, though. the taste is very faded, basically flavoured water and does not correspond to the price (€5). still this place gets 5 stars from me for everything else.; went on a sunday morning for a buffet. it was excellent, pic below is part of what they offered, there was more ….the food was perfect from the eggs right down to the hot chocolate. 10/10, the price was worth the experience and quality of food and service. bravo

name: Restaurant Familial Grillades Au Feu De Bois
formatted_address: 13 Rue de la Charbonnière, 75018 Paris, France
reviews: service and food was awful. my wife ordered 2 course menu in 17 euros but they charged us 3 course menu in 25euros. i ordered 2 course menu in price 17euros they charged us 23e of it. when we said about it they didn't admit their mistake... they didn't change the bill so we had to pay the incorrect bill..; first time trying algerian food. incredible. and everyone is friendly. the lentil soup was exceptional.; the food is really good, the people are really nice and the service is the best; very good food and friendly staff; authentic algerian grills in the heart of paris 🇫🇷🇩🇿

name: Hippopotamus
