reviews: everything was actually perfect. i’ve been to many hippopotamus locations and i order the same dish, but this time it was exceptionally great. the tuna starter was very nice, the fish and chips stood out to me. the fish was very fresh in taste from the first bite, extremely crunchy (coated perfectly), the fries were very crispy and well done (the way i prefer). the view is also very nice, of the station. there wasn’t any outdoor seating options visible during my visit, which was the reason i picked this location. service was great, the staff were friendly. highly recommended overall.; i really enjoyed my food and the environment! my steak, green beans and salad were so good! my husband ordered the fried cheese samples with dip! wow! so good!; it could be me, but i didn't like the food. to heavy and too salty. the wine was not the best i had but ok. the service was fast, but not friendly. the place is very crowded. no way to find a parking spot in the area.; one of a chain of steakhouses. basic, served a purpose due to its location and the requirements of the people we were travelling with because it was handy for the station. wouldn't have been our first choice, but was ok for what it was. food ok.; good western food served at hippo. we had beef fillet steak, hot wings and a beef salad dish and they were all amazing. just so close to gare du nord station.

name: La Padellina
reviews:
me and my family came here last night for dinner and it was really good from start to finish. i had booked the restaurant a few weeks ago on the recommendation from a friend who comes here often. the price is really incredible and we all loved our meals. i adore linguine with clams and mussels and it was super tasty and perfectly seasoned. the tiramisu is super great here as well. staff are very friendly and efficient. would definitely recommend this place to all but try to reserve as it was completely full by 7.30pm - its super busy.; we were craving some pasta and decided to go to this restaurant near our hotel and we were really impressed! it was full of people, but the ambiance was really great, a relaxed atmosphere. food is amazing, the presentation and taste is really good and the price is actually cheap for the size of the plate! the staff were also really nice and kind, it also adds charm to the place. i would 100% come back!; what a surprise finding this lovely little italian place. food is amazing and fresh. the servers are friendly and so cute. i ordered the ravioli and it was delicious. i would definitely come back here if i lived in paris. i'm so glad i got to experience the food before heading home to the us.; the experience was great, arrived a little later but the food was fresh and the service was excellent. the owner even sang for the whole place an italian song, it was great. would definitely eat here again. the ravioli was splendid; delicious italian food. my carbonara (pictured) was delicious.

the atmosphere was also fun. the owner came out and sang an italian song for us. i usually have a short temper for these sorts of things, but it was fun and relatively short.

our waiter was also fast and pleasant.

name: Le Bruit Qui Court - Restaurant Paris 18
reviews:
stumbled upon this lovely little restaurant on our first day in paris. pauline made us feel at home and managed to fit us in during a very busy night. we planned to just get a wine but stayed for a meal as the atmosphere was so great. the live music really made the experience exceptional. the food and wine were amazing as well.; great restaurant to chill out at while in the montmartre area. the food was great, the staff was super friendly, and the wine was delicious. get the charcuterie and the burrata…can’t go wrong.; dinner was perfect! nice wine and tasty beer. steak was cooked ideally with homestyle fried potatoes. sibas and smashed sweet potatoes with chili taste and cabbage topped with lemon juice- soo cool. fast and tasty, cosy and nice. thanks.

4 for the atmosphere just because kitchen too close to the tables, and no barrier in between. smog penetrated into the common space. will be better to set up at least glass barrier.; nice little bistro restaurant. small but good balanced menu. some vegetarian dishes, good cheese choice. the staff is exceptionally friendly and they do speak as well english. we were 4 and paid 100€ food and drinks. very good value in paris. we reserved an hour before arrival a table through their website. worked without problems.recommended; my favorite bistro in the neighborhood! the food is excellent (make sure to try the chocolate fondant), and the space is cozy and charming. it's also a great place for an evening drink.
the owner's and staff's personalities really bring the magic. if it's not too busy you might have a nice chat with pauline herself or with some of the many regulars.
i particularly recommend tuesday nights for casual jazz sessions. make sure to reserve as it can fill up quickly!

name: Aux Dés Calés 17
reviews:
this is a great spot. very local and away from the touristy areas of montmarte. the food and service was great and very friendly. it's a busy place and you can also sit outside. highly recommend it.; first stop for food when i arrived in paris. had the burrata salad which was wonderful. it had a pesto vinaigrette and i will definitely be back to try more dishes. staff was attentive and friendly!; this is a very nice local bistro which was pretty close to our hotel. very popular by locals and tourists. nice atmosphere, very friendly staff and excellent service.
however, i was not impressed with the bavette steak - it was almost raw and very chewy, while i asked for medium rare - close to well done (but not too dry). my wife ordered daurade (sea bream) and it was quite tasty.; i ordered a burger with well-cooked meat. and they brought me raw meat. i waited an hour and a half, and they didn't bring me the burger. lousy service. they even wanted to charge me for the hamburger. i had to go.; i didn't eat much, so i can't really judge that! on the other hand, the cocktails are very good, but when we ordered 2 shots of tequila, the waitress forgot to bring us the 2 slices of lemon and the salt, but it's no big deal, we asked her after receiving the shots. the cheese + charcuterie board was also very good! thanks, i'll definitely be back :)

name: La Ferme
formatted_address: 5 R. des Petites Écuries, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
a pleasant evening listening and laughing to the hopefully future great stars of the dz/ fr stand-up world. as for the bar, kind folks to their customers and quick service. i'll try to come back to try the food and for the fun every thursday night.; perfect bar!! went here with some friends and the evening got better and better. we were able to play our music and the drinks were great!; good place to hangout with friends. lively music and crowd too.; very nice cost benefit, however it feels weird the mix between north africa and french food.
also some of the items were missing
20 euros per person with wine.
nice staff; this place is quite awesome with very tasty foods and desserts! it can get a bit crowded and loud at night but nevertheless the concept of eating at a farm is cool.

name: LE CHIEN DE LA LUNE
reviews:
i had made a reservation for a group of 28 people, mostly us students. we had hummus, couscous or chakchuka--an excellent vegetarian option, with merguez (spicy sausages) added on request--, panna cotta infused with fennel (a superb dessert) and chocolate mousse. service was fast although the place was busy on a friday evening, with a young waitress who speaks excellent english. prices were inexpensive for a parisian restaurant and the chef, christian, is very friendly. i will certainly return with friends anytime.; the concept is nice, but you notice the place is new and just starting. the wine was to expensive for the qualtiy in my experience.
in the weekend you can't take the menu option, this is only durning the week. unfortantly it isn't obviouse. they aren't many other things to chose from. we could chose from the burger or a vegertarian dishe. both were ok, but not what we where hoping for.
you can sit outside but the neighborhood isn't cosy.; cute place, had a nice lunch here. a little bit outside from the central but i prefer because it’s nicer and quiet.; google really worries me, i stopped for lunch and here is big brother watching over my shoulder! now the restaurant was very good, both in taste and value not to mention a friendly staff. i'll stop over again anytime.; great ! a good place to have a drink by nibbling something. i recommand.

name: LES MAH-BOULES
reviews:
was here during fashion week a couple months ago, amazing service extremely friendly. amazing food. espresso martinis are annoying to make but they blesses us 🙏🏼; visited here 6-7 times during my stay for paris fashion week, food was really solid (sandwiches and chicken in particular), drinks were great, staff were really kind and obviously love their jobs.; i had a really bad experience where the staff at the venue behaved both rudely and arrogantly. after buying beer, we asked if we could buy some coins - for their table football game - but were simply refused. shortly after, to our surprise, coins were given to another guest. whether it was because he spoke better french or because he looked like someone who would spend more money, was hard to say. the attitude was generally condescending and unpleasant.; the greatest staff. fun. good food. highly recommend!!!; great place! had a surprise birthday party for my boyfriend here and the entire staff and team was extremely helpful before the event and on the day of.

the bar itself is not in the best location but the ambiance of the bar, the staff and the bar makes up for it. a great place to have a drink, play some games, and enjoy a night out with friends. very chill and wonderful bar. would definitely come again!!!

name: Le Vestiaire à Roulettes
reviews:
super service; second-hand clothing store for children with excellent value for money. you can find everything (pants, sweaters, little tops, pajamas, coats) in all sizes. in short, it’s really good!; great exchange with stéphanie from the locker room on wheels! it's great to think that we can do a good deed by recycling our toddlers' clothes and earn a few euros (even if we clearly don't do this for profit). thank you to the locker room on wheels for this positive and so necessary approach; it’s always a pleasure to come to the locker room on wheels!

the clothes are cool, and the teams provide good advice and above all are super friendly.

we can't wait to come back!; it's a great initiative but it's closed two out of three times when i go there because the opening hours communicated in the newsletter are sometimes modified. i don't have the "google" reflex so from this point of view there is a small communication failure.  crossing the whole of paris several times with a baby in a stroller or in stifling heat only to find the door closed is very discouraging.

name: LAGADOUE
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
third overalls from us, and still just as satisfied. the younger ones wear the ones bought for the eldest, and they haven't moved. in the top. as for delivery, nothing to say: careful and fast delivery.; great product, a little expensive but we will use it so much that it's worth the investment. no more worries about getting your clothes dirty
i'm delighted and baby too :-); the overalls meet our expectations, they are thin and light, can be easily worn over other clothes. very pleasant fabrics.; everything went very well!
the overalls seem to be quality!
can’t wait for it to rain to use them 😃; i have tested and approved these overalls a thousand times. my son can play in wet grass and puddles without risk of damaging his clothes. we even used it on the ski and toboggan runs and it worked great. i gave these overalls twice as birth gifts, it's a great gift for living a real child's life in nature!
i recommend :)

name: Gamme de Cooleurs
reviews:
i love this place! already bought 3 pieces for my kids and will come back for sure!; so happy to have found some great timeless ones for this back-to-school at the gamme de cooleurs pop-up at fanfare. the selection is fantastic, a real proust madeleine of classics from my childhood.; great brand of second-hand clothing for children! the sets are full of charm and each piece i received was perfect! the designer is adorable and has great taste!! i recommend 1000% 🙂; superb brand that offers second-hand or new clothing created by
clara in her parisian workshop! we bought a two-tone vest and thick jeans for our 18 month old son, impeccable size and quality materials.
i highly recommend; great concept: mixing new and second hand, all selected very carefully and in perfect condition. i really like the looks chosen by the designer and of course, i fell for the little homemade jacket, from the artificielle brand

name: Chicken Street Paris 18 Naan & Fried Chicken
formatted_address: 52 Rue de la Chapelle, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
the trekking pawns here! for the price and speed, this quick dinner place is very worth it. we didn’t get a chance to eat that evening and most places where closed already. saw this place and stopped in. a lot of delivery people picking up orders outside. must be a good sign. we walked in and was able to place an order via touch screen, which was well done as it gave us a chance browse the menu and order at our own pace. placing and order was easy and the food was ready in about 5ish minutes. we took our food to go. we got the meal with chicken naan wrap and extra wings. it was great to be able to pick the sauce for the wrap and the spice of the wings were amazing!! we were pleasantly surprised. the fries were okay, nothing amazing, but we would go back for the wings and wrap. forgot to take a picture of the food because we were so hungry and the food smelled so good. @thetrekkingpawns; it was my first time eating at this chain here but never the last, food is super delicious and tasty, worker is so kind with her brother they patiently helped me order since the menu isn’t in english.
tried the family mixed bucket and it was tasty, i highly recommend fries with cheddar as well. if you want halal or delicious food just come here.; first thing that we ate in paris and it was sooo good and tasty! we came back 3 times in 3 days 👌😍😍😍; good chicken and good service!; very greasy but so good.
there is not a lot of room and often a lot of people and it is totally justified given the quality offered.  the restaurant is clean and the choice is quite varied.

name: Restaurant Le Mondial - Meilleur kebab de Paris
formatted_address: 190 bis Av. de Clichy, 75017 Paris, France
reviews: we entered the restaurant at 10pm for late/jet-lagged dinner and yet the staff was cheerful and welcomed us. explained the dishes patiently and took our order. the good was fresh and delicious. my two teenagers raved about the kebabs and gave two thumbs up. hummus was also amazing. portion sizes are generous. we ordered chicken breast meat kebabs and the regular chicken kebabs in sandwiches with garlic and spicy sauces.; i had adana and it was very good, staff very nice.; it has good food and nice atmosphere i liked it so much, the chicken burger was the best very kind and friendly staff; came in on the way back to my hotel and got a beef kebab and some baklava and it was delicious. better than the kebabs you get in england. it came with salad and chips too. service was good and everyone was very friendly even when i was speaking quite bad french! i recommend.; it’s not the best kebab i’ve ever eaten but it is quite decent

name: Les carrières
reviews: a little corner restaurant that had great and friendly service and really good food as well. if we are ever back in the area it will definitely be a must go back to.; really nice neighborhood restaurant serving good quality comfort food with classics like burgers, césar salad, tartares... due to covid restrictions, their menu is temporarily limited to a few dishes only but it's more than enough! staff is friendly and they respect health protocols.; the best onglet steak i've head so far. the atmosphere is fine, the beer is good and the prices are affordable. some of the waiters might be a bit "weird" but most of them are very helpful and fast. pity the kitchen opens quite late😅; wonderful staff who were very patient and welcoming.  the food was fantastic.  not much more to ask for.; nice bar in an off the radar part of montmarte. the canolli pasta was delicious.

name: Restaurant Le Cellier
formatted_address: 25 Rue de la Victoire, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
we visited restaurant le cellier in paris and, despite the restaurant being completely empty when we arrived, we were asked if we had reservations, which we did. as the only table present, we were surprised by the long wait times and lack of service. unfortunately, the dishes we received were disappointing.

when another group arrived and began filming, they received much more attention from the staff, which added to our dissatisfaction. overall, the experience was mediocre and not memorable. we left the restaurant still hungry, which was far from ideal.; a nice bistro with great hospitality. don’t expect a long menu here, it rather adopts seasonal ingredients, with a fusion twist on some of the dishes. we were there for dinner and shared an appetizing salmon taco as the starter, with smoked chicken leg and seared octopus as the mains. everything was well presented and savory. and for dessert we had the miso chocolate mousse - warm, airy and light in texture, a perfect ending for a fantastic meal.; tried their lunch menu which was above our expectations.

same quality of food and service you get at chef’s one michelin star restaurant.

for such quality of food and portion size, set menu is very well priced.; stumbled across this tiny restaurant on my way back to my hotel and read some great reviews so i gave it a try. this was one of the best meals i've had during my stay in paris.  i had the filet de lieu noir cuit doucement au four, fine mousseline de patates douces. it was incredible! for dessert,  the la boite à "chocolat-miso" coulant au chocolat was also excellent. my waitress was friendly and attentive. i'd definitely come back again.; chef pitré made the most incredible duck ravioli. it was truly a special moment coming to his restaurant and one that will always cherish - thank you stéphane

name: le va et vient du nord
reviews: alright place for a quick drink or lunch. food is ok and prices are reasonable.; attentive service, very kind & patient. charcuterie board was great & filling!; good couscous, good wine, super friendly service.; dirty, rude and unprofessional. avoid!; good food at reasonable pricing.  great service as well.

name: Sylon de Montmartre
reviews:
amazing food, perfect service and atmosphere!!! loved the bacon and cheese croissant and the bacon pancakes. the servers were extremely friendly, so can’t recommend more :); nice breakfast/brunch place to eat. seems like most places in the area serve lunch starting at 1200 pm so if you are in an in-between time before lunch and need a bite to eat, this is a great place. service was great, it does get a little crowded. the manager/owner spoke english, was endlessly hustling around taking orders, cleaning up, etc. respect the hustle.; absolutely amazing food and service. everyone was super friendly. we had the chocolate pancake, egg croissant and yogurt bowl. i would dine here again.; what a beautiful gem, we stopped here for breakfast on the last morning of our trip to paris and highly recommend!

the waitress was polite, friendly and helpful, the food was fantastic. best breakfast we had in paris!

highly recommended!; really good side street cafe serving third wave coffee. nice staff and good coffee. flat white was a solid 8.0, nice flavour and smooth milk work.

name: L'Atelier de LiLi
reviews: the place is small and charming with very good food if you need something for a fast snack… their concept is cute, like you are entering someone’s kitchen. a home made mango juice was super, i like a lot their muffins, so far the best one i’ve tried in paris…other things we ordered were good as well.; amazing macarons and coffee. the owners are so friendly, would love to come back next time i'm in town!; great value, warm welcome as you are part of the family, comes much recommended !!!! well done guys, see you soon !; the sweetest owners! you can tell the food is made with love 💜🥰; short story: despite a good dish the owner tried to steal money from us. she will be very kind to clients she likes probably but she decided to snap at us constantly for no reason. / long story: the woman who runs this place scams people. all the bad reviews you see are people who have been scammed and who have been scolded at for no reason. she tried to steal 10 euros from us for the mess we left because we were eating with a 1 year old and 3 year old and they spilled crumbs (maybe don’t run a restaurant if you can’t handle it?). we were 3 adults sharing 2 expensive meals and an overpriced muffin and two coffees and she charged us 52 euros with an imaginary extra 10 euros for a “cocktail”. we returned to get refunded and she even tried to justify it because of the crumbs. she said “i added 10 euros because of the mess you left” — acknowledging this theft. imagine you were charged 10 euros extra everywhere you ate because you or your kids left crumbs on the floor? completely absurd. she chooses to run the place this way scamming those she doesn’t like. she was super nice to the table next to us and actually telling them she didn’t like our table… ?! we even apologised and mentioned the food was good and she said she didn’t appreciate our “picnic” (because we shared ….) and that the crumbs were not “serious” — i think some people should change careers if they can’t handle the most mundane happenings of a restaurant, and be the opposite of kind. especially if you’re the owner.

name: Café de Luce - Amandine Chaignot
formatted_address: 2 Rue des Trois Frères, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
i heard about this place on social media. the food was great. i just was a lot disappointed by the fact that we did not get small plates to eat the assiette de charcuterie (it had another name). we had to eat with our hands and napkins. the staff could be more thoughtful. they are not in a mind that everything is possible.; food is good, but service could be better. the brunch is great, but it’s expensive as the dessert never worth to eat, it’s not good, change it please. sometimes they forget to bring all the items from the brunch, and you need to ask and then wait a lot. sometimes one item comes before and then when you have the rest is already cold. other time i was there i took the greek planche, and it was delicious. cafe de luce has a lot of potential… i would like to recommend it to everyone, they just need to improve a little.; perfect private dinner. they have been very accommodating, service was good. cuisine is sophisticated and deserts were impressive. private room is quiet et decorated with taste. will come back for sure; friendly staff, nice place where you can sit both inside and outside. didn’t have to wait that long for the food, we also got some bread while waiting. but we only got three pieces for five persons, strange. food was well made and tasted good, but maybe a little too small for me. kids pasta was very small so wouldn’t recommend for kids over 10. overall a nice experience and a place to try french food.; very well located cafe/restaurant in montmartre (away from the big touristic restaurants).
service was correct and the food was very good. coffee was slightly pricy for the quality but except that, everything was perfect!

name: Bouillon Chartier
reviews:
solid experience and help team for a solo dinner they made my experience great. the food was awesome but i would avoid the duck for future orders. there is a line but not as bad as other locations. the prices are amazing and i will be back a few dozen more times.; french classics for an affordable price. ordered two mains, a dessert and wine, all for €40. the pig's feet was nice, but the fries could have been prepared better. the skin of the feet was crispy. the beef tongue was delicious. finished the night with a simple dessert of peach melba with vanilla ice cream.; came at 11:35am just after it opened and got in no problem. food was reasonably priced, portions were good and the food tasted great. our server anontio was very attentive and friendly, will definitely be revisiting :); excellent food, environment and waiters.
my mother said she would give 10 stars. we had 3 different meals, the sea bass, the chicken and the alsatian sauerkraut. great white wine recommendations from jevish our mauritian waiter.
my father had escargot for the first time and loved it. we are hungarians from transylvania and lots of the dishes resembled our cuisine.
a wonderful way to end our trip.; bouillon chartier offers a truly authentic parisian experience with its beautiful art nouveau decor and lively atmosphere. the menu is filled with french classics escargots, confit duck etc.

service is ok. if you’re looking for delicious french comfort food in a charming, historical setting, it’s popular with both tourists and locals, adding to its genuine charm.

name: Aux Arts et Sciences Réunis
reviews:
my wife & i came at 7pm just as they opened and the place was already half full!

manager was super helpful in explaining the dishes & also very quick in ensuring that we had our meals quick as we needed to go to the philharmonic hall for a concert by 830pm

the meal was superb and portion size generous to make sure you don’t feel hungry soon!

overall a lovely restaurant that we will surely visit again; excellent meal for a lazy saturday afternoon. wonderful service and atmosphere.; conflicted on how to rate this place due to the respect of the place, the quality of the staff and the incredible artwork/architecture displayed.  but there i must stop, the regal but outdated menu was more standard than most.  the food though seen by the table nearby catered to the welcomed architecture firm/students/members seemed to be higher quality than all the other tables.  so why would you not have a fixed menu that served the public?  rather sad we did not enjoy it as much as we could have.  i would rate it lower but out of respect i give it for now 4 stars unless i change it later due to carefully calculating my corrections.; super restaurant. the personel/seevice is great and very helpful. especially for foreigners who don't know so good french :) the food is very good. it was great to taste some local or french seasonal menu. we were early so there were not so many people so we get meals fast. dont know how it is when they are more people. few days earlier we saw a lot of people herr passing by. even though i think it would be worth waiting. dishes were delicious.; incredible restaurant with excelent service, perfect ambiance and a very balanced  menu. true french cousine affordable and best quality. my dream is to come back

name: Chez JJ
reviews: the best steak tartare ! the waiter was so nice and fast! i love the ambiance too. definitely will come back next time 👍🤩; cute little bistro.  very busy so arrive early.  the food is quite good and service is quick and very friendly.  will definitely return when we are in the neighbourhood.; i had the chèvre salad - it was tasty and bountiful. also had the crème brûlée which was delicious. great meal.; i'd like to marry the chef 👨‍🍳 this was so delicious! and big portion; the food was very nice and the staff where very nice too. a great little french restaurant. i have to say theistic was very good when i was there

name: Le Sarment de Montmartre
reviews:
best ambiance in all of paris!
the staff is so kind and works really hard to make sure you enjoy your time there. i’ve never had to wait more than a few minutes for anything because they make the extra effort to see that you are taken care of.; friendly staff, pleasant ambiance and great food, easily one of the best places in the neighborhood!; i come here sometimes when my laundry is drying next door at the washing salon. once my card didn’t work as i paid too much contact less with it and the waitress just told me to come back whenever it’s convenient for me. super nice service and the drinks are good too. best spot; great service. very welcoming to tourists as i don’t speak french the owner and her sister speak very good english
the food was amazing and everything is homemade. i had one of their house cocktails and it was lovely.
highly recommend.
thanks!; the staff is absolutely wonderful, they are kind, friendly, and absolute gem of a neighborhood bar.

name: Le Hang'art
formatted_address: 61-63 Quai de la Seine, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
love this place, laid back and very friendly. huge portions with swift service. probably our best experiance so far eating out in paris.

would 100% recommend. 4.8/5; spacious repurposed building where the furniture is school desks. good food and service. i thought the king prawns on my tagliatelle were a bit mushy but otherwise liked it all. reasonable prices. loved the banoffee; well located by the canal, this restaurant is very baby/kid friendly! 👶 they have high chairs, toys, books and a dedicated area for kids! however you need to pay 8€ to access this area.. the food in general is simple and good, nothing extraordinary but for a high volume restaurant it's fine!; fun and hip little place, very atmospheric, welcoming staff, food was yummy, overall really great experience!; i came to paris to eat but with the rain and some fatigue i tried staying closer to my hotel. this was down the street and it’s had a few things going for it: an menu that had a few intriguing dishes, a hip looking crowd, and the guy that met me at the door was pretty inviting.

i ended getting a cuttlefish and potato salad with an onion dressing and a vegetarian lasagne. both dishes really hit it out of the park for me. i’m normally leaning carnivore, but had been overdoing it on the trip so far, and so i was happily surprised that the veg lasagne was possible the best veg one i’ve ever had.

i was also peaking at the tables by me and the burrata avocado tomato salad also looked great, and the frites looked home made and home style with skins and plenty of dark bits on the edges.

name: Le Duchesse - Bar à jeux
reviews:
very welcoming staff and a quite a big choice of games. you can book the table online or directly call the place. the menu and partivipation fee are explicitly provided at their website.; top!; excellent bar; there were 10 of us, and 10 of us had a great evening!!
the team is great, very welcoming and creating a very friendly atmosphere through their behavior! the managers know how to guide you towards the types of games requested, it's very professional in my opinion!!
the bar is spacious and very beautiful: you feel good there!
the prices are reasonable thanks to the quantity and quality of the products offered!
honestly, i highly recommend this bar ☀️

it was truly a wonderful evening!!!; if you are looking to spend a great evening with friends or family in belleville, the duchesse is the ideal place! the selection of the games library is sophisticated, the drinks and the cuisine excellent and above all the service is brilliant, the whole team takes great care of you, always ready to help you understand the rules or to advise you!
the programming of themed evenings around different gaming universes is also worth watching very closely!
entered by chance this evening, we will come back! thanks :)

name: le Julia
reviews:
it is a great local and friendly bar. the food and drink were great. the bar had a welcoming atmosphere. i would like to visit again if i am in the area.; chill hideaway with a welcoming atmosphere, inexpensive bites and projections on one wall, when i visited. easy to be a regular here!; friendly, nice service even jusylt for a drink; great local and friendly bar. signature cocktails were amazing. didn't try the pool table in the basement so i will have to come back. 😁; good craft beer, a good selection of rhum whisky and cocktails.
the staff is super kind and pro.
you have plugs and wifi. you can do an unformal meeting at 2 or 4 but it's not a working place.
downstairs you can find a pool to play for free, yes for free!
the bar has an old / renovated atmosphere which makes it really cool.
you have a little selection of tapas but they are excellent and made from super fine quality products.
the owner is usually around and her eager attention to make everyone feel home is all around. she has this spirit of bar and services owner she makes people feel home and you'll see a lots of regular here.

stop at that bar and forget a little bit about everything.
its just got in my top 3 in paris.

name: La Kaskad
reviews: the food was perfect. the portion, the flavour, everything was spot on. the location is great and it was a very pleasant stay. they did a great job serving us even with our mostly english and broken french vocabulary. merci beaucoup; very classic and cozy french café/bistrot. their lunch option was very delicious (and it changes periodically, so i had meat on my go) their crème brûlée was very yummy as well. very kind staff & ideal for families, group or solo lunches/dinners. will be back if i’m in the area!; very kind service and good food at correct price. les formules could be available all time instead of just for lunch.; great food & atmosphere! the duck with honey sauce was delicious! location near the parc buttes-chamont was ideal.; very kind service even though we visit only for coffee.

name: La Casa Des Enfants
reviews:
a welcoming and caring place where my son flourishes in capoeira activity. activity done by a brazilian who teaches children both sport and the surrounding culture (music, songs, language). the children had the immense privilege of putting on their end-of-year show in the town hall of the 19th arrondissement, it was magical!
of course we will register again next year.; i highly recommend la casa des enfants for all parents looking for a fun and beneficial activity for their children.  we enrolled our 6 year old son in a yoga class and he is delighted with this activity and very enthusiastic about going. the teacher finds the right balance between "calm" proposals and more dynamic ones for children "full of energy". in addition to yoga classes, la casa des enfants also offers other activities for children, all of which are quality and age-appropriate. go for it without hesitation!!; i highly recommend casa des enfants, a friendly, cheerful and professional place dedicated to activities for children. a stone's throw from the buttes chaumont, the casa is managed with caring attention by frédérique who takes great care for the greatest happiness of young and old and their parents!; my son has been attending casa des enfants for 3 years for various activities: early learning, dance and yoga. he always goes to classes with enthusiasm. the place is friendly and warm. the location suits us perfectly in relation to the school and our home, a stone's throw from the buttes chaumont. it is a structure on a human scale where each child is taken into account; which was an important criterion for us, parents, when we were looking for extracurricular activities for our child.; we recommend la casa des enfants, the children each flourish there at their own pace. different courses are offered during the week, do not hesitate to inquire.
finally, the director frédérique is friendly, as are the teachers, in short... we feel good there ☺️

name: Arsène et les pipelettes
formatted_address: 2 Rue des Trois Frères, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
best girls clothes store in the area.; for good taste, excellent products accompanied by very professional attention; beautiful shop! a magnificent discovery!; we were here 4 weeks ago and are still so enchanted by the little shop. the lady in the store was also so sweet and accommodating! thank you for this shopping experience!; very nice shop with lots of pieces.
high price but quality products

name: Le fontenoy
reviews:
typically french bistro. good value food, set menu with specials  . patron very friendly. breakfast either continental or an omelette at reasonable price ( orange juice, coffee and omelette 12.90 euro).; we found this place by accident and glad we did. good food good wine awesome guy serving us. only place open on a sunday night . would recommend the snails here.; this is a wonderful , unassuming neighborhood bistro in the 19ieme. it offers a small menu of excellently prepared food, a nice wine list, a extremely relaxed atmosphere and friendly efficient service. it is, in short, a perfect 'bistro du quartier',  highly recommended for when you've had your fill of the overflowing-with-20-somethings places on the canal.; neighborhood café/restaurant with simple, efficient cuisine
friendly service
i enjoyed my croque monsieur on the terrace; it was very close to where we were staying, so we stopped by for a quick breakfast in the morning. we were welcomed very well at the venue and the food we ate was delicious.

name: Sardé
reviews:
sure! here’s a suggestion for your google review:

---

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

i recently dined at sarde in paris, and it was a fantastic experience! the lebanese food was absolutely delicious, bursting with authentic flavors that truly transported me.

if you're in paris and craving lebanese cuisine, i highly recommend sarde.; what can i say? original, flavorful, intriguing, yet authentic. wow!

(don't miss out on their lebanese lemonade); amazing food! pure authentic lebanese  food! must must try; i recently checked out sarde in paris, and i really enjoyed it! the atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were super friendly. i had the sarde chicken wrap, which was juicy and full of flavor. the falafel was crispy and delicious, and the manouche zaatar was fresh and tasty. overall, sarde is a great spot for mediterranean food, and i'd definitely go back.; had an awesome meal here. the food was excellent, but the service was even better. everyone there was super friendly and made the whole experience great.

the wraps are definitely the way to go—packed with flavor. the fries were seasoned just right, and even the coffee was solid.

if you’re looking for good food and even better service, this place won’t disappoint.

name: Table Des Ambassadeurs
vicinity: 11 Rue des Prêtres Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois, Paris
formatted_address: 11 Rue des Prêtres Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois, 75001 Paris, France
reviews:
on this day of june 8, 2024, we had the pleasure of eating pasta with cauliflower and above all a wonderfully well prepared cordon bleu. a good and comforting meal before returning to work. for dessert, a flan and a frangipane tart made it possible to properly end this super meal.
thanks to the chef and the whole team.
we will come back; congratulations! perfectly cooked potato followed by a subtle but delicious salting, the treat in its purest form. unfortunately, being in a bit of a hurry, i was unable to fully enjoy this beautiful place, but i would return with pleasure. see you soon and thank you again for the welcome!; very nice discovery of this high point of the parisian gastronomic scene. the location is truly incredible, a viewpoint between the backstage of la samaritaine and the church of st-germain l’auxerrois.
wide choice of starters, from the most refreshing to the most regressive. this continues with the main courses (a little extra with a vegetarian choice). cheese platter, bread from real bakers. let's end this trip with more choice: seasonal fruit salads, dairy desserts or frozen heart dessert. thank you to the team for this moment, special mention for fabrice who will not forget to remind you that life is beautiful, and who ensures that the meal goes smoothly from start to finish.
congratulations to all!; the food is very good at lunchtime and in the evening, the ambassadors are great! thank you to fabrice for bringing us joy and good humor and to all the others for their kindness and helpfulness.; tda ambassadors always smiling, especially fabrice.

name: Les Bancs Publics
reviews:
we are regulars here since it's in our neighborhood. their menus are always very original, creations based on fresh ingredients.
their weekday lunch deals are very affordable too!
just simply love it here!; steak was excellent.  fries were average (i'm picky about my fries, especially in france where i learned how good fries can be.) chocolate dessert was also excellent. and the service and ambience were exceptional.  i would go back again just to hang with the waiters and bar tender.  they were that friendly. i heard my waiter speak at least three languages while waiting on customers. this is a classic neighborhood brasserie where the menu changes.  go early to get a table.  they are busy for a reason.  if you only speak english, don't hesitate to go.  i speak french but they were very friendly to internationals that came in.; great staff, service and food. our meal came out hot and fresh without delay. the beer is cold and good. lovely little place. will be back in the future. cheers from australia.; great place! never had our dishes as quick as here. good price/quality. entrees are recommended (especially the carpaccio and aracini). they are fine if you pick 2 entrees as main meal.; classic french restaurant with a seasonal menu. few options so everything is fresh! the servers were really nice and helpful. they let me order the octopus dish without octopus 😄. also had the risotto. the strawberry dessert was notably fabulous. would definitely come again!

name: Tonton Jaurès Restaurant
reviews:
we found the restaurant after the exhibition. it was around 23:00 they were about to close soon.  but the waitress there, she's still very polite to us and it's really interesting to talk to her. also the food didn't make us down. very fresh and tasty!
will recommend this place.; came in twice in 4 days in paris, good atmosphere, nice food and very big portions.; very friendly staff. we told them we did not speak french and the waiter was very helpful and attentive with us. delicious food, well presented and reasonably priced. i would thoroughly recommend this establishment and give them a 5*; staff are friendly and speak many languages, spanish, english and french. food taste very good and is not too pricey. mixed alcoholic drinks are very tasty and not over the top in strength. free wifi but very slow in speed upload/download 0.96mb.; i took brunch option and it doesn’t worth those 20 € you pay. eggs benedict are tasteless. coffee is terrible. croissant was fine. service is relatively fast.

name: Restaurant Quedubon
reviews:
spectacular meal and service. all of the dishes exceeded expectation and excellent wine recommendations for any budget. note menu changes daily so use what i posted as an example. wine from around €30; the pros : freshly prepared dishes, excellent value for money, nice selection of wines, good service, this is a rare find in the 19th district of paris
the cons : restaurant isn’t very big, booking is recommended; a perfect evening in paris.

the food was incredible. everything i ate was delicious, and everything that came out to other tables looked just as good.

it's a small menu, and my server talked me through each option and happily gave his personal recommendations.

sitting outside and watching sunset colour the skyline, it was possibly the highlight of my time in paris. can't reccomend enough.; french bistrot cuisine. tasty and perfectly executed.
a friendly staff.
a bargain lunch menu for less than 20€.
a long list of delicious (natural) wines.
a must-go in the vicinity.; was invited there and never heard about the place before ! a small and humble facade restaurant with some amazing super quality food ! the chef is so creative and the food super nice and tasty ! i had a cold brocoli soup which was so good and a piece of grilled cabillaud and it was also great and well cooked. the lunch meal price meal price is super fair concidering the quality and the menu looks great and the price really shows the quality of the place ! not expensive for the food you have .. i will go back for sure

name: Aux Mille Saveurs
reviews:
i highly recommend this restaurant, it’s one of the few genuine spots here in paris where you can enjoy authentic moroccan food !; home made food with a friendly atmosphere. the food is very good for a affordable price !
je recommande le couscous avec petit supplément. délicieux !; most delicious cous cous i’ve ever had, speak to mohammed! he will sort you out!; an amazing experience at this local restaurant. food was delicious and staff friendly. highly recommend visiting; excellent moroccan restaurant, great food and reasonably priced.

name: La Maison de Doudou
reviews:
great pizza with a lot of flavor for a great price!; it was closed for construction; best service ever!; excellent 👌🏻; excellent and friendly

we have just eaten there and we came from nogent to spend a pleasant time in a community area and change a little.

result: nothing to complain about
there is a lot of life and children, the setting is colorful and attractive and that’s what made me want to bring the children there.

the 2 young girls on site are adorable, the prices are extremely fair: we ate very well with 3 adults and 2 children and we were completely satisfied for the good eaters that we are with pizza, drinks and very generous desserts for an ultra price down …

i absolutely don't understand the previous comments: probably coming from angry and embittered people.
but what do those who complain for nothing think?

let those who complain about the prices go and eat in other, bigger restaurants with a pizza for €22, that will calm them down.

a person from the kitchen ensured cleanliness and was himself cleaning the tables.

looking forward to returning to doudou with our children who love simplicity, conviviality and well-thought-out things!

and congratulations and good luck for the opening in the south 👏👏👏

name: La Mascotte
reviews: perfect lamb and very nice host!; very nice place, the food is perfect... thanks for the delicious couscous ❤️🍲; food is too nice, few selections but tasty , the staff is very friendly and makes you feel like eating at home; yummy couscous !; small corner café and restaurant.

name: Au Fond du Jardin
reviews:
great place, beautiful garden setting, delicious food and drinks.; amazing atmosphere, good food, lovely staff; super nice hidden garden, the restaurant is a great place for a quiet dinner.
the food is pretty good, so are the cocktails. the service is efficient, and the food and drinks are fairly priced; pizzas are good and not too expensive, although not completely filling, you should expect to need a starter or desert. the backyard is calm and nicely decorated, it's awesome during a sunny day.; cozy place, caring waiter, pleasant general atmosphere. we weren't disappointed by the dinner at this place. although, they didn't check vaccine certificate. some other minuses:
- food was mediocre (fish of the day was not well cooked and vegetables was quite watery, still, the fish tasted nice);
- absence of the music is awkward, because you can hear all the talks around.

name: Jango
reviews:
we just didn't like the food, and the service was bad as well. it seemed everyone is way too busy to attend everyone else, and even giving a menu is a task for them. the menu almost thrown at the table, which seemed very impolite. the food lacked any kind of flavour for us, didn't like it at all. the pizza with artichokes and aubergine tasted awful.; we sat out on the terrace where there was a great atmosphere of local parisians eating and drinking, many with their children. the steak and chips that our children shared came quickly and they loved it. they happily swapped potatoes for chips for them. our starters and main courses were classic french cuisine and were delicious. the standout was the pasta shells with mushrooms and truffles. the truffles were extremely vibrant tasting. worth going out of your way for this, especially with kids.; highly recommend the brunch 26$. big portions and really fresh ingredients. i loved everything i had and the price was just right. we stayed on the covered terrasse. it was nice to people watch.; authentic delicious food !; beautiful decor !
great food, wide selection of dishes. special mention to the pizza’s fluffy dough and tiramisu.
service could be better though

name: Fric-Frac Canal St Martin
reviews:
the server was super cool and chill. she had my order taken quickly and out asap. the sandwich was actually really tasty, with lots of toppings. the bread was light, not too crunchy but just right. the water with mint was refreshing. great place to grab a sandwich for lunch and hang by canal st. martin.  i paid 19 euro for my order.; we really enjoyed the sandwich’s here. bread was nice and toasty and filled with goodness. salad was fresh, seasoned chips were tasty, coleslaw refreshingly crunchy, and the peach iced tea really topped off an excellent lunch. the server was also very friendly.; very average sandwich unfortunately! service was good and a nice cute place! the fries were great and the highlight but we had high expectations based on the reviews. the aztec sandwiche was really bland even though it had a lot of ingredients. it needed more salt or something hot or some sort of sauce; nice place to eat near the canal! the service is a bit sloppy but the workers are really nice!
the best croques in the neighbourhood!; brilliant sandwiches, lots of filling and all tasted excellent.

name: The Place to... Gare de l'Est - Resto Pub
formatted_address: 131 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
- i asked for the wifi password and tried to connect
- it took 25 minutes to connect to wi-fi with password
- wifi password was correct but there was no internet connection
- i wanted to leave the cafe and asked if there was no connection i would leave
+ they told me to order my food, they said internet connection would not be a problem
+ “as soon as they brought the food to the table, they asked me to pay even though i didn't asked for the bill”. however, i did not want the bill and was planning to sit more. this was passive aggressive behavior and i felt attacked.
- i asked the other man at the bar about connection
+ and he said he couldn't help me

please check the date and time on the invoice

i have ordered another food meanwhile

worst experience in my life so far.; this place was still serving breakfast after i woke up extremely late and i was so grateful for that!

we were seated towards the front on a couch which was really nice! it was a bit warm but i was comfortable.

they have a great combination meal that came with drinks, croissant, eggs and bacon. you can have a omelet as well!

very reasonable pricing as well.
give it a try!; spacious, with places to work with a plug .  location is great as it is really in front of the train station; this restaurant is located directly across the street from the gare de l’est station. i stopped here for some breakfast & to do some work on my computer. it was a lovely experience with friendly waiters, a great environment, and delicious food. this could have all been ruined (by me) because after spending a few hours here i left with my backpack but forgot my handbag, which had my passport, money, and visa cards. i didn’t realize until a few hours later when i received a message from charly, the manager. he went above and beyond to contact me by finding me on linkedin and contacting the us embassy in paris since my handbag had no contact information inside. i am highly impressed with this restaurant and the staff members for their customer service and care. i will return each time i come to paris by train.

i got the breakfast package with an egg omelette & bacon; simple, good and overprice.m for breakfast.
service is good, the place is very cute.

name: Bistrot Des Tournelles
reviews:
everything we had here was fantastic! their famous cordon bleu is worth the hype. my beef stew was incredibly rich and tender. fantastic frites. all of this in a lovely quaint setting. good bourbon available as well really put this place over the top in my book. you don’t always see that abroad.; everything was wonderful. the servers were friendly, fun, and helpful. the food was delicious. we had the perfect paris bistro experience that we cannot have at home! see you soon!; super cute bistrot with a calming but bustling atmosphere and low lighting. service was great, we had a gorgeous orange wine recommended by one of the waiters and the food was out of this world! the chicken was cooked to absolute perfection, mashed potatoes were creamy and buttery and the steak…. melt in the mouth! not to mention the crème brûlée, which was the best i’ve ever had (and i’m a real crème brûlée fiend). would recommend to anyone visiting paris!; top 3 meals of my week long trip to paris. vibe is on point. hip dark venue with an adorable staff serving classic bistrot fare. servers were so nice. must highlight how friendly they were. i ordered a bottle of orange wine, the cordon bleu, filet au poivre, and for dessert profiterole. all were very on point for straightforward/ classic dishes. steamed cooked as requested, pepper sauce wasn’t too spicy. omg the mashed potatoes were very good. almost forgot about those. highlight of the meal was the chicken - my cordon bleu was oozing with melty gooey cheese like a volcano. it exceeded my expectations. dessert came out with a melted chocolate almond sauce poured over it, was cold hot chocolatey nutty and hit all the bases for me.; it was such a treat to end our day with bistrot des tournelles. the vibe, the staff and the food were all amazing.

the beef stew provençal was the clear favorite in our table and was quickly devoured by adults and kids (probably should’ve ordered one more). i personally loved the fillet au poivre, perfectly cooked steak bathed in a rich pepper sauce. the asparagus ravioli was a surprise, never had asparagus come off so strong (in a good way) and the hazelnuts complemented them perfectly. the chicken with oyster mushrooms in jus was great too, i couldn’t stop eating the mushrooms. i had a bite of the strawberry in chantilly cream before the kiddos made quick work out of the dessert.

shout out to the staff who were super friendly and accommodating to our large group as well. dining in a french bistro with kids is a little intimidating for us but they made sure we were comfortable and at ease.

this is a strong recommend and i would consider coming back if we find our way in paris again.

name: Café Jeux Natema.
reviews:
a place to discover urgently. a third associative place which offers excellent, very original catering and good quality products. the atmosphere of this place is an associative atmosphere with workshops, games to borrow... a treat.
important detail: the prices are very reasonable.; yannis' cuisine is tasty, with flavors that take you on a journey, the bread is homemade. the smells will make you salivate and your digestion will only be better. go for it. g; great atmosphere, fast service and pleasant waiters, excellent and seasonal cuisine; unique and privileged place!
the welcome is great.

thanks !; a great association
or we offer you lots of things
eat good products
cheap
offers you theater tickets and museum outings
and other shows
with culture of heart
we can play board games...
academic support is offered
the people who take care of it are friendly and professional.
a beautiful place

name: Candle Kids
reviews:
this is by far the best coffee shop in town!!!
staff is super friendly, food is delicious and coffee is just amazing.
highly recommended.; adorable coffeeshop with a lot of space and tables both inside and outside. there are two zones for laptops. the coffee is great. cinnamon roll is recommended!; good neighborhood coffee shop in the 20th arrondissement! we got the hojicha latte & cardamom bun — both really good!! great place to catch up with friends.even though the place is full (even outside), the people really come and go so it’s easy to grab a table in just a few minutes wait!; great coffee place, can recommend 👍
one of the « new style » chic parisian cafes that you see here and there, and everywhere if you know what to look for. which is good.; friendly and warm little cafe in belleville! this has been my go-to coffee shop during my stay in paris, hands down! best coffee and its made with l-o-v-e.  fresh oj, wonderful pastries and a lively environment to read or just people watch. also, the cutest dogs hang out there. i highly recommend.

name: Café des Anges
formatted_address: 66 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
reviews: this place is a neighborhood favorite. lots of locals hang out here at all hours: breakfast, lunch, drink, dinner; it’s always busy and hustling and bustling. they have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. lunch options include standard bistro food and plat du jour, which sometimes is a rice plate with curry. my favorite is their breakfast item homemade granola with yoghurt (they do have english menus!), so refreshing with amazing yoghurt (perfect milk/cream balance), fresh fruits and granola with minced raisins and nuts in a perfect blend of flavors, topped with fresh mint leaves and homemade berry jam. the portion is extremely generous and all for just 5.5 euros! it’s one of my favorite breakfast items in paris. they also have amazing fresh orange juice. no wonder this place is so popular: good location, fresh good food with reasonable price, friendly service (they can even speak english if you struggle with your french); my vegetarian burger with the fried portobello mushroom was delicious! the place is quite small, so it can get a bit too crowded, however the atmophere was really nice. the only flaw was that we asked 3 times for some water and, despite always promising to bring it, the waiter never did.; this is a classic french restaurant and one of the good ones. i actually liked the food, but it was a little undercooked, you need to tell me how it should be cooked in front. i was pleased with the taste. the place is big, the tables are just small but it had a nice vibe here. the prices were not too high. we can say price performance place.; visiting from america. walked here from our hotel. wanted breakfast but got there moments after noon so lunch it was. seated whenever we chose ( outside of course ). ordered loaded fries for app. came out fast & hot. i got the cobb salad i loved, friend got the chicken satay. wasn’t a big fan, didn’t love the sauce & felt the chicken was dry but maybe just how things are here. total bill €36. service was friendly! i recommend!; amazing vibes and great breakfast spot when you are in paris. the staff are very pleasant and attentive. food is way beyond expectations, simple scrambled eggs tastes incredibly exquisite! they've got an english menu available too, makes it less intimidating experience for non locals to order the food. absolutely great breakfast place! do come try it for yourself.

name: Umami Matcha Café
reviews:
i had a fantastic experience at umami matcha café! the atmosphere is calm and welcoming, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a delicious meal. i ordered the chirashi de saumon paired with their genmaicha bio tea, and both were absolutely wonderful. the fresh flavors of the chirashi were beautifully complemented by the nutty, soothing tea. the overall energy of the café was vibrant yet peaceful, with great attention to detail in everything they offer.

be sure to check out their japanese shop before or after your meal—there’s a great selection of teas and other unique products to bring a bit of umami matcha home with you! highly recommend this spot for anyone who enjoys authentic flavors and a serene dining experience.; very cute cafe with a calm vibe. i tried the matcha parfait and umami matcha. the parfait had sweet cream, red bean, matcha ice cream and a crunchy element which i think was cereal with a matcha chocolate coating. the taste was very nice and the crunch from the cereal made it easy to continue eating.
for the umami matcha you can choose white or dark chocolate, but they recommend the white. the drink was nice and smooth and just a little sweet from the chocolate, which is perfect. but for me the matcha flavour was a little too hidden, it could have been a little stronger.

in addition to the cafe they also sell other japanese condiments and goods such as matcha, sake, matcha bowls and so on.
they also have english speaking staff.; great place for matcha lovers! while the frappé had a more earthy, natural and unsweetened flavor, the umami was perfect for me as i prefer my matcha drink a bit sweet. in addition to the delicious drinks, desserts and food, they also have a section selling japanese condiments and kitchen cutleries. whether you are a matcha fanatic or a curious explorer who wants to try matcha, this place offers a wide range of choices for everyone. definitely worth checking it out!; great choice of teas and pastries with of course lots of choice in matcha products. the place is nicely decorated, great to meet up with a friend or work :) service is nice even though a little bit slow and chaotic sometimes. but always nice and with a smile :) i recommend it :); matcha latte is really good!
the marble cake is not much special, quite sweet and not much taste/smell of matcha.
would like to try the hojicha cookie next chance.

the service is nice, the seating amd atmosphere is quite dark.

name: ♡ La Confidente
reviews: good food is served in this restaurant. menu is offering a few “plats du jour”. meals are nonetheless lacking flavor and balance.staff is friendly and welcoming. cossy atmosphere.; absolutely fantastic experience. i went there with limited knowledge of french and the waiter stopped for a couple of minutes to explain everything to me. the food and atmosphere were also amazing. go here if you get the chance!; the staff was so nice and helpful. our waiter was very accommodating of our lack of french and the food was just incredible! i will absolutely be recommending this place to anyone i know visiting paris.; every dish was exquisite! on the photo you can see the blue burger, the rigatoni and the tiramisu. everything was soooo delicious! also, the service is super kind. we will come back avec plaisir!; we had an early dinner here on our last night in paris.  the owner serving us was very kind, polite and helpful.  we are an english speaking family and her english was perfect.  food was great, especially the fish balls, blue cheese burger and lamb.  thank you.

name: Les Mondes Bohèmes - Restaurant Paris 20
reviews:
the hosts of our air b&b recommended this little neighborhood gem. our family of five made reservations and when we arrived were seated on the lovely terrace. all of the staff were very friendly and helpful, though they did not speak much english (not an issue, but just a note for english speakers). we tried several meals including a burger, steak, and a pork roast and everything was fresh and tasty. i would definitely recommend if in the area.; you can never go wrong at this little restaurant near nation. waiting staff is great, food is always fresh and the menu constantly evolves based on the seasons. a great little find!; very nice terrasse with a cozy feeling. the food is what you would expect from a bistro with a nice quality on the meat.

wine selection is nice as well though not extensive.

service is switch and friendly.

go there for a date or a lunch with friends.; i really liked this place. food is good, the place is big with a huge terrace and a nice interior. the service was slow but they were only too servers and the place was packed. they are very kind and try their best to serve everyone. the salads and the meat plates are quite good. the argentinian wine finca la niña was really good.; iv usually keep five stars for the wow factor.
close by our cottage, found this quaint restraunt. my chicken and pasta was delightful, many tastes blended together, served in its own pan!
saves on washing up, lol.
customer service, brilliant, in and outside seating comfortable, all in all, a place to which i would return.
slightly above average price, worth the slight extra expense.

name: Café Juliette - Restaurant Paris 20
reviews:
had breakfast and dinner here and it’s the best! the food is good and great quality. get the orange juice for breakfast! the dinner was chicken and it’s the best food i’ve tried in europe.; food is amazing and the waiters are very kind and friendly :)
perfect place for lunch and also for breakfast!; the cafe is our go-to in paris!!! magnificent breakfast menu, salads and burgers. it closes at 1 a.m that is very good for having late suppers. service is on the top. very very good!; really lovely experience. food was good and service was extremely nice and friendly; great food, really friendly service. ideal.

name: Restaurant Station Nord-Est
reviews:
the special menu from the restaurant was amazing!!! the service is also nice as well are the tourist know nothing about french foods, the staff recommended us and we love it.; had a wonderful evening here, filled with hospitality and nice enough food.
except for a few regulars and ourselves the place was empty but this was completely compensated by the welcoming and friendly staff who took great care of us.; a true couscous specialist! it was amazing! the service was great as well. though we didn't know much about french cuisine, the staff made excellent recommendations, and we loved every dish.; this was a wonderful dining experience. the atmosphere is friendly and welcoming.

the service is second to none. we felt very welcome despite our struggle with the language. the proprietor spoke excellent english and made us feel like extended family.

the food was excellent with many north african dishes to go along with some excellent traditional offerings we started with the escargot. our teen had the cheddar burger, which was delicious).
my wife had a traditional cous cous with beef and chicken and i had the duck confit. both were perfect.

the proprietor shared a little of his history and his love for cuisine and we finished off the meal with a kettle of freshly muddled mint tea.

an overall excellent experience.; friendly staff, amazing foods and service.
definitely come back to the restaurant !

name: Les Grands Enfants
reviews:
my lamb with au gratin was very good, i got the combo for 29 euro with entree and dessert. my daughter’s veal was chewy and overcooked. my cousins veal was also very good, she specified to cook it quickly on each side. i would come back again.; i absolutely love this restaurant! the beef carpaccio was delightful, the lamb was outstanding, and the tiramisu was perfect. i always make a pit stop at this restaurant when in paris. fully halal, never had a bad meal here, really recommend coming; excellent food, great service, impeccable atmosphere. halal food makes it even more unique as a french restaurant. i had the sumptuous entrecote. this is a must stop if you’re in paris.; best halal french steaks and very good appetizers especially dynamite chicken.
fillet mignon  was delicious.; spending some days in paris and got les grands enfants recommended for the steaks and we are glad that we followed the recommendation. every course was of high quality and and tasted delicious. portions size are generous and worth any cent. nice atmosphere also for special occasions. long story short: a must stop on your paris trip.

name: Au Bonheur des Jeux
reviews: went along to their popular social night and had a fantastic evening. super friendly staff and welcoming. soon found players with their open table (for those who turn up solo or without a specific game planned!).  would definitely reccomend to any board gamer   visiting paris! literally a short walk from the nation metro and  bus stop so it's ideal for those not too familiar with the city.  such an extensive games library i wish i had time to explore them all! definitely one of the highlights of my trip!; friendly and welcoming staff, helping you find the ideal tabletop for your party. food and drinks quite decent too. place is small so be sure to come in early.; great games, super cool staff and a nice général environnement to have some fun.; j'adore cet endroit ! warm, friendly, bilingual environment with a great range of games.; very friendly boardgame venue with wonderful hosts!

name: DINER D ENTREPRISE
reviews:
top!; company dinner recommended the restaurant les compères to me, following a last minute call for around twenty people: a superb evening, in a brilliant restaurant, which perfectly responded to the few elements that i had been able to give to the phone !
i thank barth for his professionalism, our human and pleasant exchanges and his availability. i recommend 200%; last minute restaurant and karaoke on a sunday evening for a group of 30 people found by company dinner. everything was done very quickly with our criteria. i particularly recommend it. very pleasant on the phone. thank you very much for your professionalism; finally, a tailor-made, personalized offer that contrasts with the too often formatted dinners. barth likes to be challenged and responds to all requests: atmosphere, decor, tastes and colors.
i highly recommend !; top organization... great corporate evening.
thanks bart

name: Aux Tables du Père Lachaise
reviews:
we popped in early before our walk around pere lachaise. we had coffee and croissants and the croissants were the best we'd had our entire time in paris. we both looked at each other in shock that a croissant could be this good.

i highly recommend having a relaxed coffee and pastries here. worth going out of your way for; very lively atmosphere. the food was good and biers good as well. the best part was the service by fali (i hope i’m spelling her name correctly), she was exceptionally great and super sweet; she made us feel at home. she regularly checked with us if we were comfortable and if we needed anything and was smiling all through the service. she explained and answered all the questions we had about the items on the menu. she deserves a raise. santé!; it was amazing, the food was really good, i loved my salad and it has good prices; couldn’t think of a better place in the 11th to have a 2 hour lunch. the food was delicious and in huge quantities. the service was nothing short of exceptional.
apps/beers/entres/dessert/coffee cost roughly €60….. and portions were for 4 people …. highly recommended; very friendly staff -  quality of food was great
parisian atmosphere

name: Le Canon de la Nation
formatted_address: 2 Pl. de la Nation, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
worst coffee i had in a while - super burned and bitter. they probably buy cheapest/trashiest beens possible.
also, we had a flight to catch and intended for 20m grab and go, but it took 40m(!) because the servers were doing some chatty chat between themselves, so i had to shout to get the bill.; great breakfast, tasty avocado toast with salmon or bacon!; they run a tight shift around there and yet i’ve never felt underserved. reasonable prices for saint-antoine and high quality food and coffee; nice, hangout café / restaurant, for evening afterwork drinks or dinner, near the street with a view on place de la nation!; parfait.perfect.a good brasserie.services,food abverage and prices.

name: Flunch
reviews:
if i could give it a zero i would. the food was awful, i had chewy haddock , eclairs with rubber like chocolate and stale bread (see pictures below). i was on an exchange from england and there was a homeless person who was stealing food, then he was looking at the private parts of girls and boys, apart from they were 12 and 14 year olds. the toilets had hygiene and a window looking at the urinals. overall an awful experience with a pdf file, nightmare service and terrible food.; food is ok,
services good
environment is good
price upbeat able in center of paris.; we were supposed to come here to eat dinner for 3 days.

today, the first day, we come here, have to wait 1:30h and see other classes getting kicked out and pushed around.

somehow we get in, the trays are wet, forks and knives dirty, food is either cold, tasteless, or both.

staff was very rude, food was barely edible and wait time was absurd.

id reccomend going to the subway right outside or the mcdonald's closeby.

hopefully well be able to get a refund and not come here again.; excellent experience! i come here regularly to eat, have coffee, and sometimes work. the food is great, and the prices are the most reasonable you can get in the heart of paris. you can order something and then help yourself to as many vegetables as you want! i especially love the plantain bananas available on weekends. however, when it’s crowded, some people struggle to keep the facilities clean.; don't think this is a top eating establishment but for a tourist in need of something to eat at a reasonable price in central paris flunch is just the job.

you can get items cooked to order, have something from an extensive cold selection (which we did) or there are some buffet items.

excellent value for central paris and recommended within the market it serves.

name: Oh Papillou - Concept Store bébé et enfant
reviews: very nice shop and manager with excellent advice! i recommend with your eyes closed; shop which has just opened its doors quite recently, with a decent choice of toys for children and everything that concerns them from 0 to 10 years old. the manager named kelly is friendly and will be able to advise you best. to recommend. :); a pretty boutique as we like them and great brands. thanks to kelly for her advice, the gift given to my daughter is more than validated!!; great welcome!;

name: Aire de jeux pour enfant
reviews:
it's a nice place for sitting and enjoying time with some friends. lucky to be there.; amazing parc; i came from gare du nord with my son to make him wait.
2km of walking, a little small but it made you happy so mission accomplished 😉
benches around to eat while waiting; small, friendly and complete playground, slide, pine pong table, climbing canvas...for children; quite small, but it does the trick for a 20 minute break
watch your children and keep your bag close to you ;)

name: Du Pareil Au Même
formatted_address: 120 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
wonderful shop, very good variety of kids clothes. lovely experience, weta was so kind and helpful. thank you, will surely be back 😊; super!!; warm and friendly welcome! very good balance in availability for customers and autonomy left for in-store research.
kind and adorable team with children. even my child said, “they’re really, really nice.”

i recommend with your eyes closed, it feels good! :); my favorite dpam store in paris, always tidy shelves that make you want to go and the charming wetu who always gives a warm welcome to each customer, the whole family loves her!; i recommend this store. the welcome is warm and natural. which is becoming rare in paris. the person who welcomed me is truly wonderful, an excellent trader, loving her job. very pretty clothes for children are available. great gift ideas at affordable prices. i will return there for gifts for my interns with great pleasure.

name: KD Junior
reviews:
best place to shop for boys elegant clothes in paris. they have the best cut, material and prices. after shopping there for your little angels , you won't be able to go anywhere else. great service. the 2 owners serge and gérard are amazing guys. a fan from miami; great welcome.  excellent advice. very very beautiful products for children in costumes, shirts, jackets, accessories, very tasteful, beautiful and classy and great value for money.... never disappointed.  i strongly advise you. real professionals who take their time and that is appreciable and has become rare. sergio b.; very warm welcome, very good advice, very good quality suits and tuxedos at a very reasonable price.
i highly recommend, look no further to dress your son!; it's a really good store if you're looking for very nice suits, tuxedos, ties, etc... at a very good price and, above all, excellent quality.
in addition, the service is great, it helps you find the ideal costume and it really is a very good service.; excellent house. fashion and children's clothing professionals.
renewed products and complete range.
we even found the socks and shoes!!

name: Okaïdi
reviews:
😀😀😀; boring for fathers; review the basis of customer service, namely listening: i call before traveling to ask if they have an item in a specific size. they answer me: yes ma'am. i arrived 10 minutes later and they had put aside the item in the size below, telling me that it was following my call!; je déconseille ce magasin . service client vraiment déplorable, la dame à lunettes qui est en caisse ( et je suis désolée j’aime pas viser les gens ) est très désagréable au point où j’ai laissé mes achats en caisse et je suis sortie sans rien prendre….; breathtaking, that's the first word that comes to mind, an extraordinary toy corner, i highly recommend coming to this store, a little extra in sivaram, a very attentive salesman who has good advice, thanks i made my daughter extremely happy with him.
thanks again

name: La cantina
reviews:
authentic italian wood fired oven pizza with a very nice outdoor seating.
value for money & the chef was very kind to explain the types of sauces & suggest pizzas.

must try the pistachio sauce pizza; wow we loved our outdoor lunch here!! very accommodating to our toddler too. lasagne bolognese was delicious, even our son’s children’s meal was cooked perfectly. get the tiramisu! friendly service, delicious food, wonderful atmosphere, and a great price. 5 stars!; ate there for lunch today. we had the special: lasagna bolongenes with salad and bread. excellent meal good price great service.; checking in from texas!! if i could give additional starts this place would get it! some of my favorite pizza ever! great cocktails and even better pizza!; 5 ⭐️ review across the board!

we are 2 families traveling together with 4 adults and 4 teenagers.  the restaurant was across the street from our airbnb, so we decided to try it out.  we have been in paris for a week and this was our best meal by far!  we were greeted by the friendly staff and promptly seated, then chef lino came out to help us with the menu.  we went with his recommendations and the food was amazing!!!  the sauces were all unique and incredibly delicious (especially the pistachio).  furthermore, the crust was warm, fluffy, and so yummy!  the portions were huge and the prices were very reasonable.  we decided to stay for dessert because we were having such a great time.  once again, chef lino did not disappoint!
