we spent our last night in paris with great company, lots of laughs, amazing food, plus incredible conversation and service.  we highly recommend you try la cantina and leave room for dessert.  oh, and ask the chef to tell you his story about ronaldo! ⚽️

name: KFC Paris Gare du Nord
reviews:
the bucket meal for 2 was worth it and there is an option to choose salad instead of fries. food was good, we enjoyed it. location is very close to gare du nord so it does not have the best atmosphere but the store has a guard that stops non customers from coming in.; everything seems so so to me. the food is not quite good, anyway it's fast food. the wait time is quite long. also the seat is not comfortable. just grab a burger and go.; the self serve system allows users to change the language to english, however this appears to only change the name of the menu items, it doesn't change all text to english making it impossible to read the ingredients as a non-french speaker.

the other main issue is customers are expected to pay 50c to use the toilets even after already having paid for a meal, this isn't appropriate at all to expect someone to pay an additional cost to use the restroom.

the food was okay, however the kfc restaurants across europe serve the same quality and tasting food, vastly different to the taste of kfc in australia, but this seems normal for european kfc restaurants so no issues there.

dining room could have used a clean in outdoor seating area.; thanks for the staff! they were very kind even if i didn't speak french. kinda dirty...but the taste was good!; service hyper rapide ❤️❤️❤️

name: Chez Sophie
reviews:
chez sophie is a cozy gem with a warm, authentic vibe. owners sophie and her husband, who opened the restaurant just four months ago, personally renovated the space with great care, infusing it with charm and warmth. sophie’s friendliness creates an inviting atmosphere, making it the perfect spot to unwind with friends and family. the menu also features excellent vegan options, with the charcuterie board, trio de houmous, caviar d'aubergine, and the burger with raclette cheese being particularly recommended.; new favorite in town!

the food is amazing. i had the trio hummus and the filet de boeuf, which comes with a secret sauce to die for. the portions are very generous, and even the side salad was well-dressed, which is rare in france. the restaurant is cozy, and the staff is incredibly welcoming. they even offered us dessert, which was so good i forgot to take a picture.

definitely a must-try!; we loved this place. great food and drinks, and very good service by sophie! definitely going back when in paris.; great food, lovely ambience and wonderful service. you must try while in paris!! the burger was definitely one of my favorite and the steak dish was delicious!! will be back soon 😊; the 4 of us were visiting paris from mexico city & charlotte, nc and stayed nearby. so happy we discovered & frequented chez sophie twice during our stay. what an awesome energy this new family owned restaurant had, along with amazing service, very special cocktails and truly caring owners and staff!  we will definitely be back!! one of our favorites this trip for sure!!! 🫶

name: Kebap Haus
formatted_address: 109 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: loved this place! portion size is huge. the taste is great. very friendly staff.; kind staff, delicious and special döner.; food was so flavorful. i loved it; great for a quick stop! got the kebab and bowl; got a kebab bowl, really happy with it, was made quickly and tasted great. good ingredients

name: Les Cuivres - Restaurant Paris 11
formatted_address: 68 Av. de la République, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
meal was absolutely amazing and siwar was the best! he welcomed us as americans and made our experience perfect! food was also amazing, i got the tuna and it was the best food i have had in paris so far! definitely recommend coming here and experiencing les cuivres with siwar especially too!!!; how lucky we were to stumble on les cuivres on our first night in paris. mario looked after us and it was both his brilliant and accomodating service, and the delicious food that kept us coming back. as visitors from australia, the experience we had at les cuivres certainly helped us fall in love with paris!; amazing! i highly recommend this place, the dishes are versatile and well made, the vibe is great, and the service is beyond perfect, especially mario who was so kind and generous. thank you so much ❤️; great place. this is a relatively large restaurant.
we approached this place as english speakers though i can read french. siwar  and nicholai were our host and server. both were handsome and nice men though siwar had a very formidable and intense attitude that some could understand as elevating and others as intimidating with his brassy bass note voice like a jazz host on a late night session.
the food was good and desserts too.
skip the steak and get something like the duck instead.
the mi cuit (semi cooked) foie gras was more like cold paté but still rich and decadent.
get the banoffee for dessert. the tiramisu is  light whipped cream rather than rich marscapone.
the drinks were on point especially the amethyst; this place has great reviews and i understand why. they do a good job of making it look really good. the waiters are very nice. the service is not very good but they’re nice. the food looks good. but it doesn’t taste very good. i had lamb burger, which was dripping with oil and a good third of it was un edible fat. half of my fries were cold. the other half was boiling hot. the desserts were nothing to write home about. what sums this place up for me is the bathrooms. on the outside pretty cool but if you look at the inside picture it’s broken. sorry lads, i’m not going back.

name: Berliner Das Original - Kebab
reviews:
good morning
i just ordered it’s just not good 😑
the chicken meat is not cooked. there's practically only salad. the fries are good. i asked for no cooked vegetables, you gave me some. frankly a little disgusted for 14€ i am a person who used to come to taste elsewhere.; we had a wonderful evening! the atmosphere of the restaurant is very warm and welcoming. the staff was extremely attentive and helped us with everything. the dishes were delicious. the service was quick, and our food arrived hot and fresh. we will come back...; i was at the 2euros sandwich event, a first in france. there were people there and despite that, there was a good atmosphere, the servers were pleasant and there was no waiting. i will not hesitate to return and i highly recommend it, especially if you are a student like me you will be entitled to attractive discounts.; never seen so much salt in kebabs. 9.95 thrown in the trash after the second bite. too bad i took the takeaway order otherwise i would have demanded a refund.
put as much salt in the meat separately if it starts to get very tired just to keep the margins, i don't see the point.
franchises this tourist trap; the meat is delicious, the vegetables are fresh, and the sauces are great. the service is friendly and fast. perfect for a quick and tasty meal. i recommend.

name: Brasao Nation- Restaurant poulet braisé Paris 12ème
formatted_address: 252 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
really tasty honey chicken burger, good portion for the price; we took the formula for €22 which we shared between two, really good and plentiful. the service was very fast and friendly, we were very well advised and welcomed

we recommend; so good that i forgot to take a photo of my plate, chicken with an excellent marinade, lots of side dishes to choose from, i finished with a strawberry/banana lassie that the owner made for me on his own because he felt there wasn't enough strawberry.

for your information, i took the double formula with salad on the side, but in fact when you eat there with the other side dishes you will be served a little salad, so the plate will be quite balanced.

enjoy your food.; first time i've come. the chicken is perfect and the side dish is excellent. the plate well presented. i highly recommend; chicken so overcooked that it no longer has any flavor... dry, tasteless rice... and uninteresting sauces. for fans of grilled chicken, go your way.

name: Batistou
reviews: very nice place! we had escargots en persillade and they were cooked deliciously. prices are normal. the pizza was also very tasty! the crème brûlée 11/10!; very nice place! great food and good atmosphere. we had the cheeseburger and the pizza nutella, both very tasty. too bad i do not live in paris, or i would have gone here weekly… i reccomend👍; fun sidewalk café across the street from pere lachaise cemetery.  the cafe is charming and cozy. wait staff was extremely helpful. our meal was excellent.  we enjoyed pain perdue (lost bread = french toast) for dessert.; the food was absolutely amazing! i had the cheese burger with chips and the meat was cooked so well and everything was seasoned perfectly. the real standout was the music which was super fresh, vibrant and engaging. whoever was on the aux was fantastic. my server was rosali and she was so kind and inviting, she really my time at the restaurant enjoyable.; this restaurant is better than i expected as i passed by it! the food is fresh and generously served by the nicest waiters, and they even make specialty pizzas that are to die for!! definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice meal with a view of the père lachaise neighborhood.

name: Berliner Das Original - Kebab
vicinity: Gare du Nord, 25 Rue de Dunkerque, Paris
formatted_address: Gare du Nord, 25 Rue de Dunkerque, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
delivered only once, can't speak for dine in or take out, but the portions were ridiculously small.

a small wrap the size of your phone, filled with air and with barely any meat or flavor, truly awful for a berliner, the bowl of fries with chicken was tasty, but the bowl was empty.

truly disappointing, never delivering again here.; dirty, questionable freshness of products, small portions, no value at all !
avoid at all costs !; food was ok but there was a rat or mouse in the restaurant.; it was clean, decent service and airconditioned. the self service menu was only in french, would be great to have more language options as it is in front of the gare du nord.; please clarify the actual closing hour. its definitely not 01. the kebab it's wonderful tho

name: PRIMAVERA - Pizzeria Paris 10
reviews:
excellent place, great price for very good food. pizza was very good the topping was full and quality. lasagne and tiramisu were excellent. tiramisu is something i don’t even like cause of coffee but this cake had just a hint of it and soo light it was an experience on its own. extra seatings downstairs for bigger groups and the owners are really great. they serve and help customers while providing great italian food. clean and organised, seatings inside and outside and inside downstairs. the toilets would benefit from renovation but other than that i have no complaints.; really good italian restaurant in republique area in 10th district . owners are from sicily and food is cooked fresh. ordered the pasta bolognese and pasta e salmone ...both arrabiatta ...i.e. really really hot stuff! but then i like the hot stuff and so enjoyed it. also ordered a basic magherita pizza which was made just right with the cheese piping on arrival!

they also serve italian beer...moretti for those who would like to keep it all things italian.

i closed my degustation experience with a limoncello, tiramisu, and espresso.

quando in parigi in vicino area republique en distritto dieci fato mangiare de la ristorante primarevera! e buono!

english...when you are in the paris area called republique in 10th district make sure you eat at restaurant primavera! it is good!; friendly, welcoming and attentive staff! pizzas were really good, and bolognese pasta as well! complementary limoncello at the end of our meal.what a nice treat. grazie!; one of the best pizzas i’ve ever had and fantastic service! also great deserts; i recently visited primavera, and it exceeded my expectations! the pizza was perfectly cooked with a delightful blend of flavors, and the coffee was rich and aromatic. the cozy ambiance and the great customer service added to the overall experience. five stars for delicious food and great customer service!! you should give it a try!!!!

name: Le Dellys
formatted_address: 5 Rue des Deux Gares, 75010 Paris, France
reviews: service is good, the lady boss is friendly. however, the cooking is not up to standard. the beef is hard and not fresh. best food is the bread; we ate there yesterday, and it was delicious 😋 we trued couscous and tagines. both were a lot, tasty, and full of flavors.; this place could serve a very late dinner (lamb shank tagline) and it was nice relative to what could be expected at that hour. there is outside seating on the street in the summer, too (the inside is a bit smoky).; came here on a whim and had the best food we had in all of paris! had to come back twice. the food is out of this world good (i recommend the normandy chicken). the service is phenomenal and extremely friendly, so much so that we were greeted with a huge high five and smiles when we came back the second time. also, my mom dropped her fork, and our server literally came out with another one before we even told him!! he said he recognized it was a fork dropping by the sound it made! my new favorite place in france, and my whole family got a photo with our waiter before we left. if you want great food and even better service, go here!; the place is not well maintained but the staff was friendly. seems like a family business. food was average and the music was too loud. it is a good option if you want something quick during rush hours.

name: M.A.D Waffles Chicken Burgers
reviews:
delicious food in good price and amazing, friendly, english speaking staff! also special order request for pregnant ladies taken into account! 🙌; fantastique! food was amazing as well as the price. great and fast services. english speaking. very welcoming. burgers, chicken wings, chicken tenders, and fries ordered, we didn't have room to try the waffles, but they looked very good.
highly recommend.; found this restaurant the day before i leave france!!!! so good and tasty tt never thought waffle would be great as burger buns!!!!! 🍔 gonna miss'em back home tt; very good place for a nice burger or chicken tenders and the waffle and chicken is amazing!!; it was so great there! burger, fries & a drink for a very fair price! it was super taste and the service was sooo friendly:) loved it there

name: CICKEN KITCHEN
formatted_address: 121 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
they spoke english. the chicken was seasoned well. i do wish the chicken and fries were crispier, but the flavor was good.; amazing chicken and rice . stopped by on a pass by . lover of well seasoned food , thought with chicken can’t go wrong . my husband ( born jamaican) was starting to get flu like and wanted (real food) so leaving pharmacies we stopped by and order rice and chicken legs .   1 euro chicken leg and rice 4 euro and i was extremely sad i didn’t order my own! it was good plus the sauce was amazing as well .; great simple place. fresh food, good service, very simple but tasty
i highly recommend; the food was pretty basic but good. the desserts were amazing, the best we had in paris.; very good and quite cheap !

name: Falstaff
formatted_address: 10-12 Pl. de la Bastille, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
it was very good, we had tahirer as a waiter he was very chill and nice to us americans. they were fast and got us everything we needed. would recommend for breakfast lunch or dinner.
very english speakers friendly as well.; it is located by the side of the market, making it an ideal place to sit down to immerse into the fun. pizza and escargots are good.; our waitress was aiida, not only is she pleasant and such a beautiful soul, she is also very well informed about the menu. we had a lovely time and i’m super full from the food, thanks to aiida ♥️; the food was horrificly bad. the carbonara tasted of nothing, beyond bland.
the starters were frozen calamari that had zero taste and clearly frozen mozzarella sticks that were tepid. very unhappy. staff defensive and rude when we tried to express our concern and refused to acknowledge our opinions. i’d avoid at all costs.; visited on saturday evening and ordered starters and main meals.
the starters were frozen mozzarella sticks and calamari. the calamari was undercooked and tasted of cheap frozen batter.
main meals were calzone, which was cold in the middle, and carbonara which lacked any kind of flavour.
carbonara was not eaten as it was bland and tasted horrible, when we advised the waitress her response was dismissive. she was surprised that we would suggest the food wasn’t nice and not enjoyable.
when we asked for the bill and for the carbonara to be taken off as it was terrible and not eaten, they refused to do so.
would never go back and do not recommend.

name: La Nouvelle Etoile
reviews: this place is just great. the staff is very kind and helpful, the food is awesome and the atmosphere is lovely. i had my first escargot here. they have a great children's meal. my children loved it. they have daily or weekly specials. try as much as you feel brave. some of the specials are not for everyone but they are traditional french food with distinct flavors. i enjoyed every moment i spent there. i hope to visit paris and eat here again.; we had a fantastic meal here last night. the grilled vegetable salad was perfectly made, escargot was tasty, the lamb knuckle was tender, and the duck brest very well made with fantastic potatoes au gratin and side salad. the cocktails were great as well. the server (manager?) was super super nice throughout and gave us free cognac at the end because we got confused about the prix fixe menu. i highly recommend this place.; reasonable set. mashed potato and sauce was good. the lamb was tender inside but super hard and chewy in the outer parts.  i also ordered a pina colada but it was not good. so i returned it and asked for a house wine instead. luckily the server was nice and understanding.; what a great find...amazing food choices.. foie gras was awesomeness.. duck very good.. escargot.. nice.. etc. gotta come back; fresh food and good quality. the service is quite perfect.

name: La Chope Saint Fargeau
reviews:
lovely place with very welcoming staff and excellent prices. the kidney was good, the fresh sausage was great. the couscous was probably the biggest meal i've ever had in a parisian restaurant. incredible value. highly recommended!; we went here for dessert with my husband yesterday (on my birthday) and today during our 3-day holiday in france. the waiters were extremely attentive and friendly. even though we don't speak french, they took very good care of us (we used translation :))) both days and we ordered tiramisu and tarts. both were very delicious. very good service. when we come back, we will definitely come here again.; a true neighborhood's gem. this place is the real thing, simple, friendly with a typical feel of the north of paris. i asked for an onion soup which they didn't have... the waiter went straight inside the kitchen and after a quick talk with the chef he suggested a vegetable soup that despite not being in the menu, they would be happy to prepare for me. it was delicious! they also shared wi-fi internet with me and made sure i was satisfied at all times.
merci beaucoup 👏🏼👏🏼; friendly waiter. great brochettes and a pichet of vin rouge. weekday evening but looked busy and lively whenever i went past in the evenings; alert - they scam tourists. we were asked to scan qr code for an english menu, it turns out the content there is completely outdated and wrong. we thought we were ordering by set but was charged a-la-carte, which is two times the price. food is mediocre but the service, horrible.

name: Le Provencal
formatted_address: 94 Rue des Grands Champs, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
le provencal was my first meal that i had in paris and was one to remember! i walked in with a party of four without a reservation and was seated immediately by the very kind owner.

my friends and i quickly realized that we both did not understand each other's languages, which made things quite difficult as the menu was written in cursive french on a chalkboard.

through google translate and pointing, i eventually got my order in and was super impressed! we all went with the fixed appetizer + entree + dessert menu option and i personally went for an eggplant and tomato appetizer, veal as a main course, and brioche as a dessert. all three were delicious and i would definitely come back!; very cute local restaurant:
- very good quality for price
- quirky staff, very attentive
- high level ingredients, easy to digest
- good wine! waiter knows what type you want even with my limited french

tip: google translate picture shows you the menu in your language ;). note that you have a permanent menu with a few options but always a menu of the day (~4 options starter/main/dessert); i just had the best lunch experience here! i didn't have much time and just needed to eat something quick before my lunch break was over.
they have a great lunch menu and i asked the kind waitress to surprise me with one of the menu options since i didn't have the time to translate the menu.
they did not disappoint! i had a very tasty main and dessert. everything was so delicious and the service was excellent!
very happy i came here for food! can only recommend!; compared to orher bistoros in paris, these below are the outstanding things :

-madam is very friendly and attentive.
-the dish is tasty and even if the menu is traditional one thay add something special like the sauce for tarte au chocolat.
-the restaurant is clean, neat, and cute.
-the bread is warm and their petite pains are soft and original.
- the menu is very attractive and the spacial menu even has fois gras and other high end ingredients.

among many bistro in paris i highly recommend this place.; excellent food, friendly service, good prices. truly a hidden gem in paris.

name: L'Echoppe de Paris
reviews:
we were a party of five and stopped in for dinner. we all got various burgers and the food was okay. the burgers are very messy and to me the cheese is a little overwhelming on the amount and the flavor. you can't really taste burger for the cheese and sauce. it also leave the bun soggy to me, but others in our party thought they were good. the price is fair for what you get. the service was good and they speak pretty good english and we could all understand each other. a cute little restaurant.; we stopped by l'echoppe for a bite to eat when we were in paris for the weekend. we arrived when they opened at 7pm, and although quiet at first, it soon got busy with people wanting some of their well renown burgers!

we started off with a charcuterie board which was very tasty, and then moved on to the burgers. i had the ‘bourginon’, which was packed with slow cooked beef and topped with onions and blue cheese. it was absolutely delicious, and came with amazing fries and a little side salad (made me feel a tiny bit less guilty about eating this monster of a burger). my partner had the cheese burger and doubled up, so it was even bigger - he did struggle to finish it!

we finished off with some tasty chocolate mouses. we’d been walking around paris all day so we didn’t mind treating ourselves to these tasty burgers - but you’ll need an appetite as they are huge.

the service was very friendly and although small, it had a nice atmosphere. if you’re looking for an unfussy dinner packed full of flavour - you won’t be disappointed with l'echoppe!; let's start from the food and the service. hamburger are crazy good and service too is good. already been here more than 5 times and it's our favorite place to get an hamburger. if we only want to find a "defect" is the place being a bit rudimentary.; nice little burger shop located near bastille.
quite small and doesn't fit much so be sure to reserve in advance or to arrive early.
they serve mainly burgers with a fish option (salmon) and vegetarian option (but not vegan).
all of the cheese, mayo and ketchup they us is fresh and home made.
we had bourguignon burger (their most popular option) with bleu and cantal which were very good but for another time i would not take this type of meat (slowly cooked) with a burger. fries, homemade salad and the bread are delicious.; average restaurant. good service but tiny place, poor music coming from a tablet, burgers ok but nothing to retain much attention. « once in a lifetime » category.

name: Sunny
reviews:
great location near a beutiful park. good waiter woth fast service. would recommend the club sandwich.

would go again, 4.4/5; i honestly have to say, as an american this has to be one of the better burgers i’ve had in my life and in all places, france. there was just something about this burger that just made me so happy. it was flavorful and juicy, and all the ingredients you could tell were fresh. the drinks on the other hand were subpar. i’ve had better, but the burger shines. staff were also kind of annoyed/rude, but we were the only ones there besides two other tables. you should be lucky we choose to eat in your establishment. we could have took our money elsewhere and not have invested in what was an almost empty restaurant at prime dinner time on a saturday night; this restaurant needs a better chef and more attractive dishes compared to their price. the dishes are not bad but they don't have much "wow" factor! however, sunny is one of the places that i go once a while  especially in good and sunny weather , to order an avocado toast which is served with a tasty sauce, and i would definitely sit on its terrace if i could, because it has a beautiful view of buttes-chaumont forest park, which is one of the most beautiful places in paris.; best breakfast near the most beautiful park; sunny is a pleasant bistro outside the main entrance of parc des buttes-chaumont and great place to rest the feet while enjoying good food and refreshing rose after touring the park. service was very good with attentive, friendly wait staff. the toast covered with smoked salmon, avocado and poached egg was nicely presented with tasty chopped tomato, arugula, and a savory dipping sauce, pink in color but not at all sweet or fruity which paired nicely with the generously poured glass of wine. healthy vegetarian salad featured crisp lettuce, feta cheese and several types of organic vegetables nicely composed. obligatory post-meal espresso exuded strong coffee flavors. mostly local patrons with french spoken at all tables except one. interestingly this establishment features american western cowboy decor in the back of interior space and stairways leading to the restrooms. we enjoyed a nice time here and will return if visiting the park again.

name: LE COSY PICPUS
reviews:
this review is for the restaurant.  the staff were nice but the food was not.  i don't know what they cook the duck in but i left feeling hungrier than when i got there.  i then spent a terrible night feeling sick and not being able to sleep.  sorry, won't be back.; a hidden gem in a very handy part of paris. excellent transport links, nice restaurant downstairs and helpful staff. minimal but trendy and modern rooms with ac too, which was great after a long warm day.; only ate at the restaurant. friendly service, delicious food, excellent cocktails all at affordable prices.; le cosy picpus was a great experience for us during our relatively short stay in paris.

it's very close to the next metro station (; the location, far enough from the city center but accessible to the city by a metro station out front, is a great find for the price point. the staff were accommodating and the rooms were pretty decent. i would recommend this stay to solo or couples. rooms are on the small size and more than two to a room is not advisable.

name: La Tête à Toto
formatted_address: 270 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
great service and quality food! don't miss their dessert. nutella tiramisu was fantastic. definitely recommended!; very good food. merci; everything we had was great, they accommodated 9 of us despite the small space, and service was fantastic.; highly recommend the waiter who served us was so genuinely nice. he helped us with the menu and made us feel comfortable! the food really good!; loved this place!!
the service is non stop!! only they close on sundays, just so you are aware.
the food is really good and service is really caring.
it's really closed to the metro
prices are fair to the quality, loved it

name: Au Troquet de la Place
reviews: very nice bistro with good food, waitress was very helpful and friendly as well 😊; very nice spot. café and croissant for 2 euros. the terrasse is great; lovely sidewalk cafe. excellent selection of beers and cheese & cold cuts.; not bad, it could be better...; nice typical cafe, nice spot

name: Chantefable
reviews:
the food was very good and i can’t wait to go back for other items that were on the menu as we focused on the specials of the day. the desserts were particularly generous and excellent, and the prices are quite reasonable for a truly classic french bistro experience on a the edge of a pleasant little park. the owner is trying to save on waiting staff because they are simply unable to keep up with the customers so the service is very slow even though the wait staff are extremely friendly. it is a beautiful setting both indoors and outdoors, you really can’t go wrong but be prepared to wait!; lovely service and lovely food all in a great atmosphere
will definitely go back; highly recommended, great authentic french cuisine.

this is a historical place with truly french food and not a single «imported» dish - you don’t see burgers or fish-and-chips here. i respect that, as there is a whole proper french menu to try here!

had several great lunches here, taking the fish plats du jour (daily menu).

everything was top-notch, lovely service and atmosphere, and overall great food.

to the owner:
the salade de chèvre chaud was pretty sad - 3 very small pieces of cheese on pieces of toasted bread, with pretty tired greens. i would recommend iterating on this recipe 🙏; service with a smile and incredible food.

this is my second time here within a year, and both times were great.

service is friendly, quick, professional and knowledgeable. the food is gorgeous and very reasonably priced. we ordered the steak and it was delicious. the serving was very big and i was unable to finish it. the starter of snails was amazing and the red wine was perfect.

i would highly recommend this restaurant, and i will definitely come again next time i am back in the area.; thank you for the really great dinner tonight at your restaurant 😍! we had chilled asparagus soup and tatar as well as steak! it was perfectly cooked and i am still amazed about the soup.
we had a stroller along and a baby and felt very welcome. the waitress was very kind and the service was excellent.. i would certainly recommend this restaurant.

name: La Petite Place Paris 12
formatted_address: 202 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
we had a sumptuous meal at this restaurant. everything we ordered was delicious. the restaurant has a great chef and a hospitable server. we will definitely visit again when we go back to paris.; this place is quite nice for a drink and some food! we had a whole dinner and we were impressed. the entrecôte was cooked nicely and the same goes to escargot. the drinks were also pretty yummy. i enjoyed my cosmopolitan which was a little bit too sweetened. as well, the service was decently quick.; great find for dinner on a sunday night. not over crowded and the waiter was very helpful and attentive to service.
food was excellent, great portion sizes.
dessert was as lovely.; service was really good. we had the lunch special (good deal)and the croque madame , all of it was delicious. they also had craft beer in the menu.; great service and friendly staff!  we have visited a few times for drinks and had lunch yesterday. as a tourist with very little french the staff were very helpful.  thank you.  we enjoyed this place and would recommend to others!

name: Chez ma belle mère
reviews:
we came here for dinner again as the food was delicious at a very reasonable price.  good service and friendly staff.
first time:
tuna tartare with baby spinach
grilled beef in japanese style with herbal rice(look like shanghai veggie rice)
steamed fresh sea brass, herbs and pomegranates on top of chopped veggies and peas with olive oil.  all in big portions.
second time:
cheese board with 7 types of cheese
sea bream sashimi with mango and pomegranate
really yummy 😋 😋😋; place is really nice. waiters were sweet and responsive (it was really hot and we asked for ice cubes). food was really good, except brioche perdue, for my taste it wasn’t fresh. but overall it didn’t spoil the impression of lunch.; super cute ambiance. food was fantastic, was there twice while in paris. staff were very friendly and accommodating. especially to a neighboring table who seemed to be annoying 🫠; i found this bistro while exploring the neighborhood where my hotel was located in the 12th arrondissement in paris. i was delightfully surprised by the restaurants decor, atmosphere, delicious food, and friendly wait staff. always ready to try something new, i ordered the blood sausage with mashed potatoes, a mixed legume garnish, and a glass of wine. my blood sausage presentation inspired other customers to order the same. it was a happy marriage of flavors and so appetizing. if you're visiting paris, a metro ride to this restaurant in the 12th won't be a wasted trip. plus, you'll be able to stroll through the nearby park, bois de vincennes, after your meal. highly recommended.; always a favorite place to stop on the neighborhood! very family friendly and welcoming, with excellent regular options as well as staples. we love the beignets patate douce, the poke bowl with salmon and the filet de bar with green veggies. so flavorful!

name: Chez Yach Restaurant
vicinity: 2 Avenue du Docteur Arnold Netter, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Av. du Dr Arnold Netter, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
we spotted this place during a sunday walk on the coulée verte rené-dumont. we stopped and took a table on the sidewalk. the waiter was kind and didn’t mind that we don’t speak french well. the house burger was super good and cooked perfectly. the salmon tartare with avocados and mangos was also excellent. the desserts looked good, even though we didn’t try them.; it's a very nice restaurant. the staff is very pleasant. to try.; i can't put zero so i put 1. restaurant reserved on la fourchette, confirmation email + reservation reminder email the day before and arrivals in front of the restaurant: closed! really not serious at all. the least we can do is prevent; there are 4 of us coming to the restaurant after a long walk in paris this october 27, 2023.
the waiter received us very well, clean classy place :)
very nice touch in the toilets where they were very clean and there were sanitary towels, tampons, and baby towels available to customers. and also coloring for my friend's son :d
we have a drink during happy hour from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. ;) accompanied by a small pot of salted sugar popcorn.

go there with your eyes closed :)
thanks again for the welcome we had a good time; nice place. nice room. we are very well received there and we manage to prepare what suits you. i am vegetarian and i was able to have a beautiful custom-made board. thanks, i'll come back.

name: New Chicken Express Paris 20ème
reviews: food was excellent, welcoming staff.; excellent; welcoming, tasty and all at reasonable price. like it :-); food was very delicious. service also good.; gaddr endless sira( it's means very very tasty  and staff is good; very good

name: Magic - Bar de la place
formatted_address: 2 Pl. de la République, 93100 Montreuil, France
reviews:
great couscous, really fast service and generally a good place; lovely little bar in mentreuil, great selection of beers and super chill relaxed location next to a square with some gardens; small neighborhood bar/restaurant with a pleasant sunny terrace.
simple but good salads. slightly high price (14 euros) given the quantity and fairly basic raw materials. the presentation of the dishes could be improved.
simple but pleasant. friendly service.; a very friendly little family bar on this square. the mind is at peace and the service is friendly. you can eat a cake you brought while drinking your drink without it causing a fuss, my dog ​​always has a bowl of water. in short, that's good. and the couscous, without being the best i have eaten, is very honorable.; a small street corner ideally located, on a pedestrian street, opposite a square, and a very sunny terrace where the tables are discreetly spaced, we appreciate it!!
the couscous looks famous (i only went there for a drink) but, i promise, i will come and taste it, very soon!
plus the boss is nice!

name: C'Sters Café
reviews:
i was there today at 13:20. sat at the table on the right from the entrance. light-haired waiter with stye on the eye at first took a coffee and a dessert for me to eat there and then he took for me salad to take out - in a box inside of a paper bag. then he asked whether i need bread. i said yes. he took bread in a small bread basket, opened my packet and thrown this bread out of the basket inside my bag right above my salad’s pack. 🙈

what’s a foolishness!!! what’s a disrespectful attitude! you’re just hate your job and have no good manners, and you live in the city with great culture, but you are just a jerk!

my respect to the chef, creme brulee was delicious!; well a little bit disappointed. personal was ok,the waiter was speaking english. starters really nice the soup was superhot, perfect! but the main course not really. steak was like a chewing gum and the restaurant dont have a steak knife. fish was a little bit dry. i would expect a little bit more.; thank you for your great service and the complimentary snails that we could try! 👍 my friend and i enjoyed everytime we came, just for coffee, breakfast and also dinner! regards from the two germans 😀; an absolutely lovely café with cracking food. i had the chicken and my wife had the cheeseburger. she had a "florida" and i had a beer. both were delightful. the food was a really high quality we thought and there was plenty of it. they also gave us a basket of bread for 'free' with the two meals.

i have only given it four stars because, in a city like paris with literally a café on every corner, it didn't do anything particularly to stand out. the prices were fairly high too but a lot of them are in paris.; very nice place with friendly staff, good food and nice atmosphere.

name: Good Lunch
reviews:
very good quality and tasty food, above else better than the competition in that intersection (those big franchises), that's something!
friendly and polite personnel.; good food, good people; the worst kebab i ever had in france….; i got what i was looking for - good food for good price, nothing fancy.; corerect

name: Le Bel Air
vicinity: Avenue du Docteur Arnold Netter, Paris
formatted_address: Av. du Dr Arnold Netter, 75012 Paris, France
reviews: nice time, family atmosphere and really good food. meat, fish and salads were fresh and good quality. interesting non typic dish, tartare from avocado 🥑 with shrimps 🦐 (on the photo) was very tasty for me. the last nights deserts (we’ve beeen there twice) cake with liquid chocolate and crème brûlée were fantastic!; this is one of the best places to eat in paris!  it was recommended to us by the concierge at our hotel.  we ate here two nights during our trip and both nights were fantastic.  we had a group of 6 and ordered different things each night and everyone was pleased both nights.  no doubt in my mind, next time we are in paris, we will be enjoying le bel air again!; ate breakfast with the entire traveling party of 8. 2 small children, 2 wheelchairs. a lovely outdoor terrace along a busy street gave exactly the parisian vibes we foreign tourists wanted. ; excellent food, great atmosphere, friendly staff. we had the cesar salad, smoked salmon avocado and lentils with a poached egg. all were excellent. the tiramisu was incredibly good.; excellent food, perfect staff. thank you for nice evenings. bel air is the reason why to be back in paris soon.

name: Le 217 Brasserie Restaurant
reviews:
we were a party of five and stopped in for dinner and were very pleased with our meal! one of our party got the special and one got the burger and the other three ordered off the board. we were all very pleased with the food. i think the waiter was also the owner and he took great care of us. he explained things to us and gave us great options. the food was really good and we loved all of it. would highly recommend and will definitely be back when we visit the next time. the prices are really fair for what you get and the service was good as well. give them a try!; how does it taste! you have to enjoy delicious food here! prices are very democratic!; loved dining at this quintessential french brasserie near the bois de vincennes. we arrived fairly late for dinner, but the owners were graceful and welcoming. the food was delicious, surpassed only by the service and generosity of the owners. we had the pork and the steak, both expertly executed, and paired with a lovely côtes du rhône. we capped off the meal with the best baba au rhum we’ve ever tasted; the perfect pairing of a dessert and a digestive - truly the best! can’t wait to come back.; i never wrote a review before, but this time it was the most horrible experience ever. i went to this place because of the better reviews i read from others.
it seemed all fine in the beginning until i order steak (meat). the meat was watery and does not taste fresh. i could not take any bite at all, i may throw up and worried i may get sick. i tried to explain the food does not taste fresh to the waiter. he went crazy started shouting at me in french. horrible  service with horrible food. the waiter (he seems the owner btw), if you tell him something is wrong in the food, he will turn at you and rudely shout at you, and treat you as if you are a criminal or something.; this restaurant gave me happy memories of my time in paris. the food was delicious and the staff was very friendly. i will visit again.

and i highly recommended this restaurant to the korean community.

name: La Mère Pouchet
reviews:
the first restaurant in paris i ever ate in.  stopped in for lunch after getting in from the airport.  the coffee and food were good.  not sure what to make of the servers, though?; it's a good place to drink:) workers were kind and tapas was good! we drank nice and reasonable priced cocktail because we went there during happy hour (it costs 7euros each); nice drinks and snacks. good service, clean toilet, nice decoration. and superbe location right in front of a cinema. you can have a bite there before the show or after.; food was extremely good, price is average, and the people are nice! and it looks fabulous!; i really like this place ! people are very kind, smiley and welcoming. food and drink are delicious and the prices too !
i recommend you the chicken burger and the mozzarella stick ! and for drink their homemade tea or the chardonnay !

name: Pitot'
reviews:
excellent; excellent !!!; excellent whether in the taste or in the generosity, everything comes together falafel top shawarma follie excellent shredded lamb and of course the fries!
i highly recommend; very good little restaurant
the setting is cute with a little decoration.
the food is quality,
the products are fresh and homemade (fries, etc.)
top mention for the laffa schwarma.
is that what i’m buying 😆; we went to eat with my husband and my children! i had heard about it and seen the advertisements.... but there i was able to judge and see with my own eyes that it was not false advertising!! the quality and quantity is really top notch!!!! unrivaled on the taste of the shwarma which is succulent!!! the portions are really well served! we ate really well!! i recommend everyone to go there!!!
the +++++ is that it has continuous service, which is really what was missing for a falafel or swharma at any time of the day!! that's never been seen before!! and he did it!!! thank you to the team who were very welcoming and friendly!!!

name: Partie de Campagne
reviews:
good food with a definite vineyard feel (grape vines hanging from the ceiling). service was prompt even during a busy dinner rush. food was really good, and reasonably priced. cannot wait to return.; first time in paris
this place is beautiful and the food is amazing. the onion soup is wow to die for, honestly back home soups are served small porsions, here soup is like a main course, i ordered a bit too much food the soup and tiramsu was enough for me. very big porcions. tiramisu also wow super good. the waiters were very nice and professional. if i ever come back to paris this is the place i'd come back to. thank you for the food and servis. love from croatia 🥰; wonderful restaurant with amazing local french dishes & ambience. very friendly and fast service. tasty onion soup, the beef tartare with blue cheese (tartare a l'aveyronnaise) was delightfully creamy and fresh, the strawberry crumble(not on the paper menu) was soft and crumbly. will come back in the near future to try out the many crepes dishes!; place is amazing with superb atmosphere. we just tried the drinks and service was extremely good. the employees at this place were always smiling and cheerful. had great time and will definitely visit again.; we really enjoyed our late breakfast/brunch. here. the weather was great. we did sit outside in the service was amazing. we loved 🥰 louis! he created a great atmosphere for the place!! will definitely come back

name: Vincennes Food
reviews:
good food, great prices, and welcoming friendly service.

they accommodated us tourists by speaking some english with us too!
for halal food, it wasn't the best i ever had, but it tasted as expected and was still tasty!

the place was small but cozy enough to seat two at a table.; one of the best and cheap option to get freshly baked bread and kebab all halal in vincennes. the place is right outside vincennes metro. can’t fault the food and for €5 you get mouth watering kebab. if you pay an extra euro you can drink and chips too!!; good kebab and fries but they have a wide variety of food options. prices are good.; good kebab. good price.; the cozy ambiance and top-notch coffee make café harmony a local favorite. the staff is incredibly friendly, and the pastries are heavenly. a perfect spot to unwind or catch up on work. five stars!

name: La Cantine
reviews: there's nothing i can say to fault my experience ar la cantine. my husband and i had the fillet of beef with potato dauphinois. the meat was soft with a good flavour by itself. it didn't need the bernaise sauce it was served with but the bernaise was delicious so i slathered it on. i suspect the bernaise may be made in house. the potatoes were a nice accompaniment. the restaurant is quite charming in the decor and the waitress was welcoming and very helpful even though we do not speak french. a big plus here was the late opening hours. we arrived around 9:45pm and the kitchen was still open - so good for hungry travellers. highly recommend.; excellent food and an excellent atmosphere. here you feel like you have been invited to a friends house for dinner. a friend who can cook very very well. my steak was perfectly cooked and the potato bake that came with it was deliciously seasoned and cooked. the michael jackson playing is a nice touch. highly recommend and it's open late! nice.; great french food at the right price. i loved the sausage with potato mash - delightfully french!; wonderful, good value, big portions, traditional french food, warm familial atmosphere, very friendly host, fast delivery. very wide range of fruity rums. the succulent medium cooked onglet de boef with beautiful bernaise sauce & dauphine potatoes, topped with a delightfully tangy tart au citron. a palace of quality home cooked gems, highly recommended (but need to speak french or bring a french speaker to interact with owner)!; barely edible. the burger was acceptable, the chicken was not at all something you should serve a paying customer. we went next door for a pizza afterwards. stay away.

name: Monument Café Zoo de Paris
vicinity: Parc zoologique de Paris, Avenue Daumesnil, Paris
formatted_address: Parc zoologique de Paris, Av. Daumesnil, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
even animals in the cafe 🤯
they serve good coffee; delicious food, friendly stuff, family friendly environment.; ras; lovely food; a quick stopover to grab a coffee, the staff is super friendly, the location is quiet and the setting is very pretty.

name: New Chalet du Lac
vicinity: Bois de Vincennes, 2 Avenue Anna Politkovskaïa Orée du, Paris
formatted_address: Bois de Vincennes, 2 Av. Anna Politkovskaïa Orée du, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
brunch review.

first impression at the door was horrible, security guy seemingly forgot that it’s not a nightclub. once in you need to pay in advance, then if you want something extra (second glass of juice etc) you need to pay again on the spot. that seems redundant.

staff is nice and welcoming, food was great and lots of different foods were available. strong point: entertainment for children is available and included and they’re supervised.

the building is aging and many things are neglected it seems (toilet seat broken, doors to electrical safety equipment left open, spiderwebs everywhere and some chairs visibly not in good condition - also some „black mystery dust“ on the napkins). parking is difficult on the weekends due to the closure of the park, toilets are not stroller - wheelchair accessible.

for the price it must be better i think, the food can only make up for so much and then some.; beautiful park area. the building is a little need of some upkeep. i went to attend a new years eve event. the meal was just ok, and the service quite slow, even by relaxed paris standards. i noted that a large group seated almost 30 minutes after me were served their full course first. they may have been thinly staffed that night, but it seemed off.; a very scenic spot to host any event. the fees for depositing is slightly elevated but overall the service is on par.; very lame club! we were here at silvester party. first of all the bouncers were so unprofessional and unfriendly that i would gove them a minus -10.
they pushed my friend as if he were a garbage bag while checking him. even though we had biught tickets in advance for about 50€/person - they wanted to froce us to buy bottles so they can let us in. after i complained and showed them their website, another bouncer came and told them that i am right and the were wrong.
anyways we got inside and damn what we see? no age class, from teenager to old people of +60 are there.
the party was so lame! so please , if you want to have fun, go somewhere else. and hit the like if you had same bad feeling here.; the whole family was disappointed. average food, high price (but all brunch prices in paris are extremely high). hygiene is not high on their list. we went in order for the children to have fun in the kids corner but it was of no interest to them. no planned activities other than face painting. however the staff is very friendly and helpful!

name: La Grosse Mignonne
reviews: nice bar, had a bloody mary, not all bars in paris make this cocktail so i was happy 😊; ok this place is pretty good, but so expensive! i mean, i only get it once in a while since i feel kind of ridiculous paying like 3 euros for a tiny scoop. but it does encourage you to savor every single lick. most people wait in line for the original boutique, but there's actually many places in paris (with several just around the same corner) with much less of a queue. save your time and go to these places that clearly state that they serve "berthillon".; nice quiet spot for an evening drink in summer.; part of the small bar with an friendly « ambiance » within montreuil.; does not pay its musicians - enough said.

name: Félix Café
reviews:
nice terrace. 👍
good food for the price. 😋
fast service ✅
weird staff 🤔; it was an amazing cozy place for a nice breakfast.
great service and atmosphere.
i recommend the “le francais” petit-dejeuner.
the coffee was spectacular as well!

sitting on a table by the window was a great highlight!; i have the most expensive item on the menu, the steak. it was pleasant. the chips were very hot and nice and salty. the salad was good. i had a dessert which was very pleasant as well. i was unlucky enough to have a not very friendly waiter for most of the experience, which put a dampener on it. some of the other waiters however, made up for it.; we were used to have dinner in that venue since a year and by the past the meals were delicious and affordable.
unfortunately the quality decreased since a month and the price raised. my last meal was really not good at all. still a good place for a drink but to avoid now for dinner.; excellent croque monsieur made with truffle bechamel sauce. french fries were perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and the salad was perfect, too. the staff were friendly, kind, and attentive. when they didn't have the wine i requested, the gentleman recommended an excellent replacement. i highly recommend this place. i eat out in paris a lot and i can tell you that food and service here are exceptional!

name: Les officiers
reviews: cute and open fairly early on weekdays compared to other nearby cafes. excellent combos for breakfast. coffee is fresh and pastries were fabulous. would recommend and will return!; ate here with my girlfriend on the first day of our holiday in paris. very busy restaurant at 6pm, both inside and outside. good food and kindness of the staff who served us, typical of the french people.; stopped cause i liked the dish ( the linguini seemed a dream and i was really hungry) that was being served to a lady on the terrace but really loved the tuna steak with the vegetables and the pay d'oc rose. the other dish was also good but more the risotto than the shrimps. overall i was glad i stopped and had a warm meal after a whole day walking through paris.; the poke bowl was okay. the fish and chips was okay, but the piece had small bones in it, which is not the case usually. the food was a bit bland. also, the waitress asked us a few times if we were done, but there was no need for it. it's not like the place was full, and we were still eating.; i am a nonspeaking french person from the usa. i can point to a picture and the food came. it was good. bathroom downstairs. hard for an old woman. great people. they do not speak english. but go and eat anyway. edited because of owner: i did not mean for anyone to look badly at a restaurant because at the time no one spoke english. that was just to say to americans like myself don't miss out on good food because we do not speak english. yes, they will help you with yes and nos if they understand you. but don't expect them to have a conversation in english when we americans are in their country and we do not speak the language. some people get scared or worried about trying to interact with people and if you do that in this case you will miss out on having a nice meal. the only thing "i" did not like was the bathroom. i do have issues with the steps. oh, and the water bottle that is made of glass and the water do you see how clear that is?? i drank all of it. food good, customer bad for not speaking the language in the country she is visiting.

name: La Canopée de Saint-Mandé
vicinity: 82 Avenue du Général de Gaulle, Saint-Mandé
formatted_address: 82 Av. du Général de Gaulle, 94160 Saint-Mandé, France
reviews:
the rooftop deck was wonderful. sandwiches and coffee or flavored sparkling water selection. great banana bread and helpful staff; i love this coffee shop. it’s those kind of places that any neighborhood needs, there is a feeling of community here. i love that here welcomes all type of people. the cakes are super tasty.
i hope places like this one will open more and more. 💓💓; the best café in the town. chocolate cake is top. the staff or owner was very welcoming. love the ambiance.; we were looking for a cosy place to enjoy a family snack time and were delighted with the choice of products. the atmosphere was really nice; lovely cafe, very good good and fair prices. the service is so nice. very much recommend.

name: Happy Bakery & Coffee
reviews: went twice this week and a nice expresso and cappuccino. the people behind the counter are very friendly and the place was beautifully decorated for halloween. will definitely come back if i have time before leaving paris!; very fresh croissants and delicious coffee. friendly staff. clean seating area.; the place is comfortable and the coffee good, but the owner is not very friendly.; frankly i don't understand all the comments.  the managers have always been super warm and cheerful with us. certainly the pastries seem industrial but this is not the first time that a place has served this type of cake. personally i like it once in a while and so does my son.; the boss is already unpleasant with adults but also with children. the server too. they make money off the backs of children and treat them with no consideration. when we arrive to place an order, it has already happened a few times that they continue to chat among themselves and make us wait for 5 minutes even though there are no other customers. seems like they are hanging around and chatting instead of providing good service to customers. in addition, the products are extremely expensive. they are good if you are not looking for quality. in addition, their packaging says “an inexhaustible source of happiness”. inexhaustible is not really the appropriate adjective when it comes to food... in short, bad experience. other bakeries not far away are much better.

name: Caffé Shop
reviews:
tasty dishes, an amazing and kind service.
the pesto pasta is out of this world. i highly recommend getting that specific sause, it doesn't really matter which type of pasta you choose..; the best italian place in town. extra delicious food and perfect service. always with a smile; friendly stuff good pizza. not to expensive. it's a small place not very good if you are with small kids since it's next to the street. didn't try the pasta myself but other people seemed satisfied.; this place is adorable! tasty food and coffee, friendly service, good prices. i recommend!; absolutely delicious gluten free pizza, i have gone there now multiple times and they are consistently great! please keep offering authentic, tasty and affordable gluten free pizza to the people of paris 🙂
je le recommande très fortement !

name: Un Instant de Rêve
vicinity: Route de Ceinture du Lac Daumesnil, Paris
formatted_address: Rte de Ceinture du Lac Daumesnil, 75012 Paris, France
reviews: we had a reine pizza, it was good! 14 euros, we split in 4 and had 2 slices each. we then shared a crêpe with miel et citron. the dude can be a bit intimidating but he's actually really warm and nice (if you're also warm and nice that is!).; much needed lovely cafe with excellent menu, good prices and nice service. just what we needed after a long walk; awful place, avoid. undercooked pizza, bad atmosphere.; this lawyer is very kind and knowledgeable and helped my daughter a lot through a rough phase. he helped her get the compensation she deserved. he was great to work with.; a regular place nothing fancy, has everything you need especially in a hot summer day.

name: Danieli Caffè
reviews: decent restaurant with tasty food and friendly service 👌🏾 got my new spot in vincennes; we have terrible french and the waiter was lovely and accommodating, and although it was quiet there was a great atmosphere. big pizzas with lots of toppings and big drinks too (the pina colada mocktail was lush); i think i came on a bad day, it came highly recommended from colleagues. waiter got the order wrong and pretty much insulted us (it wasn't that complicated, only 5 of us) and the two pasta dishes weren't quite right and we didn't finish them. i don't like giving bad reviews and this restaurant came highly recommended from colleagues so let's assume it was just a bad day in the office.; great pizza and pasta, perfect for business lunch. very nice staff, not fancy though, and always packed.; never disappointed here. very good dishes & friendly atmosphere

name: Le BoVincennes - Steakhouse Vincennes
vicinity: 6 bis Avenue du Général de Gaulle, Vincennes
formatted_address: 6 bis Av. du Général de Gaulle, 94300 Vincennes, France
reviews:
went to this restaurant suggested by my friends and family.
the place is known for their excellent meat, so i have shared a 1kg beef rib to share.
the meat was cooked as requested and was very tender.
the platter looks big but it was quite easy to finish as the slice was not tok thick.
the service is good although it took a little time to serve our order but once appetize came in then the rest just follow nicely.
the waiting was still acceptable and we were not in a rush.
employee were very polite and professional.
i recommend this place if you are nearby, try any of their meat and their gratins.
be aware that parking lot is quite difficult in this area, you may come in advance to look for a place to park first.
see you again next time.; excellent experience dining at le bovincennes.
the servers all spoke english and were lovely to interact with. they explained the dishes in detailed and made the entire experience even better.

quick shout out to the little biscuits and mushroom spread that was served at the start of the meal. it was simple and yet so appetising!

for the entree, i ordered poêlée de pétoncles et crème de poireaux. the scallops were fresh and the cream sauce was just too thick enough but not overwhelming.

the highlight of the meal of course was what the restaurant is known for. their steaks. it was great and not so at the same time. a tale of 2 halves.
i ordered medium rare and one half of the steak was cooked to perfection but the other half was disappointingly raw. i sent it back to be re-cooked but that deteriorated the meat significantly already.

i did not order any dessert as i was already stuffed. i would definitely come back to try the desserts.

overall it was still a very enjoyable meal, i would definitely return again just to give it another chance.; the meat was ordered to be medium rare but was served a well done tomahawk? the fries was boring and with no flavour so was the sauce. wouldn’t recommend this over any other place in paris.; we went 8 guys into getting a nice evening at this restaurant, the waiter wasn’t patient at all, our food came fast, but the food wasn’t good, we all asked for medium rare, and all the beefs were either completely raw or completely cooked through. i wouldn’t go here unless you’re ready to spend 200+ euro for a beef; fancy atmosphere. the server was very polite. the food was actually not that good, unfortunately.

name: BSR RESTAURANT GROUPE CLUB ANNIVERSAIRE
vicinity: 7 ter Rue du Colonel Oudot, Paris
formatted_address: 7 ter Rue du Colonel Oudot, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
top; top!!!; barth is a person who listens to his customers. it only took one call to understand what gift i needed. he was so responsive! the restaurant proposal was perfect in terms of value for money and the atmosphere was pleasant for children as well. thank you so much.
i highly recommend.; i used barth's services to organize a birthday party in paris. everything was perfect: the room, the organization, the food, and the entertainment by the dj. we had a great evening. i recommend, you can go there with your eyes closed.; i recommend!!! this group 🙌🏼
part of a not simple organization to achieve an unforgettable evening.
for the occasion of a birthday 🎂.
25 guests, location, atmosphere, very good setting. everyone was delighted.
thank you mr b 🙏🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼.
can’t wait for the next one 🥳

name: CARACAL - Restaurant - Saint Mandé
reviews: my family and i really enjoyed our visit. the service was very polite and helpful, the decor is very tasteful and the food is amazing. we would thoroughly recommend this venue if you are in the area and looking for a lovely meal.; my favorite meal while in paris. the steak was delicious, a huge portion (easily could do 3 people), and the price for the quality seemed fair. service was also good. i love caracal cats, so i couldn’t resist visiting here. i will definitely return when i am in the area!; good atmosphere, super friendly waiters with good advice always accompanied by a smile.  the food was very delicious and at a reasonable price, the best were the desserts, the 'delice de passion' was truly wonderful.; brioche with burrata n pesto is a must try! we were surprised with the flavors 😍cocktails were good too and for a decent price. thai tartare and wok with legumes were a great choice too very light and delicious; if you are in paris this is absolutely the best happy hour and tapas.the  margarita is to die for. the staff and  the owner were  amazing. it was so good we decided to come back for dinner and it did not disappoint.

name: Au Tramway
reviews:
quality restaurent near my house. professional and friendly service, always smiles face to everyone like an old friend. i would like have a dish with fish, the chef made a  pan-fried salmon with potato. perfect!; great location, amazing staff, tasty food.; ok for coffee but our onion soup was not the real taste of soupe à l'oignon, the baguette in the soup was burnes.
the flan (came with cafe goumand) was also quit uncommon in taste.

water bottle very dirty, see picture.; second time we eat there and we’re very pleased with the restaurant. the food is very good and the staff is friendly. we took a tartare, a berger salad and some other starter and dishes it was very good.; we ate here twice on our trip to paris as where we were staying was close by and we were tired one evening!

the service was good and food of excellent value as well. it's known for its beef and i enjoyed my flank steak. of particular happiness to me was my cappuccino here, couldn't get them at many places!

name: Le Globe
reviews:
avoid. i ordered a coffee and a croissant for breakfast. it wasn’t easy because it seemed i was invisible to the waitress even if she was in front of me and the bar was empty. she comes to the table and brings my order, i asked to pay by card, and her reaction was shocking. she basically said: we don’t take cards below 10€, she took my order from the table and left inside without saying anything. i understand they have the right to do so, but there is no need to humiliate clients that are willing to pay for what they ordered.; we had an amazing experience here. randomly picked the place and turned out to be great. server was amazing and recommended a great cocktail which now becomes my new favorite. thank you so much for your hospitality while we were there briefly.; this café has nothing special to it, but is quite overpriced (expect to pay your small diet coke around 5€). no flexibility from the staff: they announce that do not accept credit cards under 10€, and wouldn’t accept it for 9,60€ either!

in short, not a good experience. there are a lot of far better cafes around!; i am not a fan of writing bad comments, but it was a third time for me that visited le globe, because its well situated and today i promised never enter again. evening of wednesday, no one came to take the order, ignoring, maximum unfriendly attitude from both of waiters. and to add, there were no clear information that payment by card is accepted from 10 euros. i would not recommend this place to anyone from my circle.; by far the best dining experience since we've been here. lauren showed patience with our group. despite the language barrier, lauren took the time to explain the menu to our group multiple times. i personally would have passed our group to another server. lauren stuck with us and made our dining experience very pleasant. i would definitely recommend le globe   if you're ever in paris. by the way food was pretty good also with nice size portions. merci beaucoup lauren!

name: Café Millésimes
reviews: a nice bar here. the servers are all very nice, and the drinks were good. there was some live music on saturday evening which made for a nice atmosphere, and we kept getting free snacks to eat with our beers! really nice service, i recommend if you fancy a chilled and relaxed bar.; we had a big reservation for a birthday and the owner managed everything perfectly even with a special decoration. the food was very tasty, the restaurant owner also recommended us the saumon gravlax which was so nice. i had the bobun salad that was unique and my friends had delicious pizzas. we would gladly come back for another occasion.; after a long time, i feel welcome in paris again.  in most parisian restaurants, native french people show very contemptuously that if you speak english, they have a big problem with it and the service is very lax and bad.  i felt very comfortable in this restaurant and the grilled camembert with mushroom and truffle sauce was also famous.  thank you!; excellent food! what a pleasant and unexpected stop. the tartare de boeuf was wonderful.; good service, a bit expensive (although we had some discount with an app), tasty food. the main dish (shrimp skeweres with creamy rice) was not big, but we had a sympathetic amuse bouche without asking, so one thing balanced another.

name: En Faim!
reviews:
my happy place; wonderful place and the service is great 👍
we were well welcomed and well served ♥️; cool; the worst lebanese restaurant i have ever tried. the meat was bland, tough and cold. the rice served was raw and bitter. it's really disgusting and not recommended. you are wasting your money not to eat anything. a lebanese restaurant that does not know how to prepare shawarma or falafel does not deserve this title, or even that of caterer.; creamy food, a new image of lebanon bringing with it a wind of novelty, the marriage of lebanese and french culture and quite simply exquisite, as a gourmet i highly recommend it.

name: O Atlantico
reviews:
a family run portuguese style restaurant. drink options are good, with unique rum offerings like don papa, and diplomatico. some nice regional wine offerings as well.

food is exceptional, we had 2 entrees, and 2 main plates, and everything was great. the chorizo entree was excellent. the main courses selected were both beef, with the beef on a hot stone plate being unique. the option to cook it to the level you want was nice, as well as the included dips being the perfect pairing of flavor.

the family members running the place are really warm and friendly, and the entire experience is like eating at a close knit family place versus a commercial restaurant. overall a superb dining experience.; nice and friendly place where we had coffee.; nice place with nice services dishes are delicious but not many options fron portuguese cuisine. if you are in the region you can definetively eat there.; nice little portuguese restaurant in pairs! the food was authentic and excellent, staff was friendly and offered good service. price was very reasonable.; very good meat! big portion .. the octopus is worthed !

name: Big Fernand
reviews: this is a fantastic burger chain. far better than the top 2 burger chains from across the pond. i had the big fernand burger. it was cooked how i asked for it to be, one really tasty burger, lovely cheese, bacon and fried onions. one of the best i have had anywhere. the fries were crispy and very tasty. my partner ha the veal burger, which she thoroughly enjoyed. will go back definitely. the staff had a good sense of humour, which to some may come across as ignorance, but not to us.; omg! best spins on hamburgers i've ever had! recommend the le jura with raclette frites. very good.  and right by the metro.; we tried the checken burger it was great and staff were very helpful. recommended; the hamburger here was good. the salad a bit basic, probably should have gone with the fries but was trying to be healthy. it’s more or less what you’d expect from a hamburger place that is a little better mcdonald’s.; best lamb burger of my life. in america i can’t find these. you can tell it’s real ingredients even the ketchup looks home made 🥹🥹🥹🙌🏾🙌🏾🙌🏾

name: Restaurant Sofiane
reviews: very homey atmosphere, odd patrons who seem to come every day, so completely untrendy it's refreshing. the food is unextraordinary but ok for the price.; says it opens at 6, but it's not even open by 7. the doors are locked, chairs are in the table, and they have furniture blocking the door.; awesome couscous and nice host. great experience!; yummy; i really like coming to this restaurant where the welcome is always welcoming. i eat the same thing almost all the time: merguez couscous: quick and pleasant service, it's not very expensive (it costs around 13 euros) and very good! i highly recommend.

name: Phou Khet
vicinity: 88 Avenue du Général Michel Bizot, Paris
formatted_address: 88 Av. du Général Michel Bizot, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
on 22 july, 2024 sometime after 11pm, my wife brought me here for dinner as it was still open. the lady proprietor who speaks cantonese greeted us warmly. we chose to sit by the window.
the vietnamese stuff we ordered were delicious.
it was a very enjoyable dinner in paris before our flight back to hong kong hours later.; nice little restaurant with very nice staff, probably the whole family. we asked for special wishes and got it with a smile. chicken instead of shrimps in the spring (summer) roll. also the red curry to be a bit more spicy. it was perfect! an interesting version with not so much coconut milk and thus not so creamy but still very delicious. also black mushrooms instead of broccoli or white mushrooms. we can totally recommend this restaurant! see you next time; a nice place, i love going there with my boyfriend.

a restaurant with good service, incredible food, i love the soups that contain shrimp, they are all amazing.

tasty starters, the restaurant is close to home and i'm addicted.; excellent service! loved the variety of the menu and the food. had a soup with shrimp noodles and white rice. the jasmine tea was very good as well. a must for different types of asian cuisine dishes.; lots of food, great service, had the pad thai

name: L’Auberge Aveyronnaise
reviews:
had a very affordable meal with great quality and service! highly recommend the foie gras with chestnut soup - good price with great taste. serving size were generous as well. aligot was delicious! they had an english menu, but the daily specials were not updated. even though there was a slight language barrier with the servers, they were patient and served with a smile. the place was bustling with locals and tourists but service was fast!; charming restaurant with a classic atmosphere. we came here to try the aligot and it was very cheesy and filling, worth trying out! it does get quite heavy and is best when hot. the highlight of the meal was the chocolate mousse, it had a deep chocolate flavour and was very smooth.

service was quite good, they seated us despite having no reservation, and many staff spoke english. our server provided an english menu for us. it does get busy quickly later in the night.; the mille-feuille was extraordinary!
the food was good and so fresh. the only problem was the lack of taste. for instance for the fish there was a sauce containig vinegar on it but it really didn’t taste anything rather than the fish itself.
the service was quite slow and after 10-15 min of waiting for the cheque, we had to go to the reception for the payement and it took another 5 min to respond.; the perfect way to end our stay in paris. this place is a must visit with the best duck liver hazelnut soup i have ever tasted!!; most of the food is medium rare. some of the staff is really nice and i've had good experiences except on one occasion when we had difficulty asking for anything recently. it felt rushed even though there were not a lot of people. didn't even bother asking if we needed anything else.

name: Arkose Montreuil
reviews:
nice place. used to be my favorite climbing gym. route setting and general ambience are very good. a shame they never fixed the sauna. 😞; i went there after my visit to arkose nation... and compare to nation montreuil is... not this same :-) climbing and routesetting is also on very high level. i enjoyed almost every single problem! everything is different and contains various holds and vision.

also... gym itself is quite a big. separate place for kids and also a room for fitness. at the bottom you can find restaurant with coffee, but (again) compared to nations it's not this same.

for the climbing place is great, but for social and great vibe i recommend nation!

anyway i had a great time over there! thanks arkose for another great climbing gym!; very good happy hour price.
extra cheap price if you‘re there for the first time.; hot spot for climbers. nice concept for those who like to do sport and for those who prefer to grab a local beer. getting pretty crowded around 5pm.; went for a family climb, gets quite busy towards mid day and the classes also take up a lot of space but nice challenging problems

name: La Cantine Arkose Nation
formatted_address: 35 Rue des Grands Champs, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
🍽️ la cantine arkose nation was a delightful surprise! 🎉 the reception was friendly, youthful, and efficient – just like home. 🏠

the simplicity of the entrecote dish was its charm – delicious and effective. 👌 don't hesitate to step in for a pleasant lunch experience. 🥩
