located within the climbing club, the ambiance is relaxed and inviting. 🧗‍♂️ i highly recommend it, even if you're not into climbing! 🌟; too bad the nice place but the cuisine not at all up to what one would expect from a king of paella, ultra limited menu, casual service but a friendlier waiter, we ask for wine in a pitcher we bring you a pitcher and they charge you for 4 glasses at 4.50, we've never seen that harsh wine, not organic or good, no choice, we wait a little, good quality music too loud, the dishes arrive without salt, pepper or bread, they have absolutely no mustard! the meat is average and cold, nothing more, so-called blue cheese sauce is in fact cold pepper too, a small pile of leftover fries full of oil and 2 salad leaves 25 euros! our friend opts for the plate of pasta of the day for nothing on the plate with organic fried egg and 14 + 2 euros! everything falls between the big holes in the table fries, cutlery, bread and bill it's unbearable we have to try to catch a waiter to get some bread almost at the end of the meal it is very very good but we couldn't find out its composition nor its provenance and cut to pieces! a cramble which is not a totally tasteless one has been sent back. there you go bobo and company it was nicer at the very beginning, the overpriced canteen, it's not even simple cuisine and too sparse! we will go back there again!; i went there just to have a drink. the welcome there was very friendly and friendly. i was looking for a more or less quiet terrace and this was the case. i will go back.; very friendly, modern, simple and bright place. very pleasant staff, fast service. the dishes are original, well prepared and above all delicious. great vegetarian options. fair prices (€20.5 per starter, main course, dessert with the daily menu) i recommend!; sporty atmosphere inside, relaxation outside. very friendly welcome and good meals all with a reasonable price

name: Les Tonneaux
reviews:
great pub with great food with excellent beer. nice patio and typical pub atmosphere in the inside. owner is amazing with his hospitality and desire to please his patrons. we were close by for a 10 day visit and we went back at least 4 times after our first visit. highly recommended if you like the pub atmosphere.; worst service ever, mixing up meals between tables.
waitress not nice at all
"hello we'd like to order"
"did you choose ?"
"well we didn't get any menus"
"if you didn't chose you're wasting my time".
1hr to be served, worst experience in parisian restaurant so far.; friendly staff. great food; it was my second time to go again to les tonneaux and i can confirm that the food is delicious. i really reccomend them to everyone. thank you very much.; great bar to chill in the summer (terrace is large)
they are nice and casual which is rare in paris area! really enjoyable

name: The bistro of Avron
reviews: here for a holiday and glad to have known of this restaurant by chance. excellent service and great food. waiter was patient to explain the menu of the day in english and made good recommendations. friendly and attentive too! the pork dish we had seem to be a popular dish with the local and tasted great! thank you :); great little place, food was amazing. service was superb. the service staff were very patient with us aussies explained the menu in english and helped us have a really enjoyable lunch. would recommend for anyone.; went here when we first got to paris. the food is great and the waiter was awesome. we will definitely go back again.; very good service. the dishes and the drinks have been fine. we chose fish, some french sausages and the burger. the price is ok. i would totally recommend the restaurant because they do not offer just the basic and the same dishes like others.; great food, wine, & prices. a favorite in our neighborhood.

name: Hippopotamus Steakhouse
reviews:
this is a good chain restaurant. i had the chicken and the potatoes and it was cooked well. my husband had the horse meat with egg and mashed potatoes. we also had carpacio and chicken wings. the food was well cooked. the people are friendly and nice. i would come again.; this is a very nice spot away from the touristy places with good food interesting drinks and good prices. i loved my steak au poivre dish, but i removed one star as my friend ordered a medium well sirloin stake, and it was all raw and red inside. we told the server, but they didn't do anything about it. overall, i recommend it, but just be careful checking with how coocked you want your meat to be.; cozy restaurant with amazing food and service.

the atmosphere is terrific, we ordered l'entrecote xl and some appetizers. the waitress was extremely nice and didn't mind to take the order and communicate in english.

everything tasted amazing, the meat was perfect.

i'd go back to try the other dishes.; great place to relax and take a break from busy france! very yummy food for reasonable prices and a very friendly service with attention to detail, especially from diane, who is a star! we felt very welcome and cared for. will go again for sure and can whole-heartedly recommend!; my boyfriend and i had to kill some time around bercy to wait for our bus and we were starving. luckily we stumbled across this lovely restaurant, which provided us with fast service and amazing food; we had the ribs and chicken chimichurri; both dishes were mouthwatering 👌🏻 the lovely lady who served us was so nice and attentive we had to ask for her name afterwards! thank you diana we had an awesome time!

name: La Table des Troys
reviews:
together with my husband we had a very delicious dinner at la table des troys. meat was delicious - my husband confirmed. personally i took a salad nicoise  - very tasty as well however this restaurant is made for meat lovers. there is a huge selection of meals. we could also taste the oysters as an entry - excellent portion. we finished with very creamy and crunchy creme brûlée ❤️❤️; i don't know how a restaurant experience could possibly get better than this. i got an amazing view of the fort neuf du vincennes with a delicious meal and some delightful white wine. my phone was dead but i wanted to take pictures, so they charged it for me! my server anthony was so charistmatic, and helped me through the menu as i don't speak french! he recommended a dish, the name of which i am unfortunately unable to recall, however it tasted incredible. if you're in the area, please do not miss this absolute gem, you'd be doing yourself such a disservice.; i think we didn't order well but the food was okay. i would try it again based on other diners' plates that we saw. french onion soup was pretty good, a bit salty. we ordered fondue which comes w 300g of beef each that you cook in a broth and oil bath on a small fire at your table. piping hot!! not kid-safe but quite entertaining. this came w 5 sauce accompaniments and some fresh french fries. the raw beef should have been seasoned w salt and pepper. this made a huge difference once i did this. some pickle, relish or suggested dish should have been offered in my opinion.; huge portions of tasty food, friendly service (even if you don’t speak french), plus views of chateau vincennes… what more could you ask for!

just 30 seconds from chateau de vincennes metro station, the only negative is that it is quite cramped in the street-side seating area, but that’s easily still the best place to sit if you enjoy watching the world go by. a great place to dine for sure!; the best restaurant in paris and we have been to many over the years. a hidden gem, excellent french food , good service and a nice atmosphere! highly recommend! been going since 2011.

name: Le Bosquet
formatted_address: Rte de la Pyramide, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
my favorite place to have lunch in parc floral. a good place for lunch or just coffee and desserts/ice creams (available to take away too). perfect for kids. just a few steps from the slides and playground area.; hidden gem! very cute vibe. tasty chicken with lemon & olives for 14€. kids menu 12€.; ideal place to go with your family!  we had a perfect day exploring the park, seeing the canadian geese, and ending with a delicious healthy lunch at le bosquet.  my two year old was in heaven at this place, an i felt very comfortable as well enjoying a glass of wine! they also offer healthy snacks you can take with you, which was very helpful for our car ride to our hotel.  i look forward to the next time i get to come here!; what an amazingly relaxed place to stop for some lunch. good selection of freshly prepared food amazing salad. hard working staff.; avoid the chicken - super dry!
cheeseburger was not fully cooked, needed to reheat patty.

name: Arkose Nation
vicinity: 35 Rue des Grands Champs Entresol, Paris
formatted_address: 35 Rue des Grands Champs Entresol, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
this is the best climbing gym i've ever been to!

first of all... people over there are amazing! they are happy, smiling and super friendly!

routestting is great. even if you can't hold small crimps, but you are strong you can do many different boulders with the same colour but in various styles! super cool moves and great vision!

for the climbing, there are two parts, one with a more vertical style and another one with a bit more overhanging. also special room for kids and a place where you can warm up and work on your weakness (strength :-))!

apart from that, you can find over there shop with clothes, shoes and climbing gear. restaurant (!) with fresh, healthy and super cool-looking food. tasty coffee with buns!

this is totally worth the money! i would wish myself a gym like that in my hometown!

from my trip to paris, i will definitely remember the most this place and these people. thank you arkose and thank you, isabelle! you are the best :-) it was great to climb meet you and climb in such a nice place!; excellent bouldering venue, quite some option for a venue located inside paris. can be crowded but you’ll always be able to make loads of sessions. people are super friendly and help you out during ascent! they have several options for membership or tickets. also available on site, lockers, showers, toilets. but also food. and drinks and a small shop. highly recommended climbing room.; so crazy i didn’t try this place years ago. great atmosphere and bigger than you’d expect so close to place de la nation. good selection of food and drinks and open all day too.; i went here while visiting paris. i really liked the problems there, and liked that they had two sections, one more technical (slab walls) and the other more steep. grades were marked only by colors, like other climbing gyms in paris. it was surprisingly popular for a weekday morning - not packed but enough climbers! homemade bread was delicious, but i wish there was more bakery options :); great, great fun! staff is so friendly. routes are changed periodically offering some challenges for all levels. it can get crowded afterwork. good for social, learning beta from other people and open until late. it also features a cafe that is mostly welcome after a session. two rooms with a top-up island in one of them --where most of the overhangs are found.

name: House of Chicken
reviews:
if you are looking for a slightly different cuisine and bored of all the kebabs you must try this place which has a different idea of food. there are roasted chickens with boiled rice and an amazing sauce and salad. they have burgers as well and some other dishes.

we tried poulet vert which was a nice chicken dish with a green sauce made of garlic and persil. the sauce was mindblowing i loved it! the quality of food was fulfilling you! 😋
we also tried classic burger which was a beef burger with a nice burger sauce! i loved loved it!

next we had some desserts which weren't the best but not so bad.
we tried cafe gourmand and tiramisu!
tiramisu was nit fantastic like how i expected but it was good!

the ambiance was so so!
i will definitely come back for the food!

total spend 50 euros which was super great! main course and dessert and the quantity was beautiful!
must try!; a great place for some really good chicken! the crisp on the chicken is quite amazing and the sauce vert is very tasty. the service is great and the menu has to offer a lot of things on it!; the best experience for halal food in paris bercy,it is nearest to ibis hotel paris bercy i enjoyed their tender soft chiken with rice and it was enough for 1 person
it was open at 11.30 pm; the best food and service we have had in paris until now.  highly recommended for people who like taste especially of masala/ spices like asians (pakistani, indian, bengali, etc). mojito is out of this world! all dishes are the best. service is excellent...highly personalized, courteous and friendly. english language is also understood and used here. great place for family and friends outings. easy access through public transport.; had an mesmerising end of our tiring day with wonderful service and delicious food. we ordered two chicken dishes, were served with big portion of rice a side salad with two different homemade sauces. to end our meal we topped up with a desert, tiramasu!!!! which was great as well.
overall 10/10. 100 percent recommend.

name: Brasserie Les Cascades
reviews:
this brasserie which combines an elegant bar and a french restaurant on the porte dorèe square is absolutely recommended for those living in the area or tourists staying in this part of paris.

the restaurant is luminous, elegant and welcoming, the choice of dishes is wide and the plates of the day are always varied and cover a wide range of preferences. the staff with us was extraordinary kindness; they always patiently satisfied our requests for changes to the dish, as real restaurateurs should always do.

the staff speak english, so tourists who don't know french will have no problems.

the ratio quality/price is very good, with an expense of around €20, you can receive an excellent plate of meat with side dishes that will not leave you hungry.

the desserts are also very attractive and tasty.

highly recommended, drop by and tell me if i'm not right!; nice restaurant, good atmosphere, seems quite fancy. staff were very attentive and friendly. our meals were delicious, we even tried escargot. food was so nice we have booked again for the next day; stunning art deco interior. great food. would eat here again.; the gentleman who was serving was not welcoming at all.
even we left for paying the check i was just getting out my ticket restaurant card.
right away the gentleman said * we don't accept ticket restaurant and waved the machine card away*

the things served were not well served even.

the whole experience was not cool.

i would not recommend; we were amazingly served by camille today, she was lovely, very attentitive, adviced us on both food and drinks. chicken tikka served with black rice and salad was delicious so was the burger. nice selection of beer in normal size of half a littre! best restaurant we visited in paris so far!

name: Les Artistes
reviews: amazingggg fresh food! filet of dourade was exceptional! and the burgers looked incredible and loads of impressive veggie options! highly recommend!; a great neighborhood location, excellent service and friendly staff. absolutely awesome entrecôte and delicious burger with chef made tomato sauce, mustard and mayonnaise. to end, the caramel pain perdu was happiness itself!; restaurant located on vincennes, near the metro station.  it has different dishes and desserts. we tried burger with potatoes and coke... in general good attention, however prices a little elevated; we got help to be seated as a big company which was nice but then service was slow. long wait to get the food, water, cutlery and one dish was forgotten which meant one of us had to wait an extra 10 minutes. had to ask multiple times for water. food okay but not perfect. chocolate cake as dry as a brickwall but good ice cream! for a lower price it would be okay but now it felt bit overpriced.; simply recommended!

name: Uncle Bumpy - Ivry sur Seine
reviews:
just the greatest little chicken and waffles place. the staff were super helpful and friendly. the food was delicious, really first class, the chicken was crispy outside and still moist inside. worth the upgrade to sweet potato fries, went so well with the salty and slightly spicy mango curry sauce on the burger.; just had lunch at uncle bumpy - the welcome was warm and friendly, menu has many options and the place is alive. the food itself is delicious and fresh! the waffles, crispy chicken, sides and the deserts! thank you to huss and lamira for the welcome, and for taking care of us (huss got us sweet waffles and cookies!) - will surely come back everytime we crave crispy waffles!; the best of the best in paris
i came specially from amsterdam city hearing about this gorgeous place serving waffle and fried chickens, i wait like 40 minutes to get my order because it’s damn busy, but it’s worth it to wait for this great waffle chicken.
good job uncle bumpy🤤👏😍
if u visiting paris highly recommended 🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤; love this place , normally i order every weekend as their burger is big and quite filling . would highly recommend!! one of my favourite places if i am craving for a fried chicken burger !; where to start ?

accustomed to the parisian soul food concept, we wanted to try this restaurant closer to home.

it was honestly a 10/10.
my husband and i had an uncle bumpy and a creamshaw waffle sandwich with sweet potatoe fries and sweet coleslaw.
everything was extremely good, fresh & tasty!

not to mention the incredible and warm welcome that houss and lamira have shown. they were lovely from start to finish of our lunch and even offered us delicious desserts.

i recommend 100% and we will definitely come back!

name: L´Angélique Café
reviews:
the most expensive cappuccino ever :)) 6€. but we liked the atmosphere, cleanness of the place & the bathroom, politeness & warmness of the staff, knowing english,
i recommend here. i wish i had time to go there for lunch.; delicious food and great service at an incredible venue; nice ambience and nice place for breakfast. they have the classic ‘globetrotter’ option which has a juice, hot drink, scrambled eggs and bread.
the staff is also very nice.; an excellent place to go.
bread, jelly, and café for a fair price.
the staff doesn't speak english, however, the service is good and they will try to serve you in the best way possible.; we had an amazing experience at l’ angelique! we were treated like personal guests, the atmosphere was vibrant yet relaxing and the food was exquisite. we can’t wait to return to dine again with our new friend!

name: L'étoile de Charonne
reviews: we went there for a short time only, to eat some desert and drink coffee. i've chosen a camembert and it was delicious. also very good coffee. the  chocolate muss and cheese cake were too sweet as reported by my friends. the service was quite good despite the girl couldn't understand english:-); great place for drinks! i love the mojitos here, there us also a good beer selection. the food is also good, quick and very friendly service. i recommend the "salad de gésiers".  burgers are great too. both inside and the terrace are nice.; the most perfect place to have brunch in paris. the people here are very kind. not a very touristic place tough. local food and french sweets. everything freshly cooked. for a culinary experience and also fun, you have to try this place. oh, and most important you can eat and drink as much as you can!; my girlfriend and i had a terrible experience here. we were not very hungry in the morning so we asked for a single breakfast to share. the owner was confused and insisted that we get two meals, but we made it abundantly clear that we only wanted one. my girlfriend asked about the croissants, and the owner told us they didn't have chocolate croissants. he insisted she get the pain au chocolat instead but several times she said no. throughout breakfast the owner continued to bring us out two of everything, despite our protests. he was incredibly rude when we told him we didn't order two meals, and when we went to pay he tried to charge us for the additional meals that we never ordered.  i would suggest staying away from this cafe.; excellent foie gras, the veal was the most delicious i've had in years! minus one star because we were seated near the rubbish bins, which my date had been too polite to mention.

name: Le 3Bis
vicinity: 41 Rue des Pirogues de Bercy, Bercy Village - Paris
formatted_address: 41 Rue des Pirogues de Bercy, 75012 Bercy Village - Paris, France
reviews:
we found this place while looking for a brunch spot in paris that actually takes reservations
le 3bis collaborates with lazy brunch to offer a super cute and super fun brunch every saturday and sunday
the plan is 35 eur for 1 hot drink, 1 cold drink, 1 salty dish and 1 sweet dish.
you also get to play any game from a super large selection of board games (we played uno and #destroyedfriendships hahah).
the staff was extremely nice and helpful
very recommended for a lazy sunday out of the house; wonderful original place with great staff. we spend 2 hours eating and playing console games. prices are reasonable and i'll happily return another weekend.; amazing place to be with your friends , great food,  great drinks and nice rooms with good decoration; we had a great time here singing karaoke in the salon cuba! we've never ever seen anything like it and vincent was gracious in showing us all of the rooms. we were extremely impressed with the concept and thought behind the intricacies of each room. the food and drinks were also outstanding. definitely recommend a visit!; if you're looking for a perfect place for an anniversary, for brunch and play, for a not so calmed play night in paris, ... look no more. this is the place. perfect experience from reservation through the night to the very last minute ☺️ the team is incredible, really, they are fun, sympa, profesional, the private rooms are great and super super clean, the food is amazing and cocktails might be one of the best in town. they were flexible with everything and just cared about us having a good time 🍻🎂🎈 so we did have the best time ever in a bar. it was indeed like having a party at my place and without the cleaning and cooking part ! you rock, if you have more business in france, let me know, with your notion of quality and service, i'll try any concept you launch!
thanks again for a wonderful night, the whole team was perfect! really, that's amazing!
best 🍰 : cheerscake
best cocktail 🍸: xstar
best room: sitcom
best activity: karaoke 🎤
cheers 🥂 hasta la próxima ! muchas gracias !

name: J’Peux Pas J’ai Poney
reviews:
cannot recommend this place enough! every time i’m in paris i have to come here. the food is great, they have so many games, and the staff and people who hang out there are so nice. almost all of the staff speaks english yet the place is still very authentically french. it’s not “a tourist bar” but it’s perfect and welcoming for any and all tourists. if you are in paris you have to go here!!!; nice new and fresh bar ! it just started but looks like it has potential !
you can play to differents video games.
if you come on tuesday, you might enjoy the blind test.
they also have a nice choice of board game. do not hesitate to ask the staff about it.; very good experience, the places lives up to the reviews online. it's a bit small but very cozy to play, i recommend to go play when you are between friends or on a date. the drinks on the menu are fun and quite tasty 😋; great atmosphere, funny and creative,  staff is very friendly and food is good. i'll definitely come back often. i recommend it.; our go to bar after dance classes. i swear we're gonna find that hidden flag one day ! 😁

a large collection of drinks with interesting names and experience, and many alcohol free options.

it also seems like batman has a hideout in there...

name: La Plume de Phénix
reviews:
great place! loved the aesthetic, lots of fun decorations and theming (menus, painting, props). great selection of board games to just pick off the wall, and seriously nice staff willing to both provide drinks/food, as well as assist with board games. food was varied, with some very nice options, and fun, game-themed cocktails. great spot for the nerds!; great pub with great atmosphere games and people; lovely food, ambiance and wide selection of boardgames!? 10/10; we really had an incredible evening! the “tavern” and friendly atmosphere is really successful, we really felt comfortable and we had a lot of fun! the drinks and food are really good quality too, really nothing to complain about!; a top games bar, the food is incredible..!! and the tables are far enough apart so as not to interfere with each other during the games. all this in a decor that gives a nice atmosphere. friendly staff.
drinking from large mugs was the argument that made me come but i admit that it's weird to put your lips on wood

name: La Pelouse de Reuilly
reviews:
now, for the star(s) of the show: the omakase! a majority of their fish is sourced from tsukiji, which is amazing! if it's not from tsukiji, then it's locally sourced. as i mentioned earlier, patrick explained every piece that he made for us and the servers who brought other courses explained those as well.; correct; unwelcoming staff, impossible to pay for two drinks (draft beer + fruit juice) in cash. required us to go to the atm. outside, the tables and table legs are rusty even emmaüs would not take them. a garbage container is placed at the entrance to the bar/restaurant and close to the tables on the terrace. the drink break in the sun is quickly over.; upon our arrival, very well received, menu and menu accessible to all budgets.
the plates are copious, beautiful presentations that make you want to taste.
i recommend this establishment which is managed by a young couple; oi boa tarde conheci um rapaz que se chama bruno e ele e portugues, preciso entrar em contato com ele, foi cliente ai no ano de 2006 , tinha uma namorada que se chamava glauciane, ele ate teve um caso com uma garçonete brasileira que vcs tinham contratado que se chamava lauren, ele pode ser pai de uma menina de 16 que procura o pai biológico, se alguém aqui puder ajudar o conhecer o bruno meu whatzapp + 5562 993165559

name: Birdie's Cafe
reviews:
place is fun, quickly served !
tried the « tagliatelle au saumon » and it was good !
overpriced, 15.9€ for launch, in a modest place.
espresso coffee was perfect ! 👍🏻
staff are are nice, thats good one too; very tasty filet de bar and cassolette dishes. nice place with an amazing decoration; place is fun, beer is correct, service is nice. don't expect over quality here (alcohol or food) but it does the job for a fun night with friends. be aware though that the music is quite loud for discussions and that tuesday is blind test day.; nice place to have food and drinks after work. prices are ok; nice place! very good food! very friendly personal! the best pub in paris!

name: Le Bouillon Belge
reviews:
tuesdays they have menu degustation for 5 euro with unlimited rice !!!! not only the food is delicious also you are in a super sympa ambiance. need i say they have free karoeke downstairs ?
a must in the quartier.; great pub with nice variety and quality of beers and snacks. the bartenders are awesome! must visit in the area to feel some cool local vibe.; best belgium beers selection in the area. very nice welsh and french fries. and now they accept card payment!!!! yeah!!!!; from a filipino living in france : good, unpretentious filipino food hidden away in a paris side street - worth the trip.; my family and i went for dinner. though we got there late they let us make an order. delicious food, very nice service and the beers were dope. highly recommend.

name: Le Triangle
reviews:
le triangle is epic! the route setting is top-notch, offering a mix of fun, creative and challenging climbs that keep things exciting. the facilities are very clean and i enjoyed a pleasant sauna after my session. but what really makes this place shine is the super friendly staff and community of local climbers. they offered beta tips, encouragement, and lots of high-fives! whether you're a newbie or a seasoned climber, this spot is a total winner. i would fly across the globe to climb here again soon.; great little climbing wall, seems very well setup for children downstairs. much better than my local wall in england which has nothing for children. upstairs adult area is relatively small, but had a good selection of routes for all abilities. perhaps it'd be nice to see some more routes crammed in to offer more choice. i think you might get a bit bored if this was your local wall and went regularly, but it was great when visiting with an hour to spare.

all round great experience in central paris. pricing was $15 for a session. again not bad for a capital city. had a lovely beer after our climb aswell. would definitely go again!; not big but neat! fun routes. right outside the subway, easy to reach. helpful staff. free water bar. has separate kids zone. excellent place to hang out with friends.; at the end of our trip to paris we were looking for a place to have some drinks in the bercy area, when we stumbled upon this gym. they were very welcoming even though most of the group was just entering for some drinks. because our bus would leave shortly we got a little discount, so me and my friend could squeeze in a quick session. overall very nice gym with some challenging boulders, thanks for the hospitality!; what a place ! great to relax, challenge yourself and have a drink in the evening. great staff who speak english and treated us well. everyone in here is very friendly and helpful and are happy to help improve your climbing! love it

name: O.T. Bubble
reviews: this place has fair prices and has really nice staff (also a really cute dog) and i recommend it to any boba fans!; great banh mi and bubble tea and incredibly friendly and helpful staff. the seating and music and atmosphere is all really nice. the only thing i could ask for is if they would consider adding a taro bubble tea just because its my personal favorite, but honestly its a lovely place and one of the best spots in this part of town.; we went there because of the good reviews... sadly the bubble tea was way to sweet and tasted very artificial... i couldn't drink it. i am more used to places where you can make your own combination but there was no overview of the options. my friend had a banh mi which he liked. the place itself is cute. but since the main focus is the tea which was not tastly, i wouldn't go again.; i love the decor and interior of this cafe. big variety of bubble tea. they offer board games too.; its an amazing place with a free arcade ;)! i highly reccomend it for any bubble tea lovers

name: La Tête à l'Envers Pub Vincennes
reviews: the service attitude of a short-haired female waitress at this restaurant was extremely cold. from ordering to payment, it felt like i owed her 5 million. she was very impatient with us. as a tourist, i haven't encountered such unpleasant service throughout paris. the rest of the staff were nice and full of smiles. my advice to this girl: if you don't love your job, maybe it's time to find a new one.; great sports bar in paris, would highly recommend everyone visiting. brilliant food and drinks and the staff are lovely.; a very nice place to grab a beer, get a talk and chill, i find it very comfortable, service is top and the ambience is like a nice pub; loud music which at first you don't mind, then it become irritating. we ordered the 'green burgers' without cheese. the vege burger was dry and so hard the knife could not enter it.  i couldn't but the bread, something was seriously wrong. i pointed it out to waiter, he apologised and bought more of the overlooked chips. my mint tea tea bag was good, otherwise we wasted  €24 on inedible meals. there are lots of drinks and cocktails available. better suited to those wanting alcohol than food.; this was my worst food experience dining in paris but then i did go to a sports bar instead of a bistro. the service was really bad and unattentive. they were too busy on their phones or watching the soccer. i waited for ages to be served and sat with empty plates for over 20 minutes despite the restaurante being empty. the fish i chose was so undercooked it could not even be described  as being luke-warm. needless to say i did not order dessert or coffee as i flat out refused to spend any more money in this establishment.

name: Du Pareil Au Même
reviews:
just passby and saw they were on sale luckily my son needs some clothing and to my surprise  they were 50%off so i try to grab 2 long sleeves was shock because it was cheaper than i was expected, i regret i did not get a lot but of course i can always come back. the textile of the clothes were soft, not itchy and i love it. they looks good too to my son; nothing to say about the staff who are welcoming, attentive, the store is well stocked, everything is perfect regarding logistics.
but still doing ceiling sanding when we welcome customers and at this time accompanied by young children do you find that normal?
first of all, the fitting room is located in a corner where you have to close a hidden door where there is a stock of clothes; closing a canvas curtain in a cramped space is really not great.
it is to the management that i am addressing; very nice store with a very good choice of clothes. the value for money is very good.
the welcome and advice were there! thanks; very tidy and pleasant store. selecting. beautiful clothes at a good quality/price ratio. kind and friendly seller.; very nice shop. i love the clothes, very colorful!
prices are correct. the staff is very nice.
i recommend !

name: Les doigts dans le nez
formatted_address: 2 Rue du Général Leclerc, 94220 Charenton-le-Pont, France
reviews:
if you are still looking for a toy store, don't hesitate any longer.
“fingers in the nose” is ali baba’s cave for little ones, little ones but also older ones. quality items and a super cool owner to welcome you. so go for it!!!; extensive selection and great advice. best children's store ever!; children's paradise!
all the kids in the neighborhood come there to play as well as to find toys and equipment.
julien is adorable and gives really good advice.
we love !; we have always found what we are looking for in this store. julien, the owner, knows the products and always gives good advice. we come back with pleasure (and the children too). thanks to him!; the best store in the neighborhood. great choice for children.
i'm a fan. very pleasant welcome and good advice.
i highly recommend

name: Kangaroo Kids - Agency De Garde D'enfants
formatted_address: 1 Ter Rue du Midi, 94300 Vincennes, France
reviews:
🙊we paid 119 euros in application fees for having unqualified profiles.; as a first year student at but gaco, i was able to complete an internship within the agency in order to discover the field of hr and commerce.
i learned a lot and developed new skills in these areas, knowing that the agency manager and her team were always attentive and showed kindness in order to guide me in my tasks.
it’s a motivating agency that makes you want to get involved.
thank you to the team for their welcome.; i am delighted with the quality of the exchanges and the services offered.
the director of the charlotte agency is particularly attentive to our expectations and responsive.
thanks to lens from the team for their work.
i highly recommend; unserious agency. makes appointments and doesn't keep them. really not okay when traveling with a baby! i also received an unprofessional welcome, not very reassuring when it comes to childcare!; customers for two years now, we are still satisfied with the agency which knows how to be responsive and efficient even in an emergency!
the team is warm and attentive, and our son loves his nanny!

name: A la Ribambelle
reviews:
we had a great time for our kids birthday party. camille was our host and she was really great.; ok; we ordered a princess-themed service for our 4-year-old daughter with camille.
very punctual (arriving early), very personable and proactive, she managed to captivate the children during the 2.5 hours. makeup, games, puppet shows, balloon sculptures, they were treated to everything. we warmly recommend this facilitator who takes her role very seriously.; camille was gentle, kind and professional to everyone.
the 3 hours on the princess theme went by very quickly and the children had a blast.
she has a talent for interpretation and energizing the children, plus she remembered the guests’ first names quite quickly and showed remarkable open-mindedness!
i recommend to everyone 100%; clown themed birthday party for my 6 year old daughter. our clown camillette and zuma (in training) arrived 20 minutes before, fortunately they finished the installation just before the arrival of the first guests.
my youngest, 3 years old, even had incredible makeup with glitter, she was in heaven. everyone loved the games, shows and activities offered (i would point out that all the activities on the website were done - they managed the time impeccably). a big congratulations to the two facilitators because it was not an easy thing to manage 11 totally wild children! it was great, thank you

name: Ava & Mr Joe
formatted_address: 36 Bis Rue de Montreuil, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
its ok; good choice; very pleasant shop with good choices and above all a very kind owner who loves her job!; a unique place where i found my happiness... return to childhood, good quality toys...
very warm welcome, smile, finally everything to go for a little tour...; more than a neighborhood store always open, a real concept store with real, always sound advice and a lot of sympathy and gentleness from the manager.
100% recommended, we can find an idea or gift whatever the budget.

name: Bambini'troc
formatted_address: 26 Av. du Bel air, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
rather pricey for second hand clothes. 10 euros for a romper, 15 for trousers. but nice collection.; very nice little neighborhood shop.

the prices are a little high for second hand, but we want to support local businesses and passionate managers like florence!

she is very meticulous in her selection, and she is someone you can trust.; incredible store to find quality clothes or toys, at reasonable prices. each item has been meticulously chosen by the owner, and there is a good flow, so we find new items each time we visit.; bambini'troc is a great place to find very beautiful clothes for children, unique and inexpensive compared to their purchase price new. all the pieces we purchased have been very well maintained and last a long time, which allows us to have original clothes which then continue their life with our friends' children. i highly recommend this place, where we always received a very warm welcome and where we regularly found gems.; the products offered are in excellent condition (clothing and toys)
very pleasant contact with the manager

name: Mercredi sur la Lune
reviews:
this store is a gem! the selection of toy book sets is neat and current. i always find great books, puzzles etc for my children. thank you laura, we can see that you are passionate!; superb toys, well sourced! the owner always offers good advice depending on the budget or when you are hesitant depending on the age of the child or baby.

the ideal store to spoil the young and old around you!; i came to buy a gift for the birth of a baby. the saleswoman was very friendly, she helped me very well in choosing my purchase. the toys and children's objects sold are in very good taste. we find things here that we don't see elsewhere. the gift (two little dolls bearing the image of the group daft punk!) was a hit. great address!; very beautiful products selected with great care! something to spoil young and old alike. for my part, i fell in love with the magnificent christmas decorations and plant candles.
and what's more, the owner is super friendly and available :)
i highly recommend; boutique love! a very warm welcome and a very nice selection of objects for little ones (and older ones!). we feel that everything has been chosen with great care and attention.

name: Pauline Lotte - Puéricultrice - Consultante parentalité - Spécialiste sommeil bebe et enfants - Premiers secours enfants
reviews:
since i became mom, i often attend different workshops related to baby and kids. among the trainers that i met, pauline is just exceptional: clear, professional, theoretical and practical at the same time. i think this rare capacity is linked with her diverse working experiences. i recommend her without any hesitation.; pauline is a gentle and fully available professional. she was able to understand my difficulties as a mother and my anxieties and she accompanied me with great gentleness and kindness without ever any judgment. my son's sleep was a real and obsessive topic. with pauline's support, i was able to find serenity. many thanks 🙏; we were desperate when we met pauline. our 5 month old boy's nights were complicated and we needed quick results. pauline, very gentle and caring, gave us valuable advice which changed things from the first night. we are better identifying the signs of fatigue in our son, and his nights, as well as ours, have quickly improved :) the first aid coaching session with her was also great!
thank you for everything pauline! we will not hesitate to call on your advice again.; we had the chance to work with pauline to improve our baby's sleep and the consultation was brilliant. from the start, pauline was incredibly caring and attentive to our concerns and specific needs.

she took the time to understand our unique situation and came up with a personalized plan to help us establish better sleep habits for our child. her advice was clear, practical and always gentle and respectful of our baby's natural rhythm. she not only gave us instructions, but explained the why behind each recommendation, which gave us a better understanding.; pauline is a gentle, attentive and attentive professional. during the sleep support and first aid training, she showed a lot of kindness, professionalism and was always available for all my questions. i highly recommend.

name: Trompette, maison de qualité
formatted_address: 52 Rue Raymond du Temple, 94300 Vincennes, France
reviews:
wonderful sales lady. went to buy a gift for a friend’s daughter. i couldn’t make a choice easily since they had so many beautiful things with nice quality. definitely recommend this beautiful shop!; best shop, best toys both fun and educational.; i discovered this store at the beginning of june, my sons were very happy, i have a magnetic game that i was looking for. i had a warm welcome and i was given very good advice. very beautiful, quality items for children. i recommend ! 👍🏻; we stopped by to buy a trixie backpack for our son, and the welcome was worthy of an olympic podium.

the person was super nice, like we've been training partners forever.

the store is small, but it's like a real stadium filled with trixie products and other cool brands. not very big in size, but in terms of choice and quality, it's high level.

i recommend without hesitation with a gold medal!; excellent toy store, each object is selected with great care by the manager who pays great attention to the quality of the products, both educationally and in terms of composition.
your money is always well spent here, the advice is excellent!

name: Yuna VERNUSSE - Psychologue enfants
reviews:
i highly recommend this practitioner who has been following my children for a few months now who sees her once a week, she was able to restore her self-confidence

listening and caring towards the child without making any judgment on the child's story or what may have brought him back to meet her.; i highly recommend this practitioner. she was able to reassure & gently accompany our daughter.; trusted psychologist, discussions are friendly and take place in a reassuring setting.
i recommend with your eyes closed.; i came with my little lancelot for a neuropsychology assessment.

very professional and caring!!!; psychologist who takes care of my little brother with a big heart. only positive things since

name: Jardin d'Enfants de l'Opac - Schubert
reviews:
my first boy who is 8 years old spent his entire kindergarten in this garden. very satisfied with the team, her brother this year is in the small section.
it’s the best maternal structure that exists! kindergartens are a great transition between nursery and school. on a human scale, the child is well supervised and the teaching is of very good quality.
i strongly advise parents to go there with their eyes closed! especially those who hesitate between public and private...here is an alternative for you.; good morning
i registered my son for september 2019 my appointment with the director and went very well nothing to say very very nice pleasant
the visit to the establishment, super school, very clean, well equipped, pleasant staff.;

name: Square enfant du Jardin Reuilly
reviews:
secure park because a large part of it is enclosed, there are many games for all ages, the floor covering is suitable to prevent children from getting hurt. presence of benches for parents. alright.; new installations, renovated floors. great park!
missing more than a few benches for parents around

name: Mon Plus Beau Jour Shop Gifts Custom Baby À Paris
vicinity: 35 Avenue du Docteur Arnold Netter, Paris
formatted_address: 35 Av. du Dr Arnold Netter, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
customization possible within 48 hours. the saleswoman is welcoming. if you are looking for a store to offer a personalized baby gift, you have come to the right place. several choices possible. the embroidery or engraving is very well done and the products are of good quality. i have purchased personalized gifts for births on 3 occasions; the parents were delighted and still talk to me about them.; it's a store that has a lot of choice, the staff is very friendly and always knows how to guide us because we just want to buy everything in this store.
according to the owner, the store has already existed for 22 years, congratulations to you!; we ordered the first pajamas from this store that our daughter will wear when she is born, and we are really happy with the result. this personalization idea is great, she will have her own unique little pajamas. plus shipping is fast, in short we highly recommend.; always a very warm welcome and good advice. perfect for personalized gifts, parents are always delighted (bath capes, cushions, toiletry bags) and the embroidery is quality. in short, i recommend! :); valuable advice, and perfect references! we would buy everything! a child’s dream bedroom, with great taste
a precious place opposite trousseau where we are delighted to be able to spoil a newborn or a little one in hospital!!!

name: Eveil Parents Enfants
reviews: poorly managed nursery, which impacts teams and leads to numerous closures; 👍; ;

name: Lieblings Éco-Concept Store Pour Bébé
reviews:
wonderful little store with so many beautiful, natural baby products that have been hard to find in other stores. the owner is very friendly and helpful.; superb store of ecological products for babies and children! the products are beautiful, healthy, and very well sourced, and astrid's advice is always very relevant. i made my baby registry there, and am delighted to go there every time loved ones give us gifts.
very beautiful brands that are sometimes difficult to find in paris, such as engel clothing, fabelab cuddly toys, holztiger wooden figurines, grimms educational games, and nina and miles musical instruments for little ones.; charming shop with a warm welcome and always good advice! the whole thing is super pretty and eco-responsible!  many thanks again for all your advice and super satisfied with our purchases! see you soon !!
i recommend +++; an absolutely adorable and accommodating team, good advice! the best store in paris to find gifts for little ones: toys, childcare equipment, comforters, clothes... all eco-designed in materials that respect the baby's health and the environment!; this store is a veritable ali baba's cave of good taste. dedicated to the world of children, the selection offered there is delicate and refined. the choice of colors is absolutely splendid, which is rare and precious in the garish and basic world of children's items.
the welcome is warm and devoted. in short, an excellent address that i recommend as a decorator.

name: Apate Association, Ecole Gulliver
vicinity: 61 Rue des Pirogues de Bercy, Paris
formatted_address: 61 Rue des Pirogues de Bercy, 75012 Paris, France
reviews: a great structure for children, which also welcomes children with disabilities and which allows for a truly wonderful mix and teaches children about mutual aid, respect for others and respect for difference. the supervising team is top notch.; very good school. the director gada, an exceptional person. for everything she does, ... she is very professional and very wise!  a very good person.; frankly i don't think there's anything better than this team, they are great, deserve more than 5⭐️, thank you for everything.; passionate director and team! very interesting educational project and very coherent activities implemented; warm and caring welcome. exceptional place.

name: Restaurant Le Prince
reviews:
it's an algerian / morrocoan food restaurant. they served us cous cous, along with veges in shorba and the kebabs and bbq meat with salads.
they had fresh things available and we chose the kebabs and meat pieces of our liking. what was unique here was the variety of lamb organs (kidneys, heart etc) though we didn't order them.
cooking standard was good. cous cous was served in huge quantity and none of us could finish it. kebabs and grilled meat were excellent.
the ambiance and decor is reasonable, nothing spectacular but it was clean. rates are very reasonable and it will cost you € 7 to 11 per person.  street parking is available.; great food! a bit chaotic but service is great. lots of locals. you should really try it!; very tasty meals absolutely lovely,  i highly recommend this place.; excellent services
very good algerian foods; toooooopppp❤❤

name: Mama Jackson Soul Food Paris
reviews: everything was perfect! i was blown away by the quality, quantity and level of seasoning. my friends and i had reservations for 7, we were the first to arrive for their dinner service. the mac and cheese was ‘sold out’ which we weren’t surprised based on the previous pictures of it (being sarcastic). the drinks were top notch, we all enjoyed our drinks. i ordered the rum punch which was surprisingly small but it was very strong which i liked, so the size is definitely appropriate for the strength. the chicken was hot fresh and crunchy but very juicy inside, i ordered a side of beans with rice and french fries. i’m not a rice person but this rice was extremely flavorful and delicious as was the french fries. zero complaints, my total (i had two rum punches) came out to just 32 euro- an excellent value. the staff was very friendly and the service was fast. the place filled up quick. my friends also ordered dessert the sweet potato pie- they liked that as well but it is served hot. overall, i highly recommend. the atmosphere is top notch, great music as well (even without the dj at that time) we were singing, dancing in our seats and reminiscing as we heard some of her classic hip hop music that we grew up on.; second visit one year apart and can’t believe it’s even better than last year. for a man that knows his chicken i can wholeheartedly say this is the best fried chicken i’ve eaten anywhere, worldwide. this year while visiting kentucky, usa i researched best fried chicken in kentucky and even that couldn’t come close. look forward to coming back on my next trip to paris to return 😊; neighborhood soul food restaurant with tasty fried chicken (little salty), bbq beans and rice, and great sweet potatoes. large portions that definitely can be shared. friendly staff with prompt service. interesting and engaging decor.; we came in when no one was waiting. we were told maybe 10 to 15 mins because a table was about to leave, also, they only take cash .then my party of 3 could be seated.   there were 2 tables for 2 open. then a party of 4 came in and was told the wait time . then, 3 mins later, a party of 2 came in and was seated immediately.   then another party of 2 came in. then the table of 3 got up and the table was cleaned . and my party was seated. then, the other party of 2 was seated beside my table. so the waitress came over and took the table of 2 that sat after us order before  us even though  we were seated before them. so out of those 3 tables my party which was here 1st but seated second order was taken last. our order 3 mama jackson plates 2 tenders and one 2pc legs . (they only have dark meat, )so we got tenders, red beans, and rice coleslaw and fried sweet potatoes.  and the starter of the mac cheese. 30 mins later, both parties of 2 tables got their food (chicken and waffles), and my party is still waiting .  after another 10 mins, a gentleman  comes over and says a few more minutes.  then another 7 minutes pass, so  i ask can  we get our starter of the mac and cheese since we are starving . then he goes to the cooks( this is an open concept so you can see them making your food) he asks for the starter, and the cook looks confused. they didn't have  a starter ready. then the gentleman  comes over with some fries on the house, he says, since our starter or food wasn't ready . we have reached  the 1 hour mark of sitting at the table.  with only drinks and the 2 tables beside use are almost finished eating their meals.. the tenders were hot, and the batter fell off the tenders . the red beans were spicy, but luke warm, same as the potatoes.  the mac and cheese reminded  me of blue box mac and cheese  with cheese sauce . pictures added. the murals and decor with the music vibe was nice. the food, though, was very disappointing.; this is great soul food. had the fried chicken, cole slaw, sweet potatoes, fries and plantains. all delicious. lovely server, good music and a good vibe.

name: La fille à papa
formatted_address: 28 Rue du Sergent Bauchat, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
i don’t know what kind of food this is but i was absolutely disgusted. i came early morning for coffee but i only realized after i was served, that they mostly take cash and if i wanted to pay with card, i needed to buy at least €10 worth of food and drinks. so i asked for something with bread and i got a baguette with a cold stinky spread (i’m not sure if it’s meat or something else). i honestly don’t know why i’m paying €10 for this. i hope this is an isolated incident because most of their reviews seem to come from satisfied customers.; very enjoyable dinner with great assistance from the chef and staff. i ordered duck and my wife the steak and both were excellent. good selection of wines at a reasonable price.; it was truly incredible! the place was so cute, amazing atmosphere. the service was also amazing, the people (owners) were so so nice.
and then the food. i haven't had such a great meal in a long time! it was excellent, and i will definitely be recommending this place to other people.; absolutely wonderful experience-- a restaurant that feels like a good friend has invited you over to a family meal. beautiful setting, wonderful hostess and a real family restaurant!

the food was amazing, and we were honored to have a chance to eat here during our short stay in paris. authentic, cozy, and enjoyable. we had such a lovely time and it was a perfect experience.; the food and dining experience were absolutely lovely! the veggie plate was delicious as well as the dessert.

the staff were lovely and very kind! overall it was a beautiful dining experience.

name: Le Picotin
reviews:
one of the best tables we ate in paris!!

professional yet friendly staff.

nice decoration; kudos to all the attention posted in the wcs (clean, nicely decorated, spacious and with some music!).

food was just exquisite!
they have a rotating monthly menu made of the best of french ingredients and revisiting some french and also international recipes!
portions are more than generous, which is exceptional for paris!!

with one of the beautiful 3 bros in spain, i expect other exotic dishes to land on their monthly menu… can’t wait to discover those revisited recipes!!

ideally located in a clam side street closed to picpus/belair; we came here for lunch and the food is super tasty and the service is excellent!!; good restaurant option if you want to experience some local french food.
however, dishes were served cold for everybody and it was difficult to communicate (it would get noisy pretty quickly). desserts were delicious!; really delicious and authentic french food! my french teacher rented out the restaurant for our class to have dinner and practice ordering in french, and it was a really nice experience. the waitress we had was really kind and patient with our limited french, and the food was wonderful.; very friendly staff and very tasty food!

name: Le Touareg
reviews:
it is worth its money.
tajina is freshly cooked and excellent. the couscous is good. also the starters are excellent.
the place is nice and the service friendly.
not expensive.; situated near bercy, this gem of a restaurant has authentic algerian and libanese cuisine. we tried the vegetarien tajine, sizzling hot. the couscous vegetarien was a good combination but on its own a bit dry. these are the only two vegan dishes. but good and tasty, value for money. good vibe also from the public; i had the couscous touareg home delivered. this comes as a huge portion of couscous, raisins, harissa, sauce with vegetables and then a beef skewer, chicken skewer, merguez, steak hache, a meatball, and two lambchops. everything was delivered separately, very clean and tidy, warm and absolutely spectacularly delicious. this is 25 euros but can feed two easily.; what a magical place!

i had to go there because of a late request from a client. they have great wifi! then i asked if my fiancé could bring our pup with him, and they were happy to have him.

their food is amazing! my other half joined me after we found out zeus was welcomed and adored.

we shared a fantastic meal that we’ll never forget.

if you’re in the area, try it out!; authentic restaurant with very nice dishes - actually i offer tajines, couscusses and local pastries.

name: Ty Louis
formatted_address: 240 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
a fabulous place, everything was to our taste. ty louis was a haven of delicious bretagne food in a rainy evening.

to begin with, the ambience and service were exquisite. the soft lights and low jazz music on the background made it very cosy. the waitress was affable and they have an english menu.

as for the food, it was excellent. we tried the onion soup, the chicken plate and the carrot plate. the onion soup was a good as in other places, whereas the chicken dish was extraordinary. the meat was full of flavor and soft, and matched perfectly with the sweet potato purée on the side, garnished with sautéed mushrooms. the carrot dish was definitely special and ambitious. i recommend it warmly, however the plate alone is not enough for a hungry person.; this restaurant was the highlight of our trip to paris. we dined here twice because we loved everything about it. the food was exquisite, especially for seafood lovers, the service was warm, friendly and personalized, and the place is very charming. we are still talking about the mussels in wine and cream (?) we had here. it was unlike any others we've had. please go when in paris. we need them around for our next visit.; ty louis was incredible. we wanted a unique and french culinary experience on our last day in paris and this did not disappoint! the flavor combinations were stellar, and not anything i had experienced before. if you’re willing to be adventurous with your taste buds you will be rewarded. we got the sea coleslaw and the andouille and both were delicious and unique.; our first evening in paris and this was the perfect bistro. even though it was very busy, the service was great and we really enjoyed our meal.; delicious homemade french classics with continuous service - so you can eat when you want, not when you're supposed to. good coffee. friendly device. what more can you ask for?

name: POIVRON ROUGE le burg'R
reviews: decent burgers and fresh fries, we order by delivery and it was still delicious.; perfect💯; ok burger ok service (by paris standards); rapid service... calm place to eat; 🤌very tasty!

name: L'Amourette
reviews:
had lunch at amourette during the olympics 2024 with 20 clients two days in a row.
communication, service, food were just perfect. great location as well. we truly recommend this restaurant if you are in the city. cedric; pleased with every dish we had there, especially the tartare de beouf, but also the carpaccio, halibut with panna cotta, foie gras, and nut ice cream.; very lovely food.  very busy, worth booking if you want a table at lunchtime.; we went there for to celebrate birthday of my boyfriend, and unfortunately the experience was not good. we reserved a table and came on time, but unfortunately were ignored for 20 minutes. in the end we were sorted at the dirty table with crumbs and spilled drinks, and even after we asked 3 times (!) to clean it, it was not done. they put couverture on the dirty table like it was fine. then we waited for a long time to get the menu and to place the order, even when we called for the waiter we were not seen. the escargot was served without pan and couverture and we had to ask two times for it. drinks were also served with 20 minutes delay. the food was amazing, but the service was the worst i’ve experienced. in the end i thought that they would at least offer the complimentary desert or a discount, but they just said “oops”. the birthday dinner was obviously ruined.; like the way of the menu presented👍 was a bit busy when we arrived but get everything in time and enjoying the lunch.

name: PB Poulet Braisé Nation
reviews:
i was so pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. we just stumbled upon it and the menu looked delicious we went in and everything was clean, well-taken care of. ronnie was our server and he was great and very attentive, the food was great, portions are huge and i’ll definitely be coming back.; very good food with fair prices.
we ordered the 1/2 chicken with salad ($16) and the plate is very big - food enough for 2; my son ordered a chicken burger and was delicious. the lady who attended our table, even with limited english, was very kind with my family.
i reccomend!; we had a great time in this restaurant. the vibes were immaculate. the food was amazing also and staff were so friendly ! highly recommend.; good food, clean place with good music, very friendly people.; this restaurant manager force to uber and deliver rider for getting good 5 star review. manager touch mobile search restaurant name from google map and put review.. it's not a good work i think. please stop that...! uber driver wait more than 30 minutes for taking command..

name: Restaurant IMPRONTA
formatted_address: 273 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
reviews: lovely place with cozy vibes. very friendly service and amazing food. i will surely come back often, highly recommend :); very good food served in this restaurant. products are fresh and well prepared. pasta are home made. staff is nice, friendly and professional. restaurant is well decorated. perfect for a night out. booking is recommended.; this is such a wonderful neighborhood restaurant! we had the arancini to start, which was delicious- hot, crisp exterior, gooey filling, and so nicely executed. i ordered the truffle gnocchi, and my husband had the tagliatelle. both were outstanding! i was especially delighted that there were real shaved truffles on the top, and the tagliatelle had an heaping portion of burrata on the top! our server, i’m afraid i didn’t get his name, was also very kind. so helpful, very patient with us as well since neither of us speak french. highly, highly recommend!; had a lovely dinner here, waiter was super friendly and had good service skills. the food was delicious, we tasted the pasta and it was definitely handmade and super tasty :) we’ll be back if we ever visit paris again!; the pizzas may be the best thing on the menu. me and my family were in town for 2 days and we ate here both days

name: Restaurant Numidia
reviews:
this is one of the best restaurant i visited in paris. ..its simply superb. foods r strictly halal. and yes, few staffs speak english so no worries. foods, drinks, meat buffet, salads all inclusive. regardless how busy it was when we visited, we got our foods in a timely manner. no, you don't need reservation.; found this bustling traditional algerian restaurant whilst walking past and as someone who had never tried algerian cuisine, it was super cool! very very affordable and you get plenty of food, i had heaps of cous cous left to take home! it tasted so healthy and homecooked, and i appreciated this as i am of middle eastern descent myself.

i also go free tea at the end and my cultures have forced me to be a tea lover, but let me tell you it was gooood tea.

تعال وجرب بنفسك; numidia one of the best algerien restaurant ever in paris.  amazing stuff that welcome you with a beautiful smile makes me feel home .thank you once again for your hospitality. delicious and fresh food . amazing vibes . yesterday went for second time and fore sure it's not not the last .i recommend that fore every one without any single regret thank you so much 🙏see you soon .; tasty traditional algerian food, nice atmosphere and good price; i have been to this brilliant restaurant called numidia. the menu has various things to choose. the service is perfect, have been served by ghiles & mine who have a full attention to detail. they made us leave with a great sentiment of coming back soon. keep up the hard work guys.

name: Indiana Café - Bercy Village
reviews:
my fiancé and i stopped off here for a quick lunch before leaving bercy. we’d tried quite a few of the other spots during our visit so we thought we’d give indiana café a go!

the service was fantastic and we were seated and served really quickly, which was fantastic to see! the food, however, was nothing to write home about and ended up being quite average.

i went for the eggs benedict, which was okay. the hollandaise sauce was runny and lacked flavour and one of my eggs was hard, but the portion was really generous and the french fries had a really nice taste and texture to them.

my fiancé went for the hot wings which were, again, pretty average and, for hot wings, had absolutely zero spice to them. he, too, enjoyed the generous portions, french fries and coleslaw though!

all-in-all, indiana café is an okay place to grab a quick bite if you’re in a rush, as you’ll be served extremely quickly which is really convenient. however, if you’re looking for amazing quality and a stellar dining experience, there are much better places seconds away in bercy village.; i loved this place!
we didn’t have to wait for a table and service was fast and friendly.
the food was honestly so delicious. after a day of walking around it was nice just sit and have comfort food.
i had the chili con carne and it was one of the best ones i’ve ever had 😳 lived every bite!
my friends were also super happy with their food!; omg loved it.  such a great place.
so lively.
we were so hungry after disneyland visit. and this place just made our day more special.
although food took a while to come but it was worth the wait.

had indiana burger, american burger, kids meal cheese burger and kids chicken nuggets.

food 10/10
service 10/10
ambience 10/10
prices 9/10; came here twice. wouldn’t come back. food is below average… i wanted to try give it a second chance due to the largely positive reviews. maybe it’s a decent place for a drink, but do not come here to eat! atmosphere and service ok. ordered the brisket mac and cheese… i received dry pasta with melted cheese on top, with a few strings of very dry and flavourless beef. previous time i ordered the chicken nachos, which were ok but not great either. had to ask for the bill three times before finally receiving it, and nobody bothered to ask how the meal was until after i already paid…; very nice restaurant with fun vibes! the food was delicious. we ordered the cheese burger and avocado toast 😋 very generous portions.

to try 💯

name: Chicken Street
formatted_address: 67 Bd Paul Vaillant Couturier, 94200 Ivry-sur-Seine, France
reviews:
best chicken naan wrap i ever had. lots of other option with very reasonable price. for what it’s worth, deserve a five star rating.; it's hala and the chicken tastes so good and so good my my teeth to eat well so i recommend you go eat cheeseburger or chicken burger so fantastic for all people
come to paris and eat hala 🥰❤️🇨🇵; amazing food!; great food and great service. the owner or the male worker during the day is very nice. i was there on holiday and he helped me out planning my metro and bus trips.; the worker is friendly and the chicken wings are crispy and tasty. i got the food quickly and the price is also reasonable. it is also open until late at night. i recommend this place!

name: Restaurant Le Karnak
reviews:
this is a small, simple spot with great food. the owner is very nice and took great care of us. we got the shawarma mix and chanklich and topped it off with baklava.

everything was delicious and the food portions were generous. there’s a reason this place has great ratings. highly recommend!; an egyptian cuisine foodie dream! it's a small place that aims on freshness and delicate tastes of food. we've tried several dishes. the meat skewers, oriental rice, starters and deserts. wish we were not just visiting paris but living in the neighbourhood. last but not least are the people there who make you feel as if you're part of the family that came for a visit.; this egyptian restaurant is a hidden gem, where the aroma of freshly bread and warm spices immediately transport you to old cairo. from the tender and flavorful lamb kebabs to the kushary, each dish is a scrumptious representation of authentic egyptian cuisine. the attentive and friendly staff provides excellent service. with reasonable prices for the quality and portion sizes, this authentic egyptian restaurant is truly a must-visit. prepare to indulge in a memorable culinary journey that will leave you craving more of their delectable dishes
i want to thank the staff.; the managers are super friendly. the food is also delicious. i ordered the mixed machawy: the chicken & the meat were extra tender, with a rice & vegetable side. i recommend the cauliflower salad as a starter. the amount was enough for 2 people. however, one small comment i have on the fetta salad, it is extra small. the dish was tiny (like a small sauce cup). other than that, everything was great. will visit again soon.; everything was delicious and perfect!!
and he gave us a delicious dessert at the end for free!
thanks a lot! ❤️❤️

name: Laïa
reviews:
a cozy place with a great atmosphere. the food was delicious, especially the octopus and the tiramisu. edgard, the waiter, was pleasant and friendly, and he communicated with us in perfect english.; perfect restaurant for any conviviality from date to outing with the parents to intimate dinner.  the outdoor terrace is especially embracing, the service attentive, and the food…oh, the food! inventive, delicious, and an order of magnitude better than we’ve ever had in paris.  easy to get to via the metro.; i like him “edgar” from japan!!
it was a store that didn't discriminate against asians. the way they served customers was wonderful. everything was perfect.; amazing service! we had the best waiter calypso. very sweet, funny and thoughtful. truly a hidden gem. biggest recommendations!; highly recommend. the food is very good, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the place is elegant and inviting. would come back

name: pizza di famiglia
reviews:
great place and great pizza ❤️ the owner is so cute and positive 🙌🏼 friendly atmosphere and location 💯
highly recommend!

p.s. i’ve ordered 4 seasons, great choice!; my daughter and i had a very rough day in paris and this was the closest place to our airbnb so we tried it. best part of our trip! we don’t speak any french and the gentleman spoke english and helped so much! so cheap for what you get they should really raise their prices, we got two bottle waters, a half bottle of rosé, and two pizzas for only 30,50 € !! if we ever return to paris we will definitely be going back to try more!; my friend and i want to find something nice and simple to eat at night.we found this pizza restaurant in a small street and ordered two pizza. it was really delicious!  strong recommended!; nice little pizzaplace that makes fresh pizza right in front of your eyes in no time.
the chef only spoke french, but we had no trouble comunicating with gestures and by pointing to the menue.
the pizza tastes great, has a good size and you get extra hot sauce for free.; tasty food and very friendly owner

name: MOSTAZA - Restaurant Saint Mandé
vicinity: 46 Avenue du Général de Gaulle, Saint-Mandé
formatted_address: 46 Av. du Général de Gaulle, 94160 Saint-Mandé, France
reviews: the smash hamburger was so good, the fries too, i've been wanting to eat for a long time and finally did. definitely a nice experience.; this place serves khebab, pizza, fries  at affordable prices.; best kebab in paris. really awesome food, location and onest prices. love this kebab, love from italy; good lads, good kebabs; this is a typical kebap shop with very friendly stuff and a large variety of food, kebap, pizza, tacos.

name: Chez Beberthe
reviews:
i really like the beef tatar and the red wines at this place; thank you for this moment!

impeccable welcome, like at home... we love hearing about the producers and winegrowers who supply the restaurant.

the price of prime rib can be frightening, but i have rarely eaten mature meat of this quality... well done and the portions for the side dishes allow you to share widely!

the chocolate mousse à la louche is just delicious and perfect.

finally the little digestive chosen according to taste….

thanks again, try again; a great discovery in maisons-alfort where i have already come several times. i was able to try several dishes and enjoyed them all. the cooking is done fresh and the products are fresh. the setting is very pleasant and the terraces will allow you to spend pleasant moments in summer. great welcome!; a great discovery.
the dishes are homemade with fresh produce. local cuisine is good.
only one person to do the service, a little waiting but efficient.; very good dishes! i had a fish tartare and the pork chop 🔥 the home fries are very good, in short i recommend.
it's nice to have this type of restaurant in maisons-alfort.
congratulations to camille!

name: Restaurant SANIOURA
reviews:
was helped by a kind man who added some extra treats to my balaclava. it was cold but i went in the evening when it had unexpectedly started raining. was yummy and affordable.; says it’s open. inside he says only for takeaway. it smelled good. it is too cold
to take away.; enjoyed the experience at this little restaurant. the service was good, and the woman running it was quite friendly.  the "menu" special at night is a good deal with an appetizer, main dish, and two glasses of wine for 15 euros. i got the charwarma which was good, but lacking a bit in vegetables so it's a good idea to have a the appetizer served at the same time since the main dish.; good, cheap lebanese food, at a friendly restaurant where you're quickly recognised and treated like a family friend.; friendly lady made us great food. recommended 👌

name: Five Guys Bercy Village
reviews:
no-one beats their burgers! what surprises me every time is how friendly, smiling, professional and agreeable the employees are. the lines go fast and they're so efficient. the peanuts are back!! can't find salted peanuts in shell in france (at least i haven't found the salted variety). we were sitting below the music speaker and it was a bit loud. we couldn't hear our conversation. i politely asked the manager to reduce the volume and he gladly obliged. keep up the delicious food and great service!

delicious and nice friendly staff!!!; i placed a click & collect order but mistranslated the pickup time and showed up too early. samia was so nice and expedited my order so i didn’t need to come back. she was very helpful and friendly, which was much appreciated as i do not speak french and was translating our conversation on my phone. the food was delicious and every employee i interacted with was wonderful. thank you so much for your help!!; first time at five guys restaurant and i was happy. they were the only restaurant open at midnight, very clean, very fast, very nice sweet staff, free drink refills, free ketchup; the five guys here in france taste better than canada.  i don't know why, but it does. service was good, atmosphere is similar to that of north america.  better than we expected.; the hot dogs taste the same everywhere you go at a 5 guys in france… this one is small, very small patio area that i don’t recommend at all when it’s hot outside, it feels like a furnace.
customer service was ok. she put some cajun seating on the side so we could try what it was. fries are a big expensive.

name: La Brasserie 1901
reviews:
i had onion soup and french sausage. as a tourist i can't say is it traditionally cooked but the taste is good and it's exactly what i expected - very different then any food i ate in my life. soup is hardly recommended but "sausage" isn't for anyone so don't order if you are not ready for something else.
about service, don't be rude and don't expect too much from those tired people. i don't care if the staff forget their smile at home, they are not rude if they don't entertain you.; went in here on the off chance, and it was a nice surprise as the decor was art deco and the starters, mains and wine were very tasty, would recommend.

definitely try the onion soup. was delicious.; very good lunch. unfortunately no menu card in english.; me and my husband had a dinner place this , that worst food and service we had in life time; great atmosphere, quick service and tasty food.

name: McDonald's
