reviews: cheap and cheerful fast food until late at night. went for the smart menu (2 burgers) with a drink and small fries for 5 euros. what a bargain.; maximilien offers best service i haven’t before when i travel in paris. my meal order was wrong and he changed it without any complaint.; you can see the line from where the milkshake was filled up. the size is already very small and for them to fill it only halfway is flat our disrespectful. i am disgusted by how small the milkshake was and how low they filled it. roughly filled halfway so the price should be half of what it is! sorry for ordering what i want how i want it i am very disappointed.  and the fries weren’t crispy or hot! good mcchicken but still! cmon!!!; 3 mouses, very very unsanitary, it totally ruined our appetite :( never gonna go there ever again; worst experience ever! it was the only food we could get at 23:30 after a long walk sightseeing. we took our order without checking the bags' content only to find out  half of it was missing when we got home. didn't have the energy to go back! very disappointed and hungry!

name: L'Annexe
reviews: the friendliest people with the best couscous in town! we loved it - merci beaucoup; the owner was super friendly. simple and easy food but so good.; person smoking in the doorframe entrance. disgusting.; nice place and good food; i organized my birthday in this restaurant and i had a very good evening! very good couscous, very good cake made by the boss's wife and very warm welcome! plus there is equipment for karaoke ;) the place is spacious and you will feel good with your friends! i really recommend this restaurant for this type of event :) we had a very good evening and the owner is very nice and welcoming!

name: Le Châlet
vicinity: 54 Avenue du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny, Saint-Maurice
formatted_address: 54 Av. du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny, 94220 Saint-Maurice, France
reviews: what a great little gem. here you get to experience the true feel of a french neighbourhood restaurant and clearly le chalet is the place to be in saint-maurice. everybody knows the owner raphael who has a nice word or anecdote for everyone, some people share with him their holiday plans, some people stop to talk to him about current affairs, it’s a true authentic parisian feel, like an amelie poulain scene. food wise, everything is high quality and fresh, and you can feel the tears of expertise behind the owner proposing surprising dishes like the chicken crumble with coconut, full of flavours and classic with a twist like the crème brûlée which arrives still flaming at your table. the whole restaurant is surrounded by a lovely terrasse.; very nicely decorated restaurant, probably the only one in the close area. the prices are average for the area. we went for lunch, and took the daily menu. the main dishes were delicious, especially the fish, and the dessert as well. we asked for quick service, and we ate in less than one hour. it was good and efficient. i recommend it!; charming place with a nice selection of wine and of food. dishes are delicious (i suggest the gratin of chicken) and you can find for sure the right wine for you. staff is polite and ready to give you advices.; delicious food, good value, friendly staff, really helpful with taxi. would definitely come back!; our favorite out of the local restaurants, cozy atmosphere, very pleasant service and delicious food (wine too!) . if you are in the neighborhood and hungry i definitely recommend paying them a visit.

name: Le Cachiquet
reviews:
as a tourist, my plan was to go for the full authentic parisian dinner experience. i had mayonnaise with eggs, duck (canard), a dessert and a digestive. these guys definitely have excellent armagnac, many choices from different years.
the waiter is very fast and courteous, he makes sure everything goes smoothly.
so yeah, i guess this was a solid success.; this was an amazing meal. fantastic food and service!; cozy and delicious, very much a neighborhood restaurant with warm service from the chef to the servers.; food was amazing and service was even better! vincent (our server) was so kind and thoughtful and took such good care of us. will definitely be recommending to friends!; super good service, even though it was kind of late they still accommodated us and were super friendly. the food was really tasty as well

name: Au Pays de Vannes
reviews: that's everything i love about this type of restaurant: starters and dishes that feel totally homemade with a desire to do well. the wine list is very good with choice, all prices, and we sense a search for the farms. in short, it was my first time in this restaurant and i will happily return. the value for money is very good.; friendly service but the food is really terrible. i barely touched the starter and the main course of 16 eur was also very bad. i really cannot believe the previous reviews.; top 👍; good; yes

name: La Terrasse
reviews: very good place to eat or have a drink. prices are reasonable. waitress and boss are very nice; good coffee and croisants. excellent price!; ok; top; a good canteen with more than adequate value for money, a very warm welcome from the restaurateurs.

name: Le bistrot de Bel Air
reviews:
this is a good, real neighborhood bistro. his polite and affable boss, his regulars, his people passing through, cold beer, tv to watch the end of the match. tranquility, peace, beer. and paying in cash will allow you to leave your tip on the table, like we did before applepay.; it's a very pleasant little restaurant located in a very quiet area. the boss is very welcoming and friendly. it's cool to be able to go back often.; an institution in this bel-air neighborhood! family atmosphere, owner who takes great care of his customers, the bistro that we would all like to have on the corner of our street!; best neighborhood bistro, a friendly owner with unbeatable prices and a varied lunch menu and good brasserie food. add to that a friendly atmosphere, if you are not a regular you will be comfortable there for the first few minutes and become a regular.; friendly old-fashioned bistro.
with a real counter.
good value for money

name: Dwitchees
formatted_address: 38 Rue Jean Jacques Rousseau, 94200 Ivry-sur-Seine, France
reviews:
it is good, not the best.
we ordered pasta and kebab.
the kebab was delicious but the portion is really small, like literally u can finish th with three bites.
the pasta was bad, no taste, no sauce, bad cheese. i did not finish the plate.; delicious burger and fries. really friendly service. you could tell the ingredients are fresh, the salad was extra crunchy.
great value for money too.; the food was great! it was so good, it was the only place on our trip that we went back a 2nd time!; inexpensive and pretty good. they work late, and it was the only one opened place close to our hotel. my beef sandwich got soggy and fell apart because of the sauce. it would have been easier to eat with utensils, and they weren't there.; good bang for your buck. welcoming and polite staff. recommend :)

name: Chai 33
reviews:
very interesting dishes and the concept with the wines cave is something different. the autumn menu was really complete and the service was excellent. definitely we will visit again in the future.; chai 33 is a true gem! the concept is fantastic – you're invited to explore a 19th-century wine cellar with a sommelier, picking out the perfect bottle at wine merchant prices. a delightful experience blending history, affordability, and personalized wine choices. can't recommend it enough!🫶🏼✨; service was awful. our waiter was left on his own for a busy terrace and forgot our orders. we waited 1h for our food, which even for paris is pushing it. and after making us wait so long they made no commercial gesture at all, not even an extra side with my steak tartare!
the food and wine were nice though.; very tasty food, especially confit de canard.; overall, the food was good, the entrées were flavourful, although they really screwed the star of the main dish. duck magret, the red fruits reduction was very delicious but the duck itself was way over cooked and a little bit burned. other than than everything was food good.

name: Au petit Panisse
reviews:
very nice dishes and really tasty tho i admit the portions are a bit small but still i would recommend it. they seem to use only fresh products and you won't have a lot of choices (we had a menu with only two main dishes) but i think this is more a strength for a.restauremt than a weakness ;); lex went on a work trip to uk & europe: dinner at @aupetitpanisse - amazing french food after a week of mediocre english food 😜😜😜. the dishes were super creative, with wonderful twists on classic dishes, and the flavours were so good!
.
salade d'oreilles de cochon, fenouil (pig's ears salad): the pig's ears were very thinly sliced, which makes it a nice crunchy texture. good combination with the fennel!
.
lieu jaune (pollack), asperges vertes (green asparagus), epinards (spinach), emulsion de burrata, œufs de truites (caviar): the sauce was absolutely amazing! not too bold to overpower the fish. the fish itself was soft and light, and it was perfectly done!
.
panna cotta, olive oil, hazelnuts: very hazelnutty! and the texture was amazing 😍. it was slightly more solid than some other versions, but nicely done 👍👍.; the best dining experience we have had in paris.  the food is creative and outstanding, the owners and staff are friendly, inviting, and professional and made the whole evening a lot of fun for us.  we would highly recommend au petit panisse and will definitely return when in paris.; the hazelnut panna cotta was the best dessert we’ve had in our lives. the meal itself was super delicious as well. great taste, great look, great vibe. i can only recommend.; amazing starters - we had beef tataki and makarel. the mains were even more delicious. thanks for the great vibes and service. definitely recommended!!

name: Basta Cosi
reviews:
their pizzas are irresistible, with perfect crusts and fresh toppings. with attentive service and authentic flavors, it's a must-visit for italian food lovers.; peace of italy in paris! amazing food and ambience. they are so welcoming and the service is 5/5. must visit; the best napolitain pizza, i‘ve ever eat before. we were received incredibly nicely. when we said that we can't speak french, english was answered immediately. we were treated kindly all the time and the communication via english was excellent.
the open kitchen with the pizza oven was very authentic. the cooks wore gloves during the preparation. overall, a beautiful and great experience. i can really only recommend it. merci beaucoup!; we visited basta cosi on our first night of our trip. we travelled throughout france for 10days and could not beat the pizza we had here at any other restaurant. absolutely delicious food that was our meal of the trip!
service was outstanding, extremely friendly and helpful with translating any aspects of the menu we didn’t understand.
highly recommend visiting!; my partner and i visited this beautiful restaurant recently whilst staying in paris. we stayed pretty much next door so could not pass on the chance to try it as the atmosphere and gorgeous exterior was as inviting as the owner, beatrice. the pizza was incredible and the service brilliant. we will definitely be returning on our next trip to paris.

if you get the chance - we would recommend visiting!

many thanks,
pete & luke - england

name: Chez Petit Hugo
vicinity: 102B Avenue du Général Michel Bizot, Paris
formatted_address: 102B Av. du Général Michel Bizot, 75012 Paris, France
reviews:
great service but food was a little salty.
thankfully, there was rice to help change the taste of the dish.; the food was delicious! restaurant in a very good location. very nice service. i will definitely come back for food 😋👌🏼🥰 yummy; very good food and the staff is very nice; the open hours of operation are not very ample,  you only have a small window between when they open and stop serving food. they are open later but only to drinking and have only snacks.; perfect service and delicious dishes

name: Eat chicken Ivry-Sur-Seine
reviews: clean place, nice staff, tenders are tasty, wings are a bit salty (though wings from kfc paris are also salty).; we come from uk best resturent in paris iam do heppy to eat here; super clean food is very good; one of the best restaurants i’ve ever had in europe. believe me, 5 stars, worth it.; food is very good and atmosphere

name: L'annexe Restaurant
reviews:
decent no-frills, good quality and well-presented dishes. fast and friendly service, always good when you have half an eye on your watch for the train. a good place to grab a bite and a drink before you go on your journey.; delicious food and coffee. very friendly waitress. definitely worth a stop if you are nearby.; very nice place with a friendly service. they speak english and have english menu as well. food is very nice too, if you are around the gare, a good place to eat and rest.; an unprecedented spot to eat in paris.! new infrequent dishes, exceptional client help neighborly and liberal! ought to visit when close by thankful to you for a tasty supper and a warm hello🌹👍; stopped here before getting our train across the road, waiter knocked over a full glass of coke all over my 6 year old and on the floor. said sorry a few times which we said dont worry it happens but he didnt really mean it as he didnt offer to replace it and still tried to charge us then lie and say it was nothing in the glass. owner came over and sorted it in the end but the cheek and disrespect was unbelievable. save yourself the hassle and dont stop for a coffee or food because they dont give a damm about there customers.

oh yea asked 4 times for water but they couldnt be bothered because they couldnt over charge for it. ordered 3 espresso’s and 3 cokes 25 euros.

edit - i checked photos its this restaurant they even try to pretending now its not the correct restaurant.

name: La Place
reviews: we had a fabulous meal here (normandy chicken and the océane salade). both were great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful. i think she was surprised that anyone might want a savoury crèpe!; my wife and i were looking for a place to have breakfast and found la place. the staff was willing to try to understand english and helped us select a perfect breakfast.; staff is english-speaking and friendly. nice to tourists and helpful as well. they even gave us an english menu without us asking :) breakfast is delicious and their croissant is prolly the best i’ve ever had!; my first meal upon arriving in paris! excellent outdoor seating to watch the people on the move. enjoyed the escargot, bread, and beer!; we stumbled in here by chance. we didn't have much time, just wanted a quick drink. the lady behind the bar conjured up two super tasty non-alcoholic cocktails for us. a virgin mule and a virgin spritz. they were delicious. we asked if there was any alcohol in them because they were so good. but they really were alcohol-free

name: Indiana Café - Denfert Rochereau
vicinity: 1 Bis Avenue du Général Leclerc, Paris
formatted_address: 1 Bis Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews: its a very nice restaurant at the corner of the street and the view is very nice. the staff was very helpful.  we had cheeseburger and steak haché and liked them but it would a little bit nicer if they seasoned the meat better.; we have ordered alcohol drinks and desserts. there was  no alcohol taste in our drinks. the service was very slow. the taste of the dessert was normal.; pretty much an average chain. american, tex-mex cuisine. food ok, but doesn't blow you away. a bit overpriced for quantity and quality. service fine. if you have time, find a nice independent place instead with a bit more character.; went here before visiting the catacombs. the ambiance of the restaurant was noce and the staff was very friendly. the prices were fair and the service was very fast. i had a chicken fajitas salad and it was very good, i was so satisfied with my choice. my friend has the chicken nuggets and they were very tasty as well. we left nothing in our plates! afterwards, we ordered a brownie and it was sweet, decadent and delicious!; indiana cafe was just a random choice for me as a pleasant and useful time to wait for a friend. nice staff, no big wait for the food ordered, which was really very tasty, and reasonable prices due to the location in which the pub is located. i will definitely recommend to friends if they are in this part of paris.

name: L'Inévitable
reviews:
i tried the duck, which was very good. the creme brulee afterwards was amazing.; a place for lunch, but a good one!
i go there almost once per week, and every time i enjoy their formule (fixed price menu) and i m never disappointed.

i also suggest the tartare, and one of the many salads! you will never get out hungry...

not to underestimate: the crew are funny and friendly! and they speak a bit of english and italian too!; despite its name "the unavoidable" you can and should totally avoid it as the owner clearly thinks he has too many clients already.
got lectured for 5 minutes because i dared asking for tap water with our drinks on a sunny summer day.
explicitly told me he would charge tap water if he could and he didn't need our business.

as i work nearby i'll make sure that less people get there for lunch and after-work drinks to help him with his problem of bringing tap water to clients.; food is very flavorful. crème brûlée is home-made and very good. friendly staff as well.; this is not the same management as the restaurant listed in google. we reserved here but were turned away. don’t reserve through google

name: Singh
reviews:
finding an indian restaraunt so close to our hotel was something we didn't expect at all! we were staying at hotel henriette and they provided us with a list of recommendations and 'singh' was on it. i cross-checked with google and they had good reviews so we went for dinner there on our first day in paris. such a warm and hospitable environment..the staff there was wonderful! the restaraunt  is a cosy place, nothing fancy but the people are an absolute gem 😊
the food transported us back to india- it was simple and delicious(no extra oil or spice) i had aloo palak, roti, rice n soyabean curry & my husband had rice and chicken curry. on their recommendation,we also took kheer which my husband had (as i'm lactose intolerant).
i want to thank the staff once again for making us feel so comfortable. i even clarified my doubts regarding the strike in paris the next day and they reassured us that there will be no problem for tourists. they were so good natured and friendly, it felt like a homely dinner experience.; food was priced good, but only since every single item was microwaved. the taste was fine, but this is not up to any standards. the rice was old and from a rice cooker too. how does this have so many good ratings, they do it all openly 😂

update: we got bad diarrhea in the following hours and in the night. sanitary chaos apparently too.; this is the first time we visited this place and i must say food was so tasty just like having from home kitchen. excellent staff and situated in perfect location. great choice for vegetarian food. i was so excited to finish my plate that didn’t take enough pics… but next time for sure.; great authentic indian food. mazaa aa gaya . . i have been living in france since more than two years and have tried many indian food restaurants. singh restaurant paris offers the best indian food i can say. it’s fresh and have authentic flavours . the owner is also very nice person. i visited with my family of 5 adults and 2 kids and everyone liked the food. the prices are also reasonable:) definitely going to visit again and recommend; if you are from india and craving for ghar jaisa khana in paris this is a must go place. it’s very small but the food quality and service is excellent. we went there twice and loved it both the times. it doesn’t require reservation.

name: ANCO
reviews:
located right in front of accor arena, the place was busy with business people who were enjoying their drinks. i went in for an early dinner by myself and the service was excellent. the bases of the dishes i ordered were basil pesto which worked for the gnocchi but not so much with the beef tartar. the potatoes with sprinkles of bacon and different fried herbs were a bit too dry. the menu seems seasonable though. 😉; thoroughly enjoyed their freshly baked croissants, coffee, and hot chocolate for breakfast.  it was so good, that i brought some friends for evening dessert.  i am a big fan of cheesecake, and i must say this was one of the best i’ve ever had.  the other desserts were praised highly also.  the atmosphere had a nice relaxed ambiance and the service was timely, even during busy evening hours.  our server was very kind, polite, and helpful.  it was always a dream of mine to enjoy this experience at a cafe in/near paris; and i must say i will be back at anco in the future… highly recommend this great place.  love from the bahamas 🇧🇸🇫🇷❤️; very interesting and varied menu with delicious dishes using fresh produce. excellent service and wonderful decor. we'll be back!; food was very good. (was expected because i first checked the reviews). in many places in france they do not speak english. here they did and they gave me an english menu card.; after an exciting olympic game in bercy, there is nothing better than a full meal to satisfy my appetite. anco is very closed to bercy and many people have been giving a thumb up to it.  we order a chef’s special which is duck breast with sweet potato in purée and roasted crepe mushroom foam, and a beef chuck with parmesan and hazelnuts. the duck breast is a bit too well done but the whole plate is delicious. beef chuck cooked for 12 hours and it just melt in your mouth. the garlic and honey sauce enhanced the flavor of beef, the roasted parsnips are fresh and full of nature taste.
the atmosphere is cozy and pleasant. staffs are courtesy and gentle. i will definitely come  back again when i visit paris next time .

name: PB Poulet Braisé Ivry
reviews:
a delightful dining experience! the restaurant's inviting ambiance set the perfect tone. the food was exceptional, a burst of flavors that left me satisfied. the cherry on top was the friendly waitress who made the evening even more enjoyable. a must-visit fir fun night out.; made us a follower too. everybody enjoyed their meal. we was picking off each others plate. chicken so moist. 10/10.; kara's service was impeccable. great guy with great taste. helped us pick our food with the right combinations. food was delicious. definitely going back again.; a colleague took me to discover this restaurant for the first time, i really liked it and even became a fan.
very friendly service.
food is tasty and has good portions.
special restaurant from the area..; kara gave customer service and the food was great! definitely coming back again!

name: YUMAN bar et restaurant
reviews:
the waitstaff was very courteous and happy to accommodate french or english.  the drinks were are standouts and very refreshing.   it was easy to enjoy our conversation and our food.  i highly recommend the cucumber gazpacho.   excellent!  we ordered different dishes and enjoyed them immensely.  thank you for a fresh and delicious meal! i’d definitely come again.; given the many choices paris offers concerning places to eat dinner, choosing the place to settle can be quite the challenge. luckily the fork helped us out with an amazing deal. at first caution is advised when deals seem too good to be true, however, we were pleasantly surprised by the food, atmosphere and charming server (and probably owner). in regards to the actual dinner, the food consisted of classics presented in a modern way whilst also offering some newer dishes. luckily this restaurant understood the importance of a-grade ingredients as simple recipes were very tasteful. given the size of paris, accessibility is very important as well. given that there is a metro station just across the street, reaching yuman should give little issues even when situated in the centre like we were. in our eyes, the owner and staff of yuman understood the message of what good food and service meant and thus we could absolutely recommend this restaurant!; as someone who isn't really into vegan and organic restaurants, i gotta say i really loved the food here, good portions and the price was reasonable; very healthy and tasty food. they use only biological ingredients. i find their prices are quite expensive compared to other places i know.; very nice place, with stunning atmosphere and decoration. super nice staff, that chatted with us and answered our million questions!
great place, both for the organic food and suitable aura.

name: Les Frangins
reviews:
very nice staff  - helped me with a menu in french and gave recommendations. made my day! food was also good, i tried local onion soup and cheesecake.; i think it’s the best restaurant for me in my trip.
the price is cute, so is the boss! so kind to people and “care” about you. really friendly to all. welcome to travelers like me!; excellent service by romain. he provided us with clear explanation regarding the menu. we were treated as locals. food was amazing and drinks were perfect. definitely we will back next time in paris. plus: we were able to watch the madrid vs liverpool match.; really nice place. great food and service. food was delicious, especially onion soup!; came here after a night out. open late and great costumer service even though the staff doesn’t speek much english. food is great!

name: Le Café du Village Paris
reviews: nice place. has a bit of alternative vibes (think of berlin bars 😄). friendly staff; i took a drink with my friend and sat down, after 5 minutes the same guy that i purchased the drink from on the bar came to tell us that the place is booked for private event and that we have to leave. i will not come again.; we just celebrated my son's 6th birthday in one of the private rental rooms there and it was a hit! there was plenty of space so the kids had a great time running around and doing the activities with the animatrice. the parents were able to take a nice pause at the cafe during the birthday event and there was even a collective market day taking place with interesting local products for sale. the staff was very helpful with all the components of planning such as cake delivery, animatrice set up, storage of supplies for the event, etc. the manager i worked with was very professional and was a super efficient communicator. they're definitely on my list for future events.; very nice, calm place to work. the staff and owners are very friendly and polite. perfect combination of work and entertainment in one place ✨; wow. great coffee with croissants in an informal atmosphere with very good service. and wifi to boot! great

name: Bomby's Café
reviews:
friendly, relaxed and yummy.

just a down to earth place to sit, eat a delicious plate of sausage and cheese, drink an honest red wine, discuss and solve every problem in this world.

i come here every time i am in paris and maybe i should not recommend it, because next time my favorite table could be occupied,…..but part of the solution of every problem in this world is to share generously with everyone.

enjoy!; great food for an unbelievable price. their lunch special is amazing and the staff was very nice and helpful.; nice atmosphere, however, the drinks are over priced and there is a €10 minimum. so don’t go if you’re only looking to buy a drink or two as you will not pass the minimum!; staff is especially nice & caring.

cute café to have a simple good coffee or something small to eat.

i recommend you go there if you are in the area & want to stop for a while! ✌🏼; staff was so nice. i fell down the road from there and just needed a place to sit. they were very kind even though i only ordered "bad" american coffee. :)

name: La Bonbonnière
vicinity: Parc Montsouris face au lac, Paris
formatted_address: Parc Montsouris face au lac, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
got the rose water crepe which tasted great (little sweet near the end but i have a low sugar tolerance so it’s probably perfect for other people). note that the packaging was thin paper and it leaked through a bit. it’s located in a nice place in the park though with plenty of seating there and nearby and a nice view of the lake.; i visit this place multiple times to get a coffee or to have some crepes with friends. unfortunately the lady (owner) is really not respectful and is serving people as she is doing it for free. she took it personally when i told her that i ordered a lungo and got an expresso, and she didnt want to fix (add hot water) my drink until i insisted.

the location is good, the crepes are good, but the service is a shame.; never ever am i going to pay 4.5€ for an ice cream like magnum or calippo, these prices are a shame!; not only the guy at the left who hates his job destroyed the nutella crepe concept by minimizing the quantity he pours to the point where it could be called just crepe, he dares to be rude and ironic at the same time. well, your food is terrible and your service deserves 0 stars. avoid this place and leave your euros outside the park.; the creep is amazing 👏 and the hot chocolate 🍫 is the pest they sells honey 🍯 it's from the garden

name: Café Framboise
formatted_address: 89 Rue de la Glacière, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
very nice place, away from traffic, original cocktails and cheerful service.; excellent evening meal out at café framboise! friendly service, good quality pizza and cocktails. highly recommend!; excellent. the dishes and pizzas are fresh and quality (with vegetarian choices). the staff is lovely and the cocktails are also very good and on happy hour until 9 p.m. very good new address, a little hidden, which deserves to be known!; we discovered this restaurant by chance, the location is not the most visible, but the atmosphere in the restaurant is warm, with a beautiful decoration.
the staff is very friendly and helpful !
we had pizza (the dough was thin, which is what we like) as well as cocktails which were very good!; we live in the neighborhood, so we were very happy to see that this new restaurant had just opened. we went to eat there this evening, and we were not disappointed! i had a “two-color” carpaccio (beetroot and goat cheese) and a chicken burger, while my husband had the eggplant mille-feuille and a cheese burger.  i also had a beer during happy hour (4.5 a pint!). everything was very good, including the fries which seemed to be homemade.

in addition, the atmosphere is very nice and the welcome is very warm. we can't wait to go back to try the other dishes or even just to have a drink/coffee.

name: Plan Libre - Café - Restaurant - Coworking - Paris
reviews:
incredible coworking! spacious, luminous, great coffee at 1,30€ and strong social and environmental mission. there is a cozy place for kids to play. highly recommend! :); very delicious food, vegetarian and anti-gaspillage, very good concept. the curry is very tasty. the service is good, everyone is very nice here. the restaurant is in the cité du refuge. not so far from the rer station bibliothèque françois mitterrand.; young and cool atmosphere very friendly and nice people 😍😍😍; i like the plan libre site because above all it is user-friendly and the food is very good. it allows for a cultural mix through its diversity, ages, origins, cuisine, and the whole thing means that every time i go there i have the impression of completing a journey (journey). the only thing i'm missing is background music.; very pleasant place to work, very well located and a warm atmosphere. absolutely lovely staff.
i will come back with pleasure!

name: Le Café Saint-Médard
reviews:
first meal in paris. all i can say is it was average... the egg, crab and mayo did not take great. the flavour was a bit bland and could honestly taste egg. it was interesting to have different textures but i don't think that is enough to support this entire dish. the peppery steak was not to my liking. the peppery sauce was really nice but the stake was quite chewy (as medium). the potatoes were nice but not enough to support the entire dish.
nice atmosphere outside but was approached by people for spare change twice in less than 1 hour... service was mediocre can't say it's one of the best but i think a bare minimum was reached.; greetings, fellow traveler! we chose to have breakfast at this place multiple times during our stay, not just because of its proximity to our hotel but primarily due to the delightful breakfast menu and the exceptional flavors they serve. highly recommended for a relaxing and enjoyable start to your day!

pros:
- outdoor tables provide a lovely street view.
- the menu offers a variety of food options.
- the breakfast is both rich and delicious.
- prices are reasonable.
- the staff is friendly.

cons:
- english may not be well understood by the staff, but this is common in france.; great staff, fab location and lovely food; set in a cozy square, this brasserie has everything that you could ask for a pleasant lunch in an authentic parisian atmosphere.
the staff is friendly and welcoming. i asked for a vegetarian croque monsieur (personal request to prepare it without ham, even though the menu has an excellent choice of vegetarian options). my girlfriend asked for the risotto with champignons mushrooms. everything was delicious and the service super fast, considering that the restaurant was getting full at our arrival.

i’m very happy for this experience and i warmly recommend this place!; cute little café near where we stayed. we didn’t find it until our last day and wish we had found it sooner. food and service was great and view of the square was adorable.

name: Strada Café
reviews:
we went here for lunch and got the bacon sandwich, and salmon sandwich; both very very delicious and filling. the coffee here was my favourite from my 2 week trip in france 😊. prices were reasonable.; very nice coffee shop ! the staff is very nice and welcoming. we tried their cold brew and cafe crème and after recommendation we ordered their signature banana nutella cake : just delicious 😋
definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu.; absolutely amazing food, staff, and great place to stay and do work on laptop. cannot stress enough how fresh and delicious the food is. you can tell it’s fresh. will definitely go back.; cute little coffee shop and breakfast place. i got the bread, butter and jam. it was delish! coated in butter. they also have fresh juices. the day i was there it was apples, peaches and ginger. i watched them throw like 5 whole fruits into the juicer. it was the best juice i have ever had! served over ice. i wish i got two!; nice little cafe with rustic looking interior with friendly staff and good food!
the staff was very welcoming and friendly. we had brunch here. the chai latte i had was very nice. got freshly made orange juice which was even better!

name: Café Jules
reviews:
i stay right in front this caffe place and really wanted to eat something sweet.
i tried the crepe with home made chocolate, it was tasty but i "didn't fall" i expected it to be more yummy.. unfortunately i won't be back, the rest of the manu is too expensive for my taste. (burgers is about 20€, desserts are 12-13€
anyway, servers were nice, location is good if you're in the area, right by the metro, atmosphere is nice, if you're smoking you have an outside area and if you don't (like me) you can sit inside.
thank you!; it was my best experience in paris!
we were in a group of 6 people and right at the entrance we were welcomed by letícia. i asked if i could come in with my chihuahua and she not only said i could, but also brought water in a little pot for him! it was cold and she quickly found a table inside the restaurant since we were with two children.
the waitress who served us was also attentive and quick.
the crepe was very good and the beer was well served.
we didn't speak french, but everyone made an effort to understand us.
for 6 people, the bill was 70 euros.
i will definitely come back here when i return to paris.; beautiful morning experience, the waiter did an excellent job at making us comfortable from the start and we had an incredibile breakfast; had a late dinner here on a sunday. prices are a little higher but the food was delicious, the service was fast and the people were friendly and helpful, the atmosphere was great too. recommended!; we went to this restaurant three times during our week-long vacation in paris because the food and service was so good. would highly recommend the carbonara (see picture). the waiter was extremely kind and friendly.

name: Café du Rendez-Vous
formatted_address: 2 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
🇫🇷 absolutely delicious 🇫🇷
i’ve been looking far and wide for a ratatouille here in paris and i finally found it here! and it was paired with a delicious tuna steak. cannot describe how scrumptious this meal was and it wasn’t ridiculously priced (like a lot of the restaurants in the city). would absolutely recommend this place.; my daughter and i have visited paris every summer for the past three years. she fell in love with the city and this particular area of paris has been our base each time. cafe du rendez-vous has been on the list of must go places since we discovered it after a visit to the catacombs. delicious food with friendly staff and fabulous cappuccino.; the is a great looking place sat on the corner near a station however the service was terribly slow with a wait over 5 minutes when it wasn’t busy

sadly the food we ordered was bad.  ordered a chicken burger but got a chicken schnitzel squeezed within a millimetre of its life in a bun that was hard. fries were cold and wet. also ordered a caesar salad which looked ok but rather than being fresh chicken was also the chicken schnitzel

the old fashioned hot chocolate was great, different to what you would expect and a nice little bit experience; had the mixed omelette,  orange and coffee option, definitely worth it very nice; best bacon cheese burger i have ever had, even better than any i have eaten in the us. my wife had the thai salad and raved about it also. liked it so much we came back the nexr day. a+++++++.

name: New Kitchen Restaurant
reviews:
what a friendly place! 😀
after looking at all the 5 stars i was initially skeptical. how come a place has so many 5 stars... but even before entering, i understood why.
we reached there at 11:45 pm, just 15 minutes before closing. but they welcomed us with a smile & open arms. one of the guys even stopped his own dinner to come and explain us their menu.
the service was quick, the presentation beautiful and it was super light on the wallet as well.
coming to the food, the ny style burger was delicious and we also enjoyed the salmon a lot. the best part were the sweet potato fries that came with the burger. best sweet potato fries i've ever had.
thanks guys for the lovely service and the late night delight.
100% recommended to anyone in the region; good food, good service and a nice atmosphere, would recommend 10/10 or in this case 5/5 since there are only 5 stars👍; very fast and friendly service with delicious food to top it all!; good food; super cool

name: Chicken Street Kremlin Bicêtre Naan & Fried Chicken
vicinity: 4 Rue du Général Leclerc, Le Kremlin-Bicêtre
formatted_address: 4 Rue du Général Leclerc, 94270 Le Kremlin-Bicêtre, France
reviews:
if you're hungry and it's late and you need something fast then this is the place for you. let me start by saying the machine that took my order was not working well. i ordered but the kitchen never received the order but the gentleman at the counter noticed it was taking an extremely long time and helped prioritize my order and even added a drink for my wait. the food was fresh and hot and just did the job. i would eat here again but if you're looking for something amazing this is just okay.; i have some meals in malta in italy butt in this tour i found best meal in france and the taste of chicken street is fabulous awesome 👌; i've never eaten such delicious chicken. i ate here yesterday and came back today. thanks to issamm who suggested this dish about me it is delicious; it was good overall, one of the best naan/kebab fast foods that i tried in paris. the chicken was full of flavor. the staff were super friendly but the wait time for my food was 10 minutes which was very slow for “fast food”. please improve the order delivery and u got yourself a better score.; newly opened in le kremlin bicetre. food is good. we tried the chicken naan. not as good as other branches i have visited in nice and paris.
staff is a little rude.

name: CANTINELLA
formatted_address: 30 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Jacques, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
beautiful food and friendly staff. our waitress was beyond fluent in both french and english.

there was a short wait for the food and the quality was excellent. for the money, the portion sizes were large too. i had the calzone with my friends ordering pizzas. all really enjoyed them.

note that if you order something with egg, it's extremely runny. so if this is not to your taste, make it known.

the bathroom was a small, single cubicle but was modern and clean.; amazing restaurant with a cozy atmosphere, super friendly, attentive staff and very good food. my pasta with smoked salmon was cooked to perfection, easily the best i've ever had. i'll gladly recommend this restaurant and come back i'd i ever visit paris again. thank you! :); we had a great experience . the host was very accommodating . we were two guests and we wanted to share and they split the dishes for us in the kitchen. and the food was amazing. i highly recommend going to this place.; super cozy place! great food and service! wish me to come back again:); after a 1-1/2 weeks of french food, we were in the mood for something different. a bit of the beaten path, but not hard to find. tried the pasta and the veal -- both very good. the service was friendly and efficient.

name: Kehribar
formatted_address: 1 Rue des Fossés Saint-Jacques, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
a very small but cute place. i had a kebab but the seasoning was not as good as the kebabs i had before. it's because the dish smelled like dill and i don't like dill.
the bread was good though and they gave us free water. the service was good too. the portions are large, and for a fair price - with paris standards, especially in the downtown.; we stopped here for a sit down dinner on our first night and we found the food amazing. the atmosphere was equally impressive. 2 days later we came in for takeaway and it was just as good.; great place, with fresh, well prepared food. the place is small, but attractive. everyone was cheerful and attentive. we went on a very hot day and appreciated the air conditioning.; the server was extremely friendly and helpful. giving recommendations and making conversation. the food was exceptional albeit pricey but will be going again; perfect food and decoration! the best turkish restaurant ever tried. staff here is so friendly and helpful, and they can speak english and spanish!! real surprise!!! the one that i would definitely come back in next paris trip!!!

name: Nossa Churrasqueira Paris 5
formatted_address: 1 Rue de l'École Polytechnique, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
great place to have gluten free dinner. they had it really clear and there was no risk. the chicken was delicious. maybe, we have to say the local was quite small and it was really hot even though all doors were open.
two small chickens, two cokes and a salad was a total of 32,5€. anyway, it was a great place to eat.; definitely a most go! its affordable and so good! ill come back for sure without any hesitation!
the chicken is well seasoned and juicy, there is a lot of fries as well! the service was a 10/10, the waiter was very friendly and speaks french, english and of course portuguese!; i had a really high expectation according to the reviews, but for some reason the chicken torn out just okay, even a bit dry i’d say. the garlic sauce wasn’t good too. the place is really small and they don’t have enough tables , so i’d suggest to reserve a table in advance.; the service and attitude of the staff was excellent, the quality and taste of the food was also excellent.  be sure to make a reservation because the restaurant space is small and you may not find a seat.  the only negative point was that there was a lot of smoke inside the hall, which they might not be able to control because the kitchen was next to the hall and cooking chicken in the portuguese way has a lot of smoke.; the place of nossa is located right in the heart of the 5th arrondissement, next to the pantheon. the food is very tasty and the quality is good. the people here are extremely nice and friendly. the place itself is small, but the only negative point is the vicinity with the kitchen with lots of bbq odours.

name: Le Beaujolais
reviews: i was having a lunch here and it was amazing. despite that the communication in english was bit of a problem. i let them to recommend me main dish with fish and a dessert and it was splendid. the first course was some pate with guacamole, second course was awesome tuna steak with popato mash and the dessert was some coffe with a taste of several other deserts. i left the restaurant 30 euros poorer but with full stomach of delicious food. i can only recommend it.; great spot for a work dinner! 🇮🇹 the atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed gathering, and everyone enjoyed the delicious italian food. friendly staff made it a truly enjoyable experience. 👍; good brasserie food, lovely staff and a fair price.; nice location, very friendly staff...great food at a reasonable price... couldn't recommend more; a nice place to meet for lunch or after work if your office is nearby!

name: Le 27 Madame
reviews:
owner and his family run the place. lovely people. great pate, duck was the best i've had, pork and chicken were great. all the desserts were really delicious.; such a little gem! i greatly enjoyed my diner at this family owned restaurant in saint germain des pres. unassuming but great fresh, good quality food.  upon arrival, i was welcomed by the son and he quickly introduced me to his mom, the chef, and the dad. all in all great french family style food. such a refreshing experience. down to earth, no fuss. highly recommend.; incredible restaurant in paris! a family kitchen where the father is the chef and the son takes care of the service, both of whom guarantee exceptional quality. the menu is updated according to the fresh products of the day (vegetables, cheese, fish, meat, bread) and everything is very tasty. the atmosphere is very cosy and the price is fair.; we met dominic as we greeted his girl maddie during our first morning walk after just arriving to paris. he was so personable and sweet we decided to return and dine with him at 27 madam. we arrived to a warm welcome and the most delicious dinner experience. first the mushroom salad and endive with a touch of blue. followed by the citrus fish and yellow chicken where every bite we savored and shared. of course yes, we had to delight in the apricot torte! this was a very special meal. made with love, fresh and crisp, everything was so amazing and we again said hello to maddie, dominic, and alex.
tannus and joe-  guilford ct usa; this was a dining experience.
the menu was small, but each meal was deliciously prepared and presented.
family run business with fresh seasonal produce, with recipes handed down. authentic cuisine provided, where local families like to gather.
what a charming place, from entry.  our coats were placed on hangers, and we were welcomed as guests. the restaurant had linen tablecloths and napkins. there was muted music, and subdued lighting. a place to relax and share conversation.
they take pride in all they do, taking the time to provide explanation when our understanding of french language and menu items were required.
it was our last night in france after a 35 day vacation.
it was a memorable place and a delight.

name: La petite cuisine de Sandrine
vicinity: 89 Bis Rue du Dessous des Berges, Paris
formatted_address: 89 Bis Rue du Dessous des Berges, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
i was staying at a hotel around the corner and i'm so glad i found this.

the food was so good!! it's €10.50 for two of the three day's choices either a starter (entree in french) or the dessert plus the main meal (with a vegetarian option) or €13 for all 3. they accept credit cards and were so friendly when i told them i spoke no french.

their daily menu is on the website. today i had a choice of rice & tuna salad or vegetable soup for the starter. the main dish was mini shell pasta covered in tomato sauce and two pieces of pork. i picked a brownie for dessert. the food tasted really fresh and healthy and the price was incredible.

my only regret isn't they aren't open on the weekend but that's my fault for not planning my trip better. also they have the option to take the food to go.

my favourite meal on this trip to paris!; good lunch at affordable price.; super !; concept that i love.
this is a very well organized family business.
you must order the day before or in the morning for the big day.
the food is prepared on the big day.
it's homemade with fresh, quality products.
i ordered takeout twice last week.
on wednesday, i had a dish of three-colored rice shrimp with tomato and feta and for dessert it was really a total killer, a rhubarb tart with a sort of custard. 🥰
never tasted this version in my entire life.
the mix of sweetness and sourness was a real marvel. it was perfectly balanced. 😍
then the next day i had a vegetable moussaka and a lemon tart.
i recommend this establishment.
you can go there with your eyes closed.
thank you to the staff for their welcome and availability.; everything is always fresh and good. the team is super friendly and smiling.
ordering in advance is the best advice i've ever been given to make sure i get what i want. the menu changes every monday.
i highly recommend it to all local foodies!
p.s the smell of the dishes, every day, directly whets your appetite.

name: Naan World
reviews:
👍😊
good; very good, value for money, excellent quality of food, especially the naan sandwich it's so creamy i can't wait to eat again. i recommend it to everyone in the neighborhood who wants to eat something inexpensive. in addition, good quality above all. thank you chef rabin; really very, very sad 😞, to see that pizza 140 has closed. i had the chance to return there a few months ago and still on top. the manager told me he would leave soon but i didn't think it would happen immediately. pizza 140 is all my youth (i started going there at the end of college), the evenings and nights where i went to have my kebab pancake there (he was the first to make them), that excellent memories.

whether it was mr. adel, his wife or his children, they were all kind. with the closure of pizza 140, memories and my youth are gone forever. i wish them the best from the bottom of my heart for the future. 🙏🔥

i haven't tried naan world yet but i still give them a 5 ⭐️ to wish them good luck.; too bad this change of
owner we loved the old ones so much
pizza! this saturday a 4 cheese pizza without cheese… very disappointed really; a generous tray of fries 🤩

name: Aupa Caminito - Burger croissant
vicinity: 48-50 Rue du Dessous des Berges Angle, 31 Rue Cantagrel, Paris
formatted_address: 48-50 Rue du Dessous des Berges Angle, 31 Rue Cantagrel, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
nice and cute place to enjoy original and generous burgers made of savory croissants dough. i enjoyed the veggie one, super tasty! good quantity! the service was nice :); ❤️❤️❤️hidden french treasure!!!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️hands down my best cafe experience in paris!!! the burgers are out of this world amazing!!! an absolute must and well worth the hike to this end of town. it is very local. i ate here several times and the vibe is very chill…. local french. but the food is what really makes this place special… you won’t regret it!!! ❤️❤️❤️ you are welcome… in advance❤️ must try the croissant burgers… vege options are amazing… 🤩; the place is warm and welcoming. we had a brunch there with 2 kids (including a baby). the place is kid's friendly. loved the croger idea which is a burger with croissant bread.
also the chai latte is by far the best i ever had!
will definitely come back 😊; we came a long way from the center to try these burgers. the waiter told us that there was no way for us to sit inside because a larger group made a reservation (even though there was still a small table we couldn’t sit there). i think it was his boss that insisted and i felt that he was really sorry about having to place us outside in the cold. i asked him for a recommendation and he showed us the two most popular burgers on the menu. we ordered both of them (the pulled pork and pulled beef). the pork one was excellent, 5/5 stars… the beef one we didn’t enjoy that much… that’s why i decided to place it in the middle at 4/5. the waiter later explained us the beef one is a traditional french recipe and the beef is slow cooked in a wine. i personally didn’t like this strong wine taste in the burger. the potatoes were okay… a bit too oily and lacking salt.
i also found the area a bit creepy at night (we went there around 10-11pm) because we came with the train and returned with the bus, and on our way back a homeless guy persecuted us. when we turned in the main street he left.
maybe we just had bad luck but overall i had a higher expectation considering the reviews i read before.; don't miss the crogers here. had the opportunity to try the most unique burger of all time, croissant-burgers, a.k.a. the crogers. absolutely loved both the veggie options. the apple-blueberry crumble was a great dessert to end our meal with. and cheers to the friendly monsieur at the counter, who took the time to explain the menu and give us great recommendations 👍 evidently i am not a great food photographer 😜, but the food tasted really great.

name: Les Spectacles
reviews:
yesterday my friend & i went into les spectacles for our dinner before seeing john mayer across the road at the accor. we love how they played john mayer music. the food was amazing & reasonably priced. the service was 1st class & our waiter was very kind & friendly.
today we went there  for dinner before going to the mika concert. again a very nice meal whilst listening to mika music, great atmosphere & sevice.
unfortunately we didn't make the concert because the company i bought the tickets from took my money but failed to deliver my tickets, it turns out that i was scammed 😥
we decided to go back into les spectacles. the staff there were very upset to hear what had happened & tried to get us some tickets. they were very kind & offered my friend & myself a free drink.
being shown such kindness really cushioned our disappointment.
the camaraderie amongst the staff was great to see too.
i will definitely be visiting again on my next trip to paris.
put les spectacles on your list of places to visit especially before a concert as they play music by the artist you are seeing that night which is a perfect way to start your evening.
thank you to you all 🥰; the ambience is good and it is located very close to the bercy station. but the waiter was giving us a weird look for no reason like he’s not happy to serve us. he also charged us 12€ for two cappuccinos which is too much, too pricy.; such a terrible experience.
unpleasant service, overpriced drinks and a waiter who will happily cheat on the bill if you don’t check the credit card machine.
never saw that in paris !!!; okay, but no ketchup); absolutely terrible service.

i got a beer without any bubbles (and not the brand i ordered) which i asked politely to be changed. this turned out to become a major issue with the staff, and two separate servers objected to my request.

for that reason, i instead asked for the beer simply to be taken back as i didn’t want it, which they again strongly objected to, and said i would be charged regardless.

it got so absurd that i could not resist to comment on the extremely poor treatment of customers by the servers.

one of the servers (with blonde long hair in ponytail) got aggressive and had to be pulled back by his colleague.

shocking!

name: Hippopotamus
vicinity: Centre Commercial Italie 2, 30 Place d'Italie, Paris
formatted_address: Centre Commercial Italie 2, 30 Pl. d'Italie, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
i like hippopotamus steakhouse, especially how they plate the food. i often eat here, and while the quality of the meat can vary - sometimes it's perfectly tender, other times a bit chewy - the portions are always fair, and you get what you pay for. overall, i will always be coming back.; best steakhouse i’ve been to yet. the food was amazing and the steak was perfectly cooked. amazed with the service, food came out with incredible speed! (10 minutes or less) i would definitely recommend this place it’s a must go to place. our server malex was lovely and welcoming, we would not want anyone different.

i had the xl beef skewer medium done and it was perfectly cooked just as i wanted. all sides and dips wanted were offered and given to us quickly by our server. this was a truly special experience.; perfect end to our holiday. non alcoholic cocktails and food were amazing. we both had the pepper stake. i had an egg starter and i had a form of apple pie, my husband had an ice cream desert.; i want to see that i love this restaurant. i order paper steak 🥩 with home fries. that cost 20 euro 💶. the service is wonderful the order arrived very quickly. with your order comes also very tasty bread 🍞. also i order beer 🍺. thanks eppopotamus!; the place is in a nice and in an easily accessible zone. they struggled a bit to accommodate us because we were 8 people but in the end they found a solution reasonably quickly. the waiters were very nice with us but they did some mistakes taking the orders even if they quickly found a solution. the service was longer than expected, and i cannot explain myself why because the number of waiters seemed to me adequate, sure it was only an organizational issue. food was very good and the menu is extensive, offering so many traditional dishes. the price was also good. i wish i could give 5 stars to the place because the food was delicious, but i can't ignore the problems regarding the service, maybe a bit more organization would be great. in general i can recommend you the place, but be prepared to wait a little bit more than average.

name: La Felicità
reviews:
the space is very nice, the food is amazing, but it is quite a busy space, so i won’t necessarily recommend it for a peaceful lunch around town. if you are looking for a place to go with coworkers or friends, it definitely works, but if you are just visiting and trying to eat good food, i suggest the other bigmamma restaurants around paris. otherwise than that, the food was excellent and the waiting time was quite short.; food and dessert are very nice. there is live music which is great fun. not suitable for those who prefer quiet.; nice place for watching football. a bit confuse the pay system, and a bit expensive also. although, there's a lot of places to sit and tablets, i was expecting more srcreen with the games. still, i enjoy the decoration. it's near to the metro station line 6.; ordered two orelsmash + side + boisson + dessert, and when i got to the "burger" counter i said my order number. the guy who was working there didnt even say "hello" to me just served my food.
for the food i didnt even wait 1 minute since it was already been done, the fries also. and let me tell you the burger and the fries were very dry. the burger and the fries were probably sitting there for more then 10 minutes ready for someone to order them and just give it away. while we were eating they were making burgers again and they were just staying on the counter for more then a half an hour ready to be picked up but nobody was coming for them. probably waiting for the next victim. i was expecting much more but it did not meet my expectations. 1/5; what an epic set up! best pizza’s i’ve ever had & delicious italian food. the pistachio tiramisu inside the disco train was super cool. epic pumping vibes, cool bar. great night, can’t wait to go back!

name: La Table des Bernardins
reviews:
atmosphere of the place is amazing,within the vault of this xiiie century building. arches bathed with the sun was mesmerising.
the table des bernardins is located at the end of the massive hall.
coffee was average and watery, the brownie was good however.
they have lunch menu as well if looking for food.
take some to walk around, it is worth looking !; a beautiful hall for celebrations and gala dinners, la table des bernardins au 20 rue de poissy is certainly a valid option.
the service is normally good and the atmosphere is great, however the food wasn't as expected.
there are rooms for improvement on the matter.; this place has a really great atmosphere. calm and relaxing. ‘rapport qualité/prix’ of this restaurant is very good and the service was also great.; nice athmosphere, friendly service, small plates; good cremé. very quiet, no wifi. nice place to spend an hour reading, studying, or connecting with a friend.

name: Gourmet gourmand
reviews: very good restaurant, they have so delicious food 😋; strangest chinese i've ever been to. all dishes are pre-prepared in a display cabinet, you choose your dish, it's measured into those salad dishes you get at morrisons then it's microwaved in front of you. tastes as good as it sounds but not as expensive as most things in paris.; i'm vegeterian and in no way it was indicated that the thaï ricw had seafood in it. however when i started eating the taste was strange and i found out i was eating shrimp.; excellent chinese food; i loved it! variety of food also for vegetarians. very friendly service, good price-quality ratio. all very rich. thank you!

name: Le Confessionnal
formatted_address: 4 Rue des Fossés Saint-Jacques, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
this place is awesome!  we stumbled upon here on a recent trip to paris.  the bartender neil was the best and treated us like regulars even though we barely speak french and are from orlando.  this is one of the friendliest bars we have been to in paris.  we ended up going back for a second time on our last night in town and had a blast.  definitely visit this place.; fun. strong cocktails. lovely barman who doesn’t seem to mind that we speak english!

don’t get on the wall of shame.; amazing ambiance. the bartender has an a surprising range of jokes and the cocktails are to die for ! recommended for any nights out in paris.; just had a drink here. friendly service and nice place.; i didn't have any food from the menu. i'm just not sure why i stopped here, there's a better spot a few doors down the street, and plus the man here was a complete jerk too. i will not be back here.

name: L'Age d'Or
formatted_address: 26 Rue du Dr Magnan, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
an interesting concept near place d'italie.
very well situated on a corner square, lage d'or presents a very alive place to spend some time, have a coffee, grab a bite, or enjoy the neighbourhood.
good food, good service, and wonderful atmosphere.
enjoy...; went here with a colleague for lunch, after getting the impression it was really popular for happy hour.

prices are incredibly high, and the food is terrible. i ordered a lamb special, and the meat was so fatty that i literally choked on it three times trying to swallow it before finally spitting it out. this restaurant has made me want to become a vegetarian. although apparently the veggie burger was also bad, according to my colleague.

service was also terrible: it was several minutes before we even got menus, and many more minutes until someone arrived to take our order (long after people next to us, who sat down later, had ordered).

on the plus side, other people like it, so there's probably just something wrong with me... as long as you don't get anything either with meat or vegetables, and don't care how much you pay, you'll probably be fine.; it was great place. the staff was very kind and the food was delicious.; great place but that should do a second toilet… the line to the toilet is too long… the place is great  but prices are steep for the area; absolutely horrible cocktail named l’été grec. sweetest thing i ever tried

name: Playin Bar à Jeux BNF
Bar Robert chez papy
reviews:
love this owner and place, makes you feel welcome🥰 should definently give it a try!; merci !!!! first night in paris travelling and this is defiantly a go to. the service is 10/10. we didn't break the bank either. we made friends instantly here do not miss it! thank you for making us so welcome!; bar of french quarter life in the middle of the china town of paris with a touch of spain the very kind and helpful manager makes tapas and tortillas; i visit often and have never been disappointed. wonderful cozy atmosphere, here you can have a great rest after a hard day at work, or meet friends on the weekend. this bar is distinguished from others by its low prices for a variety of drinks and snacks. friendly hosts and attentive service. i think this is the best bar in all of paris!; incredible welcome, we are received like kings! the tapas were excellent (special mention to the kidneys)

and thank you for the 421 track!

name: Aubrac Corner 13
reviews:
really not bad meat wise but a lack of fries in the diced proposal (you can have potatoes but it's not the same taste and vibe with a burger) + the chocolate cake could have been better.; great restaurant for meats, fast service and quality dishes. very good quality/price ratio. the staff is top notch!
we had the tartare and the steak, both were delicious, don't hesitate to try them!; i wanted to try this restaurant for lunch. i took takeaway and frankly i'm disappointed... and it's not for lack of having tried twice. it doesn't look like anything. and the taste is not there. i can't taste the aligot. the pork ribs are not great and not tender enough. what can i say about the sausage…too bad it’s served cut (that’s my opinion). maybe on site it's more interesting but in any case taking away doesn't look like much. positive point: the bread and the little sauce (homemade mayonnaise?). friendly staff.; 3.75/5
a main course + side dish / dessert / drink for 18 euros. maybe a little expensive for lunch, and the quantities aren't huge either. the ribs are very well caramelized, i ate well but they weren't the best either, on the other hand the aligot on the side... it's just perfect! for dessert, the lemon meringue tart was good but since it was brought at the same time as the main course, with the heat it softened, which was a shame. we should be able to get our desserts once we have finished the dish.
the order is placed at the bar, and they come and serve us at the table.
perfect order taking, very good service, really nothing to say about the staff, it's top notch!

in summary, it's a perfect place to come and eat lunch during your lunch break.; very good restaurant
the meat is excellent
very good value for money: €16 for meat with drink or dessert
18€ for meat, drink and dessert
downside on certain accompaniments and desserts which are not excellent

name: SOS Enfants
vicinity: 8 Rue du Château des Rentiers, Paris
formatted_address: 8 Rue du Château des Rentiers, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
👍; association whose actions are particularly interesting and whose motto is "help without assisting", and by discovering the motivation of the communities, it is a success.
i should say successes: schools, hospitals and maternity wards, training centers are built by the populations themselves...
visit their site and support their actions.
i like to support them, even modestly, and i always receive news of my support.; great association.
after having sponsored a group of 33 apprentice carpenters in congo, i am currently godmother of siméon (19 years old) also in congo, to enable him to continue his studies and i help him through the solidarity shop.
i regularly receive news and photos.
i so wish i could do more!!
i wish sos enfants to find many godparents to help all these children who need it so much.
do not hesitate to sponsor through this association or make solidarity donations.; good morning,

there is an error in the presentation of the sos enfants association, in the google maps insert.
sos enfants certainly loves animals, but does not particularly act in their favor.
sos enfants offers children around the world the means to build their future through child sponsorship and the implementation of humanitarian education, training, health and development projects.
sos enfants is a member of the federative association la voix de l’enfant.
it would be desirable for google to update the objective of sos enfants.
as a member of sos enfants i would be very grateful to you.; sublime commitment...especially during this period.

name: Les Cousins d'Alice
reviews: small toy shop with traditional toys; a nice selection of books and toys. great for thoughtful gifts.; great local toy store. good selection.; lots of unique items.; fantastic

name: l'Aventure
formatted_address: 69 Rue de la Glacière, 75013 Paris, France
reviews:
a return to childhood...
if you have a gift to give to a child whatever their age, you will find what you are looking for. some games will even remind you of your own childhood. pure happiness for very very reasonable prices.; large store with lots of choice, advice and service.
a good reason to come back.; amazing
the store is great with a great selection of toys. but what we like best... are the adorable store managers and their always relevant advice. my son reads a lot, and they always advise him very wisely when buying books. they read children's books, can talk about them and comment on them, it's really valuable for supporting children on their path to books. we see the adventure from the window and the children only want one thing: to go!!!; this store is absolutely awesome. the children love it. we meet up with the whole neighborhood every friends birthday! it is both an excellent children's bookstore and a fairly complete toy store. the sellers' advice is always relevant. we see that they know their articles. how lucky to have a store like that in the neighborhood.; a real ali baba's cave with always excellent suggestions, gift ideas, whether for books, games, activities... and thank you also for your availability and your kindness 😁

name: Natalys
formatted_address: 37 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews: great place and excellent customer service! lamia was extremely helpful and nice! definitely will come back again!; very nice store and items, totally recommended; very beautiful shop in paris. very kind staff!; best customer service; top

name: Tombé du nid
reviews:
great kids shop !; always magnificent window display, exquisite taste in the choice of clothing and toys presented in this small boutique.
the welcome and advice are not lacking🌟; i love their jellycat collection and their very warm glass. i go there regularly.; nice shop, large selection, quality items at very affordable prices. pretty clothes, stuffed animals, toys, different from those in all the chain stores where everything is the same. this little neighborhood store is very good. the boss gives you a warm welcome and gives you good advice. great empathy with families, a lot of patience with children. thank you frédéric, don’t change anything. congratulations.; unacceptable and rude behavior of the store clerk. my mother-in-law wanted to take photos of the clothes to show them to her daughter, instead of politely asking us to ask him first, he got angry with us. after we apologized, instead of stopping, he continued to speak to us in a rude tone. we finally rushed out after he called us idiots.

name: Little Jeanne
reviews:
good; super pretty shops full of treasures. ideal for birth gifts, or to treat yourself. everything is beautiful.
i left the 13th a few years ago but continue to order online from time to time.
i have never been disappointed.; reading your comments we realize that sonny angeles drove you crazy!

i went to little jeanne in physics, the shop is charming, the manager is incredibly kind. i got great advice and a very warm welcome with a good customer experience. it has a nice selection of brands for children and adults too.

to return to sonny angeles, we are just facing a reseller who has suffered the setbacks of deliveries from this supplier and who unfortunately has nothing to do with it.

i will happily return to this store; i am for little jeanne!!!! little jeanne is the store where i buy all my gifts for babies and children! i live in suresnes and yet, i don't hesitate to cross paris for births, birthdays... the advice is always super professional. my gifts are a sensation every time. each object found in this pretty boutique is chosen with taste and care. only quality. and for 7 years a few days before christmas, i have been coming to find a little gift also for each adult in my family and i always find, both for young, trendy people (vintage tray, jewelry, candles, handbag...) and for my mom (very pretty poesy wool scarf). thanks !!!! i will always be faithful!; a very charming boutique with a high quality selection, especially for little ones but not only! lots of toys, clothes, very well chosen and varied objects, and a really warm welcome. i recommend!

name: Le Ciel Is Tout Le Monde - Bébés, Enfants
reviews:
great collection of kids plates  (and some adults with a heart of a kid ) - i love their products they are so unique - i return to my home country happy with what i buy; beautiful little store for kids and babies. great selection of toys.; great selection of toys. perfect for a gift.; what pleasure i had in this store
i was greeted with professionalism and patience.
i was able to take photos to send to my sister and make our choices.
a big thank you for this pleasant moment; adorable shop. beautiful quality products at reasonable prices. we want to buy everything!

name: Jardin D'enfants Du Docteur Landouzy
formatted_address: 5 Rue du Dr Landouzy, 75013 Paris, France
reviews: we love this jardin d'enfants ! my son started last september and i find they've been very respectful of his needs and rythtms. i like the class size and how much he has learnt in such a short period of time. there has been good communication with both director and teacher. i recommend this school completely!; my daughter has been attending landouzy kindergarten for 3 years. she finds it an ideal setting to grow and learn. my granddaughter was also there 10 years ago and it is still an amazing place, where children learn with joy. today she is a brilliant high school student!; wonderful establishment: our daughter has been attending school there since last year and is thriving every day thanks to a caring and involved teaching team. gardening, philosophy, music, languages… we couldn’t imagine a more beautiful first school experience!; a place where children are welcomed with great kindness. they grow up in a caring and happy atmosphere. they build a bond of trust with adults that is very useful for the rest of their schooling. the small numbers allow them to acquire a solid foundation before the first grade. our eldest, who is in ce1, had a good time arriving at primary school. the two little sisters are taking advantage or will take advantage of this extra place.; my child has been attending this kindergarten since the small section, and is currently in the large section. being a child with some difficulties, not always fitting into the boxes as they say, we were reassured from the start that she was in a gentler environment, with a caring team. the teachers have a dual skill: being educators of young children, therefore specialized in the development of children aged 3 to 6 years, but also being trained to follow the national education teaching programs. the kindergarten facilitated a smooth transition to kindergarten, allowing each child to integrate and progress at their own pace. it is a human-sized structure, which encourages parental participation. children benefit from foreign language, science, philosophy and music workshops offered by parents. i saw my child flourish and develop a thirst for learning.

name: La Butte Aux Piafs
reviews:
a very quiet cute place for your meal, break, or escape from the day for a moment.
i walked by it twice on different occasions before i decided to sit and have a meal. the server was great, courteous, and helpful. did an amazing job handling a pretty big section, the menu was nice and affordable. this is why this is one of the small places that amazed me in paris.
i sad outside and enjoy lunch, the filet mignon dish was delicious, meat was tender and the fries were to die for. then the waitress took a break and the manager was helping her out taking over her tables in a smooth manner, had the chance to visit the inside and it was nicely, simply, and stylishly done. the design and staff’s “friendliness” made me fool like i was home. i will always stop by this bistro during my visits to paris.
highly recommend it.; visting from florida.  i've eaten here twice now because the food was so good i came back.  the servers and owner are very nice and everything tastes good. i particularly like the caesar salad.  i highly recommend this restaurant!!; the food here was very good, and the price was very reasonable i would highly recommend going to this restaurant if you’re in the area.; what stood out for me was the experience altogether. the food was pretty good and the owner was the kindest man, he even offered us dessert from his end! highly recommended for any travellers!; walking around in the misty rain on way to another place down the block. saw bone marrow on menu. that’s my stop here trigger.

titu, the server, was setting up outside and asked us to step in as he saw i was having a hard time reading menu in the dark.

place had excellent vibe with young newlyweds celebrating their nuptials.

we were given a table for 4, even tho my wife and i were just two. immediately not treating us a tourists

we started with escargot, the bone marrow (huge and filled with an insane amount of wonderfully buttery marrow. took like 10 baguette slices, at least, to finish it off.

valentina had the andouilette and i had the lamb shank.

the andouilette was wonderfully but not overwhelmingly funky and fabulously complemented by the mashed potatoes.

the lamb shank was without a doubt the best i have ever had. as owner of a nyc michelin forchette provençal resto, i’ve had many lamb shanks but not like this. moist, just enough fat and so sweet and herbaceous, i swear i could taste the pasture the sheep grazed in. it came with penne in a very flavorful but not overwhelming and not acidic at all tomato sauce.

as i’m not a huge lover of pasta with tomato sauce i asked for a 1/2 portion of the mashed potatoes which were complementary.

we had a very nice pic saint loup with the meal
