charles, the owner behind the bar, was kind to send us a couple rum digestifs to end our wonderful evening

we left with the rain gone and the evening warm. on way home we found €20 to put a cherry on a wonderful experience

a very special memory

see you all in april

name: Café Brasserie Le Paul Fort
reviews:
i went there to have a breakfast at 10am and they had some options. the omelette with cheese and salad was really good! the taste was really amazing. and because my collegue could speak french, she was talking friendly with the woman there, and she made us try handmade pepper sauce. and it was really delicious. i took one star off because i found a hair on the plate but if you want something like mother or grandma cooked, you will like this place.; well, i tried only the breakfast. the old lady is very pleasant and takes care of her guests, so it is a bit hard for me to write the fair review. i ordered croissant and cappuccino. look at the photo, it is not cappuccino, the taste is awful, i stopped  right after trying. croissant looks just as it tastes. i got fooled by nice reviews, so beware.; awful coffee! un cappucciono terrible. croissants are not   good too. i cannot recommend it for breakfast at all.; very friendly place with fresh dishes.  the owner was very nice.
not expensive. we enjoyed the place!; great food, generous portions and great service. the lady was super nice and her service was outstanding. i would highly recommend!

name: Le Sympathique
reviews: le sympathique is an awesome restaurant. the steak for two was tender and delicious.; nice!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!; very pleasant time with friends, the food is very good and the atmosphere is nice, i would go back.; good little restaurant in gentilly. the boss achou is super nice. the meals are very correct. very interesting value for money. has a terrace.; super warm, welcoming, family and very friendly restaurant. this restaurant is suitable for everyone, since the change of management (around 1 month) this restaurant has regained credibility and it is very pleasant to eat there! i advise you not to focus on people's opinions from more than a month ago because they speak of the old management which is no longer the same today. so i strongly advise you to try it for yourself!!

name: Le Bon Plan
reviews:
the pizza and pasta were both better than i had in italy. the tiramisu and creme brule were both absolutely wonderful. we were also given an appetizer of some olives in some kind of pepper / tomato sauce with bits of cooked pizza dough which was delicious.

this restaurant is so cozy and comfortable. the owner was so gracious and welcoming. easily one of the best meals i've had in europe.; delicious food, perfect services❤️ the host is so kind and friendly; occasionally found this place with friends in the evening. a cooker was also a waiter, he greeted as kindly and even made some jokes! food was really good and in the end that guy even suggested us to switch on our music that was very cute!; it’s basically a hidden gem!!!
this food was one of the best food in paris!!!
i really loved it!
looks not the best but the service and the food is 10/10 ohhh and the price is amazing compare to the other places…
10-15€ a main course and you will get full; i ate there dinner tonight and can honestly say that this is one of the best pizzerias in paris!
the staff was amazing and the pizzas were not only delicious but also heart shaped.
i'll definitely go there again

name: Le Bistrot Du Perigord
reviews:
wonderful evening and dining experience. three of us reserved for dinner and were not disappointed. all chose the 55 euro prix fixe, only 3 or 4 options for each course but a nice range of choices. all our courses were delicious, pictures are of escargot, fish entree, and two desserts-cream brûlée and chocolate cake.
feels like a family run spot with the two brothers taking care of us and very accommodating with our questions and requests. nice selection of reasonably priced wine bottles as well. best to make reservations as it’s a smallish spot.
definitely recommend!!; amazing french onion soup! the duck was cooked and flavored very well! our server was super nice, let us try the wines before ordering a glass. brought us a thing of olive oil & butter for our bread (upon request). olive oil was so good!; a wonderful family restaurant!
we were absolutely pleased with both the service and the food at this charming family restaurant. the atmosphere was welcoming, and the staff made sure everything was perfect. the food was delicious, fresh, and served with care. highly recommended for anyone looking for a great dining experience!

however, we were quite shocked to witness a group of six americans asking for a discount in exchange for a recommendation. such behavior was surprising and out of place, but it didn’t take away from the restaurant’s wonderful quality.

we’ll definitely be back!; a nice little bistro just outside of the hustle and bustle focused on duck recipes, and also traditional favourites like escargot, onion soup, and beef.
quaint, cozy bistro serving traditional french food  and wine. very enjoyable.; one of my best experiences in paris hands down. onion soup was so tasty and delicious then moving onto tournedos rossini which i think is top 3 steaks i’ve ever had in my life. not only the food but also the service was amazing i love how respectful and polite they are with all of their costumers. love the whole family restaurant vibe and highly recommend it if you’re going to paris and willing to try onion soup.

name: Brasao Alesia- Restaurant poulet braisé Paris 14ème
formatted_address: 47 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
very delicious food.  chicken was awesome and cooked perfectly. fresh bread for sandwiches

loved it.; if you eat here plan on them being out of half the menu. no whole chickens, no chicken sandwiches, and when you try to cancel the order they don't know how to give you a refund.
you only serve chicken!; i did well when i asked the service for order recommendations , escalop brasao with green beens. the experience was just delicious, and on top of that it was halal, the restaurant is so modest, the quality of food deserved reminded me of micheline star restaurants, my salutations to the 🧑‍🍳; very delicious foods.
kind staff.
good location.; it’s very delicious and fast delivery! i love their chicken!

name: Breakfast in America - Latin Quarter
reviews:
woah! i have never seen any paris restaurant have so many american tv show or movie. i can tell what is their favorite show or movie. the sign on board was written in english which i was very surprise to see that. i mean i speak english.

the staff was great and friendly personality. the waitress was very good looking and beautiful.
she did a good job service the food and drink.
i enjoy eating american food again. i love burrito, homemade fries, and hot chocolate.

im glad they got a bathroom, but the sink was in a different area and right next to bathroom.; we loved their food! their california french toast was amazing. very nice staff, great service. huge bonus—their tap water is ice cold and is divine (we have not found this anywhere else in paris); highly recommend ! i love this place. the food is excellent and the staff is awesome ! if you are looking for scrambled eggs , real bacon and sausage 😁 , toast , fresh squeezed oj , pancakes and french toast this is the place to visit. love the chicago bears helmet sitting on the shelf. shout out to chef jared pierre from the "chi".; great experience and food at this diner.  service was a dream and the food was excellent!  would highly recommend to anyone in paris.; we went on sunday brunch, which is very popular, and there was a long wait. that was expected and normal. once inside the service was very slow. the food was ok. not great not bad, just ok. the waiter forgot part of our order and we had to wait almost 40 minutes for them to bring it. they had to remind the kitchen about it. it is a very generous 3 stars because the food took way too long for being just ok, but the staff was very friendly. there are way better spots to eat while in paris.

name: Les 400 Coups @ La Cinémathèque française
reviews:
great food with fresh ingredients. they have a changing menu everyday with great soup. the queue can be long at times but it moves very quickly. highly recommend.; what a nice place to have a coffee and snacks!
the cookies are to die for!
good café and great service!; very terrible service. i was ignored by this one waiter all the time. almost got late to the movie due to the time waiting there for service.; a rustic type place next to the cinema, we were desperate for a coffee fix after   travelling on the train from girona. it is also next to parc bercy where we couldn't find any facilities. the coffee didn't disappoint, the place was full of well dressed people waiting to go into the cinema for a film preview.; it’s a horrible place for children, they have a very small, very dirty corner with some toys but the rest is totally not kid friendly. in their deffence at least they have something, paris is horrible to kids, all places are small, dirty, no facilities and unwelcoming for families with small children.

name: L'Aubergeade
reviews:
authentic and traditional french restaurant
have great food and english speaking server.
lobster is nice and canard has a unique and chewy taste. overall is great and would come back again.; the best meal i had in paris, by far. called ahead for a solo seat. had delicious wine, the most incredible foie gras, and the duck breast… i will think about that duck breast for the rest of my life, or until i return for some more 😅. didn’t have room for dessert but they looked great. not at all touristy, owned by local twin brothers who were so kind and friendly to me. merci!!!; delicious french experience.
everything is perfect but the place is a little small. the owner is so friendly and will greet you warmly.
all items we had were delicious (check the pictures!!) and prices are very fair.
don't forget to take your omelette norvégienne for desert !; lively little restaurant. the staff speaks very good english and recommended the wine well. the place is busy and hard to get a table without reservation. the canard is very good.; oh my god! by far the best food i had in paris!! it is a small restaurant so please book ahead. they have few menus, but everything was more than great. the staff is extremely generous and kind, on the friendly page :) and the food, oh the food... i had snails and calamari, and i totally recommend them.

name: Le Moderne
reviews:
excellent place to eat, if you're near the catacombs i highly recommend it. great service from bryan - thank you very much!

i had the salmon and it was delicious; moist and flavorful. it came with a great bearnaise sauce. my friends had the duck and the steak, they both enjoyed them very much.

my table had a red wine (côtes du rhône) which was delicious as well.

overall, this is the best meal i had in paris.

thanks again to bryan! your excellent service made a great meal even better.; casual, but mid-scale dining. my food was so yummy, my husband and i came back a second night. try the duck. friendly staff. decent price. my husband ate the rump steak. he loved it. if you want it well done, be sure to say so. even rare, he loved it.; very friendly and helpful staff, atmosphere is really good! really recommend this place for a place to eat out or drink with friends; i've eaten here several times, everytime has been enjoyable. always the same server too, he is kind and patient with my lack of french. be sure to have the salmon, no matter how its prepared, it is magnificent!!!; our waiter bryan was amazing, the food was superb. if you go the roasted duck is a must!

name: Le Papagallo
formatted_address: 25 Rue des cinq Diamants, 75013 Paris, France
reviews: this unassuming resto bar surprises you with exceptional service and food. a bit out of the way, but so worth it! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️; this place was so much fun. the food was excellent. is the help warm and friendly.; nice pub with friendly staff. good range of drinks and food, but if you have allergies / intolerances, be very specific. they do not have gluten free alternatives.; the drinks where good and cheap but the food kinda killed the place, wasnt good at all!!; amazing restaurant and friendly staff. my wife loved her burger and the special cocktail you made for her thank you

name: La Traversee de Paris
reviews:
delightful restaurant. the steak and salmon were simply prepared, enjoyed by everyone in our party and reasonably priced. desserts were delicious also. we stood out like the tourists we were (there were clearly a few regulars, which felt like a good initial sign) but the staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome.; just happened upon this little gem one night.  it was totally by accident as the place we were going was closed but i'm telling you, this was a great accident.  i got the steak. i don't speak french, my wife does,  so i can't remember what the dish was called, but the steak was huge,  cooked perfectly, and tasted great.  the potatoes were incredible as well.  my wife got the chicken, and she loved it.  what started out as an accident turned into a great experience.  we're planning on going back before we leave.  i definitely recommend.; quaint little spot with ambient lighting, friendly staff and an out of this world chef 👨🏼‍🍳 😋!! food was delicious and 🍸 drinks were too!! left nothing to be desired.  highly recommended spot, be sure to check it out.; mixed feelings about this place. we saw a breakfast menu outside of the place which had : french and british breakfast options. however, a member of staff told us that the british is not available, which was a bit disappointing. why put it on today's menu then ? finally we took the french was which was a croissant, orange juice and coffee. we waited so long for the croissant, apparently the staff member had to the bakery to get them. after, when we wanted to pay, we had to wait long again because he went again for the croissants for next customers... not very well organised.
but the coffee and the juice were good and the place is quite charming. it's very close to gare de lyon.; people are super kind, i loved dishes so much, the price is really good. highly recommend this place 👍👍👍

name: La Maison du Boulevard
reviews:
this place is a must go in paris. the atmosphere may not look fancy but is cozy, and the food quality is definitely one of the best we have had in paris. the duck was absolutely amazing. it was well cooked, juicy and tender. scallop in the risotto was wonderfully cooked to perfection. portion was huge and we hardly could finish. host is very nice and friendly.

we were surprised there were only limited guests in the restaurant and we do think this restaurant deserves to be known more. will definitely come back again when we are back in paris; simply the best french meal we had in 2 weeks. chef is the best and warmest among all restaurants we visited, no matter how many michelin stars they have lol, though we barely see one of them…
we ordered the lamb shank and sea food plate both are perfect. extremely delicious meal and the very fair price you can get from any decent restaurants in paris.

highly recommended to any travelers or even locals who may want to give it a try!; very passionate boss, introduced us the signature food in the restaurant. food are amazing, the sauces of our lamb shank and the snail are amazing, risotto a bit not like the traditional but still acceptable. environment is comfy and clean. highly recommended with high quality french cuisine at reasonable price. the boss also gave us a few free drinks and a feee tapa (salmon and avocado); very nice atmosphere, delicious food, and welcoming stuff. we were offered 2 free starters. great value!; great experience! hearty, tasty and wholesome food with very hospitable owners in a cozy little shoplot. the escargot were large and plump and perfectly done with a butter herb sauce. first time having duck breast cooked medium rare, simply succulent. thank you for the delicious complimentary bread and tartare avocat saumon (raw salmon with avocado)!!

name: Le Cèdre
formatted_address: 2 Rue Roger Salengro, 94270 Le Kremlin-Bicêtre, France
reviews:
le cèdre is the go to destination for lebanese food in paris! i have been going to the original location on rue mouffetard for over 10 years and recently discovered this location on the outskirts of paris.

le cèdre offers authentic lebanese cuisine in a warm and cozy atmosphere. the menu is varied and offers vegetarian and vegan options. all is cooked fresh and served fast.
the portions are generous, the food delicious and full of flavors. the service is impeccable and super friendly. the owner is always kind and always ends up given us free pastries.

the falafel is the best i have ever had and the hummus, truly delicious. the beef dishes are my go to and come with lots of side, white garlic sauce and a salad. i also tried the lebanese lemonade and loved it. check out the pics and menu and make it your go to for lebanese food! either locations are great but the one i went to tonight just has more space.

on top of all this, this is an affordable meal that will only set you back around 20 euros.; the guys are great and the food they make is incredible. it was our first time tasting lebanese food and we are more than satisfied.

we mainly communicated with tony. his english is excellent, he translated the whole menu for us and modified the plate to suit our preferences. we even got their traditional tea after the meal. if you overeat like us, it’s highly recommended to drink it. 😁; lovely lebanese food, really friendly service!; this restaurant is exceptional for several reasons. the food is excellent and generous. the staff is friendly and can speak english fluently. i was attended to by samir, who took the time to guide me and answer all of my questions, even when the restaurant was full and there were some people waiting in line. it's a must if you're staying here in paris. i felt very comfortable there. the tips are shared among all the staff if you're considering leaving one.; brilliant food, reminded me of my two holidays in lebanon. really helpful staff who helped us pick just the right amount of food (with translations!). great value too - that’s a big compliment in paris!

name: Jin Xin Lou
formatted_address: 63 Rue de l'Amiral Mouchez, 75013 Paris, France
reviews: don’t be fooled by the modest decor.  food was delicious with beautiful presentation.  we got the french tasting menu.  chef apparently trained under a famous michelin starred chef.  would come back again to this hidden gem.; exceptional dishes with full of flavors! beautiful presentation of the dishes. and very generous portions!! friendly atmosphere with great service!; fantastic discovery, very nearby to cité uni. a chinese restaurant where the son of the owner studied also french haute cuisine with a starred chef . all staff - i guess family - looked after me very kindly. fantastic food, tasting menu 39 euros. high quality and very convenient for paris prices.  i will go again and i warmly suggest it.; great experience! you need to reserve before if you want to test the amazing food of the chef (who used to work in a michelin stared restaurant) i’m sure i’d be back again, with friends and family! highly recommend!; the restaurant looks like a mom&pop chinese restaurant, but the meals and services were excellent !

name: Chez Lili et Marcel
reviews:
delicious entrecote, fresh fries and salad, flavorful sauce! it's a cozy place in a good location. the staff is attentive and professional. we visited 2 times, and we'll definitely come back.; nope: never again. €5.50 for a diluted coffee. the whole place is very noisy, right next to the train tracks. while it is across the river. you could actually find more restaurants and cafes at the river side across the street.; great place to go for a drink. the waiters were absolutely accommodating and efficient. very lovely. the place could do with more vegan options though. prices were fair for the capital. very easy to reach by metro and all.; the services is so poor, the steak is not special, too hard to process; nice place to eat around the clock!

so apparently the place opens quite long every day. we came around 11pm and they were still serving warm foods. the prices were nice, i could even say it was cheap for paris. they also have some wine options but were not that much, and variety.

i ordered the steak (8/10), it was maybe around 220g of meat served with some salad and fries, it was good, i ordered medium and they came also in medium so it was nice.
my friend ordered a chicken tandoori (7,5/10) they should've just change the name into something else, bc the indian taste in that food was quite gone haha. but i mean it wasn't that bad, it was just when u read a name and it didn't turn out like what u expected, its bit disappointing. well anyway.

i drank sauvignon blanc from some winery it wasn't taste good, maybe i use to good wines from germany:d

i loved their tiramisu though. it was huge, without alcohol (which i found better than with), lot of mascarpone instead of the biscuits, it was just the way i liked it, so yummy!

if u look for some affordable, nice, and open around the clock- place to eat, then come here, its located also next to a metro station, so u won't have difficulty to find it.

name: TournBride
reviews: the charcuterie was delicious, especially the pâté. duck confit was also excellent, fall of the bone. the potatoes were probably the best i've had in any restaurant.; randomly came here and tried one of the best dishes during my trip. it's quite a small place. they have a regular menu and some daily/weekly special items. very well-seasoned and delicious food. my favorite is the duck (if i remember correctly) with wine sauce and mashed potato. it's really amazing! it's the special item so i don't remember the dish name.; i had the duck confit and it was delicious! the service was lovely and the wine paired so nicely with the dish. highly recommend this restaurant.; very nice restaurant & brasserie. we had lunch with 3. burger, salad, shrimp cocktail. dessert & café. quality of everything was great. and a super friendly service as well. we had the window-table inside, so brilliant view on the street live, even during bad weather. prices were absolutely reasonable. we will definitely be back…; expérience incroyable new years eve 2023 special menu.  one of the best meals we had in paris. food was amazing, eight happy tummies. our waiters didier and serge  looked after us very well ❤️.  they both have been top class👏. we will definitely come visit again next time we're in paris .. mirela m.

name: Au Moulin à Vent
formatted_address: 20 Rue des Fossés Saint-Bernard, 75005 Paris, France
reviews:
we had high hopes for au moulin à vent, given its inclusion in timeout’s recent piece on the best bistros of paris. the place was less than half full at lunchtime which made our reservation probably unnecessary however david our wonderful server who’s probably the manager told us it gets much busier in the evening.

we love the intact decor of vintage 1946 vibes, which includes red banquettes, wine barrel light fixtures and rows upon rows of wine bottle gracing the room.

for starters we had veloute of courgette and ouefs mayonnaise, both startlingly underseasoned to the extent that i felt self-conscious with my over use of the salt shaker. in spite of the lack of salt of both dishes, i could tell that there was good quality ingredients involved. i love the mustard of the mayonnaise and the shower of spring onions and parsley on the eggs as well as something crunchy that could be fried onion.

our mains were bouef bourguignon and magret canard, the latter which was a beautiful duck breast cooked to perfection, yielding juicy red meat with deep flavor. rather than potatoes, jules chose sautéed veg and mushrooms, which were a perfect and fresh accompaniment to the meat. my beef oddly lacked the rosy hue that one would expect from having been stewed for hours in bourguignon. in spite of that detail the beef was fairly tender, and the mushrooms cooked with it were delightful however as with the soup and the eggs, a healthy sprinkling, and then re-sprinkling and another re-sprinkling of salt were necessary to enhance the flavor of the meat and its accompanying sauce. while i would’ve preferred mash, the rice was actually a really gentle and appropriate bed for the stew.

we ended our meal with the highly praised profiterole dessert which was quite good with a warm and very light chocolate sauce poured over the ice cream filled choux.

all in all we enjoyed our meal, the good service and the vintage ambience of au moulin à vent.; i’ve been dining at “le moulin à vent” every time i visit paris with my girlfriend for the past eight years, and it never disappoints. last night was no exception. the “plat du jour” was a shoulder of lamb, which we decided to try, and it was absolutely exquisite. our italian waiter, fluent in several languages, made the experience even more special—he was incredibly friendly, welcoming, and had an impressive knowledge of wine. this place isn’t your typical pretentious french restaurant; the atmosphere was vibrant and lively. highly recommended!; everything is delicious.
it's a must to have the escargots,  os a moelle, and the profiterole for dessert.
make sure to make a reservation if you dont want to miss out on an amazing culinary experience in paris .; the best bistro on earth prior to international discovery, as simple as, thanks to the gorgeous team, theo and the other fabulous. a bit overrpriced more and more compare to few years ago. plates shrinking, prices rising, but chartreuse forever.; i was seated  in a tight corner beside two very unpleasant people. there were plenty of other places to be seated. i felt that because i was alone, i was placed “out of the way”. i was so happy when they paid and left. i had been looking forward to coming to your restaurant for weeks. everyone was pleasant, the food was superb. i wish more thought had been given to my situation in the restaurant. i did have a long standing reservation.

name: Café Resto “Les Jolies Mômes”кафе возле дома
reviews:
tourist trap! the waiter charged us 14€ for 2 beers (25cl) when te original price is 8,60€… we complained about it and he paid us back the rest…not recommended; very good cheeseburger. staff are very friendly; i'm really bad at french
in spite of going straight to the bar and buying there charged 'salle' that is on the table, not 'comptain' that is on the bar. will never go there again!! a pity because we are staying for 6 days and are accommodated just around the corner...; sometimes kitchen is close early and you don't get the food, but bier is good from the barrel. they have a big screen tv.; from the kitchen to the boss without forgetting the musicians, the whole staff of les jolies mômes are simply my friends. as a canadian in paris, they have been my family far from home from the minute i opened their door. this place is a magnet as well as a haven for the traveller where they will be welcomed with openmindness, keen interest and benevolence. so full of warmth, humanity, interesting people that it can easily become addictive 😉
one of these too rare bars where drinking a glass of wine feels like you took an ecstasy.

name: L'ile Aux Singes
reviews:
quaint restaurant and bar. fantastic atmosphere and very attentive staff. we never wanted for anything. we ordered mixed drinks to start, perfectly balanced. the food was quick and cooked exactly as requested. we ended with coffee and desert, our daughter loves tiramasu and she commented that it was the best in paris. a+; amazing!! service was great! food was good, tiramisu was amazing!!
the restaurant was very cute with a sunroom in the front. not busy at all, and food came quick. owner was very kind and was very quick to respond to any need. loved it!; a darling little restaurant with a charming atmosphere.  i had a delicious espresso martini and my caesar salad was very tasty. the tiramisu was very good along with the coffee.  i am from the states, but hope to get back there again before i leave.  the service was friendly, welcoming and very attentive.   great experience!!!; stopped by for a quick afternoon apero...the meteor beer was refreshing and the mojito correct.; nice french bistro, good service and normal prices.

name: Le Pretexte
reviews:
little bistrot/ café/ restaurant.
nice to have a drink with collègues, great food, coffee is good.
it maybe a bit pricy for what it is, but today when i went with my wife the waiters were very friendly. they allowed to share 1 dish together a steak tartare which was perfectly seasoned.

our friend had a caesar salad and really liked it.; this place is an apt window into parisian nightlife. the atmosphere is welcoming, intimate and vivacious, especially during its thursday jazz nights. my friends and i were bopping away to the jaunts, and the band's singer had a great conversation with us afterwards. staff members always welcome you at the door. food- and drink-wise, it also serves well. i'd definitely visit this place again next time i'm in paris, and recommend it to anybody wanting a slice of night in paris.; best breakfast in paris! everything was fresh and yummy😍; the waiters are so rude. it takes too much time to bring the order and not welcoming as you are not from france and from the english speaking country!! not recommended at all!!!; a really nice bar. the service is good and the good too. a little bit of communication issues but other than that very good

name: Dudule
reviews:
it was the first meal we had on our first day in paris and luckily they were not bad. the only dish we didn't enjoy was the risotto mainly due to our own taste and preferences. although their snails were a bit pricey especially to foreigners, but they were good!

at first we thought we wasn't welcomed as no one was asking us in / how many people, but perhaps it's due to the language barriers and we wasn't really sure how french restaurants work in terms of services (whether we wait for waiters to come or we choose our own seats). after we got settled down, the services were surprisingly good!

* the waitress with a braided hair (unsure of her name) who took our order asked us whether we wanted dessert at the end of our meal but due to my family not being able to understand english fully, i repeated what she said to my family and she mistakenly thought i was correcting her pronunciation 🥲. if the owner is reading this, please show her this and let her know that her service is superb and so is her english!!! i could tell that she was a bit frustrated / upset but we were rushing to other places and i left without getting the chance to explain it to her!! 🥹; nice sit down place with great food. we got the 'to share' smoley samin platter. im forgetting the exact name but it came with a bunch of items including spring rolls as well. everything taste really good.; went there once on holiday , the atmosphere is phenomenal , the waiter guy is friendly , the foood is good with the combo make it very affordable.overall 10/10 rating tbh; best café so far that i’ve tasted in paris !
a big shoutout to lucie and helder for their kindness and prefect service !
very nice cocktails as well btw !

its a must to go !!; the worst meal i've ever had in any country. no flavor, overcooked pasta.

why is my carbonara swimming?

i'm mad this was almost 20 euros

name: LA GAULOISE PARIS
formatted_address: 59 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
eight of us had a memorable dinner at this place, everyone of us ordered the full course which includes the dessert. one of us ordered the beef but the staff didn’t ask for the medium or medium rare on the beef.

in terms of the service wise, we were served by a french guy at first who passed us the menu and afterwards was managed by another guy. overall experience on the food was superb as elderly were satisfied with it.; perfect foie gras and onion soup. we hunted for the best classic french food and found it here. presentation of the dishes was chic. setting was beautiful too, like something from a movie. the lovely female waiter was so kind as well.
the cocktails could be fresher/have more of a kick, but the food trumps any drawback with the drinks.
overall, fantastic dining.; me and my partner came here to celebrate our anniversary. unfortunately, we were extremely disappointed by the food and the service, even though after checking the reviews online, our expectations were high.

firstly, the waiter was extremely cold and unwelcoming. we felt as if no-one wanted us there. he didn’t even bother bringing us napkins and placed our cutlery on the dirty table. the menus we got were paper, ones that previously had gotten wet, because they were wrinkled and the ink had spilled. (the restaurant had normal, big menus with proper covers, but for some reason we were the only ones who got the paper ones)

secondly, the food was awful, although at first it looked promising. our dishes were tasteless and unseasoned. it was extremely disappointing, because the dishes are not cheap. i’m just glad, i didn’t get anything more pricier. complete and utter waste of money. we decided to skip on dessert because of the quality of our dinner.

the only good thing here was the wine, it was delicious.

what was supposed to be a romantic evening, quickly was turned sour by incredibly unwelcoming service, complete ignorance and god awful food. this was the worst service we’ve received and the worst food we’ve eaten our entire trip.; this restaurant didn't meet our expectations. the snails were disappointing, and while the duck was decent, the service was lacking. the crème brûlée tasted like it had gone bad, so i didn't eat it. we experienced long wait times, and it felt like the waiter was rushing to get rid of us. on the positive side, the wine was excellent, and the prices were reasonable.; a nice choice to go if you want taste traditional french food. we ordered the foie gras, the onion soup and snails for the starter. and beef steak, brass and duck drumstick for the main dishes. they are really delicious!

name: Chez Papa Montparnasse - Denfert 14ème
reviews:
after watching olympics games, there were only very few places with kitchen open at 11pm. so chez papa came handy, offering a long list of options. in this perspective, it is very tourist-friendly.
heard it is a famous local french fast food chain. and indeed french it turned out to be. my favorite part is they served roasted potatoes over lettuce alongside a foie gras burger, lol. yeah why do we need fried chips to add more feeling of guilt? let the lettuce balances the scale.
back to the food. you could go heavy or light. my friend’s pappadelle with foie gras was decent, not over greasy. my wife orders a salad bowl and it was served warm, with cooked beans and eggs.
maybe not an impressive gourmet spot, but it saves the tourists’ kitchen work.; the food was good but we were given dirty cups so i must minus the service star. also they dont speak english much, an unfortunate for sll the travelers. the atmosphere is brilliant with the weather and the wind and i do not have anything to complain about. the portion is huge so be aware guys. also try the steak and the foie gras, it id expensive but it is worth every bite. by the way every dishes have potatoes as side dishes…; this was our first bistro in paris. we were jetlagged and hungry. boy did it hit the spot. we had the escargot served papa style de shelled and in a cream sauce, the formule (set menu for entree, dessert and coffee)

everything was delicious needless to say.

pictures from left to right :
escargot papa and chicken and cheese au gratin. this was more than enough for 2. the apple tart however had cold spots and was not thoroughly warmed all the way through.; delicious and authentic french food, abundant portions, very friendly personnel. pleasant atmosphere. tasty cassoulet, perfect for colder autumn days!; a hidden gem!! thank you for starting off my paris experience amazingly!!

this place looks like a small, family-owned business, located right next to a cemetery, so our expectations were pretty low.

however, all the food they served was extraordinary!! there are mostly duck-related options, with different, exquisite sauces, including some personal recipes. they are all accompanied by sauteed potatoes, which were very nicely prepared!

they have a nice desert choice which is "4 random mini-deserts", which we enjoyed for a fair price.

the atmosphere was also nice, and the waiters were friendly. both the waiters and the menus were english-friendly.

we werw here on a monday evening without a reservation. however, the place is quite small, so i wouldn't expect it to be free during more touristic times.

thank you! totally recommend!

name: Le Café du Commerce
reviews:
this restaurant is a classic french bistro, but what sets it apart is its straightforward, uncomplicated menu. when you walk in, you're immediately struck by the stunning open space above you, a reminder that this place was once a department store before it was transformed into a restaurant. as i glanced around at other tables before ordering, i noticed most people had chosen escargots and the traditional french onion soup, which clearly suggests they are the most popular dishes.
the service was slow at first, though it became more attentive as the meal went on. the food was enjoyable, though not exceptional—good but nothing that really stood out. overall, i'd say the main reason to visit this restaurant is for the charming atmosphere and the very reasonable prices.; my family and i had a very pleasant time! the meal was delicious, everything was clean, and the service was great!
we were attended to as soon as we arrived, and the waiter was very friendly and patient, even speaking in another language when we had difficulty understanding the menu!
i recommend it and will definitely return.; we had a lovely evening. food was delicious and the service on point. normal portions size on a reasonable prices. very tasty french onion soup, sea bass and beef steak. recommend it!; le parisian perfection!!! 📌
le café du commerce is a quintessential parisian dining experience. the service is impeccable; the staff is knowledgeable, attentive, and effortlessly charming. this was a selection from a local and colleague that lives in paris.
the food is a symphony of flavors. each dish is a masterpiece, showcasing the finest ingredients and impeccable culinary technique. from the delicate starters to the rich and satisfying mains, every bite was a pure delight. the wine list is extensive, offering something for every palate.
the ambiance is classic parisian, with a touch of modern elegance. it’s the perfect place to savor delicious food, enjoy great company, and soak up the parisian atmosphere.; i was there twice!!! amazing service, delicious food. such a cute aesthetic spot, three stories high! i tried my first escargot there and boy did i love them! they also did something special for my birthday! they made it so great!

name: PUB St GERMAIN
formatted_address: 17 Rue de l'Ancienne Comédie, 75006 Paris, France
reviews:
really nice pub/restaurant down one of the many parisian side streets.  we called in by chance around 8pm in wednesday and was able to get a nice table for four on the ground floor 👍
the pub has 3 floors and has quite a quirky layout (which is not a bad thing), lots of space with lots of cool fixtures and fittings - just a really cool, relaxed vibe about it.
service was quick and friendly 👍  menu is not too large but has a good mix of food to suit most palates.  camembert & fig starter and the fish (cod) & chips were excellent 😎
drinks selection is good (they have brooklyn lager 💙).
price is pretty reasonable 👍; nice pub with something for everyone. good bites, great beverages, and screens if you're trying to catch a match.
service from a lovely gal at the bar was delightful. she even made me my first st germain spritz. delicious. am i a parisian yet?
😉; "i visited pub st. germain and was disappointed. the service was painfully slow, and the mussels were a real letdown — they were tiny, barely the size of pistachios yet a commercial quantity but that doesn’t change the quality. they were dry to top it off with zero of the so called sauce, the bacon had been so over cooked it basically turned to ash in your mouth, while the atmosphere was pleasant, it wasn't enough to make up for the overall experience."; might be the best place in paris to watch the roland garros (french open). many big tvs in both restaurant and bar, and able to put on multiple games to keep everyone happy. very comfortable seating and atmosphere, both inside and out and great bar food and drink selection.; the food is ok. the prices are a bit high, but you can watch the matches here. too bad romania lost with belgium today.

name: Odessa
reviews: food was on average overpriced like many comments said. coffee was good but food tasted bland overall. the waiter with no hair single handedly ruined the whole meal experience for us being rude when the card machine mysteriously rejected all 3 of our credit cards (we later used our cards elsewhere and they’re all working fine). he did not troubleshoot their card machine at all, instead very rudely rushed / forced us to pay in cash in the end and even gave us back 10 cents less in change.; was walking along the morning market and came across this cafe. decided to take our breakfast there. they have 2 sets, parisian and american. croissants and eggs were nicely cooked and nice. the server was a bit impatient and come across as rude.; beautiful establishment with amazing service. the food and drinks were also really good.; incredible experience here. my fiancé and i enjoyed a nice lunch meal here during our second week stay in paris. everything was beyond delicious and the server (english speaking) provided amazing hospitality and recommendations. our server, naïm  was humorous, kind and very knowledgeable about the menu. very vibrant outdoor seating area. i had this incredible lamb rack that server recommended and my fiancée had a chicken wrap that was surprisingly filling. the server also provided us great wine pairings as well. i highly recommend!; lovely, welcoming cafe with a lively atmosphere.  tim was a very warm waiter who spoke perfect english and didn’t make me feel like a tourist!  cheese plate was very filling and wine was good.  definitely recommend.

name: Auto Passion Café
reviews:
honestly if i could give more then 5 stars, i would. the place is amazing for any car, racing or formula 1 fan. it’s definitely a must visit if you’re a fan of anything with an engine and it’s so full of history.
i was told by one of the employees that the renault on the ceiling was an actual second car used by the renault formula 1 team, just crazy
the staff was also very lovely and kind and we were served pretty fast given the place was full
this place is going to be at the top of my list every time i come to paris; incredible place for formula 1 fans!!! staff speaks english. recommend you to reserve place for you, because in rush hours it could be a lot of people.; the ultimate venue for any pizza affectionados looking for an auto-themed night out.  good selection of beers, but the pizzas were outstanding!

will definitely visit montparnasse again during my next visit just for the pizza here.; we had the fish and chips and a pizza and they were both amazing! the pizza dough was so good.
the staff was really nice and the decoration is very interesting if you like cars. if you don't, you will also like it because it's very cozy.
i definitely recommend this place!; had a dinner with 8 people. everybody was happy with their food (my medium burger was well done, but it was still good). i was a bit suspicious about the food considering the interior of the place but the whole food experience was really 5/5. the place is a bit expensive compared to many others around but it was actually worth it.

name: Café Daguerre
formatted_address: 4 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
10/20/2024

solid breakfast, the orange juice was fresh and pulpy. i enjoyed my cheese omelette too. the service was good but maybe a little rushed, but still very good. the price was right too, 12€ for a lot of food; not using a real espresso machine, which i didn't notice until i tasted the "flat white" i was brought and it had no flavor. the omelette tasted of nothing and was so full of cheese i almost gagged while chewing it. the only good thing was the croissants, which they brought in from the bakery next door... it's maybe fine as a bar, but better skip at breakfast time.; nice place in the neighborhood, best for happy hours , friendly server, and good appetizers .
you must try it.; i cannot praise café daguerre nearly enough for their exceptional breakfast experience! from the moment we stepped in, we were greeted warmly by the staff and seated promptly in a cozy and inviting atmosphere.

oh, the food! so much food! we needed 2 tables  (no joke) to fit everything they brought to us  every bite was a symphony of flavors. the omelette was perfectly cooked, fluffy, and packed with melted cheese. the croissant was flaky and buttery, just as it should be, and paired perfectly with the freshly baked baguette. and let's not forget about the fresh squeezed juice - it was like sipping sunshine in a glass, bursting with vibrant flavors and nutrients. and of course, the coffee was divine, providing the perfect caffeine kick to start the day.

but what truly sets the café apart was the impeccable service. the staff went above and beyond to ensure that every guest felt welcome and attended to. their attention to detail and genuine hospitality made my dining experience truly unforgettable.

if you're looking for a delicious and delightful start to your day, look no further than café daguerre. trust me, you won't be disappointed!; absolutely fantastic beef bourguignon  casserole.  best i've ever had. the fillet steak my mrs got was amazing too. lovely staff and the coffee milkshake is to die for.

name: Le Bouquet d'Alesia - Restaurant Paris 14
formatted_address: 75 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
we visited this bar on several occasions during our stay. they offer a variety of food, drinks and cocktails on the menu at reasonable prices. food was tasty with a generous portion size, and staff were friendly and accommodating.; a decent enough bite to eat, filled a hole. not the biggest food selection but it was cooked well. i had the ham and cheese omelette with chips. staff were very friendly, welcoming and attentive.; came here for sunday breakfast.
staff friendly and efficient and the restaurant itself is a lovely place to sit and relax. lots of people on their own and i understand why and would happily do this.
food great by uk standards but i’ve had better meals in paris. i had the cottage cheese and granola - nice but quite small and nothing special for euro 7.50, the avocado on toast my daughter had was large but relatively expensive at euro 16. the set meals if you want more to eat look much better value.; we started with a coffee and then saw reviews, and the food looked great. we tried the chicken burger and we loved it.; really delicious! only bone to pick was that they didn’t let us order from the kids menu, but that’s understandable. overall good food.

name: Café de la Place
reviews: deborah was so kind and thoughtful with us! she was patient with our lack of french and helped us choose what to get. the place is well located and super cute. perfect for a coffee and people watching with some sweets.; nice restaurant! lamb chops were a poor cut. very fatty and hard to eat. that should not be served to people. good drinks.; came here for lunch with two friends. we all ordered the farm raised chicken with fries and a salad. the food was good but nothing exceptional. very typical french brasserie that caters to tourists. beautiful and welcoming decor. my portion size was small and the chicken skin could have been cooked slightly longer. a bit pricey at €17.; what a surprising place close to the train station. the food is absolutely delicious, homemade mayonnaise, melting-in-the-mouse beef, and really inexpensive for the area. they serve quickly (1h total) as we had a train to catch. on the top of that, decoration is really cute with plenty of lights thru the windows fully recommended.; long, leisurely lunch on the patio, with great people watching, good vibe, friendly and fun staff, yummy food… grilled octopus was excellent! a great place after a visit to montparnasse cemetery

name: Coffee Club
reviews:
came here for dinner since i wanted a ceasar salad. it was decent but a little pricy for what it offered. also had a cocktail and that was good. there was a book event going on but i was just there for the food and there was no issues.; nice little brunch place next to the jardin du luxembourg. there is a nice menu with diverse choices from burgers, to toasties, to classic american breakfasts. the taste is good but i didn’t feel it was anything crazy neither. prices are alright and not too expensive neither which is nice.; the place is nice and the food is good. the staff is ok. it is overall a nice place, where you better take your time, and reasonably priced.

the french fries where really good.
unfortunately, we had some half burnt pancakes and too cooked crispy chicken.

we were a party of 7 + a child, ate plentiful and paid around 280€.; i would rate this as a solid “fine”. it’s a place that has potential, the atmosphere is good and the service is excellent.
but the food is really “mid”,
it feels like they are charging as much as a normal portion but giving you kids portions. the food wasn’t even that good or that bad it’s just not really what you’re expecting with the menu, the prices and the american style.

i would stay away from the heuvis rancheros, the tortilla was impossible to cut through.; i don't get homesick as much as many american expats, but i have to admit this place rang some nice bells for me. high-quality american diner cooking, which i sometimes still crave.

hamburgers without pretense, milkshakes that taste like real milkshakes, and much better fries than i'm accustomed to in paris.

the service is very friendly, bordering on jovial.

all around, a solid spot.

name: Le Titi Touareg
reviews:
unfortunately we did not take any pictures of our meal but the service was excellent and the food was amazing. super kind waiter and the beer was about the only thing i did capture a pic of. our daughters burger had so much flavor and my wife ordered a soup with couscous and they raved about it. i ordered the meat of the day and it was good. the whole block was so warm and friendly.; extremely friendly staff and great food. for a small hunger you can take a small plate (ham and cheese with an awesome french baguette) and it will be just great. totally recommended to visit!; lovely cafe and excellent service. it has a real community vibe.
victor served me both times i visited. he was really nice and spoke to me in english so i didn't feel uncomfortable for not being able to speak french.; we enjoyed a very good experience and the dishes were very good. also, the service team were very welcoming with their sense of humour.
best of luck; very good food and nice service. that said, i think it's a bit pricy.

name: PB Poulet Braisé
reviews: taste, variety and service make for the very best meal. our server memo,spoke english which we are thankful for, and he attended to us with a smile. our family of all ages was pleased and well satisfied with everything on the menú.  from chicken wings, chicken burger, sweet plantain wraps , creamy pasta, the whole menú was delicious.; thank you for the excellent service and delicious meal today especially to mahyra and aminata.everything was on point—from the warm welcome to the perfectly prepared food. i’ll definitely be back soon!; good to foreigners & they serve good food and portion size; mimo top👍 service the best; amazing food and fantastic service

name: Chicken Street Montrouge Naan & Fried Chicken
reviews: a better fast food doesnt exist in the world. i would fly the whole world just to eat this. recommend it for everybody,give it a try and it wont dissapoint you.; one of the best meals i had in paris till date. both the chicken and the naan tasted exceedingly delicious. it was the actual naan and not an ordinary tortilla wrap which you will find everywhere in paris at the kebab shops saying it's a naan. this is a must try food chains and you will definitely be not disappointed.; my mans hooked me up with more delicious chicken than i ordered; we ordered via deliveroo bucket of chicken wings and tendres for 30€ and what we got left me disgusted. chicken wings with hairs, tenders undercook, soggy and with horrible taste. fries was cold. seeing others comments here makes me doubt your hygiene and interest in what you serve to your customers.; good quick food, people are helpful!

name: Palais d'Orléans
reviews:
it is an asian restaurant with very good taste. everything is delicious, not expensive, inside the restaurant is clean. sitting and eating in the shop is very convenient. if you go at noon, you may have to wait in line for an available table. the restaurant is near porte d orlean station. my family and i ate here several times for dinner when visiting paris.; a very friendly and tasty place:-)
i was staying in the neighborhood and looking for a late night dinner

many choices of food, friendly owners, proper area to dine in if you want or take away as you wish!

enjoyed the different small dishes very much. recommend!; nice place, where you can rest for a while eating decent food , provided by nice people .
what else ?; gracious owners. food was excellent with tasty fried rice, curry fish and chicken with black mushrooms. we sat outside in lovely weather and people watched.; very nice and quiet place,people were very polite.the food was perfect and the prices low enough .i suggest it to you!

name: Au P'tit Zinc
reviews: feels really homey. great traditional french food, served by a very welcoming staff that makes you feel like you’re eating in their home kitchen. the owner eric has incredible energy, zipping around the restaurant and tending to all the customers, many of whom are clearly regulars who keep coming back. he took really good care of us and despite my broken french, he filled us with great food and laughter.; authentique french expérience ! the owner is there every day. food had good portions and was tasty, desert was nice too. very friendly, easy going atmosphere, there was a guy playing guitar which was super nice, and then i guest decided to sing. really nice atmosphere. highlyly recommended.; amazing and charismatic service, superb food and the best desserts i’ve had in paris so far. the strawberry tiramisu is mind blowing. 🤌; a gem in the 14th. great team, great atmosphere and great food. i went alone and will be back with others. just go; fresh food , splendid welcoming, great meal, unknown but excellent restaurant draft biers. i simply loved the place. i will consider this place as one of the best parisian restaurants around montparnasse. highly highly recommended

name: Le Suffren
reviews:
i seen lobster in the window and wanted it. i was highly disappointed when i sat down and noticed they were selling half a grilled lobster, which was small i might add, for 39 euro.

that said, i switched to the sea-bass. i seen someone with it and it looked good. i also asked the waiter and he recommend. it was very good. one in our party still got the lobster and complained about the size and price. the salmon dish was also good. last but not least one person got the french onion soup which he said was cheesy and good as well.

as far as the atmosphere, it’s tight in there. had to move a table for people to sit down. also, the smoking sucked, as usual.; a memorable experience from start to finish. we were dining as a big group, and from the moment we stepped into the restaurant, we were immediately greeted by one the staff at the restaurant who made everyone feel welcomed, even the young ones in our party.

service was professional and felt sincere, and they really did their best to make sure their guests felt comfortable and looked after.

the food was delicious. everyone in our group loved the food. beautifully seasoned and expertly executed dishes.

it was a beautiful way to end our paris vacation and made a positive lasting impression. will definitely be dining here again in the future.; great customer service.  the server did not rush us order and the portions were quite large.  food quality was outstanding.  crepe flambeed with cointreau was delicious.; very nice place. we were not that hungry so we ordered a few smaller meals like onion soup, fish soup and caesar salad, and everything was fresh and tasty.
i was expecting the fish soup to be a bouillon with fish parts, but it was a crème soup instead; i cannot blame the restaurant for my mistake.
caesar salad was very good but was missing some croutons.
onion soup was tasteful, but be aware that the amount of cheese on top is huge, what makes the soup pretty salty.
the staff was extremely friendly.; very nice place 👍🏻 even though it’s located in a very touristy area it’s does not feel that way at all! a lot of local people eating there which a good sign. very friendly stuff and food is really great. we paid 60€ for two for 2 course meal which is really isn’t expensive!

can definitely recommend this place!

name: Restaurant Farouche
reviews: really great dining experience. good staff, very good food. i would go back in a heartbeat. only thing i would not get again was the house made lemonade. it was essentially just soda water. no citrus flavor.; such a lovely find! we tried this restaurant after the high reviews and it did not disappoint! i enjoyed the focaccia starter, it was deconstructed and focused on the fresh ingredients, then the sea bream and pavlova for dessert. we had the wine pairing which enhanced the dishes perfectly! excellent service! would go back!; simply! we reserved a table for dinner for 3 pax. we ordered all the dishes from the menu, we wanted to try everything, we didn't want to skip anything. all the food was outstanding, although some dishes stood out more with their layered flavors. the service had minor difficulties, but that does not diminish the overall experience! we discovered the restaurant on the internet, and we still recommend it! i will remember one dish for a long time; artichoke soup, chorizo, spices ... wonderful!; incredible food. it's our favorite restaurant in all of paris. you really get extremely fine cuisine and fresh ingredients for the price. we have been coming here since it was called aubergine et cie. the chefs really have a creative mindset and have been consistently good. desserts were especially incredible pastry with cream of rose and grapefruit sorbet and other guest had a cherry and rhubarb poêlée with a fresh milk ice cream. out of this world; i was looking for a restaurant to celebrate my birthday, i chose it thanks to the great online reviews. the food was delicious,the wait people were friendly & efficient. we loved the way the chef would come to ensure that everything was going well. all my friends said they shall definitely return.

name: Café Arthur et Juliette
reviews:
myself and my friend stopped by here recently and had a juice and i took a thé gourmand. the service is quite slow but the staff were actually very nice. they brought out water to my dog too which always appreciate.; excellent. food was tasty, service was good. it has a great atmosphere. not much to dislike! salmon poke bowl was especially excellent.; a place in the corner with terrace and nice view to the park.
there's a formule or menu for weekdays but also a lot of options between burgers, salads and other dishes.
prices are average for paris but i think we'll served.; i needed a place to charge my phone before my train ride, and the staff kindly showed where i could plug it in. thanks to their kind service i wanted to give them a nice review though i did not have their meals. everyone seemed like they were enjoying their meals and service as well. next time i'm here, i will definitely bring in my friends and eat their meals!; fantastic little find opposite parc georges-brassens.

very friendly staff who spoke english, even though we did try and order in limited french.

nice decor and a friendly vibe to it.

reasonably priced and the food was great.

inside and outside seating available.

name: Zéro Zéro Sèvres
reviews:
positive: free mouse show
negative: no commercial gesture, bad faith employees, frozen pizza; hit the spot!! we we’re looking for somewhere to eat dinner and two other restaurants nearby were fully booked or closing. this was about 8:30pm/9pm. and this place did not disappoint. i really enjoyed the escargots and the steak with egg was also good. the chips were amazing! i had the strawberry mojito which was good. staff were friendly, reasonably priced. i left satisfied.; friendly brasserie. we stopped in for a late lunch. the server speaks a little english, but he made up for it with his friendliness. the food was good and reasonably priced for the neighborhood. my friends had the beef bourgogne, and i had the pork filet with mustard sauce. we washed it down with the house wine.  we would come back.; i like here because  they serve " bertillon" ice cream. some of the meals are good, but the onion soup i ate the other day was too salty and overcooked, so i left it.  the tartare dish was delicious.
comfortable restaurant.; my boeuf bourguignon was authentic and delicious! i asked for green beans instead of mashed potatoes and the waitress happily complied. good for people watching too.

name: L'impératif
reviews:
i had dinner with a few friends for an anniversary, and unfortunately, the experience was far from satisfying.

while the atmosphere of the restaurant was pleasant, the service, food quality, and execution were severely lacking.

first, the service was unprofessional. we had to wait a long time before placing our orders, and it took about 30 minutes for the food to arrive afterward. there were also some mistakes made by the server, which i won’t go into detail about.

as for the food quality, it was disappointing. the pasta wasn’t fresh, the chicken was too dry, the burrata lacked freshness, and both the lamb and other meats were excessively fatty. overall, the food was of low quality, especially considering the high prices.

regarding food preparation, none of my friends who ordered steak or lamb received the cooking they requested. one friend asked for his lamb to be cooked medium rare, but it was so undercooked that it was practically raw, with blood dripping as he ate. the french fries were decent, but overly greasy.

to top it all off, we brought a cake to celebrate our friend's anniversary. when we asked if they could store it in a cooler, they charged us 20 euros for the service.

there’s significant room for improvement in several areas for this restaurant to live up to its potential.; a fair place to eat if you’re in the neighborhood and you have “the fork” discount, otherwise it’s not recommended!
half of the staff are friendly the other half isn’t.
the service is okay!
the starter is good.
unfortunately the duck breast is not good! the fat is not rendered and it is lacking seasoning!; we’ve been in a city break here in paris and had the luck to come across this place in the first day. we ended up ordering from here every single day :). the food is really good, we tried pasta, pizza and burgers.

the service was amazing. the guy who took care of our orders was super polite and charismatic, we enjoyed our experience especially because of him. i did not get his name but from the small talk we had i remember that he is originally from india and he had a past girlfriend from romania (the country i am from).; we enjoyed the food. service is good and prices. good busy place with a good vibe.; honestly not so bad. the food is great the restaurant in itself is veryyy nice but i gotta admil the seevice is bad. slow veryyyy slow waiters and they sometimes see you calling, they ignore you.
i wouldnt repeat this experience although the food is really really good.

name: La Petite Bretonne
reviews:
great and real crepe, tradi, local, no much expensive. you should go to try it.
lovely neighborhood; stumbled on this place while buying souvenirs next door. sweet couple hustling and putting out locally sourced fresh food.

shared a vegetarian crepe that we had some left over. not because it was bad but because it was plenty of food. my wife was going to order a salad, but there was none available because he told us the produce delivery that morning did not look good and he declined it. that is a good sign.

give them a try!; best crepes we’ve had in paris and we were crepe-hunting :d so so good both the galettes and sweet crepes. had the maraichere and lemon sugar.; stopped in quite late for lunch after having arrived earlier in the morning on a flight from the usa.

the gentleman was kind enough to seat us and serve us a quick lunch even though things were definitely winding down

the galettes were delicious in every way. the service was prompt and efficient. so very happy to have stopped by!; this did not disappoint! it was super cozy inside and super delicious. i got the recommended ham, cheese and egg with onion crêpe. it was huge and i ate every last bite! it’s voted the best restaurant for crêpes in paris, and there’s no doubt why!

name: Au Manège de la Mode Enfantine
reviews:
very good store of products for kids!! the owner is also very kind and helpful.; it's great place but sooooo expensive.; attracted by the beautifully decorated windows, we entered this charming little shop run by a lovely lady. she recommended various toys adapted to the ages requested, and gave us excellent advice with touching enthusiasm. there is something for everyone: we highly recommend going to this local business!; wonderful shop, very well decorated.
this store is run by an adorable little lady.; thank you for the quick delivery of a stuffed toy that i had been looking for for months to make my daughter's double cuddly toy!
careful packaging. thank you so much

name: Square des Droits de l'Enfant
reviews:
a lovely, highly coveted and friendly children's park suitable for very young children

what i find unfortunate is that we don't really respect the safety instructions inside the park (ban on playing ball games, closed doors so that children don't leave the park...) i find this is a shame because as parents we are not at peace that our children are playing in the park when that should be the case! .; beautiful redevelopment. it no longer has anything to do with the old square. it is more open and the floor has been redone. pleasant little square for a sandwich.; a city, young people. other than that, quite lively park.; very nice new park;

name: Du Pareil Au Même
reviews:
super; always very warm welcome. the manager is always very smiling, pleasant and gives good advice. i hope this precious little store for the neighborhood will not close its doors. it brings joy and color to our children; pretty shop right in front of the tram, colorful collections often on sale. it's a change from supermarkets, a real plus for the family neighborhood. no need to go deep into paris, it's convenient. very nice salespeople, good advice
my favorite store for children's clothing. a few seasonal shoes would have been perfect.; bad trip! it's been 25 years since i set foot in a same place!

depressing, poorly arranged, confusing...
ugly clothes, the height of bad taste! but what happened to the “same and same” of the 90s? what did you do with your stylists?

fortunately the little saleswoman was very nice.; our favorite store to find very pretty, fashionable and very good quality clothes. you will find sizes from birth to 12 years old, the worlds are very distinct, and it is easy to find your way around. the staff is welcoming and gives good advice.

name: Le Divan Perché, librairie jeunesse
formatted_address: 226 Rue de la Convention, 75015 Paris, France
reviews: perfect for kids. plenty of good books for all ages; nice neighbourhood library for kids; the person at the cash register is very haughty, zero empathy, zero smile  nothing to compare with their store for adults across the street.; i wanted to buy everything. lots of cool stuffs for kids!; amazing, terrific!

name: Maman Bébé
vicinity: DJV SA, 52 Avenue de la République, Montrouge
formatted_address: DJV SA, 52 Av. de la République, 92120 Montrouge, France
reviews:
great shop with lots of selection for babies/kids of all ages. great welcome and advice! for gift ideas, i highly recommend.; not very happy to break my nose on the door (where it is posted closed until august 23) with my grandson on august 21, 2024 while on google the store was supposed to be open and the hours confirmed to google by phone call 4 weeks before.; very pleasant shop and welcome. there is a quality and varied choice.; i am always torn when i go to this store.
there is a lot of choice on fairly classic gifts, it would be worth a little renewal of products that are perhaps more current or more innovative like what we can find at certain toy essentials or on the internet. if you are looking for a classic gift for a birthday for example, you will find what you are looking for here. if you are looking for something more original (new trend / new bonus games during dedicated events e.g. story box, marble rug) i don't recommend going there.
i don't find that the salespeople/managers are particularly pleasant, quite cold sometimes, a shame for a toy store, the only one in montrouge and a children's paradise.; the strike allowed me to shop nearby and discover this store.
the lady who has run the shop for 30 years gives good advice. i found the ideal gift for my 2 year old niece while supporting local businesses. i am glad :-)

name: Aire de jeux pour enfants (2 à 10 ans)
reviews: quite a few games to accommodate quite a few children. it quickly remains close to saturation.; superb playground for young and old children. but be careful, not closed and the lake right next to it.; there are quite a few activities but you must always remain vigilant because there is no barrier and the park pond is right next to the playground; it's very good and what's more it's free (not like in the jardin du luxembourg).; excellent, enough to keep the children occupied for several hours. including an area for adults and children

name: Les Artistes
reviews:
best meal my mum and i had in our paris trip. thank you so much! will definitely be back. the waiter, cook and staff were so kind and made the atmosphere so relaxing. big smiles on their faces and had very charismatic laughs. thank you. we loved every bit of our meals - mains & desserts. cannot recommend them enough 🫶🏼 xx; first restaurant we went to on our trip to paris, and exceeded expectations! wonderfully kind service, delicious food (with surprisingly hearty portions), and a beautiful atmosphere. highly recommend stopping in for a meal, drink, or lunch.; mathis was very professional, helpful, and pleasant.
the food was delicious and served quickly and nicely presented. will come back again to eat here. highly recommended 👌🏼; very pleasant and beautiful cafe) the atmosphere is positive and the staff is very polite and communication in choosing the menu is very easy. the kitchen is absolutely magnificent! everything was delivered quickly and very tasty. we recommend coming to this special place!; very friendly staff! yummy cocktails! and great coffee. we really enjoyed our time at les artistes. very pretty decor and outlook. give it a try! we recommend. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Le Paris Montparnasse
reviews:
we stayed at the pullman around the corner and found this to be a great restaurant in the neighborhood to relax after a long day of sightseeing. enjoyable atmosphere with a wide array of menu items. some nights we stopped in for a full meal, the salmon was great, or just relaxed with one of their many delicious crepes. overall would highly recommend.; typical brasserie just outside the gare montparnasse.
nice range of dishes: salads, meat options, croque monsieur...
if you're in a hurry to catch the train, you may still be able to grab something to eat: several options (notably the salads) can be prepared in a few minutes.; location is a walk away from hotels and the train station. service was good and the place was clean, recommended after a long day walking in paris. food was excellent, had all of our favourites, especially the escargots.; thoroughly enjoy eating here. great service and fantastic steaks. the ribeye was perfect!  onion soup was great as well. i got the same thing i ordered last time and will probably be the same next time.; have eaten here twice and loved the food!! cute cafe and convenient to where i  stayed.

name: Bistrot Basilic
reviews:
last night, my husband and i enjoyed an incredible meal at bistrot basilic. i had a delightful beef stew, while my husband savored the chicken dish, both of which were absolutely delicious. the highlight of our evening was the dessert, undoubtedly the best i've ever had! a lovely young lady who works there shared that she made it herself and was kind enough to give us the recipe. we left bistrot basilic very happy and highly recommend it!; cozy family run restaurant with authentic taste, definitely order a khachapuri to share!

we went as a group of 4 on a hot summer day. we were welcomed nicely and the host was very patient with the ordering process. since i’ve been to georgia for a holiday and loved the food i wanted the other people to try this cuisine.
it was their first time eating georgian food and they all loved it very much. we shared badridschani (grilled aubergine with a nutty paste) and khachapuri (georgian cheese bread) for starters and then ate other speciality like the ojakhuri (meat with potatoes) and some georgian dumplings (it was not khinkalis but also very tasty). we all liked our food very much and the service was very friendly and welcoming. although i would recommend bringing some time, since they make everything fresh from the spot, you will have to wait a bit for your food to be ready (which is normal, because the dishes take a lot of time to make). highly recommend to go there and try authentic georgian food. the smell and taste transported me right back to my holiday in georgia.

it’s suitable for vegetarians as well although you will have a more limited selection since the georgian cuisine is very meaty.; great and fresh food. amazing service. very clean setting. highly recommend! :); ordered the ocean salad and it tasted amazing. food was very good and staff were friendly. highly recommend.; very cosy restaurant with an excellent georgien food and very friendly personal. me and my family had an amazing time there :)

name: Le Bistrot des Campagnes
reviews:
this place is just horrible!!
i brought my mom to show her a friench cuisine. before i made a reservation and i didn’t noticed that it wasn’t confirmed. we came there and lady administrator just asked as to leave without checking the other reservations also she was not friendly and looked at us judgmental. only the nice young lady waiter proposed us a table for a quick 1 hour dinner. it was not ideal but she tried for us. this was the only nice moment. the atmosphere was very tense and big relaxing at all. some people were complaining about their reservations. we ordered well done duck, be they brought us medium rare(see the attached picture). also ordered foie gras and instead of nice black bread got just a white baguette. we were waiting for our order about 30-40 minutes (assuming we promised to leva the place after short dinner of 1 hour). the main feeding area looks massy and not cozy. i wouldn’t recommend to come here.; lovely meal with friends. really honest food and lovely service. bustling and busy with a good vibe.

the beef tartare and the smoked salmon starters were very good and the duck breast was fantastic. the desserts were good too. for €60 per person with wine i think it was good value.; lovely french cuisine.
we enjoyed the gourmet meals here.; had an amazing experience here! the staff and chef were incredibly friendly and the food was delicious! will be recommending this restaurant to others! couldn’t have had a better time!; the  server was great. she was hustling, one server in the dining room with a full room. she helped us with the wine choice and made us feel welcome. food was simple but done right. would recommend to go try it out.

name: Le Verre Siffleur.
reviews: one of my favorite restaurants in paris so far. a fun diner meets french café vibe. the coconut curry chicken kebabs were amazing and the big plate of charcuterie with cheeses was perfect for those of us who can’t handle the stinky cheese - very mild cheeses on the platter. was walkable from our hotel along beautiful and quiet residential streets.; i enjoyed a tasty glass of wine with some excellent tasting pieces of meat. you really feel your in a local place here, with puffs of cigarettes smoke coming in from the terrace, and intellectuals debating life whilst drinking some wine. staff is friendly but not overly engaging, which i like, but english is not always very strong.; great find! perfect for a simple breakfast of coffee and croissant and a lovely dinner menu too. i had a delicious risotto and cheesecake. relaxed, unpretentious atmosphere and friendly staff.; the place is lovely and bright. we come here often, but the service and quality of food has gone really low. we recently got burgers that were soggy and overpriced, the patty really low quality. service isn’t warm at all, waiters tend to be snappy. it’s a shame because it’s a really nice place. with some training and improvement in the kitchen, it can go back to better experience.; as a business traveller, i've only enjoyed one dinner here, so can't comment on consistency or broad choice. the place has charm and the menu offers adm attractive selection. i went for the entrecote (saignant), which was clearly above standard, and burrata with vegetables as starter, which was excellent. my colleague enjoyed his meal, too. service was attentive and friendly. what more could you ask for?

name: Les Petits Plats
reviews:
excellent food and service. the waiters were both super friendly and we were never rushed to make a decision.

starters:
catch of the day (seabass & pollock)
crispy minced beef tongue

mains:
beef cheek, polenta, olives, beef marrow
fish of the day (cod), asparagus, doughnut with ginger [favourite dish]
suggestion of the chef (razor clams and cockles)
rumpsteak was favourful and tender
