thank you! :); delicious food, perfectly presented with correct price. very kind service too. the “tarte au citron is just amazing!; grabbed a quick lunch and the service was delightful. very friendly and helpful. and the food, amazing! they even pointed us in a good direction to find a cab as we were in a rush; lovely french brasserie! the food is of excellent quality and the prices are fair. the service is great! i would totally recommend this place, as it is truly a french experience!; great place for lunch and dinner. typical parisian bistro with friendly staff and great menu. a little expensive for what you get in my humble opinion, but still a good value.

name: Buffalo Grill
formatted_address: 117 Av. du Général Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
reviews: i recently visited buffalo grill in paris 14 and was thoroughly impressed. the steaks were cooked to perfection—tender, juicy, and full of flavor. the staff were warm, friendly, and attentive, ensuring a great dining experience. the restaurant's cozy, rustic ambiance added to the charm, making it perfect for both family dinners and casual outings. highly recommended!; excellent place, pleasant atmosphere, excellent service.  the waitress was called nana, delicious food, big portions.  reasonable prices.  recommended. we came twice to the restaurant, and the second time they did not disappoint, including nana the waitress; the place is very clean and inviting, the food was very tasty, we also came the next day.  our waitress nana was amazing, smiling and very helpful.  definitely worth coming; an excellent place our serve sas david great guy talks three languages and great service overall; a little pricey, added extras cost more too which is a little unusual for foreign travellers. food itself is reasonable to very good. about 22- 25 euro per person incl drink and pudding.

name: Indiana Café - Montparnasse
reviews:
the food was excellent, served quickly and delicious. the nachos were amazing but the portions were very large. both times we dined we were served by shanna, she was lovely and we enjoyed speaking to her. 5 stars all around!; this place is good to go with less crowd in the afternoons. the starters are good, but the main dishes are not that great. they do know how to make a great virgin mojito. ambiance is okay. the place is at the main street which makes it easily accessible.; from the moment we came in we felt as though as we were english we were ignored.
we asked for a jug of tap water, which was on others tables. to then be given the bill and charged almost €6 euros for water. this was removed of the bill which we was happy with but if your from a different country be careful! it also happened to us earlier in the day too.
food was ok. mac and cheese was nearly cold when brought over. chicken fajitas good.; this place has so many vegetarian options.. i specifically liked vegetarian chicken type fajitas with cactus. vegetarian burger was bland. should have had a little bit of other flavours. the dessert was delicious. we tried browny with vanilla ice cream. it was like as air. sweet potato fries were also excellent addition. pina colada cocktail was really good.; nice view, good ambiance, good service, they serve the food but its not quite hot so that when will you order tell the server to bring the food little bit warm ,test wise is ok.

name: ZAEKA Restaurant INDIEN Fast Casual
reviews: excellent food, best tikka masala i have had in france, cheese naan really good too, very friendly owner who cooks the food to your taste. the place is clean and comfortable. 👍; great place to eat authentic street indian food. the staff is friendly and the food delicious. the portions are quite big too, especially for the price. 😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋😋; love their chicken! briyani chicken rice taste good for europe standard. though it's small restaurant, they give perfect serving to the customer; when i walked by this place i was not sure about the food as it looked just like a fast food place selling lots of fried chicken but i decided to trust the positive reviews of indian and nepali cuisine and give it a chance.  i must say my friends and i loved everything we ordered. i was craving for a plate of authentic momos and chilli chicken and i got exactly what i wanted. the chef is a sweet and friendly guy who even treated us with a plate of hot pakodas for free. i definitely recommend this place :); lip-smacking food at affordable prices. had the most amazing daal (lentil) with rice. special shout out to ganesh for cooking such incredibly delicious food. highly recommended if you are looking for authentic indian food in montparnasse area.

name: Indiana Club Maine
reviews:
stayed in paris for a week and i am super upset i didn't come here sooner. good was excellent 👌🏾👌🏾👌🏾.
dessert was amazing. fresh taste and right sizes. staff speaks english also but be patient; i had a truly disappointing experience at this restaurant. despite waiting for what felt like forever, all i was served was a cup of coffee, a glass of orange juice, and half a piece of bread. the wait time was completely unacceptable, and when the food finally came, it was far below expectations. the lack of attention to customers and slow service made the visit frustrating and unpleasant. i expected much more and definitely won't be coming back. only the young guy welcoming us is welcoming 🤯; i recommend the chicken burrito as it was so tasty and delicious.the staff is also very friendly; fantastic vibe, great bartenders, good location. lots of pool tables which is a great time and plenty of outdoor seating! loved checking out during my visit!; not at all what i expected. i was seriously excited for this place sinc least few months. the place does look good but the staff . oh god! they really don't know how to talk to the guest. the prices are extremely high. and also if you order a cocktail trust me you won't be able to taste alcohol even 1%. there was just one girl who was our server who was genuinely sweet , even though she deserve to be in a better place. the other staff especially the one who was handling the pool area was rude and quite offensive. being from this field i know exactly on a friday night how busy it gets but being so so formal and rude is unacceptable.

name: La Table
reviews:
very good location in the city centre. the food is fresh, delicious and modern.

the service good be better, well very very basic. also, they a big line. make sure that there no big company waiting before you - they don’t hurry to fill the available free tables for 2, if they have 4 people waiting first. 😛

no plant based milk options for coffee, a big minus nowadays.; i had high expectations when we chose going to this restaurant after shopping, given its iconic location in the heart of the bon marché, but unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. the service, in particular, was quite disappointing.

while placing our order, our server, was more focused on chatting with a neighboring table than paying attention to us. he didn’t even make eye contact during our interaction. to make matters worse, he was forgetful and unresponsive. we had to repeatedly ask for water, which eventually arrived after a long wait, and the coffee we ordered was completely forgotten.

the server mentioned we wouldn’t be charged for the coffee due to the long delay, which we appreciated. however, when we received the bill, the coffee was still listed. when we pointed this out, he insisted it couldn’t be removed from the bill, despite what he had promised earlier. while paying for the coffee wasn’t an issue for us, it’s the principle of making a promise and not following through that left a bad impression.

overall, the service was mediocre, especially for a restaurant in such a renowned location. i hope the management takes this feedback seriously and makes the necessary improvements.; situated within le bon marche (market side) with a glass canopy — it had a nice ambience, very much like dining in a greenhouse. i had the special of the day; slow-roasted pork belly which was very tender and flavourful. it was cooked to perfection. i thought i wouldn’t be able to finish it but it was delicious enough to do so. niçoise salad was very good too — generous and fresh. so was their bread + butter (have to request). complimentary madeleines that came with my coffee was fantastic! made in-house daily. service was prompt and attentive (unlike other earlier reviews). the restaurant was full and had a queue. seemed like a popular dining spot even for locals, besides throngs of tourists.; my chicken was good, very tasteful. after a long day of shopping it’s a good place to grab a bite.; not sure why all the negative reviews but i think this place is fantastic. you sit in a relaxing atrium within a department store with great food and staff. even one of the chefs said goodbye as we were leaving. the oysters and prawns we had were fresh and the strawberry dessert was delicious.

name: Restaurant Mona Lisa
reviews:
such kind people, put up with our attempts at atrocious french. attentive and made us very welcomed. food was generous and tasty. whether street side or sitting in the restaurant, the atmosphere was lovely. good value.; my first breakfast here on friday morning was amazing. omelette was fluffy and it was served with creme fraiche. coffee rich with milk froth. orange squeeze was fresh and the pain au chocolat was tasty.

i returned on sunday morning but it's a bit different. orange squeeze and pain au chocolat were very nice, but the omelette was not as fluffy and they did not serve creme fraiche.

but on both days the service was consistently great. the servers were a lady on friday morning and a cheerful man on sunday morning.; it’s a well located restaurant with a variety of dishes. the service is good. i wanted to taste the greek salad but i was a bit disappointed because they added unnecessary stuff to make the dish look generous when in fact they just needed to add tomatoes and keep it small and charge it less! the ingredients of the greek salad present in that dish are not worth the 16 euros.; we came here as a party of two on a sunday night. servers were very friendly and helpful, answering any questions we had. the pasta fusilla and duck confit were incredible and very generous portions. our waiter recommended an excellent wine to go with our meal. the dessert of a cheese board and creme brulee was also so good! definitely worth a visit - once of the best meals we had in all of paris :); i ate at this restaurant 8 times while in paris and tried different dishes. every dish, from the pizza, chicken, carpaccio, tartare and burgers are delicious! the service, staff and environment is excellent as well. i’ll miss this restaurant but when i return to paris will definitely eat here again.

name: Café Larousse
reviews: i love this cute little café. the service is excellent. when it is nice out, they have a cute terrasse and the selection of drinks is amazing with great prices.; the server and cheff are extremely kind and understanding.  they cooked something special we asked for. the food was delicious and quite affordable! 100% recommended; loved it here. fab food! was that a complimentary glass of wine the owner gave me?! can’t say enough about it. highly recommend: good food, good welcome, good prices. top des tops!; its great specially frites; the new owners of what was only a small local café have very nicely rearranged the room with a blonde stone wall and warm wood tones. slightly limited choice of classic dishes but well served. for dessert, the homemade apple pie is worth all the yummy!

name: Jin Xin Lou
formatted_address: 63 Rue de l'Amiral Mouchez, 75013 Paris, France
reviews: exceptional dishes with full of flavors! beautiful presentation of the dishes. and very generous portions!! friendly atmosphere with great service!; don’t be fooled by the modest decor.  food was delicious with beautiful presentation.  we got the french tasting menu.  chef apparently trained under a famous michelin starred chef.  would come back again to this hidden gem.; fantastic discovery, very nearby to cité uni. a chinese restaurant where the son of the owner studied also french haute cuisine with a starred chef . all staff - i guess family - looked after me very kindly. fantastic food, tasting menu 39 euros. high quality and very convenient for paris prices.  i will go again and i warmly suggest it.; great experience! you need to reserve before if you want to test the amazing food of the chef (who used to work in a michelin stared restaurant) i’m sure i’d be back again, with friends and family! highly recommend!; the restaurant looks like a mom&pop chinese restaurant, but the meals and services were excellent !

name: Chez Friloux 1933
formatted_address: 90 Av. de la République, 92120 Montrouge, France
reviews:
the food is ok, the lady that served me was great, but the bartender was absolutely hateful and she didn’t even have to serve me.; this spot stands out by its wood smoked meat and fish. great settings in a lively and busy restaurant.
menu is exhaustive and a daily menu is offered.
while the serving staff was efficient, a little smile would not have hurt -or at least pretending that it was a good day at work.
i would definitely recommend to avoid sitting next to the door locked out of service, except if you fancy cold air during your meal (that only applies during cold season).; really good neighborhood restaurant. we had beef tartar, tuna tartar and lard français. delicious! cute terrace good for people watching.; the service is bad, but no worse than elsewhere in paris.

the menu is good, with lots of meaty options.

the ‘7- hour cooked lamb’ is worth dying for’. the pepper sauce they serve with the steak is the best i have ever had. it is worth asking for some sauce to dip your bread in; it will change your life!

the green beans... again... amazing! compliments to the chef!

coming from south africa, the steak just don’t compare and the quality of the meat is not the same.

even though you ask for ‘well-done’ you still get a piece of meat that is slightly tanned on the outside.

only one waitress understood english, but she left now. for the rest.... just point at the menu and pray.:)

the restaurant is family friendly. a great evening out!; stoped for a drink when i was wandering. pleasing relaxed feel, friendly staff and a plate of olives came with my beer. nice.

name: CAMILA
reviews:
so happy we found this amazing restaurant on our last night in paris.
we had delicious food, but the best part of our dinner was definitely the service.
leandro was so helpful and friendly with us, it made our night even better!

we had picanha, octopus and milanesa. everything was delicious and the presentation was nice too. the atmosphere is very cozy and the place is located in a very nice area.

definitely would recommend it!; artur and peter were very hospitable and the food was amazing.

must try the octopus. we had octopus, chilli con carne and crispy skin salmon and chocolate fondant cake for dessert.

all 3 dishes beautifully presented and tasted great. dessert was decent

would re visit and recommend; the food was good but overpriced. plus, they refused our -50% discount by booking via the fork because we were late 15 minutes. fyi the place was almost empty.; very hospitable service by chames. we had the empanada platter, salmon tartare, grilled octopus and milanese with tomato and mozzarella.; we had an excellent service by peter. everything was great, food was good, drinks were amazing. very nice restaurant. will definitely be back.

name: La Table 12
reviews:
my wife and i had a wonderful meal at la table 12 this evening. it is a very french neighborhood bistro. we like small, authentic, neighborhood places where we can discover great food in local atmosphere. we found it at la table 12. i would highly recommend the l'incontournable saucisse aligot. i had never had this before and felt adventurous. i was rewarded with an amazing culinary discovery. la table 12 helped make our short stay in paris unforgettable.; it was my best time ever in paris f.r.
everyone in the restaurant is so nice and kind. they made my day!

although my magaret was tough(i think it was not fully ready for lunch), the servers attitude made me moved.

when i come to paris next time, whereever i stay i will comeback to this restaurant. the goat.; if you are staying or passing through vance’s, this is a must. burrata was magnificent and the subtle fusion of soy balsamic glaze made it memorable. the duck and steaks were both delicious and cooked to perfection. i will be coming back craving the combination of the cocktails and to try their other items on the menu.; i ordered the entrecôte, not the best that i've had. it was a bit chewy and a bit hard. the fries that come with it were delicious.
i expected a restaurant like that to be able to have the check at the table, but no, you should go to the counter to pay. the bathroom was average clean... that's a pity because looking at the restaurant, you'd think it's better maintained.
and again, there is no music and a lot of noise inside.; amazing place with the most friendly staff! this great restaurant was a very unexpected but welcome surprise on our work trip. we were actually just looking for a simple pizza place around our hotel and stumbled upon this gem, drawing our attention. feeling very lucky about that because the food was super! great atmosphere and highly recommended!

name: Les Frangines
reviews:
we were received immediately upon our arrival. seating was available, our orders placed an enjoyable atmosphere of local families sharing their afternoon. thank you for exceptional world class customer service.; i think the standard of food in france is just higher. even a normal local joint can deliver amazing croissant. service is also simple but perfect. love it.; first time that i do not finish an avocado toast. it was really bad, service was really good though.; great cosy place with a very cool chill laid back music! friendly staff and tasty food is the least to be said!
was happy to pass by this place, such gems are hard to find in paris.; went there for breakfast and it was great! delicious food and friendly staff. i had the egg bun and the pancakes and they were both superb. highly recommend if you want to have breakfast at a local cafe :)

name: Le Petit Broc
reviews:
absolutely amazing restaurant! i luckily found this place four years ago as a tourist and it was so good that i noted this place on my list and revisited today with my parents! all the food were incredible and just mindblowing!!!!! the onion soup was divine - the best i ever had and the fish dishes were so soft and flavorful. we had a very pleasant and memorable lunch thanks the friendly service as well. i’ll come back again when i visit paris next time.; food was so delicious and surely frenchy authentic. we love everything we ordered.
definitely will return on the next visit.; this restaurant is such a gem! the location and atmosphere are so enjoyable. the service is top notch- very friendly, approachable, and very kind to have english menus and english speakers!  we loved getting to know them. food was out of this world. we got the french onion soup, cheese soufflé, beef carpaccio, and molten chocolate cake. all were 10/10, extremely delicious, unique takes, generous portions , and very reasonable prices . plus happy hour wine was amazing! will definitely return and could not recommend enough.; best breakfast we had during our 3 day stay in paris.  service was excellent; this place is amazing!!!!!  i have no words to describe. we ate here 2 nights in a row.
absolutely delicious everything we tried.

name: Madame Pampa
reviews:
we went there to get a cooked meal because we had been very pleased with their breakfast before. unfortunately, we got a rude waiter who would not let our 12 year old have the kids menu and said she was not 12. we offered him to see the passport but then he pretendent not to speak english any longer. we ordered food from their recommended menu, but were told that that food was no good and that we should order something else which we did, and which was more expensive. however we got the food we originally were having, which indeed was no good, but ended up paying for the more expansive meal. so in the end the waiter got us to compensate with more money for cheaper food. also the red meat we had was too red, nearly cold, which we said but we were not offered any compensation (we were not asked how we wanted our meat while ordering either). i would never eat there again in the evening or at lunch, and i feel sorry for the owners who have such a waiter in their staff. the morning staff are brilliant (for us a woman and a man of 50 plus, who surprisingly spole better english than than the young waiter) and so is their parisian breakfast menu.; this is such a nice restaurant in the montparnasse area. we really enjoyed our dinner there. the staff is so friendly, the food is good and the atmosphere is wonderful!!; samantha was the best server we’ve had so far in paris. she was so efficient, friendly and remembered our crazy order and specifications. she made our day!; my best experience in the last 5 days here in paris. if you are in the area, this place is highly recommended. i have the brazilian picaña and the mango passion cheesecake. and to bring the experience to its best, the live music band and tap dancer were amazing.  they play tuesdays and thursday.; had an opportunity to have dinner 🥘 on a nice evening. options of food are good 😊.

had a beer and food and it was scrumptious 😋. service is good and have an happy hrs option 😎. had 🐠 fish & 🍟….🕺

service was good 👍

strategically located and and in a nice place. a must try for food lovers and have fun 🤩.

overall had a good experience and nice food.👏👏👏

name: Zéro Zéro Sèvres
reviews:
hit the spot!! we we’re looking for somewhere to eat dinner and two other restaurants nearby were fully booked or closing. this was about 8:30pm/9pm. and this place did not disappoint. i really enjoyed the escargots and the steak with egg was also good. the chips were amazing! i had the strawberry mojito which was good. staff were friendly, reasonably priced. i left satisfied.; positive: free mouse show
negative: no commercial gesture, bad faith employees, frozen pizza; friendly brasserie. we stopped in for a late lunch. the server speaks a little english, but he made up for it with his friendliness. the food was good and reasonably priced for the neighborhood. my friends had the beef bourgogne, and i had the pork filet with mustard sauce. we washed it down with the house wine.  we would come back.; i like here because  they serve " bertillon" ice cream. some of the meals are good, but the onion soup i ate the other day was too salty and overcooked, so i left it.  the tartare dish was delicious.
comfortable restaurant.; my boeuf bourguignon was authentic and delicious! i asked for green beans instead of mashed potatoes and the waitress happily complied. good for people watching too.

name: BCBG gourmet
reviews:
everything was perfect. the burger, the fries (cheddar fries for 1 euro in plus - best deal!) and kindly staff.
happy wife, happy life.
i made a mistake twice when i ate in mcdonalds near this restaurant... never ever!
if you are in that zone, u need to try it!
good job guys! 5 stars from me.; burgers were perfect. we got le looke and le bourgeois. the meat, the sauce and the cheese were all tasty. nice and polite staff. we really enjoyed our meal.; the place is great, and the food and the service are amazing. liked it so much, i went twice during my 3-day stay in the area.; we came here for a late lunch. the service was really good, friendly and attentive. burgers were delicious specially the chicken one. love them.
we really enjoyed the food and the place!; such a beautiful and lovely place, i ordered a veggie burger, it was delicious, as well as the dessert. the guys were so kind and available, definitely would recommend and can't wait to come back!

name: 750g La Table
reviews:
i had dinner at 750g.

the atmosphere is relaxed and casual, perfect for a dinner with friends. the decor is eccentric, kitsch, but cozy.

the food was good. i had egg with a mix of fried mushrooms and veg couscous. both definitely tasty and well-prepared.

the menu is often changed, but vegetarian options are always available.

service was friendly and efficient.

overall, 750g is a reliable choice for a casual meal in paris. it's a good option if you're looking for a comfortable place to eat with good food.; an excellent budget bistro.

i've had multiple entrees, mains and desserts and everything i've had has been very good to excellent.

on several occations there has been room for 2-4 without reservations.

includes options of entree+main or main+desert for 22€, full 3 course for 26€, excellent value for money.

the pictures include a 'perfect egg', steak and fries and a rice pudding, all very good and tasty.

can strongly recommend if you do not have a reservation for the night after a day at the expo center.; food was good, not the best i’ve had in france but it was pretty good, and the atmosphere was really great and cute! about half of the menu was gluten-feee or was able to be done gluten-free, which was nice but there wasn’t much detail provided in french or english on the dishes and how they were served.
additionally, i will preference this next part by saying that we were there during the olympics and it was probably 80% full, but our service was pretty bad. we ordered a bottle of wine when we sat down and had to ask 3 different people for it and it still took about 30 min to get it. we also asked for bread multiple times and it still took about 15 min, and our food was cold by the time the bread got there.; i really liked this restaurant. we were quickly seated just before 20:00, and the staff of young waiters was very friendly to my american colleagues who do not speak french (it's my first language). one co-worker was vegetarian, which is always a challenge in paris, and she enjoyed a nice vegetable curry. i was happy that they had magrès de canard (duck breast) on the menu of specials. it was very good. not great or awesome, but satisfying enough and i had a very pleasant meal. the ambiance is really nice. the glass-door terrace gives the place an outdoor feel while staying inside, away from the incessant french smokers. the decor is super lively and fun, quite refreshing with vibrant decorations and greenery. definitely a recommended spot for a nice french dinner and a good break from the traditional brasserie.; good for value restaurant and obviously very popular among locals. we were quite amused to see that the local police also visits them and one even got a rousing birthday celebration.
the food is decent though some are obviously better than others.

name: Eat With Joy
formatted_address: 3 Rue de la Convention, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
we got a takeout vegetarian burger & vegetarian wrap from here. the potato wrap was delicious & spicy. i wish the burger was spicier (but i should’ve asked!). both items were made freshly and priced reasonably (15 euros total). would recommend!; food here is above average,  cant say its bad but definitely cant say its high quality and delicious compared to other kebab shops. it can be a good option if u are extremely hungry and want a snack, otherwise better look for other restaurants; amazing find for a delicious meal. friendly and helpful service. generous portions and fresh ingredients.; got the spicy burger(chicken) meal which was lovely. must try. great customer service.

no sitting place. but worth the takeaway; we had a take out today, nan kebab, for its price it was excellent. both taste and quality were very good.

name: Cucina Eat
formatted_address: 65 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews: such a lovely cafe and wonderful staff. i am a vegetarian and was craving a simple veg tomato pasta, which they did not have in the menu but the chef made it specially for me and it was soooo yummy, it made my day. my husband tried the brunch and was very happy with that so overall amazing cafe.; amazing food, great service. decided to share the brunch menu and they gave us another coffee and orange juice for free! we went for the brioche toast with egg, avocado and salmon and it was surprisingly nice. we expected a tourist trap since it's so close to the eiffel tower but it was really not at all one. for dessert we went for the chocolate lava cake and it was so good i couldn't get a picture of it before we ate it. all in all great experience would go again. we paid about 17,50 euro per person which is honestly fair for the area.; such a beautiful little cafe for a spot of healthy & tasty lunch. service was wonderful and extremely friendly. my daughter has a lactose intolerance and this cafe was easy to order for her due to the vegan options. the creamy chicken parmesan pasta was sensational as was the smoked salmon club sandwich. highly recommend. thank you; cool outdoor space next to champs de mars with a chill vibe, healthy food and very nice people.; very friendly staff, tasty food, speedy service and reasonably priced. we had the brunch menu and it’s all homemade food which is very well made. would definitely recommend if near the eiffel tower.

name: Les Cocottes
reviews:
i had my last dinner at les cocottes on the way to the eiffel tower. i typically dine early, around 7 pm, and it wasn’t too crowded at that time.

i would recommend making a reservation in advance. the staff are friendly and helpful as well in recommending and explaining the menu.; this is the best bistrol food that i have tried in paris. razer clam seasoned really well and sweet. not too salty over all. many restaurants prep food way salty here. exellent service as well. reasonable price and good portion to share. good wine selections. highly recommended for everyone who plan to  be at elfel tower. must try!; we found this place by chance with my husband, and it was great!
we had no reservation, but we were seated at the bar and introduced to the menu.
the service was excellent!
we ordered a course menu for two and a bottle of wine.
the food was excellent, not too salty but also not plain in flavour.
i would recommend to anyone visiting paris and wanting to have a nice time with good food at a reasonable price next to the eiffel tower.
we would love to come again!; les cocottes in paris came highly recommended by a local youtuber, and i must say it completely surpassed our expectations. from the moment we walked in, the ambiance was warm and inviting, but what truly elevated our experience was the exceptional service. the staff, and what i would assume are the management, took incredible care of my wife and me. this was our second visit during our stay in paris—the first was right when we arrived in the city.

since then, we’ve had the pleasure of dining at several restaurants throughout france, including one at the eiffel tower, and while many of them were fantastic, there was something special about les cocottes that drew us back. i can only describe it as elevated comfort food for the soul. every dish felt like it was crafted with love and care, offering both sophistication and the warm embrace of home-style cooking.

les cocottes is now a must for us whenever we’re in paris, and we cannot wait to return on our next trip. if you’re in the city, don’t miss out on this gem—you won’t regret it!; delicious french restaurant within 10 minutes walking from eiffel tower.
the manager and the entire staffs were very friendly, professional, and attentive.
the razor clams dish and the squids and black rice dish were phenomenal  (even though some of the clams didn't taste as fresh).
we definitely will come back to this place next time we visit paris.

name: Tasca
reviews:
tasca, a gluten-free italian restaurant near the eiffel tower, offers a solid option for those with dietary restrictions looking to enjoy a classic italian meal. the menu is extensive for a gluten-free establishment, with a variety of pizzas, pastas, and risottos made from organic ingredients. the pizzas, while understandably lacking the chewy, airy texture of traditional neapolitan dough due to the absence of gluten, still manage to deliver decent flavor. the toppings are fresh and enjoyable, though not quite at the level of the best italian pizzas, especially for seasoned travelers familiar with authentic italian cuisine.

as for the atmosphere, it is functional but nothing remarkable, and the overall experience might feel slightly underwhelming in terms of ambiance. the service, while friendly, could be more attentive, especially given the expectations for dining in paris.

overall, tasca is a good option if you're in the area and need a gluten-free meal, particularly considering the convenience of its location near the eiffel tower. however, for those seeking a more memorable or exceptional gluten-free dining experience, it may be worth exploring some of the other options available in paris through apps like "find me gluten free," as the city offers a range of choices for gluten-sensitive diners.; great location! some of the best gluten free pizza i’ve ever had, we loved our meal. my partner got the gnochhi and it was yummy as well.; went here with my celiac travel partner, and this meal blew me away!

the bread they brought us to start tasted almost just as good as any typical bread.

i was super excited to try the ravioli or tortellini, but as other reviews have stated they were all sold out by dinner time unfortunately. we both ordered the gnocchi (mine was four cheese, hers was truffle) and they were both a pillow-soft texture and so rich in flavor.

the wines we paired were delicious, and our desserts (chocolate mousse for her, pistachio and dark chocolate gelato for me) polished off our meal on a high note.

this spot is super close in proximity to the eiffel tower, so expect it to be very busy toward the evening. but this gives you a perfect after-dinner walk to finish of your night out:); we are in paris for vacation - seven days.   we have eaten here four times.  as someone who has to eat gluten free, this restaurant was a blessing.  the food is delicious.   i will miss their food when we return home to the states. i wish they had a place in pennsylvania by us.; good gluten free pizza and great gluten free pasta particularly carbonara. bread gluten free which is nice as feels normal. very allergy / kid sensitive, made a pizza for my son just pizza tomato and ham no cheese. also can do take away boxes if you can’t finish it all. pudding was good for allergies too with sorbets etc. we actually ate here 2x as it was well located and knew we could get allergy safe food. helpful that staff speak english, spanish and french if you can only remember a few languages.

name: Birdy
reviews:
birdy offers high quality american-style burgers, it was hard to choose one from the menu so we got the nola and the yankee, along with an avocado spring salad and chicken tenders. the burgers were so good, so the salad but there was something with the chicken tenders, the coatign has a strong flavor of cumin, i couldn’t bother it so i removed the coating to at least eat the chicken. besides that i like the concept of this place, their menu and their burgers.; came for lunch with my partner. we both left very full and happy. the burgers were made quick and were very tasty. the chips were crisp. their lunch deal with burger, fries and a drink is a pretty good deal; if you like remnants of fries from the bottom of the bag, recooked after the lunch rush, then this is the perfect spot for you. tasteless rubbish. image pictured is after we had eaten the 8 half-decent fries served.

for context, on our first day in paris, we excitedly looked up on google maps “french fries” - birdy was recommended with fries as a “menu highlight”. there was no one else in the restaurant when we ordered, so can’t blame any sort of rush. very disappointing.

on the burger front, the chicken burger was decent. the falafel burger was very dry.

the owner/manager who initially greeted us was nice and friendly. the server was totally impartial.

if you’re only spending a few days in paris, don’t waste your time here.; good hemade burgers, quick service, reasonable prices, and 600 mts from eiffel tower.

its a small cafe with limited space but good enf for a quick bite.; honestly a bit sad about the place, we were really looking forward to trying their burgers but were left disappointed. maybe it was a bad evening for them but burger was very raw and meat tasteless and french fries were cold and very soft (felt like they were made a while ago). home made ketchup is brilliant and milkshake was quite nice, service is friendly too. maybe as i said it wasn't a good day for them.

name: Pop's
reviews:
fantastic service, very very welcoming and friendly.  the food was even better. black risotto as well as the day's special risotto with coquille saint jacques and asparagus.
both risottos were creamy, one of the best we've ever had.  tasted really good.  the coquilles were a tiny bit too hard but still very tasty.  finished it all up with a tiramisu which was very big and very good!; had a lovely time here. the waiter was so friendly and the food was amazing, especially for the price. i definitely recommend the squid ink risotto. it is in a quiet spot so not too busy. would go again; manager/owner has created a welcoming and inviting place to come for a bite to eat (pasta, tuna, or pizza). the inside or outside seating is quaint.; excellent! peaceful environment, great food and friendly staff which makes your experience very enjoyable! it’s worthy to highlight the high level of the desserts… amazing! also to remark, the great value for money since we paid less than 30€ each including dinner with a bottle of wine; had an absolutely amazing experience here tonight. we ordered the entrecôte, with a bottle of red wine with tiramisu and chocolate mousse for dessert. the entrecôte was perfect made with an amaaazing bernaise sauce, with 10/10 crispy fries. the desserts were also super good, i really can recommend them both!

but the best thing about this experience was the amazing service we got here. everyone working there cared about our well being and made sure everyone was okay. we got a read through of the menue, recommendations, taste of the wine and just big smiles from everyone. very genuine people. strongly recommend you to take a visit here! the pizza also looked amazing from here.

thank you for amazing service, and delicious food and wine, we will be back! -couple from norway

name: Chez Pippo
formatted_address: 31 Av. de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France
reviews: it so happened that we visited this restaurant twice in the same day. it’s located just an 8-minute walk from the eiffel tower. we came around lunchtime without a reservation but managed to find a table and enjoy the weather. the food was incredibly tasty, and the cappuccino was the best i’ve had in a while. the service was top-notch as well. in the evening, after a walk along the seine, we returned to the restaurant, had some delicious tea, and shared a pizza! both times we left very satisfied – a little slice of italy in paris.; great italian food, excellent service, and wonderful dining experience.  wish we took a photo of the bread basket. but the bread was so tasty it didn't last long. it tastes like the pizza crust, fluffy inside and charred crisp on the outside. everything else we had was very good too. it's a short walk from the eiffel tower and worth a visit.; seriously high quality cooking. one of the best pizzas i've ever had. the sauce was perfect, the cheese was high quality, and the dough was light and airy. the truffle pasta was very balanced, which is very difficult to achieve when using truffle. overall an extremely high quality restaurant; this charming little italian restaurant is conveniently located near the eiffel tower. the food is really tasty and offers great value for money. the only downside was the wait for the waiter, which is understandable in a busy restaurant. highly recommended!; good, cozy italian restaurant five mins away from eiffel tower. i like the atmosphere and food. pizza and pasta are delicious. their wine options are good. reasonable price. only problem was tiramisu. my expectation was very high, it wasn’t bad, but didn’t make me happy.

name: Tribeca
reviews:
we stumbled upon this cute restaurant on the way to the eiffel tower. not too touristy, lots of french speakers around and joie de vivre. louis was a fantastic waiter! great place for people watching as well.; we loved tribeca! such a gem on rue cler. we sat outside and people watched (so many
cute dogs to watch on their walks!) while enjoying wine and pizza. the margarita pizza was delicious and the perfect size for sharing. the washroom was large and wheelchair accessible.; highly recommend it!😊👍👍

firstly, i love the seating the most especially if you had a long day walking around the city comfortably and cushioned chairs will welcome you at the restaurant.

the food was great too! i had a today special ravioli and it was delicious. but i would go for pinsa if i visit here next time. also, the coffee was good and strong! it kept me awake till nye fireworks!😊

the waiters and waitress were kind and spoke english very well so i had no issues with ordering food.

in general, most of the customers(including babies) in the restaurant seemed chilled and relax.

thank you for the experience!; nice little cafe. comfortable brunch on a rainy sunday, we had the "new york" option, fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, fresh bread and a nice omelette with cheese.

very cute street it's an area worth exploring as well.; a nice and quiet place to eat. staff are very friendly. foods are in good portion and very tasty, and prices are reasonable.

name: 20 Eiffel
reviews:
what a special place for dinner! check sunset times and then make your reservation. try to get an outside table. the food is fantastic as is the service. there is nothing as spectacular as eating dinner with the eiffel tower right in front of you.; the food was really good, and a good price considering the view of the eiffel tower and three course meal. i recommend the escargots.
it seemed very popular because there was a lot of people.
the atmosphere was fantastic, with an amazing view of the eiffel tower.
will definitely come again when in paris.; the restaurant was clean and nice. the staff was very friendly and attentive. they were kind and tolerant in every situation and condition. especially karim was very attentive, very knowledgeable about the food, always smiling and helpful, and zahra was very kind and friendly. a very nice place for a nice dinner under the lights of the eiffel tower. we will visit again when we come to paris again.; this place was recommended by the michelin guide as bib gourmand, but i don't understand how. the starter tasted like refrigerated chicken, the main was mediocre, and dessert was pretty good. i am impressed they made it into any guidebook. given how many good restaurants are in paris, i would highly recommend going elsewhere for food.; my visit to 20 eiffel was a whole parisian experience tasting some exquisite french food and wine while enjoying a superb view from the majestic eiffel tower. my family went with the menu option and we couldn't agree on which was the best. delicate food and great attention to detail.

name: Au Café Jaby
reviews: been here dozens of times of times!! everything is so tasty and the portions are big. always order aperol 😝; the fish and chips were amazing, the portion size was just right and the tartar sauce was… so good…. ah…. yes definitely reccomend; one of the best food experiences we have had in paris , not to mention great service . highly recommend; thank you for a good lunch!👌🏻☺️; found this place on google maps because it was close to the hostel i was staying. this was my first meal in france after a 16 hour journey and it did not disappoint! made sure to go back my last night as well. lovely staff (seriously super friendly waiter) and really tasty food, and very reasonable prices too! highly recommended!

name: Zig Zag
reviews: the food was really good and we all felt full after the different plates. really worth the money! definitely recommend this place!; what a find! we had really delicious lunch with fab, freshly prepared food. service was friendly and helpful and prompt. my picture doesn't do it justice, but it was flavoursome. i would definitely recommend dining here.; zig zag café is a vibrant café with a lively atmosphere and delicious menu offerings. the coffee is excellent, and the staff is friendly, making it a great place to relax and enjoy a meal.; amazing food and the staff is just the best! had a lovely time. 5 stars especially for the host❤️; lovely little café with polite staff that went above and beyond to serve us. only reason i didn't give 5 stars is because i asked for medium well done and the burger was too pink for my liking but i'm used to the british definition of medium well i suppose 😂

name: La Buvette du Parc
reviews: nice restaurant with plenty of outdoor and indoor seating in the middle of a beautiful park.  a lot of shaded tables, place to fill up your water bottle, restroom.  a lot to offer on their menu including cold beer on tap.  take away or dine in.; very pleasant to have a little coffee in the park between hospital appointments. peaceful atmosphere.; tasty slate/ tasty coffe/ lovely company😍; small buvette in the park with tables outside which are extremely pleasant during summer. ok food but very nice staff; super !

name: Partage Café
reviews:
a very good brunch place: tasty food and a great service, cosy. you might have to wait a bit to get seated at lunch time. a bit elevated price for brunch (27€) than other places but other than that really great. waiters are super lovely and attentive.; cozy, delicious, heartwarming in a nutshell and excellent coffee! i had the breakfast scone with eggs and bacon, a very tasty and fresh combo, thanks again for the recommendation! i really like the vibe of the place and the fact that everyone was friendly with a genuine smile was just a cherry on top to start the day. they also have homemade granola and a great selection of pastries. and did i say the coffee is good? the coffee is good!; you can taste that the chef loves his job! super friendly service as well. love the place!; we had brunch on sunday morning and it was perfect! big plates, great to set you up for a day of sightseeing. fresh and healthy options. oat milk available. for all the family. would definitely come back! thanks guys!; small cafe with outdoor seating. food and coffee are savory and rich.
nice cafe for having breakfast or brunch.
quite a walking distance away from the the main streets.

name: COCO
reviews:
quintessentially french café at a reasonable price and good, central location. quiet during the sunday we went, but livened up a lot at night. staff and atmosphere were fantastic. everything was very reasonably-priced for a parisian restaurant too. will defintely go back when i'm next in paris.; very small portions for what you get. 15.5€ the poke full of rice, 6 euros the very small detox juice ? too expensive.
the burger was good.
and the staff lied when asked for more ice cube because i’ve asked twice.; the place was absolutely crammed, but i appreciate they fitted us in. if you hate kids yelling don't go🤣 very loud, felt like a kindergarten, but i'm sure it's a lovely place for parents/people with children to enjoy an excellent meal and have your child preoccupied. the food was delicious, so any tiny inconvenience is erased really. servers were running around trying to take care of everyone. there was one man specifically who brought out loads of food, he seemed to be the most caring and fastest one. lovely lovely food. if you have kids, go here. we don't, but i would come back for the food.; the hostess/owner was absolutely wonderful. we had great food and cocktails. will come back next time i'm in paris!; very good! open recently we wanted to try and we have been happily surprised. waiters were very polite and friendly. food is not expensive, is good quantity and on top of that is good!! we will be back!

name: Café les écrivains
reviews:
great place for lunches, fish options are available as well. better to come earlier or reserve a table in advance. salmon lasagna is delicious. value for money; we had a very nice dinner at the café. the staff is friendly and welcoming. the food is delicious, we tasted the tartare and were not disappointed. prices are reasonable.
the ambiance was good although having a giant screen in the back with sports turned the nice restaurant into half a sports bar/half a nice dinning place.; we had a great burger. it's a place for all audiences, in mixture of a pub, café and bistrot.; very nice place. no nononse, but good food and perfect service.; came here for dinner. food was good, french fries were amazing. we had the beef tartar and trout tartar. beef tartar was  flavorful but a bit heavy with relish. happy hour wine could have been better. mojito and champagne was good. music was all american oldies which i was surprised by. overall was a nice experience

name: Café Du Marché
reviews:
oh la la! the food was delicious! steak, mashed potatoes, green salad, sea bass. you’ll be glad you ate here. quaint and very parisienne. only 48€ total for two people including one glass of wine.; terrific experience from beginning to end. i always try escargot as it's not common in the states. these were very authentic and i had never had them in the shell. fantastic!; lovely restaurant on rue cler with great food and service. i ordered the duck confit and it melted in my mouth! roasted potatoes were also crispy and garlicky. our server was very friendly and charming.; i found this place by chance. the waiter was lovely. i enjoyed the complementary olives and pretzels. the duck breast was a highlight! it came on a bed of mash - the nicest mash i’ve ever had. i think it had honey in it, which i’ve never tried before. there was also a side of granny apple purée - this is the first time i’ve tasted an apple purée that i feel actually works really well with the savoury main. very pleased with my dinner experience. the only downside was the table of noisy americans inside, and to get away from the americans i had to sit with the smoking french outside (still preferable)!; it must be noted that restaurant has changed management over a year ago and is so much better!

the food, service and ambiance were perfect and i recommend to anyone looking for an authentic parisian bistro on the cutest street.

the food is unpretentious, high quality, and delicious.

highly recommend!

name: Aux Cerises
reviews: highly recommend! had the sirloin and the chocolate cake for dessert and no complaints, such friendly staff very quick service and such good value for money €13 meal and was €21 each! first time in paris and would recommend and would definitely come again!; my husband and i didn’t have a reservation but they made room for us anyway! the staff was so kind and the food was the best i’ve had in paris so far!!! 10/10 and will be back before the end of our trip!! 💛; this is probably the best place you can go to in a neighborhood filled with tourist traps. even then, the food is mediocre and incredibly overpriced for what you get. menu is quite limited, especially for vegetarians or those looking for a light/healthy meal. service is perfectly fine and it’s a nice place to sit at, but ultimately it’s also the food that matters.; great food, awesome service.  absolutely no complaints from me.; super cute place and friendly service. we got the brunch formula and everything was excellent.

name: Le Moulin à café
reviews: community effort run by volunteers. cheap drinks and tasty food during lunchtime. lots of events take place there.; local community effort is a place for all kinds of activities: arts, sports, games, organic market, flea markets,  free children workshops. offers simple beverages and house made "menu du jour" at low prices. small abonnement gives you right to pay less. very nice playground and garden right by.; good atmosphere, excellent place for relaxing..; good place for cheap coffee and hanging out at a disco soupe; cool

name: Le Café de Mars
reviews:
i wish to come back here once and try other dishes!
the service and the place are really nice and we had a great time here. also, i love the calm music,  it really fits the atmosphere.
great thanks to the lovely waitress, you are doing great ;); although, we dont have a reservation, they greeted us with a big smile and seated us at a table. they cooked our meat as we wished. it was delicious. the atmosphere was also very romantic. the wines were matured and delicious. they asked about our satisfaction many times. we left very satisfied. as i promised, i couldn't help myself comment well.
p. s: toilet is needed revision or at least repairment. except it, it was a perfect experience!; service here is very friendly and accommodating. the food is also delicious. it's not the traditional french food and that is also perfect on its own.

had the labne appetizer that had very fresh and aromatic flavors. then, followed with the drunken steak. the mashed potatoes, shiitake, and steak are individually delicious. they don't go together perfectly but consumed individually, it was delicious. recommend this dish!; our first dinner in paris was here.🥰
i’ve been searching tirelessly the week before coming to paris for cafes and i believe i found a gem in le cafe de mars💙

the servers speak english and they’re really polite and friendly. i appreciate them as this sets the tone for other restaurants and cafes that we’ve visited. their specialty is the “drunken dragon” which is a grilled flank steak with purée and picked shitake. my daughter loved the burger with fries. it’s also kid-friendly, they’re very nice not just to us but to my kids as well. they have a kids menu but we opted for the normal menu so we can share. super love it here! price is really good!🥰; the food was so delightful, and the service was incredible. she patiently awaited us since my mum is a slow eater, and she was excellent and very friendly.  sorry, i'm bad with names. the place was comfy and beautiful to have a drink.

name: Café Lulu
reviews:
ive been coming here for just over two years with my friends during school, and its a perfect place to stop for some pasta or a salad prepared right in front of you with fresh ingredients. the two lovely people have never failed to greet all of us with a smile and the food has stayed consistently good over many years.; loved the coffee n people here
very nice and friendly. iced latte and cappuccino. both tasted yumm; honestly, i really liked this place. the food was good and affordable, and the dessert was so good! i could use my computer and a big plus was the staff who were so welcoming! they even came with a small cake to have with my coffee. will definitely come back!; i was delected by the welcome of the owners at my arrival, as well as the food served. it was very good. would definitly recommend; love it....

name: Le Petit Go
reviews:
a quiet and atmospheric restaurant in the 15th arrondissement. the food or menu is nothing special, but overall the taste is above average. it is recommended to sit outside when the weather is warm, but it is good to eat inside as the sun shines well into the restaurant. the staff are friendly, so you feel good after visiting.; this restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel and we were not disappointed. we took daily offers and they were just right - tuna steak and grilled lamb, both were served with amazing sauces. lovely place!; comfy outdoor seating in a quiet neighbourhood. extremely friendly staff who were extremely gracious dealing with australian english.

food was fantastic.; very nice place with good food and even better drinks. especially the st germain spritz 👌💕; amazing service ! the staff are so friendly and kind . definitely recommend it :)

name: Friends Vaugirard [Location Salle Paris, Anniversaire, Cocktail, Réunion De Famille]
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews: amazing! booked this for my daughter’s birthday party. booking was very easy and communication was fast!; be aware that you will not get your security deposit back. they will use any minor excuse to cash it in.; i loved be here just because i liked my friends. there is not a large variety of products but you can have some cookies, coffee, juice, muffins, cake, salad-cake, etc. pretty quiet inside; without terrace; good service.; could be a great place but lack of maintenance. lack of flexibility on certain element for example the coat check next to the kitchen counter... no curtains or shade on the windows...; comfortable sofa but they won't serve the viennoiserie cause it's for delivery orders (foodora-ebereats) only??? like actually being in the cafe makes you second class client?

name: Le Bois
formatted_address: 29 Rue Bois le Vent, 75016 Paris, France
reviews: me and my family visited the restaurant with the best experiences. food was so amazing, friendly and funny staff, very charming. highly recommend!!; in the heart of paris, this delightful restaurant offers a charming ambiance with attentive service and an inventive take on french cuisine. guests can enjoy the scenic outdoor terrace and a diverse menu. for those seeking meat-free options, the menu features grilled cauliflower with sweet potato, carrots, and herby cream cheese; spinach salad with cashew nuts, fennel shavings, and pomegranate; and a power bowl rich in flavors from smoked salmon or chicken, or even opt for panko prawns. don't miss out on their exquisite desserts, including a classic tiramisu and a creamy cheesecake, perfect for rounding off a memorable meal.; lamb shank 💯 great service and atmosphere. surrounded by french locals but english friendly. thank you for the amazing food!; we enjoyed it.  lunch and dinner menu great. the service was great.; overall a nice experience. food was good and staff were friendly.

name: Seventy Five Burger House
reviews:
we are canadian tourists and i can say with certainty that this is the best burger i have ever had. not only is the service absolutely fantastic but the owner is the kindest. i recommend everyone has a burger from here at some point whether you are a tourist or a local.; best burger i’ve ever had! i’ve tried a lot of burger places in paris but this is by far the best one! the staff is super nice and open to any variations, the atmosphere and music very pleasant but the star of the show is definitely the food! i got a chicken burger and the meat was so tender but crispy at the same time, the bread super soft and the other condiments were really fresh. will definitely go back!; such a big burger and taste was on point. cherry on top its halal. the man is very friendly.
i highly recommend his burger shop!; if you're on the hunt for the best burger in paris, look no further than 75 burger house. this spot is an absolute gem. the burgers here are not just meals—they're experiences. cooked to perfection, each bite is juicy, flavorful, and leaves you wanting more.

the variety on the menu is impressive, with creative names that add a fun twist to your dining experience. but it's not just the food that makes the place stand out; the service is top-notch. the staff is incredibly welcoming and attentive, always open to customizing your order to make it just right. the owner, in particular, goes above and beyond to ensure every customer leaves with a smile.

the atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, making it a great spot whether you're out with family, friends, or just on your own.

special note : the "noter dame" burger is a must try !; sooooooooooo good. this is a real smash burger! delicious. asked for the classic with tomatoes & lettuce added = perfection. 🍔

name: La Côte et l'Arête - Restaurant, brasserie, bar à vin - Convivial, chic et chaleureux
vicinity: Face au cinéma UGC Issy, 2 Promenade Coeur de Ville, Issy-les-Moulineaux
formatted_address: Face au cinéma UGC Issy, 2 Prom. Coeur de Ville, 92130 Issy-les-Moulineaux, France
reviews:
the place is quite nice and comfortable for friends catch up very lively coloured. the food is not bad i would say. i have ordered the salmon with mashed potato.

the waiter that serves us, he is quite cute. serves with smile always even though he is limited in english, he tried his best. and recommended us at the end to take a big choux for dessert that we can share amount the table. for the price i think it was a great one. i think i was amazed with the size of the choux that i totally forgot to take a picture. but the taste was really good. highly recommend.; we went twice since the food was so good.
the entrecote was incredible.; this restaurant is way overrated 😩 the plates are drowned with smashed potato and the sashime tuna wasn’t quite it. and in terms of a good atmosphere: the light in the restaurant are so bright i had to wear my raybans 😎; the restaurant atmosphere is great, well designed. the service in general is super friendly. the food on the other end didn’t convince me. i tried one the chicken, it was half cooked and was really disappointed, the fish and chips is extremely oily. the burger is really good, one of the best item on the menu.; nice place, with lots of space both in and outside. friendly staff and amazing food!!  great combo between beef meat and seafood!

name: Big Fernand
reviews:
it's a no-brainer!
a delicious french-style burger, impeccable service and a pretty cool atmosphere.
(i recommend the paprika french fries)
honestly, i'd like to thank the waiter, who really made us feel at ease and looked after our every need.
a big thank you,
a big fernand. 🍔; probably closer to 4 stars.  came here on sunday about 8pm.   ordered the bartholome with fries.  got a blonde ipa which was amazing.   nice little restaurant.  service was good.  recommend ordering one level below as to not get it overcooked..  overall, definitely see myself coming back.; if you want to the worst hot dog of your life and fries with sprouts coming out of them this is the place to go!; this is the second location i’ve eaten at and is a fantastic burger!  homemade french fries with a great dipping sauce or use the tomato catsup provided on tables (rare in europe) that was superb as well.
quality ingredients for sure and next time i’m in france will be eating at a big fernand again.; ordering burgers from here was a big mistake. ordered big fernand, received a soggy bun with small portion of overcooked (ordered a point) meat (without even a pinch of salt), tiny bit of sauce, small piece of cheese and a piece of dried tomato. 14 euro for that is a joke. i didn't think i'll ever say this, but mcdonald's is better quality than this.

name: Ban Sue - Restaurant Thai Paris 15
reviews:
after a week of delicious but monotonous french bistro food, we were craving the spiciness and freshness of authentic thai cuisine. ban sue delivered with delicious homestyle thai dishes. very kind service and a stylish space too.; the food here was amazing! the service is wonderful, and they are very welcoming. i would recomend the steak because when me, my grandma, and mom tried it, we all were like omg this is so gooooood, so tender, & the sauce is out of this world! also for dessert, you should definetly get the sticky rice and mangos because its absolutely perfect!😋 overall, if u are looking for a thai place...come here!!! (coming from a ten year old using my mom's phone) 😉; i found this place because not far from montparnasse train station,luckily authentic thai ,chef from thailand and best dish that i took is pad thai gambas,laab,tomyom,papaya salade.i keep coming back at least 2-3 a month with friends and family.i loved the place.the team they’re nice and friendly especially with khun sue .she’s remarkable lady and has passion about thai food experience 🙏🏽🫶🏽; amazing dining experience,tasty authentic thai cuisine,cosy place!
definitely will be visiting again!; lovely restaurant for authentic thai food - the team is super warm and welcoming, and the flavor of each dish transported us to thailand. don't hesitate to visit for a comforting and delicious meal!

name: MELTING POPOTE
vicinity: 2 Rue du Pic de Barrette, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Rue du Pic de Barrette, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
great food and very nice vibe!
the owner was soo nice and she made us feel very welcome. the menu was in french but she will offer to help to translate it if you need it. the food was very good and made fresh. i would come again :); i was visiting france from boston, massachusetts and stumbled upon this little cozy restaurant, decided to try it out. i walked in and was immediately impressed of how fast the host came to greet me. the smell was quite pleasant definitely smelled aromatic like herbs and spices. i got to the table and immediately was asked if the host wanted to translate the menu for me and i was very impressed the first restaurant that someone who would actually translate for me. moving to the dish i got the egyptian chicken i was skeptical at first because i thought it would be over seasoned but no it was perfectly seasoned and cooked fresh salad on the bottom and a side of sauce wish was rich in flavor. i was blown away how not heavy the food, how flavorful and aromatic it was. i’d recommend anyone to give this place a shot if you’re in the area friendly, small, aromatic establishment. (mind you i’ve eaten at many different places in paris and so far this has made my top 3 list).; the food was very yummy and has good flavour and left the 4 of us very satisfied. the lemonade was great too, especially on a hot day. the host was very friendly and chatty and gave me the lemonade recipe too! would 100% recommend!; kitchen is filled with burnt oil aroma. risotto was not properly cooked, yet it was drenched in fat. sautéed veggies dish was drenched in oil. salmon was overcooked. service is friendly and very good. overall, not impressed at all.; we had a fabulous time thanks to rosa and her husband in this family-owned restaurant. the food was absolutely delicious (please try the fries!!), the service adorable and the atmosphere super friendly. a neighborhood gem!

name: Pedzouille La Grange
vicinity: Novotel Paris Porte de Versailles, 4 Avenue de la Porte de la Plaine Rooftop - 8ème étage, Paris
formatted_address: Novotel Paris Porte de Versailles, 4 Av. de la Prte de la Plaine Rooftop - 8ème étage, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
it was amazing here.
the service was very quick and all the staff were very nice.
the food was delicious. i had the steak with fries and it was incredible and my mom had the weekly nemo which also looked delicious.
the location was amazing with the view from the balcony being incredible.
overall i highly recommend coming.; amazing restaurant. the food was the best i’ve ever had with lovely and fast service. the views were stunning, particularly during the times when the eiffel tower was twinkling. the food is fairly priced considering the views & quality! you definitely get a lot of food and it is worth the money. it took us a while to find it but you have to enter the novotel hotel & go up the lift to the 8th floor.; the atmosphere was quite attractive and pleasant. the service was excellent, and the staff were very friendly. the cocktails were delicious; however, the food was rather average. the steak and french fries were not served warm.; pedzouille is worth it for their rooftop view alone. (go for dinner and see the eiffel tower twinkle while you eat!) but then you go and the food is amazing as well as the view! the staff are friendly and speak both english and french. they are available to explain the menu in detail and will encourage you to stay after your meal to enjoy wine on the terrace while you relax. this was one of the highlights of our stay in paris.; i had a terrible experience, we had to wait alot just to get the food menu. i told them i want to change the table it was high table and very uncomfortable they ignored me. there is no view indoors its like any regular restaurant and we ordered rib eye steak it came after 1:15 hours which is insane and it was extremely overcooked and so dry it was the worst experience i had in paris and i don’t recommend it. ah i forgot we paid 160 euros for 3 🙂

name: L'EXPOSITION
reviews: i got a ribeye steak. the peppercorn sauce is the best i've had, and the fries were amazing too.; excellent service and delicious good. very welcoming and friendly staff. impossible to reconcile our experience  with the single negative review i read, seems completely unfair to this business. will definitely return when in paris; amazing food and very friendly customer service nice traditional style; i wouldn’t feed this food to my dog. absolutely disgusting. fatty, overcooked, no flavour. rude staff. avoid at all costs.; booked a table through thefork, arrived at the restaurant, got told it was completely full and then got completely ignored by the staff.

name: Big Buddha Bois le Vent
formatted_address: 17 Rue Bois le Vent, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
really good red and green curry. spice on point. taste on point. would definitely recommend. can be a bit crowded during lunch on office days.; the lady cashier is super nice and friendly. when she took our order she smiled. every time we had an eye contact she smiled. she spoke english and was friendly.
they have some nice chairs and tables outside but indoors dining is not a good idea because it's a very small restaurant.
the food is good i think but too oily. i also don't think the ratio of protein to noodle or rice is good because the quantity of meat is just not enough.

edit: went there on 15/9 at 9pm. ordered a pad thai with chicken. there's no chicken and no fried onion in it. it's all watery like soup. just paid for some wet noodles!
very disappointing...; the food was really good for the price. the service was ok, nothing crazy.; very generous portion, good food.; went here for lunch with friends and no one was disappointed! it was very yummy and you order yourself on a kiosk. the food came pretty quick as well.the only downside is that it is small on the inside

name: Bistrot du Parc - Balard
reviews: we had a nice time at the bistrot. we enjoyed the tables outside and had a cesar salad and a bavette with french fries. i took the crepe with nutella for dessert. nice place and nice staff.; after many failed attempts to find a great dining experience, my companion and i stumbled upon this place and was in food bliss from start to finish.  the veal and steak diner were  the highlight of our trip. the server was helpful and knowledgeable about every item that was placed before us. i can wait to return and have a great meal with friends. thank you.; good service, prices are ok. but what i like the most is its location! with good weather you can seat outside and watch the kids in the park. there are not many places in paris that have this advantage when it comes to families with children.; love the beef tartar. friendly service and reasonable prices too.; great nutella crepes and excellent vanilla ice cream. fair prizes and okay service. a lot of outdoor seating in the shadows, perfect for a hot day.

name: Les Petits Parisiens (Bistrot de bons goûts)
reviews:
beautiful dinner experience for a good price. came because of the michelin guide and left delighted, the service and staff were lovely and we felt very comfortable. starters were out of this world, the veal kidney was incredible and the mashed potatoes were perfect. the strawberry tarte was so fresh and just the perfect amount of taste. all in all a first class experience for a good price; spectacular cuisine and outstanding service. arnaud and his team took care of us and guided us through the vast menu of delicious foods and wine. highly recommended!; fantastic dinner experience, maybe our favorite in paris. every course of food was delectable, the wine was excellent, and the service was impeccably attentive. i will be thinking about my dessert, the rice pudding, for years to come! they were kind to accommodate our sleeping baby  in a stroller as well.; we had the opportunity to enjoy an extraordinary dinner experience at this restaurant. from start to finish, we had an attentive waiter that was friendly and respectful, he was also competent and efficient.  he was knowledgeable about the extensive wine list they offer and easily recommended us a wine that was to our liking that would also pair well with the food we ordered. the restaurant is in a small and quiet place, so the atmosphere was calm and enjoyable. there was no excessive noise. the food itself was also delightful. our food was prepared with high quality ingredients and all the dishes we ordered were properly and skillfully flavoured. we enjoyed all the courses fully, the only complaint i would have would probably be the fish not having enough depths in flavours itself. the toppings however made up for most of it. finally, even though the portions are relatively small for the prices they charge, we were still quite stuffed after having the 3 courses. they also served a pre-appetizer before we ordered which helps portion-wise. to be honest though, they only charge 41 euro for a 3 course meal which is a very reasonable price and an inexpensive place to enjoy a more exquisite experience. one of the biggest downsides is the lack of air conditioning so it felt a bit warm eating in the restaurant.; great food and atmosphere. had the chance to try some french classics paired with great wine recommendations.

it was a bit out of the way but i’m glad we made the journey.

veal kidney is a must

name: Pap's Café
reviews: my airbnb was right across the street so we enjoyed three meals at pap’s. bob was very good to us. the burrata salad was my absolute favorite! the salmon tartare and burger were very good as well.; first time visiting paris, from new york - we were just strolling by and came across this lovely place. we were greeted by bob. he is very friendly and kind. made us feel welcomed. the food was absolutely delicious, and the best veggie lasagna i’ve had! bob made this experience wonderful for my family and i. so very grateful! would definitely recommend coming here for the service, food and overall all smiles! will come back once we visit again. thank you so much!!; had some hot drinks and bread with butter and strawberry jam. coffee was good and the baguette was fresh.; we stayed on avenue du maine for a few nights and ate across the street three times at pap’s café. excellent wine choices and traditional french cuisine. bob our server was so kind. get the burrata and salmon tartare. and all of the desserts.; great burger and fries, and a coffee ☕️ will come back again during my stay in paris

name: Le Lock Groove
reviews:
best bar in the 14th district. excellent food, better cocktails and even better service ❤️
cozy place to enjoy homemade food & cocktails while listening to og records the staff choose and play along the night; great burgers (not your average french portion) & fries with a good variety of options. it can get crowded but we arrived on a monday night around 830pm and managed to grab a couple of seats in the front near the bar. it's a grungey dive bar but we liked that, not into pretentious places that charge a bomb. well worth a visit for a casual drink, good burger and a relaxed atmosphere.; low-key spot in the busy neighborhood of denfert-rochereau, the bar offers great burgers at a decent price. to wash it down, beers on tap are proposed!
to top it up, friendly service!
indoor seating options (check for seats at the back). get crowded quite fast!; i feel bad for you if you don’t know this place ! the ambiance was amazing, high level cocktails and just an overall gorgeous decor. especially a thanks to server pierre and kylian for an awesome evening.; cant say enough good things about this spot! great spot- like walking back in time to a 60's bar with a dj playing all the latest british rock and naked hotties pasted to the walls. interesting characters frequent the spot. great spot for nightcap. i hear the burgers are great. 14th arrondismont

name: Numéro 41, Restaurant - Bistrot Paris 16
reviews:
everything is fresh and excellent. friendly service. plan to make a reservation ahead of time, very busy at lunch time.; food was excellent, both starter and main, for all three of us. service was spot on, very friendly, funny, quick and accommodating. pricing was in line with expectations, not too expensive. atmosphere was good and as you'd expect from a residential neighborhood...a friendly local restaurant, nothing too special, but 60-70% full with friendly groups of locals mixed with a few tourists.; michelin starred restaurant ( which we discovered once inside) the food was absolutely delicious, perfect quantities, simple and efficient combinations… it just hits the spot! we went there on a sunday night and it was nice and quiet. such a lovely surprise that we will go back to for sure !; atmosphere: cozy and family-style with soft lighting, a semi-open kitchen, pet-friendly.

food: high-quality ingredients, modern cuisine with french influences.

opening hours: surprisingly, open all day, serving meals during breakfast, lunch, and dinner, with beverages available in between

rservations are recommended.; great food, wonderful food, unpretentious vibe. the service was good too. my friend and i ended up finishing an amazing bottle of bordeaux wine (in retrospect, i wish i took a photo of it or took note of the name) with our dinner. the ambiance of the restaurant was really cozy and welcoming.

it does get really busy so i’d recommend making a reservation. would definitely go back there.

name: Bistro Cobalt
reviews: we visited one evening and the atmosphere was great and it was really busy. the staff were very friendly and service was good. the only minor issue was the food was just okay and not very hot. they take something off the bill for this 👍; great place for afterwork especially during hotter temps! happy hour available. we got the croquetas and hummus — enough for two for a light snack/dinner.; very nice café and very nice staff. prices are extremely competitive (aka for the area very cheap). i can only recommend this place.; happy hour with two pints of beer and frites for 10€, great option!; i went here for a simple bite to eat. the menu is a strange mix of nothing. within ten minutes i was asked to give up my seat because regulars were coming. i am a filmmaker from la in paris to promote my movie. the regulars looked like silverlake kids living off their parents. ironically the owner was wearing a dodgers cap. don't go here if you have any self respect.

name: La Cabane 47
formatted_address: 47 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
