i wish i could give higher than 5 stars.  i live nearby and la cabane quickly became our local place.  the food, cocktails, and service are all amazing!  the owners and servers are bilingual.  they are so friendly and kind to everyone - guaranteed a good time.  we bring all our visitors here as well!  never disappointed.  when in paris - you must stop by la cabane 47!; very polite, professional service and amazing food. served in intimate atmosphere. restaurant is small and quite busy so we were surprised when we were offered a good choice out of the available tables. food arrived shortly after we ordered and it was tasty, well seasoned and filling.; some of the best food experiences we've had- the team operates like clockwork and dance around each other like a well rehearsed performance.
the food was fantastic- we had burgers, fries, beer and dessert. the quality of the ingredients is what made it delicious and the guys working that evening treated us so well. we can't wait to be back. thank you for making our 1st anniversary special. 🫶; really good service and accommodating and welcoming to non french speaking visitors. food and cocktails were delicious and good values for money. atmosphere was fun and enjoyable inside and out.; every time i go to paris, i have to eat la cabane 47. their truffle pasta is one of the best truffle pastas i’ve ever tried!! also, the staff are amazing and super super friendly. highly recommend them!

name: Le Vauban
reviews:
great for waiting for aura experience!

we arrived one hour earlier to the aura light show and we came here to have dinner. it was very cozy inside, good dinner, good price.; had an amazing piece of steak at this place, it was lunchtime and was packed, that could be a testimony of how good the food is there. the table service was reasonable, quite polite and the prices fair.

i recommend a visit and surely will go there whenever i find myself in paris.

ps: the surrounding area is also filled with cultural attractions worth walking around after lunch or dinner and hear their history.; the pris fixee menu was an outstanding value at €50 per person. the food was delicious and beautifully presented on the plate. a generous amount of good quality wine was served with each course. the waiter poured a good amount of rum on the baba au rum dessert, and then left the bottle on the table in case anybody wanted a little more.  wow!; had a cappuccino here in 2017 in a group trip with my sister and cousin. honestly don't remember anything about the food, but it was fun trying to find this place in google maps off memory.; beautiful restaurant. beautiful staff. american friendly!!! dinner was wonderfully done,  dessert was delicious,  bread was super fresh. will come here again!!

name: Wave In Paris
vicinity: 107 Rue de la Croix Nivert, Paris
formatted_address: 107 Rue de la Croix Nivert, 75015 Paris, France
reviews:
if you got the california blues, this is the next best thing to light up your day 😉
my kid had a blast, on a cold & rainy parisien afternoon. the staff is great, prices vary between 25-35 euro for an all inclusive hour of fun. just bring your bathing suit and a towel.; i went surfing once as a kid, so my skills were more than rusty. ponch was a great instructor who made me gain confidence and skills quickly! by the end of the lesson, we were doing 360° on the board. 10/10 would recommend giving this a try!; great experience. thanks to the instructor ponge, i upgraded my surfing skills, very patient and clear. the place has a space co-working with bar and snacks. i fully recommended it!; top!
i highly recommend this place! great place to learn to surf with great instructors! you have access to showers and locker rooms. instructors easily adapt to the level of each one of us to let us improve quickly while having fun and motivating us!
thanks for today’s session!
also great place to meet new surf addicts!; the place to be !!!
amazing experience, my daughter and her friends were having the time of their lives.
1 hour with the brilliant mateo, super professional and attentive coach.
thanks again for an amazing experience we will come back.

name: Le Thermidor
reviews:
very nice food and very nice people; classic bar tabac with authentic interior. downstairs features timeless telephone cabines and bathrooms. friendly service.
i hope it stays this way.; my experience at this restaurant was absolutely awful, if i could give it less than one star i would. the service is horrible and the staff are extremely rude and discriminatory. me and my dad were at the louvre and decided to stop by here for lunch. my father has cancer and eats a strict diet because of his condition. when we asked about vegan options we were treated rudely and were barely accommodated. i did my best to speak in french and was nothing but kind to the server. upon finishing my main course the server abruptly dumped the remains of my plate onto the table in front of me knowing that i had ordered dessert and it was not there yet. in addition, i watched as the server walked with the used plate, wiped it with a dry cloth and laid it with the clean plates. disgusting.
not to mention we were 1 out of 2 brown families sitting in the restaurant both of whom were treated with a lack of respect from the server and the owner. the other family who sat directly in front of us had brought small children to the cafe. the children, as children do,  began to get playful in the cafe and the owner yelled ferociously at them. i was horrified. paris is a tourist city, in fact we were right down the street from the louvre. that being said, it is evident that many of the customers that eat at this joint would be tourists so it is unfair to expect that everyone will speak french and to treat paying customers rudely because of this is insanely ridiculous. the experience i had at this joint not only showed a lack of hospitality but a lack of humility. the food was subpar but would have tasted much better if they had been kind to us while we were there. this was one of the first and only meals i ate on my trip to paris and it left a sour taste in my mouth for the rest of my trip. i would not recommend this cafe to anyone. a tip to management: food is best served with warmth and kindness.; took over one hour to get the food to our table. when asked, was very rude. food was not good. would not recommend visiting here.; nice 🇩🇰🇩🇰

name: Le Relais Charbon
reviews:
my parents and i were there at the first time and we absolutely would recommend this place to our friends.
the food tastes good, quite big menu so everyone can choose what he wants, good looking as outside as inside.
the workers were friendly and really polite.
generally speaking, this place worth to be visited for 100 percent
the snails and blue cheese are my favorites!; amazing authentic french cuisine and a comfortable atmosphere. be patient with service: it’s great, but when we were here there was one server for most of the restaurant.; unplanned visit - the food and service was excellent. duck confit was excellent! my dining partner did think his steak was undercooked, double-check with your server.; very good food at affordable prices - located literally opposite chelsea michel metro which makes it easy access to all and close to shops and the buzz of the 15eme - meat was good: nice entrecôte, we recommend the ‘supreme de volaille’ and ‘tartare’ (not with blue cheese though) - nice wine menu and generally friendly staff; delicious lunch , you get really full, and lovely local wine as well.
good service and price.

name: Le Village du 15
reviews:
me and my partner came to paris for a 3 day trip. we had eaten in multiple places, yet nothing compared to village. the food, service and overall experience was just amazing. the staff were just so friendly and honestly cared about the service they provided. it is so reasonably priced, the cocktails were lovely and we even received a free dessert! honestly could not recommend this place enough. if you visit paris and want somewhere affordable with great food and excellent service, please please visit here.
(also, the chicken burger was the best we have ever tasted anywhere in the world); the best meal and service! our team had an amazing time here and the food was fantastic; just got to paris, and i'm already loving it because of this place! such a good vibe ✨️  french music, great champagne, yummy burgers with fries and salad, delicious coffee, and dessert, not to mention the awesome service. we were smiling the whole time!! recommend; one of the most memorable restaurant evenings we have had. came with friends, sat next to locals who shared their meal, and recommended an off-  menu tomahawk steak to share. the atmosphere and service from the owner was truly delightful and the  evening is one we won't forget for a long time.; something must have changed since the information on the page more reviews are accurate. super small, limited menue and taste is low.
also some items were-not available.

name: Su Misura
reviews:
you need to dine at su misura while in paris. our party of three had a wonderful dinner here after a long day touring paris.

su misura's food is freshly prepared with love in a clean and beautiful restaurant filled with family mementos.

great staff, atmosphere, menu selection, and the food is phenomenal. located on a quiet street with beautiful views of the eiffel tower from the street.; su misure is a great place for multinational cuisine. at the premier location close to eiffel tower, this traditional restaurant offers a great variety of dishes like pasta, pizza as well as local cuisine like gratin. we are vegetarian and there are lots of options for us. we ordered a tomato sauce gnocchi and a vegetarian gratin. they were well seasoned and delicious in a way they stimulated your every tongue pallet.; we came here during our trip to paris. the food, service, and atmosphere were outstanding. first time being able to have gluten free ravioli (it’s rare to come by) and i was blown away. the atmosphere is so cozy and quaint.; su misura is a charming gluten-free exclusive restaurant that offers a personalized dining experience with lovely outdoor seating and a stunning view of the eiffel tower. from the moment i walked in, i was captivated by the stylish yet cozy ambiance. the soft lighting, elegant decor, and friendly staff set the stage for a memorable evening. the service at su misura was exceptional. our server was attentive, knowledgeable about the menu, and very accommodating. knowing that every dish was gluten-free put me at ease and allowed me to indulge without worry. the outdoor seating added a delightful touch, with a serene atmosphere, a gentle breeze, and the breathtaking sight of the eiffel tower enhancing our dining experience. after much deliberation, i decided to order the gluten-free ravioli, while my dining companion opted for the gluten-free bolognese. the ravioli was a revelation. the gluten-free pasta was perfectly al dente, stuffed with a rich and savory ricotta filling. each bite was a delightful blend of flavors, enhanced by a light, aromatic tomato sauce, and a sprinkling of fresh basil. it was evident that only high-quality ingredients were used, and the balance of flavors was impeccable. the gluten-free bolognese was equally impressive. the sauce was robust and hearty, with tender ground meat and a medley of vegetables cooked to perfection. served over a bed of gluten-free pasta, it was a comforting and satisfying dish that showcased the chef's skill and attention to detail. for dessert, we shared the flourless chocolate cake, which was rich and decadent, with a velvety texture that melted in the mouth. it was the perfect way to conclude a fantastic dining experience. overall, su misura exceeded my expectations in every way. the combination of delicious, thoughtfully prepared food, outstanding service, and a warm, inviting atmosphere with the added charm of outdoor seating and a view of the eiffel tower makes it a must-visit. i will definitely be returning to explore more of their gluten-free offerings.; went tonight and loved it. i had the lamb shank with roasted vegetables. what a delight. our gracious, friendly and knowledge server lenny recommended it and now i know why. for dessert we had the tiramisu (gluten free) also quite nice. the gluten free bread and the veggie potato soup at the start we're spot on. if you're in the area have a meal there. they will take good care of you.

name: Restaurant PERCHIANA Paris
reviews:
i recently dined at perchiana paris, an exceptional iranian restaurant that i highly recommend. the food is freshly prepared, bursting with authentic flavors that truly stand out. the owner is incredibly generous, ensuring every guest feels welcomed and valued. the calm, inviting ambience makes it the perfect spot for a relaxed meal. whether you're familiar with iranian cuisine or trying it for the first time, this place is a must-visit.; we have eaten here a number of times and every time the food has been excellent and full of flavor.   the portions are also very generous as is the service.   we have not eaten at other persian / iranian in paris and with the quality of this restaurant there is no need to try another!  highly recommend as you will not be disappointed.; a little cozy persian restaurant where you can get very tasty food! they are so kind and always smiling which makes us feel even happier with all the delicious food! the portions were good size and we even took them for takeaway. if you are looking for good quality food and amazing service, i definitely recommend this place!; first time in france, visited this restaurant and it exceeded our expectations in every possible way. the rice was freshly cooked and  chicken and lamb were great quality and tender. the owner is also super friendly and professional and had a chat with us whilst inviting us to try their saffron black tea which tasted heavenly. whether it's your first time trying persian cuisine or you've tried it before, i'd highly recommend visiting perchiana to have a wonderful and authentic dining experience.; the food is really delicious and aromatic! i highly recommend the restaurant. do try their gormeh sabzi!
the service is quite quick. i’m case you take grill options, you’ll have to wait because they prepare it fresh. 3 people, we paid 19€ each for the dish. (rather a bit expensive)

name: Restaurant italien pizzeria la gourmandise
reviews:
delicious italian food. we went there twice for dinners in 3 days.  great price, great food, great service.  the pasta, risotto, and pizza came out hot.  highly recommended!; wonderful food! all of their pasta is immaculate both in flavour and texture, and is very reasonably priced. the margherita pizza was even better, a huge pizza for just 10 dollars, cooked to perfection. easily my favorite thing i've eaten in my travels to france. not to mention the service, with an amazingly enthusiastic and loving staff.

wonderful restaurant, 10/10; grabbed a lunch with family before heading over to the tower. nice seating outside off a side street. pasta tasted ok but not great. flavor was a little bland. carbonara, bolognese.  salad was ok. it wasn’t supper busy but servants didn’t really check in.; it is quite affordable considering the location however the pizzas that we order were average. i had much better ones for same price but it doesn't mean they were bad, food was nice. the restroom was clean but small.; this place is a hidden gem, it’s tucked down a side street a few minutes away from the effiel tower. prices are affordable, 10-18 euros for a homemade pizza, beer is 5 euros and the service is excellent. highly recommend.

name: mombini
reviews: we had a beautiful one hour walk to get here, and although the store is small it is beautiful.  the range and quality of the merchandise was reflected in the prices.  the cafe at the back was great testing point.  would come here again if i felt like picking up quality items for friends or for ourselves.; it's a shop with nice but expensive toys for kids, some design stuff for the house and a small café in the back with a play area for the kids. it's on the expensive side but the food is very nice.; great shop / café / atelier and amazing stuff for kids but quite expensive; a great alternative to a freezing day! a small space designed for small children with books, games and large cushions. we had a music workshop upstairs, very interesting and engaging, perhaps with the heating too strong. at the moment of leaving the delirium, on the floor below the crowd of strollers and screaming children. the second time we were lucky and only found 4 other children, so there was room for the strollers and i was calmly able to taste the products in the cafeteria.; a very nice shop and a very pleasant place for children. i tried the musical awakening workshop, a real pleasure! small downside, the workshops are on the first floor so not always easy to access with two babies.

name: Les Apaches
reviews: i noticed that the restaurants and seating areas were quite small wherever we went, but the food and flavours were exceptional. this establishment offered a remarkable fish dish, which i cannot recall the name of, but it is visible in the photograph. it was incredibly delicious, and the escargot was also delectable. the entire experience was wonderful, and the food was truly exquisite.; wherever in paris you might be located, you need to go there! the food is delicately prepared to every order. taste is a 10/10 and the vibes are immaculate. we went back another time after eating there one evening (even though far away) because it was amazing. the staff is really kind. restaurant is not so big so make sure to make a reservation. definitely ask to try the vodka produced by one of the owners!; the steak was a bit tough and difficult to chew but the server was very kind and friendly and the atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy. i would recommend to my friends to visit☺️; food was great, service was phenomenal and it felt right at home! enzo and galin were great and definitely made my birthday. felt like a proper cheers with some great friends 🍻🍻; fantastic little bistro near to where i was staying at the ibis budget. the food was great, as was the service. thoroughly recommended.

name: Bistrot Le dôme
reviews: this restaurant provides the beeeeest french  meals in paris! the confit and tartare are the beeeest i’ve ever had.😍 don’t miss it! btw, the waiters here are soooo nice💗; food + wine was amazing, both server/bartenders were lovely, and the vibe was so relaxed and neighbourly.; beautiful spot, far from the tourist area. delicious food, warm attention and good prices. we were looking for something to eat at 3 pm and found this oasis. will definitely come back when we visit paris again :); good meal for a reasonable price. breads of decent quality can be refilled for free. kind and friendly staff welcomes visitors.; was expecting something extremely good due to the high rating of 4.9, but everything was quite ordinary: the duck was dry, the beef bourgoune was out of stock. it was slightly compensated by  the wine , which was indeed good, but overall rating should be  at my opinio about 4 points.

name: L'appart Bistro
reviews:
i was visit with my partner sunday night at 06/11/2022, just for take one glass. it was too quite. mr:barman was recommended me one blond beer, which i was order. too good beer. as one beer lover!  i definitely recommend to enjoy it.

little music will be more better 😁.

thank you for your service mr:barman. we will come back.; the food is ok but really go here for the service and the ambiance. the staff are lovely and the street is quiet and it's not crowded or hurried. i would go back in a heartbeat if i'm ever here again.; nice place to have lunch. i am from spain and it has a lot of plates variety. very recommended; local and authentic parisian food and atmosphere. friendly and welcoming host who also speaks english. came here twice during my short stay.; wonderful french bistro, food was amazing, and they accommodated our large group with no problems. boeuf tartare and boeuf bourguignon were our favorites! wine selection was very good too. would definitely come back again.

name: Le Petit Baigneur
formatted_address: 10 Rue de la Sablière, 75014 Paris, France
reviews:
small cute traditional french restaurant, well sized dishes of great quality. definitely would call this a unique experience, the atmosphere is great and they even let you mark your order on a piece of paper to save time. would recommend for a family dinner.; excellent food and service. they give you a paper and ask you write down what you want to order
it is then given to the chef who is very quick to prepare the dishes. the young couple who served us were full of energy and passion and kept the turnover fast. not crowded you can walk in. spoke good english so was easy to communicate. we had the escargots and ravioli for starters roast pork and roast chicken for mains and chocolate fondant and lime and raspberry tiramisù for dessert. if i were to go there again i would just order the starters as it is quintessentially french food which is fast disappearing in the global landscape of burgers pizza pasta and sushi; very pretty traditional french food, nice decoration. love their terrace under the sun.; quaint bistro, classic french cuisine. the menu is similar to that of the close-by bistro des plantes. mostly traditional dishes, but with a few idiosyncratic elements. very enjoyable throughout. fairly priced, given the quality and the sizeable portions. friendly service as well. inside and outside seating available.; great place where i ended up having lunch, just because of the way it looked.
everything was a delight here, from the staff to the food and wine.
very recommendable!

name: Le Relais de la Place
reviews:
quick ordered and served, nice staff. parisian way.
now, i really hope my tiramisu was fresh but am really not sure as it looked old with water in it. not sure the place is safe
i will update this post if not. give me 12 hours
:); had a calabrese pizza and 2 stella pints. great meal, beer and price. magnificent. thanks; natalle, the proprietor was helpfull and very friendly.  now a pizzeria the food is still fantastic. very reasonably priced; nice atmosphere and very nice service; there is an older hostess (she might be the owner) who has a permanent frown. she never even tries to smile. tries to give the impression that she's doing you a favor by serving you...soured the taste of the chocolate mousse in my mouth! you're lucky if you're served by the younger waitress, who is quite friendly. the mousse was actually quite good...would have given 4 stars, if it weren't for the attitude.

name: La Delizia restaurant traiteur italien paris 15
reviews:
certainly! here’s a positive review for la delizia 174:

---

we visited la delizia 174 in paris last night, and it was an unforgettable experience! the food was absolutely delicious, with a truly authentic italian taste that made me feel like i was right in the heart of italy. the cozy, intimate atmosphere of this small restaurant added to its charm, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed meal.

a big highlight of our visit was the owner—his attentiveness and warm hospitality made us feel right at home. i especially loved the lasagna with truffle flavor and mushrooms; it was simply amazing! we will definitely be coming back. highly recommend for anyone seeking a true taste of italy in paris!; small cozy restaurant, the guy tried his best to translate it as well. the burrata is yummy! didnt take the rest of food, but its worth trying if you are near the neighbourhood.; there was nothing good about food at this place. i give 2 stars only because we didn’t have food poisoning.
arancini is good inside but everything is ruined by the fact, that it’s not crispy at all, it tastes like made 2 days ago and reheated in microwave. carbonara doesn’t have guanciale or anything like this, it tastes like cheap ham, i also need to add that it’s made with cream…
ravioli - oh my god. it was served cold inside but what’s funny it is not the worst thing about this dish. in my opinion pasta is the same one you can buy in monoprix or any shop like this. absolutely no! tomato sauce is like just sauce from the bottle, not even seasoned.
and the best one - tiramisu. i don’t think that they add any mascarpone there, it’s like sponge cakes layered with whipped cream.
for appetizer+dish+dessert you have to pay 16 euro if you eat at the restaurant.
i would not recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy meal.; we had a magnificent time at this restaurant. the food was delicious and the owners were so very kind, warm, and generous. on top of that, their prices are very reasonable. i highly recommend having a meal at la delizia.; we used to come here to buy some italian cold cuts and cheese and it was delicious.
the place is now suitable for a dinner as well.
the staff is friendly and always smiling.
the platters taste good. we tested the antipasti platter and the buffala as starters: it was really tasty.
we had liguine with truffles: could do better in taste but it’s still good.
the bolognese lasagna was also good.
an overall good experience.

name: La Source
formatted_address: 49 Bd de la Tour-Maubourg, 75007 Paris, France
reviews:
everything was really nice at this restaurant. the drinks menu and the food menu is quite rich and i fell in love with the interior design. we will definitely be back.; great little restaurant off the main stretch - enough traffic for people watching without being overwhelmed but street noise. the french onion soup and bolognese was delicious. escargot was full of flavour but the snails were a bit smaller than others were had. the frog legs were tender but needed a bit more salt (and more cook time, one was a bit too raw - make sure to check before eating).

overall great spot and would definitely come back again!; la source in paris is a culinary oasis that captures the essence of french cuisine flawlessly. from the moment you step in, you're greeted with a charming ambiance that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience. the menu boasts a delightful array of french classics, each dish crafted with precision and bursting with flavor. the service is impeccable, with knowledgeable staff who are passionate about ensuring your satisfaction. a true gem in the heart of paris, this restaurant is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic taste of france.; i had a greet welcome here, staffs are so nice, food was good. tidy, clean!
nothing to complain on the day we visit here!; we stumbled upon la source and found the atmosphere to be inviting and prices very reasonable. we ordered the beef tartar and it was just perfect. our waiter was also so friendly! highly recommend

name: Bistrot Pia paris
reviews: my husband ordered a cheeseburger and said it was one of the best burgers he's had and i ordered chicken fillet linguine and it was delish! highly recommend this place! 🤍; i ordered the bruschetta (not pictured) and the risotto with shrimp. the bruschetta was not prepared the italian way, but it was still ok. just not what i was expecting. the risotto was delicious.; delicious food and amazing service and friendly staff! will definetly be back!!; extremely helpful to english speaking have a separate menu with english, staff and management absolutely lovely.; atmosphere is fine if you are seating outside.  happy hour is great at 5.5 euros for a pint.  service could be better.

name: L'Ogre
reviews: we had a very tasty meal, the food quality is very good at reasonable prices, and the wine collection is quite large as well.; order the entrecote steak with a 10euro red wine! you won't regret it. and the male staff  is super friendly and fun; the waiters here are classy. aude took care of us and she was wonderful. the food was tasty. it's a short walk from the eiffel tower. the sauce on the beef tartare was excellent, just enough flavors so it doesnt take away from the full taste of the beef. i really wish the wagyu steak had better texture but it was still good. definitely recommend starting out with the bone marrow. hope to be back again.; above all, the staff was so kind. we visited only after looking at google reviews, and we were a little worried because we were not good at french. however, the staff explained it in english so kindly, and there was no problem with communication at all. and when we ordered meat for 4 people, they explained that we could order it properly so that we wouldn't overpay, and we were very satisfied. we plan to visit often during our stay in paris. 👍; come for the steak, stay for the bone marrow. lovely little restaurant, very good wine list and very friendly staff. perfectly located if you want to see la tour sparkle. i don’t smoke but if that’s your thing, they have a cigar room. you can’t as it go wrong here, unless you are vegetarian.

name: Pizza du Chef
reviews: the best pizza in issy but maybe even in paris! the dough was cooked to perfection, soft and crispy. we ordered the prestigieuse with truffle and often times truffle pizza can taste overwhelming but here the flavour was just perfect. we also had chicken wings which were equally tasty! our new pizza joint! i highly recommend it.; generally a take away place, but they have some tables outside and are happy to serve you of you eat there. large menu with plenty of vegetarian options. good crust.; moved to the neighborhood recently and was pleasantly surprised to find pizza du chef! it’s not your traditional pizza, there is something  unique. you can taste the high quality ingredients and pride they take in their craft.; we ordered few pizzas last thursday with some friends. we like to order our pizzas there: they are fresh and pizza du chef is offering a large variety of pizzas.; the pizzas are excellent. french interpretation of the italian delicacy. there are two small tables outside , not really a place for a sit down meal. better than almost all other pizzerias around.

name: Il Cottage
reviews:
we drove by on a weekday and the terrace looked cozy and funny for an italian restaurant that pretended to be a ski club in summer in paris.

i noticed they had a buffet with salads, pizza, cheese, vegetables and pasta’s. looked great, so we decided to take it. two drinks were included for a pretty decent price.

we were not disappointed. the food was good and very tasty. there were also some slices with pizza bianca left. these were great! i trust that the rest of their menu was good as well.; we wandered in off the street and we're pleasantly surprised by this offbeat restaurant. good pizza and calzone. good crust, fresh arugula, great prices. we liked it.; the only thing saving this place from a lower rating is the fact that food is really good at a nice price and and the outdoor terrace is super nice on a sunny day. the service is super slow (only two severs on a busy saturday afternoon - seems like a management scheduling error ?) it’s also child friendly but menu options are limited on the weekend ..; great location and amazing concept. as an italian living in paris i explore all the food places claiming a relation with italy. food wasn’t bad at all to be honest but the two stars are for the service : slow and not very attentive to the customers needs and demands. after a walk in the nearby park de boulogne it’s a nice place to stop for some food and some drinks especially in a sunny day; a really extraordinary spot near the boulogne forest :-) hans among customers is really what one would not expect in the central paris :-)

name: STREET FOOD ORIGINAL
formatted_address: 12 Rue du Général Lanrezac, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
it's probably a foodie secret that if you want great food, you need to get out of the primary thrufare or main streets and get to side streets and gullies which it turned out to be true in this case. went with the family for a sit in dinner after visiting 'arc de triomphe'. it was a 10 min walk and shop's sitting arrangements begs improvements.
but, man the food was quite great, tasty and warm. we ordered few things across the menu like pesto panini, arrabiata pasta, omelet, fries and home made thiramusu. they got lot of food options.
food was somewhat quick given there were only 2 people, one taking orders and one cooking in the kitchen, it's a small place with seating for only upto 10 or 12 folks....
i'd give more for service. they both were awesome.
if you are in the neighborhood do plan to visit them for lunch or dinner.; wonderful experience! we are visiting and this pizza was amazing! some of the best pizza we’ve had and we are coming from new york. we will eat here again before we leave. the owner was very kind and welcoming!; we ordered different dishes here, pasta, burger, pizza & crêpes. the pizza was the best, the rest were plain and not much taste.; food was just perfect. we ordered a pizza and dessert crepe. some of the best pizza i've had, and i used to live in nyc. the man (owner?) who was preparing the food was so friendly as well. and to top it off, it was one of the most affordable meals we've had in paris so far. i highly recommend!!; great place close to the city visiting area and worth a trip there if you are looking for a mouth watering food 😊. been to the restaurant with my family and there is food for everyone both kids and grown ups .

name: Le Chalet
formatted_address: 63 Rue de la Pompe, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
just stopped in for a quick café crème and croissant 🥐. the great atmosphere of a typical french bar. a very busy but efficient barman. 5€ bill was also a pretty good in this day and age.; always have a nice experience here whether for a coffee during day or drink in the evening. indoor and outdoor seating.; we ate here twice on our stay (both mid week, mid afternoon). the food is absolutely superb. we had slightly different steak dishes, and it’s one of the best steaks we’ve had.

the service was also excellent. i would definitely recommend eating here; a nice cafe, restaurant and bar. the place opened early morning and busy during breakfast time. a nice place to eat and drinks. lots drinks selections of hot and drinks  including wines and cocktail.; me and my partner went here on our first night in paris, food was amazing but we didn’t feel very welcome there, one waiter spoke english and came over and helped us which was lovely.
we decided to give it another chance on our last night and never felt more disrespected. it took about 20 minutes for us to get a menu and another 20 to actually order, the waiters were horrible and clearly did not want to serve us.
it seemed like an older audience here so maybe they thought me and my partner did not ‘fit in’ as were in our 20’s.
it’s a shame because the food is amazing and the place is beautiful, but i will certainly not be returning

name: Schwartz’s Deli
reviews:
the hamburgers were so nice, which comes along with a side dish of fries. they also serve free water, which is very nice! it's also pretty close to the eiffel tower, and the sight of eating out is very stunning. the prices here are pretty good - not overpriced for what you get.
the service was very friendly and we received our food pretty fast as well. i'd definitely recommend to eat here.; excellent food and even better service. we were craving a jewish deli and weren’t disappointed. they actually specialized in hamburgers but the pastrami was really good. they have a few locations but this one was nice because the whole restaurant was open which kept the temperature comfortable.; very fast and friendly service with great food. as a tourist in paris i was made to feel welcome by the lovely team here. the rueben was fantastic with great chips and the kind staff even charged my phone for me 🙏🏼🙏🏼; the food is good, i was expecting more because of the youtubers reviews, but i felt it's a little bit over rated. the service is great. the ambience is good too nothing special.; the tastiest hamburger we've ever eaten, excellent beef tartar, excellent service and quality.  for sure we will be back

name: Coffee Parisien
reviews:
eggs benedict and ceaser salad delicious - great terrasse; lovely french bistro to grab a quick bite. the crispy chicken sandwich i was awesome. service was lightening quick and friendly. glad i stumbled upon this today.; bbq ribs was big  tasty service good food arrived fast, for kids meal order chicken balls and fries, my kid love it; super tasty food!
particularly love their club sandwiches, pecan pie and cheesecake
overall you won’t be disappointed by whatever you order; even though i happen to work for starbucks, i've never really been a coffee everyday type of person. that all changed while visiting paris, i fell in love with @coffeeparisien, the coffee and burgers are fantastic. the ambiance was perfect, but what really made it super welcoming was the staff: alexandra, julia, philippe and mary made me feel as if their home was my home, and definitely gave me something to look forward to when i visit paris again!

name: Café À la Fontaine
reviews:
amazing food, original recipes , i would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great eating experience..🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥; (dine in 5/5/2024)robbery. food is fine. but the service is not. we made a reservation with the folk which offering 30% discount on food. when payment, the waiter kept refusing to make discount on bill. kept saying i need a card for discount and acted like having a language barrier. after payment, his english level suddenly returned to normal. can i call it a discrimination? if you are not willing to give a discount, simply just shut down the folk option and stop cheating the customer.

update on 10/5/2024:
case addressed by the cafe’s manager. verbal apologies with refund offered. so we are done here. thank you for the prompt action from the manager. wish you all the best.; very nice parisian brasserie ,
quick and kind service
the burger was told to be delicious; having a rainy weekend in paris with our dog proved to be a challenge, but thankfully we came across this cafe with a great covered/closed in patio. service was kind and excellent! great formulas for brunch and the oj was perfect. we will be back!; the service and atmosphere are great but the food can be improved
it’s also a good café for drinks

name: Café Contre Allée
vicinity: 57 Avenue de la Grande Armée, Paris
formatted_address: 57 Av. de la Grande Armée, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
great atmosphere. great bistro.

they were so kind about my appalling french (yes, of course i’m ashamed!) and helped me. ordered chardonnay during their happy hour and peppered burger. both fab! loved sitting listening to the hustle and bustle of parisian life. great place to eat and drink. i’m from scotland - i should know. 👍🏼; we were walking from one pub/cafe to another looking for a french beer and this place had it! we couldn't be happier! staff super friendly as you want them to be! cozy enough place. took booking for a table from us for next day no problem, well spoken english.; good stake and decent price for paris standards. suggested.; really good food, really nice ambient, good price, and really nice reception from a super polite blonde girl. @20-06-2016 (dinner); in the culinary desert that is the neighborhood; this place is decent and service is nice. food average.

name: Indiana Café - Beaugrenelle
reviews:
this is my last night in paris and just wanted to try as it is next to my hotel. i fascinated with the atmosphere, kindness and speed of staff and taste of the foods. calamaris, chili cheese balls and cheese quasadilles were amazing! tacos was really delicious and even i really love nachos, i couldnt finish it. kids menu is originally designed with main dishes, side dishes, desert and drink. price performance level is charming.
i asked for limoncello at the end, it was a bit chaotic until getting it but never mind, sometimes it happens :); we stopped in here on a very busy day of site seeing and walking. we ordered a hamburger and a taco salad. sorry to say both were mediocre. wait staff was hardly ever available. never rude, just not attentive. we wont go back.; we arrived during the happy hour and the server was very nice and helpful.
we did not have to wait long to order our food or to get our food. we had two main dishes, two desserts and 3 cocktails and paid under 70€. that is absolutely fine for paris and being that close to the seine.
food was quite good and the cocktails were delicious :)
they even have pool tables there.; the service at the restaurant was slow, it was very hard to order and then to get the servers attention, the restaurant wasn’t particularly full also. we had a long wait for the food and when we got it wasn’t as hot as it should have been.
when the food did come although a little cold it was delicious and they have a good range of food and drinks.; we were very pleased when we arrived, although we hadn’t booked they managed to fit 4 of us in, although it was very cramped area. the food was good and a reasonable price, service was a little sketchy. the waiting staff had no pads and tried to memorise order (very radam) they got our order wrong and never really put it right. i think i would still be waiting for the drink i ordered and then asked about 10 minutes later if we had left. overall okay but wouldn’t go back.

name: Carette
vicinity: 4 Place du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, Paris
formatted_address: 4 Pl. du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
a great place for breakfast and the hot chocolate was most definitely worth the wait. a lovely view of macaroons on display inside.

the viewing platform to the eiffel tower is only a 2 minute walk which is very convenient.

a big queue which lasted about 20 minutes. goes quicker than it looks; it was our first time there, the breakfast was good. overall a pleasant time spent there!

we wasn't too familiar with the culture, but they wasn't very patient. but still acceptable i guess. food a little overpriced too compared to some of the other breakfast places i tried in paris.

environment was beautiful. 😍

breakfast was good too!

worth trying once!; if you enjoy pastries, cappuccino, crepes, macaroons, a classic paris cafe feel/vibe then run don't walk to carette!!! during our trip to paris we ate at two different locations and they were both delicious. we ordered a variety of items and everyone in our family was extremely happy with their meals both times. not only was the food good, the service was delightful. we didn't feel rushed or neglected, just the right amount of time to order and eat. the atmosphere of the cafe was very classic paris and had great charm, this for sure was one of our favorite spots in paris!; visited july 2024 with my teen daughter and nieces who had seen this place all over social media. hot chocolate and croissants were delicious but a bit overpriced for what they are. brother in law had the eggs with mushrooms and he loved it. hubby had a cappuccino and a side of bacon that was really tasty too. overall we enjoyed it, service was ok. guy behind the counter at the bakery could be nicer. our waitress was nice and efficient. got vanilla macaroons to go and they were delicious!!; this institution with a stunning view of the eiffel tower has been in paris since 1927, located in a very touristy location. it is beautifully decorated and well run. however, extremely overpriced. recommended for its pastries and afternoon tea but lunch and dinner.

name: Café La Fleur
reviews: comfortable cafe, great coffee, rude service by apparent owner. came in for some coffee and asked if we could possibly charge our phone with them or if they had outlets. the host that greeted was nice and tried to understand what we wanted with our limited french. the other hostess or owner stepped in and told us to go look for to-go coffee somewhere else, and insisted our own charger didn’t work and they could not provide chargers. she kind of made a scene of it, taking our charging cable and trying different outlets in the cafe saying it was broken. i had to ask her if there was any problem for us to order coffee “sur place” (for here). she said yes and we sat at a table with a perfectly working outlet next to it, charged our phone for about 5 minutes, and got the code we needed in our phone to be able to enter the airbnb across the street. the whole thing was pretty embarrassing and unnecessary. this interaction kind of bummed me out, but we had had great experience overall in the town of puteaux. i’ll say their coffee was great anyway.; great food and even better service. the staff made non french speaking tourists like us feel comfortable and took the effort to explain the dishes. five stars from me.; excellent food with good vegetarian options and very friendly service. highly recommended...; great place to have lunch in puteaux. fantastic service and great food; good food for work lunch with colleagues. service not so friendly sadly

name: Thé Cool
reviews:
superrrrr friendly staff. their cake portions are huge and all are selfmade.

loved this cozy place; we have been to thé cool many times and it is always a lovely experience. the food, the staff and the beverages are perfect. a wonderful lunch option to meet an old or new friend.; great place of you like a healthy dish. a real parisian neighborhood in the 16th a little bit away from the fancy and most exclusive or expensive places. it's most affordable and super good ! love to go there.; came here randomly during a trip to paris.
great spot; amazing service and incredible food.
the owner annie is the sweetest person; fresh juices and home made pies as well as good service.

name: Le Relais du 15ème
reviews:
stopped here because of the soaking rain and starving kids. the food was awesome and the staff was friendly with kids. the half melt cake was so good even my daughter who hates chocolate cakes loves it! highly recommended for families with kids.; best pasta ever. i ordered pasta with smoked salmon and my husband ordered pasta with chicken. they both were delicious. also the service was beyond great. you will not be disappointed to come here. next time i want to try their pizza!!!; food is amazing i almost had lunch and dinner every day on my stay at paris, definitely best pizza in town!
roshanak is the best she is so nice and lovely!
highly recommended; i came to this restaurant with my friends and ordered pizza and pasta. both were delicious. the servers tried their best to communicate in english with us, and the restaurant’s decor was absolutely beautiful.; the atmosphere and aesthetics were amazing, and the staff were very friendly. communication in english was easy, and the food was outstanding. my wife had the penne au saumon, and i had the pizza with an incredible crust. we highly recommend trying the tiramisu!

name: Zamane 16
reviews:
vraiment incroyable! nous avons mangé comme des rois et avons aimé tout! 100/100. absolutely incredible, one of the best lebanese meals i’ve had! our waiter jafar was such a lovely person and a real entertainer, he made sure we had the best meal and the best time. shukran!; we were recommended this place by a new friend made here in paris.  this is his favourite restaurant and i can see why with all the friendly staff greeting and helping us.

i had small servings as i wasn’t aware of this plans, but everything i had was very delicious from my lamb kebab, to the desert in my photos.; one of the best lebanese restaurants in town, jaafar will make you feel in beirut, awesome ! thank you !; i went with my colleagues during our lunch break. they are very nice and friendly. we were sitting outside on their terrace. we had our meals very quickly. they offered us a delicious dessert. i like their food and atmosphere. i'll come back for sure.; zaman 16 has set new standards for lebanese food in the france.  if i can give it a higher mark than 5 i would have done! the food was fresh and full of taste the service was superb!!  will be back again... i would deffinatly recommend this restaurant.

name: Les Deux Stations
reviews: les deux stations – a traditional parisian bistro in the 15th arrondissement! discover classic french cuisine familiale – simple, generous, and all at very affordable prices. this cozy spot serves up a delightful range of parisian dishes, with a variety of starters, hearty french favorites like steak frites, fresh salads, and tasty french desserts. their burger is a must-try – it's absolutely delicious! it's the ideal spot for a satisfying meal in a warm, inviting atmosphere.; a local joint with damn good food. the service was amazing and very friendly, we went back because of it.; excellent quality food and keep great standard for years. recommend ”boudin noir”, yummy; i just wanted some coffee and a croissant and this place scratched that itch. service was great and i really enjoyed my coffee sitting by a window watching the activity happening outside; excellent service, excellent dishes and desserts. price is good considering the neighborhood where is located. been here several times and enjoyed all of them.

name: Les Jardins du Presbourg
vicinity: 3 Avenue de la Grande Armée, Paris
formatted_address: 3 Av. de la Grande Armée, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
les jardins du presbourg a highlight, not to be missed.

greeted graciously by a super stylish and lovely host. eva was our lovely waitress. so personable and great with recommendations and so attentive. the decor is super chic, with a great vibe. the presentation of our lunch was great and brought us french classics with a few surprises that were top notch! i ordered escargot for the first time and it was delish!

great juices and vegetarian options. and the bread and butter was so good!

right near the arc de triomphe but not touristy. just go!; les jardins du presbourg did not disappoint!!
we received a warm welcome on entering the restaurant from your hosts. the decor is super  chic, with a great vibe. the presentation of the food was first class, and tasted even better.

great selection of wines and yummy cocktails.

our host pierre was amazing! he was very professional and attentive to our table. i just wished i left him my phone number (lol)

this was my first time, it won’t be my last. i’ll see you in a few weeks time

merci beaucoup

kim; we sat on the terrace of les jardin du presbourg and enjoyed drinks along with steak tartare. while the tartare was good, i wished it had an egg yolk on top and finer slices. the fries were excellent, and the ambiance was very aesthetically pleasing. service was great too.; the food was great and the services as well! i had cappelini citron and it was surprisingly delicious!
no comment for the wine! and the place is gorgeous.; we spent a beautiful evening here and were so glad we did. the host was incredibly friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome (which has not been the same everywhere in paris). thank you sabrina!  the food was absolutely delicious. we tried fois gras for the first time and had an amazing chateau filet cooked to perfection ("cuit à point", thank you again sabrina!).  incroyable!

name: Café Théâtre Restaurant
reviews: i like it,; passable; family cooking!!! it will become rare or less common in 2024!!! this is really the place where you can eat homemade products!! the price of the menu at €18 with starter, main course and dessert + 1/4 wine or 1/2 mineral water is simply incredible value for money!!! superb welcome from rafael and great cooking from his mother and brother. thank you, i will come back for sure!! keep it up, you're on top. thank you thank you thank you 🇵🇹🇵🇹🇵🇹; very nice discovery. top welcome from raphaël. the mother in the kitchen. excellent value for money. i really recommend this restaurant. obrigado!!!; great place: great service, fresh and tasty food, unbeatable value for money. i'll be back !

name: La Rotonde de la Muette
formatted_address: 12 Chau. de la Muette, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing ambiance, amazing service. but the food was only decent. my son loved his cheeseburger. my wife said her risotto was one dimensional. my steak was good but not memorable. the chocolate mousse was huge; way too much for four people to eat. it rich and flavorful but dense for mousse. the ice cream was stellar. we would definitely eat here again, though, and felt that we got good value.; this place is all five stars. the ambiance inside is amazing, you could film hollywood movies there. we were sitting at the terrace. our waiter was wonderful, even if i noticed that another waiter, the one that seats people is not as nice. and cerise sur le gâteau  - our foie de veau was the best one i’ve eaten my whole life ! 😍; we had breakfasts in this amazing restaurant three mornings in a row, while staying in paris. everytime the service was so nice and food best of the best. warm recommendations!!! we surely will come back during our next visit.; the atmosphere was fantastic, with a genuine, traditional vibe that felt authentic. 🌿 i loved their fruit salad—the presentation was impressive, with perfectly shaped fruit cuts. every bite was fresh and delicious. 🍓; great, great cafè! (capital “c” is compulsory)

had a great breakfast, had a great service (waiter was so nice) and had a great time even if it was just half an hour while waiting for a museum to open.

the place is great-looking, in a wonderful spot and everything around you seems to have came out of another time.

very good cafè creme, as good as the pain au chocolat and the yogurt with jam and the orange juice; 21€, which, given everything i said, i think it all right.

try it!

name: Figuig
reviews:
we were looking for some ethnic food options and found this gem on google.

we stopped by for dinner and it was a great find and a fantastic dinner experience.

host was very nice and friendly and speaks english as well. she guided us through the menu and we got the perfect amount of food.

we ordered the following:
1. mint tea
2. lamb shoulder with couscous - delish!!
3. harira soup - one of the best soups i ever tasted
4. crispy traditional moroccan pie stuffed with chicken

i highly recommend this spot for dinner if you are looking to try something different.; service is nice and food is good overall. lentil salad is surprisingly good with spice kick. tanjine lamb is surprisingly sweet, which i personally don’t like much.; wonderful restaurant with amazing local moroccan food! the meals are tasty and the staff is super welcoming ! mehdi was super lovely and i would definitely recommend; we visited this lovely gem of a restaurant with a group of friends.  the service was good and the moroccan food was outstanding.  the lamb and chicken tagine was the best we have ever tasted.  will visit again.; the best ever maroccan food i have eat. 100%.🤩  soup, goat cheese rolls and tajine😘 marroccan wine. so i come back … and. marroccan team with sweets.  harven. ❤️ thank you r

name: Durant Dupont
reviews:
i tagged here coz i needed to wait for a rendez vous. i wanted to get a detox juice and something to snack while waiting.

after 20 minutes waiting and nobody coming (there are 10 servers and the place was half empty) i went to one server and asked if i could order.

he told me (in a snarky way) : "sorry i'm not your server, wait for your server" which never came again after 15 minutes more waiting. i left.; love it ! the service was really good + the waiter was lovely. unlike most places in paris, they had an iced latte with oat milk.
depending on what you take, the portions are a bit big. we will be back !; as a new yorker that moved to neuilly in may, i tried many places in the neighborhood to make my regular hangout spot. this place has become durand dupont. it’s perfect for brunch or dinner. also, big shout out to diana - the best hostess; perfect location on a nice square with convenient parking garage right under. clasicle brasserie interior, busy spot. nice terras, less cosy first half of the venue but the restaurant in the back is nice. food is good, in the brasserie understaffed and orger servants not that eager to give a helping hand. overall great meeting point; stopped by for some drinks a saturday afternoon. the staff is friendly, but it’s taking some time before you can order (even by french standards) and some more time before the drinks are served. in addition the prices are rather high, and can’t see that they are justified in any way.

name: Le Petit Banville
formatted_address: 22 Rue Théodore de Banville, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
though i haven’t written reviews, i felt compelled to write this one to highly recommend this place.  we have felt welcomed and valued as customers from the very first time we dined at le petit banville. it is a small, family-owned, and managed restaurant with excellent food and service. there are quite a few menu options without straying from a core french menu. the food is delicious. if you are looking for the french bistro experience, this place is authentic. because dishes are made in-house, each time it really feels like having a home cooked meal. it’s perfect for couples wanting a cozy, intimate setting. it’s not fancy, but it is warm and real. families with younger kids rest easy. they are family-friendly, with kid-friendly options. getting there is easy also. it is just a short walk from metro lines and from parc monceau.  it’s worth it.; what a lovely restaurant. linda was our server, she is a gem and worth her weight in gold. she did a wonderful job dealing with our loud family of obnoxious americans, she made excellent recommendations, and got all our orders perfect. ask her what to order and then listen to her- she knows her stuff.

the chicken risotto is delicious!; lovely small french restaurant with a homely feel. had the butcher's cut (morceau du boucher) with white wine. the beef steak was grilled and meat rare as i ordered. came with a small salad and fries. overall, the serving was small but suited my evening appetite. enjoyed the cripsy fries very much. the steak was average. the cheese sauce helped lift the taste. the white wine recommended was nicely chilled. good service and affordable meal.; just the restaurant you need if you want comfortable parisian experience with really good food and excellent staff.  so glad we went there.; this is an absolute gem of a small family restaurant. good food, good wine, served in a charming surroundings. just good traditional food, well done in a lovely setting. you may find better food in paris but you will not beat this place as an all round great restaurant.

name: Sir Winston
reviews:
needed a drink on our (very long) walk so popped in for a quick one!
gorgeous interior and the downstairs bar looked amazing too.
despite only ordering two drinks our waiter treated us like royalty - if we had more time in paris we'd have loved to try some of the meals here!; this bar came to our rescue when we were in dire need of a drink, offering the perfect combination of what we were seeking. the stunning decor, good service, and the unexpected presence of pimms on the menu were delightful surprises. the seating arrangement was exactly what we needed at that moment. departing with a sense of curiosity, i look forward to experiencing the bar during the evening and on a weekend, as our mid-week, afternoon visit found the place rather empty. nonetheless, it was a fantastic recommendation that left us thoroughly satisfied.; the staff were very helpful and food was good/okay. starter was better than the main, the reason i have marked down is because i have had much better food in paris for a lot cheaper. i understand this is in a tourist area but i have also ate in other tourist areas within paris and found them better value for money.; sir winston is a charming british pub located in the heart of paris, offering a cozy atmosphere that feels like a little slice of england. with its traditional decor, including wood paneling and comfortable seating, it’s an inviting spot to relax and unwind after a day of exploring the city.

the menu features a delightful selection of classic british dishes, including fish and chips, shepherd’s pie, and a hearty english breakfast. the food is well-prepared and generous in portions, making it a satisfying choice for pub fare. the extensive drink menu includes a variety of beers, wines, and cocktails, perfect for pairing with your meal or enjoying during a casual evening out.

service at sir winston is friendly and attentive, creating a welcoming environment for both locals and tourists. the pub often hosts live music and sporting events, adding to the lively atmosphere.

for anyone craving a taste of british comfort food in paris, sir winston is a delightful destination that combines good food, a great selection of drinks, and a warm ambiance.; favorable location, close to the arc de triomphe and champs-elysees, i was quite intrigued by the british and indian fusion. the place is bustling and crowded, the service was slower because of the rush. we had the winston burger and the fish and chips. food was pretty nice actually but there was something in the water which completely threw us off. we are still not sure if it was in the glass or water, any which way it is not acceptable. overpriced compared to other places in paris but you have to keep in mind that it’s in a touristy spot

name: XVIe Avenue
reviews:
sat outside for dinner.
came for some lovely vin rouge then decided to stay for food.
started with some escargot which was delicious.
my main was bouef bourguignon which was fantastic!
i finished with the crème brulé which was perfect.
all washed down with some incredible french wines.
the atmosphere was great and the service was excellent.
merci.; the food was great and good quality, prices were low, atmosphere was nice, and the service was just perfect! they have the kindest staff and they are doing the best they can do for the best customer experience. definitely recommend!; although the staff was very good the food was disappointing.   my husband got a fried fish and chips type dish that he liked. the french onion soup was good but the beef bourguignon was quite awful. the chunks of beef were tender and i ate them but the vegetables seemed like they were cooked separately and put in the bowl with the meat and gravy. the veggies were bland, no seasoning and the gravy had a processed taste to it. the only other time i had beef bourguignon was following julia child's recipe so maybe my expectation were too high. the mixed drinks were good.; rude! rude! rude! i came in with my family in the evening close to 9pm  to try some desserts, but as soon as i started to order ice cream for my kids,  the women who sat us interrupted me and asked if we were having dinner, i said no and she became even more upset and she said she had to move us from the table because that table was not a table to have ice cream, she walked to a table that was not set and shoved the table and said here! to which my husband and i responded with  thank you and proceeded to be leave.

mind you the restaurant was not busy, it was actually pretty empty (makes sense now after i have read other terrible reviews) there were about 4 other tables that were being served on the inside.

the only reason we went in was because it was across the street from our hotel and it has signs on the outside saying  they have coffee, desserts, hot chocolate, etc.

good luck to anyone else accidentally stumbling upon this rude and disrespectful staff! run away as fast as you can…; we had the most incredible experience at xvie avenue. not only was each course exceptional (seriously) but the service was outstanding! our server, benedict, was polite, professional, and so willing to provide recommendations—and she was funny too! we began with a bottle of white, escargot, and a simple, but delicious salad. for our mains, the veil stew and duck filet (a must try), and we capped off our meal with an exceptional apple crumble and espresso. the cherry on top for me is that it’s slightly off the beaten path and not loaded with tourists. i would come back time and time again to experience this place.

name: Da Franco
reviews:
i recently dined at this italian restaurant, and i was very impressed. the food was absolutely delicious. the staff were fantastic, very friendly, attentive service that made us feel right at home. i highly recommend this place for anyone craving quality italian cuisine!; my wife and i were looking for an italian restaurant close to our hotel and we found this lovely little italian restaurant less than 5 minutes walk.
the food so delicious and authentic - it was like being in italy - we ordered one pizza, one pasta and one starter. everything was so good and we were very satisfied with our meal. we finished off with limoncello which was perfect!
the owner was incredibly hospitable and so friendly to everyone in the restaurant.
we will definitely be back and highly recommend eating here!; went to this restaurant with my husband. had a lovely time. really enjoyed the pasta we ordered and the wine was amazing! wish they can have house wine ( a bit more affordable like they have it in italy ) on menu as well though.

limoncello at the end of dinner was great!
throughly enjoyed my experience. will be back!; gnocchi quattro formaggi and lasagna with beef. both amazingly delicious.
tiramisu was out of this word good
service staff was attentive, professional, friendly and knowledgeable about the menu
we highly recommend da franco; da franco is a gem! the food was delicious, flavorful and fresh. the staff were friendly and attentive, making the whole experience really enjoyable and the owner was incredibly welcoming, making you feel right at home!

if you’re craving great italian food with excellent service in paris, this place is a must try. we’ll definitely be coming back! 😁

name: La Table des Ternes
reviews:
we really enjoyed this restaurant. it was a last-minute reservation, but we were very happy with the food, service and wine selections. michelle was attentively to our service and food for a large group of 8, even though she was busy with other customers.  definitely,  we will come back and tell everyone about this restaurant.; great dinner. perfect and good location, very friendly staff, delicious food. having dinner at 2 evenings. really lucky that we tried this restaurant, and we were so happy about it.
good price ratio; amazing restaurant, great location, delicious food and super friendly service.; we found this restaurant while walking around the neighborhood near our hotel.  what a find!  this was the best meal that we had in paris.  highly recommend.

les repas ici étaient délicieux!; this is the greatest restaurant in paris - low-key neighborhood place with amazing service. keep this place going so i can come back and eat here next time i visit from america.

recommend:
the strawberries
fois gras
the strawberries
steak tartare
the strawberries

name: Saperlipopette
formatted_address: 24 Rue Mars et Roty, 92800 Puteaux, France
reviews:
food was as always amazing.

but what’s with the attitude of the person who served us on friday night? he was indifferent, didn’t seem to care at all. just to give an idea, the freebie muffins that were served fell out of the plate on to the table and no reaction at all, he left it there.

again service by others - at the door, girl at the bar was very kind.; overall? it was nice having lunch there and cheerful.. responsive staff! a must try experience! the chicken was tender and juicy!! not an expert on food but my tastebuds definitely was satisfied; i went with my parents  and husband to this bistros for fathers day. we took 2 menus and 2 a la carte. all the food was delicious. only my main which was the chicken was a bit undercooked and i didn't expect it to be looking like this. but besides this the cesar salad was amazing, the other main were great (duck / fish) and the desserts delicious. the highlight was the service. our waiter was really nice and even gave us a bread to take away as we said we liked it so much. i will definitely come back!; it's a good restaurant with kind service and a warm atmosphere. but something is missing, maybe the coziness of a smaller place. this restaurant is massive. and somehow they manage to keep the quality pretty good. prices are not cheap but it remains ok for the greater paris. you won't be disappointed.; amazing experience, accommodating and great service. great food

name: Le Petit Chef - Paris
reviews:
le petit chef did not disappoint anyone in our group of seven, including our 5 year old.  the dining experience was very enjoyable, from the storytelling to the culinary flavors.  the chef actor went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed and was extremely kind and interactive with our child.  it's definitely worth it!; 🍴food was delicious and each dish came with an animation and live entertainment!!
👨‍🍳there was an actor playing le petit chef interacting with us and doing skits!; what a cute experience / show! very entertaining and the food was good too.; we had a great time at the restaurant and the experience was very nice! the waiters were super friendly, especially the host/presenter, who was super thoughtful and funny! however it was quite pricey!!; i saw the advertisement of le petit chef on instagram and i made a reservation for two immediately! the storytelling was okay, but the food was awful. it absolutely didn’t worth for the price we paid. the kids menu, which was the french fries and nuggets, looked more delicious than the normal meals. if you are looking for a delicious meal, don’t waste your money, otherwise you may need to fill your stomach with some bread like we did.

name: Jardin d'Acclimatation
vicinity: Bois de Boulogne, Route de la Porte Dauphine à la Porte des Sablons, Paris
formatted_address: Bois de Boulogne, Rte de la Prte Dauphine à la Prte des Sablons, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
very nice park with attractions for all age groups. the entrance fee is 7 euros then you pay each attractions (unless you pay for full access ticket).
there are nice places to bring your own lunch, and you can find some simple food too.
the park is really well maintained.; we had an amazing time at jardin d'acclimatation, and we highly recommend visiting, especially during their día de los muertos celebration, which runs until november. the park is beautifully maintained, with vibrant gardens and a wonderful atmosphere. all of the attractions are fun and offer something for everyone—whether you're visiting with kids or just looking for a relaxing day out. the día de los muertos decorations and activities are a special highlight, adding a unique cultural experience to the visit.

make sure to buy your tickets in advance through their website to avoid lines and ensure a smooth entry. it’s a fantastic spot to enjoy a day in paris!; highly recommended. for families and for individuals. great location and accessible by metro and bus. we enjoyed our stay and we did have fun.; awesome day... a few rides were closed. it was raining but all the staff were helpful. wonderful park area, the restaurants were stunning and the food was excellent. well worth it, it would be nice to visit on a dry day and just walk around and eat; we had a blast  at jardin d’acclimation, good snacks, wonderful rides for all ages, and very cute animals. the employees were friendly and no long lines.

name: Le Forty One
reviews: had the most amazing croquet monsieur ! enjoyed a sugar crepe and delicious cappuccino for dessert. loved the staff, atmosphere but the food was the best i've had on my visit to paris so far!; nice little bistro on a busy corner. food was ok. we had omelettes and a croque madame.; very nice, typical french restaurant. good food, nice staff. great!; my wife and i are visiting paris and wanted a good dinner -- reasonably priced -- with french cuisine. so glad we found this place!! excellent beer and wine list; i had a glass of sparkling champagne, but could have gone for a big draft beer. we split a good salad that had greens, tomatoes, hunks of blue cheese, prosciutto, hard-boiled egg and a tasty dressing. main course was grilled rib steaks with french fries and a wonderful bearnaise sauce -- so good i had to tell my wife about the chapter in "a moveable feast" when hemingway enjoys this same meal. topped it all off by splitting a strawberry ice cream dessert with whipped cream. told the owner how much i loved the dinner and he kindly asked me to write a review. this is it.; regular customer to this little brasserie. lovely spot away from crowds but always with a good atmosphere. fast and friendly service. what more could you ask for in paris.

name: Pau Brasil
reviews:
nice show and good dinner, with the dancers making part of the show in between the tables. brazilian festive ambiance, and the scene open for the customers to dance after the show. excellent moments for me.; was therewith my wife for our wedding anniversary.

they broke my nose a few years ago during their show.

worse , they let me bleed in their toilets without assistance and finally charged me  ... did not even offer a cent.; its is a shame to see that such a place is hosting events like miss top latina, a competition ran by a corrupted dude who sells dreams to young women blinded by their aspirations: pau brasil should denounce such activity instead of using those girls distribute and post their flyers illegally in the streets of paris. those young women are mistreated and are too afraid to say anything. randy romero is a crook who makes money by using those girls selling tickets and promoting your place. shame on you!!!; turns into an african club on week-ends but not enough space to really dance. the dancefloor is too small; went on a monday. they had open mic night. very amusing.

name: La Terrasse du Jardin
vicinity: Jardin d'Acclimatation, 6 Avenue du Mahatma Gandhi, Paris
formatted_address: Jardin d'Acclimatation, 6 Av. du Mahatma Gandhi, 75116 Paris, France
reviews: this restaurant struggles to meet even the low expectations one would have for dining inside a theme park. the service was excruciatingly slow, and they messed up multiple items in our order. when we finally got our food it was decent, overpriced (which is to be expected), but what should have been a 40 minute lunch between enjoying the activities of the park took over 2 hours... management should be embarrassed.; nice place to go to in the garden. had their caesar salad which was good but needed more than 4 small pieces of chicken. bonus: found marinated anchovies buried in all the lettuce ! great.; the food is very bad and overpriced. the worst entrecôte i have ever ate... (and it’s 35€). what a joke.. better to come only for a coffee or a tea (and i don’t know if it’s good either).; just fine. we went for lunch on sat 16th. it was busy. nice interiors with white table cloths. good was ok - nothing special - but served correctly and totally adequate for a meal after going to the fondation lv.; i rarely give reviews, but this restaurant deserves a much higher rating than it currently has (3,7). we had chicken, big caesar salad and small carafe of wine - altogether for 54,50. not cheap, but nothing outrageous for paris. the food was delicious and portions decent. chicken was cooked really nicely with a smokey flavour, caesar salad was perfect. first time i had a good caesar dressing in paris. definitely will come back.

name: Auberge du Bonheur
vicinity: Bois de Boulogne, Allée de Longchamp, Paris
formatted_address: Bois de Boulogne, All. de Longchamp, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
a wonderful countryside atmosphere in the bois de boulogne. great simple dishes adorned by the high trees.; the place is super cosy
i love the water 💧 fall. i forgot to snap my food but it fine will go there next time; attended a private dinner here! very cosy vibes . most efficient staff ever. amazing service, ok food .; in one word- wonderful! wonderful atmosphere, wonderful food and wonderful service. set near the forest, it does feel like dining in a beautiful graden.
the menu has something for every taste bud... wonderful, rich in flavor yet refined desserts.; wow!!!  what a fantastic place to have lunch!  food was excellent!  i especially loved the shrimp avocado appetizer and rose wine.  beautiful outdoor garden seating with the smell of lavender from the trees.  very reasonable prices.  wonderful service.  and it takes you away from the bustle of the parisian city.  definitely come here if you are looking for an authentic parisian escape.  everyone around me spoke french, so it's not overrun with tourist like myself :)

name: Le Chalet des Îles
vicinity: Bois de Boulogne, Embarcadère du Chalet des Îles Porte de la Muette Ceinture du lac inférieur du, Paris
formatted_address: Embarcadère du Chalet des Îles Porte de la Muette Ceinture du lac inférieur du, Bois de Boulogne, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
went here for a staff dinner with my coworkers. the setting is beautiful, the tables are out in a garden and everything is gorgeous, tastefully decorated and calming to the soul. disappointed in the service as it was very very long between each course and they actually forgot about our desserts (apparently they were sent to another table) the food was alright, nothing exceptional, seasonal produce well cooked but not well seasoned and no interesting spices or sauces.. a shame the food and service wasn’t to the same standard as the setting.; wait was long despite only a few tables being served. they're under staffed when we visited, but they're pretty nice. food taste wasn't so special, though pleasing in the eye and cost may be worth the maintenance of the restaurant in a romantic isle setting. i particularly love the cozy raft ride. relaxing and romantic.; honestly for the price point, i was quite disappointed by the service. i understand the appeal is the atmosphere, which is undoubtedly magical, but our waitress forgot our order twice and then brought our aperitif with our appetizers which we specifically asked for the two to be served separately. personally, i don’t like to sip a fruity cocktail with a ceviche and i probably would’ve ordered white wine with the appetizer had the cocktails not arrived at the same time as the first course. the waitress also completely forgot our table at the end so we did not want to wait around for dessert, although we might have ordered something had she not been so distracted. the lack of attention to detail in the service really brought down the quality of the overall experience, although the food was very good and the atmosphere lovely. for 18€ for an aperitif, i expect more from the service.; greeted by a very rude waitress,

we asked to sit in the garden but she told us no, you will be sitting on the balcony knowing when we booked we asked for our table to be lower on the terrace.

we asked for water several times and the food was very ordinary,and not delicious; delicious meals with good ideas in combining flavours. the ambiance is amazing near the lake. you reach the island by water shuttle for 2 euros.

name: Da Antonino Restaurant au Jardin d'Acclimatation
