reviews: it was a buffet style lunch and ridiculously expensive. we didn’t stay there.the waitress let us looked at it before deciding. it was scarce and a lot left. pizza and pasta in general. we went to a more affordable place.; nice all you can eat restaurant with an impressive buffet. the upfront payment system is a bit weird to be honest as it creates a long queue at the entrance, i dont know why they cant make the customers pay after the lunch. the place itself is rather basic and unimpressive, it could have a bit more decoration, the tent can get pretty warn during the summer. however there is lots of space for the kids to move around; this is a great restaurant in the park. their buffet has a lot to offer and it all tastes great. the setting is spacious and good for kids.; i remember last year that this restaurant was so good! the kids and i couldn’t wait to get back. but after covid, they’ve changed it to an “italian restaurant” however, it is far from it. it’s frozen food they’ve heated up, close to “continental” food… i got the salmon, “the healthiest option” but it was disappointing. it was actually disgusting. will not come back. too bad i didn’t take any photos 🤢 service was bad too, unfortunately. they brought me the wrong plat and forgot my drink. but oh well 🤷🏻‍♀️; they lacked the basic items that most restaurants have like straws and table cloths. the service was mediocre at best. no indoor seating. unless you arrive within a certain time period all you have available is pizza. nothing else. i arrived at 3:00 and they refused to make anything else. overall one of the worse restaurant experiences.

name: La Petite Tour
formatted_address: 11 Rue de la Tour, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
i recently dined at this amazing restaurant and had such a wonderful experience, even though i came alone. the staff really stood out to me—every waiter i interacted with spoke perfect english and was incredibly charming and friendly, which made me feel right at home.

now, let's talk about the food! it was simply incredible. the flavors were bold and well-balanced, with each dish offering a unique and delightful combination of tastes. honestly, the plates were like works of art—beautifully presented and almost too pretty to eat, but too delicious not to!

to top it off, everything was reasonably priced, especially given the high quality of both the food and service. i left completely satisfied and can't wait to come back. highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience!; this is a lovely restaurant. we tried its five-course tasting menu. we enjoyed the two starters (sea bream ceviche and egg mushrooms) and the dessert (chocolate ganache and roasted plum and rosemary sorbet) but found the entrees (fish and chicken) were a bit plain. the fish with orange sauce was a bit too sweet, which required some balance. the chicken was not overcooked though the flavor was nothing impressive.; what a fabulous find! we searched google for restaurants with 10-15 minute walk of our hotel.
it’s opened since lock down, the guys running it were friendly, informative and passionate about fresh, seasonal food. the restaurant is simply decorated and fresh. we arrived around 19.45 as the first diners but it quickly filled up.
lovely atmosphere and amazing food. my husband likes steak, has been on a couple of courses to cook it at home so i was surprised when he ordered steak. it looked and tasted amazing. he declared it was the best he’s ever eaten,
we both chose different things on the menu and it was suggested we try each other’s dishes to get the full experience. it’s what we do but it’s rare restaurateurs suggest it. definitely worth a visit.; my wife and i had a wonderful dining experience in paris. we chose the five-course meal, which was both reasonably priced and satisfying. i also enjoyed a glass of chardonnay that paired well with the meal. the standout dish for me was the third course—a delicious cod served with a lobster bisque, which was unforgettable. the atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a mix of locals enjoying their meals, adding to the authentic parisian vibe. the restaurant itself was spotless, and the ambiance made for a perfect evening.

the only small downside was that there were just two servers, so as the restaurant filled up, it became harder to get their attention, which delayed our departure after we finished dining. however, this was a minor issue in an otherwise delightful experience. overall, i highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking to enjoy a great meal in paris.; excellent food, wine and service. focus on fish and vegetarian with a few meat options. high quality and very good value. had a three course menu with a bottle of wine. always great wine suggestions here.

name: Club Circus Paris
reviews: first time here, security outside would not let me in as they said i had running trousers and it’s nike ??? it’s a full long trousers i had on and they said it because they might have children inside which would not look good so i went back to my hotel and got black jeans which they allow me in, inside i saw so many people with same trousers as mine rough and has holes, others with ripped knee jeans ???? come on as other comments said i think this place is catered for locals only. dealers are pretty good and they do speak english. there is a smoking booth (so small that only one person can stand inside) inside main gaming floor which you can smell the smoke around the entire area. poker tables quite a lot and took me an hour to get a seat. overall i would not recommend non locals to come as they seemed bias.; worst poker room in paris. they make it impossible to play their tournaments if you’re an outsider. they have extremely long waiting list and you can only register online if you are a french national. they also charge €12 every time that you enter the building it’s ridiculous; loved the vibe. so many players! (and the restaurant was great); best place to play 2/4 and 5/5 in paris. staff is friendly and there's not a lot waiting usually. the only bad thing is the food.; wpt prime in circus was probably the worst tournament series i've ever been to. this club is good enough to run their weekly €100 tourneys but definitely not good enough or big enough to run an international tournament series

name: Bowling Foch
formatted_address: En sous-sol, 1 Av. Foch, 75016 Paris, France
reviews: i went there on a monday evening to checkout the place for an event i’m planning at work. there wasn’t a lot of people when i arrived (around 6:40pm). unfortunately there aren’t a lot of “snacks” options to choose from (and we wanted to grab a bite), but the list of cocktails is good. the food and drinks are good but a little overpriced in my opinion. i think the system isn’t very clear as how many games you are paying for, so i’d suggest to ask before you find yourself with a long bill! i didn’t see the shoes getting cleaned after we used them so i really hope they do it! overall a good experience but they can improve.; worst principles i have ever experienced. we arrived as a group of 9 people, where 3 were children aged 14 and below. when arriving, we were told that the place had a dress code, and that we could not join in as one of the kids was dressed in joggers. this was told while pointing at the kid, resulting in the kid feeling responsible for us not being allowed inside. both the telling and the pointing kept on for several minutes. however, while standing outside, we saw a man come out wearing blue joggers and an oversized dirty t-shirt. he clearly did not match the so called “dress code” the place swore by. the man himself told the security that we were not dressed any “worse” than him, but the security were determined. in conclusion, an awful experience for the kids and the rest of us. will definitely not recommend this place to anyone, as these principles and rules are filled with nonsense and double standards.; great hosts at the cashier desk, very welcoming and gave positive energy. thank you!; pretty good bowling alley! it is under ground! which made it kinda hard to find! go to the adress and look for stairs that go underground like a train station and it will be down there!; i came as a part of a work event. i'm not a big bowler, so i cannot complain about the game related stuff. the staff present was fine.

name: Le Brandevin
formatted_address: 29 Rue du Dr Blanche, 75016 Paris, France
reviews: what a fantastic find !! we spent a looooong lunch there on a getaway to paris and it was worth it..the waiters are amazing and authentic, the banter is there and the service as well. the food is delicious… we ate till the food coma and i will come back for it !! see the pictures for more details… i had a cold so i took the ginger chicken, the rice was so flavorful!; i had the best calf liver for dinner. and delicious oysters   when i was in paris 2 weeks ago.  i highly recommend this restaurant.  everybody including the staff are happy    a great atmosphere; as good as a true countryside french meal. if you really do love food and are not just a foodie for the sake of it make the trek here. the confit is fantastic. don’t be shy and crunch on the ends of the leg for the a culinary experience you won’t forget. the caramel ice cream is an explosion of flavor and texture that caps the splendor of what  good food is all about.; very friendly, genuine service, delicious french classic cuisine, and an atmosphere of conviviality. would highly recommend!; super restaurant of 16em. service and food are greta

name: The Honest Lawyer
formatted_address: 176 Rue de la Pompe, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
very good and tasty, especially for the price.
nice staff, professional and welcoming.
large choice of food (several vegetarian dishes)
the seats are very comfortable.
the place is a bit noisy but that is also normal
we had a great time.; lovely staff!!! happy hour 17:30-20:00, 50cl beer offerings listed (grimbergen, 1664, guinness, kilkenny, carlsberg, etc.). cute, popular corner pub, outdoor seating packed with young locals, conveniently located across from a franprix on a quiet and pretty corner. nothing special food-wise (it's a pub. a pub! period.), but cozy, friendly, easy-going and exactly what you'd hope for. would personally like to see the menu include typical irish fare... mostly because i'd like to see what french chefs could do with it! a ploughman's share board, french style?!needs to happen!!! bet they could elevate a humble shepherd's pie to unattained heights, too! ;) also conveniently located near avenue foch with its grassy boulevard and both pub and grass are doggies-welcome... :d; this may indeed be my most favourite pub in paris, the decor certainly reminded me of the u.k. service and drinks were great, couldn’t complain!; very nice pub ! the clientèle and drinks are a bit on the expensive side,  but the service is really good and relax :); awesome place.  vegetarian friendly.  staff tolerated my terrible french, and accommodated my when i needed to revert to english.

they have an array of tvs for sports games, but they are closed sundays.  so no american football.

name: La Flamme
reviews: very beautiful place. the decoration was made out from many flowers from inside out. the colors were within purple tone. very beautiful. great atmosphere with such a great songs. very friendly english speaking waitress. excellent food. good price. one of my favorites in paris so far. the cobb salad it’s so flavorful, the red wine 🍷 is excellent quality. my friend took the spaghetti with meat and it was not too big and very nicely made. fruits icecream was the lightest dessert and also good. second night we came back, happy again. love the cake and my cognac. super thin crust and excellent apples. the waitress was smiling and very professional despite full restaurant and lots of work.; the confit de canard was one of the best we have had. the whole vibe was excellent, funky 70's, even the seats fit the theme. our waitress was very kind. it was a great place to hang out and enjoy good food on a rainy afternoon.; service is honestly king at this restaurant. naseem, our waiter, was fantastic. super polite, responsive, helpful, and everything we wanted was getting done at the same moment. i was looking for a good steak near my hotel and spent sometime on doing research and decided to come here and it was the best decisions ever! tourist fellows. if you’re like me reading all these reviews and wondering if you should come here “like i was moments ago” then it’s a big yes. best steak i’ve had so far in paris, would come over and over for this amazing experience. thanks you naseem and la flamme. what a lovely restaurant and staff!!; this restaurant has a disco vibe, at least that is how we perceived it. singers from the 1970s adorn the walls. the music playing in the background was all disco hits. the decor is flamboyant and red. the food is good. the location near the arc de triomphe is excellent and the staff is friendly.; first day in paris during my second visit here and decided to try this cafe since i was craving some escargot nearby by hotel - they were delicious! i’d definitely recommend. i also ate later in the afternoon around 3:45pm, so there wasn’t a crowd at all. my waitress also helped me to learn a bit of french and practice some phrases as well.

name: LES ENFANTINES PARIS
reviews: if you're looking for a hidden gem in paris that offers stunningly chic dresses and elegant clothing for kids and babies, this boutique is an absolute must-visit. the selection is filled with beautifully designed pieces that capture the essence of parisian style, perfect for those who appreciate timeless elegance. the owner is incredibly kind, friendly, and warm-hearted, making the shopping experience even more delightful. it's tucked away in a calm and peaceful location, adding to its charm. japanese mothers, in particular, will love the unique and high-quality fashion options for their little ones. highly recommended!; beautiful clothes and gifts. very friendly owner who also designs the clothes.; i wish i hadn't gone inside. the owner has poor manners. caughing on the face of pregnant women seems normal to her. she justified herself by saying i'm not sick i just left my house with wet hair. in retrospect, i should have left everything and exited her store.; very cute store, good quality baby clothes.; great baby selection

name: Kids around Paris Victor Hugo
reviews:
very friendly and helpful staffs! would definitely come back again next time we travel to paris; the staff are so patient and nice, and they help a lot.; fashion kids
the place to be for kid’s clothing.
big interest brands like hugo, lanvin, marc jacobs, aigle… and many more.
trendy. stylish. quality.; very nice boutique good prices; correct.

name: Dreams and Wonders
reviews:
i really recommend this store. bought a cot online, it arrived in one week, super fast shipping and really well packed. the cot has a beautiful design with quality materials. justine was really nice in answer all my doubts. thank you 😊; everything was okay. good communication and fast delivery to slovakia.; my daughter and i are delighted with this piece of furniture. both the quality and the aesthetics. the packaging was very careful. fortunately my neighbor helped me with the assembly because it was somewhat complex but we got through it!
thanks again for everything. monitoring, reception, availability. in short, your professionalism was incredible!! ditto the mr who organizes the delivery was great! great team! 🥰; great site, i highly recommend. efficient delivery tracking and very fast delivery, we are delighted with our purchase!; second order and still delighted with my purchases. after buying a high chair a few months ago, this time i ordered a bed. it is lovely and quality. delivery took place on time. i highly recommend!

name: L'enfance Heureuse
reviews: what a cute children's clothing store! a magnificent selection and high quality products. perfect for a nice original gift.;

name: Les Enfants de Passy
reviews:
family club supervised by educational and committed coaches.
our son has been there for 3 years and we have been able to see his progress but especially his taste for football!
the children have a great time and we parents enjoy watching them play!
we must also highlight the quality equipment provided at the start of the year!!
alain, the manager, is very concerned and listens to parents and children!
in summary, we are all delighted!; the coaches are really great and very educational.
my son is thriving in this club and he is progressing well... he is happy to go to the football game to meet his friends to play ball.; a family club the coaches are very
well i'm in the club
then 1976 long live the children of passy; very good club it’s square;

name: Du Pareil Au Même
formatted_address: 3 Rue de la Pompe, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
nice clothes at an affordable price .. the sales people were nice and very patient as we worked through an issue with a gift card. good sales at times.; good deals; shows discounts and in the end there are none. in addition, the saleswoman tells me that it is “up to 50%” but “up to” means that there is still a discount whose percentage is to be defined. but if it starts at zero% it’s misleading. very bad attitude from the saleswoman after my request which was legitimate and asked in a very polite manner. i left without buying anything even though i had spotted several items. damage. i will find nicer elsewhere.; i recommend this store
place is warm
the saleswoman is superb and patient
and we find some nice items; quality collection but i was greeted by an unfriendly, unfriendly and unhelpful saleswoman. the welcome is much more pleasant on rue du commerce.

name: Bon Enfant
formatted_address: 14 Av. du Colonel Bonnet, 75016 Paris, France
reviews: i highly recommend bon enfant for the quality of these activities.

name: Atelier Enfant
reviews:
we took the "brigadeiros" workshop for our daughter's birthday and are very happy with marina's performance. she showed great patience and kindness. we highly recommend this workshop.
“thank you very much marina for your professionalism and for sharing your passion for chocolate with us.”; very good site with a wide choice of activities for children. the site is easy and very practical. great idea to help parents.
thanks; quartier japon regularly receives requests from its customers for our japanese activities, mainly for our manga activities. an efficient and professional platform!; great platform to find activities of all kinds for children of all ages and not just in ile de france!; varied, constantly renewed, a maximum of ideas! the children are always happy!
to consume without moderation

name: Fil de Legende
reviews:
more than delighted with my order. karine gave very good advice, on the phone, to guide me on the sizes to take for the dress as well as the shoes. the dress fit my little girl perfectly. the quality is more than there, the dress is sublime as are the little shoes. i have absolutely no regrets about my purchase and my sweetheart has had nothing but compliments for her baptism. i recommend with your eyes closed.; delighted with my order! dress, hat, vest, socks, everything is lovely and of very good quality.
ms. onillon is pleasant and available!
i highly recommend !!
thank you very much 🤩; complete baptism outfit ordered for our son:
- cape
- romper
- beanie
=> thomas model
- leather slippers

the whole thing is really very pretty, very beautifully made.
perfect outfit for a baptism in winter, warm enough. (add a pair of tights).

really very happy to have been able to afford this pleasure. thank you very much to ms. onillon and her colleagues.; i recently used fil de légende for a christening dress for my daughter, and i must say that i am absolutely overwhelmed by their service and the quality of their product.

faced with a last minute situation where i desperately needed a dress, their team was impressively responsive. not only were they able to respond to my request in record time, but the dress i received was of breathtaking finesse and elegance. every detail, every seam reflected exceptional craftsmanship.

during the ceremony, my daughter looked stunning in her dress, and many of our guests commented on the beauty and quality of the garment. it was a special moment, and i am infinitely grateful to fil de légende for making it even more memorable.

a big thank you to karine from fil de légende!; dress and cape purchased for my daughter's baptism. the result is perfect. the dress fits perfectly. after several exchanges by text and telephone we were able to find the size that suited us.

i really recommend it if you want a quality outfit with perfect finishes for your ceremonies, it will be a sensation!

name: Oxybul Paris Victor Hugo
reviews: great selection, good prices and friendly staff. books and toys conveniently organized by age. plenty of educational toys and options and good selection of books. limited electronic toys though.; great selection of toys and games for kids 0 to 10 years old; very good service from ornella; julie top; nice kids store

name: Le Bistro de Longchamp
reviews:
got the steak sandwich and it was amazing, staff were so attentive and friendly.
sauce that came with the steak sauce was amazing could have had it for my meal alone.; this is the best restaurant that i have eaten in paris in these days.  the service and quality of the foods are outstanding.; an essence of portuguese in the center of paris. friendly staff and delicious plates. there are some local (from portugal) beers and wines. of course, you have to try as a desert the famous pastais de nata. it's also possible to watch a football game of the primeira liga.; we didn’t feel appreciated or welcomed during our meal at this place. it was a busy lunch, but we waited just like everyone else. our steak, fish, and soup were underwhelming; the steak was tough and filled with gristle. when we tried to raise our concerns, the manager just said that’s all they have. we requested a larger table for our group, but they didn’t make any effort to accommodate us. the bass didn’t taste fresh either.  their selection of wines and bordeaux was quite limited as well. we hadn’t planned on having a late lunch here, but we were starving after a long walk and shopping.; a portal to portugal😎
very friendly staff, tasty food and beer.
their pasteis is a cherry on top!

name: Wallace Corner
reviews:
this place is a fantastic hamburger joint! 🍔 wallace corner in paris 🇫🇷 serves an awesome combo deal for a burger, fries 🍟, drink 🥤, and dessert! 🍮 definitely try the burger with the bao bun and the chocolate 🍫 cake! 🍰 the staff 👨‍🍳 is super friendly, welcoming, and professional! the service is quick. ⏲️ they have plenty of indoor seating 🪑 and even air-conditioning. 🌬️ i wish i knew about this place earlier!; very respectful and accommodating staff. there's a lot of choices to choose on the menu.; this place recently opened after closure of a franchise french burger restaurant!
comparing to that this is mych better!

i didn't like the size of burger which was mostly a mini burger to me so i don't give a good note for the value i got for what i paid!

also the dessert was not good at all! don't try the tiramissu as it was even worse than what you can buy in supermarkets!

they firstly said to me that coffee is offer kn our burger so due to that goodwill manner i ordered dessert as well but at then i saw in the bill that coffees were invoiced!!!; wonderful place, super nice food, the steaks were great! the staff was very friendly. will definately visit the place in my next stay to paris!!!; had breakfast with my young family here while visiting paris - it was such a treat. the staff are exceptionally kind. the breakfast choices are delicious, very well priced and prepared with great care. a great spot!

name: Restaurant Martinet
reviews:
lovely, classic parisian restaurant. high quality food and excellent service. not overpriced. if you want a taste of the true paris then this is the place!; wonderful family restaurant.
it just opened a few months ago and it’s a real gem! the products are fresh and homemade, the dishes are simple and of good quality.
the service is warm and very family-friendly.
a real family restaurant with the owner's children doing their homework.
in short, a neighborhood restaurant as we like them.; superb little restaurant, good food and good atmosphere!
we are welcomed with joy and good humor.
i recommend 100%!
come early or book, the room fills up quickly at lunch.; fast service, ideal for lunch when you don't have much time but want to eat well

i really enjoyed my tartare prepared with the spicy option; a great welcome and very good cuisine 😉😉
a menu reduced to a minimum because everything is homemade and a daily special that changes and adapts.
i highly recommend

name: Restaurant VEGE
reviews:
cozy vegetarian restaurant with vegan options, atmosphere and music is fantastic, personal is fast and speaks english, but not so communicative. the food was pretty good! the location is so convenient.; we absolutely loved the food here. the flavors were  amazing. everything we had was scrumptious. we would love to come back again.; great vegetarian restaurant. we ordered starters to share (yummy) and then veggie burger and moussaka. all very much appreciated and tasty. the 2 vegetarians in our group were very satisfied (as was the rest); such a cute spot for incredible vegetarian and vegan middle eastern food. the salad with hummus and falafel is an absolute must. it sounds simple but the meddly of ingredients and flavours is amazing. they also have a full selection of wines and alcohol which was a nice plus.; meals average €15 and drinks €5. variety of vegetarian and vegan starters, mains,  drinks and desserts.

small to average size "family run" feeling restaurant with a lot of love and effort put into it. very friendly staff and atmosphere. top quality presentation with the meals and fairly priced. i do not know french but they accommodated us well.

us four had two vegetarian burgers and two vegan burgers. both were very well presented and came with potatoes. the meal was not a hot meal if that's what you were expecting. the freshly squeezed juices were lovely.

name: Daylice Café
reviews:
i’ve been there twice with my 2 years old son. staffs are super friendly and their menu is changing on a regular basis. couscous was really nice and i recommend their chicken or fish menu! nice and cozy place for lunch.; super friendly and accommodating staff. strong and good coffee. lovely place to sit out in the summer; small cafe with lunch menus, reasonably priced.; cosy environment
friendly staff
decent food; fresh! delicious! a wonderful experience. thank you❤️🇫🇷

name: Beer Station
reviews:
very neat place to grab a beer and a small meal. the service was excellent and the waitress was wonderful.; restaurant français

good location
tasty food
good price
excellent service; great little spot with good food and drinks! i think this place gets passed up because of the name, but definitely a great option for a solid meal. i got the grilled salmon and my husband got the burger and both were delicious! our waiter was very kind and got us everything really quickly.; this is a well located, top restaurant. we went there for a late lunch after a visit at champs élysées. the staff was nice and the place clean. we have tried a salmon, onion soup, french bread and drinks. this was a great quality-of-experience for us; the food is tasty, especially the french onion soup. sirloin was a bit hard but well seasoned and generous serving of chips to go with it.
hard to comment on the beef tartare because you either like or dislike it. you also can’t compare that with other beef dishes since it is raw.
the service was really good, the waitress gave her recommendations on food and beer for first timer like us.
having a view of the arc de triomphe across the road from the restaurant adds to the ambiance.

name: LOVE - FRIENDS FAMILY FOOD
formatted_address: 120 Rue de la Pompe, 75016 Paris, France
reviews:
every single item in my bowl was fresh, flavorful and nourishing. i would eat here all the time if i lived in this neighborhood . what a dream.; if there was a six star rating, i would give it! food is delicious and service is beyond exceptional. i had ordered food to cater a meal at home. and all my guests were ecstatic. i recommend this place, without any hesitation!; delicious food!  davina was divine! merci! makes all the difference to eat food that was made with intention and good energy 😌; i love it here and the food is delicious! thank you davina ❤️; finally a good address in the neighborhood!
everything is good. the salads are made with care, well seasoned, the meatballs were tasty and the owner is very nice. we feel there is love here. see you soon ✨

name: Les Filaos
formatted_address: 5 Rue Guy de Maupassant, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
title: the food is delicious and staff are wonderful but the prices are far too expensive.

les filaos is a restaurant that does fusion cuisine between island and indian/african.  the plates are small, expensive but very tasty.  if their portions increased in size i would be back in a heartbeat.; flavorful food, a nice location, great staff, with vegetarian options! :d overall a good experience; wonderful! we had dinner here and the food is amazing! the service is also top notch. had the swordfish dish and it was incredible, i highly recommend it. my fiance had the saffron curry dish and it was delicious as well. the atmosphere here is romantic but comfortable. everything tastes 100% fresh and the combination of flavors are authentic & creative. if i'm ever lucky enough to visit paris again, i would absolutely come again. i read one review complaining about the expense, but we thought the prices very reasonable.; what a wonderful find! the service was warm and welcoming, we immediately felt like regulars. two of our table were vegetarian and the kitchen cooked up a delicious vegetarian feast. the restaurant was very welcoming of my 9yo son and made sure he enjoyed a fantastic kids meal. i would highly recommend a visit here.; average food, but way too expensive....

name: Mayfair Garden
reviews: i have been to hundreds of indian restaurants- this is definitely the best. a. perfect mix of tradition and presentation, coupled with excellent service. you can‘t ask for more. my compliments!; i rarely leave reviews but this place was absolutely amazing. best food i’ve had in paris so far. excellent service.; this place is good .more vegetarian option .food was so amazing and delicious and staff was so friendly.must try place  paris; food is authentic and tasty. it really suits for those who like less spicy indian food, especially for arabs and saudis. high appreciation to sachin for friendly service. but manager is very bad guy. behaviour is very bad with too much attitude; best indian food since we visited the chutney mary in london. 10/10⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Amalfitana
reviews:
delightful restaurant in ternes. we had a simple meal, pizza and penne bolognese with tiramisu for dessert, but everything tasted great and service was friendly and efficient. i would recommend amalfitana for delicious food in an unfussy and comfortable environment!; on april 3, 2023 after a long evening of not having any luck with finding a restaurant our 4 person group could agree on for our last night in paris, we stumbled on this lovely restaurant. and what a fortunate find it was!

the ambiance was warm and inviting and our host guillaume, which he translated to william for us, was just as warm and inviting.

he was so accommodating and patient with all of our questions and was willing to socialize with us.

we were the only guests at the time for most of our meal, and guillaume was just so attentive and friendly and really helped to make our last night in paris a memorable one for us.

the food was delicious and everyone was full and satisfied with their meals.

as promised, we did leave their card and a lot of complimentary words with the hotel we were staying so that they could hopefully recommend this place to their guests.

thank you for a wonderful evening!; after a busy day sight seeing we decided to eat italian. the food was freshly prepared and full of flavour. the pizza is the best. we was served by william, he was amazing and a very experienced waiter. his recommendations and attention to detail was bang on. next time i’m in france i will be back. thank you.; unfortunately we were a bit disappointed by our visit here. we didn’t expect that, given the good reviews. the table was small and dirty (sticky). the bruschetta were completely burnt (black, not even brown..) and small. pizza was burnt on the bottom and uncooked at the edges. pasta was good, the atmosphere was nice and the waiter was very friendly, though.; lovely meal and service! highly recommended and quite reasonable.  bruschetta and pasta were delicious. tiramisu was on another level.

name: Lobster Paradise 🦞
reviews:
picked this place based on location to our hotel, price and google reviews. highly recommend! my son said it was the best meal he has had on our trip. the presentation was so beautiful and the taste delicious. i got the lobster roll and new potatoes, my husband and son both got the lobster burger and sweet potato fries.; we recently tried out lobster paradise, a fantastic street food spot specializing in all things crab. i found it through some great reviews on google, so we decided to go there for our breakfast.

the guy making the food was super nice and friendly, which made the experience even better. the food itself was delicious – every dish was packed with flavor and really filling.

overall, lobster paradise is a great place to grab a tasty and satisfying meal. we highly recommend it!; the lobster roll and potatoes are absolutely delicious! yanis, the owner, was friendly and great to talk to. you can tell how much thought was put into the menu and ingredients of the food once you’ve taken your first bite. it’s simple food with an amazing touch. this place is a must go-to!; first and foremost, the food was incredible. fresh tasting and an absolute sensory experience you wouldn’t want to miss. yanis, the owner was a pleasure to speak with and learn about his culture, while keeping an open ear and heart for foreigners. we look forward to coming back for many years to come.; a fantastic gem near the arc de triomphe. if you’re in the area, do check out this restaurant. the lobster roll and pasta were fresh and delicious! highly recommended 😃

name: Hippopotamus
reviews: the review is specifically to thank mrs. sofia for her excellent customer care and attention. there was a small mistake in the order, and she was so proactive in immediately solving the issue in a way that left us very satisfied. the food is fine, and the atmosphere is okay. prices are very reasonable.; it's my second time here. the steak was excellent and delicious. the most important thing is to ask for mediumwell. caesar salad is regular, but order it without chicken because the chicken is dry for me.; we were delighted with our experience at the restaurant. the venue is beautiful, the food was delicious and the service excellent. many thanks to mariam for her kindness and availability. we'll be back very soon to discover new flavors; came in expecting a great experience but i had to ask twice for water and by the time the water was served my throat was so dry i couldn’t talk. caesar salad and chicken on top was very bland and cheap. mac and cheese balls were also bland and dry. mimosa’s were good. cute atmosphere.; we got the bbq ribs and the l-original burger with the paradis and candy bramble crush to drink. the ribs were great in every way. the burger was quite good as well but does get soggy if not eaten quickly enough. service was good, fairly quick and nice. however, asking if you would like to add a tip at the end is an uncomfortable way to do so from the american perspective i'm used to.

name: Dom's
reviews: this is my favorite place in paris, sweetest owner! best food! i'm emotional because of how sweet he is please go and talk with him . i always have to go when i'm in paris he feels like family. this man is a next level makes me wanna be a better person; delicious fries and inexpensive wraps, nice costumer service; a gem in the area. family was looking for a no fuss, late dinner option to bring back home and dom's exceeded expectations. the staff was really nice and happy to offer suggestions. the chicken shawarma was a highlight as well as the lebne, hummus and falafel platter. highly recommended if you're in the area and hungry.; really great typical lebanese food. i was craving a ´mankouché’ and it hit the spot! really tasty and very fresh. will definitely come back to try other things on the menu!; very refreshing option if you want something as fast as mcdonald's but tastier and great customer service :)

name: Mayo Restaurant
formatted_address: 3 Pl. du Général Kœnig, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
simple and straight menu gave easy understand how the food will be …
but the taste is more than can image.
the side dish of the grilled octopus was good and maybe can simply eat just for a big bowl of it.  dessert is simple and nice
we will come back to visit when stay at the hyatt regency; we had a great lunch experience here, the foods and service were excellent 👌.
highly recommended; we stay at the hotel for four nights and had three breakfast in this restaurant!

the food are very good and with lots nice selection! very nice coffee station too!

but the service needs lots improvement, and no salt and pepper on our table and all table around us, i grab a set from few tables away and no salt in it also!

the restaurant in 5 stars hotel are missing all small details!

very sad!; hotel breakfast buffet @ €25 inside hyatt

great selection, good service from all staff, also speaks english. a good variety of fruits, juices and pastries and omelette on demand. not too many cooked savory food selection but still satisfying.; great healthy restaurants with great portion. i have to take away because we couldn’t finish al dishes. macaroni and rib eye are very well made, broccoli is surprisingly tasty. service is quick. very convenient if you are in a rush.

name: Au Bon Accueil. Bar...brasserie. Restaurant
reviews:
i dont know if its really a bon acceuil for everyone ...
my friends got a wonderful acceuil meanwhile the lady taking care of our table was super annoying with me refusing and a little bit rude with a smile talking back while i was asking for simple things like salt... ketchup....
so yeh it depends if you want of whether the staff appreciates you or not ..depending maybe on your face ....
she did also hide away my friends cigarette taking it away from his hand trying to be funny and maybe protective of his lungs ....
i thought that was a bit invasive

overall the food was good...
fresh french fries...
a good place to stop by on your lunch break to enjoy the show ur gonna get from the staff!
your experience could be completely different from mine...; highly recommend, the food was delicious. i loved boeuf au basilic with wine.; food tastes worse than the ones ordered at a food court to be honest; a favorite of locals to enjoy cold beer and cigarette on a quiet street.  excellent ownership and service.  the potato chips and peanuts are a nice touch.  a gem.; the food is garbage.
ordered entrecote and it tasted like burnt food. the ceasar salad is not good, 1/10 as well.
will not recommend this restaurant if you are hungry and will eat good food.
the toilet as well is very dirty. right beside the kitchen.

name: Le Relais du Bois
formatted_address: 1 Rue Guy de Maupassant, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
excellent food and warm services, the best dining experience in paris during my trip, everything is super.; i had an amazing dining experience at this french restaurant. the servers were incredibly kind and professional, making us feel welcome throughout the meal. the food was authentically french and delicious—every dish was thoughtfully prepared and full of flavor.; definitely coming back here next time i'm in paris!

got in here simply because it was close to the monet museum and the place looked very local, which turned out to be a great surprise! i had a fish/crab soup and beef tartare; both had complex but pleasant taste. the portion is quite big and they both come with some bites e.g. potatoes so if you're a solo traveler, you may talk with the waiter/waitress if your order would be too much. i wanted to have crème brûlée but too full! the lady here was very friendly and accommodating too!; this place was incredible. it is definitely difficult for the average tourist. we got a few looks and felt a little bit out of place, but we survived. the food was absolutely wonderful. the blood sausage was the best i’ve ever had. the crème brûlée was also amazing. it tasted like actual cream and not some yellow custard you find at other places. i wish i could come back to try more of the menu. please try this establishment if you want great food and the local experience.; i was the first to arrive at the beginning of the evening service, a senior solo lady in search of a wonderful meal.  i certainly found it!  i was greeted immediately by friendly staff, and seated at the back, which i loved because then i could enjoy my bordeaux as i watched the place completely fill up with happy locals.  the filet de boeuf was perfectly rare, the sauce delicious, the potatoes beautifully grilled, and — the pain perdu, grandmother’s recipe  — absolutely divine!!  if i am lucky enough to return to this part of paris, i will absolutely return!  5 stars!

name: la Gazette
reviews:
i had a wonderful experience at la gazette; the dishes were exquisite, and the ambiance was perfect. the service was impeccable, making the evening truly memorable.; the parisian welcome you’re looking for.

la gazette is one of those places: if you know, you know. great food of course. vibey ambiance and tasty cocktails. you will most certainly enjoy your meal. but above all, the service and welcome are unmatched. hugo and team are the best! they go above and beyond to ensure you have an outstanding experience at their establishment and their positive energy is contagious. we enjoyed our first dinner so much that we decided to also spend our last evening here before leaving paris. la gazette is our home away from home and we plan to visit every year.

p.s. it’s definitely the kind of local place camille would hang out at. #emilyinparis #camilleknowshugo; friendly and exuberant staff, relaxed atmosphere and delicious food. the menu is quaint, yet varied in tastes and styles.; solid restaurant in a quiet side street. outdoor seating is limited. lunch was good. menu is available in english as well. for undecided tourists, they do offer a burger option. one of the little ones got the burger and it was a nice one. the rest of the food was good ranging from fish, pork and chicken with various sides. all dishes are freshly seasoned using various fresh herbs.; everything was very tasty! the serving of the artichoke and sauce were amazing.
as “aubergine caviar” is our home traditional dish (odesa, ukraine), we would definitely recommend add garlic to empower the taste)

name: Aux Cocottes
reviews: loved this place so much we ate here twice in 2 days. such a cute place, great service and amazing food!  we are walking distance from our hotel and so glad we found this restaurant. recommending this place to our friends and family who travel here often!; thoroughly enjoyed the beef chuck at this quaint little restaurant with great service. served with fresh french bread and made with only gluten free and organic ingredients, this meal was a delight. you can stroll down the street for views of the eiffel tower after your meal as well if it so pleases you.; for my birthday, i ended up in a very cozy french restaurant located just an 8-minute walk from trocadéro square. we didn’t make a reservation, but we got lucky with a table. the service was great, and the waiters were attentive. the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was very pleasant. we definitely recommend it!; amazing dinner, the restaurant is on a quiet street and feels very intimate. the burrata appetizer was so fresh & delicious. the duck was some of the best i’ve had. topped it off with french toast for dessert which was incredible!! will definitely come back here next time i’m in paris!; the staff were patient and kind with our poor french, and the location/interior was great and food was exceptional. the slow cooked beef was amazing, and the pepper sauce on the duck has a nice bite. very highly recommend going here.

name: Brasserie Au Moka
reviews:
it was the best dinner i had in paris! croque madam was just perfect! it comes with a cripsy fries as well:)  we also really enjoyed our aperol spritz there!
staff was nice, speaking good good english!; our dinner was amazing - the beef bourguignon was perfection. great little stop that felt local, not touristy.; good food but service was not well. we feel uncomfortable.; arrived today at 2.55 for a 3 pm booking.
to be told the chef finishes cooking at 3.
the staff did their best to accommodate us.
unfortunately, the food was not very good.
i asked for a salad as i have lots of allergies.
i was given a small bowl of lettuce with tomatoes in a sauce.
however, the staff did their best.
the fork need to update their appointment system so others don't get disappointed and turn up for a booking with no chef; great food in a cozy environment with very friendly service. our group of 14 en to this restaurant and we were treated extremely well. we had a great dinner and felt at home despite being a  large group. the owners went the extra mile (even speaking to us in spanish) to mark us feel welcomed. will definitely return in our next visit to paris

name: Le Sain Sert
formatted_address: 3 Rue Roque de Fillol, 92800 Puteaux, France
reviews:
lovely place the meat was cooked to preciously how i asked for it thank you for such a beautiful experience 😀; this is a fantastic little restaurant just a few minutes from la defense.  the staff are welcoming and attentive.  the herring starter was fabulous, and my main course of hanger steak was great too.  the crème brulee is probably one of the best i've ever had - the crust was thin and crisp and the crème unctuous and rich.  all topped off with a good coffee.  excellent value for great quality food.  would heartily recommend; we had an amazing experience here, the best authentic french cuisine in the area! we had french onion soup and snails! come here if you’re looking for a warm environment, incredible food, and friendly/caring staff!; nice and warm place!
it is good to see, that there are still places, where the priority is the quality and not the number of seats.
dishes are all well home-made and good tasting.
prices are on line with other restaurants, but for sure the quality is much better.
good choice of french wines too.
the atmosphere makes this place ideal for a romantic dinner.
for sure one of the best restaurants tried in paris.
good position, very close to la defense (10 min walking).

saved in my favs. be back for sure!; this restaurant marked our visit to paris. it was very close to our airbnb and we went in for a dinner with little expectations. the staff was very warm and welcoming, and went above and beyod to accommodate us. they translated the entire menu for us, gave us their opinions, recommended range of wines and even offered free meals if we didn't like them! of course the food topped our experience, and was the best tasting during our short 4 day visit to paris. much better experience compared to any restaurant in city centre we've been to!
5/5 for food
5/5 for wine
5/5 for hospitality
5/5 for atmosphere

name: Bistrot Le 90
formatted_address: 90 Rue de la Tour, 75116 Paris, France
reviews: we are tourists and always try to hit different places, never going to the same place twice.  we made an exception for this little bar, we love it!   we had the sangria special 2 days in a row on our way back to our airbnb.  off the main paths, great service, great sangrias.  we love this place.; the owner of the restaurant was very arrogant, disrespectful and even told us to not come back  with our kids 2 and 3 years old because he thought people were not entering to his place because of the children, even though  the place was already empty when we arrived.; nice little café, bar, restaurant run by a portuguese family. they have homemade pastel del nata that are worth a detour.; portuguese restaurant although its dishes are not all portuguese. they have a €15 menu consisting of a starter + main course or main course + dessert. the service is very good and the food is delicious. on saturdays you do not have kitchen service.  recommendable; authentic french-portuguese restaurant, managed from father to son. warm welcome, exquisite fusion cuisine, friendly atmosphere. unforgettable culinary experience.

name: Le Murat
reviews:
intimate setting.   my friend, a local, brought me there.  i enjoyed the evening - service is efficient and i appreciate they the staff does not come in to interrupt our discussions just to ask “how’s everything”.  same menu for lunch and dinner.  food is good but nothing spectacular.  i’m not a fan of the fried sushi.; went in late at night for dinner. the atmosphere is great, and so is the service. unfortunately the food was very unsatisfactory. normally, i would rate the food a 2, but at this price point, i have to rate it a 1. we ordered tortiglioni and octopus, and the only thing that we actually liked were the side of mashed potatoes, which also needed salt. if you're aiming for a nice, classy atmosphere and don't care much about the food but moreso, then you may like it. otherwise, i unfortunately would not recommend.; my friend said that the le tigre qui pleure was one of the best beef dishes he had so far for his europe trip. that summed it up on how good the food is from this restaurant.

since this restaurant is located in an affluent neighborhood, many well to do people dine here. there is a section inside the restaurant reserved just for the vips.

this restaurant knows how to serve the vips. they provide impeccable service and the food always come out succinctly. our waitress was very attentive and called my friend by name.

people come here for their gourmet food. all the food we ordered were delicious and fantastic. my friend loved the beef dish and he said that the meats were so flavorful and tender.

my miso glazed salmon was so good too. the fish meat was so tender that it melted in my mouth. with the miso glaze, the salmon tasted amazing.

i have to mention that the egg roll appetizer was one of the best in town. i felt it was better than the ones from the vietnamese restaurant we had the previous night.

we were so thankful that my friend took us there for lunch. this has been the best meal we have had since we arrived in paris.; we were fortunate to find this lovely restaurant not to far from the hôtel molitor. we arrived just after 2pm, when many restaurants are closed. it was relatively empty and we were treated well and promptly by the staff.

we shared the smoked salmon starter, which was amazing and huge! we were glad we shared. my tiger steak was prepared correctly at medium rare and melted in flavorful bites. her fish and asparagus was like wise light and flaky and well seasoned.

our petit millefeuille was wonderful but a bit small to share. the salmon at the start more than compensated. if you don’t get a huge appetizer, get your own desserts.

we will look to revisit here on our next trip.; very nice restaurant with good wine and good food. had the chance to have dinner with my co-workers and the food was really good. large variety of dishes and wine. we had the pastèque salad to start (watermelon, cucumber, tomatoes, olives and feta) which was very tasty. the sea bass was next - well presented and tasty. the spinach could have used more seasoning but all in all it was a good dinner. the place was packed as the juventus - paris game was happening, so if you go before an event, make sure to make a reservation 😉

name: Atelier du Marché
reviews:
thank you for making our paris trip so memorable. we love this restaurant so much that we went there three times, and each time the restaurant not only lived up to but went beyond our high expectations.  all the staff were consistently friendly and helpful, and were tirelessly willing to explain the menu and some french cuisine that we were not so familiar with. we ordered salmon and sea bass dishes, which were super yummy.  the avocado plate was also our favorite starter.  as for dessert, we really loved apple crumble and apple tart.  however, we found chocolate mousse too sweet and cantaloupe a little bit too simple. absolutely, we highly recommend this restaurant and cant wait to visit it again during our next trip to paris.; great atmosphere. very friendly staff.  we liked everything very much.  it was very delicious!; a neighborhood favourite. was recommended to this restaurant and it didn't disappoint. had the pan seared duck breast with roasted potatoes, mushrooms and carrots. the duck meat was nicely pink and juicy and vegetables fresh and tasty. went down nicely with a glass of wine. bread was a little tough. service was quick and attentive. the interior has a rustic feel and well decorated but too warm to sit inside in summer.; first night back in paris and had to have a nice meal at one of my favorite restaurants.
the staff is always so welcoming and accommodating.  the food and service are always a delight.  this time was no different.
thank you for your continued attention to details and friendly atmosphere.; cozy atmosphere that makes you feel like you're having a meal with at someone's house. there were quite a few people there for a sunday evening, so it still had a nice vibe.
service was pleasant and attentive.
the food was excellent, not perfect presentation, but it didn't matter. try the duck breast, or the steak tartar.

name: Le Tournesol Paris 16e
reviews:
rude french waiters, but the food was pretty good. the desert was fresh and the entree above average.; off the beaten path so it wasn't overpriced and full of tourists. my judgment always starts with if the locals eat there, it must be good. we'll le tournesol had plenty of locals and from there we couldn't have asked for a better dinner experience. the wait staff was very attentive, the food and wine were exceptional,  and the atmosphere was very casual.
if you're looking for a great dinner, away from the hustle and bustle, we highly recommend le tournesol.; went to this place by chance as it was just next to my airbnb. so no expectation thinking to find just a little neighbourhood restaurant. but what a delightful surprise. nothing pretentious but everything executed with great care and taste. flavours were well balanced and every course was a hit, i even ended ordering extra starters just to taste. great service as well and great atmosphere; we arrived late (after 10:00 p.m.) and fortunately we were still able to grab a seat for a bite to eat. we had the calamari as an appetizer. this one was really delicious. as a main course i had the steak tatar. i will definitely recommend this one! the portions are good!; very good place to go for lunch on a sunny friday, with a nice terrace you can suntan while enjoying a caesar salad or some more traditional and heavier french dishes. service is a bit slow, hence 4 stars instead of 5.

name: La Grange
reviews:
this little restaurant was the highlight of my paris trip. tucked away on a small street in the centre of paris, it was much better than the tourist areas. i walked in on a quiet evening where i could enjoy a meal with a friend and had a great time. the food was of great quality at a reasonable price and the decor created a cozy atmosphere. i ordered the risotto and it was creamy, cheesy and just right. i would visit again if i could!; server was surly. tartare looked like cat food. worst meal in paris by a long shot.; nice location, nice and friendly staff, the menu is small but good. we enjoyed it we’ll end of june 2022. the only topics are: the large beer is 10€ 😳😳

the white wine asked (try wine, sec, no residential sugar!!!!) for was too sweet and i could not drink 😡😡; quaint and cute local restaurant; food was unique & delicious, the owner was very kind and attentive, and very good prices overall.; very homely food. in the heart of paris but not a rip off. a good casual place to eat if you are sick of touristy or up market fancy fine dining bistros with average food around the champs elysees. service was stretched the night we were there but the waitress had a lot of ♥️

name: Petit Victor Hugo (PVH)
reviews:
it was our first lunch in paris and we randomly found this place and we were pleasantly surprised. from a warm welcome to the delicious food. the young waiter was very professional, answered all our questions and was very attentive to us!
the meals were all perfectly balanced and well seasoned. i felt pure bliss leaving the restaurant and definitely will be returning in the near future.; i think we came here at a perfect time. we had a late lunch here. it was pretty quiet. food was delicious! we had oysters and prawns for starters, roasted octopus and veal fillet for our main course. i'm very picky with my oysters and it didn't disappoint. they were fresh! prawns were delicious with the curry sauce! the roasted octopus was cooked into perfection! if we had more $$$ we could've added another order lol! the veal was very very good! i was kindda skeptical about it but it was so soft and the sauce with mushroom was delicious!

we had lemon cheesecake for dessert which was surprisingly good. it's by far the best we've ever had. it's not your usual cheesecake that's like from cheesecake factory. it was light and delicious!

our server was very nice and attentive! merci!; very classy and elegant place for your pre dinner drinks and for your actual dinner meal. service is fast and super professional. i tried some of their sea food and it is beyond any expectation for being in paris. excellent food, detailed interior decor, professional service. all the money you spent here is well spent and it will make you happy.; mixed experience at le pvh

firstly, i must acknowledge the stunning decor of the restaurant. the attention to detail in the interior design created a beautiful and inviting ambiance. the tasteful decorations and comfortable seating added to the overall charm of the place, creating a pleasant atmosphere for dining.

however, i was disappointed with the initial service i received upon arrival. despite the restaurant not being full, it took longer than expected for the staff to seat us. it seemed like they were understaffed, as there were only two waiters for the entire terrace and outdoor section. this lack of attention affected the overall efficiency and service quality, leaving a negative impression.

moving on to the food, i have to admit that most of the dishes we ordered were delicious. the flavors were well-balanced, and the presentation was visually appealing. however, the crispy gambas with curry sauce was a disappointment. the dish was not well prepared, as evident from the picture i took. the prawns were overcooked, looking rather dark and lacked the desired crispiness. it was clear that the chef responsible for the fryer was not experienced in handling seafood dishes.

it is worth mentioning that the staff, although not particularly attentive, was polite and accommodating when approached. however, due to the understaffing issue, it was challenging for them to provide the level of service one would expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

with some improvements in service and more attention to detail in food preparation, this restaurant has the potential to become a top seafood destination.; great experience!! the food was really good especially the mussels! service was so great the staff (all of them that served us) were great!! best experience for us throughout our entire paris trip. very adorable as well!

name: Restaurant Marcel 16
reviews:
this was an amazing breakfast, pricey, but great quality. a client and i had gone in the morning & we split an egg with cottage cheese & toast, plus a beautigul french toast as our 'dessert'. it is was perfect for 2 people who don't eat too much & even better for 1 person who is a big-eater.
great ambiance, as no one was there since it was so early morning, but as noon came, the restaurant became packed.
honestly, amazing bfast for a great price.; very nice lunch in charming, neighbourly restaurant. service was nice & friendly and, were she not the only server in the restaurant, would probably be efficient, too! ;) seemed a little short-staffed at times, though could be because of large group of american students who arrived all at once. duck was delicious, and the octopus salad a favourite. beer on tap would be preferred to bottled. would recommend, especially the octopus salad!; this review is specifically for the burgers.  if you like your burgers raw/super rare go for it. the meat is amazing. in the us we like our burgers cooked “medium”, so in france we order “medium well” which is essentially the equivalent. no matter what we say, they arrive almost raw.  we give up! this has happened too many times. we’ll stick with smash burgers from now on.  fyi almost all the reviews listed here are for a different restaurant.  this place opened in 2021/2022.; absolutely enjoyed our breakfast here ❤️ we tried the waffles and the norwegian  style eggs - both were amazing, presentation and all. what really stood out was customer service, main host was very accommodating when we had a lot of questions and took our time ordering. he was being helped by 2 kids who were also so sweet and helpful! would definitely come back again to try other dishes. 10/10 would recommend; our first local dinner in paris in our local airbnb area. i called for a reservation day of a few hours prior, and they were able to take me in. prices were reasonable. food came in a timely manner and was excellent, i had the duck breast and my fiance had the shrimp.

name: Le Wilson
vicinity: 2 Place du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Pl. du Trocadéro et du 11 Novembre, 75116 Paris, France
reviews:
quite a decent place

contrary to the ratings, we found the restaurant quite good. service was top class. we ordered the menu (chicken roast, egg salad and ice cream), onion soup, penne pasta and crepes.
the quantity of each dish was more than adequate.
except the roast chicken which was as a 4 star, i would rate every other dish a 4.5-5 star. the ice cream was especially delicious and the pasta was surprisingly good. overall for the price, we were very satisfied.; located in trocadero and near eiffel. so it’s a touristy area and ofcourse a bit pricey

i ordered entrecote steak and it’s good. well i think it just need more veggie on the side

staff are friendly but i have to wait for a long time for my dessert; we had the lunch menu- it’s nice you can switch your options at a small additional cost. the tartar was very well seasoned, but some of the other dishes were bland and dry, like the chicken and the steak. overall, it’s an okay place with okay food.; overall, this experience was not one of our favorites in paris.

first off, the food was pretty unflattering, and didn’t have much taste. the steak came out pretty stiff and the tartar was completely filled with capers which completely took away from the taste of the beef.

also, the staff had forgotten about my plate so i sat waiting for my plate for a while after everyone else had gotten theres. not a big deal, it happens, but just a bit inconvenient.

i do have to say that our server, who had red hair, was very very nice and attentive to us.; we ordered the menu, the starters was good but when the meat arrived was tough, we ordered it medium and it was not good cooking. the fries were not good at all. the ice cream was ok, the portion is really generous but and if the main curse you can't eat it, the entree and dessert don't save the restaurant.  if you go, don't order the meat, it looks very good, but you won't be able to eat it.

name: Comptoir Principal
reviews:
we had breakfast in this cafe twice. very nice interior, cozy. i ordered toast with avocado and feta. it was delicious 👌🏻 the croissants are fresh and tasty. that's why we came back here for breakfast again. the terrace offers a view of the eiffel tower.; amazing food, the stand out was the avocado toast and the fried risotto balls. first restaurant i've been to that asks for tips. the complimentary bread can be ignored, as the food prepared is so much better.; perfect little breakfast spot, very impressive food for the price ( we had the toast,avocado and feta) nice coffee and freshly squeezed juice. very welcoming, friendly staff to non french speaking tourists. highly recommended!; the outside seating gives you a really good view of the eiffel tower. the food is pretty good, and we really appreciated the multi-lingual service we received.; after being in paris for days this is one of the best croissant and breakfast i had! their croissant is a must to eat! have it with butter and jam, it's amazing!!!

croissant with scrambled eggs and ham was very good too!

name: La REcyclerie
reviews:
what a beautiful space that’s many things from cafe to restaurant to work space to pop up space. decorated with recycled goods and plants, there’s plenty of places to sit indoor and out. their chocolate croissants were excellent and staff friendly.; yesterday morning, i left the house wanting to charge my camera, buy a shirt and listen to prince and i was able to find it all la recyclerie. the place was different and interesting,the staff were so nice, my croissant was meh and my pain au chocolate was also meh; this gem of a place goes beyond just good coffee—it's a sustainability haven. with a plethora of engaging activities from workshops to conversations, it fosters a strong sense of community. the staff is exceptional, and the atmosphere is unparalleled. plus, their commitment to using organic, locally sourced ingredients for their delicious food adds another layer of charm. it's a must-visit for anyone seeking meaningful experiences and eco-conscious living.; a large and welcoming cafe with a heavy tilt toward sustainable choices. i had lunch here alongside businesspeople, families, and young creative types working on laptops. they had several vegetarian options, and a full coffee and alcohol bar. prices were reasonable, i paid about 15 euro for a hearty soup with a poached and fried egg, a coffee, and a cookie.; i visited during the weekend, and they provided a weekend brunch special which comes with unlimited tea/coffee/hot chocolate and bread.
the view and vibe was amazing.
food was delicious.
staff spoke excellent english too, and explained the concept of the weekend deal kindly to me.
i loved this cafe.

name: Poppy Paris
reviews:
poppy is an absolute gem for brunch in paris! the service was incredibly kind and gracious, making us feel welcome from the moment we walked in. the food was beautifully prepared, with every dish tasting as fresh as if the ingredients had been picked that morning. it’s the perfect spot to enjoy a cozy meal in a lovely atmosphere. i can’t recommend poppy enough—definitely a must-visit if you’re looking for a delightful brunch experience!; cute brunch place, with very nice food and friendly staff.
the street is only for pedestrian on weekend, which makes it a great outdoor terrasse on sunny weekend.
the coffee is ok and could be better.; nice cozy place. they serve sort of "homemade" food. friendly atmosphere. brioche bun is tasty:); we loved the brunch, awesome service and really great food. the juice and dessert were particularly good.; beautiful place but incredibly mean people work here. specifically the manager of the hotel. i’ve never been so disrespected in my entire life. ruined the first half of my vacation. thank god i checked in to a wonderful place elsewhere — steer clear of the restaurant and hotel if you are american or don’t speak french fluently. they told me they don’t offer “any protein.” i asked for fish, beef, nuts, egg or chicken (i’m hypoglycemic and require protein frequently) and they said no. i’m confident it was because of my accent (i used google translate because i’m not french). truly a sin this place is in business.

name: Morny
reviews: i had a great experience at this restaurant. the beef tartare was excellent and definitely worth trying, with a generous portion. the salad came with a tasty dressing that complemented it perfectly. the service was attentive and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. while there’s room for improvement, it’s a solid choice for a good meal.; excellent spot for a classic onion soup and much more french dishes . the staff is great, very attentive and accommodating. i would come back here and would recommend it to anyone looking for a casual fare around the area.; came here for dinner with my fiancé & mother and from the moment we sat down our waiter was engaging, funny and efficient. he sat us in a beautiful quiet dining room inside where he was attentive to all our needs. every course was delicious with not a single fault to be found. we had onion soup and fois gras for entree, all of us had confit duck (the best i have ever eaten!), and all of us had crème brûlée which again was faultless with the perfect caramelised sugar top. would highly recommend to anyone visiting paris.; we had such a wonderful time here that we had to come back the next day! service was impeccable and the food was delicious! we had the spaghetti bolognese and veal steak and tried a few wines on their list. the staff gave us suggestions of things to see while here in paris. we felt like family and are looking forward to visiting morny on our next trip to paris!; overall my experience here was very good, the food was exceptional and the service was very good. overall great experience eating here and would highly recommend if you’re in the area.

name: Beauvau Saint-Honoré
reviews:
i rarely leave any reviews. this restaurant deserves every star, my parents came to visit me and of course i wanted every meal to be perfect for them. i am so glad we went here, the food was amazing, i got the octopus and my parents both got the two specials of the day. both wines that were recommended to us were great pairings, the ambiance and music was also great. above all, the service was a 10/10, our waitress was so kind and attentive, speaking only french with me and only english with my parents, she also brought out a digestif of limoncello free of charge at the end of our meal and offered to take our photo. i can’t wait to bring everyone who visits me in paris to the restaurant. word of advice: get the charcuterie and cheese board to start, the octopus for a meal, and the cafe gourmand as a dessert, excellent!; i looked for a cozy and simple ambience to have a dinner close to my hotel and found this spot.
the food was very good and the stuff super friendly.
i highly recommend everyone to visit if you are looking for good food and a chill atmosphere.; real experience : a dining experience that ruins a trip! i pointed to the picture and the waiter made a mistake. we had to order again! in fact, this steak can not be cut, put in the mouth like chewing wax, like dead mouse meat, very bad! at the same time the charge is very expensive, everyone must avoid this restaurant!; ordered the steak medium-rare and it came out rare at best and was mostly gristle. only ate 25%. chips and sauce were fine. cocktails were acceptable; lovely restaurant italian inspired. good is excellent and also the desserts are tasteful. nice menu, fast service, reasonable price. i would personally recommend this restaurant in the very nice 9th district of paris. enjoy it

name: Café Dose Paris • Batignolles
vicinity: 82 Place du Docteur Félix Lobligeois, Paris
formatted_address: 82 Place du Dr Félix Lobligeois, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
i recently visited café dose and had a fantastic experience!

their scrambled eggs are delicious 😋👌—fluffy, perfectly seasoned, and just the right portion. paired with a delicious cappuccino, it made for a perfect breakfast.

i also want to add that the service was very fast. i used the qr code to check the menu, but i had to order by asking the waiter. then within 5 minutes, i had the breakfast on my table! impressive.

they also have a nice selection of fresh bakery available for take away, and a long queue of people waiting to take their coffee and bakery to go, which says how good this is 😋.

the outdoor seating is a lovely touch, providing a relaxing atmosphere to enjoy the meal. if you’re in the area, i highly recommend stopping by for a bite!!!; insects flying around and parking on our food felt unpleasant and a bit disgusting having it on our meals, trying to always deal with them instead of focusing on eating. this broke our experience considering that inside place is pretty small and busy.

we had a salmon toast & grilled cheese with orange juice and iced latte with topping, our food and drinks were amazing.

have to mention staff was very fast and helpful also, speaking both french and english with us; lovely little café with indoor and outdoor seating.
atmosphere is family, work, group of friends friendly, so everyone can feel at easy.

coffees are delicious, of course, and the bites made of fresh products.; cute place! it has very nice staff, who can speak both french and english. i personally ordered the chocolate bread and a matcha latte and they were very delicious  😋.  my family also liked their food very much :); if this is a flat white double shot then i don't want to see what a single shot cappuccino looks like. takeaway coffee should also maintain its quality. and quality is not satisfactory. sorry :(

name: Le Petit Ney
vicinity: 10 Avenue de la Porte de Montmartre, Paris
formatted_address: 10 Av. de la Prte de Montmartre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews: fantastic with very helpful staff thank you; top; a supportive place with a warm atmosphere. the cuisine is simple but tasty and the people are very kind. a place that reconciles with humanity.; very interesting visit to the blémont district with a guide from petit ney who told us lots of unexpected anecdotes about the history of the district.; an atmosphere that is both simple and exciting, great encounters and a brilliant storytelling show: a great journey in all dimensions!!!

name: La Place
formatted_address: 5 Pl. du Maréchal Juin, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
we were on a trip to paris for 5 nights, we were staying close to there, and it really surprised me the service in this place. david was so kind and he was trying to help us all the time, as we don’t speak french. nothing was missing in our table, and david really engaged with us. food was good but not incredible, i think it’s the perfect place to sit outside and have some wines and the ham and cheese platter. my steak was perfect but i had better fries in france. 100% recommended, and thank you so much david!; really bad service, the staff is super mean but the food was okay. i wouldn’t go back to this place. the schedule isn’t accurate 0/10; must try the burger and the chocolate mouse it was very good and service was fast. the creme brûlée was delicious too. we eat it all!; rude service, overpriced, noisy atmosphere, trashy place, 9.5€ for a glass of low-quality wine. food is horrible.

went for drinks and took a "tapas" plate to share.

we were kinda surprised when the waiter brought ketchup and mayo to the table. maybe for patatas bravas?

the "tapas" ended up being some defrosted jalopeno poppers, nutri-score f "chicken", onion rings and three pieces of frozen baguette with ketchup and some awful cheese melted on top. served with some bbq-dip, as in every spanish sophisticated cuisine😋 even mcdonald's could do better.

this fourth-grade boy's sleepover birthday meal had two different prices on the menus, 12€ and 10€.

after waiting for the bill for a good 20 minutes, i went inside to look for the waiters but could'nt find any - even though we were almost the only people in this so called restaurant. more waiting inside and finally some guy came and took the payment. after a little negotiation, i paid €10 for the tapas instead of 12€👍🏻; only went there for breakfast. we only had the coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice, croissant and a baguette with butter and jam but we liked it so much that we went back several times in the week that we were there in paris. the staff was friendlier each day. it was also nice that they spoke english. i had café creme which was the best one i had in the whole time that we were there in paris. it was also cheaper (by 3 euros) than another place that we tried later on in the week where we ordered the same thing.

name: Hard Rock Cafe Paris
reviews:
hard rock cafe paris offers a lively american dining experience with a rock ‘n’ roll vibe. the decor features iconic music memorabilia, creating an energetic atmosphere. the menu includes classic american dishes, vegetarian options, and signature cocktails, with generous portions and consistent quality. service is friendly, and staff often speak multiple languages. located centrally, it’s convenient for tourists, and there’s a retail shop for hard rock merchandise. well-founded by the dedicated staff, it has become a beloved spot, but it will be closing within a month, making this your last chance to visit and enjoy its vibrant ambiance.; went here on a business trip with ~30 colleagues, food was incredible, unfortunately they forgot a lot of our collective order & completely missed the starters from the pre-arranged set menu.

additionally there were some administrative issues when it came to pay to do with our deposit. nevertheless, it was an incredible experience and for groups not as large as ours i can highly recommend!

the issues we faced were definitely unique to our specific situation with such a large group, they are not going to be reflective of a typical experience so please don’t let us discourage you from visiting!; this hard rock is very unassuming from the street view but is very cozy and lively inside.  the  employees were all helpful and friendly.  our server was the greatest, patient and kind.  i had the messi chicken sandwich; come with an appetite, that’s all i got to say.  we also had the ribs, the meet was falling of the bone tender.  they have 50% off drink specials in the early evening, yum; even non alcoholic for the kids.; as we are a fan of hard rock, we already knew the standards of service and foods. amazing as always! 👏🏼

a big thanks to a lovely server there, she was very attentive and friendly. our salad was missing and i was a bit disappointed but she tried her best to manage it for us, we understood how busy and crowded it was.. result was impressive. 👍🏼
