one thing to note, we came from switzerland to paris (visited almost 10 times) and we speak german and english.. there was a bartender (i prefer not to mention the name) he was not so happy once we said we are from switzerland.. his reaction was strange, the way he spoke to us was not friendly at all. he even asked if we speak german? with a tone of voice that i concluded that he didn’t like that we speak german. (i was speaking german to my daughter, though my husband speaks fluent french.. my husband pretended to don’t speak french to him just to see how he would serve us) my husband ignored this ridiculous reaction and we didn’t take it seriously or personally, but as a world class restaurant i expect more that the workers are used to meet people all around the world who speak different languages.; the experience was quite enjoyable, and i would recommend it to anyone looking for a classic american dining experience with a touch of parisian flair.
i ordered the legendary burger, and my companion opted for the big cheese burger. both burgers were cooked to medium-well perfection, with juicy patties and fresh toppings. the fries were crispy and well-seasoned, making for a delightful side. the serving size was generous, and the presentation was on point. the aioli dipping sauce added an extra layer of flavor to the meal.
while the prices are on the higher side, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience justify the cost. our total bill came to €56.40, which included two burgers and two sodas. given the portion sizes and the quality, it was a reasonable expenditure for a special dining occasion.
hard rock cafe paris offers a solid dining experience with delicious food, great service, and a lively atmosphere. it’s a fantastic spot for both locals and tourists looking to enjoy a meal in a fun and iconic setting. i would definitely visit again and recommend it to others.

name: Café Pimpin 18e
reviews:
we had breakfast at pimpin, and it turned out to be surprisingly good. we enjoyed the meal, though the coffee wasn’t the best. other than that, everything was great.; best coffee during our paris visit. staff is great! really good value for money. i could happily go there every day!; earthy healthy cafe with plenty of indoor and outdoor space. various types of seating makes it ideal for different groups and for people working. it’s quite peaceful and a nice spot to grab a fresh juice. their coffee was decent, and food was average for the price.

i had a flat white and an avocado toast with one egg which was €17. the toast was not even fresh bread, came with a side salad and although it was fresh, it was quite basic.; this cafe has a very relaxed vibe, good hot chocolate and coffee and great scones. staff are very friendly. you can only use your laptop between certain (non-peak) times; i go there every week, once or more, to work. it’s a warm atmosphere. the food is always fresh produced and delicious (the scones are my favorite). waiters are so nice. a very cozy place to hang out with friends also.

name: Bistrot Chez Soi
reviews:
very nice place. the food is delicious. we ordered hot goat cheese salad and a well done pork chop with garlic potatoes. absolutely delicious!; enjoyed our seafood (the red tuna was especially good) and service was friendly. typical paris bistro where you come for the food rather than the ambiance.; fantastic food. staff were super friendly, with an incredible knowledge of whisky :-). who made us feel welcome; definately worth a visit. very well made dishes. we had the chicken salad and pokebowl. kind staff and the place has a nice calm atmosphere.; great parisian bistro. a bit off the beaten path, but well worth the trip.
the bistro serves all of the classics, sometimes with an interesting twist. the atmosphere is chill and nice (visited on a saturday night).
had a cheese plate as a starter and enjoyed it very much. the baguette however is not exactly to my liking (not enough crust), but overall it was good.
the entrecôte was delicious and cooked perfectly to medium as requested.
a bit sorry i had the cafe gourmand and not just one dessert, since the selection was a bit disappointing.

name: Cantine Chic Mam's Cantine De Famille
reviews:
good home made food. quite expensive for the quantity though.; cozy and delicious food; the main course, dessert and drink formula costs more than €15. the taste is there but at this price, you can find better elsewhere.; self-service meals to reheat on site or take away. bobun, curries, salads, etc.
i ordered a chicken tikka and rice and for dessert some chia seeds rice pudding style with strawberry coulis and pieces of strawberries.
i got it for around €15.00 with a bottle of sparkling water. it was pretty good, and the staff was friendly. the space is a little noisy, but we get used to it. the price is a little expensive for reheatable dishes served in plastic containers, hence my somewhat harsh rating.; a chic canteen that serves good meals either to take away or to eat on site.  come between 12 p.m. and 12:15 p.m. to easily get a seat. the dishes are cooked on site.

name: Au brazier
reviews:
just had a great meal at this place close to my holiday accommodation. it was all cooked to perfection, absolutely delicious, spent 32 euros for a menu classico meal, two chicken skewers, a portion of sweet potatoes, one of fried ones and a portion of green beans plus drinks. i eat outside quite a lot but this place stunned me. it was the best meal i had in 5 days in paris. highly recommend!; food was delicious and the price was affordable.
service was amazing, thank you to morat.
i will definitely be back.; just perfect grilled chicken! good and fast service.; service is good, staff is friendly, food is great all in all a very good place to get a nice dinner for low cost.; value for money! big portion with affordable price and a good taste. i order the classico menu.
i saw the halal certificate that seems from their chicken supplier posted at the receptionist desk.

the place is a bit small though, but it's clean and they have a toilet inside (need to asked first to use it).

name: Les enfants terribles
reviews:
good bar and good cocktails fantastic 😍🥂
with cheaper prices also 😉👌; cool local bar! i've been here a few times and it was always a nice experience.
to order drinks you normally go to the bar and bring them to your table, so don't always expect that once you sit servers will come to you because that's not the general type of service here.
you pay at the bar and receive the drinks upon payment so even quicker than waiting for service to bring drinks so rather efficient and quick!; great pub for drinks.
it's the cheapest in the area and is cleaner and more pleasant than the more expensive options. the staff are friendly and diligent, it's also a good place to go for foreigners as the staff and regulars are welcoming.

a few notes for people. a) the bar doesn't offer any good, you are allowed to eat your own food from elsewhere on site. b) the service is often at the bar, ie the staff won't always come to your seat, for me this is great as i prefer ordering at the bar c) it gets very busy after around 6, so you don't often have a place to sit.; super chill place to hang out affordable drinks and have great crowd all around had a great time spent almost 4 hours till it closed had a great great time night a bunch of shots for so many awesome people i had pleasure cross paths 🙏🏽🙏🏽 for tourist it’s a perfect place to visit :); 19.8 absolutely lovely lady making great drinks, greetings from finland, coming back 😘

name: Beco do Brasil
reviews:
lovely place ! food is absolutely delicious, ambiance is super friendly :); we celebrated a friend's birthday yesterday at beco do brasil in a brazilian fiesta atmosphere 🥳
the cocktails are delicious and the catering service delighted us!
a very pleasant place to party with friends 🤘🏼; in the open air, a deck with a few tables in the shade, flooded with lively brazilian music, to linger while tasting the house specialties prepared in a container. grilled or sweetened tapioca, iced acai, hot dog... everything is good
smiling service, very pleasant. low price.
we will come back with pleasure; finally a place with a calienté atmosphere with 360° of sunshine.
i highly recommend the #manioc #frango #carné skewers, they are delicious.. and many other delights....

of course we start with a caïpirinha and a dance step before welcoming this culinary delight from the sun.

deckchair at the appointment and other surprises...; cuisine and cocktails that take us directly to brazil while remaining in paris. i go there regularly and i recommend this address which is a little gem. there is a play area for children.

name: Les Bariolés de Maud Paris 9
reviews:
to be honest i am very surprised by the number of good ratings. let me start with service: it is quite clear there aren't enough servers as we have to wait for each step (to be seated, to get a menu, to order, to get a bottle of water, etc). ambiance: the tables on the terrace are too close, there aren't enough space among the customers so naturally, it is quite noisy. tables aren't flat as the floors aren't and it does not seem to be a problem at all to the server that put down the fork&knives that started to slide down on the table. cuisine: vegetables are quite obviously coming from supermarket bags, with the cold egg served.  taste is personal thus i do not let it influence the rating (even though i did not enjoy much). the price is too high for what we had, if it's cheaper i would say it would justify the little service and other things i mentioned above.; very fast service with delicious dishes.
when it comes to beverages, it's self service and there's only filter coffee.
tere's literally no place to move. they're using every cm possible to get more customers.
the service was friendly.; went there for sunday brunch. for 28 euro you do get two large plates and coffee, tea, orange juice. the first plate is hearty food. really delicious and nicely put together. the second plate is sweet. pancakes or fruits with yogurt and granola. service is friendly and on point. onle the place itself is really small and if you sit outside it can get chilly since the wind is blowing through this alley like a jet nozzle.; une belle découverte dans ce joli quartier.
we booked based on reviews and 0 regrets. the food was just plain yummy good. it was simple yet cared for. un sans fautes - i will come back.; a great discovery! the menu is original and tasty. i liked the fact that you can get drinks a volonté and you go serve yourselves. it makes it easier for you and the staff that can focus on preparing and serving the food. the portions are really generous, we had pastries earlier in the day and could have just shared a menu. it was very good so no regrets :)

name: La Casita Restaurant
reviews:
c bon; excellent; the best burger address in levallois and the surrounding area. excellent home fries (real potatoes). in addition, a wide choice of sandwiches and salads.
a warm, smiling welcome and fast service. nickel!; generally, between 12 p.m. and 1 p.m., we wait a bit! but, it's worth it. there is a wide choice: salads, sandwiches, pastas. you can even eat a 100% american menu: a bagel, a cheesecake accompanied by a coke. the service is quality and the staff is very friendly.; very warm welcome, a very wide choice between burgers, paninis, salads and grills (evening only), the burgers are excellent, the place is warm and lively. well done guys!

name: Popotes
reviews:
this place is amazing. i got a fresh juice with ginger - wow! also had warm vegetable/chicken in delicious light pastry, set on a bed of greens with balsamic dressing. lots of wonderful choices, hard to decide. smiling service, english speaking as well.; fantastic juice!
very cute and cozy place, stuff is great!
5 star all around, definitely recommend!; my favorite lunch place! the food is fresh, healthy and delicious, and there is always something new in the menu. the juices are also super good. on top of that, the staff is super friendly and the place is adorable.; best cold brew i have ever tasted. bottled cold brew often has a bitter taste, but popote’s cold brew is incredibly smooth, sweet, and fruit forward. i actual checked the label because i thought that maybe there was sugar or flavoring added, but there isn’t, it’s just the delicious coffee.; amazing food! coffee, and juice. so lovely we will be back!

name: Le Basilic
reviews:
quintessential french restaurant with classic dishes, cosy old-world style dining room and attentive service.

the steak and fries and chicken thigh and fries were both good. both the house bread and the onion soup are delicious.

make room for dessert. the chocolate mousse was smooth and very rich.; excellent onion soup. the steak and frites was okay--the steak was quite chewy. they had an express lunch menu so that was nice to have a shorter wait. our waitress however seemed over-worked and didn't smile the entire time. nice amount of both indoor and outdoor seating.; very good restaurant. great location, beautiful old building. traditional interior inside to give a great authentic french atmosphere.

staff were friendly and chatty and make you feel welcome. food was great, french onion soup amazing. great spot for lunch when touring around montmartre. lot's of options on the menu to choose from.; fabulous taste of french cuisine and even better service by the staff. onion soup was the best ever. quaint little establishment with very affordable 2 course meals for lunch and 3 course meals for dinner. great wine list too.; service at a height
the food is delicious
we attended the celebration of two birthdays, congratulations!
ambience great

name: Restaurant Bachaumont
reviews:
last night we dined at  bachaumont in paris and i must say, it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. the service was exceptional, the cocktails were perfectly fresh and balanced, and the food was absolutely delightful.

let's start with the service. the staff at bachaumont were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was top-notch. from the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm smiles and a genuine willingness to make our visit memorable. the staff even showed us to a private dining room, which was a pleasant surprise and showcased their commitment to providing a personalized experience.

now, let's talk about the cocktails. bachaumont definitely knows their craft when it comes to mixology. the cocktails were expertly crafted, with a perfect balance of flavors. each sip was a delight, and they truly complemented the dining experience.

speaking of the food, there were a few standout dishes that i highly recommend. the prime rib steak was cooked to perfection, tender, and full of flavor. it was a true carnivore's delight. the salads were fresh, vibrant, and bursting with seasonal ingredients. and let's not forget the truffle pasta, which was a heavenly combination of rich truffle flavor and perfectly cooked pasta.

however, i must mention that the sea bass carpaccio fell short of expectations. it was under-seasoned and lacked the wow factor that the other dishes had. while it didn't ruin the overall dining experience, it was a slight disappointment.

overall, my experience at bachaumont was exceptional. the service was impeccable, the cocktails were a delight, and the prime rib steak, salads, and truffle pasta were highlights. i would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion, a private dinner, or simply a memorable dining experience in paris.; simply amazing! i have stayed at the hotel many times and this was my second time dining here. staff were extremely friendly and helpful with great pairing recommendations. if you are in the area or at the hotel make a reservation and don’t miss this opportunity. also order a dessert!; charming restaurant with wonderful breakfast and dinner options. however, the service in this place is absolutely lacking (especially given the price). there is a young, short man in the morning wearing round glasses and all-black clothing who is just the embodiment of “ennuit” - he doesn’t greet you, he’s emotionless, and when you ask for something he just doesn’t care. it just turns our experience so sour & makes us not want to come back. such a shame…; dinner here last night, the decision based on menu and past reviews. it was a very good decision!

my date and i were seated quickly with advance reservations. the atmosphere is comfortable and inviting, at the first floor of the hotel bachaumont.
our server was friendly and quick, very welcoming.
we started with the courgette flowers, a delicious seasonal delicacy.
next, we had the angus beef entree and the boneless smoked veal chops, with side vegetables.  everything was delicious and cooked to perfection.
we elected not to have dessert,  although what we saw looked fabulous.

in short, make a reservation and go enjoy a great restaurant!; amazing food, amazing experience.
our best meal in paris was here. the lunch menu with 3 courses was out of the world. (my son's words)
staff was very accommodating for us, i really recomend it, for the food, the experience, the service, and the great atmosphere, the price was for us surprisingly not much.

name: Le Relais Des Broc's
reviews:
- staff is friendly.
- ambience is authentic.
- food is really delicious.
- price is reasonable.
- we love our visit.

merci beaucoup; the food was nice but not outstanding. the steak tartare was a little too similar to uncooked hamburger, and the pasta was undercooked and quite hard. the service was attentive and the staff was very pleasant.; good cafe in the rain between antique, trödel and second hand; quaint little restaurant with quick service and friendly, efficient waiters. chicken cesar salad made with iceberg lettuce was average.; wonderful place, great food, and great service.   i like places that remember who i am.  i highly recommend it.

name: Le Hasard Ludique
reviews:
this is the coolest spot in paris to have a drink. i didnt see a show but the abandoned train tracks and platform are amazing.; as someone who loves smaller live venues this place acoustically,  size wise , logistically , layout and ambiance was brilliant . well worth the 10 hour drive to get here

great stage area and the dining downstairs along the old train track just added to the uniqueness of this place; nice cultural venue, probably even nicer in summer when the outdoor area by the rails is in use. the concert hall had a very good, transparent sound and i liked that it is rather broad (instead of long) so that many people can stand close to the stage.; we went to brunch here a few months back. it was delicious, vegan and gluten free friendly, and had self serve coffee and tea. we really enjoyed everything and even it was almost too much food for the three of us. will love to come back for happy hour and aperitif outside in the train track area; definitely recommend this place for a chilled evening for drinks or a light meal. everyone is really welcoming and they’re nice to tourists too. you can get a drink and one of those folding chairs and just sit by the train tracks or on what used to be the platform of the old station.

name: Place des Fêtes
vicinity: 6 Place des Martyrs de l'Occupation, Clichy
formatted_address: 6 Pl. des Martyrs de l'Occupation, 92110 Clichy, France
reviews: my wife and i came here on a friday evening to soak in the atmosphere of an evening in paris. we ordered our drinks and our food and they all taste really good. the staffs were friendly and helpful and even translated and explained to us as the menu were in french. highly recommended to come to this place and chill.; food was ok. the bread was quite hard, dry and tasted stale, however the desserts were delicious. there is a children’s play section inside the cafe with more seatings outside (under cover) staff were friendly and spoke english as well. not really much else to say about this place it was really an ok experience.; great food and drinks but most importantly i forgot my luis vuitton scarf there (500 euros) and they kept it a week later! i am impressed and very happy with the great staff and the team there! thank you; was looking for place to eat near to hotel on bastille day- not many places open but this was. not serving main meals due to holiday but did a sharing platter of cold meats and cheese. staff friendly and accomodating, nice area on edge of park, lovely place to sit and watch the world go by with a drink and some food.; really good cheese boards! great wines and awesome customer service. the terrace is really nice but it’s not easy to walk in for a table. the inside is cozy, the music is loud but that’s because everyone is drinking and talking so it’s a cool vibe for younger people. plenty of english speakers too.

name: Patoche - Microbrasserie
formatted_address: 32 Rue des Trois Frères, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
as soon as i walked in i was welcomed warmly by the owners. this was my first brewery in france and they set the bar high.

they have many different beers to choose from. the ne double ipa was my favorite, but the gose was also very good.

to top it off the ambiance inside is very pleasant and makes you want to stay.

thanks so much for your hospitality! i’ll definitely be back next time i’m in paris.; my favorite brewery in paris. visited the first time in december 2022. when i returned to the city this may, i stopped in every night but one while i was in the city. chill environment, great beers, excellent staff. i recommend it to all my friends traveling to paris; this is a very cool brewery located in montmartre. the man at the bar is nice and friendly. they have good beers that you can find and log in untappd. they also have cans for takeaway.; fantastic microbrewery in paris. the neipa i had there was genuinely one of the best beers i’ve tried in some time! plenty of board games there to keep you entertained and loads of different taps on offer. i even got a tour of the brewing operation which was very kind of the bartender to give me. if i’m back in paris anytime soon, i’ll be back here that’s for sure!; cute little microbrewery with lots of choice whilst relaxing playing board games. we visited on a rainy day in paris, enjoyed beer, crisps and chess!

name: Bistro Championnet
reviews:
we dined once in this bistro / cafe and we were lucky to have a nice staff that evening. the owner or the male waiter allowed us to sit where we wanted. cafe was almost empty inside. most of the people were outside. food was tasty and reasonably priced.
however, our second visit was a disaster. their waitress was extremely rude and we were not welcomed and not allowed to sit at the same spot that we sat last time in absolutely empty cafe.
we left without having any dinner and decided not to come back again. there are plenty of restaurants around. so this place lost. regardless of some good reviews of that restaurant, their owner needs to make sure that his / her staff is well-trained and is behaving politely and welcomes people with nice manners, not just locals, but and especially foreign tourists, who might be not speaking french well. otherwise, such rude behaviour kills all good impression about paris.; it was an incredible experience at the restaurant in paris with such kindness, delicious cuisine, and a wonderful atmosphere. thank you for the best bourgogne!; very nice lunch on a sunny day after cold and rain the week before. prompt service and pleasant interaction with the owners and wait staff. there was a small mix up with my meal but what they brought out, i ate and very much enjoyed, so no harm. decently priced for portion size and the restaurant is located at a busy intersection for great people watching and soaking in the energy of the neighborhood.; we visited this restaurant while waiting for a taxi and had a great experience. despite our large amount of luggage and our dog, the servers were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. they brought water for our dog several times on the hot day and even offered to help with our bags when we left. thank you so much for your excellent service!; valentine, the waiter was extremely friendly and welcoming. he made room for a big group of us on short notice. i can definitely recommend this restaurant

name: COT COT
vicinity: Au Garage a Velos, 21 Rue Gérando, Paris
formatted_address: Au Garage a Velos, 21 Rue Gérando, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
been wanting to try this place for a while. we took burgers and the chicken was really good, tasty and crispy and i liked the fries. i was disappointed because i specifically chose the spicy burger for the coleslaw but there was almost no coleslaw in my burger. the service we didn’t find very warm unfortunately. there is bar style seating inside (4/5 seats and a two seat table outside.; delicious food & good hospitality with mohammed , i tried classic sandwich with fries and coleslaw; first off a warning: this is a *panko* type of fried chicken; not the battered kind. makes a big difference.
the chicken is good; the fries are good. the prices are incredible. the staff is kind.
the coleslaw was so so and the sauces nothing special but it's a great place; will go back to try the sandwiches; the chicken here was so juicy and the employees were so friendly. english speakers are more than welcome here at cot cot. if your craving some good fried chicken, this is the place to be! instagram: ricebag101; super crunchy and delicious chicken sandwiches. the chicken nuggets and sauces are really good. and they also have desserts from mamiche. best of both worlds.

name: Okaïdi
reviews:
thank you to marie and julien for their welcome, their smile, their patience and their kindness. my daughter dropped a pile of leggings and julien was very kind without getting angry or blowing as many would have done. i would like to highlight marie's professionalism at 8:05 p.m. with ladies who take all their time or choose their method of payment... she remained very correct and professional despite the hour. good luck with this difficult closure.; great store! very professional salespeople and marie was really attentive to what i needed and ordered me what we couldn't find in stores! i will definitely come back; a very welcoming store.
i would like to thank marie for her welcome and her smile.
who to accompany us for our purchases for our child.
i recommend the saleswoman marie.; i really like this store i often make purchases but unfortunately i put one star for the saleswoman who is in charge of the store at the moment, i visited the store 3 times this summer and i find it really unpleasant, very cold and haughty.; great experience at okaïdi! impeccable customer service, wide choice of products and pleasant atmosphere. i highly recommend !

name: Du Pareil au même
reviews: clichy 92; very welcoming, good value for money, top clothing for children who really appreciate them. top notch staff. i recommend this store ++++ interesting promotions with lots of choice beautiful design.; there is choice and quality. the staff is pleasant even when closing. there are some great promotions going on at the moment.; tidy shop, very clean… i loved it, beautiful, elegant clothes; it would be good for consumers to update the schedules on the internet and in the window! the store is indicated as still being open for half an hour and i find a clause!

name: L'Été en Pente Douce
reviews: love this place. excellent french food, great atmosphere and good service. will always come back here.; the food, the service, and the environment are so so so so lovely. it was such a pleasant experience that i brought my french friends back to this restaurant for our final meal together. highly recommend coming back here because it's close to montmartre but doesn't have the overwhelming vibe of tourists.; accidentally reached this hidden gem in montmartre, 18 arr. ordered day’s special duck confit with orange reduction sauce. it was delicious. vibe is homely. everyone speaks just about perfect english. it’s a happy family run restaurant, at least it seemed so. recommend everyone to go and enjoy!!!; random strolling took us to this place which looked attractive on the first go itself. the staff was welcoming but the two lasagna we ordered was not upto the expectation at all. so we had to leave disappointed with giving the price not worth the food served.; we happened upon this lovely restaurant in june of 2018.  my friends and i loved our quiche lunch.  my husband and i are returning to paris in november, 2024.   we will most certainly enjoy lunch here together!

name: Les Puces Des Batignolles
reviews:
very very nice place. great atmosphere and great wine choices. good for breakfast lunch or dinner. staff very attentive. highly recommend; had lovely dinner there last saturday night, surprisingly not too busy. the staff was friendly and the food was delicious.
my starter was " croustillant d avocat"  kind of avocado spring rolls. omg, it was scrumptious 😋.  my husband and son had the foie gras, large slice with warm bread. they loved it.
and then we all had the "risotto with gambas" which was very nice too but a bit bland,  (we used the slice of lemon of my youngest who had fish and chips ) and then it was absolutely delicious.
would definitely recommend the place.; we walked by at lunch and saw someone’s burger looked great and so we went here for dinner. we really enjoyed our cheeseburgers with added bacon. the fries were also tasty with a generous portion size. my teenage daughter thought it was all delicious.
the background music was fun with a mix of modern and 90’s that had us guessing songs and artists.; the burger was not good..no flavor and a lot of bread. the staff is wonderful and the atmosphere is a nice vibe.; great welcoming, food was stunning, loved the atmosphere! thank you jack. see you soon.

name: Marguerite - Restaurant Italien Clichy
reviews: amazing friendly staff. nice atmosphere. pizza was great. some of the staff spoke english. clean restrooms. good prices.; wonderful service and excellent food! super friendly staff and very warm. the food was superb!; good pizzas, excellent service; i have ordered marguerite pizza here.. the taste was absolutely good and chilli sauce with pizza was so spicy(super)..cashier recieves very well.. his way of speaking with clients was so attractive..environment makes you so cool and positive..wine and alcohol will be served there on request.. reservation are accepted here.. i personally rate 4.6/5..; waitress was very nice, she spoke fluently in english and everything described to us. food was delicious and fast prepared. spritz and beer was cold and chips were a special bonus from restaurant!

name: Le Petit Nico
reviews:
we ate here two of the three nights we were in paris. the server was friendly & helped is navigate the menu. he remembered us the second night & asked about our day, which was so kind.

the food is wonderful! the best escargot we've had. my husband is still talking about the sauce that came on his steak. the only downfall of this restaurant is the 10 hour plane ride required for us to visit again!; our trip to paris from amsterdam was a bit challenging but our evening was made so much better after finding this amazing bistro - le petit nico! the service and food were a perfect end to our evening. our waiter found the perfect wine for us, walked us thru the menu and made recommendations. the restaurant was a very cozy, relaxed environment where we were able to easily enjoy a conversation with our daughter and sil, sip our wine and enjoy the dishes served. we recommend you visit if you’re in the area.; the staff is so welcoming and made you feel almost like home.  the serveur spoke perfect english and offered very good recommendation.

had the best bœuf bourguignon - secret home cooked recipe from the chef’s hometown.  wiped clean the entire bowl with the generous portion of bread.  we also ordered the hummus & tzatziki dip with pita bread which was incredibly yummy.

the only downside is the coffee, i like mine with oat milk which they didn’t have.

will definitely come back for seconds!; had a lovely meal here my last day in paris. staff were attentive, helpful, and went above and beyond in their duties. hummus and buratina were the entrees and the main was a whole sea bass with pesto and lemon that complemented perfectly the tender, fresh fish.; very delicious food, especially the snail dish, a dish you should try when you go there, comfortable atmosphere, cheerful, friendly and enthusiastic service, a highly recommend restaurant.

name: Brasserie Le Moncey
vicinity: BRASSERIE LE MONCEY, 14 Boulevard des Batignolles, Paris
formatted_address: BRASSERIE LE MONCEY, 14 Bd des Batignolles, 75017 Paris, France
reviews: great food! we came here twice during our stay in the monmartre area. steak and  came out perfect every time. while my husband had the chicken and fries and pictured here are the beef skewers. service was fast as well. highly recommend for reliable and tasty dinners! without a reservation.; we just got to paris today and picked this restaurant and were so glad we did. the meal was perfect, the staff were great, and the atmosphere was great. the onion soup was so delicious and well seasoned. we loved our croque monsieur meals, which were packed with flavor and the fries were perfectly crispy. even the salad had a delicious mustard vinegarette. lovely meal for a good price. thank you for the positive welcome to paris!; service was prompt and friendly - spoke english, always a bonus. burger and croque monsieur were on point, reasonable price.; affordable and delicious food. i would eat here everyday if i could. delicious beef tartar; tried it once, went again on the next day. i just loved the steak with the sauce o poivre. it honestly wasn't the best steak, fries or salad i ever had but everything just matched.🦾 the service was fast and nice. the restaurant rather simple but traditional. i enjoyed the relaxed ambience. if you're staying in place de clichy you really should come here if you want to grab a nice steak with pepper sauce.🥩 don't forget the wine! i would come again for sure 🌌

name: Bar Restaurant Le 17
reviews:
the food was good and the service was great.

it's a hotel dining experience so the atmosphere is definitely not what you expect in paris, but the convenience is always nice if you're staying at the hotel.; nice; very pleasant and fast service! very good quality meals at a reasonable price! i recommend !; i had doubts going there in view of certain comments. but really i was surprised. pleasant, plentiful and quick.; i really liked the food, the atmosphere and the service.
the food looks appetizing and the price-quality are equivalent.
the atmosphere is impressive, everything very nice and cozy.
as for attention, i had a problem. to put it in context, when ordering i try to explain myself correctly so that there are no problems, depending on the language i adapt so that it is better understood, i know that i am not a native but at least i try to ensure that everything is understood.
but it is very difficult if they serve me quickly, they don't let me finish my order and they do everything with little tact.

name: La Belle Epoque
formatted_address: 36 Rue des Petits Champs, 75002 Paris, France
reviews:
la belle epoque is a cozy brasserie nestled close to the opera garnier and offers classic french fare as well as seasonal dishes you will love. this is my second time eating at this place but first time eating dinner. no reservations needed as the dining room is rather large. dinner is served inside only and not at the tables outside where you can have lunch or drinks at night. we had the cod, burger, fries and beet/ feta salad. finished it with a creamy scoop of pistachio ice cream. the menu is not in english but the staff speak english and was super attentive. last but not least, the atmosphere is fantastic with music that is not too loud. the building is from the art deco era so you will be surrounded by gorgeous art deco tile and art. our meal with optional tip was 90 euros.; we wanted to sit at a bar and have drinks. they have a large neon sign “bar” and barstools, so we thought we had found what we were looking for. we waited an unusual amount of time before they took our order. the drinks were lovely and we ordered the truffle gouda, also good although the bread served with it was extremely hard. we would have liked to order another drink but the server never returned. we noticed the outside tables seemed to be getting better service. we finally gave up on more drinks and finding the server to pay and went to the hostess stand to pay. others around us were also receiving terrible service.; food was okay, but not for the price.
service was terrible.  maybe they recognized we were tourists and just don't like to host tourists.
not air conditioned so it was very hot in the restaurant.  had to ask for water a few times.  they only brought two bottles in the 3 hours we were there.
waiter showed up once to take the order and not again.  we had to flag him down.
we had to wait almost 3 hours for our meals.  three people waited so long that most of us had finished.
i get that it's a favourite for locals but this place is not at all worth the hype.  there's a plethora of smaller better restaurants in paris.; nice location but staff appeared stressed. food came extremely fast. the fish was bland but the chocolate mousse for two (or definitely more!) was good. by the glass wine was also ok but i found it too expensive overall for what we had.; food was delicious! and the staff were very friendly. there was a girl who worked there who was happy to help select a wine for us and we generally had a good experience!
be aware of thieves though. we had a situation where someone came to our table and wanted to grab food off my friend's plate, saying he was hungry. we were shocked and this was the ultimate distraction for the guy to steal my friend's phone off the table. the staff were also concerned and even tried to help us find the guy who stole the phone, but with no result unfortunately. overall a very nice atmospheric place but just be  cautious of your surroundings and belongings (just like everywhere in paris really)

name: Au Coin
vicinity: 2 Rue Hélène et François Missoffe, Paris
formatted_address: 2 Rue Hélène et François Missoffe, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
love the ambience love the food and love the drinks. a great place to hang out.; got a living spider in the ceaser sald. still had to pay full price ! worst food experience i ever had ! bad servic!! would berer recomend it for enyone !!; wow, this place has one of the best customer service, and food in paris.

my wife and i had the only burger and steak on the menu, and it was terrific. they will cook it the way you like it.

also, my wife and i are from america. this is better than some of the places in america.; the young barman was incredibly rude and made a point of studiously ignoring our table. he turned a good night sour.

after april i went back as well aug 5th and while the service was a little better the aperol spritz tasted a bit weak. revised from 1 to 3 stars.

ah well - hopefully third time lucky...; nice place to sit outside. small selection of dishes, but we'll prepared. prices are reasonable.

name: La Compagnie
reviews: i had an amazing time here. the restaurant was recommended by one of the saint laurent staff and it did not disappoint. my french is limited but the staff were patient to explain everything in english. the ambiance was stylish and cosy. the food was divine. i would definitely recommend and will stop by next time i’m in paris. i ordered the fish, the flakes fell off my fork. the crispness of the skin was crunchy enough but the meat of the fish was very moist. the fish was deboned which made it even more pleasant because i didn’t have to worry about choking on a bone. the dessert was sublime absolute 10/10; very good service. food was very fresh and delicious. thanks!; not warm or welcoming or very good at all. space smells like cigarette smoke--they allow smoking on the enclosed porch, which bleeds into the interior seating--and we could not even get a good omelet. we were the only ones in the restaurant and it was still served cold!; the arrogance of the waiters was amazingly classic french. like i was in a movie! didn’t even get through the front door and it felt like there was a problem.; a fabulous surprise in the heart of wagram.. a variety of cuisine to suit all tastes and ages. for our main course we had the la milanaise and ribs "lily wang", both were delicious.... staff were very friendly and attentive, busy but not over-crowded. a restaurant to return to.

name: Le Petit Champerret
reviews: this was a local to where we were staying. we came here for our anniversary and the hostess was nothing but attentive and friendly. this was our favourite meal in paris.; enjoyed an amazing meal in the most traditionally french restaurant. the menu may have been restricted, but, it was perfectly suited for me; oeuf mayonnaise followed by blanquette de veau and a creme brulee that was impeccable; first in my neighborhood. corsican food, and you can't get much better than this. chef and owner is on the spot, and takes pride in every sumptuous dish. the best  mediterranean in the hood. arguably the best restaurant for high quality and at affordable prices. 40 to 50 eur pp; good but don't have to go if you are far from here; cute spot for lunch in the 17th, had a fresh chicken and veg salad, with a veg and burratina plate. perfect combination

name: Au 62
reviews:
i had the plat of the day. it was really average and not worth the price. i had couscous with meatballs and it was super dry. felt like i was eating only couscous. maybe the other dishes are good.; i discovered this place 2 years ago and whenever i'm in the area, i come back with pleasure.
the food is very good and you can eat on site.
prices are correct
and to top it all off, the place is very clean.
to discover.; very friendly staff
very good quality products
correct price; fresh, healthy, choice, very tasty products and warm welcome, a great address; the best sandwiches and food bowls. everything was delicious and the staff was lovely. thank you so much

name: Il Conviviale
reviews:
booked online with a friend and came on a tuesday and the place was nonetheless busy. but busy in a good way, ie. showing the restaurant popularity.
the dishes were served promptly and were delicious. we both went for a pasta dish from the daily choice of the chef, which changes often and use seasonal ingredients.
the wine was excellent.
and the service was quick and funny.
overall, lovely evening with yummy italian food!; the restaurant and workers are inviting and nice. i don’t even know french but they were very nice to me and help my table out. the food is so amazing! the most authentic italian food i have ever had! i would come here everyday if i lived here! overall a wonderful experience for our first night in paris!; my wife and i ordered linguine cabonara and san pietro pizza for main and tiramisu and dessert au chocolat for dessert. the portion is generous and they taste amazing. the italian owner was warm and friendly. i would definitely recommend anyone whom are looking for authentic italian food to this place. last but not least the price is reasonable, we spend 45 euros.; came here on our last night in paris, the food was incredible. last time i had pasta that good i was in bologna. highly recommended to anyone in the area after authentic italian cuisine.; fantastic pizzas, great staff and lovely atmosphere. really nice place. owner was so chatty and friendly, made us feel very welcome

name: Sur Un Arbre Perché
reviews:
we went for a set menu and a bottle of wine . not sure why all the pillows disappear maybe because it is the summer time. the wooden chair is quite hard to sit. the food is alright but nothing memorable unfortunately. i was hoping to taste some interesting thai french fusion cuisine; very tasty food. beautiful place with unique decoration. very friendly staff.
recommended.; was surprised (and disappointed) to see that this restaurant only had 3 tables in use when we arrived; it deserves to be a packed place. food is unique and first rate, and we had a cool chance to sit on one of the two swing tables. service was helpful, ambience was simple, made for a great night out.; very nice restaurant with a unique decor... very romantic, perfect for lovely dinner; we had an excellent evening here, celebrating my friends 50th birthday! the service is extremely friendly, the food amazing, and the interior decorations very cozy. if you can book the swings (there are four), you will have a night to remember, but it is not necessary for a great evening. we also booked shiatsu massage for my friend which certainly came as a surprise. all in all, a fantastic experience for a very reasonable price.

name: Le Ruisseau
reviews:
omg….best burger i have ever had !

the vibes at le ruisseau are immaculate, lots of tables outside and a great happy hour deal :)

the burgers are delicious and we could tell that all the ingredients were fresh and of good quality.

service here was also great with friendly staff ☺️

je reviendrais !; salad over fish burger!
though the fish burger with added cheddar cheese was yummy and juicy, it did feel a bit common. so let's talk about the salad...simple, fresh, lightly dressed and just what i needed when every 500 meters you end up sampling some delicious looking pastry in this effiel tower city.; we went to this burger place because of the good reviews. the restaurant is spacious and nice and the staff was also very friendly.
the burger was okay, but not that delicious. the flavour was just basic.; absolutely fab. prices decent. good service.

burger filled me up and was tasty 🍔; amazing service, atmosphere and great fresh food and cocktails.

name: Aux Bons p'tits Plats
reviews:
this place  was family friendly with a nice amount of food.
i had the best baboon ever.(they also had some wonderful nems!); very good bobun, friendly staff and at the price - i recommend; changed to a chinese seafood grill, very fresh and authentic chinese cuisine, for connaisseurs.; located in the vivienne gallery, the small restaurant doesn't look like much. but today we have the choice between normal and maxi bobun. so i opted to test the maxi version. and honestly, it’s one of the best bobun i’ve eaten in paris (i sample every district i pass through). it is very well garnished: beef with 3 spring rolls and chinese sausage with well-cooked noodles which are very good. the bobun is provided with the sauce on the bottom and a little spicy. the only thing that's a shame is that we don't have a lot of carrots or vegetables... i'll come back but to try the non-maxi version!!!; choose the maxi bobun😋 and possibly add the spicy sauce.😁
always nice to be greeted with a smile.

name: Le Saint Regis
reviews:
i got the best service so far in paris. our waiter was amazing. he was able to communicate well since he spoke several languages.; was lovely sitting outside having cheese and wine. also had a creme brûlée which was gorgeous. the staff were really friendly, and made good conversation. the bathroom was clean and tidy. unfortunately their card machine wasn’t working but there was an atm round the corner so not a problem. very happy would recommend.; food is beyond my expectation.
dining in here is worth it!! experience french cuisine with reasonable price. we will definitely come back.
staff are very helpful and friendly.; loved the crepes, coffee and escargot, perfect breakfast in montmartre! menu provided in french, spanish and english ingish; amazing food, i didn't expect such an amazing food, the menu of the day looks like regular food, but the flavor of the food and seasoning was amazing, please go there so the restaurant is still there the next time you come to paris

name: Le Café de la Poste
reviews:
very quick service for food this good!  the salmon is amazing, the desserts are wonderful, definitely get whatever special dessert is served that day.  they have a full bar, seating inside and out, seating at a bar, and charming decor.  seems to be a favorite with the locals and i can see why!  perfection! they do have vegetarian options.; this place was close to our hotel and we saw it from the street and decided to come in. so glad we did, the waiter, ag, made our experience top notch. he was so friendly and we felt instantly at home.
we came twice, first time we came around 10pm, ordered a burger and onion soup, both delicious. nice place to relax after our flight into paris.
next day, we decided to come for dinner again since we had such a great time the first night, and saw the same friendly server….he remembered us :)
this time we ordered the duck and lamb rack, both dishes very tasty as well. the wine we ordered was delightful.

if we ever come back to montmartre area, we would definitely make a point to come here :)  such cozy and inviting atmosphere. merci beaucoup!; i came here twice for breakfasy because they were opened earlier than others

i chose the breakfast package and the complete package served with omellette and salad
the omellette cooked perfectly and the salad was also best

surprised with the croissants
it’s crunchy flaky tender chewy in the same time
the best i tried in paris so far

the staffs are friendly n full of smile 😍😍

hopefully to be back here for their lunch and diner menu; the first restaurant where we dinner when arrived to paris. we loved french onion soup and beef tartare - it was so fresh and well seasoned!; looking around for lunch last week in paris,  walking around the area and stumble to this nice cafe bar call le poste,  had perfect lunch of steak and apple tart dessert,  the steak was tender and the creamy  potatoes were a perfect combination.  the freshly baked apple tart was just the dessert i needed with a blob of ice cream and a cafe au lait to finish a delighful lunch in a wet morning around paris. cost 30 euro

name: Un Zèbre à Montmartre
reviews:
exquisite food, impeccable food. real local experience, none of that over the top for tourists decoration. the service is indeed very french, so americans might find it slightly dry, but for european standards, everyone was friendly and helpful. kids were welcome and had the kids menu. all in all fair price and great food. definitely recommend it!; had a great meal at this restaurant.  the service was fantastic, and the staff was super friendly and great to chat with.  i had the daily pasta (pictured), which was fresh ravioli with ricotta and spinach in a pesto garlic sauce and freshly grated parmesan cheese.  for dessert, i asked the waitress to surprise me with one of her favourites which was an apple pie.  nothing like i'm used to with a fouble crust, north american style: the pastry was super thin on the bottom only, and the filling was pureed apple,  the texture of pecan pie with chunks of apple.  the butter in the pastry caramelized for an extra treat.  highly recommend and wirh plenty of indoor seating!; very nice, cosy place. the food was excellent, but i am removing one star as it took too long. still recommended 👌; great food. i would say the service isn't typical for france. we found that being a tourist led to more than a normal chilly reception.; we had an excellent meal here. the staff were really kind and attentive and the atmosphere was great. we speak limited french and they were really patient and encouraging when we attempted to speak french!

there is a really nice local feeling and the prices for food and drink were very fair especially given the quality. we will definitely be back especially because we had the best bread of our trip here!

name: Le Poulbot
reviews: tasty food! i highly recommend duck confit, yummy and crispy, accompanied with delicious salad and fried potatoes. steak was too difficult to chew. onion soup was my less favorite from the ones we tried but my husband loved it a lot so it’s a matter of preference. snails are good but the portion is tiny. the chocolate lava cake was the best we tried in france. service was friendly. prices are rather high.; a quaint and cosy restaurant on a side street of montmartre. it offers a bit of a respite from the crowds. we really enjoyed the soups and stews. they serve cider as well, which can be a life saver in the hot summer. there are a few tables on the street which is awesome for days with nice weather.; amazing service. the waitress was so friendly and really attentive. i asked if there was anything vegan and she was happy to put together a salad with lots of extra things added. it was really tasty and fresh. my partner had the french onion soup was excellent, best he’s ever had and beef stew. lovely place to sit outside in montemartre; we were out and about all morning, and stumbled across this restaurant as they have good reviews. we ordered our entrees for lunch, and the food was delicious. i had the fish, and it was fresh and they nailed it. the fish skin was cooked perfectly, and the taste was amazing. my nephew had the duck, and he said it was one of the best duck entree he had in paris. this place exceeded my expectations. i highly recommend trying this restaurant for lunch or dinner!; loved it here. i'm glad my partner and i decided to come earlier than our reserved time as it got busy quickly! the food was delightful and delicious. space was cosy, intimate, and a little compact, but enjoyed the experience thoroughly

name: Brasserie Barbès
reviews:
the food was good but not great. a bit expensive. the cocktails were very well priced during happy hour. inside the brasserie is lovely and quite large but outside are a lot of men selling illegal cigarettes.; great food and fantastic service. friendly waitress offered us a choice of tables and the spaces all looked inviting (we chose one in a little side area so we essentially ended up private dining!)

our food was all lovely but i will admit by the time i got to my monster of a profiterole, i was defeated and sadly could not finish as i was too full from the previous good food 😅

would definitely visit again next time we are in paris and it was the perfect ending to our trip; we went to brasserie barbès as a group of colleagues during the paralympic games, and it was a great experience. they seated us on the top floor, where we enjoyed a nice view. we ordered drinks and food, and everything was wonderful.

i loved my drink, although i’m not sure what it was called since my boss ordered it for me, but the cocktail tasted great. for food, i had a burger, and it was delicious—the sauce, which was like butter, added an extra touch that made it even better.

one cool thing i need to mention is how we paid the bill. we just scanned a qr code, split the bill, and paid with apple pay, all without anyone bringing a payment machine. isn’t that amazing?

i’ll definitely try to have another lunch or dinner here before i leave paris!; first time in brasserie barbès and i was not disappointed! the staff were friendly and welcoming! i had a grilled chicken dish and it was delicious! i definitely will come back!; great service and very clean and stylist place in the restaurant! i had high hopes for this places after great reviews! we ordered the steak and frites and order rare/ medium but came out almost very well done. steak was tough and the chips/ streak was very very greasy - did not feel very well after sadly!

name: La Crêperie d'Amélie
reviews:
this place took my heart❤️ the coffee is perfect for my taste, and they have 3 kinds of vegan milk)
they also serve good food, bobble tea, matcha and gelato !; the best crepe in the world , that was delicious. we order a nutella crepe with chocolate and coffee ice cream omg delicious. and also we order coconut ice was like i was young. amazing; i tried this place on my last morning in paris and it was by far the best place to have breakfast! the yogurt parfait was made the same day and was very delicious. the egg sandwich was another hit for me as well as the cappuccino! if i ever come back to paris i will definitely be coming to this place!; a fairly quiet place in the heart of montmartre, with quite generous and very very tasty menus. really easy to order your menu with tablets displayed at the entrance,and such a beautiful,quite and warm place to eat.

we decided to repeat and we went today again for the second time on our first visit to paris (even though being 1h walking😂) i will recommend it to my friends and family for sure!

we ordered a bacon smash burger,a hot dog and nuggets both days and they were delicious. all of them served by the staff on table on the second floor.

at last,i would like to thank the person in charge (as he already left when we finished) as he recognized us and gave us churros dessert for free to taste them,really good also.

we were really satisfied with your glad and helpful service and will repeat if we come back,thanks a lot!; perfect crepe for breakfast with fresh orange juice, hot chocolate and coffee - five stars for faty the chef

name: MOB HOTEL Paris les Puces
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
we booked during a long week end with a bank holiday so prices were higher than usual.

we had a big room for 1 night which was perfect. the baby cot was in the room when we arrived, plenty of space for us which made our stay very comfortable! (big fridge, table and chairs in the room, spacious bathroom)

we liked the concept of the hotel: no plastic, nice shower products, restaurant with organic food…

easy to access by metro, on a quiet area with a park close by.

only negative point if i have to mention something: the window on the ceiling isn’t good, the light pass through the curtain.; my go to rooms in paris. a bit out of the way but the price and quality is worth a metro or taxi ride; liked: hotel stuff around was really kind, good mood around, modern and comfortable facilities. there was no problem with breakfast time, amount and taste of meals. room equipment at standard level (e.g. hairdryer, towels, toiletries, ....). restaurant staff really kind, friendly - more then satisfied with services. there could be some negatives about location, but lot of these are expected because of travel references (location, safety feeling, ...)

disliked: during the stay there was no complications but some negative emotions (extremely crowded metro line,...), check-in little bit complicated e.g. 24/7 reception was not working completely - ringing the doorbell for few times, no additional information about stay (check-in around 01:00am, because of flight complications), we paid taxes for two times (first time just for one night, next one for the other two nights). little bit harder to find exact location in the night; very nice hotel with friendly staff and pretty, clean rooms. breakfast was great, also nice that you have the option to have diner at the hotel. the location is good, public transport is at walking distance and outside the busy crowded luxurious paris city center (which we liked). it was nice to be around 'normal' people and not just tourists. there are plenty of shops and places to eat nearby. i would definitely come back here if i visit paris again.
if i can give two suggestions: 1) please fix the shower so that in the morning when everyone is showering the water does not go from very hot/ice cold; 2) it would be nice to have some sort of closet space, since we now had to improvise with the window frame, tables and the floor.
besides that, very pleasant stay!; overall, this was an amazing hotel to stay at and i will go out of my way to come back here next time i am in paris (or any of the places they look to be opening). the concept is wonderful with stylish and chic decor as well as great activities. this is definitely the place to stay for young professionals and style-conscious travellers aged 20-40. that is not to say it is only for young people: i stayed here with my parents and they also found it lovely for a handful of nights in paris.

pros:
- impeccable style
- cool and helpful staff
- almost everything is easily accessible by metro and uber/bolt from the center is cheap
- lively neighbourhood. we did not feel unsafe
- reasonable underground parking (though be aware of the gate, it is not open very long when you try to get out so you basically need to be two people with one driving and one entering the code)
- fair pricing
- check-out at noon
- absolutely wonderful bar

cons:
- some rooms are tiny. there does not seem to be a price difference nor a choice between the tiniest rooms and the more reasonably-sized regular rooms.
- we checked out on a sunday around 11 am, which is expected to be a busy check-out time. additionally, there had been a big rugby world cup game the night before so there were many people checking out. there was, however, only a single person at the desk. combining this with many people apparently having small booking/payment issues, it meant standing in line for an unreasonable 30 minutes with guests getting very frustrated. this would have been so easily avoidable with just a little foresight.

name: Kozy
formatted_address: 5 bis Rue la Vieuville, 75018 Paris, France
reviews:
i’ve been to their other locations and when they opened one up in my neighborhood, i had to try it! honestly, it’s still a great place to visit with friends for breakfast or brunch. they are accommodating with food allergies as i have a severe nut allergy. service is always quick and friendly. food options are great and i recommend all of their eggs benedict 😋; delicious breakfast, the menu has loads of fun choices. cute space - there was a queue to get in but it moved quickly and the service was great. worth the wait!; the food was very good, the seating was nice and it had a cozy and laid back atmosphere.
the food and drink selection was good and they had three special pistachio options.
all in all i’d recommend coming here when you’re in and around montmatre; fabulous food and experience. the atmosphere was lovely and welcoming! the pistachio raspberry french toast was phenomenal and the avocado halloumi benny was very good too!!  the food was served quickly. i highly recommend this cute cafe!; this is definitely the place to be for specialty coffee and brunch in paris. we loved everything about this place! the coffee shop itself is very cosy, service was very good, so you are looked after right away after you walk in. food was outstanding. we had 2x eggs benny with pulled meat and salmon, 2 very delicious cookies, a brownie, and banana cake. overall, a top experience. highly recommended in montmartre, paris! we will be back.

name: Storyboard
reviews: a great place in saint-ouen. it has a nice atmosphere as a cafe + bookstore, which is always a nice combo. the people working there are always friendly and helpful. the coffee is good and the cookies are delicious.; great coffee (we had cappuccino with oat milk), it was so tasty. it’s also a very nice concept/book store. will definitely come back again. 🤍; love this place☀️ great coffee, amazing book selection and kind service🫶🏽; omg the best cookies ever, especially if you manage to get one still warm at 9am. my favourite coffee place in st ouen: great service, great coffee, really nice selection of books, chill lo-fi background music and very cozy interior. also the only ones to provide vegan milk for your coffee around here ! ;) i really recommend this place for breakfast, gifts, and getting some work done in a pleasant environment.; one of my favorite little cafes, one visit and i’m hooked, because books. also this is a great taking-off point if you’re on your way to the saint-ouen flea market. the approach from this side is much more peaceful and relaxing without all the street hawkers.

name: Le Café Qui Parle
reviews:
this restaurant deserves 6/5 ... the place is really super. the service is very friendly, they have a nice menu and the food is high quality and mind blowing tasty. this restaurant is at the top of my list when i am back in paris. absolutely recommended!; very dice place with great atmosphere without a doubt. great for breakfast. so far in this trip, the best coffee i have had in europe. careful... i haven't got to italy yet, so the jury is still out on this subject. a tad pricey i have to say, but everything in paris is pricey... my wife did not care at all for their salad, but the rest is good. i would say, go for the brunch buffet because going a la carte ended up being more expensive although not by much. the staff is actually really nice and courteous.; went to le cafe qui parle for lunch with a long time local of the area, mostly because it had good food and “unknown” to the tourists. i was not disappointed with the food indeed.  both tartare beef and snails were my first time.  they both looked and tasted great!; nice place for a breakfast. came here for a sunday brunch, which included: pastries, baguette, jams and spreads, scrambled eggs, soup, green beans, sardines and some more. pastries were top notch along with the soup. we also chose to take the cheese plate, which included 3 cheeses over arugula and olive oil.
the toilets have seen better days and ran out of paper for a while. coffee is just fine, nothing too exciting.; the qui parle is a tiny café in montmatre with a small but quite versatile menu. this time we were there in a group of four and had the escargots de bourgogne (snails with lots of garlic!), raviole de royan a l'huile de truffle (ravioli with cheese and truffle oil) and the soupe a l'oignon (onion soup) as starters. for the main course we took again the raviole with truffle, tartare de boeuf (beef tartare), and the "la belle salad de chevre chaud" (basically salad with lots of cheese and honey etc.). while i personally don't like truffles, the others told me that the ravioli were excellent, as were the snails, the soup, and the cheese salad! especially the latter was just huge and looked stunning! as for the beef tartare: this was actually one of the reasons why we went there again after having visited in 2017. it was perfect, served with roasted potatoes.

the staff was extremely friendly and very helpful despite our large knowledge gaps regarding the french language 🫣 as for the furniture and style, it's exactly what you'd expect in a french café and everything including the toilet was tidy and clean 🙂

i think le café qui parse might be the one restaurant in paris that will always be on my list when in town!

name: La Chaufferie
reviews:
not sure why this place is underrated with the reviews but my experience was quite nice. staff were helpful and welcoming. i had onion soup and french fries. these were delicious and well done in a traditional french way. wine was surprisingly expensive as i paid €11 for a glass of chardonnay. it is pricey compared to the other places.; cute place with great service and they were very friendly when it came to accommodate our baby. the burger was superb. the lamb was a bit strong for our taste.; very good cafe place/brunch place near gard du nord.

service was very fast, 6 minutes until we got out classic breakfast menu.

croissant was excelent, so was the feshlu squeezed orange juice.; such a great vibe! the atmosphere is relaxed, and the food is both healthy and delicious. everything tastes so fresh! 🌿🍴; good service with good atmosphere filled with relaxing music, wood structures, comfortable sofa, and friendly service. ordered french onion soup, slow-looked lamb, and tiramisu.

name: Plein Ouest
reviews: we had a great dinner there last weekend. we were staying in a hotel in the 9th and while looking for a restaurant in the neighbourhood it caught our attention we could try cuisine from bretagne. the food was delicious and the staff really friendly. highly recommended place to visit.; seafood is fresh here.  it seems like they have a different dinner menu everyday.  would definitely come back for more when visiting paris.; experience the charm of a cozy restaurant with simple and tidy decor, exuding a warm and welcoming atmosphere. indulge in delicious cuisine while enjoying the serene ambiance—a perfect setting for a quiet and enjoyable lunch in workdays.; the two owners of plein ouest are incredible. the chief is hands-on, friendly, and so amazing at his craft! the menu is fresh, well thought out, and delicious. the the wine and beer menu have been hand selected, and the owners are knowledgeable about pairings. the cheese platter is generous as well. i’ve been twice, and cannot wait to return!; we went here on our first night in paris and absolutely loved it. the owner is so warm and welcoming and the restaurant has a lovely neighbourhood restaurant feel, even though it’s in the middle of the opera district with lots of bustling bars. would recommend if you’re looking for somewhere that feels like  a cozy local restaurant with fresh, local food and friendly service.

name: Restaurant Enzo
formatted_address: 84 Av. du Président Wilson, 93210 Saint-Denis, France
reviews:
i love this place and the owner is very enthusiastic and helpful and the chef is an awesome italian dude and the pizza is as close to legit italian pizza as it gets. for real.
i've been there 4 times and i ordered pizza all 4 times but my friend ordered some truffle pasta and he said that it was delicious.; just come back to our hotel after visiting this restaurant. what a wonderful place, wish i had found this on day 1, go home tomorrow. what can i say the food is fantastic, fantastic customer service...if you ever come to this part of paris you must visit this place. will definitely be back again...best of luck 🤞; great little restaurant. has a lot of charm to it. staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating.; guys if you ever get the chance to be here , deffo go to this restaurant  . amazing food great company 🤟; amazing food very friendly staff. thank you

name: Les Oiseaux
reviews:
so good the first night we had to go back the second night. the food came quick, the staff were extremely friendly and the atmosphere was great!
we had the steak and fries, which were cooked to perfection. and the croque monsieur was perfect for my 7yr old who only really eats a ham and cheese toasted sandwich. 😁
we were staying just around the corner, and it was the perfect location to relax after travelling.
will definitely visit again.; enjoyed a late lunch with croque madame and chicken with fries.  tried to order croque poilâne, but they ran out of the bread 🙁.

overall a laid back and casual atmosphere and service.; great pavement side parisian cafe. well priced and good portions; my go to place when meeting local friend. usually for a croissant. a very busy place so sometimes difficult to get served. pleasant family owned cafe/restaurant. prices good. no frills.; was able to sit right down for lunch with a group of 10. food came out quite quick and was cheap,

name: Ho'skfe Brasserie Restaurant
reviews:
very friendly owner and sunny terrace save this far from excellent brasserie. poor quality homemade fries will be offered to you with ketchup that has expired for 15 months. but not expensive.; very very warm welcome and beautiful exposure of the tables to the sun in the morning. very good croissant coffee.; the service is warm, friendly, pleasant.
bar and restaurant that does good for the neighborhood.
you can eat unpretentious but well-prepared and tasty dishes there.; very good restaurant at lunchtime (extra meat), friendly bar, tobacco and lucky games; the team is nice :) in short the best in the neighborhood, respectful of the customers.; takes a break on the terrace very well

name: Le Paul Bert
reviews:
avoid this place unless you are starving and don’t care about what you are eating.  a classic french cheese omelette came out like compressed scrambled egg. absolutely terrible. they clearly do not even have a chef in the kitchen. even their espresso is not good.; we didn’t have food but i saw what other customers were getting given and we got pretty tempted!

however, we had drinks and the hot chocolate was unreal. definitely the best one i had whilst i was in paris. it was well worth the €7 so don’t let the price put you off. service was decent and the seating was comfortable. you can sit outside with the heater on and you’re covered from the rain or sit inside(both are comfy and warm) would love to go back again to try food!

you even get a cute postcard with your bill.; an interesting restaurant. part tourist trap that happens to have the most scrumptious sardines i have ever tasted. hard to rate because the sardines are tinned therefore require no cooking. a double espresso is over £5 which is insane. the french onion soup was alright. ambiance was giving market vibes. i highly recommend the sardines though.; nice atmosphere and very kind and fast service! the gros artichaud is maybe the best in paris! 🤩; visited 15 sept 2024. i can genuinely recommend the place.

ordered snails, omlette and confite duck. all tasted very nice. the services was good  given they were very busy. i think they may need a little more staff.

price was value for money.

name: Le Cabanon
vicinity: 75 Place du Docteur Félix Lobligeois, Paris
formatted_address: 75 Place du Dr Félix Lobligeois, 75017 Paris, France
reviews:
beautiful place to dine, food was great and the waiter attends with warmth and friendly smile always asking is everything is okay, or if i need anything else? he also took the time to suggest best dessert to try.

wonderful restaurant and i highly recommend. try to go at night where the ambience is warm and nicer. love it so much; good service with a smile, we had lunch on the terrace, with 1 main, 1 drink, 1 dessert each, totalling about €38 each.
like many terraces in paris, tables are small but it was comfortable.
note that smoking is allowed outside and you will notice if someone around is smoking.; omg! it was absolutely amazing from the start till the end. the food, espresso, wine and special deserts. atmosphere of paris and france is in all pieces of the restaurant. we ordered snails, italian salade and tiramisu. so can’t want when i start to be hungry and come back for a new portion of the best experience!❤️; it was pretty good
the services are mean though
the food came relatively quickly and the quality and taste were good
it’s nice to sit outside if the weathers nice; didn't know à cup of coffee can make me so happy until sitting under the flower roof in this beautiful cafe right outside of the park. 😍
would the mokapuccino and mokaviennois on the coffee menu make u curious too?

name: Kimsou
reviews: i had inadvertently come across this place on a last minute ditch effort to find some quality comfort food before calling it a night not too long.. and this is truly one of the hidden gems in the streets of paris! upon first glance the joint was really tight for space but they had additional seating upstairs for dining. they have a pretty smooth touch-screen ordering and operating system where patrons can place their orders step-by-step.. it was all in french but luckily that had images with each selection as you navigate through the ordering process! the food, my god the food was a very pleasant surprise in terms of everything made fresh, quality of ingredients, and the service!! i personally enjoyed every savoring moment and bite, but the lasting impression was the restaurant staff. i honestly felt like a valued customer in the way they took care of me despite not being able to speak french. these gentlemen and i’m presume one of them was the owner, really took care of me.. in fact, i loved dining here so much that i stopped-in on several other occasions during the duration of my visit within paris (3-4 other visits in total). 𝒯𝒽𝒶𝓃𝓀 𝓎𝑜𝓊 𝓈𝑜 𝓂𝓊𝒸𝒽 ~an; even takeaway , it’s delicious , price quality and quantity is correct!; it is so good for real every man how loves chicken is right; one of the best burgers you may try. original recipes. friendly staff.; really nice team and good food! definitely would recommend to anyone who likes a good burger!

name: De l'infans à l'Enfant
reviews: very good training organization

name: Enfant Présent
reviews:
good to look for for children preventive nursery; gangs up with dare to place children with slanderous accusations and do it quietly and brutally
i will never forget may 23, 2022
when i dropped my children off at the nanny's house at 9 a.m. and at 3 p.m. they called me to tell me that he had taken them from daycare, even they were shocked that the accusations were false. in 7 months we managed to have our children but it weakened my husband that i left at the worst time... we had a replacement on march 15... he died on june 22... so thank you family killer

name: Nursery School De L'opac - Fernand Pelloutier
reviews:
my daughter started kindergarten at 2 and a half years old. a great opportunity to start the school curriculum gently in a class with a very small number of students. a superb teaching team that is involved, caring and... passionate about their job :-)!
daily monitoring of the children which is very appreciable.
lots of manual activities, stories,
motor skills workshops, free time,...
there is a protected exterior with games for children but also a small gardening area!; my son started school last september (2021), at 2 years and 8 months!! :))) luckily i found this kindergarten, because in my area, i don't have a kindergarten with a very small section. the team is attentive, more than competent, with a very elaborate educational program. my son has not experienced the community (parental leave + health context) and this human-sized kindergarten is the perfect solution! i recommend 1000 times and without reservation!; my daughter entered the pelloutier kindergarten at the age of two and a half. now she is in the middle section. we are very happy to see its progress each year thanks to the team at this kindergarten. a superb teaching team, involved, caring and passionate about their profession. in addition, the director has put an application through which we monitor the work of our children.
thank you élodie.
i can only recommend this kindergarten.; the pelloutier garden is a structure supporting children from 2 and a half years old until they start primary school. the number of classes being smaller, the child adapts and becomes familiar more easily with contact with others. my daughter was delighted to spend superb years rich in education within this structure. many fun and educational activities are offered every day so that the child grows properly. i recommend all parents to come and see this structure by participating in the information meetings. another big thank you to the entire pelloutier kindergarten team.; my daughter has been attending kindergarten since she was 2 1/2 years old, and despite the distance from our home she will stay there until she starts first grade.
