i highly recommend all parents to register their children. the management team is top notch (special mention for elodie the director!), we have access to an application on which photos and information are posted very frequently which allows us to follow what our children are doing. communication is fluid and very easy, we know what happens daily for our children the educational method is really good: they (100% female team) adapt to the rhythm of each child and respect it, while following the program. national education.
the children are happy and that is priceless ☺️

name: mini nippes
vicinity: 4 Rue Louise-Émilie de la Tour d'Auvergne, Paris
formatted_address: 4 Rue Louise-Émilie de la Tour d'Auvergne, 75009 Paris, France
reviews:
mini nippes is a very nice neighborhood shop
the owner carefully and tastefully selects each item of second-hand clothing for children from 0 to 12 years old.
you can find discounted “small boat” clothing at discounted prices.
and also designer clothes and accessories handmade in paris
don’t hesitate to come take a look and follow the news on instagram

i highly recommend; very good quality clothes, clean +++
go there without any problem, the lady is adorable.
well organized store with lots of choices...; consignment sale always with pretty things (bonpoint, bonton, cyrillus, bout’chou...) at low prices. also stock small new boat, books, childcare accessories.; a very pretty shop, very tidy and managed by a charming and very welcoming lady. all topped off by attractive prices. i will come back.; nice shop. well stocked with a good choice of brands and sizes. friendly shop owner.

name: Môme City
vicinity: Bâtiment 274 Parc Icade Les Portes de Paris Avenue des Forgerons,, Aubervilliers
formatted_address: Bâtiment 274 Parc Icade Les Portes de Paris Avenue des Forgerons,, 93300 Aubervilliers, France
reviews: very welcoming store and staff; very fashionable clothes for little girls and very good value for money.; good; ; ;

name: Magasin Les Petits Mecs - Costume Garçon Mariage
reviews:
great experience in this store! i highly recommend!! great welcome, the salespeople are great and really listen to give the best advice. very human! in terms of model, it clearly has a better choice than the other local shops. customer service and product quality really has nothing to do with the others. thank you very much for your help. i will come back with pleasure.; very small store at first glance but with a lot of stock and above all very good quality children's costumes with very nice finishes.
a very pleasant welcome despite the cramped conditions when there are several customers at the same time...
i recommend !; i came to buy a complete costume for my 2 children (10 and 12 years old), we had an excellent welcome and very good advice. the suits are really good quality and very well fitted.; came this sunday to find a suit for my son, customer satisfaction at zero... we arrive first in the store which is without customers and very small. bad luck, a large customer arrived a few minutes after us... the salesman suggested that we try on a navy blue suit directly even though it was not our choice of color. after this first fitting, we asked many times to try another color. but the seller was deaf and offered us a navy blue with black edging that my son tried but only the top.
after that, ignored by the seller, i decided to do what i should have done from the beginning: help myself... and i saw several color models of the size i was looking for: red, gray, light blue... so, i ask him to try the gray and he says no, sorry, the boss doesn't want more than 2 fittings, we're not at zara here! so finished...
i insist because, at the moment, i did not have the feeling of trying anything apart from one and a half costumes imposed on my son by the seller, and i had not been informed from the start of the rules strict of this gentleman... he accepts but this will be my last fitting.
i finally bought the last one because we must not hide it, the costumes are very beautiful and very well cut but the moment and the sale were an extremely painful and very unpleasant moment.
despite everything, i was subsequently able to speak by telephone with a manager who was very attentive and concerned about this problem.; great welcome and advice, i came with a tired and sick little one who refuses the fittings, they managed to calm him down and find him a perfect costume! thank you so much :)

name: Bistro L'Olivier
reviews:
we visited during our trip to paris and first of all the restaurants were fully booked but because we were visiting from the us she let us sit down and the treat was awesome.
food is really good i had the black angus beef plate. highly recommended; delicious food and cocktails! i had the scallops for my main and they were divine. great atmosphere and lovely staff that were very attentive. i couldn’t recommend enough.; delicious food. so warm and comforting - the atmosphere and the cuisine. the service was also so pleasant. lots of smiles. will come back!; what a fabulous find this bistro was! the wonderful, inventive food was served by friendly, knowledgeable staff in a pretty, relaxed environment. everything we ordered was delightful (though try to save space for the strawberry mousse!); i loved the food and the service! the table outside was a bit noisy and has some people coming up asking for money but that’s to be expected. overall was really delicious

name: L'Atelier des soeurs
reviews:
came here on a birthday weekend and this cafe was close to the hotel. we discovered it to be and beautiful cafe with gorgeous rustic and floral decorations, delicious food and very patient and helpful servers. lovely “parisian“ experience.; came here for breakfast as its near our hotel and we wear looking to try buckwheat pancake in paris. the staff were very welcoming and offered us english menu. we had a very enjoyable time as they made us feel very comfortable and checked on us through the meal. the food was generous too.; wanted to give my partner a "dream breakfast in paris" as a 60th birthday present. i'm pleased to say this restaurant allowed that dream to come true. everything was delicious. we were delighted by the friendliness and hospitality of the staff. it was excellent value for money.; i arrived fresh from the eurostar for a 1 night fling in paris. of course i had start at l’atelier des soeurs for their world famous galette but was mortified to find out they were “fini”! how devastating!

i settled for grilled cheese sandwich.

food good.
rain cover excellent.
saw two dogs. 🐕
classic 🇫🇷 spot with ⛪️ on the square.; i speak very little french (i’m american). the server was extremely patient with my wife and i as we tried to order. the breakfast food was phenomenal.they have a menu in english which was quite helpful too. 10/10

name: Au Bon Coin
reviews:
the waitress is cheerful and helpful. food is great! the escargot with their house butter sauce is superb.; this place was really special.  we stopped in after a long walk and found ourselves enjoying a beautiful little salad with ham, cheese and potatoes along with a chicken and rice dish that was fantastic.  wine, espresso and then an apple and rhubarb pie.  super!!!; highly frequented bistro with a selection of bistro style entrée, plat, dessert, and wine by glass, pot (50cl), or bottle. the food is fresh, simple, and tasty. the formula works well. it's a lot of fun so no wonder it is a hit with the locals.; wow! we came here for our meal and were greeted by amazing and lovely servers who made us feel welcome even though we don't speak a word of french. they explained the specials board to us and gave us english menus. and then the food. easily the best steak i have ever had and the best meal we've had throughout our whole stay. for an affordable price as well. the place is packed with locals as well and the whole restaurant has a home feel. i cannot recommend this place more. if you're in paris you need to eat here.

thank you so much!!; we used this place several times during our stay in montmartre - would definitely recommend. the food was simple but very well cooked and presented and excellent value for money. staff were friendly and helpful and there is a different vibe at different times of the day depending when you go. it is clearly well frequented by locals which is always a good indicator for me.

name: L'Anvers du Décor
reviews:
great service from our hostess. the cuts of beef were not the best, and the mussels were tiny. nice onion soup, escargot and tarte aux pommes.; we had a lovely dinner here. if you haven't tried frogs legs yet, i do recommend you try them here. they were tender, delicious, and the price is fair. we also had beef bourguignon which was great as well. the service and atmosphere — excellent. all in all, we love this small and cosy restaurant.; typical touristy trap cost reduction kind of meal.

meal presentation of the photos does not match to the actual food.
- wine was average, escargot was quite tasty, foie gras below average
- frog legs/ cheese and meat platter- very misleading. has some old stale baguette underneath/ soggy salad underneath to make it look bigger

staff service was excellent

still wouldn’t come back; came here with our baby and 3 year old. not too busy here and could fit our buggy in as well. service was warm and friendly and we really appreciated that they went out of their way to help us with washing a bottle and providing boiling water for baby formula. food was nice and came quickly. we had mussels, steak and chicken skewer and all were delicious and cooked well. around £23 per main with a soft drink.

only downside was there was no baby change so we had to use the floor of the washroom.; we went for a late lunch as a group and loved this place!
the staff were super friendly and helpful.
we had delicious frog legs for the appetiser, tasty steaks and amazing white wine. and of course crème brûlée, it was definitely a highlight of our lunch!
we all recommend this restaurant

name: La Villa des Abbesses
reviews:
we had dinner in this restaurant with its set meal. it includes one entree, one main course, one dessert and it’s about €30. the roasted chicken is very flavorful and the crème brûlée is superb. and the price is also very good. we loved our meal here! oh, and the bread is warm came with butter!; our server was very pleasant even when we came at a busy time. we sat at an outside table and enjoyed the local atmosphere. food and wine was reasonably priced and was delicious.; we visited this place more than once and it was amazing! the service was fast and they were so kind. you can tell they're very proud of the food they serve and they should be because it was the best food we had in paris.; a beautiful restaurant for brunch in the heart of montmartre!  if you’re hungry, get the brunch with eggs, ham, croissant, baguette & coffee at a very reasonable price.  the weather was nice, so we sat out on the terrace & watched the world go by.  the food was delicious and the service was great.  beautiful presentation too.  i highly recommend this nice restaurante.; the set meal is topnotch! make sure you're hungry because it will make you fill up your stomach! will definitely recommend.

staff are nice too. 🙂❤️

name: La Vacherie
reviews:
as much as little it can be the place you can always order to go and be sure you won't be disappointed!

la vacherie is a little hidden gem in saint ouen, we discovered it when it opened and never left since! if we want a burger we have several options from the fast food and even if we don't want to go further but for la vacherie we walk or go in metro just to eat there, for the quality of the food and the prizes that are a little high but it's still worth it since the quality is amazing! thank you la vacherie, see you soon!; burgers and fries are great, the place is very small but perfect if are searching for a good burger and no fuss. will definitely go again.; this restaurant needs to update their exorbitant prices on uber eats. they are trying to sell burgers for 20 euros. it is what i call a highway robbery. it's a shame, that a simple french burger restaurant with questionable options tries to take advantage from clients to such extent. i agree with being compensated for your work, but don't tell me your employees are benefitting from your price increase and have better working conditions. absolutely not, it is going straight into a greedy pocket. i will not be convinced that some good reviews for a simple plate, equal a 20 euro burger. not even in the high-end places, inside of paris.

with these prices and the offering, frankly, get a better burger somewhere else.

#realitycheck; nice local restaurant. the owner was super nice. the meat was great prepared and we had nice french fries. we will come back 🤗; burger are okay .. but for me a lot to fat and the meat smells extremely cheap. i even had little bone pieces in it. the fries need a lot more salt and never ever try the fish burger..
the veggy ones are not that tasty, but i love that they have veggy options.

name: Les Fricoteurs
formatted_address: 37 Rue Madame de Sanzillon, 92110 Clichy, France
reviews:
expensive and cold.  looks nice from outside. wine was good but well over priced. avoid.; taste good that is a relief given the price point for the area...however service is chaotic; top!; everything is excellent.
an original and always renewed menu, with homemade and delicious cuisine.
friendly service, a super friendly manager and tables spaced apart for peaceful eating!; very good restaurant where everything was extremely well prepared with great taste

despite a full room, the dishes arrived quite quickly, the staff were polite, friendly and organized, it was a pleasure!

i would happily go back

name: Casimir
reviews: good restaurant in a quiet spot around the corner from paris gare du nord railway station. good food from an interesting menu; we had gazpacho followed by a dish of raw langoustines with ham and grapes. very friendly and helpful staff. lots of outdoor seating some of it covered.; remarkably excellent food! this owner chef is a creative genius. my dinner was superb. the staff is warm and welcoming, to locals and travelers both. they speak english so don’t worry about your french. the wine list has many delicious wines by the glass too. i had pork with a heavenly sauce and fresh warm bread, exquisite. this is a true gem in paris, prices are good for this high level of quality and i’ll be back. don’t miss it!; lovely place behind gare du nord that offers really tasty food and a warm environment. the staff is super welcoming and everyone will try to make your time day enjoyable. i can’t recommend this place enough if you’re looking for something nice around this area.; the food is out of this world. the suckling pig and corn gratin was simply to die for. the flavours just can’t be described.; lovely early dinner. good cheaper lunch menu too. really lovely staff who took time to explain the menu. great to go into the wine cupboard/room to select wine. so close to the station for catching the last train home too. highly recommended.

name: Le Clos
vicinity: Face à la Place Front Populaire ligne 12, 28 Rue Waldeck Rochet, Aubervilliers
formatted_address: Face à la Place Front Populaire ligne 12, 28 Rue Waldeck Rochet, 93300 Aubervilliers, France
reviews:
unfortunately i had an underwhelming lunch experience here recently. we were quite a big group that arrived around 13:15 and the restaurant had space but took a while to seat  us. we ordered - everyone at our table only a main but no starters - but the food at our table took almost an hour to arrive. other tables were served much faster, so there was an annoying inconsistency in the level of service. it’s a large restaurant that should be able to accommodate a busy lunch time service and deliver the food more efficiently but here they failed in most regards. the service was hard to reach and did not properly apologize for the long wait, basically just brushing us off. the food itself was decent but not great for the price. i had the duck breast and it came with sweet potato mash, so it was a tad on the sweet side and the duck could have been leaner. there was no vegetable, only the duck and the mash. maybe i was unlucky with my cut. the price was too high (24€) in my view and also other dishes are priced a bit too excessively for the area. if you are in the area, the brasserie de front populaire just some 50 meters next to it is definitely a much better choice and better value for money.; my husband and i spent a lovely evening here, on the recommendation of the easyhotel staff.  food was excellent.  the service was outstanding!  we don't speak french and our waitress didn't speak english, but she went above and beyond to ensure we had a great night.  would definitely recommend you visit if you are in the area.; i had the veggie burger and i think it was the best burger i've had. everything tasted fresh and was just perfect. the atmosphere and service were excellent! i felt very welcome :) if i'm ever in the area again i'll definitely go back.; very delicious food and professional service👍🔥; food dressing was good as food.

staff were amazing and helpful !

name: Chez Ma Cousine
reviews:
had a lovely dinner at chez ma cousin today! my friend and i had moule frites (mussels and fries) and a chocolate lava cake. the moule frite was a generous serving, and the broth was delicious. simply made to be simply the best and very fresh.

special shout out to kahled, our server. he was kind and funny and made sure we had enough water and weren’t too cold despite the chilly night. seriously i would go back for the food but he made the service extra special, so i would return just to see him again as well!; on july 14, 2024, my wife decided that we should have lunch here. while she was attracted by the mussels dish, i ordered a set lunch with escargot as appetiser. it was the first time we could afford the time to have lunch at montmarte!; absolutely lovely restaurant. tasty fantastic and very affordable menu .5 star .i have  here diner every time i am visiting paris; i did not expect this place being the most amazing restaurant since it is located in a tourist place. atta, oscar and his team were amazing..they were attentive, super friendly and generous..i had the best food since arriving in paris...the flavour of the mussels were so delicious, the portion were so big and could have eaten more if i wasn't so full. they gave me complimentary drinks which  us unknown of any restaurants in a touristy area. i would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who come to visit sacre couer.; very good restaurant when we visit paris we came here few time . i am sure you won’t be disappointed if you visit the restaurant have a lovely diner when you are in paris .

name: Picolo
reviews: excellent ox tongue, probably the best dish i’ve had in my paris visits (more than 30 times!) but dessert was disappointing 😂 very friendly staff and service was fantastic!; casual cafe & bar with great atmosphere ♡ loved live music which i especially missing in where we live. friendly staff too ♡; excellent place to relax with the family for lunch after a hectic morning at the paris flea markets. staff were friendly and spoke excellent english. meals were huge! great blues to listen to. highly recommended by this aussie dad!!; in the centre of big flea market, full of character, with live music during day; outdoir space, it's ideal for meeting with friends or making new ones on one weekend afternoon; live music on sunday

name: Les Fils à Maman Grands-Boulevards
reviews: the vibe here is like travelling back in time to the 70s/80s with decor (cassette tape wall, kid and adult tv series posters and vintage signage) appointed from a time past. the origin story of the restaurant is featured in a spiral bound menu that was provided in addition to the fold-out brunch menu. the formule at 30 euros is a steal. in general, the restaurant offers great value for money. the egg/ham croissant was a 3 for me because of the scrambled egg quality (reminded me of cafeteria powdered eggs) and croissant quality (tough texture). the service is a 3 because the order had to be reconfirmed a few minutes after our drinks were served and one of our drinks was served “virgin” in error. the ambience is fun and the guests appeared to be very pleased. note: the table seating is very cozy; delicious food and friendly, accommodating staff. ambiance is nice as well, with plenty of interesting things to look at. we shared a charcuterie/appetizer platter, with deep fried croquettes of cheese, pulled pork and more, along with some sliced salami, pickles and some amazing "fries" made out of chickpeas. for mains, we had the chicken cordon bleu and some kind of mushroom and cheese pastry. they dont have english menus, but the staff was great about explaining things. give the french ipa a try as well!; on our final night in paris, my mother was really craving chicken cordon bleu and we were fortunate enough to find it at les fils a maman. service was great and we really loved the fun, quirky atmosphere. i ordered the filet mignon (delish) and the cosmo spritzes were great as well!; very pleasant dinner experience - they accommodate large groups with reservation. the cordon bleu chicken deserves all good reviews it has. other dishes are also tasty.; all demands and expectations have been fulfilled. nice chicken fillet, outstanding homemade drinks. we had a wonderful time.

name: Le Ruisseau
reviews:
omg….best burger i have ever had !

the vibes at le ruisseau are immaculate, lots of tables outside and a great happy hour deal :)

the burgers are delicious and we could tell that all the ingredients were fresh and of good quality.

service here was also great with friendly staff ☺️

je reviendrais !; salad over fish burger!
though the fish burger with added cheddar cheese was yummy and juicy, it did feel a bit common. so let's talk about the salad...simple, fresh, lightly dressed and just what i needed when every 500 meters you end up sampling some delicious looking pastry in this effiel tower city.; absolutely fab. prices decent. good service.

burger filled me up and was tasty 🍔; we went to this burger place because of the good reviews. the restaurant is spacious and nice and the staff was also very friendly.
the burger was okay, but not that delicious. the flavour was just basic.; amazing service, atmosphere and great fresh food and cocktails.

name: Neni Paris
reviews:
what a great find! right opposite gare de nord. up above the hustle and bustle of the busy paris streets below, a gorgeous haven of beautiful interiors with delicious food! fabulous combination! all the dishes were delicious. staff were friendly and accommodating. highly recommend.; went this week for an early lunch with a colleague.
location is great, especially if somebody has to catch a train from gare du nord
the food was delicious – every dish we chose was full of flavor and a different experience. we chose tapas style by taking several starters: falafel, artichoke, fish carpaccio, and a side of potato skins.
this was not my first time – each time the food has been great.
the service has varied in the past, but it was very good on this most recent visit

the photo was taken from the window so i could help my colleague find the restau.
for first time visitors it can be hard to find as it is inside the hotel

reservation was v easy to make through their website online; our whole family of eight enjoyed a delicious meal this evening. the waiter was excellent, funny, charming, prompt and made us all laugh with his personality. we had the best chicken shawarma we've ever had and the kids who had the kebab felt the same. the meal was finished with an unexpected complimentary dessert plate.  the best food we've had in paris over our 2 weeks stay.; it's so good! i had very limited time and they recommended what would be the quickest - salmon - and i don't know how, but it was just amazing. very beautiful, very chill, extremely reasonable prices! i wish i has more time and i will definitely come back 😍 it's also quite easy to find - go to the big gate, then up the stairs, then to the left and here you are :) you can also ask for something to go; the whole experience was just amazing, starting from the very professional and polite staff… to the super tasty food! mauricio was extremely nice with us and his recommendations made our dinner even more exceptional 👏🏻

we had the entrecôte and there were delicious, juicy as it supposed to be and just perfect! 😍 🔥

we will be definitely back, as soon as possible 🫶🏻

name: Brasserie Riviera
reviews:
waiter that served us tried his best to communicate in english. made us feel welcome, and was very helpful.
highly recommend this restaurant.; perfect mix of music and exceptionally good food. just look at my pictures. the nems came on a bed of lettuce and mint leaves! this is a real highlight. the barmaid was delightful and her drinks perfectly served with a gorgeous smile.; really perfect and exactly what we were looking for a lunch before our train. huge salad, delicious croque madame, et warm crusty baguette. service was friendly and accommodating. great find.; so lovely place. we went here for dinner, having plenty of tasty food! we took a planche to share and it was really great. the main dishes are so good and tasty, portion sizes quite big. the desserts are unusual but you must try them! the bill was fair, they also accept the yum points from the fork, which is great. people working here were really kind and always speaking in english with us.
the only thing i would improve here is the ambience, as the furniture seems a bit 'older' and way dirtier than the pictures.; great atmosphere. the food was awesome. and we had great service. our waiter (mark) was amazing. we will definitely recommend and hope to come back again soon!

name: Le Relais Gascon
formatted_address: 13 Rue Joseph de Maistre, 75018 Paris, France
reviews: this place is slightly hidden from the busy montmarte area, away from all the tourists. great food - the onion soup was delicious. the escargots were tasty, too. we also had the duck confit as well, which was served with fried potatoes with garlic (wasn't too sure on this). otherwise, it's a great place to hang out. nice and quiet place. highly recommend it.; great experience! really great dinner tonight! staff was amazing and made some really great food suggestions. did the 3 course meal and happy hour pint. overall, really great first dinner in paris; they brought all of our order together instead of appetizers first and then the meal. they kept the burger under the warmer for more than 30 minutes and said it was fresh. not; stopped here at lunchtime for a quick bite and a glass of wine and it was a delight. our waitress was friendly and efficient and the assiette de fromages with very nice bread was a perfect french lunch!; it’s a pretty little restaurant in montmartre serving traditional french dishes. onion soup and escargots were delicious as well as their beef and potatoes and the garlic bread is to die for. they also have fixed price menu and happy hour for drinks. the waitress was smiling and she was quite friendly.

name: Food Market | Loisirs | Événements | Boom Boom Villette
reviews:
the food court has exciting vibe, free arcade game, and yummy foods!!!; lovely atmosphere - for fun and also great for co-working - incl. places with plugs!
great coffee and tasty food!
staff is amazingly friendly and the escape room was really fun!; nice place for food but could’ve been cheaper than this. … the food is a bit costly compared to its taste; this review is for street banh mi at the food market. follow a very good review of vietnamese community group on facebook, i gave it a try to support my homeland foods and restaurant owners. i tried their special “bánh mì chảo” which is kind of double price of a normal bánh mì 8,5€. and that’s already expensive compared to many good banh mì that i have tried in paris. it was very noisy there and we needed to wait a bit long. and the “bánh mì chảo” is too far from the bánh mì chảo that i know. dry, no sauce and quantity is not up to the price 15€. the quality is average. and the bread is under baked, white, too soft not crunchy. i usually don’t spend time to write negative review. i did this time because it isn’t correct to serve average quality for high price.
it deserves 2,5 stars.; boom boom villette is a big food court. it has almost all type of cuisines. including indian chinese thai maxican american african japanese korean and many more. lot of sitting place. drinks also available on separate shop . it is very near to m7 and t3b station.  parking is also available. at basement they have a huge bowling place. also many fun activities for kids. at food court also you can plag foosball and many other games for kids. you can come here with friends and family. it remain open till late night.

name: Manhattn's Burgers
reviews:
i’ve passed by this place many times on my way to other restaurants, but this time i decided to stop in—and i’m glad i did! the burgers were delicious. however, the queue was quite long and felt a bit disorganized, as there were a lot of people waiting to order. the staff were busy rearranging tables, shifting from larger setups to smaller ones, which added to the confusion.

i ordered a chicken burger with avocado, but unfortunately, the avocado was unripe and hard, which was unexpected. the fries, on the other hand, were softer than i prefer. the prices were a little high comparative to other fast food places. despite these small issues, i still enjoyed the overall experience, the aesthetic was nice with all deco and will likely be back.; this is definitely one of my best burger places in paris.
the portion was good and the sauces and spices used gave it a good taste.
their salad was beyond amazing and i recommend it to everyone (a bit expensive for a salad in a fast food place but worth it).
prices were acceptable but they could use some promotions to attract more people.
the atmosphere was good and the place was clean.
their home made ice tea is a must try to; we have order 2 burgers. 1x fries and 1x sweet potato.
burgers were amazing. each of two had different taste and was original. sweet potatos was little too soft and fries little dry but overall really enjoy the food and the interior decor was wonderfully atmospheric and very american; best burger i’ve had in paris - great meat, sauce, and even the bun was 5 star.  and at a great people watching spot if you can get a table outside.  will definitely be back.; best burger in town, juicy meat, amazing souces! and bread was so good that i finished full burger and i didn't feel any heaviness after eating. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Bot Tola Restaurant
reviews:
biriyani !!!!
seriously !!! i think the chef and the owner never visit bangladesh . if you call it's biryani then my name is george clooney . when i pay €9 for a spicy rice with only three piece of meat and three piece of bones of course i will piss off. really horrible taste after eating my tongue is burning for the spice they used. even no salades .
this is the third time i'm disappointing from this restaurant. also the cashier is like he does not give a s*** off the client who came here pay their money it's like he giving a favour to give me food .
never ever i will back again and throw my money to this place .; it was really good taste.specially the combination of biryani with raita and piece of thanduri chicken amazing taste.but the thing was unexpected is price. in the menu they set price of beef biryani is 7 euro but when we went for payment they charged 9 euro.🧐so,i recommend they have to update their menu price .; really great experience in "bot tola"restaurant.thanks nasir vai for your service..; delicious authentic food, excellent service. thank you 🙏; this is one of the best resturent in france for bangladeshi food

name: Soc Francaise D Exploitation Restauran
reviews: great value for money for the crazy bar.

name: Café Kraft
reviews: the food is very good and staff are friendly, i definitely recommend it; dinner was nice, hamburger and curry sausages tasted good. fries where soggy and not crispy or tasteful because of this.; amazing food, fun environment, friendly staff. i want to try everything on their menu!!; we loved this place! the food was delicious and the service was warm and friendly.; we stopped here during a sudden downpour thunderstorm and enjoyed it so much we went back for lunch the next day. great spot with tons of vege options as well.

name: Café Klin
reviews:
highly recommend l!! a really nice café with loads of veggie options. they also serve natural wine and have a great selection of fresh juice and craft beer.
a must to try when you are around republique area in paris. 5 stars.; i am not vegan but i find the food in this little café absolutely delicious. i had a taster meal (5 courses) and everything was fresh and tasty. staff is very nice. you can even seat outside. i will come back; one of my best cafes for breakfast in the morning. an active atmosphere. and their service is good. and a special thanks to the restaurant manager. i will be back to visit again.; cute interior, a bit dirty, the coffee was good. the selection of pastry was a bit small but it was ok.; an excellent cafe, super friendly staff. highly recommended !

name: Restaurant La Colline
reviews:
lunch menu tuned to perfection. amazing service. authentic ambiance. more than fair prices for the experience and quality.; we went here for dinner last night. we arrived at 8pm and managed to get a table. there was a good variety between meat, fish and vegetarian. all the food was beautiful presented and tasted amazing. the service was friendly and the wine was tasty; lunch was excellent!  the chef put together some truly remarkable dishes.

on their lunch menu (which changes) they always offer a four-legged animal, a fish dish, and a vegetarian or vegan dish.

we will absolutely return here, and soon!; this new restaurant opened on 14th september 2023 and i had lunch there. the owner jb also owns the popular restaurant le jourdain. la colline is spacious with a main room and a smaller second one near the kitchen. as with le jourdain make sure you reserve a table. i had the 3 course lunch menu for €21. the menu changes every day and there is a good wine selection. the food was delicious and the service by jb and the restaurant manager célia was very professional and friendly. i enjoyed my lunch and have already booked a table for saturday evening.; absolutely loved my time at la colline !
the food was delicious , simple and very generous for the price. it is one of the best food experiences i’ve had here in paris (and i live here ! ) for the price and quality of the food. bravo!

name: La Brigade - Réaumur
reviews:
yum food and great service.

meat cooked to perfection; fantastic food and service! the meanie is very simple, and you get your choice of meat and sauce. there's seating outside and upstairs, but it's not nearly as large as the opera location.; the meal was excellent and the service was as well.  small, but the steak frites were excellent. sat outside, but an area upstairs was also available.  quick and convenient!; this place is great for a casual bite.  there's a bit of seating upstairs, and they'll bring your food up.  sometimes you just want a sausage and fries, and this place doesn't disappoint.  their pepper sauce is just brown gravy, and it's so good.  if you're around and you want a quick, simple, but really worthwhile bite, then stop by la brigade.; i had the chicken toast, the three meat meal and it was just unbelievable. the meat was well done even if i requested medium rare. so just ask for rare. apart from this it was amazing.

name: Botzaris Café
reviews:
amazing food and customer support. we had amazing time having dinner there as foreigners who do not speak french. other places nearby seemed to have a problem with that and had quite an attitude. this place was both tasty and judgement free; nice, small place, friendly, fast and smiling service. :)
affligem beer is really good, kind of sweet, not too strong.
you can also get food from here, even some vegetarian options. they speak english here. and what else...maybe ought to visit the restroom here if going to the park.; excellent place! amazing couscous and i loved the waiter, funny guy :)) keep up the good work 🫶🏻; friendly staff, who were up for a chat, good vibes all around, the chakchouka that suggested was delicious!; enjoyed an absolutely delicious lunch! we both had 4 hour cooked beef with truffle cream and potatoes. was amazing. and the service was fantastic too, this was our last meal in paris before heading home and was delighted it was lovely!

name: Fédération internationale des cafés des enfants
vicinity: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, Paris
formatted_address: 92 bis Quai de la Loire, 75019 Paris, France
reviews: very special place for kids! ❤️; the ideal place to get together with your children and adults.; perfect for taking a breather

name: La Place Verte
reviews:
enjoyed a late night dinner here.  dishes were good and the portion size was large. so large we took the leftovers home, which the waiter kindly boxed and bagged for us. he even told us it was ok to take home the spreads in the glass jars they came in.  drinks were good to.; nice restaurant, the chicken caesar salad was fresh and the chicken was tasty. the staff was nice and the atmosphere was cozy. it’s a great spot for a relaxed meal.; absolutely fantastic experience! the pizza and burgers were delicious, and the hospitality was top-notch. they were incredibly welcoming and great with the kids, making our visit truly enjoyable. highly recommend for families looking for a wonderful dining experience!; i had lunch at la place verte and it's definitely a cozy gem in the neighborhood. while the initial reception might be a bit shaky, don't let that put you off.

the service is friendly, with smiling staff offering great recommendations. i opted for the salmon, cooked to perfection, and the accompanying vegetables were delicious. my advice would be to avoid peak hours; it's like paradise during quieter times.

overall, a solid local spot... just dodge the crowds. 😊🍽️👌; great little pizzeria. good price and nice friendly staff.

name: Café Odilon
formatted_address: 16 Quai de la Marne, 75019 Paris, France
reviews:
we had a nice time at this restaurant. the pizzas (mozzarella and burrata) were delicious and the desserts were really good (crumble and cheesecake). its just a bit noisy at evening. but the service was quite quick for a saturday night.; i would like to highlight the chia pudding, pudding made of chia seed and coconut milk probably. a nice combination to serve.

the tartare beef is served with peanuts and is gentle in taste. i find it interesting but i don’t describe it in a surprising way. i expected it rawer as a beef tartare should be. the sauce in the starter amazes me and i hope i would know how they make them so that i could try to do it on my own.; we waited an hour for our food, only to be told they'd completely forgotten about our order. the place was being run by two rather aggressive students, particularly the girl at the counter, who proceeded to shout at us when we calmly expressed our frustration about the service. she seemed to take offence at the notion that we expected to be served.

now, i believe "service" and "serve" stem from the same root. if serving people isn’t your thing, perhaps it’s time to reconsider the profession.

overall, it was a thoroughly disappointing experience, and our sunday night was completely ruined.; very nice place for lunch in the front of the canal st-martin. the pizzas are delicious. nice selection of entrees as well.; the customer service here is really bad. takes forever to get served, a long time for the drinks to arrive and an eternity to pay the bill. parts of the order was forgotten as well. cute place, but seriously.

name: LES FARFADETS PARIS
reviews:
their salads are fantastic whether you're vegetarian or not!; very good and cheap food. friendly staff; 👍; i had a sandwich and a salmon quiche.
the sandwich was good, but the bread seemed industrial to me.

likewise, for the quiche: bad surprise i came across a bacon quiche when i had ordered a salmon one... a slight disappointment especially since the quiche dough was much too soft to have taken out of the oven.; having been faithful almost every day i can guarantee you that this place is just great, varied products and very, very good! i'm going to miss the leprechaun! your former neighbor 😋

name: Café Zoïde
formatted_address: 92bis Quai de la Loire, 75019 Paris, France
reviews: perfect for parents and kids 👌 there are plenty of toys, books and other activities that will keep your little ones very happy and busy while you can enjoy drinks and food calmly 😊 you pay an entry ticket that includes a drink, and they also serve pastries, crepes and a brunch on sunday.; our favourite place for kids in paris. so much to do for kids of all ages. art, dressing up, slide, fusball, reading corner. we particularly recommend the musical mornings (free with the entry ticket) at 11am weds-sun. simple, cheap and delicious middle eastern inspired food, alongside homemade cakes and mint tea. our kids have been coming since they were a few months old, and always find things to do now they are much older.  and all in a spirit of non-profit solidarity (it's run by a charity).; amazing place for kids!!!!; amazing café for people with kids, to spend some time and eat crepes. they speak english very well; very special place for kids! ❤️

name: Miliki Paris
reviews:
staff was amazing, one of the best iced americanos i had in paris; delicious coffee ☕️; my best coffee shop experience in a long time! go and discover this wonderful place, fun, calm, design, premium, very affordable, quality… this place is everything that lovers of hot drinks can dream of: congratulations to those who imagined the concept. it was super comfortable to enjoy a golden latte in the large room. i wanted to stay all day and i'm going to come back and discover the lunch offer which looks excellent! in addition, the manager is super friendly, close to his teams, welcoming and smiling: what more could you ask for? i wish you great success 👏👏👏; pleasant places, comforting food, tasty coffee and lovely people.
i recommend, the prices are correct for the location!; but what a great discovery! quality coffee and generous portions! very good granola, perfectly sweet thanks to the honey, a soft cookie in the heart and crispy on the edges...but then special mention for the avocado toast with salmon!!! the best avocado toast i have ever tasted!

name: Doppio
reviews:
the atmosphere was excellent just like a paris restaurant and the staff were kind as well. however the food was not what i excepted it to be, the design and textures are well done, but the tastes wasn't on spot either dry or the food will be combined with something that wouldn't go together, as of my meal had pasta with lemon over it. i hope as well the prices will be cut down because they were too high for the expectations.; quaint yet popular restaurant. great place for a fresh and hearty plate of pasta.
came with my grandparents, walked from gare du nord station and it was really worth the walk there.
owner himself served us with good recommendations.kudos for the great service and awesome food.
will be back if i am ever in paris again.; good food served in this restaurant. products are fresh now meals are lacking flavor and balance. service is kept simple.; delicious food, probably the best tiramisu i've had. they also had a special we tried which was also delicious. the service was prompt and friendly, perfect end to an exhausting day of walking, highly recommend.; starters and cocktails were ok, but both main courses were disappointing.
scallop risotto was very bland and sloppy consistency, and beef ribeye was a bad cut of meat very chewy and gristly for the prices being charged.
lack of ambience and not the most friendly of staff i won't be returning anytime soon!

name: Chicken Street Paris 19 Naan & Fried Chicken
reviews: the best wrap i ever had. naan chicken tandoori was excellent and i didn't want to eat anything else after that for my 5 days stay in paris. staff was very polite and helpful.; the food taste was amazing, the staff was so welcoming specially ali, the food came very fast. you must try tiramisu.; great chicken wings and service! delwar mahmud was very welcoming and recommended us their spicy chicken wings, amazing🇲🇽; update your google hours of operation! if you are not open for lunch on a weekday, don’t say it’s open at 11:30 am. not even open until later than 7pm. 👎🏿👎🏿; delicious fried wings & the batter is well spiced to my asian taste bud. this food joint is also very clean.

name: Hippopotamus Steakhouse
reviews:
steaks were awful. all were well done and not rare and medium rare as we asked. even after we sent the first steaks back. also slightly misrepresented on the menu and not the best cuts.

would stick to the burgers etc if you visit.

wine was good though as were the chips/frites.; i have no idea why this place is scored that low. they do serve really great food, i did enjoy my steak a lot and we were able to order smth also for our kid. the staff was quite friendly, but they didn't have proposed a balloon until our baby didn't get it on his own when we were heading to exit. so while i can see how they can be inefficient, but this totally didn't ruin our impression about the place as it was really delicious and great atmosphere inside.; food was delicious and the wine choice was lovely. i had the salmon and the tuna salad as an appetizer. i had a sweet wine usually served with dessert. didn't catch the name but the server advised it was local to france.; worst place i have ever been in. the restaurant was entirely empty and me and my girlfriend wanted to sit facing the window and the waitress was extremely rude. she plainly said no for no reason whatsoever just bad attitude. she even proceeded to gossip to her colleague while we were sitting pointing at us, and it was extremely inappropriate. food was 90% fat and the rest was digestable.; fine place, very big. nice menu with much choice. kinda like an american burger place like tgi and such. service and friendly and quick. prices are reasonable. food is good.

name: Atmosphère
reviews:
food quality and quantity is was below any level for the price. we didn't check recension before we order, huge mistake. we recommend you to by pass this place.; an absolute fleece! over rated brand and heavily marketed. we ordered veggie toast because the said menu it had spinach, walnut and goat cheese. we got 3 tiny leaves of spinach, 3 poor slices of goat cheese and half a walnut! it was pathetic and dry, not even toasted. not worth the 7.20 euros, at all! and when i asked the employee there, she said she didn't make it and walked off!; not vegan friendly and expensive

*to me, vegan friendly means having more than salad and fries. any restaurant and cafe could say they were vegan friendly if this were the case. a vegan soup of the day would be a stretch but i would take it because it’s hot. also suggesting vegetarian to a vegan person is like suggesting spaghetti to someone who doesn’t eat pasta.; shocking; tested for snacking. we ordered waffles. i immediately recognized the type of waffle: they were the small lotus waffles found in supermarkets.
the waffles are cold covered with a little bottled chocolate and the additional whipped cream is €2.
cost for 2 mini waffles, 1 pancake and 1 pago fruit juice: €20.7

name: Indiana Café - République
formatted_address: 1 Pl. de la République, 75003 Paris, France
reviews: indiana cafe in paris brings a taste of america to the heart of the city. with its vibrant atmosphere and diverse menu featuring burgers, ribs, and tex-mex favorites, it's a fun spot for casual dining. generous portions and friendly service make it ideal for a laid-back meal with friends or family.; service was terrible. we had to ask the waitress three times to get the beer we ordered. i never did get my entree. seems the waitress was taking a mental day off as she couldn't concentrate on her job.; came here after making reservation at other place. they accommodated us, turned channel for us to watch tennis. service was great, enzo took great care of us. ❤️; the food was okay but the milkshakes were out of this world. the staff was super nice and who ever on "yelp" was yapping about them being super rude are karens.; stopped here for a bite to eat while in paris. it was very typical american food, which honestly, was a nice change of pace after a week and a half abroad. the beignets with mozzarella were delicious!

name: Le passage à niveau
reviews:
the food is okay and tasty, although i was not convinced by some combinations. the service is nice and the staff is quite friendly and nice, and the pace is quite good considering the number of seats that they have. an outdoor area is available and is not far from the metro line. the wine is good; great healthy food! the vegetables had that great grandmother farm taste and the place has a great atmosphere. a very nice terrace and good background music to enjoy a great meal.; a little hidden gem in the bissyness of the east of the city
great food and a nice selection on the menu
portions are large and very well priced,
will visit again when i am back in paris
also has a nice terrace and bright seating area inside; super cool place, super service and the food was good. large selection of dishes and good selection of wine as well.
highly recommended; had some time to kill before attending a concert, we found this spot nearby and i'm so glad we did! we went right around 5:30 and basically had the whole place to ourselves. but it was still a fun and lively atmosphere with staff and guests mingling, it made it feel cozy. i know if i lived in paris i would come to this place often! we had the thai salad dish, the house tzatziki and the grilled halloumi with a basket of bread. we each had a cocktail and our bill was still under 50 euro! can't beat that!!! everything was delicious, not a crumb left at the end of the meal. if you find yourself in the area, you must try!

name: Les Petites Flèches Parmentier
reviews: great place for drinks and darts (fléchettes) - very unique. they have a good dart board set up and the scoring is automatic- they use cameras and it is very precise - a screen updates the score for each dart thrown; also funny videos play when you score or don’t score.; the golf game was cool but way too pricy. it’s 29 euros for an hour on the dart board and drinks are at the top end of what you pay in the area; excellent night out with colleagues! we came several time before and after the lockdown. super happy that the bar and games still exist. staff is super friendly and kind. explanations given for the darts game was 300% clear. there’s a few games available per darts target. song the game you can drink super fairly priced beers and cocktails, but also some finger food. highly recommended address in the middle of paris!; such a fun night with friends ! this is cute bar in a very vibrant street in paris. its specialty is that you can book slot to play darts (perfect bar game) - each slot is about an hour or so . drinks are reasonably priced , crew is friendly and cool!; we had a team building here and everyone had an amazing time. our host was great to work with and explained everything so well. the technology used to keep score was extremely beneficial so that all we had to worry about was having fun and playing the games! i'd highly recommend this to anyone as you'll have a great time regardless of your dart playing skills!!!

name: Lou Pascalou
reviews: very cosy and interesting place; friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere; great monthly schedule!; a small cosy place. the waiting staff is nice and serve with a big smile. cheap pint during happy hours. i was told the live music is only on saturdays. definitely recommended.; nice café/brasserie. they often have bands playing, or cinema projections or other entertainment. the ambiance is easy and relaxed.; lived in paris 1994-1998 then visited very regularly 1998-2000, lou pascalou was one of the places i went to the most.. it has evolved a bit since (which is good!), but remains a very special place in ménilmontant, still run by the same (very friendly) person. if you want to "feel" what that area is about, go there.; such a warm pub to drink and have fun. usually there are interesting concerts.

name: Les Enfants Du Métro
reviews: magnificent park with a multitude of activities for children. the facilitators are pleasant and smiling, always ready to help you. unforgettable memories for my children's first camp.; excellent col. vast space and pleasant facilitators. it's really great to make quality colonies like this!; i've been going there for 9 years and i can no longer hug myself, it's so good, i highly recommend it 😉❤; very good campos from god's felt, i loved it, we have to continue and don't remove the puss; great! a big thank you for this camp in poiseux, my children are delighted! thanks to all the animations

name: Les Contes de la petite Boutique
reviews: book received as a gift for our daughter who is very fond of reading. poorly written story and sentences too long, impossible to follow the story.; very nice but be careful delivery deadline not respected order 6/12 reception on december 27!   too bad because after christmas: in theory 10 days after order! merry christmas book!!!!!!; magnificent drawings and stories! a must-have for your child who remains dazzled from start to finish!; very beautiful personalized books, children love them!;

name: Jean Cariel Paris - Spécialiste Cérémonie Enfant
reviews: children need to wear nice clothing and here you will get what you need and want. smatch it!; i went to jean carriel's house today with my nephew. mr cariel and his saleswoman gave us a very warm welcome. they quickly identified our request and responded pleasantly. you will find a varied choice of high quality. mr cariel showed professionalism, sympathy, patience and a lot of humor. i highly recommend going there, you will not be disappointed. it's been more than 33 years since i knew this store; i dressed my goddaughter there, my daughter for various ceremonies. i have always been delighted by my choices and their advice. thank you again mr carriel and good luck to you see you soon; very nice seller, with a very wide and beautiful choice of children's costumes. i highly recommend; my wife and i were delighted to have come from center val de loire to buy our son's costume. very good quality of service from mr. cariel himself. i highly recommend it if you need it for your children.; varied choice of suits and formal dresses. mr. cariel is very patient and this resulted in a very nice outfit for our son within our budget. thanks !

name: Crèche Parentale République Enfants
formatted_address: 48 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
one of the best parental crèches in paris. our child is doing well there and his development is excellent! happy children with pros and parents who follow them from year to year, a new family around your little family. perfect for making friends with children and parents. artistic and sporting activities, a secure outdoor space where children can let off steam. a community of parents to support each other... what more could you ask for!; a stable team of professionals who listen to children and parents. the children live in a small group of 8 which allows them to socialize easily and develop in a safe environment.
the involvement of parents (particularly through on-call services) makes it possible to monitor the child's progress together over the days. the few parent-pro meetings organized throughout the year allow us to discuss the stages of development that the two groups of children are going through and to share good practices to be adopted by adults. it allows you to feel less alone in the difficulties of everyday life.
it is obviously also a very beautiful human experience that is played out and joy on a daily basis!
our son loved this nursery and so did we for 2 years. i recommend without reservation to all parents who have a little time to spare! taking into account the problems of staff shortages in other nurseries, i find that the investment is not that significant.; great nursery, my daughter is very happy there and so am i. the professionals are in a process of listening and respecting the children's rhythms, which is very valuable. it's a parental crèche, which means that the parents are very involved in the life of the crèche, and this is the way my partner and i wanted to operate. i regret not having known this structure for my first daughter, that’s saying something!; my three children went to this nursery. the professionals are great. no turnover. never absent. the parents manage the place with them. so we can come up with ideas. strong parental involvement. but it's worth it for the kids. they do swimming, gym, music. i recommend; a very great experience: our son spent his last year of nursery with valérie, catherine and all the professionals at the république nursery. and even today, we often think of this year which brought us so much; we recommend this parental crèche 100,000%. the investment in time and energy is well rewarded. with our best memories (adam’s family)

name: Big Shop Paris
reviews: super friendly owners, pierre and his wife were absolutely helpful and kind. lots of options to choose from including american and english baby brands. if you're a first time mom & dad, this store is a must shop.; great service, i needed a stroller and nathalie was amazing. she went above and beyond helping us find what we needed. highly recommend this baby store for locals and anyone visiting paris; great shop with a huge variety of product at a reasonable price and a organised manner. the owner was very kind and talkative. i was looking for a present for a friend who's expecting a baby in january and she managed to introduce me the perfect present within the price range i was aiming for! thanks a lot! definitely going back if i would be buying more baby products 😊; i was looking for a gift for a child and i found this big store in the center of paris with many choices for babies and kids, i bought a small guitar and a doll for her, she was very happy! thanks the personnel for the advice. very recommended if you want to offer a gift; the very kind woman from the shop was so helpful to find a gift for a friend of mine. i absolutely recommend this place. thank you for the smile when entering the shop (this is so rare those days)!

name: MemoryKids
reviews:
it's such a great place! toys are innovative, educational, and excellent quality. and the store is so cozy. must visit!; a bit expensive but they have very good quality toys.; superb toy store near république, start of the marais!
beautifully decorated, we return to childhood...
florence gives very good advice on gifts for young and old... she is even very accommodating for special orders to singapore :-)
i highly recommend this shop!!!; a lovely discovery thanks to another mother, florence is a very friendly person who takes care of her customers very carefully.
delphine.; what a lovely selection well presented in this store where we are always warmly welcomed: there is a beautiful collection of maileg and all the cutest things in this childish world (games, books, dolls, makeup and bath bombs). , miffy….). a real joy!

name: CEREMONIE EXPRESS
reviews:
top; very satisfied, the quality of the costume is impeccable. the sellers are very nice. i ordered online and it was delivered on time but the costume was small for my son, i called and went to change the costume the next day on site without any problems. i highly recommend this store.; very nice shop with a welcoming and very patient seller.
i found my happiness
i advise you to take a look at this store.; complicated to get a refund for the item if it does not suit you, the seller asks you to send it back by mondial relay at your expense and will not recover it, the item came back to me, responds to the email that interests him to sell, and the same on the phone. very disappointed.....1st and last time; very good store for children i found 3 outfits for my children, the seller was able to advise me on good products at very reasonable prices i will come back for a next party

name: Park Avenue
reviews:
food was nice and the beer was good. seemed quiet, but i was eating early.

the waiter had a good level of english, all in all a pleasant experience.

only 4 stars as the tvs had different music videos to the soundtrack through the speakers. i can never understand why places do this.; this place would have an overall 9/10 for me.

honestly beautiful place if we start by the atmosphere it is cozy and very nice in winter when you want to feel warm.

for the food overall 9/10,

cesar salade i would give it a 9/10 because the lettuce were too big and the cucumbers too but overall taste was amazing.

entrecote d’argentine 10/10 amazing!

faux filet normand maturee 10/10 amazing

the restaurant is known for its beef so it is a must try!!!

service was friendly.

will be back for sure :); nice place, tasty food, friendly staff, beautiful terrace and view if you sit outside. repeatable experience; stayed at hotel across the road so decided on having tea here. it's an american styled bar/ restaurant. food was reasonable priced and delicious. staff were pleasant and made us feel welcome.; the service was spectacular!!! music was great (we even got asked for our own recommendations!).their happy hour was a great deal. and special thanks to hasan and wessal for their brilliant service!! 10/10 recommend for the atomsphere and fun!

name: Les Dunes
vicinity: 90 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, Paris
formatted_address: 90 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
something new to try and the food is very good, service was excellent. the staff were friendly and make you feel at home.; if you like tunisian food this is a cheap place to go. a bit loud and service was unprofessional. overall a fast food atmosphere, with mostly men inside. toilets very dirty.; great place for great food and cheap. marocco restaurant with grill. staff really friendly.
100% for turist and not; pro: great place to get a good and cheap coucous... you can even watch some football if you dine in. really friendly place

con: if you are looking for luxury, this is not your place to go.; great tasting tunisian food. a little lost in translation.

name: Le Beef® - Parmentier 11e I Restaurant Viandes Grillades I Restaurant Paris I Restaurant Viande I Restaurant Grillade
reviews:
nice small place. very tasty burger and fries.
delicious sweets.; great food
wow desert was really wow!; incroyable endroit! incredible place and the server steven was an absolute gentleman and his charisma and sense of humor was second to none.; verry good food, verry good service, the lady was verry nice and verry attentive to the tables, we highly apreciate her service!; we have passed by accidentally but stayed for funny jokes of stuff and amazing original burgers. highly recommend if you are looking for a great moment and a food of quality !

name: La Forge
reviews:
la forge french restaurant offers a delightful atmosphere with fast and friendly customer service that enhances the dining experience.

the food is outstanding, particularly their french-style steak, which is both popular and delicious. the fries and sides complemented the meal perfectly, and the bread was exceptional.

a highlight of my visit was their homemade wines, which were incredibly delicious and surpassed even the food in my estimation.

i highly recommend la forge to travelers in paris. explore their menu, especially the wine selection, for a memorable dining experience that captures the essence of french cuisine and hospitality.; very nice food. we had escargots and filet mignon and canard. and for dessert french toast and apple pie. crowded, but still the owner made sure we got enough attention and didn’t need to wait too long.; only a first impression and i really wanted to like it but good food accompanied by incredibly slow service (even by french standards) killed this place. the older gentleman two tables over from me waited for about forty minutes between appetizer and entree, so long in fact that he stabbed his steak knife into the table and glared at the staff. now, i don't approve of such behavior, and it was as awkward as it was entertaining, but it was nice to know it wasn't just me who got the service at the speed of a snail. also, the à point steak came out bien cuit. though i will say the fois gras was delicious and the sauces and fries that accompanied the steak were also good. i'll give the place another shot but it's a bit of a gamble to go in my opinion.; truly excellent. noticed some lovely attention to detail such as the pre seasoning of the potatoes they used for the fries so the fries themselves don't need salt. would recommend.; service was okay here (apart from staff insisting on speaking english despite me being fluent in french) and there was a good buzz to the place. unfortunately the snails must have been off because they gave me quite severe food poisoning (3 days out of action). that aside, the fruit sauce on my wife's duck was very grainy. for the price we would have expected much better.

name: Pakito
reviews:
really nice tapas and great vibe at the restaurant! unfortunately the waiters didn’t come out to us at all when we sat outside so it was hard to order and pay - but still a nice evening!; great bar. good choice of drinks. friendly staff.; we stopped in waiting for our dinner reservation across the street. nice owner and a very casual place to have a beer or wine.  tapas we had were ok...could do with fresher bread.; the place is lively as are the bar staff. a little too busy doing shots and eating more than serving but they were very friendly.; nice food but not amazing quality.
atmosphere is nice

name: Les Trois Frères
reviews:
ainis you’re the best! give this man your money! and some pastries. sorry i didn’t get to visit one last time. will return. merci for everything! 💜; amazing local restaurant with great service! had a pleasant talk with the waitress (in french and german). hope to come again here!; staff: super cordial, smiling and available. a bit in difficulty with the many clients but not excessively to say it took time to prepare dishes, or take orders.

cleanliness: service was very clean

quality of dishes/sides/drinks: everything looked lovely and my dish was absolutely amazing. great wines. not much choice of dishes but for me this is great.

price: prices are really good. only fyi is that no checks are accepted (like most of france by now) and cb over 15 euros.

fanciness: i wouldn't call it fancy but it's extremely cozy, beutiful, and authentic. which is what you like to see in paris.

view/location: not much view except for the inside which is nice. nice church nearby.

extra-services/curiosities: n.a.; food was great, staff was even better. made our group of canadians feel welcomed and like we were home. fun and engaging conversation with our waiter all night. highly recommended.; if you’re looking for good food somewhere unpretentious and welcoming in paris, this is the place to go. as walk-ins, we were warmly greeted as soon as we arrived, and seated quickly. even though we only spoke basic french, this was a complete non-issue. the service was wonderful, very friendly and fast. the home style food was hearty - i had the vegetarian couscous while my partner had the beef.

name: Le tablier rouge
formatted_address: 40 Rue de la Chine, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
delicious food served in this restaurant. menu is kept simple with a handful options (none suitable for vegetarians). staff is nice and welcoming. restaurant has a few table but quite popular so would recommend booking.; highly recommend ! good service, high quality food, super yummy!; super good food and excellent service. the advice about wine was on point, the dishes delicious and the little outdoor area is really nice in summer time.
i can only recommend this place; this was the first restaurant my son and i visited while in paris... very small, intimate, and amazing.

we started dinner with a glass of their house champagne, which was perfectly dry and balanced.

they offered a 3 course option at a very reasonable price.. and the hostess was able to guide us to the perfect wine to pair with all of our courses.

the food was perfect and simple, with spanish flair to classic french cuisine. i would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an amazing experience with parisian cuisine.; a very cozy and classy restaurant specialising in more than good service and quality. this is the restaurant where they know your name. there is the family atmosphere which makes it feel even closer. it epitomises "enter as a customer, leave as a friend. food is fantastic, good seasonal menu with a good wine selection. it was champagne for me as i celebrated my birthday.

name: Numidia Ménilmontant
reviews:
first time trying algerian food and it’s much better than i expected. we order grills, spicy and sweet dish, they all come out well. the sweet dish with lamb is really good and the meat is super tender. the selection of meat for grilling are quite wide and the organs are also good.; the staff is great.
the meat is magical. it melts under your tongue.
the atmosphere is very lively and friendly.
thank you so much. we will be back!; where do i start? food is amazing and very affordable and staff is adorable 😍
i highly recommend !!; super atmosphere with good old algerian music, the food was excellent hands down, the server yousef was welcoming and very helpful. definitely recommend the couscous and tiramisu oreo it was a delight.; we had tajine lamb with almonds and apricots and the meat was fall off the bone. we had an assortment of skewers and everything flavored deliciously. i would like to try the potatoes and soup next time but i was so full off the meat. really friendly staff and cute atmosphere.

name: Musa Oberkampf
reviews:
i honestly thought the food was lacking in flavor and had very high expectations based on all the reviews i saw. the dish that saved it was the dessert. great atmosphere though! i highly recommend coming for drinks only. the staff is extremely knowledgeable.; incredible cocktails! mehdi was so kind and creative with the drinks he offered us. the ambiance is chill at the beginning of the night and you might just end up dancing with your neighbour at the end of the night. food is so fresh and delicious. we keep on going and loving this place!
best espresso martini i’ve had so far!; fabulous place. loved the food and it was such a funky vibe. really busy but the one waiter and barman seemed to handle with ease and a friendly smile ! thank you 🙏; delicious food, the cocktails were amazing and the space super lovely. as a vegan it was easy to find suitable options for me, while my friend could enjoy other food as well.; what a gem! delicious menu (both food and drinks), cozy ambience, friendly service. so glad we stopped by!

name: La Belle Epoque
reviews: great tajine and couscous. friendly staff; a friendly place in the 18th: delicious pizzas and couscous like in the countryside; the mint tea is incredible and rachid always has a smile. absolutely worth discovering 😘; i often go there with my brothers and friends, the manager is a good, friendly person, the food is so good, lots of choice, good luck.; friendly place where you eat delicious couscous at a reasonable price. i recommend!; very good pizzas made by chef rachid, always in a good mood! it also makes very good ti punches!

name: L'imprévu
formatted_address: 30 Bd de Bonne Nouvelle, 75010 Paris, France
reviews:
had a few  drinks and a camamber röti. everything was good and delicious. heart warming handsome chef kindly offered us delicious tekilas for the closing ceremony and it was perfectly delicious too. thank you, we will definitely come back again!; nice restaurant with a cute terrace and a view on one of paris corners.
excellent service and very kind staff!
the food is good: grilled halloumi for appetizers was excellent!
the lentils salad is good! i would have suggested some small potato pieces.
the chicken normande is juicy and delicious.; my american bestfriend wanted us to have a good brunch!

we actually enjoyed every second of it.

the foamy cappucino and fresh orange juice were so good!!

i ordered the nutella pancakes & she ordered the eggs benedict bacon.

excellent !

very kind staff and a nice view of the chef live cooking in front of us!

atmosphere could be less loud on a sunday :) .; nice food and adorable prix with thefork promotion. i highly recommend this restaurant, especially cordon bleu maison.; great spot for brunch & espresso. didn’t want burgers & fries so came here for some french flair. was not disappointed at all. food was wonderful and service was good. really enjoyed sitting outdoor with a bit of breeze and observing the people walk pass. paris really lives up to the outdoor cafe ambiance. prices are very reasonable

name: Aux Ours
reviews:
maybe this is not the best place for a family but we tried our chances. this is more of a couples/groups place rather than family. burgers were tasty, service was sufficient, but as i said, the atmosphere is not for a family with children. anyway, we were greeted well, ate well and left the place with a fulfilled hunger.; horrible service. no one came to take my order nor did the waiters acknowledge me to let me know they will be with me.

the restaurant was not busy.; this place was recommended to us by different friends so we really had to try it our! we went there for lunch and the next day again for breakfast. the place has really nice ambiance and all the food is really good! the service was kind too. 10/10 :); even though they barely spoke english, the staff was very receptive and managed to provide a great service.

we had great food, with very big portions, and a couple of drinks with friends. a very good experience overall.; very good lunch, a sunny day, a street in paris, affordable menu...say no more.

name: Au Comptoir Du Temps
reviews:
a local hangout with televised sports. we tried the draft affligem and a pina colada.  beer was cold and refreshing while the cocktail was very sweet. ordered the large regina pizza to share. it tastes great with beer.  place was packed with football fans watching the european cup matches.  had a good time.  i say check it out for a quick bite.; excellent quality food! delicious food and friendly staff!; great staff and service. lovely apple pie great tea and coffee; very conveniently located next to cité des sciences et de l'industrie. staff was nice and provided 2 booster seats for my kids.
kids enjoyed the kids menu (10 eur) with breaded chicken, fries, juice and applesauce. enough qty in 1 menu to feed my 2 boys.
i enjoyed my italian salad. large qty as well and good taste; i was looking for a nice and pleasant place to have meal near my rent flat and i found that restaurant. very responsive service, tasty food, nice atmosphere, big portions. highly recommend that place, staff speaks english very well

name: Arkose Pantin
reviews: great place if you’re a pro or just a beginner. lots of different paths that keep changing frequently. friendly staff and cool atmosphere; really interesting spacious indoor climbing from entry level to black panther level. the staffs are friendly and lively. awesome experience !!; one of my favorite climbing gyms in paris. it is very busy, but the people are just simply so friendly, the food and beverage options are awesome, and the boutique is second to none when it comes to getting climbing gear in a climbing gym.; cool more intimate place, like the routes a lot, friendly staff; good bouldering and rope climbing gym. can be challenging to reach for non locals

name: Chez Papa
reviews:
the food was really good and the waiters are very friendly. i had steak with mushroom souse and ipa beer. they even let me taste beer before ordering.; we enjoyed our choice of meal for the last night in paris.  for starters, we had snails with parsley, and charcuterie board, steak with mushroom sauce for our entree and apple tart and cremé bruleé with espresso double; came in for lunch on the last day of 2018 right before i had to catch the coach to london at gallieni. the staff were so kind and wonderful despite my inability to communicate with them in french, and even gave me an extra piece of foie gras and wished me a happy new year. (i’ve been hunting for pan fried foie gras in paris and i finally found it! it’s my favourite dish of all time, so this is extra special!) so wonderful and excellent service, will definitely return the next time i’m in paris! thank you guys for putting a huge smile on my face on my last meal in paris! 😘; the waiters were really accommodating and understanding about our lack of french. the food was delicious and such a good price for paris.

would absolutely recommend, especially the veal cutlet and the massive creme brulee (shown)!; in a nutshell, disappointing or underwhelming.  first the highlights... the baguette - superior, the escargot - no bad just slightly weird (unconventional) that 6 escargot arrived in a 12 piece dish.  nevertheless, i liked the fact the escargot weren't garlicky instead simple without cheese... mainly pesto.  the veal was also tender; hence properly prepared.  the real disappointment was the cream sauce and the scalloped potatoes. cream sauce was not all the creamy and either the sauce or the potatoes were ladened with salt (almost inedible).  would not return if i'm ever back this way.

name: Melting Pot Food Court
vicinity: 43 Avenue du Général de Gaulle, Bagnolet
formatted_address: 43 Av. du Général de Gaulle, 93170 Bagnolet, France
reviews:
a family friendly restaurant which offers a large choice of different meals coming from all over the world for all kind of tastes. the milkshakes & cocktails are extremly good, as well as the deserts! the decoration of the restaurant is very original.; this is a value for money place, good food with good pricing. it’s near our hotel and closes late so we always drop by here for dinner after a long day of sightseeing. serves a variety of cuisine and it’s a chill place. choose from the self serve terminal, take a table number tent and pay.  they accepts cash at counter too!; it’s a nice place for us as tourists who ate their breakfasts here!
the egg sandwich was very delicious but there’s room to improve the coffee and tea!

the staff are nice and friendly!
the menu is good!
the place and the jazz music is just lovely!
