the price is good as well!; food is very good, basic dishes but well made, the staff is absolutely delightful. always a smile and doing their best to give you a great experience. the place is clean, including toilets, we've stayed here for hours without being bothered by anyone, waiting for our flight home. we'll be back.; what a great place for having lunch or dinner, our hotel is just a walking distance from this food court and we have just finished the day trip and was hungry.

the food court catered several restaurants from italian, thai and indian ect.

order is very easy with some tablets for ordering food and drinks just after the entrance. not ling our order is done and the staff will bring it to your table.

our food taste great and with a huge portion to.

nice and clean interior with friendly and helpfull staff.

name: La table de yemma
reviews:
excellent home made algerian food. variety of choices fish, mea5 or vegetarian. to be tried !  sorry for the photos but i ate everything 🤣; title: incredible experience at la table de yemma

"i recently dined at la table de yemma, and i have to say it was an outstanding experience. the food was absolutely delicious—every dish was packed with authentic flavors and tasted fresh. the service was top-notch, with attentive and friendly staff who made sure everything was perfect. the cleanliness of the restaurant added to the overall comfort, making it an enjoyable place to eat. if you're looking for amazing food and excellent service in a welcoming atmosphere, i highly recommend this place!"

would you like any changes to this?; when we arrived there was a large queue outside the restaurant; we soon found out why.

the food is excellent, the ambiance is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and hard working. it was also the cheapest meal we had in our stay in paris.

an absolute must-visit.; very good atmosphere and delicious algerian food 👌; great experience! we loved the atmosphere and the welcoming team! the food was just excellent! we will definitely come back to this place the next time we are in paris again. 💕☺️

name: Le Patio
reviews:
a lovely restaurant with wholesome food and impeccable service. all round a wonderful experience. dessert was delicious too!; very nice place for a delicious food and wine!; the service was implacable and the food was very good. we can’t wait to come back.; very good place for a typical french bistro lunch. the waiter was very helpful translating the menu and we all had lovely food. the thai steak was amazing - very good sized portions and delicious; je le fais en anglais pour adriana et sutha le chef:
they are first of all the kindness you will never find in the city of love, paris. but here the love in serving you to the good food you eat without being ripped off!  please try the mille feuilles chèvre-betterave and salmon tartare with mango and …..
just go there and meet adriana who is at the bare and taking care of everything with kevin. do not miss this place in paris!

name: Monique & Myrtille
reviews: very good food (with great veggie options), great service, very cosy! definitely recommend; the best cozy ambiance, service and quality products make this place my favorite coffee shop and cantine. i discovered this wonderful place in novembre 2021, so its has been already several years of good experiences.; great staff, very good espresso, cozy ambiance, normal prices; tb; delicious 👌

name: CLINT Roquette
formatted_address: 174 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
from the coffee to the food in this restaurant, all the food is incredibly good and delicious, especially the staff have a continuous smile on their faces, it's nice to talk and you have to feel comfortable to eat.   everyone here is incredibly sweet people.   everyone should come and eat at least once; very crowded but staff still smiley and friendly. burgers are nice, sweet potatoes are better than bacon cheese imo (tad too salty).; very yummy brunch. i have been there twice and will go again & again. i truly love their coffee latte!; a family of four for late lunch, everyone very happy. even the limonade and the coffee was good. merci; it felt a bit like being back in melbourne 🇦🇺
friendly stuff in a way that is not common in paris(they even adj your name - apparently for no reason but better feels nice 🤣)

good job on branding.

thé food is as it should be. 😊

name: Chicken Rapido
reviews:
pleasant servers. however, the food is not good: cold bread, cold and not well-cooked fries, meat that is far too salty and a price that seems unreasonable given the quality of the dish.; worst greek meat and fries are hard very small portion. the staff gives prices depending on the person, they made me pay €11 for greek without raw vegetables even though that was not the base price. the tacos are dry and the cheese sauce is not good.
i really don't recommend, avoid!!!; best greek in the neighborhood where i go very regularly. the staff is very friendly and always attentive to sandwich modifications or possible supplements.
i recommend.; i've never made an opinion but i have to do one, it's the worst tacos i've eaten in my life, barely cooked fries with an ungenerous portion, the meats really not quality , the dry cheese sauce

i really don't recommend; a 4/10 for the kebab. acidic sauce, tired salads, lack of onions, chewy gum bread. the cordon bleue was soft. it gave me a stomach ache. 10€ for that.. too bad 😕

name: Café Le Papillon
reviews:
our first night in paris was raining and cold but le papillon was warm and inviting. the food was delicious. classic french menu available but establishment is very english friendly. perfect first vacation dinner!; i bump into this place because it’s close to where i’m staying and the reviews were not wrong.
this restaurant has a great atmosphere and the food is amazing. the waitress, pierina, and the bartender were super nice and the food was incredible.
i’ll be back for sure :); nice place, great food and pierina is the best server. she is very professional and will give you the best customer service experience.; the hostess was so nice! we don’t speak french but she was very helpful since one of us has allergies. the atmosphere was incredible and the food was delicious. our hostess was the star of the show, she was so kind, we found out she could speak spanish as well so it made it easier. great place in the 20th and super friendly to tourists. drinks were a great price especially during happy hour and were made very well!; the food was soooo good. i had the clasic burger and it was delicious.

name: Le Petit Magnolia Café
formatted_address: 52 Rue de Terre Neuve, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
good prices for beer.; friendly staff and good service; second time for us. the first was in romantic mode, we liked it so much that we invited friends and we were not mistaken!

we had an extremely friendly time, with incredible dishes (the lamb shank is really killer!). the service, once again, top notch, it’s so pleasant, you feel like you’re among friends. ares is great, he makes you feel at home, with a big smile, and nordin manages it so well that you don't even realize the wait.

all the little details are well taken care of, there are no pretensions but only great work: classic, generous plates (very!), a super friendly atmosphere, with regulars, beautiful wines, and we rarely saw a glass of prosecco so full at such a price. honestly, a gem! there is a family spirit which is enormously pleasing, when we see the table being filled with beautiful things (royal couscous, lamb shank, fondue) and the smell of good, well-spiced food takes over, at the same time. first bite all the senses are satisfied. we definitely recommend it and we will come back and come back, especially when the sunny days begin, because their terrace is very nice. it’s really the cuisine we love!; the waiter is very sexy, welcoming, smiling and does pole dancing after midnight, he lights the fire like johnny in those crazy years, not to be missed, especially the rotit camembert which looks more like a roasted quarter-rembert🧀; the welcome is friendly.
but the starters and desserts, nor the drinks, for that matter, the prices are not indicated anywhere, i did not have a menu. i had mushrooms as a starter, a well-stocked plate but disappointed to find that they were canned mushrooms and they were very spicy, there was a lot of pepper. i don't like pepper, why not add a pepper shaker to the table to add pepper (or not). at our convenience. there was a fried egg with it (nobody mentioned it to me), very nice, but the texture of the egg white was very strange (i had never eaten an egg of this texture).
i tried my friend's dish which i didn't like either. the fries tasted very strange, the breaded chicken also had a suspicious taste, the breading is much too thick, it doesn't even taste like fried food. so i didn't take anything else. the only good thing was the bread. the atmosphere is nice with a playlist of youtube clips on a tv despite the advertising. the waiter at reception is nice, but too bad i won't go back there again

name: Le Café Sans Nom
formatted_address: 57-59 Rue de la Réunion, 75020 Paris, France
reviews:
amazing ambiance of this cute cafe. we had breakfast here and even tho we didn’t know french the server was very polite and respectful. the cafe has variety of posters all around and a library vibe to it. don’t forget to check out the toilet as well lol!; this was an amazing experience. a croissant 🥐 that has just been made, a very fresh orange juice, a generous eggs portion and a strong coffee. the perfect way to start the day. the person who took our order was super nice and spoke to us in english.

overall, 10/10; really everything is great and the service is excellent. every traveler should try it.; located on a wonderful square, this is a vibrant and friendly spot. the food is delicious, the service is friendly and there's sometimes live music which adds to it all. the perfect spot to while away a few hours with cards and a beer!; unfortunately, they don’t handle any hot water requests after 6 pm. you could still make tea, as it doesn’t make much of a mess.

name: CAFÉ CHARLOTTE
reviews:
great cafe/bistro
i had the lunch menu which was delicious and fairly priced.the staff was also very nice and helpful (i was on crutches because on an injury, so they helped me with my bags/to set up, which was kind).
overall a really nice atmosphere :); amazing food, great service, cozy dinner atmosphere. i dined here alone, harrison was not only a great waiter but also good company. highly recommend; good « formule » (plat et dessert for 15€). loved the cheese burger with cheddar cheese. service was friendly and relatively fast. good red wine by the glass. tasty chocolate fondant. overall a good option to eat near pére lachaise cementery.; a fantastic address in paris with great staff and awesome food. highly recommended; this was a nice cafe with a clean bathroom.  however, i found that the coffee was less tasty and a bit more expensive than other cafes in the area.  the employees were very nice and this review is only representative of the coffee (not so great) and service (great!).

name: Café Méricourt
vicinity: 22 Rue de la Folie Méricourt, Paris
formatted_address: 22 Rue de la Folie Méricourt, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
a good place to get breakfast food.

it was pretty hot inside of the restaurant so we opted to sit outside.  the avocado toast had many herbs and picked red onion on top. the brioche sandwich with avocado and crispy bacon was delicious. the bun was fresh and the avocado was perfectly ripe. it also had a spicy jam in the sandwich which made it more interesting.
the menu is not large but it had savory and sweet breakfast options. the only downside is that we didn’t enjoy the coffee.; friendly and welcoming service! the coffee is smooth—highly recommend the latte.

the fresh orange juice and avocado toast with a soft-boiled egg are also great choices. the shakshuka is flavorful, though the bread was slightly hard and overdone.

a lovely spot for brunch in a charming neighborhood.; great brunch cafe with friendly service! i enjoyed trying their green eggs (turkish eggs) and a flat white. the egg dish was very flavorful with unique tasting profile. the bread that came with it is very good too!; i have absolutely no notes for this place.
the avocado toast is to die for. excellent atmosphere,  low key french music to accompany your food.; one of the best coffees in paris. i live around the corner and i feel super lucky! food is really good. a great place for brunch or afternoon good quality coffee with a treat. the owner and waiters are lovely. 100% recommended. — on weekends count on a 20-30min wait. they have a qr waiting list so you don’t need to wait in line.

name: La Trockette Café-Atelier
formatted_address: 125 Rue du Chemin Vert, 75011 Paris, France
reviews: great little thrift store. it was a little bit scattered and messy, and felt a bit overpicked but a good find, none the less. the notions and books were "name your price" at the time i was there. great deal.; the best place for low cost goods and exchange or for donate your own goods to give them a second life! eco friendly ! come to see it !; super association, bel esprit.; cosy&friendly. loved it!; ok

name: Le Petit Bonheur - la cantine des Lilas
formatted_address: 184 Rue de Paris, 93260 Les Lilas, France
reviews: such a lovely experience with super polite service from the waitress !!; grey hair women who is rude! maybe not liking my colour of skin (asian) i went twice and she ignored me. the others were embarrassed but didn't come forward.. information your charity fridge is filthy... what a shame. it is such a good idea!!😴; good food n good drinks bubble tea and great service would love to visit again; nice drinks; it's worth sticking together a little to eat because you won't be disappointed by the quiches and dishes. maybe a little more generosity on the slice of dessert tart, shortcrust pastry and very good citrus almond mixture.

name: LE GAMBETTA Bagnolet
reviews:
absolutely incredible spirit. everything here feels like a family, the customers and the staff are united in such a beautiful way. i have been given free cake from one of the customers for his daughter’s birthday. the bartender has been very kind and helpful as well. food is great. great value. i just love this place. very different experience from the cold parisian bars.; a radiant space where human and professional warmth diffuses a sparkling mirror whose consumption is of exceptional quality, good flavor and a unique taste.
couscous is a treat packed with a host of irritable nutrients. only happiness and bravo!
it's worth a lot of detours.
hamid bagnolet on october 3, 2024.; i have seen a change in this brasserie, the dishes are good, the restaurant is clean and the team is very warm.; my daughter brought me a couscous from this restaurant. honestly delicious 🤤 typical kabyle couscous and really well served.  we will definitely return; i love this place ! we feel good there...
everyone is friendly, and it’s cosmopolitan. sometimes concerts are given and it’s great!
bistro cuisine, good couscous, and on saturdays grilled sardines with excellent fries!!!
thank you mr. cook! !!

name: Bistrot des Familles
formatted_address: 68 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
reviews:
best football bar in paris, incredible atmosphere, great owners, good beer; not expensive, lots of fun.; love it; kiki on t’aime ❤️; football is a popular sport and you can feel it in this bar

if you don't want to pay too much for tickets to the park or a tv subscription, come to this bar and you won't be disappointed!

name: Lyoom Cantine
reviews:
the food was amazing, but was hard to choose because there was no menu in english. also, we didn’t get the receipt at the end, the waiter just typed an amount in the calculator and due to the menu’s prices we payed more (maybe the service or something?)…
but overall the food was amazing!; great place with friendly staff! the tunisian food was tasty. highly recommend!; i guess we discovered this place randomly. :) perfectly choose i would say. was tasty so good and smells freshly. reccomend this place.; we had an amazing meal here! the staff were friendly and helpful. the menu is not in english, but the staff made recommendations and helped us. the lemonade was really good and the food was delicious. we ordered the brochettes et mezzés - your choice of skewers with 2-5  small dishes (mezzés). we particularly enjoyed the hummus and tunisian salad. also the crème de toum is a must for garlic lovers - strong stuff! i would recommend this place in a heartbeat.; great spot for lunch. the interiors are unique and takes you to a different setting while in paris. the servings are generous, the food was delicious, the staff was helpful in picking out which mezze to choose, good value💯 they have 3 other branches around the area

name: Maison Zada
reviews: overrated, classic tourist fast food. meat shawarma is awful, do not even try it. the chicken one is ok; delicious meal served by friendly staff who went out of the way to make us feel welcome.; great food, sweet staff 💛; the place is small, clean and quiet. excellent service and delicious food. my first experience with lebanese food and definitely left me with a good review. as you enter, he offers you delicious tea, he advised us because we didn't know much about the dishes, very fast service and offered us two baklavas. i will come back soon; very good, the sandwiches are excellent as well as the falafel, the service is good, the value for money is perfect. i recommend it 100% for lebanese food, it’s really good!

name: Osè African Cuisine | Voltaire
reviews:
the spot if you are looking for africain food. the taste of the food is the best i have experienced 🤤🤤 literally! savannah will help you with your order with a very warm welcome! will come back again!; super delicious ! very tender chicken wings and good quality . spices are well balanced .; truly amazing! the flavors are wonderful and a real gem! so glad we stopped by and tried ose. the chicken sandwich and the plantains were delicious.

friendly and clean! highly recommend.; quite enoyedy pulled beef burger! my mates got some rice of some sort which i enjoyed as well. the plantain is amazing too!; this place is a culinary gem! from the mouthwatering dishes bursting with authentic african flavors to the exceptional service, every aspect exceeded my expectations. the playlist adds a soulful vibe to the ambiance, making it an great experience. highly recommend!

name: Leepeedee - Cheffe À Domicile - Traiteur Et Ateliers
reviews:
great service and tasty food and a very friendly owner :-); delicious, tasty, flavorful, well seasoned. friendly atmosphere. i recommend; ah it was good..it was good..i loved the padthai with the marinated chicken and spicy tortillas just like i like..i'm going to come back plus it's low in calories that's all that's good i needed to rebalance my diet. recommended more more...ah yes the tiramisu is good even without sugar...we still have the same pleasure eating it 😋; very good cuisine in a warm and cozy atmosphere absolutely recommended; excellent performance. fresh and seasonal products. we eat a healthy, balanced diet and leave the table feeling full! it was perfect!!!
a caring and aspiring chef! we will definitely come back! thanks for everything

name: LE GRAND BALLS
reviews:
an excellent lunch here, very good portions of food per dishes as well actually took a bit too much. everything was yummy and delicious. highly recommended; this place has become my new favorite in town! the food is amazing, the atmosphere is fantastic, and the team is welcoming and warm. the portions are generous, and the menu is very well thought out. you can choose from a variety of delicious sauces and pair them with the balls of your choice, whether it's beef, chicken, or a vegetarian option. the sides are also very tasty and generous.

definitely recommend!; might be the best restaurant in paris.  balls brings the fun to your mouth!  most of the restaurants in paris are filled with overpriced raw food that’s served by pretentious waiters who pretend not to speak english.  not balls!  balls serves up honest good food that comes in hot ball shaped goodness.  a great option for a first date or a 10year anniversary.  you simply can’t go wrong.; yum yum yum! our first night in paris and we only walked 200m from our air bnb to find this place. the food was so delicious, not too expensive (for our family of four). teenagers loved it as well. really great meal and excellent and friendly service.; the food was delicious, had the veal balls in a tomato sauce and the spicy balls in a yogurt sauce. the owner served us and was extremely nice and generous, even offering us a free slice of cake for dessert. will make sure to come back here next time i am in paris.

name: Chez Chouette
reviews:
me and my best friend visited here last week, we were starving and feel exhausted since we just helped our friend to moving to another apartment.
and this chez chouette just right there across at the corner “waving to us” 👋🏼
then we decided to eat here and having best chicken burger very big portion with frites and salad on the side dishes. then we also have a big bowl of greek salad.🥗
all taste really good and the chicken inside wasn’t just a flat piece of chicken but it’s rather like chicken patty combine with veggies maybe and other herbs makes it flavorful and delicious.
and the most important part is the service!
i personally want to standing ovation for kat (katherine i hope i write her name correctly), kat since the first we came in to the restaurant she’s already busy, she’s flying around here and there taking orders and delivering the meals.
and we are patiently waiting for her since we know she’s working hard.
and despite she always said “pardon my english” she’s still always smiling explaining to us about the menu.
which is never a true parisian can be this very kind and helpful like her. i adore her immediately and we became friends!
i will come back again!; the soup was fine, the sausage is really tasty and the potatoes. nice person here.; fab service and amazing food - would definitely recommend eating and drinking here !; good lunch at unexpected place. curry de poulet from daily menu was great and croque de monsieur (with egg that we did not actually order) was also ok.; a very nice place to eat and drink. the staff are very sweet, abd the service is good!
the food is well made, i took a vegetarian burger that tastes really good!

name: Les nouveaux sauvages pl réunion
formatted_address: 71 Pl. de la Réunion, 75020 Paris, France
reviews: lovely spot to have lunch, very friendly french speaking staff (my french is terrible). we had a panuzza and it was very good.. simple food but away from the stupidity of the tourist traps.; terrace season is amazing here and the food and music is 10/10; really good pizza!; top bar; loved this place, the food and the service is awesome!

name: Pépite
reviews:
i recently dined at restaurant pepite in paris, and overall, it was a pleasant experience. the atmosphere was friendly, and the waiter was attentive and accommodating.

i opted for a non-alcoholic drink, and the waiter suggested an iced tea, which unfortunately tasted like lemon juice dissolved in water. as for the starters, we ordered asparagus, terrine, and croquettes. the asparagus were decent but nothing extraordinary. the terrine, on the other hand, was delicious, although i would have preferred a different type of bread to accompany it. the bread they served had a thick crust and was quite hard. unfortunately, i found a piece of plastic wrapping inside one of the croquettes, which was promptly addressed by the staff. they apologized sincerely, and the situation was handled well.

the main courses and desserts were tasty, although perhaps not perfect. overall, it was not a bad experience, and i would recommend giving it a try to form your own opinion.; we go here almost every week for lunch and it’s always excellent. they have 2 starters, one vegetarian, one fish and one meat dish every day. perfectly sized so you’re full after entree+plat but can squeeze in a delicious dessert. also super nice waiters, good bread and fancy flavored butter; small quantities but delicious meal for a reasonable price!
i went it a second time with friends and it was delicious again :); delicious menu, great service and affordable price. highly recommend; great food. limited choice at the menu (which is for the best) with veg option. amazing dessert. french cuisine. friendly service. typically local.

name: Un Air de Famille
reviews:
ordered butter chicken & cheese naan from uber eats. emphasis on the butter.
it was 50% butter, 50% salt.
cheese naan was barely a pitta bread with philadelphia spread on.

:(; one of the best restaurant for kebab and indian pakistani dishes. mouth watering taste. the owner is very good man.; 1 rue de clos paris 75020 this restaurant food very delicious.all types of indian curry and tandoori chicken yammy taste.; mediocre food i don't want to finish my 2 meat tacos which i paid €7.90 i don't advise you to go to the restaurant because it's average quality; everything there is very poor quality and not well cooked, even the fries have no taste! naan is always not cooked enough inside, tikka masala there is only onion... very disappointed :(

name: La Belle Pizze
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
this is myself and my friend’s first visit to paris - we arrived around 6pm on the evening off 23-5-24 and wanted somewhere local to our hotel for dinner… we had booked la belle ville in advance and when we arrived were promptly taken with a choice of table… our server (who we sadly didn’t get the name of) was amazing, he had glasses and was extremely friendly, he was helping us practise and order in french and just made the whole experience so fun.

my friend had a burrata pizza and myself the regina with added olives, both delicious!

thank you for a lovely first evening in paris.; hidden treasure place. highly recommend; perfect service-very lovely staff
food and drinks are very good; very good; great range of pizzas and excellent service.

name: Fraté by Italian Kitchen
reviews: if one hates people, he shouldn't run a restaurant; excellent; walid super!; excellent !; excellent

name: Le Bal Perdu
reviews:
an institution. the cornerstone of the neighborhood. the owner knows everyone. a great spot to be immersed and feel like a part of the community, even if you're just visiting. also their pizzas are delicious.; super; le bal perdu was a bit like our canteen when we worked in bagnolet, in 2022. between the quality of the menu and the quality of the service, we still regret not being able to come there as often; a must-see if you are in bagnolet.
always a great atmosphere, a lively place, generous and delicious pizzas. we love going there with friends or family. thank you amar for making our city alive!!; we came to eat at bal perdu following the positive reviews from tripadvisor and google and we were not disappointed. the pizzas are really very good. my husband had a burger which was also good. for dessert, we had crème brûlées, personally i liked the crème brûlée less but my husband and my aunt liked it. our server was very kind and attentive. all the staff at this restaurant are really lovely and take great care of their customers. i recommend this restaurant for their pizzas and their kindness.

name: Troll Café
reviews: this is a real beer bar in the town, 130 kind of beers very well classified to guide you in your choice. you can find a wide collection of french, belgian, german, irish, english and other beers that meet all tastes (soft, strong, blonde, amber, brown, red, white...). nice atmosphere and the bartenders are kind and cooperative.; very friendly people and good atmosphere.; amazing cosy atmosphere and a great selection of beers. guaranteed fun evening! and don’t forget to get the planche!; charismatic bartender/owner. nice selection of belgian beer. reasonably priced. crowded (come early in the evening or during the week if you want seats).; great beer selection.

name: Tape à l'œil
formatted_address: 97 Rue de Paris, 93260 Les Lilas, France
reviews:
cool; the opening team is very friendly and welcoming.  now, the slightest question regarding the articles "yes but the store runs without you whether you are there or not", uhhh what should i understand?; despite not much choice but i love this store but i was disappointed during my last visit, usually the team is very friendly but this day i came across a new person who sees their managers as really unpleasant and treat their employers badly in front of everyone and i didn't appreciate that at all; she has no right to this behavior. we were 3 customers and it can be seen that we were all uncomfortable with this behavior. it's a shame.; tape a l'oeil is no longer the store i knew, not very welcoming and very little choice; too bad store lilacs too small so less choice and no stock.
the team, which dates back 3 to 4 years, young blonde women, were pleasant. today it's okay but it depends on who you come across they give advice but without more too often lack of sizes so i go on the site and often there are two brunette saleswomen there is one cold it's not great

name: Les Enfants Paysans
opening_hours: ['Monday: Open 24 hours', 'Tuesday: Open 24 hours', 'Wednesday: Open 24 hours', 'Thursday: Open 24 hours', 'Friday: Open 24 hours', 'Saturday: Open 24 hours', 'Sunday: Open 24 hours']
reviews:
ti’ bout de paradis; my little refuge, hands in the earth, moments of sharing that feel good! we fall in love with the chicks and the whole atmosphere that reigns at the children peasants…and nico is just adorable!; great place, rich in both human and practical discoveries in living soil. made a u-shaped “pergolu” as its name suggests!; after nanterre and vive les groues, the centerpiece of a 'timeless' garden!
the adventure continues in bagnolet at serres volantes, good luck 🤞; a green setting managed by wonderful people, i took part in permaculture training and i learned a lot. thanks!; finally a place to disconnect from the gray and rediscover the pleasure of sharing values ​​for the future and warm moments around nature.

name: Les Enfants Terribles
reviews:
j'ai vue la semaine derniere le dindon avec les élèves comédiens de l'école de comédiens les enfants terribles dans le 20e arrondissement de paris... quel travail franchement !!! mise en scène très forte, des jeunes comédiens avec un talent fou que l'on va vite retrouver à avignon apparemment apparemment et dans un théâtre de paris , les enfants terribles est un lieu incroyable et une gentillesse d'accueil qui fait du bien ... bravo à cette école d'acteurs et à son équipe  ... encore !!!!; very good school, great group atmosphere, and great teachers!
and “funny prince”, when we criticize we at least have the courage to do it under a real identity... non-constructive criticism coming from a coward is worthless.; 3 years in it! great encounters.
varied and talented teachers!
a great training course that prepares you well for the reality of this profession!
i continue to do this job so... thank you et!; quality teaching, close-knit students, very good support from those involved. it’s a school that’s worth the detour!; a well-built theater with a nice program for semi-pro but already very talented actors. the welcome is simple and warm. a small bar upstairs to meet the actors. good times.

name: School Montessori - Le Petit D'homme
reviews:
my son was on another montessori school for the first cycle (3-6yo), did a year at a public school école turrenne and entered petit d’homme for ce1 and is now there for ce2.
even if he adapted really well from his first montessori school to the public school, i was very disappointed of the public method of education and specially on the socialisation aspects of the education.
so i was lucky to find a place for my son at petit d’homme, i found a open communication, a positive educational approach that really follows maria’s montessori views, and a beautiful ambiance.
i can really see that the teachers duos work so well and that they have so much experience. this is very reassuring for me as a parent and for my son. the ambiance just has a great flow.
my son was integrated really quick with the group and goes happily to school every morning. he even asks to stay at the garderie to play longer with his friends.
the educators were always attentive to his needs and even to our needs as a family. i’m brazilian and had to travel during the school year and they were very understanding and accommodating. the teachers did a whole amazing plan for him to catch up during the trip, but with no pressure.
i love this school and recommend it to parents that are looking for a montessori and a individualized approach to education. so different from the one size fits all of the classic education that is all around in paris.; my daughter has been enrolled at petit d’homme since the start of the school year in september, and her little brother is getting ready to join her.
i can only express my gratitude to the school director and the teaching team, for the exceptional environment offered to our children. 1 teacher for 10 children, great kindness coupled with healthy firmness, the children's rhythm respected. my daughter goes there with pleasure every morning, i see her flourish and progress, and i have total confidence. it’s lucky to have a montessori school at such a reasonable price in the 11th!; not all montessori schools are equal. after a very disappointing experience in the first year of kindergarten in another montessori school, we were lucky enough to have a place for our daughter at le petit d'homme in the second year of kindergarten. our daughter was able to complete her schooling there until the end of cm1 and thrive there. the transition to a cm2 in the public went without problem.; i have 12 years of experience with this school because all my children have completed their entire education from kindergarten to cm2. the teaching is exceptional, quite montessori. they have not only acquired an excellent level without no problem adapting to classical education but also valuable maturity and ability to resolve conflicts. during all these years they went to this school every day with pleasure and have excellent memories of it. like me.; my daughter has been attending le petit d'homme since her first year of kindergarten, she loves her school and so do we! kindness, listening and joy of living are on the menu! the students are mixed on several levels, which promotes mutual assistance and autonomy. everyone advances at their own pace, the material is of high quality, the teaching team is regularly trained and reinforced by the presence of student trainees. i recommend this establishment!

name: Nursery School Mairie De Paris
reviews:
thank you to all the kindergarten staff, for the pedagogy, the involvement and the education that you provide to our little ones.
thank you for your dedication allowing many parents through your presence during the strikes to be able to go to work.
thank you

name: Brasserie Les Buttes Chaumont
reviews:
pretty standard fare for the neighborhood. nice folks, decent food.; cool staff, and good quality in a cozy local.; i'll begin by saying that i've worked in restaurants myself and this one here...it's pretty d@mn close to perfect. i can't say enough how refreshing it is to have competent, kind, friendly management and staff that do their job and do it with pride, thus making the 19th such a wonderful, calm and relaxing corner of paris. this review might be long but in a city that feels like it's quickly forgetting what the parisian cafe/brasserie is meant to be for the community, i have found this place to be not only special but an increasingly rare exception.

i usually come here almost 3 to 4 times a week for my morning coffee and to peacefully work on my laptop (with wifi!) without anyone ever making a fuss.

the brasserie is situated on a lovely little corner, just steps from buttes chaumont with two sides to the cafe terrasse allowing one to choose if they want to eat alone/work in peace away from the somewhat busy street or watch the cars and people go by without being bothered.
it appears to be a hit for work lunch as i often see large groups come in and out most often at the middle of the day.

ambiance inside or outside is always a perfect mix of convivial yet calm. prices are exactly what they should be, the menu is short and sweet with fresh ingredients whose quality you can taste. this isn't your stale and tired traditional "french" menu nor is it trendy and ridiculous like a french inspired taco... here it appears every plate is thoughtfully approached with only seasonal and local ingredients. each option is a simple yet unexpected pairing: a classic hard boiled egg with mayonnaise mixed with squid ink sauce. the red pepper with feta and almonds was by far my favorite. while i have yet to try the larger plates, each and every entrée has been more than delicious, well-seasoned and well-portioned. this is great if you're like me and your afternoon (unfortunately) doesn't include time for a "sieste" immediately following the meal ;)
added bonus! the offering changes just slightly from time to time giving those who frequent the spot a chance to always try something new.

service is always attentive and quick, never pushy or rushed which is why i find it's always filled with people of all ages and backgrounds, families, children, friends or solo.

tables are large and accommodating which is rare to see in paris, especially on the terrace, where in other cafes around the city one typically feels packed in like sardines, forced to sit in on the conversation and cigarette smoke of their neighbor ;) here, each of the tables outside can comfortably fit 4 people.

unfortunately i am no longer living in the area but if you ever find yourself new to the neighborhood, maybe searching for your "go-to" spot to enjoy a moment outside the confines of your humble abode, i can't recommend this one enough. for me it feels exactly like home :); this is the worst cafe in the pyrénées area. i have never tasted such a dry croissant. nor had such poor customer service. i advise you to explore other cafes, lest you waste your money in this economy.; great food at fair price and a nice terrace. not fancy but good quality 👌

name: Family Pizza
reviews: very good pizza and very good sandwich;

name: Crispy Soul
reviews: delicious waffle burgers and a huge portion. the chicken is sooo juicy and the atmosphere is amazing with some old school hip hop bangers (few romantic ones) since i have been with my girlfriend. 10/10 value!!!; when we arrive there we sat and after two minutes the waitress came to us and asked for how long we are sitting there, without even saying hi. she wasn't nice at all. then she said that they will close in 50 minutes, and left. for ordering we had to use their website which asked us to enter phone number and email, unnecessarily. to me, the food was ok, but only for one time. it was a wild mixture of very different tastes, sitting in a hot metal plate. we ordered fries with cheddar, which was 1.5€ more expensive than normal fries, but she brought normal ones. when we told her about it, she denied but after seeing our recipte, she accepted. it was offensive. she stayed outside of the restaurant, waiting us to finish and leave. if you don't mind a low quality service, you can the food a shot.; best fried chicken i have ever had. the lady was so nice, she even gave me her wifi. straight up  bussin!; cozy little food place in paris. visited after seeing a post on ig recommending it and did not leave disappointed. i had a lakers waffle burger and fries. overall, the food was good, the prices were reasonable,  payment was easy, and service was more than adequate. i would recommend this place👌🏽; very good place for fried chicken lovers ! excellent service, jennifer was so lovely and helpful. the food tasted amazing, definitely recommend the place :)

name: BEBOP
vicinity: 1 Av Gambetta, Place Auguste Métivier, Paris
formatted_address: 1 Av Gambetta, Pl. Auguste Métivier, 75020 Paris, France
reviews: a classic parisian bistro right next to the cimitiere pere-lachaise. frequented by locals it has a lively and convivial air that draws you in especially on a cold winter's day. the servers were warm and friendly with us as we entered and greeted us each time with a smile. the food is of great quality, of which the steak tartare and the profiteroles i can personally attest their rich taste and excellent presentation. i highly recommend you stop by if you're in the area.; best soup and salad combo? i had been searching for a proper vegetable salad and was so glad to find it here! the french onion soup was delicious.; my husband and i stopped into this restaurant for lunch after walking around pere lachaise cemetery. we had the special for the day. it was very good. we sat outside and enjoyed the excellent weather and pleasant service.; we had a very good lunch here on our way to visit the père lachaise cemetery. the food was excellent and the atmosphere was nice.; best choice ever. what a surprise. the quality of ingrediets is superb, the choice of the menu is "wow" and the waiters are super cute and the price is fair. the sunday brunch is a great deal. do try the guacamole!

name: Restaurant Campanile Paris Est-Porte de Bagnolet
vicinity: 28 Avenue du Général de Gaulle, Bagnolet
formatted_address: 28 Av. du Général de Gaulle, 93170 Bagnolet, France
reviews:
the best hotel in paris!

in the fall of 2023, on halloween, my family and i were lucky enough to spend five days in this wonderful hotel.

the decorations were stunning and the breakfast was simply fantastic!
the atmosphere, food, cleanliness and service were all impeccable.

if we travel to france from hungary again in the near future, we will definitely stay here!  🇭🇺 ❤️ 🇫🇷

best regards: istván jakab, hungary; quite pricy but its ok its halal and have it own standards; good morning,
my son also had the chance to do a short internship in 4th grade at your establishment and he was very satisfied with it. the kindness, attention and consideration that you showed to him and his friend were very rewarding. this commitment is very significant and suggests high quality service to your customers. well done and thank you!; it's not as a customer, but as a mother, my son spent 3 weeks in training in catering and he loved it and thanks to the team he wants to do his future jobs. thank you very much.; pastries are of the day as well as bread.
unlimited detox drink.
coffee is ok

name: Café de la Mairie
vicinity: 2 Rue du Pré Saint-Gervais, Les Lilas
formatted_address: 2 Rue du Pré Saint-Gervais, 93260 Les Lilas, France
reviews:
i called ahead so we'd be sure that we have a table. very friendly over the phone. they sat us down at a great and clean table in the sun. we started looking at the french menu but the waiter was already getting us the english menu, very thoughtful!

we ended up ordering the hamburgers (cheese and texan hamburgers), those tasted very good, served with homemade mayonnaise it think? and potato wedges. definitely would recommend it.

our children didn't really like the sparkling lemonade, so we asked the waiter for glasses of water, which he got us free of charge, excellent service if you ask me.

the restaurant itself does not at all appear to be tourist focus, we were dining amongst locals (just the way we enjoy it).

if you're in paris (porte de lilas), i would definitely recommend going here!; 2 coffee and a chocolate milk for our girl took 20 minutes… we also received suddenly some kinda baguette which we didn’t ordered. we decided to take a croissant with jam and go to the bakery across the street. croissant was served on a napkin with a bottle of jam. no plate or knife to open your croissant… the waiter grabbed the croissants out of a bag with his hands and put it at the napkin. what about the hygiene? 🤔; you can enjoy simple food in the evening, and the owner is friendly and it was a good experience 😁; great restaurant, prices are fair, especially for paris. we paid 70euro and still had some food leftover to take home (4 people) the dining experience was enjoyable, the rice, vegetables and fish were adequate, fair for the price. the cheeseburger (i ordered no pickles) was delicious, the fries were well cooked and the mayo... the mayo was so good, it was clearly homemade, if i had to pick one condiment to eat forever, this would be it.
staff was very polite, very enjoyable; café de la mairie was our favourite place to eat in the area. the most amazing experience.  the food and the service were amazing.  whenever we return to paris we will definitely be back.

name: À l'Endroit
reviews:
typical french cuisine.we loved the place, the foie gras fait maison was excepcional,  same as the boeuf bourguignon.nice desserts too ( the tatin is a must), but the best of all was the service, really going the extra mile to help .we strongly recommend if in the area.; spent an evening there with my girlfriend while on a visit in paris for a weekend.
we were warmly welcomed by both, the waiter and the owner most likely. especially the young man was really friendly and giving his best to explain the menu to us in english.
the dinner was delicious, especially the paleron de bœuf kept its promise to taste like made by grandma. can highly recommend to eat there.; i went there during the paris olympics and had a fantastic lunch experience. the owner, sylvain, is very welcoming and friendly, patiently introducing each dish to me. the food was amazing. i hope to visit the restaurant again next time i’m in paris.; i recently visited this restaurant for a family dinner and i absolutely loved it. the owner was incredibly kind and welcoming, and the food was exquisite. every dish we ordered was exceptional, and i would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful dining experience. i can't wait to go back!; very neat and cozy place! the owner takes time for and care of all guests. food is great, tasty and delicious.

name: The Ceilar
reviews:
best bar of paris #periodt 💓; they let us out after 1 hour even though my friends and i booked until 2am.
in addition, the manager only monitored us throughout without any freedom.
no permission to eat without consuming their food. very unpleasant and very haughty in the way he expresses himself.; false advertising. we came before the scheduled date to ask our questions. we were told that everything was free, only when we arrived we were informed that we had to consume to stay. telling him that we couldn't, he informed us that our reservation was canceled even though we were expecting more than twenty people. don't come back! nothing is free.; a super warm welcome. the staff is really very nice. a special thank you to hassan and sadjo who allowed me to have a very happy birthday. the space reserved upstairs is optimal for a party of 40 people. i recommend!!!; amazing place! super friendly and festive :)

name: Chez Paul
reviews:
i recently dined at paul chez restaurant in paris and had an exceptional experience. the food was truly remarkable, showcasing the rich flavors of french cuisine. i started with the beef tartar, which was fresh, expertly seasoned, and presented beautifully. it set a high bar for the rest of the meal.

for my main course, i opted for the steak, and it did not disappoint. the steak was cooked to perfection—tender, juicy, and full of flavor. the accompanying sides complemented the dish well, enhancing the overall dining experience.

the wine selection at paul chez was also impressive. our server recommended a wonderful red wine that paired perfectly with both the tartar and the steak, adding an extra dimension to our meal.

the ambiance of the restaurant was charming and cozy, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed dinner. the service was attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant and memorable evening.

one minor downside was that the dessert menu was somewhat limited, but given the quality of the main dishes, this was a minor flaw.

overall, paul chez offers excellent food and a delightful dining experience. i highly recommend it for anyone visiting paris.

rating: 8.5/10; it was wonderful to have a nice dinner with. potato was really tasty, so hard to finish all food you have ordered.  i think 4 person - 2 starter / 3 main dishes / 2 dessert / 1~2 bottle of wine to share would be perfect and enough. for sure, foods in here is wonderful.; very french restaurant as my french friend said.
very good food.
good atmosphere, super busy service.
i recommend to call in advance to make sure you have seats.; a good restaurant for french dinner. baked snails had a nice butter flavor. beef tartar was my favorite. red wine pear with vanilla ice cream was an excellent dessert.; service was good. they ignored me just the right amount.
nice atmosphere, outside.
the pepper steak was excellent, perhaps a tad less tender than i would like, and the sauce was very peppery, but flavorful. the potatoes surprised me with flavor and creaminess.
the goat cheese and salad was a delightful combination.

i am pretty tough generally on the traditional brasserie/bistrot. here is a great find. i will be back

name: Assaporare 10 sur 10
reviews:
amazing dinner place. the truffle pasta is top notch that you felt the aroma is dancing along your tongue. good charcuterie and legume antipasti. the owners are very nice and took a long while to explain each dish and how they were made. nice wine pairing as well. highly recommend.; one of the best ravioli i have had. got a table by the door which was open so felt the cold al along but it was made up by the warm smile and service!; it’s my kind of quaint, homely, and delicious italian restaurant that you can always go back to.  staff here are warm and friendly.  beautiful settings.  italian made with lots of heart.; lovely food, one of the best italian we had. not too overcroweded like many near restuarants. the ingredients were fresh and you can sense it from the taste of it.  they took their time while preparing the meal and helped us understanding the menu. it was a pleasant experience. felt like a family buissnes dedicated to serve authentic food rather than a mill machine making fast food.. i loved it..!! i will recommend; my first visit in jan 2019 : the food was good, with some quite unique ingredients like the vegetable from naples. but the price is high for the portion you get, especially that it’s not cooked with care (in that vegetable i found weeds cooked together). the menu is all in italian and the waiter couldn’t clearly explain to us. but the worst and not acceptable is: at the end, they billed us 8.5€ a bottle of san pellegrino, while the bottle is even in plastic!
with 40-50€/person, you can definitely get better food easily elsewhere!

now (3 years later i came back here because of an event organized by my company), i still find the portions very small, the pasta very oily, even more expensive and not worth the price (150gr pasta for 20€). the menu still only in italian and not very clear, the deserts not very tasty.
the spritz aperol was good though, the service friendly, but the decorations are very disturbing: nudity drawn in black perm-marker on a transparent plastic sheet all over the wall and on the table serving as a table mat... 😱
and the inside is very hot and humid, we were all suffocating and sweating, and as it is a small space and people speak quite loudly, it became quickly a unpleasant experience.

name: Le Faidherbe
formatted_address: 69 Rue de Paris, 93260 Les Lilas, France
reviews:
happy hour until closing time. 3.80 euros for a pinte of blonde. and generally very good prices in a nice typical environment.  a place to visit if you are around!; my experience there was terrible.
i came there with my two friends.
we ordered 12 snails and two pastas.
we wanted to share everything.
our waiter didn’t speak english which i understand but when he hear that we didn’t want to order any drinks he became so angry and he told us that we must order something to drink and if not there is a pizza on the other side of the street. he told us that we need to leave and it’s better for us to eat sandwich or pizza somewhere else. he became offensive and i was terrifed. he started to throw the menu card and the forks. who is behaving like this? i was shocked. how can somebody treat his customers like that? i’m glad i didn’t spend money in this place. i don’t recommend going there. so unpleasent people working there. avoid at any cost.; don’t go there!!! the owner is very rude, he didnt want to serve us food because we didnt want to order wine. after that he threw us out of the restaurant!!; the dinner was fantastic with great staff; everything was great!

name: Le Gevaudan d’aligre
reviews:
wonderful place … different … lovely owner. thank you for the nice evening! steak tatar is worth it! ❤️; what a hidden gem 💎 we accidentally passed by this lovely restaurant and decided to have lunch there. we were welcomed warmly by the lady owner and super tasty food. we ordered the menu of the day, which includes appetizers and main dishes. we got a salad with avocado and a salad with pork sausage, both were fresh and delicious. the main dishes were veal and fish, which were also delicious and certainly taste like home and comfy. the owner has been very helpful with explaining the dishes and she’s also the chef. it just feels like we went into someone’s kitchen.; i had oysters and swordfish for lunch..the  ingredients ,bread,seafood and veggies are so fresh and delicious . the restaurant is cute and cozy especially the owner was so friendly. if you want to find a real seafood ,his is the place.
english manu is available.; cosy little bistro popular with locals. the zucchini soup we had was disappointing. the staff said it was normal but kindly took it off the bill. the other food we had was good. probably just a bit unlucky with the soup..; worst place that i never eat. customer service  is really bad and impolite. food quality is not fresh and over cook. i asked for a rösti and it was to much oil and not cook

name: Aux Spatules cuisine de partage
reviews:
very cozy place and delicious food!
service is pleasant and fast.
worse visiting 👌; delicious! every ingredient fresh and lovingly prepared. one of the very best restaurants i have eaten at in the 20eme— or indeed in paris.; so wonderful and kind! everything was delicious and fresh. would go back for brunch any day!; the food was amazing and so was the service! even though it was busy, the host was friendly! 10/10!; lovely coffee and exceptional service! 5 stars 🌟
